1.text: And which one of you was a marksman at ten? Keep practicing, Bran. Go on.
Get the lads to saddle their horses.
He swore an oath, Cat.
Tell Bran he’s coming, too.
He won’t be a boy forever. And winter is coming.
In the name of Robert of the House Baratheon, first of his name …
King of the Andals and the First Men …
Lord of the Seven Kingdoms and protector of the realm, I, Eddard of the House Stark, Lord of Winterfell and Warden of the North, sentence you to die.
You understand why I did it?
But do you understand why I had to kill him?
The man who passes the sentence should swing the sword.
The White Walkers have been gone for thousands of years.
A madman sees what he sees.
There are no mountain lions in these woods.
It’s a direwolf.
Tough old beast.
Better a quick death. They won’t last without their mother.
I’m sorry, Bran.
You will train them yourselves. You will feed them yourselves. And if they die, you will bury them yourselves.
You have five northern children. You’re not an outsider.
It’s your gods with all the rules.
Tell me.
Your sister. The boy …
He’s coming this far North, there’s only one thing he’s after.
Hey,, hey, hey, hey. What are you doing with that on? [Pulls off ARYA’s helm]
Your Grace.
Guarding the North for you, Your Grace. Winterfell is yours.
My queen.
Tell me about Jon Arryn.
We both did.
Aye.
I’m not worthy of the honor.
She was my sister. This is where she belongs.
It’s done, Your Grace. The Targaryens are gone.
The boy I beheaded. Did you know him?
He was talking madness. Said the Walkers slaughtered his friends.
A wildling ambush.
Winter is coming.
Your pardon.
Yes, the king has honored me with his offer.
I don’t fight in tournaments.
I don’t fight in tournaments because when I fight a man for real, I don’t want him to know what I can do.
I’m a Northman. I belong here with you, not down south in that rat’s nest they call a capital.
The king takes what he wants. That’s why he’s king.
How did he get so fat?
Send him in.
Stay.
What news?
She’s fresh widowed, Cat. She doesn’t know what she’s saying.
No, but I’m still better than you.
I hope I’ll serve you well.
I have no choice.
You can. You must.
There's great honor serving in the Night's Watch. The Starks have manned the Wall for thousands of years. And you are a Stark. You might not have my name, but you have my blood.
The next time we see each other, we'll talk about your mother. I promise.
I've half a mind to go with you.
You should have asked me 20 years ago.
I recall a few chances.
Bessie. She was one of yours.
Wylla.
Nor will I.
The worst thing about your coronation... I'll never get to hit you again.
Daenerys Targaryen has wed some Dothraki horselord. What of it? Should we send her a wedding gift?
She's little more than a child.
Tell me we're not speaking of this.
But you can't get your hands on this one, can you?
Even a million Dothraki are no threat to the realm, as long as they remain on the other side of the Narrow Sea. They have no ships, Robert.
He will not cross. And if by chance he does, we'll throw him back into the sea.
Where is she?
Who took her?
Right, get back.
Back! Back to the inn. All back!
Are you hurt?
It's all right. What is the meaning of this? Why was my daughter not brought to me at once?
In bed asleep.
Stop it! That's enough of that.
Stop! Arya!
Gladly, your Grace.
You can't mean it.
s this your command... your Grace?
No. Jory... Take the girls to their rooms. If it must be done, then I'll do it myself.
The wolf is of the north. She deserves better than a butcher.
The butcher's boy... You rode him down?
Get the girls settled in. I'll be back in time for supper. And, Jory, you go with them.
Glad to see you're protecting the throne.
Very handsome armor. Not a scratch on it.
You've chosen your opponents wisely then.
But you just stood there and watched.
Is that what you tell yourself at night? You're a servant of justice? That you were avenging my father when you shoved your sword in Aerys Targaryen's back?
You served him well, when serving was safe.
Lord Varys.
A shame you didn't say a prayer for the butcher's son. Renly! You're looking well.
She has, Lord Baelish. I understand you knew my brother Brandon as well.
Perhaps you chose the wrong man to duel with.
Grand Maester.
And you served another King.
Without the King?
40,000 gold dragons to the champion, 20,000 to the runner-up, 20,000 to the winning archer.
Are you telling me the Crown is three million in debt?
How could you let this happen?
I will not believe Jon Arryn allowed Robert to bankrupt the realm.
I'll speak to him tomorrow. This tournament is an extravagance we cannot afford.
There will be no plans until I speak to Robert. Forgive me, my Lords. I had a long ride.
What's happening here?
Go to your room. We'll speak later. That's for you, love…
The same dollmaker makes all of Princess Myrcella's toys. Don't you like it?
It's all right. Go on.
War was easier than daughters.
Arya, open the door. May I come in? Whose sword is that?
Give it to me. I know this maker's mark. This is Mikken's work. Where did you get this? This is no toy. Little ladies shouldn't play with swords.
Come here. Now what do you want with this?
A blade with a name. And who were you hoping to skewer with Needle? Your sister? Do you know the first thing about sword fighting?
[laughs] That's the essence of it.
No, sweet girl. You didn't kill the butcher's boy.
Sansa was dragged before the King and Queen... And asked to call the Prince a liar.
Darling, listen to me. Sansa will be married to Joffrey someday. She cannot betray him. She must take his side even when he's wrong.
Well… Look at me. You're a Stark of Winterfell. You know our words.
You were born in the long summer. You've never known anything else. But now winter is truly coming. And in the winter, we must protect ourselves, look after one another. Sansa is your sister.
I don't want to frighten you, but I won't lie to you either. We've come to a dangerous place. We cannot fight a war amongst ourselves. All right? Go on. It's yours.
Try not to stab your sister with it. If you're going to own a sword, you'd better know how to use it.
My wife is in Winterfell.
You're a funny man. A very funny man.
It's too dangerous.
Until we know who our enemies are...
Littlefinger's right. I can't do anything without proof.
Then I bring it to Robert... And hope he's still the man I once knew. You watch yourself on the road, huh? That temper of yours is a dangerous thing.
He still loves you.
Off with you.
The King's tournament. I assure you the Hand wants no part of it.
You'll get 50. Lord Baelish will see it paid for.
You found money for a champion's purse, you can find money to keep the peace. I'll also give you 20 of my household guards till the crowds have left.
The sooner this is over, the better.
I'm sure the tourney puts coins in many a pocket. Now... If there's nothing else, my Lords?
I've been hoping to talk to you about Jon Arryn.
Why?
What did Jon want the night before he died?
A book? What book?
I'd like to read it.

"Harkon Umber, first of his name, born to lord Hother Umber and lady Amaryllis Umber in the 183rd year after Aegon's landing, at the last hearth. Blue of eye, brown of hair and fair complected, died in his 14th year of a wound sustained
Did Jon Arryn tell you what he wanted with it?
Jon's death...
Did he say anything to you during his final hours?
"The seed is strong"? What does that mean?
And you're quite certain he died of a natural illness?
Poison.
I've heard it said that poison is a woman's weapon.
Everybody knows that.
I've taken enough of your time.
Thank you. I'll find my own way out.
It's a hard fall down these steps.
Cats? Syrio saysâ€¦
He's right about that.
He needs to get his strength back first.
No. But someday he could be Lord of a holdfast or sit on the King's Council. Or he might raise castles like Brandon the Builder.
You will marry a high Lord and rule his castle. And your sons shall be knights and princes and lords.
Pycelle talks too much.
Knighted for what? Why are you telling me this?
Where is Ser Hugh? I'll speak to him.
Varys or the Queen?
Yes.
Why?
Lord Baelish, perhaps I was wrong to distrust you.
A knight. They strut around like roosters down here. Even the ones who've never seen an arrow coming their way.
Let them look.
What did Lord Arryn want?
I'd like to see him as well.
This is fine work.
There's nothing to forgive. When Lord Arryn came to visit you, what would you talk about?
What kind of questions?
Your mother?
What did you tell him?
Look at me. Get back to work, lad. If the day ever comes when that boy'd rather wield a sword than forge one, you send him to me.
King Robert's bastard son.
Your Grace.
Putting my name on it doesn't make it mine.
She likes it here.
What are you doing here?
The King called on me to serve him and the realm, and that's what I'll do until he tells me otherwise.
If that's my job, then so be it.
I was also trained to kill my enemies, Your Grace.
Does Ser Hugh have any family in the capital?
He'd never worn this armor before.
Who determines the draw?
Aye... But who holds the straws? You've done good work, Sisters.
I'm glad we never met on the field, Ser Barristan... as is my wife. I don't think the widow's life would suit her.
My father once told me you were the best he'd ever seen. I never knew the man to be wrong about matters of combat.
And that lad... He was a squire until a few months ago. How could he afford a new suit of armor?
Yes. That will never happen.
If the King got what he wanted all the time, we'd still be fighting a damned rebellion.
You're too fat for your armor.
You're torturing the poor boy.
The breastplate stretcher?
Maybe you should have one invented.
You have no business jousting. Leave that for the young men.
And who's going to hit you back?
There's not a man in the Seven Kingdoms would risk hurting you.
Aye.
I'm not thirsty.
Your squire... A Lannister boy?
Robert?
Where's Arya
Hey.
Ser Loras rides well.
He'll never walk again.
So they say.
I've been in the capital a month. Why have you waited so long to tell me this?
So why do you trust me now?
What sort of doom does the King face?
Who gave it to him?
The squire, Ser Hugh?
If Ser Hugh poisoned him, who paid Ser Hugh?
Jon was a man of peace. He was Hand for 17 years -- 17 good years. Why kill him?
You know I had half my guard out searching for you? You promised me this would stop.
Who did?
Oh, Arya.
Where did you hear this?
What were you doing in the dungeons?
Your name, friend?
Did Benjen send you?
Ah, we'll find recruits for you.
Know what?
Go on. We'll talk more later.
Jory, take her safely to her room.
Well?
I need to see the King first -- alone.
Is it about my wife?
You're speaking of murdering a child.
You will dishonor yourself forever if you do this.
Then we're no better than the Mad King.
You want to assassinate a girl... Because the Spider heard a rumor?
Based on whose information?
Mormont? You bring us the whispers of a traitor half a world away and call it fact?
He broke the law, betrayed his family, fled our land. We commit murder on the word of this man?
The Narrow Sea still lies between us. I'll fear the Dothraki the day they teach their horses to run on water.
I followed you into war - twice, without doubts, without second thoughts. But I will not follow you now. The Robert I grew up with didn't tremble at the shadow of an unborn child.
I will have no part in it.
And good luck to him. I thought you were a better man.
I'll go ahead with my daughters. Get them ready. Do it yourself. Don't ask anyone for help.
What can I do for you?
Why? What do you care?
I don't have the time.
Round up all the men we have and station them outside the girls' chambers. Who are your best two swords?
Find them and meet me at the stables.
Aye.
I will.
When Jon Arryn came to visit you, what did he want?
She looks healthy enough to me. The girl shall want for nothing.
What do you know of King Robert's bastards?
How many?
And Jon Arryn tracked them all down. Why?
Come.
Jory!
I remember him well.
He was taken at my command to answer for his crimes.
You kill me, your brother's a dead man.
Your pardon, your Grace.
She did nothing I did not command.
I am the King’s Hand -
- trying to keep the peace -
He butchered my men.
Jaime has fled the city. Give me leave to bring him back to justice.
If we don’t act… there will be a war.
And what about Jaime Lannister? What about Jaime?
As you command your Grace. With your leave, I will return to Winterfell and set matters straight.
The hunt?
The Targaryen girl -
These men, were they flying a sigil? … A banner.
You’re describing Ser Gregor Clegane.
I cannot give you back your homes or restore your dead to life. But perhaps I can give you justice in the name of our king, Robert. Lord Beric Dondarrion.
You shall have the command. Assemble 100 men and ride to Ser Gregor’s keep.

In the name of Robert of the House Baratheon, the First of his Name, King of the Andals and the First Men, Lord of the Seven Kingdoms and Protector of the Realm, I charge you to bring the king’s justice to the false knight Gregor Clegane and all those who shared in his crimes. I denounce him and attaint him. I strip him of all ranks and titles of all lands and holdings, and sentence him to death.
Grand Maester Pycelle.

Send a raven to Casterly Rock. Inform Tywin Lannister that he has been summoned to court to answer for the crimes of his bannermen. He will arrive within the fortnight, or be branded an enemy of the crown and a traitor to the realm.
Then how come Robert is king and not Tywin Lannister?
I’m sending you both back to Winterfell.
Listen -
What? No.
This isn’t a punishment. I want you back in Winterfell for your own safety.
When you’re old enough, I’ll make you a match with someone who’s worthy of you, someone who’s brave and gentle and strong -
Go on, girls. Get your septa and start packing your things.

“Lord Orys Baratheon, black of hair.” “Axel Baratheon, black of hair.” “Lyonel Baratheon, black of hair.” “Steffon Baratheon, black of hair.” “Robert Baratheon, black of hair.” “Joffrey Baratheon… golden-haired.”
I've had worse, my lady.
The South doesn't seem to agree with you.
I know the truth Jon Arryn died for.
Has he done this before?
Your brother Or your lover?
My son saw you with him.
With all my heart.
And they are all Jaime's.
You've always hated him.
When the King returns from his hunt, I'll tell him the truth.
I've made many mistakes in my life, but that wasn't one of them.
You damned fool.
I will.
I'll, I'll do everything I can to honor your memory.
Give him milk of the poppy.
No man could have protected him from himself.
His squire? The Lannister boy?
His Grace has had a change of heart concerning Daenerys Targaryen.
And what should I do with a hundred swords?
What about Stannis?
Stannis is your older brother.
Stannis is a commander. He's led men into war twice.
I will not dishonor Robert's last hours by shedding blood in his halls and dragging frightened children from their beds.
You will sail to dragonstone tonight.
Now leave us.
The King has no true born sons.
The throne passes to his brother Lord Stannis.
There is no "unless".
Do you have a shred of honor?
We?
What you suggest is treason.
Make peace with the Lannisters, you say. With the people who tried to murder my boy.
No. I won't do it.
There is no other choice. He is the heir.
You promised Catelyn you would help me.
No, all right.
King Joffrey?
Good. Is Lord Renly joining us?
Ser Barristan, I believe no man here could ever question your honor.
Ser Barristan is a good man, a loyal man. Do him no harm.
Commander! Take the Queen and her children into custody.
I want no bloodshed.
Varys.
What about my daughters?
And Sansa?
You watched my men being slaughtered and did nothing.
The madness of mercy. That she might save her children.
The Queen can't kill me. Cat holds her brother.
If that's true, then slit my throat and be done with it.
Tell me something, Varys.
Another visit? lt seems you're my last friend.
On her knees begging for me. Hm! Did you laugh with the others?
l don't know what you want. l've given up trying to guess.
Huh. Can you free me from this pit?
What do you want? Tell me. No riddles, no stories. Tell me, what do you want?
Robb? He's just a boy.
Stannis Baratheon is Robert's true heir. The throne is his by rights.
You want me to serve the woman who murdered my king, who butchered my men, who crippled my son?

You think my life is some precious thing to me? That l would trade my honor for a few more years of... of what? You grew up with actors. You learned their craft and you learnt it well. But l grew up with soldiers. l learned how to die a long time ago.
Baelor!

I am Eddard Stark, Lord of Winterfell and Hand of the King. I come before you to confess my treason in the sight of Gods and men. I betrayed the faith of my King and the trust of my friend Robert. I swore to protect and defend his children, but before his blood was cold I plotted to murder his son and seize the Throne for myself. Let the High Septon and Baelor the Blessed bear witness to what I say

3.text: And which one of you was a marksman at 10?

6.text: Lyanna.
No, I’m not a dream. I’m here. Right here.
I’ve missed you, too.
Shh. You are.
You’re not going to die.
Get her some water!
Is there a maester?
I looked for you on the Trident.
The Mad King is dead. Rhaegar lies beneath the ground. Why weren’t you there to protect your prince?
Where’s my sister?
No. Now it ends.

1.text: You’ve got fat.
Cat!
Nine years. Why haven’t I seen you? Where the hell have you been?
Who have we here? You must be Robb. (To Sansa) My, you’re a pretty one. (To Arya) Your name is?
Take me to your crypt. I want to pay my respects.
Ned.
One minute he was fine, and then … Burned right through him, whatever it was. I loved that man.
He never had to teach you much, but me … You remember me at 16? All I wanted to do was crack skulls and fuck girls. He showed me what was what.

Don’t look at me like that. Not his fault I didn’t listen. (They laugh. ROBERT sighs.) I need you, Ned. Down at Kings Landing. Not up here, where you’re no damn use to anybody. Lord Eddard Stark, I would name you the Hand of the king.

I’m not trying to honor you. I’m trying to get you to run my kingdom while I eat, drink, and whore my way to an early grave. Damn it, Ned, stand up. You helped me win the Iron Throne, now help me keep the damn thing. We were meant to rule together. If your sister had lived, we would have been bound by blood. Well, it’s not too late. I have a son, you have a daughter. We’ll join our Houses.
Did you have to bury her in a place like this? She should be on a hill somewhere with the sun and the clouds above her.
She belonged with me.
In my dreams, I kill him every night.
Not all of them.
Are you as good with a spear as you used to be?
I know what I’m putting you through. Thank you for saying yes. I only ask you because I need you. You’re a loyal friend. You hear me? A loyal friend. The last one I’ve got.
You will. And I’ll make sure you don’t look so fucking grim all the time. Come on, boys, let’s go kill some boar!
Gods, this is country! I've half a mind to leave them all behind and keep going.
What do you say, just you and me on the Kingsroad, swords at our sides, a couple of tavern wenches to warm our beds tonight.
There were wars to fight, women to marry... We never had the chance to be young.
There was that one... Oh, what was her name? That common girl of yours? Becca? With the great big tits you could bury your face in.
Bessie! Thank the gods for Bessie and her tits. Yours was... Aleena? No. You told me once. Meryl? Your bastard's mother?
That's it. She must have been a rare wench to make Lord Eddard Stark forget his honor. You never told me what she looked like.
We were at war. None of us knew if we were gonna go back home again. You're too hard on yourself. You always have been. I swear if I weren't your King, you'd have hit me already.
Trust me, that's not the worst thing. There was a rider in the night.
A knife perhaps, a good sharp one, and a bold man to wield it.
Soon enough that child will spread her legs and start breeding.
Oh, it's unspeakable to you? What her father did to your family... That was unspeakable. What Rhaegar Targaryen did to your sister... the woman I loved. I'll kill every Targaryen I get my hands on.
This Khal Drogo, it's said he has 100,000 men in his horde.
There are still those in the Seven Kingdoms who call me Usurper. If the Targaryen boy crosses with a Dothraki horde at his back, the scum will join him.
There's a war coming, Ned. I don't know when, I don't know who we'll be fighting, but it's coming.
Quiet, woman. Sorry, Ned. I never meant to frighten the girl. But we need to get this business done quickly.
Enough! He tells me one thing, she tells me another. Seven hells! What am I to make of this? Where's your other daughter, Ned?
Now, child... Tell me what happened. Tell it all and tell it true. It's a great crime to lie to a King.
What would you have me do, whip her through the streets? Damn it, children fight. It's over.
You let that little girl disarm you? See to it that your daughter is disciplined. I'll do the same with my son.
I'd forgot the damned wolf.
So be it.
As you will.
A direwolf's no pet. Get her a dog. She'll be happier for it.
It's been a long time. But I still remember every face. You remember your first?
Who was it?
How'd you do it?

Quick one. Lucky for you. Mine was some Tarly boy at the Battle of Summerhall. My horse took an arrow so I was on foot, slogging through the mud. He came running at me, this dumb high-born lad, thinking he could end the rebellion with the single swing of his sword. I knocked him down with the hammer. Gods, I was strong then. Caved in his breastplate. Probably shattered every rib he had. Stood over him, hammer in the air. Right before I brought it down he shouted, "Wait! Wait!"... They never tell you how they all shit themselves. They don't put that part in the songs. Stupid boy. Now the Tarlys bend the knee like everyone else. He could have lingered on the edge of the battle with the smart boys and today his wife would be making him miserable, his sons would be ingrates, and he'd be waking three times in the night to piss into a bowl. Wine! Lancel. Gods, what a stupid name. Lancel Lannister. Who named you? Some halfwit with a stutter? What are you doing?
What do you mean it's empty?

Is that what empty means?! So get more. Tell your cousin to get in here. Kingslayer! Get in here. Surrounded by Lannisters. Every time I close my eyes I see their blond hair and their smug, satisfied faces. It must wound your pride, huh? Standing out there like a glorified sentry. Jaime Lannister, son of the mighty Tywin... Forced to mind the door while your King eats and drinks and shits and fucks. So come on. We're telling war stories. Who was your first kill, not counting old men?
Your outlaw... Any last words?
What about Aerys Targaryen? What did the Mad King say when you stabbed him in the back? I never asked. Did he call you a traitor? Did he plead for a reprieve?
I'll bet you smell of blackberry jam! Let me smell it. Come here.
I've been sitting here for days! Start the damn joust before I piss myself!
Yes, yes. Enough of the bloody pomp. Have at it!
Your mother was a dumb whore with a fat arse. Did you know that? Look at this idiot! One ball and no brains. He can't even put a man's armor on him properly.
Fat? Fat, is it? Is that how you speak to your King? That was funny, is it?
Oh, it’s funny, is it?
No? You don't like the Hand's joke?
You heard the Hand. The King's too fat for his armor! Go find the breastplate stretcher, now!
How long before he figures it out?
All right, all right. But you watch me out there. I still know how to point a lance.
Why? Because I'm king? Piss on that. I want to hit somebody!
Anybody who can. And the last man in his saddle... will be you!
Are you telling me those cowards would let me win?
… Drink.
Drink. Your King commands it. Gods! Too fat for my armor.

Hmm... A bloody idiot... But Cersei insisted. I have Jon Arryn to thank for her. "Cersei Lannister will make a good match", he told me. "You'll need her father on your side." I thought being King meant I could do whatever I wanted. Enough of this! Let's go watch 'em ride. At least I can smell someone else's blood.
What? Oh! An inspiring sight for the people, eh? Come! Bow before your King! Bow, you shits!
Stop this madness in the name of your King!
The whore is pregnant.

I warned you this would happen. Back in the North, I warned you, but you didn't care to hear. Well, hear it now. I want 'em dead, mother and child both. And that fool, Viserys as well. Is that plain enough for you? I want them both dead.
Honor?! I've got Seven Kingdoms to rule! One King, Seven Kingdoms. Do you think honor keeps them in line? Do you think it's honor that's keeping the peace? It's fear! Fear and blood!
Careful, Ned. Careful now.
And if he's right? If she has a son? A Targaryen at the head of a Dothraki army… What then?
Do nothing? That's your wise advice? Do nothing til our enemies are on our shores? You're my council? Counsel! Speak sense to this honorable fool.
She dies.
You're the King's Hand, Lord Stark. You'll do as I command or I'll find me a Hand who will.

Out! Out, damn you! I'm done with you. Go! Run back to Winterfell! I'll have your head on a spike! I'll put it there myself, you fool! You think you're too good for this? Too proud and honorable? This is a war!
I'm glad I could do something to make you happy.
I suppose this is where you tell me to give the job to your brother Jaime.
I don't know. But I do know this, if the Targaryen girl convinces her horse-lord husband to invade and the Dothraki horde crosses The Narrow Sea... We won't be able to stop them.
It's a neat little trick you do, you move your lips and your father's voice comes out.

Let's say Viserys Targaryen lands with forty thousand Dothraki screamers at his back. We hole up in our castles, a wise move. Only a fool would meet the Dothraki in an open field. They leave us in our castles. They go from town to town, looting and burning, killing every man who can't hide behind a stone wall, stealing all our crops and livestock, enslaving all our women and children. How long do the people of the Seven Kingdoms stand behind their absentee King, their cowardly King hiding behind high walls? When do the people decide that Viserys Targaryen is the rightful monarch after all.
Which is the bigger number -- five or one?

Five... one. One army, a real army, united behind one leader with one purpose. Our purpose died with the Mad King. Now we've got as many armies as there are men with gold in their purse. And everybody wants something different. Your father wants to own the world. Ned Stark wants to run away and bury his head in the snow.

We haven't had a real fight in nine years. Back-stabbing doesn't prepare you for a fight. And that's all the realm is now, back-stabbing and scheming and arse-licking and money-grubbing. Sometimes I don't know what holds it together.
Ah, so here we sit, seventeen years later, holding it all together. Don't you get tired?
How long can hate hold a thing together?
Yes, it is.
You've never asked about her, not once. Why not?
So why now?

You want to know the horrible truth? I can't even remember what she looked like. I only know she was the one thing I ever wanted... Someone took her away from me, and Seven Kingdoms couldn't fill the hole she left behind.
I know.
No. Does that make you feel better or worse?
Who’d have thought she had it in her?
Oh, will both of you shut your mouths? Catelyn will release Tyrion and you’ll make your peace with Jaime.
Quiet, woman.
Hold your tongue.
Wear it in silence or I’ll honor you again.
See what she does to me? My loving wife. I should not have hit her. That was not… That was not kingly.
So tell your wife to return that little shit of an Imp to King’s Landing. She’s had her fun, now put an end to it. You hear me? Send a raven and put an end to it.

I’m half a kingdom in debt to his bloody father. I don’t know what happened between you and those yellow-haired shits. I don’t want to know. This is what matters - I can’t rule the kingdoms if the Starks and the Lannisters are at each other’s throats, so enough!

Piss on that! Send a raven. I want you to stay. I’m the king, I get what I want… I never loved my brothers. A sad thing for a man to admit, but it’s true. You were the brother I chose. We’ll talk when I return from the hunt.
Killing things clears my head. You’ll have to sit on the throne while I’m away. You’ll hate it more than I do.

Seven hells! Don’t start with her again! The girl will die and I’ll hear no more of it. Put on the badge. And if you ever take it off again, I swear to the Mother I’ll pin the damn thing on Jaime Lannister.
Oh, what was I saying?
It was! It was. You’re too young to remember. Wasn’t it, Selmy?
The enemy was right there in the open, vicious as you like, all but sending you a bloody invitation. Nothing like today.
Exhilarating, yes. Not as exhilarating as those balls and masquerades you like to throw. (laughs) You ever fucked a Riverlands girl?
You think? I think you’d remember. Back in our day, you weren’t a real man until you fucked a girl from each of the Seven Kingdoms and the Riverlands. We called it “making the eight.”
You ever make the eight, Barristan?
(laughs) Those were the days!
Easy, boy. You might be my brother, but you’re speaking to the King.
I should have spent more time with you, shown you how to be a man.
My fault. Too much wine, missed my thrust.
Out, all of you!
Paper and ink on the table, write down what I say.
Give it to the council after I'm dead.
And my son Help him, Ned. Make him better than me.
My memory.
As your brother, I feel it’s my duty to warn you
There was nothing to be afraid of until you told father. [In a whisper, mimicking] We’re Lannisters. Lannisters don’t act like fools.
But who would he tell?

If he told the king, both our heads would be skewered on the city gates by now. Whatever Jon Arryn knew or didn’t know, it died with him. And Robert will choose a new Hand of the king, someone to do his job while he’s off fucking boars and hunting whores. Or is it the other way around? And life will go on.
That’s an honor I can do without. Their days are too long, their lives are too short.
Don’t get up.
You’ve much to teach me, no doubt. But our sister craves your attention.
A family trait. Now, the Starks are feasting us at sundown. Don’t leave me alone with these people.
I thought you might say that. But since we’re short on time, (he opens the door; a bevy of whores enter and descend on TYRION) Come on, girls. See you at sundown.
I hear we might be neighbors soon. I hope it’s true.
I’m sure we’ll have a tournament to celebrate the new title, if you accept. It would be good to have you in the field. The competition has become a bit stale.
No? Getting a little old for it?
Well said.
Are you completely mad?
It’s all right. It’s all right.
I heard you the first time. (To BRAN) Quite the little climber, aren’t you? How old are you, boy?
Ten.
The things I do for love.

You look lovely tonight, Lady Stark. Widowhood becomes you. (Catelyn grabs a large rock from the ground) Your bed must be lonely. ls that why you came? l'm not at my best, but l think l could be of service. You slip out of that gown and we'll see if l'm up to it. (She marches towards him and hits the rock against his forehead) Oh, l do like a violent woman.
Let me show you how. Hit me again, over the ear. And again and again. You're stronger than you look, it shouldn't take long.
But l don't, my lady. The dark is coming for all of us. Why cry about it?
What gods are those? The trees your husband prayed to? Where were the trees when his head was getting chopped off? lf your gods are real and if they are just why is the world so full of injustice?
There are no men like me. Only me.
l pushed him out the window.
I hoped the fall would kill him.
You should get some sleep. lt's going to be a long war. (Catelyn drops the rock and goes away)
Little brother.
Tell me you're not thinking of taking the black.
Even if the boy lives, he'll be a cripple, a grotesque. Give me a good clean death any day.
My dear brother, there are times you make me wonder whose side you're on.
A sword for the wall?
Good man. Have you swung it yet?

At someone, I mean. It's a strange thing, the first time you cut a man. You realize we're nothing but sacks of meat and blood and some bone to keep it all standing. Let me thank you ahead of time for guarding us all from the perils beyond the Wall... Wildlings and White Walkers and whatnot. We're grateful to have good, strong men like you protecting us.
Is it "we" already? Have you taken your vows then?
Give my regards to the Night's Watch. I'm sure it will be thrilling to serve in such an elite force. And if not, It's only for life.
Thank the gods you're here, Stark. About time we had some stern northern leadership.
Sturdy old thing. How many kings' asses have polished it, I wonder? What's the line? The King shits and the Hand wipes.
I know. People have been swinging at me for years, but they always seem to miss.

I have a knack for it. It must be strange for you coming into this room. I was standing right here when it happened. He was very brave, your brother. Your father too. They didn't deserve to die like that. Nobody deserves to die like that.

500 men just stood there and watched. All the great knights of the Seven Kingdoms. You think anyone said a word, lifted a finger? No, Lord Stark. 500 men and this room was silent as a crypt. Except for the screams, of course, and the Mad King laughing. And later... When I watched the Mad King die, I remembered him laughing as your father burned... It felt like justice.
Tell me... If I'd stabbed the Mad King in the belly instead of the back, would you admire me more?
Calm down.
I was thinking of us. You're a bit late to start complaining about it now. What has the boy told them?
Then what are you raving about?
We'll say he was lying. We'll say he was dreaming. We'll say whatever we like. I think we can outfox a 10-year-old.
I'll go to war with him if I have to. They can write a ballad about us
Never.
The boy won't talk. And if he does, I'll kill him. Him, Ned Stark, the King... the whole bloody lot of them, until you and I are the only people left in this world.
One of the outlaws in the Brotherhood.
You killed Simon Toyne with a counter riposte. Best move I ever saw.
I cut his head off, so no.
He said the same thing he'd been saying for hours... "Burn them all." If that's all, your Grace...
Listen. Do you hear them? How many do you think are in there with him? Guess.
He likes to do this when I'm on duty... He makes me listen as he insults my sister.
Why do I have to forgive you? Have you wronged me?
Have we? Strange, I've forgotten.
That's where you got your scar?
Vicious sons of whores.
They stopped liking it at the end. That was a proper battle. D'you remember Thoros of Myr charging through the breach?
I saw the youngest of the Greyjoy lads at Winterfell. It was like seeing a shark on a mountaintop.
I doubt it.
I don't serve Lord Stark.
Such a small pack of wolves.
Was!... the Hand of the King. Now I'm not sure what he is... Lord of somewhere very far away.
Get back inside where it's safe. I'm looking for my brother. You remember my brother, don't you, Lord Stark? Blond hair, sharp tongue, short man.
It seems he had some trouble on the road. You wouldn't know what happened to him, would you?
Come, Stark. I'd rather you die sword in hand.
Threaten? As in, "I'm going to open your Lord from balls to brains and see what Starks are made of”?
You're right. Take him alive! Kill his men!
My brother, Lord Stark... We want him back.
"Summoned to court to answer for the crimes of your bannerman Gregor Clegane, the Mountain"
Catelyn Stark took my brother.
Tyrion?
One of our men interfered, speared him through the leg before I could finish him.
It wouldn't have been clean.
I could care less what anyone thinks of me.
It's the truth.
Of course it bothers me.
I didn't realize you placed such a high value on my brother's life.
So the lion does concern himself with the opinions of..
He's been covering himself in glory.
Lady Stark. l'd offer you my sword, but l seem to have lost it.
l've lost them too, l'm afraid.

We could end this war right now, boy, save thousands of lives. You fight for the Starks, l fight for the Lannisters. Swords or lances, teeth, nails - choose your weapons and let's end this here and now.

2.text: King in the North. I keep expecting you to leave me in one castle or another for safekeeping, but you drag me along from camp to camp. Have you grown fond of me, Stark? Is that it? I've never seen you with a girl.
You don't trust the loyalty of the men following you into battle?
Smart boy. What's wrong? Don't like being called ‘boy’? Insulted?
If that's true, Stannis is the rightful king. How convenient for him.
I was your prisoner when Ned Stark lost his head.
You have proof? Or do you want to trade gossip like a couple of fishwives?
You think my father's going to negotiate with you? You don't know him very well.
Three victories don't make you a conqueror.
You're a virgin, I take it?

Childhood must have been awful for you. Were you a foot taller than all the boys? They laughed at you, called you names? Some boys like a challenge. One or two must have tried to get inside Big Brienne.
Ah. But you fought them off. But maybe you wished one of them could overpower you, fling you down, tear off your clothes. But none of them were strong enough. I'm strong enough.
Of course you are. You'd love to know what it feels like to be a woman.

Ah. "They lay with lions." Tavern girls, I'd say. Probably served my father's soldiers. Maybe one of them gave up a kiss and a feel. That's how they earned this. The glorious work of the Northern freedom fighters. Must make you proud to serve the Starks.
Tell yourself that tonight when they swing in your dreams.
What are you doing?
We shouldn't stay here. We should get back on the river.
Untie me. Now!
Apparently eating is now a crime. Who knew?
But it's not a crime to starve. That's justice for you.
For stealing a pig?
Have you been to Ashemark?
Then you don't know me.
Is it near Ashemark?
I've never been there.
I wish someone had told me. I wouldn't have had to steal that pig.
Those were Stark men.
You think my father’s going to negotiate with you? You don’t know him very well.
Is she the fat one?
No, no. There's only one fat Lannister. If she was your mother, you'd know it.
When?
I went to Willem Frey's wedding?
He threw up on his horse on the way to the tourney grounds. What was his name?
Poor lad. That was my brother's doing, I seem to recall. I remember you. You'd never squired for anyone before.
You didn't, though.
You knew when you were needed and when to go away. It's a rare talent. Most of my squires, they mean well, but young men with big jobs, they tend to overdo them.
You were saying?
More embarrassing than being chained to a post covered in your own shit?
I understand completely.
It's just that I I was 16 once. I also had to replace someone's squire on short notice.
Barristan Selmy. The fight against the Kingswood Outlaws. Before your time.

He was A painter. A painter who only used red. I couldn't imagine being able to fight like that, not back then. And to help him do that, to be a part of something that perfect. I don't need to explain how that felt, not to you.
It's like stepping into a dream you've been dreaming for as long as you can remember, and finding out that the dream is more real than your life.
No. I didn't have your gift. He couldn't take a step without stepping on me. I was awful, a complete liability. Until one of the outlaws decided to take on a 16-year-old squire.

It's a good thing I am who I am. I'd have been useless at anything else. I'm not well-suited for imprisonment. Shocking, I know. Some men are. Ned Stark, I imagine he made an excellent prisoner right up until the end. Not me, though. My life has left me uniquely unfit for constraint.
Of course. Every day.
Good prisoners breed good jailers, apparently. The Starks are very careful.
But there is a way, I think. It wasn't possible until now.
It's actually quite simple.
You'll only have to do one thing.
(whispers)You'll have to die.
Thank you for fighting on my behalf, Lady Stark. I would have come to your defense, but
You've become a real she-wolf in your later years. There's not much fish left in you.
Come to say goodbye, Lady Stark? I believe it's my last night in this world. Is that a woman?
Old Lord Karstark doesn't seem to like me.
Oh. Oh. Was he the one on guard duty? He was in my way. Any knight would have done the same.

So many vows. They make you swear and swear. Defend the king, obey the king, obey your father, protect the innocent, defend the weak. But what if your father despises the king? What if the king massacres the innocent? It's too much. No matter what you do, you're forsaking one vow or another. Where did you find this beast?
Kingslayer. What a king he was. Here's to Aerys Targaryen, the Second of His Name, Lord of the Seven Kingdoms, Protector of the Realm, and to the sword I shoved in his back.
Do you know, I've never been with any woman but Cersei. So in my own way, I have more honor than poor old dead Ned. What was the name of that bastard he fathered?

No, that wasn't it. Snow, a bastard from the North. Now, when When good old Ned came home with some whore's baby, did you pretend to love it? No. You're not very good at pretending. You're an honest woman. You hated that boy, didn't you? How could you not hate him? The walking, talking reminder that the honorable Lord Eddard Stark fucked another woman.
Damn.
You're much uglier in daylight. What's your name? I'm Jaime Lannister of Casterly Rock, son of Tywin.
A captive knight has a right to know his captor's identity.

Tarth, Tarth, Tarth. Crescent moons and starbursts. Lord Selwyn Tarth. Your father. Do you have any brothers and sisters, my lady? It's a long way to King's Landing. Might as well get to know one another.
Have you known many men? I suppose not. Women? Horses? Ah.
I didn't mean to give offense, my lady. Forgive me.
Why do you hate me so much? Have I ever harmed you?
Has anyone ever told you you're as boring as you are ugly?
I already have. Look at you. You're ready to chop my head off. Do you think you could? Do you think you could beat me in a fair fight?
The answer is no. There are three men in the kingdoms who might have a chance against me. You're not one of them.
If you're so confident, unlock my chains. Let's see what happens.
I took you for a fighter, a man Pardon. Woman of honor. Was I wrong? You're afraid.

3.text: Cersei.
Do you know how long it's going to take us to get to King's Landing walking through fields and forests?
So how shall we pass the time?
It's going to be a very dull walk.

You know, it doesn't matter how loyal a servant you are, no one enjoys the company of a humorless mute. Trust me on this. People have been serving me since I was born. You think Lady Stark is going to want a giant towheaded plank following her around for the rest of her life? A week's journey with you and she'll order you to fall on your sword.
All the good it's done her.
How did you come into Lady Stark's service? There's something we can talk about.
It had to be recently. You weren't with her at Winterfell.
Because I visited Winterfell. I would have noticed your dour head smacking into the archways.
Were you pledged to Stannis?
Ah, Renly. Really? He wasn't fit to rule over anything more important than a 12-course meal.
Why? I lived with him at court since he was a boy, don't forget. Could hardly escape the little tulip. Skipping down the corridors in his embroidered silks. I knew him far better than you.
Sounds like you quite fancied him.
Oh, gods, you did.
Did you ever tell him? No, of course not. You weren't Renly's type, I'm afraid.
He preferred curly-haired little girls like Loras Tyrell. You're far too much man for him.
Unless they're about me. It's all true about Renly. His proclivities were the worst kept secret at court. It's a shame the throne isn't made out of cocks. They'd have never got him off it.
I don't blame him. And I don't blame you, either. We don't get to choose who we love.
No, you really can't.
He knows who I am.
Maybe you're right. But what if you're not? What if he tells someone?
More innocent than Lady Stark's daughters?
It's a tough decision-take the bridge and risk being seen or cross the great water.
Anyone can see us on the bridge, but cross by water and the current could take us or I could escape down the river.
It's wonderful to watch you wrestle with these dilemmas. Which will she choose?
Gambler at heart. Wouldn't have guessed.
I need to rest.
I have these, you know, on your feet when you walk too far. What do you call them?
Corns. I never used to get corns. Of course I used to ride everywhere, not march around like a common foot soldier wearing the same shit boots for over a year.
This heel is ruined. There's no way-
I never understood why some knights felt the need to carry two swords.
Ooh. You move well for a great beast of a woman.
You shouldn't grimace before you lunge. It gives away the game.
Bit of a quandary for you. If you kill me, you fail Lady Stark. But if you don't kill me, I'm going to kill you.
You're good. Graceless, but good.
See? If you were willing to hurt me, you might have had me there.
We enjoy a good fight. Gets our juices flowing. The Flayed Man of House Bolton. A bit gruesome for my taste.
Let us go and my father will pay you whatever you want.
I hope you're pleased. If you had armed me, they never would have taken us.
I was in chains if you recall. Our little match would have ended quite quick if my hands weren't bound.
I've been sitting in a muddy pen wrapped in chains for the past year.
You were not beating me.
When we make camp tonight, you'll be raped. More than once. None of these fellows have ever been with a noblewoman. You'd be wise not to resist.
They'll knock your teeth out.
No, I don't think you care about your teeth. If you fight them, they will kill you. Do you understand? I'm the prisoner of value, not you. Let them have what they want. What does it matter?
Close your eyes. Pretend they're Renly.
If I was a woman, I'd make them kill me. But I'm not, thank the gods.
You know who she is, don't you?
She's Brienne of Tarth. Her father is Lord Selwyn Tarth. Heard of Tarth?
They call it the Sapphire Isle. Do you know why? Every sapphire in Westeros was mined on Tarth. Sapphires are gemstones. The blue ones.
Lord Selwyn would pay his daughter's weight in sapphires if she's returned to him. But only if she's alive, her honor unbesmirched.
Not defiled.

I hated to read as a child, but my father forced me to study the books every morning before I could practice with sword or horse. Two hours every day holed up in the maester's chambers. I learned a lot of fancy words.

You'll be a rich man till the end of your days. And your sons will be rich men and their sons after them. Lands, titles-- you'll have them all. The North can't win this war. You're a smart man. You understand that. We have the numbers. We have the gold.
Fighting bravely for a losing cause is admirable. Fighting for a winning cause is far more rewarding.

Now that we're speaking together man to man, I wonder if you need to keep me chained to this tree. I'm not asking to be freed from my constraints, but if I could sleep lying down, my back would thank you for it. I'm not as young and resilient as I was once.
I'm famished, actually.
Well, I do like partridge.
Oh, yes. Yes, this will do nic-- ah!
My father--
Don't.
(desperately) Water. Water. Please, water. Wa-water. Water, please. Please. Please.
If I die, you won't be getting--
I'm dying.
I don't care about revenge.
Misfor-- misfortune?
My sword hand. I was that hand.
Lord Bolton.
Is there word from the capital? Roose BOLTON
Will I die?
Then you'll die. You're no maester. Where's your chain?
I don't need my right hand to kill you.
Mmm.
No milk of the poppy.
I'll scream.
I'll scream loudly.
Not so hard. You'll scrub the skin off.
I need a bath. Help me out of these rags.
Now get out.
This one suits me fine. Don't worry. I'm not interested. If I faint, pull me out. I don't intend to be the first Lannister to die in a bathtub.
You swore a solemn vow, remember? You're supposed to get me to King's Landing in one piece. Not going so well, is it? No wonder Renly died with you guarding him.
That was unworthy. Forgive me. You protected me better than most--
I'm apologizing. I'm sick of fighting. Let's call a truce.
I trust you.
There it is. There's the look. I've seen it for 17 years on face after face. You all despise me. Kingslayer. Oathbreaker. A man without honor. You've heard of wildfire?

The Mad King was obsessed with it. He loved to watch people burn, the way their skin blackened and blistered and melted off their bones. He burned lords he didn't like. He burned Hands who disobeyed him. He burned anyone who was against him. Before long, half the country was against him. Aerys saw traitors everywhere. So he had his pyromancer place caches of wildfire all over the city-- beneath the Sept of Baelor and the slums of Flea Bottom. Under houses, stables, taverns. Even beneath the Red Keep itself. Finally, the day of reckoning came. Robert Baratheon marched on the capital after his victory at the Trident. But my father arrived first with the whole Lannister army at his back, promising to defend the city against the rebels. I knew my father better than that. He's never been one to pick the losing side. I told the Mad King as much. I urged him to surrender peacefully. But the king didn't listen to me. He didn't listen to Varys who tried to warn him. But he did listen to Grand Maester Pycelle, that grey, sunken cunt. 'You can trust the Lannisters,' he said. 'The Lannisters have always been true friends of the crown.' So we opened the gates and my father sacked the city. Once again, I came to the king, begging him to surrender. He told me to bring him my father's head. Then he turned to his pyromancer. 'Burn them all,' he said. 'Burn them in their homes. Burn them in their beds.' Tell me, if your precious Renly commanded you to kill your own father and stand by while thousands of men, women, and children burned alive, would you have done it? Would you have kept your oath then?

First, I killed the pyromancer. And then when the king turned to flee, I drove my sword into his back. 'Burn them all,' he kept saying. 'Burn them all.' I don't think he expected to die. He-- he meant to burn with the rest of us and rise again, reborn as a dragon to turn his enemies to ash. I slit his throat to make sure that didn't happen. That's where Ned Stark found me.
Stark? You think the honorable Ned Stark wanted to hear my side? He judged me guilty the moment he set eyes on me. By what right does the wolf judge the lion? By what right?
Jaime. My name is Jaime.
You should. But instead, you're sitting here watching me fail at dinner. Why might that be?
We both know who would pay the most. Or make you pay the most if he found out you had captured me and sent me back up north for a summary execution.
It would be, if you honestly believed my father would never find out about it.
He'll make time for you.
Shall we drink on it?
You do understand how suspicious that is to ordinary people?
Very well. My lady, may our journey continue without further incident.
I'm afraid I must insist.
Tomorrow.
Lord Bolton's traveling tomorrow as well. He's going to the Twins for Edmure Tully's wedding. You're to remain here.
I owe you a debt.
(nods) I will return the Stark girls to their mother. I swear it.
(nods)
My father will make him Grand Maester if he grows me a new hand. Roose BOLTON
(nods) Tell Robb Stark I'm sorry I couldn't make his uncle's wedding. The Lannisters send their regards.
What's the purpose of an arm with no hand?
Yes, we've stymied the corruption. You're a learned man.
You did well sewing up this mess. You're far better at this sort of work than Grand Maester Pycelle.
So why did the Citadel take your chain? Did you fondle one boy too many?
What is?
You performed experiments on living men.
With their permission?
Dying paupers, I assume. Men with no families to complain. You found them moaning in the poorhouse and had them carted back to your garret and opened up their bellies to see what was inside.
I don't know.
(shakes his head)
Countless has a nice ring to it.
Half a million. The population of King's Landing. You were in charge of the ravens at Harrenhal. Did you-- did you get a bird off to Brienne's father in Tarth?
A fair offer.
Why not?
(sighs)
They'd be fools to kill her.
We have to return to Harrenhal.
I've left something behind.
And what are those orders?
You think you'll get a reward.

You think you're getting a reward. Let me explain something to you. When my father sees me, the first thing he's going to ask is what happened to my hand. And I'm going to tell him this man chopped it off.
Or I could tell him this man saved my life. We return to Harrenhal now.
Whoa.
Be quiet.
A wooden sword?
You gave her a wooden sword.
I'll pay her bloody ransom. Gold, sapphires, whatever you want. Just get her out of there.
Get behind me.
Pull her up.
We're taking her to King's Landing. Unless you kill me.
What do you think is more important to Lord Bolton? Getting his pet rat a reward or ensuring Tywin Lannister gets his son back alive?
Well, we must be on our way. Sorry about the sapphires.

4.text: Magnificent.
Looks fresh-forged.
No one's made a Valyrian steel sword since the Doom of Valyria.
Where did you get this much Valyrian steel?
You've wanted one of these in the family for a long time.
Two?
Well, thank you. It's glorious.
Any decent swordsman knows how to use both hands.
No. But as long as I'm better than everyone else, I suppose it doesn't matter.
Where's that written? I can and I will. The Kingsguard oath is for life.
How many people in this city alone would love to see his head on a pike?
Home?
You are the Lord of Casterly Rock.
You know what they call me? Kingslayer. Oathbreaker. Man without honor. Now you want me to break another sacred vow.
No.
No.
There's my answer.
My bloody honor is beyond repair, but my answer is still no. I don't want Casterly Rock. I don't want a wife. I don't want children.
Supper would be nice.
I suppose you want the sword back.
(Groans)
You like it so much, you're welcome to chop off your own hand and take it.
Days?
Uh... a hook would be more practical.
Odd little man.
What symptoms?
You let him touch you?
I'm surprised. You never let Pycelle near you.
I'm not sure I've ever smelled a dead cat.
You drink more than you used to.
Why?
It must have been traumatic for you.
A rather short siege.
Father disowned me today.
You're forgetting Tyrion.
Staying in the Kingsguard means I live right here in the Red Keep with you.
I want... Not now? When? I've been back for weeks.
Something's changed.
What do you want me to apologize for?
You think I wanted to be taken prisoner?
Every day I was a prisoner, I plotted my escape. Every day. I murdered people so I could be here with you.
I... What are you saying?
Go away.
All the Kingsguard will be on duty, of course. Ser Boros will be stationed here. Ser Preston will be stationed here beside the primary entertainment. Your Grace?
Ser Meryn will guard Lady Margaery and Tommen.
And I thank you for it, Ser Meryn. All very good. I don't expect any trouble.
Margaery Tyrell, I've heard.
The war's not won. Not while Stannis lives.
My apologies, Your Grace. I was rather busy.

So this is the famous "Book of Brothers"? All the great deeds of all the great Kingsguard. Ser Arthur Dayne. The Sword of the Morning. (Chuckles) Led the attack on the Kingswood Brotherhood. Defeated the Smiling Knight in single combat. Ser Duncan the Tall. (Laughs) Four pages for Ser Duncan. He must have been quite a man.
So they say.
There's still time.
I use my left hand now, Your Grace. Makes for more of a contest.
Yes, there she is.
To return the Stark girls to their mother who is now dead.

Well, Arya Stark hasn't been seen since her father was killed. Where do you think she is? My money's on dead. There's a certain safety in death, wouldn't you say? And Sansa Stark is now Sansa Lannister. Bit of a complication.
What do you want me to do? Kidnap my sister-in-law? And take her where? Where would she be safer than here?
Are you sure we're not related? Ever since I've returned, every Lannister I've seen has been a miserable pain in my ass. Maybe you're a Lannister, too. You've got the hair for it if not the looks.
You won. One fewer brother. Must be proud of yourself. There's really nothing you wouldn't do, is there?
Tyrion is your family.
You don't get to choose.
Are you really mad enough to blame him for that? He didn't decide to kill her. He was an infant.
The things I did to get back to you, to endure all that, only to find you-
Those are words.
Told him what?
You told him?
You think he'll just accept that?
What did you say?
Someone will walk in.
Is that any way to speak about our mother?
What do you think I’m doing? The galley’s waiting in the bay bound for the Free Cities.
Varys.
You have more friends than you thought.
There’s a locked door at the top of the stairs. Knock on it twice, and then twice again. Varys will open.
Farewell, little brother.
Quickly now.
Gilded steel.
I'm not hungry.
Oh!
No, I'll do it. Leave us.
I can't fight anymore.
I can hold a sword, but all my instincts are wrong. How can I protect the king when I can hardly wipe my own ass?
I'm not Father. I'm the Kingslayer. When people find out I can't slay a pigeon...
With whom? You? Men talk. Soon as someone discovers I can't fight, he'll tell everyone.
My brother tells me you can keep your mouth shut. Unusual talent for a sellsword.
Is this place safe?
Uh-huh.
I haven't used a sparring sword since I was nine.
Ah! Bold warrior you are, attacking a man when his guard's down.
Come on, then.
Ser Loras, it's quite all right. Your sister looks very beautiful.
So, looking forward to your wedding?
Our fathers are both rather keen on the prospect.

Perhaps they should get married. If you were to marry Cersei, she'd murder you in your sleep. If you somehow managed to put a child in her first, she'd murder him, too, long before he drew his first breath. Luckily for you, none of this will happen because you'll never marry her.
Move away!
Joffrey! Joffrey!
How are you?
You are. You will be. I'll see to that.
Please give the queen a moment alone with her son.
I don't know what I saw.
Tyrion's my brother. Our brother. There'll be a trial. We'll get to the truth of what happened.
You're a hateful woman. Why have the gods made me love a hateful woman?
No.
(GRUNTS)
I don't care.
I don't care.
I don't care.
What the hell was that?
You're a rare talent. When you're fighting cripples, anyway.
You talk to my brother this way?
Do you think he did it?
We're done for today.
You stood for him in his trial by combat at the Eyrie.
To tell you the truth, this isn't so bad. Four walls. A pot to piss in. I was chained to a wooden post covered in my own shit for months.
Maybe a bit. I'm sorry I didn't come sooner.
How do you think? Her son died in her arms.
Don't. You know what's coming?
Now that you mention it, she did ask.
Depends. Did you do it?
Are you really asking if I'd kill my brother? How can I help you?
You know I can't.
What do you want me to do? Kill the guards? Sneak you out of the city in the back of a cart? I'm the Lord Commander of the Kingsguard.
Inappropriate? You're accused of killing the king.Freeing you is treason.

Which is why we're having a trial. A trial. If the killer threw himself before the Iron Throne, confessed to his crimes, and gave irrefutable evidence of his guilt, it wouldn't matter to Cersei. She won't rest until my head's on a spike.
Not just yours. She's offering a knighthood to whomever finds Sansa Stark.
You sent for me, Your Grace?
Ser Boros is on duty tonight. Tomorrow I believe...
I promise you Tommen's safe. We're protecting him.
What?
You know why. She'd hoped I'd send her daughters back to her.
I swore by all the gods that if her daughters were alive, I'd return them to her.
I wanted to get back to you. Should I have told hert o fuck off?
Catelyn Stark's dead. So if I told you to leave the capital right now and find Sansa, if I told you to find that murderous little bitch and bring me her head, would you do it?
I had to see him. I had to know for myself.
He didn't do it, Cersei.
It's the duty of the Lord Commander to fill those pages. And there's still room left on mine.
Mmm. It's yours.

It was reforged from Ned Stark's sword. You'll use it to defend Ned Stark's daughter. You swore an oath to return the Stark girls to their mother. Lady Stark's dead. Arya's probably dead, too, but there's still a chance to find Sansa and get her somewhere safe. I've got something else for you.
I hope I got your measurements right.
I almost forgot. I have one more gift.
Of course you do.
My brother owes him a debt. He's not safe here. You're keeping him from harm. It's chivalry.
See? He's a good lad.You'll get along.
They say the best swords have names. Any ideas?
Good-bye, Brienne.
Father's orders.
You'd condemn your own son to death?
This isn't a trial. It's a farce. Cersei has manipulated everything and you know it.
You've always hated Tyrion.
As did I. Do you know the last order the Mad King gave me? To bring him your head. I saved your life so you could murder my brother?
Justice?
He'll be executed.

Once you said family is what lives on. All that lives on. You told me about a dynasty that would last 1,000 years. What happens to your dynasty when Tyrion dies? I'm a Kingsguard, forbidden by oath to carry on the family line.
What happens to your name? Who carries the lion banner into future battles? Your nephews? Lancel Lannister? Others whose names I don't even remember?
It survives through me. I'll leave the Kingsguard. I'll take my place as your son and heir if you let Tyrion live.
You have my word.
You're going to be found guilty.
When you are, you need to enter a formal plea for mercy and ask to be sent to the Wall. Father's agreed to it. He'll spare your life and allow you to join the Night's Watch.
Father is not Joffrey. He'll keep his word.
Do you trust me?
Keep your mouth shut. No more outbursts. This will all be over soon.
I made a deal for you to keep your ungrateful head on your ungrateful neck a little while longer.
You threw your life away. You threw it away. It's not a joke. You understand that, don't you?
You fell in love with a whore.
Careful. I'm the last friend you've got.
Yes, brilliant speech. They'll be talking about it for days to come. I thought you were a realist. Didn't realize you'd die for pride.
I can't save you this time either. My training has proved that I can't beat a stable boy with my left hand.
(laughs)
It is tempting.
If he wins.
No. Not Ser Meryn.
Soon.
I've never seen him fight.
Oberyn believes in himself.
Beheading.
Cousins.
Of course. Wet-nurse dropped him on his head. Left him simple.
Nothing made you happier. You'd think being tormented from birth would have given you some affinity for the afflicted.
The joke wore thin, though.
I had other interests.
Why?
Volarik. Tried to touch me once.
Every day around the world, men, women, and children are murdered by the score. Who gives a dusty fuck about a bunch of beetles?
He was twice your size.
I don't know.
Good luck today.

5.text: What he built. The towers. He built it for us. He meant it for us. They’re going to try to take it away, all of it.
All of them out there are enemies. They’re waiting a night to make sure he’s really dead and as soon as they see the stones on his eyes they’ll set to work on tearing us apart.
This is exactly what they want.
Thank you.
Whenever you’re ready, My Lord.
Try not to lose it this time.

I know you didn’t want to leave Dorne. But I’m glad you’re coming home. Your mother’s desperate to see you. And I’m glad Trystane’s coming with us. He seems like a nice boy. You’re lucky. Arranged marriages are rarely so… so well arranged.
If she sees you’re happy, I’m sure she will.
Have you ever known your mother to like anyone aside from her children?

I’m not so sure about that. Listen. There’s something I’ve wanted to tell you. Something I should have told you long ago. So. Now that you’ve seen more of the world, you’ve learned how complicated things can be. People can be. The Lannisters and the Martells have hated each other for years, but you’ve fallen in love with Trystane. It was an accident, really, I mean what were the chances? You happen to fall in love with the man you were assigned to marry? (Myrcella laughs) My point is… we don’t choose whom we love. We just… It’s beyond our control. I sound like an idiot.
What I’m trying to say. What I’m trying and failing to say…
No. I’m afraid you don’t.
Myrcella?
Myrcella?!
Myrcella?! Myrcella?!
A summons from the queen.
Itâ€™s a threat.
No note.
Softer.
Not so loud.
The world can't know knows sheâ€™s our daughter.
If I was the father to any of my children, theyâ€™d be stoned in the streets.
Iâ€™ll make things better.
Iâ€™m going to Dorne. Iâ€™ll bring our daughter home.
Iâ€™m not going to ask him anything.
No army. Do you know where theyâ€™re keeping her?
Iâ€™ll find her. Is there anything else, your grace?
I never said I was going alone. (exit Jaime)
Ser Bronn of the Blackwater.
Thank you.
A pleasure. (he kisses her hand)
Beautiful bride you've chosen. When were you planning on getting married?
On with what?
It's very good for you.
Mmm.
I would have advised against that.
'Cause you're going to come with me and help me with something important. And when we return, I'm going to give you a much better girl, and a much better castle.
As far south as south goes.
Is that Estermont?
This ship's sailing to Oldtown. We'll get off earlier, not far from Sunspear. Row ourselves to the Dornish shores in the night.
No.
You should be happy to go back. (Drinks some water).
We are not kidnapping their princess. We are rescuing my niece, bringing her back to the family,
That's why you're here.
Because I don't want to start a war.
It has to be me.
It has to be me.
(Quietly) Varys set him free.
He murdered my father. If I ever see him, I'll split him in two. And then I'll give him your regards.
As far as I've seen, they're all shit ways to die.
I don't care what's sung about me when I'm dead.
Sounds like all the rest.
What about you? What shit way would you choose?
How disappointing. I thought you'd have something more exciting planned.
In the arms of the woman I love.
Let's go.
Pentoshi.
As I said. Why?
A bag of gold.
It was a heavy bag.
Four.
One, if he's slow.
I thought the sharks would get us. (Bronn looks at him).
I could have sworn those were shark fins.
Luck.
First we need to bury these bodies.
Corpses raise questions, questions raise armies. We're not here to start a war.
(Holding out his hand). I can't dig very well with one hand. Not at all, really.
Alright, thats enough.
We’re trying to blend in. We don’t want everyone in Dorne to hear your accent.
It can wait. Up there.
That’s the Water Gardens.
I like to improvise.
Myrcella.
Let’s speak in private.
Excellent. Good to meet you.
We have to go, Myrcella, now.
You’ll be fine, I promise, but we have to--
And more hands. How’s Trystane?
I’m sorry for that. It wasn’t supposed to happen that way.
Your mother’s worried about you. Threats have been made. Dorne is too dangerous for you. I’ve come to take you home.
It's for your own good. These are complicated matters.
I don’t understand.
Prince Doran. (bows)
Princess Myrcella.
What a lovely dress.
You must be cold.
Prince Trystane. How’s your jaw?
Looking out for the safety of my niece, the princess Myrcella.
We received a threatening message. The princess’s necklace in the jaws of a viper.
Ah. Excellent. The last meal before the beheading.
I’m afraid he does.
I accept.
You have my word.
May I inquire into the fate of my man?
He said it was just a fleabite. The fault is mine. Bronn is merely a soldier following my orders. If anyone should be punished it’s me.
You’re a good man.
Prince Doran, Ser Bronn of the Blackwater.
I believe you’ve already met Prince Trystane.
Prince Trystane here is a man of mercy. He’s agreed to grant you your freedom.
There was one condition.
Your maester kindly agreed to copy it over for me.
She will.
Of course, she’s my niece.

6.text: Mother.
Shh, shh. Don’t think about it.
She’s not suffering. She’s gone. No one can hurt her anymore.
I know.
Listen -- listen to me. She was my daughter and I failed her.
You don’t believe that.
Fuck prophecy. Fuck fate. Fuck everyone who isn’t us. We’re the only ones who matter, the only ones in this world. And everything they’ve taken from us, we’re going to take back and more.
We’re going to take everything there is.
You’re welcome to her.
Those two have their eyes on you.
Not my type.
Ladies, have you met Ser Bronn of the Blackwater, hero of the Battle of Blackwater Bay.
There you go.
I’m sure he would be.
Have you done much fighting yourself, Lord Frey?
No, but back in your day.
Yes, you’re a great conqueror.

They don’t fear the Freys, though. They fear the Lannisters. We gave you the Riverlands to hold the Riverlands. If we have to ride north and take them back for you every time you lose them, why do we need you?
Come on.
Almost.
Your mother wouldn’t do that.
Are you angry with her?
Then why didn’t you let her come? She has every right to be here.
They’re not putting your mother in a cell ever again. Not while I’m here. Why haven’t you gone to see her? Everything she endured, she did it for you.
Why not?
We all fail sometimes.
Go and see your mother and ask her to forgive you.
Go and see your mother, Tommen.
You’re a bold man.
You must long for the next life.
You imprisoned and humiliated my sister.
What about my sins?
I broke a sacred oath and stabbed my king in the back. I killed my own cousin. When the gods judged my brother guilty, I helped him escape their justice. What atonement do I deserve?
Oh, the gods won’t mind. They’ve spilled more blood than the rest of us combined.
They should be closer if you mean for them to save you.
I’ve fought against worse odds.
What did you do to him exactly? I haven't been able to get a clear answer.
Does he understand what we’re saying? I mean, to the extent that he ever understood complete sentences in the first place.
So tell him to march into the sept and crush the High Sparrow’s head like a melon.
Has the Faith leveled official charges yet?
That is one trial by combat I look forward to watching.
I’m Lord Commander of the Kingsguard. The Lord Commander of the Kingsguard does have a position on the Small Council.
The same women who murdered Myrcella have overthrown House Martell and taken control of Dorne. We've got a lot to discuss. All of us together.
Cersei is the mother of the king. She has the king’s ear and his trust. And the king has been speaking regularly with the High Sparrow about Queen Margaery and Ser Loras.
You’ve got the second largest army in Westeros. You'll bring them into the city, stop queen Margaery’s humiliation before it starts, and take her back into Crown custody.
You’ll take no action at all. When the Tyrell armies come, you will stand down. Are you expressly forbidden from standing down?

The whole thing will be over before anyone can call on you to do anything. When the High Sparrow is in custody or dead, preferably, and Margaery's back at Tommen’s side, do you think the king will be angry at the outcome?
My lord.
Sorry to interrupt. We’re here for Queen Margaery and Ser Loras Tyrell. Give them to us and we’ll be on our way.
I speak for King Tommen of House Baratheon, First of His Name.
You already insulted one great house. It won’t happen twice. Every last sparrow will die before Margaery walks down that street.
I’ve been a member of the Kingsguard since before you were born. You don’t have to do this. You don’t have to do anything.
Not when you’re sitting in that chair.
Will I be walking naked in the streets? Or will I spend a few months in the sept dungeons first to teach me about the gods’ mercy?
I’m being sent to deal with the Blackfish. Apparently Walder Frey can’t manage it on his own because he’s 400 years old. Sent me with an army to the Riverlands and a siege that could last months.
I’m not going to the Riverlands.

I’m going to give Bronn the largest bag of gold anyone’s ever seen and have him gather the best killers he knows. I’ll take them to the sept and I’ll remove the High Sparrow’s head and every other sparrow head I can find.
He has our son! He stole our son! He’s torn our family apart. How should we treat people who tear us apart?
You’ll stand trial soon. I need to he here for you.
Someone certainly does.
You’re an anointed knight. There’s quite a difference.
You have better instincts than any officer in the Lannister army.
I expect to command all the Lannister forces before long. You can be the right hand I lost.
And you’ll get all three. A Lannister always- -
Lothar, is it?
‘Cause you didn’t set up a proper perimeter. You just allowed 8,000 men to approach unchallenged.
Have Lord Edmure bathed and fed.
Only a fool makes threats he’s not prepared to carry out. Now let’s say I threatened to hit you unless you shut your mouth, but you kept talking. What do you think I’d do?
I’m here by the king’s command to take back this castle. Have him bathed and fed. Unless you’d like to take his place.
The siege is now under my command. The next time the Blackfish looks out from those ramparts, he’ll see an army at his gates, not whatever this is.
As I said, the siege is under my command. If that’s not to your liking, go home.
Get word to the Blackfish. I want a parley.
He’s an old man.
Blackfish.
I don’t have them.
You know why I’m here. This castle belongs to House Frey. You’re trespassing. In the name of King Tommen, I order you to surrender or- -
It won’t stop with Edmure. You’ll force me to storm the castle. Hundreds will die.
We’ll breach them and kill every last one of you. But if you surrender, I’ll spare the lives of your men. On my honor.
The war is over, ser. Why sacrifice living men to a lost cause?
You clearly have no intention of saving your men’s lives. Why did you come to treat with me?
Well, now you have.
I never thought you’d find her. I just assumed Sansa was dead.
In my experience, girls like her don’t live very long.
Well, I’m proud of you. I am. You fulfilled your oath to Catelyn Stark against all odds.
Of course my sister wants Sansa dead. The girl is still a suspect in Joffrey’s murder, so there is that complication. What the hell are you doing here?
You’re welcome to have him.
With what army does she plan on taking Winterfell?
They’re a bit occupied at the moment. I was sent here to reclaim Riverrun currently defended by the Tully rebels, so you can see the conundrum.
Riverrun was granted to the Freys by royal decree.
Exactly.
We shouldn’t argue about politics.
I’m a Lannister. Don’t ask me to betray my own house.
What do you propose?
Why would he abandon his ancestral home?
Have you ever met the Blackfish?
He’s even more stubborn than you are.
All right. Try to talk some sense into the old goat. He won’t listen, but his men might. Not everybody wants to die for someone else’s home.
You have my word. You have until nightfall.
It’s yours. It will always be yours.
Yes, Lady Brienne?
Of course it does.
Let’s hope it doesn’t come to that.
Lord Edmure.
I apologize for the way the Freys treated you. A man of your birth deserved better. You have my word you’ll be properly fed and clothes from now on.
The Blackfish is an old man. A good death is all he can hope for. But you, you have a child now, I’ve heard. A son you sired on your wedding night. You’re a potent man.

You should be with them both. I can arrange that, you realize? Comfortable rooms for you at Casterly Rock. A tutor for your boy, knights to train him to fight and to ride. And when he comes of age, he’ll have a keep of his own.
I’ll remind you that our houses are at war. I’m sorry if this conflict has inconvenienced you, but rebelling against the Crown does have consequences.
Did I give you the impression that this was a negotiation? It’s not.
I’ll leave the judgments to the gods.
I was your sister’s prisoner once. She hit me on the head with a rock if I remember correctly.
Perhaps, but she didn’t. Catelyn Stark hated me just like you hate me. But I didn’t hate her. I admired her. Far more than her husband or her son.
No, I don’t, but I’m telling you anyway because you’re my prisoner. You don’t have a choice. The love she had for her children, I was a little awed by it. Reminded me of my sister.
I’m not here to trade insults. Your sister was a strong- -
I’ll talk about whomever I want.
She loved her children. I suppose all mothers do, but Catelyn and Cersei, there’s a fierceness you don’t often see.
They’d do anything to protect their babies.
Start a war. Burn cities to ash. Free their worst enemies. The things we do for love.

That’s exactly why I came here. I love Cersei. You can laugh at that if you want. You can sneer. It doesn’t matter. She needs me. And to get back to her, I have to take Riverrun. I’ll send for your baby boy.

And I’ll launch him into Riverrun with a catapult. Because you don’t matter to me, Lord Edmure. Your son doesn’t matter to me. The people in the castle don’t matter to me. Only Cersei. And if I have to slaughter every Tully who ever lived to get back to her, that’s what I’ll do.
Good. Bring him to me.

7.text: What is this?
He knew it. Made me memorize every damn city, town, lake, forest, and mountain.
No, not angry.
Should I be?
Dragonstone.
They have deep-water ports for the ships. Stannis left the castle unoccupied, and that's where she was born.
Winter is here. We can't win a war if we can't feed our men and our horses. The Tyrells have the grain, the Tyrells have the livestock.
If they think Daenerys will win. No one wants to fight on the losing side. Right now, we look like the losing side.
Three kingdoms, at best. I'm not sure you understand how much danger we're in.
A dynasty for whom? Our children are dead. We're the last of us.
We never talked about Tommen.
Our baby boy killed himself.
Cersei--
Even Lannisters can't survive without allies. Where are our allies now? You saw what happened to Walder Frey and his family.

We couldn't. He was a useless, old coward, but the Freys supported us. Now they're all dead. Whoever killed them is no friend of ours. We need allies. Stronger, better allies. We can't win this war alone.
The Greyjoys? You invited the Greyjoys to King's Landing?
Well, it looks like all of them.
How are they better allies? How are they different from the Freys? They both broke their promises and murdered their former friends as soon as it suited them.
They're not good at anything. I know the Ironborn. They're bitter, angry little people. All they know how to do is steal things they can't build or grow themselves.
Oh, what did he come here for, then?
You're not a rightful monarch, though, are you?

The Greyjoys rebelled agains the throne for the right to be monarchs, but as I recall, you were soundly defeated. Come to mention it, weren't you the one who started that rebellion by sailing to Casterly Rock and burning the Lannister fleet? You certainly caught us there. Very smart move on your part. Of course, we all made it to the Iron Islands anyway. I was there.
