The people I was cutting down were your own kin.
And I enjoyed killing Greyjoys.
Lord Tarley.
Rickon, isn't it?
That's it.
Thank you for coming. The other lords of the Reach look to you for guidance now more than ever. They might not have come if you hadn't.
Do you ride for Hornhill today?
And what side will you be fighting for? You were the only man to defeat Robert Baratheon in battle. Not even Rhaegar Targaryen could --
I want you to be my ranking general in the wars to come. I want you to swear allegiance to Cersei and I want you to help her destroy her enemies. All of her enemies.
You swore an oath to the Crown as well, Lord Tarley.

She was a great woman, once. Now she's broken. She wants revenge so badly she brought the Dothraki to our shores. The Dothraki in Westeros for the first time in history. I know you don't like my sister, but you have to make a choice. Do you fight with us or with the foreign savages and eunuchs?
When the war is won the queen will need a new warden of the south. I can think of no better man than Randyll Tarley.
This same mob spat at my sister not long ago, and if you turn on us, they'll cheer to see your head mounted on a spike.
Advice?
No.
Don't.
What are you doing? No one can see us like this ?
It is.
I suppose as well as can be expected.
The truth is Casterly Rock isn't worth much anymore. Well, it is to me. My fond childhood memories won't keep Cersei on the throne.

For now. They won't be able to hold it. Euron Greyjoy's navy burned their ships, we emptied the larders before we left. Eventually they'll be forced to abandon their position and march all the way across Westeros.
As Robb Stark did to me at Whispering Wood. There are always lessons in failures.
My father always said I was a slow learner.
Widow's Wail.

To you, sure. To others as well. But after we've won and there's no one left to oppose us, the people living peaceful in the world she built, do you really think they'll wring their hands over the way she built it?
Possibly. Not much to be gained from discussing it with you though, is there?
Yes, it has.
I think we're done here.
Cersei had several ideas. Whipping you through the streets and beheading you in front of the Red Keep. Flaying you alive and hanging you from the walls of King's Landing. I talked her out of those.
No. I made sure of that.
Halt that wagon!
I'll save my confessions for the High Septon.
No, there isn't, is there?
That's a lot of money I just gave you.
You don't want Highgarden.
We're at war. Daenerys Targaryen could come take it back the day after you move in. Besides, think of the upkeep. The more you own, the more it weighs you down.
They're not mine. The gold belongs to the Iron Bank. We pay our debts.

Bronn of the Blackwater, formerly of whatever nameless shit heap you're from with a saddlebag full of gold complaining about not getting paid. When we win this war all the castles in the Seven Kingdoms will be yours to choose from with no one left to take them away from you.
Stranger things have happened.
The current harvest?
Ser Bronn, will you accompany the Tarleys and help them accelerate this process?
No, but motivating reluctant farmers to hand over their harvest, I've heard you guys have a real talent for that.
Good.
We are stretched a bit thin.
Let's give them fair warning first. These men fought well at Highgarden.
Rickon.
I hear you fought bravely at Highgarden. Your first battle?
And?
They didn't deserve to die. But Lady Olenna chose to betray the queen and support the Targaryen girl. So here we are.
What?
Spears and shields! Spears and shields!
Spears and shields!
I'm not abandoning my army.
We can hold them off.
Hold the line!
Archers! Archers with me!
Knock!
Loose!
Qyburn's scorpion is over there.
I can't shoot with one hand.
Come on!
Take cover!
Come on, boy. Come on!
You could have killed me.
Ending the war by killing her.
That was only one of them. She has two more. If she decides to use them, to really use them --
Don't you mean we're fucked?
I have to tell Cersei.
We haven't done a full counting.

I just saw the Dothraki fight. They'll beat any mercenary army. They'll beat any army I've ever seen. Killing our men wasn't war for them, it was sport. Her dragon burned a thousand wagons. Qyburn's scorpion fired bolts bigger than you. They couldn't stop it. And she has three of them. This isn't a war we can win.
He didn't.
I'm not talking about father. Tyrion didn't kill Joffrey. He had nothing to do with it.
It was Olenna. She confessed before she died.
After.

If you were Olenna would you rather have seen your granddaughter married to Joffrey or Tommen? Which one would Margerey been better able to control? Which one would have made Olenna the true ruler of the Seven Kingdoms? She was telling the truth.
She's dead like her son, her grandchildren, her whole house. And if we don't find a way out of this war we'll follow them.
We don't have time for this. We should be preparing the city for a siege. The Dothraki are coming.
I seem to recall them giving you a bit of trouble as well.
Why down here?
Today might be the day I kill you by accident.
Don't talk about our father.
I once told Bronn that if I ever saw you again I'd cut you in half.
What do you want?
You want Cersei to bend the knee you can ask her yourself.
Why was QYBURN here?
I met with Tyrion.
Daenerys wants to meet.
To discuss an armistice.
Because an army of dead men is marching on the Seven Kingdoms. Tyrion claims he'll have proof.
Tyrion?
You let it happen. Why?
Who will you say is the father?
People won't like that.
The lion doesn't concern himself with the opinions of the sheep.
The thrill will fade.
Gold?
Family.
Maybe it really is all cocks in the end.
Yes, he's always been a champion of the downtrodden.
Perhaps you ought to sit down.
How many?
It's been good to see you. I imagine the next time will be across a battlefield.
Yes, and I'm not looking forward to seeing more of them. But I'm loyal to the queen and you're loyal to Sansa and her dolt brother.
Fuck loyalty?
And tell her what?
At her until she kicked me out. She thinks I was an idiot to trust you. A lot of people seem to think that, actually.
I suppose we should say goodbye, one idiot to another.
Our men in King's Landing will march north in three days' time.

We don't have a fortnight. If the North falls, we fall. Three days. The remaining forces in the Westerlands will take the river road east. We'll meet at Lord Harroway's Town and march together to Winterfell.
Your Grace.
Preparing the expedition north.
You pledged our forces to fight our common enemy.
You saw it with your own eyes. You saw a dead man trying to kill us.
This isn't about noble houses, this is about the living and the dead!
I made a promise.
Our child will never be born if the dead come south.
And then what?

When the fighting in the North is over, someone wins. You understand that, don't you? If the dead win, they march south and kill us all. If the living win, and we've betrayed them, they march south and kill us all!
I faced them in the field. We can't beat them. We can't beat their dragons.
Two.
For all we know, it's guarding her fleet!
We can't beat the Dothraki. We don't have the numbers. We don't have the support of the other houses!
The Golden Company is not here. They're in Essos. How is a mercenary company in Essos going to help us?
You plotted with Euron Greyjoy without telling me, the commander.
I didn't conspire with him.
I pledged to ride north. I intend to honor that pledge.
Treason?
Doesn't matter what I'd call it.
Are you going to order him to kill me? I'm the only one you have left. Our children are gone, our father
Give the order, then.
I don't believe you.

8.text: She did.
She lied to me as well. She never had any intention of sending her army north.
She has Euron Greyjoy's fleet and 20,000 fresh troops. The Golden Company from Essos, bought and paid for. Even if we defeat the dead, she'll have more than enough to destroy the survivors.
I promised to fight for the living. I intend to keep that promise.
Do you want me to apologize? I won't. We were at war. Everything I did, I did for my house and my family. I'd do it all again.
Because this goes beyond loyalty.
This is about survival.
Thank you, Your Grace.
I'm sorry for what I did to you.
I'm not that person anymore.
You're not?
You're not angry at me.
Why didn't you tell them?
What about afterwards?
Yes, here we are.
How do they feel about their new queen?
And she is? Different?
You're sure about her?
She didn't seem sure about you.
Hmm.
No, that part is real.
She's always been good at using the truth to tell lies. I wouldn't be too hard on yourself. She's fooled me more than anybody.
What?
Your cock.
Lady Brienne.
He's come a long way.
I'm sure you'll teach him. I've been told you're commanding the left flank.
It is.
Yes, I think you're right.
What?
I truly don't.
You want me to insult you?
Good.
I came to Winterfell because-I'm not the fighter I used to be. But I'd be honored to serve under your command, if you'll have me.
So, what can we do?
If that's true, he'll never expose himself.
That would be something to see.
Mm.
It wasn't so simple. I was sleeping with my sister and you had one friend in the world who was sleeping with his sister.
Do you miss it?
Well, my golden-lion days are done, but whore-mongering is still an option for you.
Oh! My lady.
You really think any of us are going to sleep tonight? Join us.
I'm sure someone does.
Fabled loser of the Battle of Whispering Wood.
You don't need a king. Any knight can make another knight.
I'll prove it.
Kneel, Lady Brienne.
Do you want to be a knight or not? Kneel.
In the name of the Warrior, I charge you to be brave.
In the name of the Father, I charge you to be just.
In the name of the Mother, I charge you to defend the innocent.
Arise, Brienne of Tarth a knight of the Seven Kingdoms.
We'd better get some rest.
We fought dead things and lived to talk about it. If this isn't the time to drink, when is?
(to BRIENNE) Um You are an only child.
You didn't.
I surmised it.
You have danced with Renly Baratheon.
Drink.
Drink.
That's a statement about the present.
You didn't drink.
In the game.
In the game. This is Dornish.
Suit yourself.
You keep it warm enough in here.
That's very diligent. Very responsible.
You know the first thing I learned in the North? I hate the fucking North.
I don't want things growing on me.
How about Tormund Giantsbane? Has he grown on you? He was very sad when you left.
(nods) I do, don't I? It's bloody hot in here.
I'm taking your shirt off.
I've never slept with a knight before.
Then you have to drink. Those are the rules.
She's sworn to protect the Stark girls, so... Say something snide.
To climbing mountains.
What? That's not your concern.
You're a dog.
What are you doing with that?
Power resides where men believe--
And you trust Cersei--
Highgarden? Are you mad?
He's not going to kill us. He wouldn't be talking to us if--
Highgarden will never belong to a cutthroat.
What happened?
Have you ever run away from a fight?

You think I'm a good man? I pushed a boy out a tower window, crippled him for life for Cersei. I strangled my cousin with my own hands just to get back to Cersei. I would have murdered every man, woman and child in Riverrun for Cersei.
She's hateful. And so am I.

1.text: Do you have to?
Ned. Ten is too young to see such things.
All these years and I still feel like an outsider when I come here.
I wonder if the old gods agree.
I am so sorry, my love.
There was a raven from Kings Landing. Jon Arryn is dead. A fever took him. I know he was like a father to you.
They both have their health. Gods be good. [pause] The raven brought more news. The king rides for Winterfell. With the queen and all the rest of them.
You can always say no, Ned.
We need plenty of candles for Lord Tyrion’s chamber. I’m told he reads all night.
How much could he possibly drink? A man of his … stature.
In any case, candles.
Gods, but they grow fast. [Seeing BRAN on the wall] Brandon!
How many times have I told you
I want you to promise me
D’you know what?
You always look at your feet before you lie. Run and find your father. Tell him the king is close.
Where’s Arya? Sansa, where’s your sister?
Your Grace.
My queen.
Then he is the stupidest prince that ever lived.
Hush now. Your father hasn’t even said yes.
He’d have to leave home. He’d have to leave me. And so would you.
Sansa…
I’m sure it’s very grim, after Kings Landing. I remember how scared I was when Ned brought me up here for the first time.
I hear the same.
I won’t let him take you.
I’ll say, ‘Listen, fat man, you are not taking my husband anywhere. He belongs to me now.’
He only stops eating when it’s time for a drink.
This was sent from the Eyrie. What’s she doing at the Eyrie? She hasn’t been back there since her wedding.
She’s fled the capital. She says Jon Arryn was murdered. By the Lannisters. She says the king is in danger.
Lysa’s head would be on a spike right now if the wrong people had found that letter. Do you think she would risk her life, her son’s life, if she wasn’t certain her husband was murdered?
They murdered the last Hand. Now you want Ned to take the job.
He spent half his life fighting Robert’s wars. He owes him nothing. (To NED) Your father and brother rode south once on a king’s demand.
Robb. Robb! You've ruined your sword.
Shh! Shh! Shh!
My boy. They have your sisters. We have to get the girls back. And then we will kill them all.
l want to see him. Now! Leave us.
Leave us. (the guards leave)
l will kill you tonight, Ser. Pack your head in a box and send it to your sister.
That is what you want the world to believe, isn't it? That you don't fear death.
Because you are going to the deepest of the seven hells, if the gods are just.
Because of men like you.
My son Bran. How did he come to fall from that tower?
Why?
Why?
I would have dressed, your Grace.
I never knew.
I am grateful..
You've said it.
I want you to leave.
17 years ago you rode off with Robert Baratheon. You came back a year later with another woman's son. And now you're leaving again.
That's what men always say when honor calls. That's what you tell your families, tell yourselves. You do have a choice. And you've made it. I can't do it, Ned. I really can't.
Talk to Poole about it.
I don't care about appointments!
I have to take care of him.
What if he's wrong? Bran needs me.
Close the windows! I can't stand it! Please make them stop! (Wolf’s howling repeatedly)
No!
What I am about to tell you must remain between us. I don't think Bran fell from that tower. I think he was thrown.
Someone tried to kill him twice. Why? Why murder an innocent child? Unless he saw something he wasn't meant to see.
I don't know. But I would stake my life the Lannisters are involved. We already have reason to suspect their loyalty to the crown.
I don't trust a raven to carry these words.
No. There must always be a Stark in Winterfell. I will go myself.
I must.
Too large a party attracts unwanted attention. I don't want the Lannisters to know I'm coming.
I have prayed to the Seven for more than a month. Bran's life is in their hands now.
It's nine years since I've set foot in the capital. And no one knew who I was the last time I came either.
I would. We've done nothing wrong.
Instructed? I don't know who's providing your instructions, but...
You little worm! You take me for some back-alley Sally you can drag into a…
How dare you bring me here! Have you lost your mind?
How did you know I was coming to King's Landing?
Lord Varys.
How did you know I was coming?
Do you know whose dagger this is?
Yours?
To whom?
Ned! [poking her head out of a window]
We have proof. We have the blade.
Petyr has promised to help us find the truth. He's like a little brother to me. He would never betray my trust.
I won't forget this. You're a true friend.
I wish I could see the girls.
Just for a moment.
I know they did it, Ned. The Lannisters. In my bones, I know it.
My temper? Gods be good, you nearly killed poor Littlefinger yesterday.
Does he?
And to you.
I was still Catelyn Tully the last time I stayed here. You, Ser... Is that the black bat of Harrenhal I see embroidered on your coat?
And is Lady Whent a true and honest friend to my father... Lord Hoster Tully of Riverrun?
The red stallion was always a welcome sight at Riverrun. My father counts Jonas Bracken amongst his oldest and most loyal bannermen.
Knight of House Frey

This man... Came into my house as a guest and there conspired to murder my son, a boy of 10. In the name of King Robert and the good Lords you serve, I call upon you to seize him and help me return him to Winterfell to await the king's justice.
Remove his hood.
I did... often and loudly.
And why would I do that?
Shadowcats and hill tribes are the least of your concerns.
Five years ago.
I am not a murderer, Lannister.
The dagger found
Rodrik?
To whom do I speak?
There was no time to send word.
That's why there was no time. He is my prisoner.
My sister will decide what he looks like.
Lysa, you wrote me about the Lannisters, warning me t-
This man is my prisoner. I will not have him harmed.
Lord Tyrion, you are accused of hiring a man to slay my son Bran in his bed, and of conspiring to murder my sister’s husband; Lord Jon Arryn, the Hand of the King.
You've had this since dawn?
A courtesy?! My husband has been taken prisoner.
Ned rots in a dungeon and you speak of patience? He is your brother by law!Does family mean nothing to you?
You will not support us then? Do I understand you correctly?
That is what I ask.
If you fear for the safety of your son...
And that is why we have to stop them.
Robb's brought the North with him.
You look well.
I had not thought to be here.
I remember the day you came into this world red-faced and squalling.
No one? Who were those men I saw here?
All of them are seasoned in battle.
Oh, would that I could.
From the Queen, you mean.
How many men do you have?
you would never be allowed to leave. No.
Do you know what happened to the Targaryen children, when the Mad King fell?
On the orders of Tywin Lannister. And the years have not made him kinder.
I suppose it does.
"The late Lord Frey" my father calls him.
Robb.
Keep shooting them down. We can't risk Lord Walder sending word of your movements to the Lannisters.
The Freys have held the crossing for 600 years, and for 600 years they have never failed to exact their toll.
l agree. l'll go.
l have known Lord Walder since l was a girl. He would never harm me.
lt is a great pleasure to see you again after so many years, my lord.
ls there somewhere we can talk?
l'm sure she will give you many sons.
He is quite ill, my lord.
My lord, l â€“
l'm sure there were reasons â€“
To ask you to open your gates, my lord, so my son and his bannermen may cross the Trident and be on their way.
lf you could climb your own battlements, you would see that he has 20,000 men outside your walls.
You swore an oath to my father.
Why don't you?
Lord Walder has granted your crossing. His men are yours, as well.
Less the 400 he will keep here to hold the crossing against any who would pursue you.
You will be taking on his son Olyvar as your personal squire. He expects a knighthood in good time.
And Arya will marry his son Waldron when they both come of age.
And when the fighting is done you will marry one of his daughters. Whichever you prefer. He has a number he thinks will be suitable.
l did.
One was â€“ Do you consent?
Not if you want to cross.
No!
lt is not your sword l want. Give me my daughters back. Give me my husband.
Take him away and put him in irons.

2.text: You don't want Balon Greyjoy for an ally.
They say a million rats live in the sewers of King's Landing. Shall we rally them to fight for us?
I don't trust Lord Greyjoy because he is not trustworthy. Your father had to go to war to end his rebellion.
I mothered more than just rebels, a fact you seem to have forgotten.
You want to leave Sansa in the Queen's hands? And Arya, I haven't heard a word about Arya. What are we fighting for if not for them?
It's time for me to go home. I haven't seen Bran or Rickon in months.
I beg your pardon?
Why in the name of all the Gods -
I haven't seen Renly Baratheon since he was a boy. You have a hundred other lords -
I will ride at first light.
You've done so well. Your father would be proud.
King Renly. There's a king in every corner now.
Walder Frey is a dangerous man to cross.
And you mean to do it anyway?
I know that seems important to you.

Your father didn't love me when we married. He hardly knew me or I him. Love didn't just happen to us. We built it slowly over the years, stone by stone, for you, for your brothers and sisters, for all of us. It's not as exciting as secret passion in the woods, but it is stronger. It lasts longer.
Why not? Because she's not beautiful? Because she's not exotic and exciting?
And you agreed to it. You gave him your word. Treat your oaths recklessly, and your people will do the same. If your father lived his life for one thing
You don’t want Balon Greyjoy for an ally.
He is not trustworthy!
Lord of Winterfell and King in the North.
You are most kind.
It will be enough to know that justice was done, my lord. Your Grace.
I do not sit on my son's war councils. And if I did, I would not share his strategies with you.
My son is fighting a war, not playing at one.
And all of them young and bold like your Knight of Flowers? It's a game to you, isn't it? I pity them.
Because it won't last. Because they are the knights of summer and winter is coming.
You fought bravely today, Lady Brienne.
How dare you?
You betrayed Ned.
I trusted you. My husband trusted you. And you repaid our faith with treachery.
Get out!
Have you lost your mind? Get out!
You have Arya, too?
What do you want?
Of course they will. Jaime Lannister for two girls? Robb will never agree to those terms.
You think I keep secrets from my son?
I don't want your gifts. A token of Tyrion Lannister's goodwill. He wants you to understand that this exchange of prisoners is offered in good faith.
Good faith?
What's this?
Get out.
I had not thought to be here, Lord Stannis.
Listen to yourselves. If you were sons of mine, I would knock your heads together and lock you in a bedchamber until you remembered that you were brothers.
We share a common enemy.
By the mother. My son has no interest in the Iron Throne.
And the wording of this oath?
And in return for my son's loyalty?
Our two houses have always been close, which is why I am begging you to reconsider this battle. Negotiate a peace with your brother.
No, wait, it wasn't her!
We've got to leave. They'll hang you for this.
You can't avenge him if you're dead.
To me it just looked like... A shadow in the shape of a man.
We should reach my son's camp tomorrow.
Only long enough to tell Robb what I have seen. After that, I will leave for Winterfell. My two youngest need me. I've been away from them for far too long.
I'm sorry.
My own mother died on the birthing bed when I was very young.
What comes after is even harder.
You mean to kill Stannis.
But Stannis has a great army around him. His own guards are sworn to keep him safe.
I'm as good as any of them. I should never have fled.
Renly's death was no fault of yours. You served him bravely.
He's gone, Brienne. You serve nothing and no one by following him into the earth. Renly's enemies are Robb's enemies as well.
When the time comes, I will not hold you back.
I vow that you shall always have a place in my home and at my table and that I shall ask no service of you that might bring you dishonor. I swear it by the Old Gods and the new.
Robb.
Lady Talisa.
Lady Talisa
Maegyr? Forgive me, I do not know this name.
Yes, you look positively forlorn.
I wish that you were free to follow your heart.
You have inherited your father's responsibilities. I'm afraid they come at a cost. You are promised to another.
A debt that must be paid.
I told you, never trust a Greyjoy!
Let me go and talk to Theon.
What is it?
Lord Karstark, this man is our prisoner.
And crippled mine. He will answer for his crimes, I promise you, but not here.
You will strike me down? Have you forgotten me, ser? I am the widow of your liege, Lord Eddard Stark. I am the mother of your king!
How dare you!
I understand your grief, my lord, better than most, I understand it. But in the name of my son, the King in the North, stand down.
Wise men do not make demands of kings.
Take him to the stockades. Bind him with every chain you can find!
And gag him!
So they say.
Come.
I need to be alone with him.
Your orders, which I just gave you, are to leave me alone with him.
Do you hear them out there? They want your head.
You strangled his son with your chains.
You are no knight. You have forsaken every vow you ever took.
She is a truer knight than you will ever be, Kingslayer.
You are a man without honor.
Brienne.
(to BRIENNE) Your sword.
For the girls.
Robb
Bran and Rickon are captives in Winterfell. Sansa and Arya are captives in King's Landing. I have five children, and only one of them is free.
I grieve for your sons, my lord.
Killing Jaime Lannister would not buy life for your children, but returning him to King's Landing may buy life for mine.
Robb. How many men did we send in pursuit of the Kingslayer?
Robb.

3.text: Ser Jeremy. My father's bannerman.
I hadn't seen him in years. I don't even know how many.
Will I be wearing manacles when I lay my father to rest?
Something else?
Have you received any demands?
Have you heard anything from Theon at all?
You're afraid of her. And she knows it.
No.
You can't help because a mother makes one for her children to protect them. Only a mother can make them.
Twice.
After a fashion. I prayed for my son Bran to survive his fall.

Many years before that, one of the boys came down with the pox. Maester Luwin said if he made it through the night, he'd live. But it would be a very long night. So I sat with him all through the darkness. Listened to his ragged little breaths, his coughing, his whimpering.

Jon Snow. When my husband brought that baby home from the war, I couldn't bear to look at him. I didn't want to see those brown stranger's eyes staring up at me. So I prayed to the gods, take him away. Make him die. He got the pox. And I knew I was the worst woman who ever lived. A murderer. I'd condemned this poor, innocent child to a horrible death all because I was jealous of his mother. A woman he didn't even know. So I prayed to all seven gods, let the boy live. Let him live and I'll love him. I'll be a mother to him. I'll beg my husband to give him a true name, to call him Stark and be done with it, to make him one of us.
And he lived. And I couldn't keep my promise. And everything that's happened since then all this horror that's come to my family it's all because I couldn't love a motherless child.
A person could almost be forgiven for forgetting we're at war.
I've missed you, Uncle. Father missed you, too, from the day you left. Maybe he never said it in so many words--
I'm glad you were with him. I wish to the gods I had been. Did you make peace in the end?

Every time he would leave for the capital or fight in a campaign, I'd see him off. 'Wait for me, little Cat,' he'd say. 'Wait for me and I'll come back to you.' And I would sit at this window every day when the sun came up, waiting. I wonder how many times did Bran or Rickon stare across the moors of Winterfell waiting for me to return. I will never see them again.
(Sighs.)
Brandon.
How many times have I told you? No climbing.
I want you to promise me. No more climbing.
Promise me. Promise me! Promise me!
Promise me! Promise me, Bran! Promise me!
The Karstarks are Northmen. They won't forgive the killing of their lord.
Spare his life. Keep him as a hostage.
You're willing to risk our freedom and our lives for a chance at a prettier wife?
Lord Walder is prickly by nature.
Yes, and that is why--
Lord Frey will take this delay as a slight.
He's getting a wedding. It was a king he wanted.
Are you sure about this?
It's dangerous.
Why are you telling me?
We have enough men?
If Walder Frey cooperates.
If reinforcements arrive from King's Landing, before we take the castle, we'll be caught between Tywin's army and the sea.
Show them how it feels to lose what they love.
[Looking at EDMURE and talking to BLACKFISH] He complained about this marriage the entire ride from Riverrun and now look at him.
[Laughs] Uncle.
Don’t you drink, Lord Bolton?
I hope she makes you very happy.
Poor girl.
Oh, Ned forbade it. He said it wouldn’t be right if he broke a man’s jaw on our wedding night.
Robb!

Lord Walder! Lord Walder, enough! Let it end! Please! He is my son! [ROBB is still cradling TALISA on the floor] My first son! Let him go and I swear that we will forget this! I swear it by the Old Gods and New! We will take no vengeance.
Take me for a hostage but let Robb go! Robb, get up! Get up and walk out! Please! Please!
On my honor as a Tully, on my honor as a Stark, let him go or I will cut your wife’s throat!

1.text: And you never worry about anything. When we were seven, you jumped off the cliffs as Casterly Rock. One hundred foot drop into the water. And you were never afraid.
What if Jon Arryn told someone?
My husband.
You should be the Hand of the king.
We’ve been riding for a month, my love. Surely the dead can wait.
Where is our brother? Go find the little beast.
Yes. Lovely country.
Hello, little dove. But you are a beauty. How old are you?
You’re tall. Still growing?
And have you bled yet?
And your dress. Did you make it?
Such talent. You must make something for me.
I hear we might share a grandchild someday.
Your daughter will do well in the capital. Such a beauty shouldn’t stay hidden up here forever.
Stop. STOP.
He saw us.
He saw us!
Stop talking. Get back into bed.
What do you mean?
It's no mercy, letting a child linger in such pain.
I still can't believe you're going. It's ridiculous even for you.
The children don't need to hear your filth. Come.
Please.

This is your home. I'm your guest. Handsome one, isn't he? I lost my first boy, a little black-haired beauty. He was a fighter too... Tried to beat the fever that took him. Forgive me. It's the last thing you need to hear right now.

It was years ago. Robert was crazed, beat his hands bloody on the wall, all the things men do to show you how much they care... The boy looked just like him. Such a little thing... A bird without feathers. They came to take his body away and Robert held me. I screamed and I battled, but he held me. That little bundle. They took him away and I never saw him again. Never have visited the crypt, never. I pray to the Mother every morning and night that she return your child to you.
Perhaps this time she'll listen.
How dare you speak to your King in that manner?
Your girl and that butcher's boy attacked my son. That animal of hers nearly tore his arm off.
Joffrey told us what happened. You and that boy beat him with clubs while you set your wolf on him.
She's not. Sansa, come here, darling.
She's as wild as that animal of hers. I want her punished.
Joffrey will bear these scars for the rest of his life.
And what of the direwolf? What of the beast that savaged your son?
We have another wolf.
Where is the beast?
Ser Ilyn, do me the honor.
Is this some trick?
Please, it's nearly healed.
A King should have scars, you fought off a direwolf. You're a warrior like your father.

That's not true. You killed the beast. You only spared the girl because of the love your father bears her father. When Aerys Targaryen sat on the Iron Throne, your father was a rebel and a traitor. Someday you'll sit on the throne and the truth will be what you make it.

Yes. She's very beautiful and young. If you don't like her, you only need to see her on formal occasions and when the time comes, to make little princes and princesses. And if you'd rather fuck painted whores, you'll fuck painted whores. And if you'd rather lie with noble virgins, so be it. You are my darling boy and the world will be exactly as you want it to be. Do something nice for the Stark girl.
No, but you will. The occasional kindness will spare you all sorts of trouble down the road.
How would you handle them?
A royal army?
And if the northerners rebel?
And these 10,000 northern troops, would they fight for you or their lord?
But you've just invaded their homeland, asked them to kill their brothers.

The North cannot be held... not by an outsider. It's too big and too wild. When the winter comes, the Seven gods together couldn't save you and your royal army. A good King knows when to save his strength... And when to destroy his enemies.
Everyone who isn't us is an enemy.
How could you be so stupid?
He's a child... 10 years old. What were you thinking?
Nothing. He's said nothing. He remembers nothing.
What if it comes back to him? If he tells his father what he saw...
And my husband?
Let me go.
Let me go.
And if you find the proof?
You're missing your tournament.

I thought we might put what happened on the Kingsroad behind us â€“ the ugliness with the wolves. And forcing you to kill the beast was extreme. Though sometimes we go to extremes where our children are concerned. How is Sansa?
The only Stark who does. Favors her mother, not much of the north in her.
I might ask the same of you. What is it you hope to accomplish?
You can't change him. You can't help him. He'll do what he wants, which is all he's ever done. You'll try your best to pick up the pieces.
You're just a soldier, aren't you? You take your orders and you carry on. I suppose it makes sense. Your older brother was trained to lead and you were trained to follow.
As was I.
I'm sorry your marriage to Ned Stark didn't work out. You seemed so good together.
Without a Hand, everything will fall to pieces.
No. He's not serious enough. I'll say this for Ned Stark - he's serious enough. Was it really worth it? Losing him this way?
The Dothraki don't sail. Every child knows that. They don't have discipline. They don't have armor. They don't have siege weapons.
Is my father wrong?
We still outnumber them.
Five.
What do you want?
Our marriage.
Every day.
Well, seventeen years is quite a long time.
Yes, it tis. What was she like?

At first, just saying her name, even in private felt like I was breathing life back into her. I thought if I didn't talk about her, she'd just fade away for you. When I realized that wasn't going to happen, I refused to ask out of spite. I didn't want to give you the satisfaction of thinking I cared enough to ask. And eventually it became clear that my spite didn't mean anything to you, as far as I could tell, you actually enjoyed it.
What harm could Lyanna Stark's ghost do to either of us that we haven't done to each other a hundred times over?
I felt something for you once, you know?
Even after we lost our first boy -- for quite a while, actually. Was it ever possible for us? Was there ever a time, ever a... moment?
It doesn't make me feel anything.
Do you know what your wife has done?
By what right dare you lay hands on my blood?
You were the King’s Hand!
You shall now be held accountable.
Lord Stark was returning drunk from a brothel when his men attacked Jaime.
I took you for a king.
He’s attacked my brother and abducted the other. I should wear the armor and you the gown.
I shall wear this like a badge of honor.
You're in pain.
Perhaps it's time to go home.
Do you, Lord Stark? Is that why you called me here, to pose me riddles?
Jaime would have killed him.
My brother is worth a thousand of your friend.
The Targaryens wed brothers and sisters for 300 years to keep bloodlines pure.
Jaime and I are more than brother and sister. We shared a womb. We came into this world together. We belong together.
Do you love your children?
No more than I love mine.
Thank the Gods.
Hated him? I worshiped him.
And what of my wrath, Lord Stark? You should have taken the realm for yourself.
Oh, but it was.
Robert, my sweet...
May I see that letter, Ser Barristan?
We have a new King now.
You condemn yourself with your own mouth, Lord Stark.
You think he stands alone?
Sansa sweetling, you are innocent of any wrong.
Little dove, you must write to Lady Catelyn and your brother, the eldest.
Word of your father's arrest will reach him soon, no doubt.
You disappoint me, child.
That depends.
On your brother. And on you.
Ser Barristan Selmy.
Rise, Ser Barristan.
Whose death, Ser Barristan? Yours or your King's?
The Council has determined that Ser Jaime Lannister will take your place as Lord Commander of the Kingsguard.
Careful, Ser.
Do you have some business for the King and the Council, Sansa?
My son, this is madness.

2.text: You command the City Watch, do you not, Lord Slynt?
And are you not a Lord at my command?
Then do your job. Shut the gates to the peasants. They belong in the field, not our capital.
What are you doing here?
What are you doing here? This is the small council.
Our father is Hand of the King.

Out! All of you out. (The small council members all get up and leave until it is only Cersei and Tyrion. Cersei stands up and approaches Tyrion). I would like to know how you tricked father into this.
I've done nothing.
I tried to stop it.
Robb Stark is a child.
What do you know about warfare?
Joffrey is King.
You are here to advise him.
How?
One.
Arya, little animal, she disappeared.
Lord Baelish.
I wonder if I might ask you for a favor.
Ned Stark's youngest daughter Arya... we can't seem to locate her.
And yet my friends in the North report no sign of her.
If we choose to negotiate with the Starks, the girl has some value. Whoever finds her, well, you know what they say about Lannisters and debts.
A mockingbird. (Points to a pin on Baelish’s shirt). You created your own Sigil, didn't you?
Appropriate for a self-made man with so many songs to sing.
I heard a song once about a boy of modest means who found his way into the home of a very prominent family. He loved the eldest daughter. Sadly, she had eyes for another.
And which truth is that?

Seize him. (Cersei’s guards seize Baelish). Cut his throat. (A guard holds a knife to Baelish’s neck). Stop. Wait. I've changed my mind. Let him go. (The guards let Baelish go). Step back three paces. Turn around. Close your eyes. (The guards do as Cersei says). (To Baelish) Power is power. Do see if you can take some time away from your coins and your whores to locate the Stark girl for me. I would very much appreciate it.
What is all this?
We can't find Arya Stark.
Perhaps. But if not, we need her. They'll never give Jaime back to us for Sansa alone.
We need to set our armies to the task of finding her. Send out as many men as we can. I'm sure if you asked grandfather -
His life is in danger.
Our enemies will say anything to weaken your claim to the throne.
Of course it is. No one believes this foul gossip -
What are you asking?

Your Grace, in the judgment of your Small Council, it would be neither proper nor wise for you to wed the daughter of a man beheaded for treason, a girl whose brother is in open rebellion against the throne as we speak. For the good of the realm, your councilors beg you to set Sansa Stark aside.
What are you doing here?
I’ve done nothing.
What are you asking?
“From this time until the end of time, we are not part of your realm, but a free and independent Kingdom of the North.” (Rips up the letter). He has more spirit than his father, I'll give him that.
You'll give the Starks our reply, cousin?
Did you see my brother when you were the Starks guest?
If you speak with him, tell him he's not been forgotten.
If that's everything?
Another king? How many is that now, Five? I've lost count.
Perhaps he's forgotten we're fighting a war. We have no men to spare.
One trip to The Wall and you come back believing in grumpkins and snarks. (Walks away, followed by Varys).
I have every confidence the brave men of the Night's Watch will protect us all.
Lord Janos Slynt was Commander of the City Watch. You had no right to exile him.
You're serving as the King's Hand until father gets here. I am Queen Regent.
Ha, the people. You think I care?

He did what needed to be done. (Now loudly). You want to be the Hand of the King? You want to rule? This is what ruling is! Lying on a bed of weeds, ripping them out by the root one by one before they strangle you in your sleep.
I don't care what you think! You've never taken it seriously. You haven't, Jaime hasn't. (Sits down). It's all fallen on me.

You're funny. (Laughs). You've always been funny. But none of your jokes will ever match the first one, will they? You remember... back when you ripped my mother open on your way out of her and she bled to death.
Now they're gone, for the sake of you. There's no bigger joke in the world than that. (Storms out).
Soon, darling, when the war is over.
The princess just spoke to you.
He might. Would you like that?
Even if he does, Sansa will do her duty. Won't you, little dove?
I will not let you ship her off to Dorne as I was shipped off to Robert Baratheon.
Are you mad? The Martells loathe us.
She'll be a hostage.
You won't get away with this. You think the piece of paper Father gave you keeps you safe. Ned Stark had a piece of paper, too.
No.
No!
Get out! Get out!
Killed? By whom?
Really? Who'd have thought?
Whomever did it, I say well done.
Littlefinger says we can outspend him three to one.
Aren't there other things you should be doing, like sealing my daughter in a crate so you can ship her away?
Yes, I know how concerned you are for her safety.
So clever. Aren't you always so clever with your schemes and your plots?
No need to concern yourself over it. The king is taking personal charge of siege preparations.
You may, specifically, or you may ask vaguely. The answer will be the same.
It's the king's royal prerogative to withhold sensitive information from his councilors.

One day I pray you love someone. I pray you love her so much, when you close your eyes, you see her face. I want that for you. I want you to know what it's like to love someone, to truly love someone. Before I take her from you.
Your mother might have prepared you. You flowered, my dear. No more.
In what way?
Wait until you birth a child.
You're a woman now. Do you have any idea what that means?
A prospect that once delighted you, bringing little princes and princesses into the world, the greatest honor for a queen.

Joffrey has always been difficult. Even his birth, I labored a day and a half to bring him into this world. You cannot imagine the pain. I screamed so loudly, I was sure Robert would hear me in the Kingswood.

Robert was hunting. That was his custom. Whenever my time was near, my royal husband would flee to the trees with his huntsmen and his hounds. And when he returned, he would present me with some pelts or a stag's head, and I would present him with a baby. Not that I wanted him there, mind you. I had Grand Maester Pycelle, an army of midwives, and I had my brother. When they told Jaime he wasn't allowed in the birthing room, he smiled and asked which one of them proposed to keep him out. Joffrey will show you no such devotion.
You may never love the king, but you will love his children.

That's so very touching to hear. Permit me to share some womanly wisdom with you on this very special day. The more people you love, the weaker you are. You'll do things for them that you know you shouldn't do. You'll act the fool to make them happy, to keep them safe. Love no one but your children. On that front, a mother has no choice.
You can try, little dove.
Who did you say your mother was again?
Since I decided that I can't stand to look at any of my handmaidens for another instant.
How many times can you read one raven scroll?
More than we have.
We have strong, high walls. We'll rain fire down on them from above.
Why not? He has a good mind for strategy, doesn't he?
I'm sure you'll make a point eventually.
I'm not the one giving the boy whores to abuse.
Did you?
Do you think I haven't tried? He doesn't listen to me.
I always hoped he'd be like Jaime. He looks like him. In a certain light.

The Targaryens Wed brother and sister for hundreds of years, I know. That's what Jaime and I would say to each other in our moments of doubt. It's what I told Ned Stark when he was stupid enough to confront me. Half the Targaryens went mad, didn't they? What's the saying? "Every time a Targaryen is born, the Gods flip a coin."
Odd little boy.
You and Varys both.
He's only a boy.
He's not ready.
Better than you. Some men have a gift for this sort of thing, some don't. His place is not on the battlefield.
Do you think I'm an idiot?
You shipped off my only daughter. And now you want to send my eldest son to the battlefield to die.
Do you know why Varys is so dangerous?
Because he doesn't have a cock.
Perhaps I'm dangerous, too. You, on the other hand, are as big a fool as every other man. That little worm between your legs does half your thinking.
(laughs)
Because I'm happy.
Because I have your little whore.
Such a droll little fellow. Tell me, have you married this one yet? No? Good. Father will be so pleased.
Because a Lannister always pays her debts. You stole my only daughter, you plot to have Joffrey killed.
For what? Your skill in battle? Pretty thing, your whore. Lovely body. The bruises will heal in time.
Varys isn't the only one who hears whispers. Really, a Lannister lion necklace? You need to hide your secret whores more carefully.
Oh? Well, you're the expert. Tell me.

You're usually a better liar, baby brother. This one you like. You like her very much. Could it be love? Don't worry, she'll be treated gently enough. Unless Joffrey is hurt. And then every wound he suffers, she'll suffer, too. And if he dies, there isn't a man alive who could devise a more painful death for your little cunt.
Would you like to see her? I thought you might. Ser Mandon, bring in my brother's whore.
Get out.
Your words are always wise and measured.
You brought me something?
I know what ten drops will bring.
You may not. You must have a lot of work to do. I'm sure many brave men will need your wisdom soon.
Sansa.
I was wondering where our little dove had flown. You look pale, child. Is your red flower still blooming?
Fitting, isn't it? The men will bleed out there and you will bleed in here. Pour Lady Sansa some wine.
So? I didn't offer you water. What's he doing here?
Ser llyn? He's here to defend us. When the axes smash down those doors, you may be glad to have him.
Guards we have paid. Should the city fall, they'll be the first ones out of the doors.
The battle's first traitors. Have Ser llyn see to them. Put their heads on spikes outside the stables as a warning.
The only way to keep the small folk loyal is to make certain they fear you more than they do the enemy. Remember that if you ever hope to become a queen.
He is. Traitors are a danger to us all. More wine.
Sansa, come here, little dove.
You're perfect, aren't you?
What are you praying for?
Oh. On all of us?
Even me?
Even Joffrey?

Oh, shut up, you little fool. Praying to the gods to have mercy on us all. The gods have no mercy. That's why they're gods. My father told me that when he caught me praying. My mother had just died, you see. I didn't really understand the concept of death, the finality of it. I thought that if I prayed very, very hard, the gods would return my mother to me. I was four.
He believes in them, he just doesn't like them very much.
One for her.
Here. Sit. Drink.
Not like that. Drink, girl.
I should have been born a man. I'd rather face a thousand swords than be shut up inside with this flock of frightened hens.

It was expected of me, as it will be of you if you ever become Joffrey's queen. If my wretched brother should somehow prevail, these hens will return to their cocks and crow of how my courage inspired them, lifted their spirits.

You'd like that, wouldn't you? The Red Keep should hold for a time, long enough for me to go to the walls and yield to Lord Stannis in person. If it were anyone else outside those gates, I might have hoped for a private audience, but this is Stannis Baratheon. I'd have a better chance of seducing his horse.
Have I shocked you, little dove? Tears aren't a woman's only weapon. The best one's between your legs. Learn how to use it. Drink.

Do you have any notion of what happens when a city is sacked? No, you wouldn't, would you? If the city falls, these fine women should be in for a bit of a rape. Half of them will have bastards in their bellies come the morning. You'll be glad of your red flower then. When a man's blood is up, anything with tits looks good. A precious thing like you will look very, very good. A slice of cake just waiting to be eaten.
And you will be Joffrey's. Enjoy. I don't think I know this one.
Pretty.
That's the worst curtsy I've ever seen. Here, it's not difficult. I mastered it when I was four. Straighten your back and bend.
Better. You learn fast. How long have you been in Lady Sansa's service?
When did you leave Lorath?
I had a Lorathi handmaiden once.
But she was a nobleman's daughter. You're not. When did you come to Westeros?
From Lorathi commoner to the Red Keep in 10 years, all without learning how to curtsy. I imagine that's a very interesting story. What's your name?
Tell us a story, Shae.
What news?
Where is Joffrey?
Bring him back inside at once.
What?
Bring him back to his chambers now.
With the women and children? Do you want him to be mocked as a coward for the rest of his life?
Now!

When I told you about Ser llyn earlier, I lied. Do you want to hear the truth? You want to know why he's really here? He's here for us. Stannis may take the city, he may take the throne, but he will not take us alive.
Where is my son?
Why do I care what you want? Bring me
Shh! Be calm, my sweet.
No one's going to hurt you. I'll tell you a story. You know the one about the mother lion and her little cub? They lived in the woods.
Yes, my love. In the Kingswood, there lived a mother and her cub. She loved him very much. But there were other things that lived in the woods. Evil things.
Like stags.
And wolves.

"For one day, all the beasts will bow to you. "You will be king. "All the stags will bow. All the wolves will bow. "The bears in the north and the foxes of the south, "all the birds in the sky and the beasts in the sea, "they will all come to you, little lion, "to rest a crown upon your head.
" And the cub said, "Will I be strong and fierce like my father?"
"Yes," said his mother. "You will be strong and fierce just like your father.
" I will keep you safe, my love. I promise you.
Father.
(cries)

3.text: Cersei
Protecting me, I assume. Will you let me in?
If I wanted to kill you, do you think I'd let a wooden door stop me?
I'm not afraid of you, little brother.
I wanted to see your face. They said you'd lost your nose, but it's not as gruesome as all that.
I should hope so. The rebels came for Joffrey's head, they lost their own. Thanks to Father.
No? Curious. Bit of a comedown from chamber of the Hand. But then I don't suppose you need much room.
You're meeting Father today?
Because I have hundreds of spies in my employ. The Master of Whisperers owes me a favor or two. Father told me. What do you want from him?
You're going to make me cry.
Because you've slandered me to Father before.
You told him I had my guards beat that servant girl at Casterly Rock.
I was nine, too.
If I remember correctly, she never stole a necklace again.
And what's this truth you plan on telling him today?
Because you're a liar. I expect you'll tell lies about me, about Joffrey.
You're a clever man, but you're not half as clever as you think you are.
Yes, it suits you perfectly. I imagine you might be rather cold.
You might find a bit of armor quite useful once you become queen. Perhaps before. Joffrey tells me you stopped your carriage at Flea Bottom on your way back from the sept this morning.
Cersei
You're right, of course. But you are your father's son. We can't all have a king's bravery.
I'm sure she does.
A joke. Joffrey did not mean it.
Let him make his threats. Hmm? He's a bitter little man.
Come along.
We have so much to celebrate. A wedding to plan. You must rest.
Come.
Leave.
So, enjoying married life? An unhappy wife is a wine merchant's best friend.
Deserve? Be careful with that. Start trying to work out who deserves what and before long you'll spend the rest of your days weeping for each and every person in the world.
(chuckles)
I won't be marrying Ser Loras.
You're not me. You want to make things better for Sansa? Give her a child.
So she can have some happiness in her life.
Not very. But if it weren't for my children, I'd have thrown myself from the highest window in the Red Keep. They're the reason I'm alive.

Even Joffrey. He was all I had once. Before Myrcella was born. I used to spend hours looking at him. His wisps of hair. His tiny little hands and feet. He was such a jolly little fellow. You always hear the terrible ones were terrible babies. 'We should have known. Even then we should have known.' It's nonsense. Whenever he was with me, he was happy. And no one can take that away from me, not even Joffrey-- how it feels to have someone. Someone of your own.
Until we've dealt with all our enemies.
Then I suppose it will go on for quite a long time.
That's better. It makes you look very strong.
Looks like a Tyrell rose. Give it to Margaery for her wedding gown. Should be more than enough fabric.
Tell me what you think of her.
Margaery.
It is a good match, but what do you think of her? She's beautiful and intelligent.
Her concern with the well-being of the common people is interesting.
I only meant that to go out of your way to endanger yourself.
Margaery Tyrell dotes on filthy urchins for a reason. She dresses like a harlot for a reason. She married a traitor and known degenerate like Renly Baratheon for a reason.
You need to ask yourself
(chuckles)
I have no doubt you will prove equal to this challenge.
The ceremony is traditionally held in the main sanctum, which seats 700 comfortably
There aren't more than 700 people of any importance.
Are you sure Lady Margaery doesn't find all this a bit macabre?
Yes.
Seems like a lifetime ago.
No, he wanted his remains returned to Storm's End.
A fairly predictable tragedy. Hunting and drinking don't mix.
I seem to recall he laid siege to Storm's End for the better part of a year.
(chuckles)
And yet the world belongs to them.
The gods have seen fit to make it so.
Joffrey. Wait.
Yes, about Jaime.
I wanted to make sure we're doing everything we can to get him back.
You started a war.
Whatever you can.
Yes.

Did it ever occur to you that I might be the one who deserves your confidence and your trust, not your sons? Not Jaime or Tyrion, but me. Years and years of lectures on family and legacy-- the same lecture, really, just with tiny, tedious variations-- did it ever occur to you that your daughter might be the only one listening to them? Living by them? That she might have the most to contribute to your legacy that you love so much more than your actual children?
The Tyrells are a problem.
Margaery has her claws in Joffrey. She knows how to manipulate him.
Perhaps you should try stopping him from doing what he likes.
Lord Baelish.
I wonder if I might ask you for a favor.
I have reason to believe that House Tyrell do not hold the crown's best interests at heart.
My father's a practical man. He appreciates facts.

And he appreciates those who aid his family, as you well know. He's almost as generous to those who help us as he is unpleasant towards those who don't. You have a good working relationship with the Tyrells. I thought you might look into it before you leave the capital.
Thank you. And your best will prove better than when I asked you to locate Arya Stark?
(amused) Yes, it is.
She's flowered, I assure you. She and I have discussed it at length.
You should be thanking the gods for this. This is more than you deserve.
What do you mean?
I will not.
No, I won't do it.
I am Queen Regent, not some broodmare.
Father, don't make me do it again, please.
We can have them both killed.
Father doesn't discriminate. We're all being shipped off to hell together.
The Tyrells were plotting to undermine our family. I did what I did to protect our family.
I do admit it. If it weren't for your trick with the wildfire, Stannis would have sacked the city before Father got here. Our heads would still be rotting on the city gate.
What do you want me to say?
Probably. But not from Joffrey. He won't do anything now Father's here.

Not the Tyrells. Soon they won't need to be afraid of him. Joffrey will belong to Margaery, the little doe-eyed whore. And so will his children and their children. History will be taken from our hands.
When Jaime gets back, yes. But when do we think that's going to be? He's out there somewhere.
Who's going to tell her?
Radiant? Why radiant?
You're a musical girl, aren't you? I imagine you have a lovely voice.
Ah, but you know the song 'The Rains of Castamere'?
So you know the story of House Reyne of Castamere?
House Reyne was a powerful family. Very wealthy. The second wealthiest in Westeros. Aren't the Tyrells the second wealthiest family in Westeros now?

Of course, ambitious climbers don't want to stop on the second highest rung. If only you could take that final step, you'd see further than all the rest. You'd be alone with nothing but blue sky above you. So Lord Reyne built a castle as grand as Casterly Rock. He gave his wife diamonds larger than any my mother ever wore. And finally one day, he rebelled against my father. Do you know where House Reyne is now?
Gone. A gentle word. Why not say slaughtered? Every man, woman, and child put to the sword.

I remember seeing their bodies hanging high above the gates of Casterly Rock. My father let them rot up there all summer. It was a long summer. 'And now the rains weep o'er their halls, and not a soul to hear.'
If you ever call me sister again, I'll have you strangled in your sleep.
Perhaps you could talk to your bride-to-be instead.
Stay.
Nobody cares what your father once told you.

4.text: Such an ingrate. I spent days with the goldsmith - getting the details just right.
Better part of an afternoon. There, how does that feel?
Elegant, I think.
Thank you for your help with the other matter.
Gone completely. I am in your debt, Maester Qyburn.
I've grown rather fond of him. He's quite talented, you know?
Symptoms that are not your concern.
You jealous?
(Laughs) You think I'd let that old lecher put his hands on me? He smells like a dead cat.
Well, they smell like Pycelle.
Yes.
Let's see, you started a brawl in the streets with Ned Stark and disappeared from the capital. My husband died in a tragic hunting accident.
My only daughter was shipped off to Dorne. We suffered through a siege.

A rather short siege that I didn't expect to survive. And now I'm marrying my eldest son to a wicked little bitch from Highgarden while I'm supposed to marry her brother, a renowned pillow biter. So...
He can't disown you. You're all he's got.
You don't really plan on staying in the Kingsguard, do you?
Not now.
Everything's changed. You come back after all this time with no apologies and one hand and expect everything to be the same?
For leaving me.
Don't know what you wanted. You weren't here. You left me alone.
You took too long.
I'm saying you took too long.
Come in.
Bloody Martells.
You're dismissed, Grand Maester.
Not anymore.
You can save him?
Do everything you can. Come to me with anything you need.
Will it weaken him?
Very well then.
I'm opening it again.
I will not.
I don't care. I will stay in King's Landing where I belong with my son, the king.
I'm not interested in hearing another one of your smug stories about the time you won. This isn't going to be one of those times.

When you marched into the throne room to tell me we'd won the Battle at Blackwater, do you remember?! I was sitting on the iron throne with Tommen. I was about to give him essence of nightshade, that's how far I was willing to go when I thought someone awful had come to take my son away. Someone awful is coming to take him away.

Joffrey is dead. Myrcella's been sold like livestock. And now you want to ship me off to Highgarden and steal my boy, my last boy. Margaery will dig her claws in and you will dig your claws in and you will fight over him like beasts until you rip him apart. I will burn our house to the ground before I let that happen.
I'll tell everyone the truth.

You don't know, do you? You never believed it. How is that possible? What am I saying, of course it's possible. How can someone so consumed by the idea of his family have any conception what his actual family was doing? We were right there in front of you and you didn't see us. One look in the past twenty years, one real look and you would've known.
Everything they say is true. About Jaime and me.
Your legacy is a lie.
Yes you do.
Jaime.
For my family, no. I would do things for my family you couldn't imagine.
He's not.
I do, so do you. You can choose the creature that killed our mother to come into this world-
A disease doesn't decide to kill you, all the same you cut it out before it does. What do you decide? What do you choose?
I choose you.
Yes. Like the ones I just said to father. I told him.
I told him about us.
I told him I wouldn't marry Loras Tyrell. I told him I'm staying right here with Tommen, with you.
Go and ask him.

I don't want to talk about Tywin Lannister. I don't choose Tywin Lannister, I don't love Tywin Lannister. I love my brother. I love my lover. People will whisper, they'll make their jokes. Let them. They're all so small I can't even see them. I only see what matters.
I don't care.
She's the whore I told you about. The dark-haired one.
He saw us.
You're an example to us all.
Did you just bow?
Lady Brienne. You're Lord Selwyn Tarth's daughter. That makes you a lady whether you want to be or not.
I owe you my gratitude. You returned my brother safely to King's Landing.
Did he? Haven't heard that story before.

I'm sure you have many fascinating stories. Sworn to Renly Baratheon. Sworn to Catelyn Stark. And now my brother. Must be exciting to flit from one camp to the next serving whichever lord or lady you fancy.
But you love him.
She'll do no such thing.
You should see Qyburn. He's quite good.
More repugnant than your gnarled fingers on that girl's thighs?
My little brother had you sent to the Black Cells when you annoyed him. What do you think I could do to you if you annoyed me?

But you are. You annoy me right now. Every breath you draw in my presence annoys me. So here's what I want you to do. I want you to leave my presence. Leave this wedding right now. Go to the kitchens and instruct them that all the leftovers from the feast will be brought to the kennels.
The queen is telling you the leftovers will feed the dogs or you will.
I suppose I am.
Small pleasures.
Can't say I've ever met a Sand before.
No? How tolerant of you.
I suppose you'll never know, Prince Oberyn. It's a shame your older brother couldn't attend the wedding.
Help him! Someone help him!
Joffrey!
Joffrey! Joffrey!
Don't touch him!
Joffrey. Please, Joffrey. Joffrey, what is it? Help him!
My son.
He did this. He poisoned my son, your king. Take him. Take him! Take him! Take him!
You did this. You did this!
Take him! Take him!
Where is his wife? Where's Sansa?
Where is she?!
This is hardly the place or the time.

It was Tyrion. He killed him. He told me he would. "A day will come when you think you are safe and happy and your joy will turn to ashes in your mouth." That's what he said to me. You saw it. You saw Joff point at him just before he...
Avenge him. Avenge our son. Kill Tyrion.
I don't want a trial. He'll squirm his way to freedom given the chance. I want him dead. (CRYING) Please, Jaime. You have to. He was our son. Our baby boy.
Jaime, not here, please. Please.
Stop it. Stop it. Stop.
Stop it. Stop.
Stop. Stop. It's not right.
It's not right. It's not right.
(CRYING) Don't.
Don't. Jaime, don't.
Your Grace. How formal of you. How many Kingsguards are posted outside Tommen's door?
So one? You have one man guarding the future king?
The way you protected Joffrey? Why did Catelyn Stark set you free?
I've been wondering for months. Ever since that great cow brought you back to the capital. Why did she set you free?
She hoped or did you promise?
So you made a sacred vow to the enemy.
You didn't mean it, then? You have no loyalty to Catelyn Stark?
I know you went to see Tyrion. That creature who murdered our son.
And?

You've always pitied him. Our poor little brother. Abused by the world. Despised by his father and sister. He'd kill us all if he could. I want four men at Tommen's door day and night. That will be all, Lord Commander.
There he is.
Long may he reign.
Yes. He wasn't, though, was he?
You still mourn for Joffrey?
He would have been your nightmare.

You knew exactly what he was. I did, too. You never love anything in the world the way you love your first child. Doesn't matter what they do. And what he did, it shocked me. Do you think I'm easily shocked?

The things he did shocked me. He's only a boy. A good boy. A decent boy. He always has been. Who was the last decent king, I wonder? He could be the first man who sits on that throne in 50 years to actually deserve it.
He will need help... if he's going to rule well.
A mother is not enough. You're still interested in being queen, I take it?
Yes, speak to your father. I'll speak to mine.
(CHUCKLES)
As soon as decency permits. After we've allowed Tommen the appropriate time to mourn his brother and Margaery to mourn her husband.
That seems reasonable.
(shakes her head)
Shortly after Tommen's.
A fortnight.
We had that in common.
Then whom can we trust?
Robert wasn't particularly rich.
Haven't a clue.
Pounds, tons, ounces?
That can't be.
Then how do we pay for anything?
How much?
There must be someone at the Iron Bank you can speak to, come to some arrangement.
Someone does work there. It is comprised of people.
It's for the good of the family, I understand that. I'm not sure my brothers do.
I respect that. We don't need to discuss it.

The Lannister legacy is the only thing that matters. You've started wars to protect this family. Turned your back on Jaime for refusing to contribute to its future. What does Tyrion deserve for lighting that future on fire?
Prince Oberyn. Writing letters?
May I show you the gardens?
No, you couldn't.
I didn't realize you were a poet.
For your paramour?
You have several, don't you?
Eight? Eight daughters?
Beautiful name.
Perhaps that's why she's difficult. The gods love their stupid jokes, don't they?

You're a prince of Dorne. A legendary fighter. A brilliant man feared throughout Westeros. But you could not save your sister. I'm a Lannister. Queen for 19 years. Daughter of the most powerful man alive. But I could not save my son. What good is power if you cannot protect the ones you love?
Yes, we can avenge them.
I know he did.
We'll have a trial, anyway. I haven't seen my daughter in over a year.
I want to believe that. I want to believe she's happy.
Everywhere in the world, they hurt little girls. Would you bring her a gift for me? I wasn't there for her name day. I don't know when I'll see her again.
The best shipwrights in King's Landing have been working on it for months. Myrcella loves the open water.
Please tell her... her mother misses her very much.
A coward and a traitor.
Conquered with what?
Baby dragons. Larger every year, Your Grace.
He's an old man. He wasn't fit to protect my son.
Don't tell me you're worried about a child halfway across the world.
"I will hurt you for this. A day will come when you think you are safe and happy and your joy will turn to ashes in your mouth and you will know the debt is paid."

(Nods.) Shortly before the Battle of Blackwater Bay. I confronted him about his plans to put Joffrey on the front lines. As it turned out, when the attack came, Joff insisted on remaining at the battlements. He believed his presence would inspire the troops.
I discovered he'd been keeping whores in the Tower of the Hand. I asked him to confine his salacious acts to the brothel where such behavior belongs. He wasn't pleased.
Ser Gregor. Welcome to the capital. Thank you for riding here so quickly.
You seem to be in good form.
Does it matter?

5.text: Why not?
He’ll never know we’ve been gone.
You don’t need to be afraid of my father.
Yes.
Of course we should.
No.
They said that you were terrifying. With cat’s teeth and three eyes. You’re not terrifying. You’re boring.
I know you’re a witch and you can see the future. Tell me mine.
This is my father’s land. My land. Tell me my future or I’ll have your two boring eyes gouged out of your head.
I’ve been promised to the prince. When will we marry?
But I will be queen?
Will the king and I have children?
That doesn’t make sense.
They will keep waiting. I want a moment alone with him.
They will wait.
He never wanted you to be a King’s Guard, but here you are, protecting his dead body.
They?
They had nothing to do with it. The man who murdered our father, he tore us apart, he’s the enemy. I’ve been telling you for years, you’ve been defending him for years…
...and now our father is dead. And that little monster is out there somewhere drawing breath. Did you set him free?

Tyrion may be a monster but at least he killed our father on purpose. You killed him by mistake. With stupidity. You’re a man of action, aren’t you? When it occurs to you to do something you do it, nevermind the consequences. Take a look. (gestures towards Tywin) Look at the consequences. Here they are. He loved you more than anyone in this world.
Thank you so much for your kind words.
Cousin Lancel. I hardly recognized you.
Uncle, it’s quite alright.
I’m sure he’ll grow out of it. Whatever it is. Excuse me.
Your wounds from the Blackwater seem to have healed.
What can I do for you?
What could you possibly have done to warrant my forgiveness?
I doubt you’ve ever led anyone anywhere.
I don’t know what you’re talking about.
The day Tywin Lannister’s soul needs your help…
I have sinned. I see that now. How could I have been so blind for so long. I want to be clean again. I want absolution. The Crone came to me with her lamp raised high, and with its holy light--
Once I’ve confessed, will I be free?
The Mother have mercy then. I lay with a man outside the bonds of marriage, I confess.
Lancel Lannister.
I was lonely and afraid.
A husband of whoring every chance he got.
May the gods forgive me.
No.
No.
I do.

A lie. A lie from the lips of Stannis Baratheon. He wants the Throne, but his brother’s children stand in his way, so he claims they are not his brothers’. The filth. There is not one shred of truth to it. I deny it.
Trial? I have confessed?
I bow to the wisdom of your High Holiness. But if I might beg for just one drop of the Mother’s mercy. I haven’t seen my son… I don’t know how long it’s been. I need to see him. Please.
Thank you. Thank you.
I will, I will. I swear it, day and night.
Am I free to go?
My atonement?
There are only two like it in the world
Of course itâ€™s a threat! Our daughterâ€™s in Dorne surrounded by people who hate our family. (mocking) "It's a threat."
They blame us for the death of Oberyn and his sister, and every other tragedy thatâ€™s befallen their cursed country. I will burn their cities to the ground if they touch her!
What?
Our daughterâ€™s in danger, and youâ€™re worried Iâ€™m speaking too loudly!
Then donâ€™t call her your daughter. Youâ€™ve never been a father to her.
And what has your caution brought? Our eldest child murdered at his own wedding. Our only daughter shipped off to Dorne. Our baby boy sent to marry that smirking whore from Highgarden.
You never made anything better.
You canâ€™t just ask Prince Doran to give her back! Sheâ€™s promised his son.
You go there with an army, itâ€™s an act of war.
Oberyn mentioned the Water Gardens.
(scoffs) Youâ€™re going to Dorne? A one-handed man? Alone?
Not him.
That won't be necessary, Ser Meryn. I don't want to dissuade the other hunters. Mistakes will be made.
Take the head.
Very good.
No, Uncle. Clearly it would not be appropriate for a woman to assume that role. I'm merely advising my son until he comes of age and chooses a Hand for himself.
You're a good man, Lord Tyrell, but I don't imagine you'll have the time. In addition to being Master of Ships, the king has appointed you Master of Coin.
He called your experience and wisdom in financial matters unparalleled. He said he would be honored to have you represent the crown's interests in the same.
The King has named Qyburn the new Master of Whisperers.
The qualification of loyalty, Grand Maester. That's far more than the eunuch ever had. Far more than many ever have.
The king is very busy at this moment.
He is learning. On this occasion, in his capacity as ruler, he's asked me to speak on his behalf.
My brother has left the capital to lead a sensitive diplomatic mission.
That is not your concern as Master of War.
You would abandon your king in his time of need?

You look very much in love. The first days of marriage are often so blissful. She's certainly very pretty, isn't she? Like a doll, she smiles quite a lot. Do you think she's intelligent? I can't quite tell. Not that it matters.
There's nothing for me in Casterly Rock.
(Chuckles). Why are we speaking of Casterly Rock?
This is my real home now. Where my family lives.
I know that. I know you do, my sweet boy.
Don't you look lovely. Marriage agrees with you.
No, no. I, I can't stay. I just wanted to let you know if, there is ever anything I can do for you.
Tommen seems quite taken with his new queen.
Good. Good. I'm glad to hear you're happy.
I'll leave you to it then. (Turns to leave).
There's no need for such formalities.
Won’t that be a lovely day.
Remember. Anything you need.
You were assaulted?
What do you want from us, High Septon?
And where do I find this man? This High Sparrow?
Nonsense, Ser Meryn. These are deeply religious people. (To a man at the bottom of some stairs). Where can I find the High Sparrow?
A young man said I would find the High Sparrow back here. Where is he?
Why no shoes?
Is that why you came to King's Landing? To remind everyone?
(Smiles). Perhaps they're right.
An unacceptable way to treat the chosen representative of the Gods in this world, wouldn't you say?
The High Septon came to speak to me today. He doesn't want me to arrest you, he wants me to execute you.

(After a moment). My thoughts on the matter align with your own. The High Septon's behaviour was corrosive, as was his attitude. Having a man like that reside in the Sept eats away the Faith from the inside. So now he resides in the Red Keep's dungeons instead. (The High Sparrow looks up at her surprised). The Faith and the Crown are the two pillars that hold up this world. If one collapses, so does the other. We must do everything necessary to protect one another.
Send a raven with this message to Littlefinger in the Eyrie, or wherever he's slithering about. (Hands him the letter).
How's your work coming along?
You've made progress?
Very good. I'll leave you to it then. Make sure Littlefinger is clear on the meaning of the word "immediately".
How much can the Crown afford?
You're the Master of Coin. How do we pay them?
You've already given us too much. (Gets up and walks to a window). No, we must arrange better terms with the Iron Bank.
In person.
We must send an envoy to the Iron Bank, someone of importance, to show these bankers our respect. As the King's Master of Coin, I can think of no one more qualified.
The King has expressed concern about his father-in-law's safety on this voyage. (Smiling). He's ordered Ser Meryn to personally lead your escort.
Safe travels, Lord Tyrell.
(Walking out). Not small enough.
May I offer you some wine, Your Holiness?
The old High Septon would have asked the vintage. (Smiles).
Hmm.
All over Westeros we hear about septs being burned. Silent sisters raped. Bodies of holy men piled in the streets.
Perhaps the Gods need a sword of their own. (HS raises an eyebrow). In the days before the Targaryens, the Faith Militant dispensed the justice of the Seven.
If I explain the holy purpose to my son, the king, I have no doubt he will sign a decree arming the believers you felt worthy.
An army and service to the Gods themselves. And to you, of course. As the chosen representative of the Seven.

Which is why you were chosen. (HS smiles). You and I both know how the world works. Too often the wicked are the wealthiest, beyond the reach of justice. The king himself cannot always punish those who deserve it most.
(Smiles. Continues after a moment). What would you say if I told you we have a great sinner in our very midst? Shielded by gold and privilege.
(Turns around). Did I arrest him?
I did. And your wife has every right to criticize. (Begins walking towards her desk). Can't allow fanatics to arrest the Queen's brother, no matter his perversions.
I told you I am not holding Ser Loras. You're the King. I'm sure if you speak to the High Sparrow, he'll release the poor boy.
The Faith arrested the heir to Highgarden.
The King’s orders. Is the King to blame for Ser Loras’ perversion?
House Tyrell won’t tolerate it? I’m the insulted party, Lord Baelish. Ser Loras was promised to me, instead he chose the company of boys.
Most curious. Lysa Arryn for instance. A sorrily repellent woman. Forgive me. I know you’re still in mourning.
She was neither of those things, we both know it. Still, I pity her son. How fortunate that the young Lord of the Vale has a new father to counsel him.
If war comes to Westeros will the Knights of the Veil fight for their king?
Good. (Cersei gets up) If there’s nothing else.
That’s not possible.
Roose Bolton is Warden of the North by the grace of my father.
We were fools to trust a turncloak.
I will skin him and his bastard like that wretch on that bloody sigil.
Patience? Sansa helped murder my son, Roose Bolton is a traitor.
Winterfell is 1,000 miles away from here. The weather has already begun to turn.
My Uncle Kevan has all the courage of a kitchen mouse.
Jaime is away on a sensitive diplomatic mission. I’ve no idea when he’ll be back.
Forgive me Lord Baelish, you have a reputation as a money lender and brothel keeper, not a military man.
And if you succeed?
I’ll speak to the king this evening. Have him issue a royal decree.
And I’ll l know you’re a man of your word when I see Sansa Stark’s head on a spike.
You must be exhausted.
Ah, yes, the famously tart-tongued queen of thorns.
Beg your pardon.
If you apologize for that comment perhaps--
I was as shocked as anyone when The Faith arrested Ser Loras. I have no love for these fanatics. But what can the queen mother do?
I assure you our alliance with House Tyrell remains--
As I said, i didn’t imprison anyone. As for your veiled threats--
The Lannister-Tyrell alliance brought peace to a war-torn country. Do you really want to see the Seven Kingdoms slide back into warfare?

House Lannister has no rival. The High Septon has called for an inquest, not a trial. Just a small hearing to determine whether the charges against Loras have merit, which I’m sure they don’t. Loras will be freed, our happy alliance will continue, and we’ll forget this unfortunate conversation ever happened. Good day, Lady Olenna.
This testimony is an insult to a great house. Why should The Faith or anyone else take the word of a squire over the heir to Highgarden?
Starving yourself won't make things any better for her, my love.
No matter who you are, no matter how strong you are, sooner or later, you'll face circumstances beyond your control.
You know as well as I do who the first casualty in that war would be.
