We must be strong for those we love. We cannot give in to despair.
Let me speak to him on your behalf. The king cannot dirty sully himself negotiating with an unwashed fanatic.
Your happiness is all I want in this world

No you don’t. You can’t possibly. Not until you have children of your own. I would do anything for you. Anything to keep you from harm. I would burn cities to the ground. That is all that matters. You and your sister. From the moment you came into this world, my boy. My only boy.

This is horrible. Unacceptable. Are they feeding you enough at least? I brought you this. Venison. It’s quite good. I had it myself for supper only last night. We did everything we could from the moment they took your brother. Tommen even went to the sept himself to confront the high sparrow, but I fear The Faith has left reason behind.
We are making every effort on your behalf. I swear to you by all the seven gods.
You’re upset. You’re not thinking clearly. I’ll visit again when you’ve had a chance to calm down.
I do hope you change your mind about that. I’ve been told men often go mad in the Black Cells below the Red Keep, but I suppose your isolation will end once your trial begins.
Yes, I’m afraid I must. My son needs me now more than ever.
Sleep well, sister.
Yes.
Her accommodations seem sufficient. What happens to her now?
Who will stand judge?
Will you be one of them?
If one or both of them were to confess before the trial…
What does The Mother’s mercy entail?
Thank you High Septon for bringing them whatever justice they deserve in the eyes of the Seven.
I think I may have heard at one point.
I’m afraid i don’t.
Move. Let me go immediately.
You will order her to let me go! I am the queen! I am the queen! Have you lost your mind? Let me go! You filthy… I am the queen! Let me go!
Look at me. Look at my face. It’s the last thing you’ll see before you die.
My son. Let me speak to--
My face will be the last thing you see before--
The charges?
All lies.
I wish you’d said it sooner. Any word from Jaime?
Tell him I need to speak to him.
What about my son, the king? If you can visit me then surely the king--
You need to talk to him, you need to talk to my son to come and see me, come and see his mother.
I can’t stay here.
Confess? To the High Sparrow? I won’t. I made him. I rose him up from nothing, I will not kneel before some barefooted commoner and beg his forgiveness.
I’ll get out of here, you realize. Before long.
I can make you a wealthy woman. A lady of the court.
I can make sure you die in the most hideous way imaginable, and all I do is sit here imagining ways for you to die.

6.text: Myrcella…
Do you remember the first time you saw a dead body?

All I could think about when she died was what would happen to her now. Every day, every night, what does Mama look like now? Has she started to bloat? Has her skin turned black? Have her lips peeled back from her teeth?
I think about locking Myrcella in a crypt.
I think about her beautiful little face starting to collapse.
I have to. I have to. It’s not right she has to suffer alone.
She was good. From her first breath, she was so sweet. I don’t know where she came from. She was nothing like me. No meanness, no jealous, just good.
I thought if I could make something so good, so pure...maybe I’m not a monster.

No, I knew this would happen. The witch told me years ago. She promised me three children. She promised me they’d die. “And gold their shrouds.” Everything she said came true. You couldn’t have stopped it. It’s prophecy. It’s fate.

Of course I do. You told me yourself when Father died. You said we had to stay together. You said people would try to tear us apart, take what’s ours. That was a prophecy, too. I didn’t listen to you, and everything you said came true.
Confess. Confess.
Confess.

Confess. It felt good. Beating me, starving me, frightening me, humiliating me. You didn’t do it because you cared about my atonement. You did it because it felt good. I understand. I do things because they feel good. I drink because it feels good. I killed my husband because it felt good to be rid of him. I fuck my brother because it feels good to feel him inside me. I lie about fucking my brother… because it feels good to keep our son safe from hateful hypocrites. I killed your High Sparrow… and all his little sparrows… all his septons, all his septas, all his filthy soldiers, because it felt good to watch them burn. It felt good to imagine their shock and their pain. No thought has ever given me greater joy. Even confessing feels good under the right circumstances.
You’ve always been quiet.
I said my face would be the last thing you saw before you died. Do you remember?
What? Now? Today? You’re not going to die today. You’re not going to die for quite a while. Ser Gregor.
This is Ser Gregor Clegane. He’s quiet, too.
Your gods have forsaken you. This is your god now.
Shame.
Shame.
Shame.
Show me.
Show me.
He should be with his grandfather, his brother, his sister. Burn him and bury his ashes where the sept once stood.
Get out of my way.
What are the king’s orders?
You’re barring me from attending my own daughter’s funeral?
I would like to speak to my son.
Did they put her in the red gown or the gold?
Good. It was always her color.
I understand. I’m glad to see you.
It’s all right.
Always.
Varys's little birds?
The High Sparrow has hundreds of Faith Militant surrounding him. Ser Gregor will can’t face them all. And he won’t have to. He’ll only have to face one.
Not yet.

Don’t stop at the city. I want little birds in Dorne, in Highgarden, in the North. If someone is planning on making our losses their gains I want to hear it. If someone is laughing at the queen who walk naked through the streets covered in shit, I want to hear. I want to know who they are. I want to where they are.
Thank you for bringing it up. It’s well past time we addressed the abuses I endured.
Grand Maester Pycelle, would you sanction that statement?
What about Myrcella’s death, Uncle? Do you consider the murder of your own blood a troublesome issue?
And seeing as you cannot make us leave, we best get on with it.
What are you doing here?
Leave.
Is this a Small Council meeting?
Since I’ve missed the past several Small Coucil meetings, I wanted to speak to you about a few things.
As have we all, unfortunately.
Look at me. What did they do to me? To the king’s own mother?
It’s all right. It's done. It’s in the past. And of course Margaery’s safety is paramount.

Whether I like her or not is completely unimportant. Margaery is the queen. Queens must command respect. Kings even more so. Not just for their own sake, but for everyone’s. The High Sparrow has no respect for kings or queens. No respect for anything in this world. He has no use for the things of this world. He want to knock them down and replace them with what? With fantasies. With beggars in the street. With nothing.
You’ve spoken with him?
It would be a breach of confidence which he would not take lightly, given his constant prattling about the truth. I am your mother. You can always trust me.
The Small Council meeting has been postponed on the king’s orders.
You once spoke of your respect for our father because he understood the necessity of working with one’s rivals.

The High Sparrow seized power knowing full well we'd bicker amongst ourselves instead of seizing it back. Here we are. Well done to us. Now the future of the Seven Kingdoms rest in his dirty, peasant hands. In a few days, he’ll have a trial for me. But before that, Queen Margaery will make her walk of atonement. Yes, Margaery will repent her sins before the good people of the city.
I agree.
You hate these fanatics as much as we do. You hate what they’ve done to your son. Do you want Lancel back or have you given him up for good?
Then stand aside and let the people that took him from you be destroyed.
BEtter you’re elsewhere at the head of an army than in the sept dungeons.
What, then?
You can’t.

We should treat them without mercy and we will. But if you kill the High Sparrow, you won’t leave the sept alive. And without you, this is all for nothing. Stand at the head of our army where you belong, where Father wanted you. Show our men where their loyalties belong. Show them what lannisters are, what we do to our enemies. And take that stupid little castle back because it’s ours and because you can.
It will be a trial by combat. I have the Mountain. They’ve made us both stronger, all of them.
They have no idea how strong we are. No idea what we’re going to do to them.
We’ve always been together. We’ll always be together. We’re the only two people in the world.
I heard you were leaving King’s Landing.
Your grandson is still a prisoner. You’ll leave him rotting in a cell?
You’re right. I made a terrible mistake. I carry it with me every single day.
I delivered an army of fanatics onto our doorstep. And now we must fight them together. We need each other.
You love your granddaughter. I love my son. It’s the only truth I know. We must defend them.
Never. I’ll never leave my son.
Have been permitted? That’s rather a tortured way of putting it.
Who permitted them inside the Red Keep?
The king is aware of their presence?
His Holiness the High Septon is welcome to see me here in the Red Keep.
It is a request, Cousin Lancel. You are asking me for something, I’m refusing.
He promised me I could stay in the Red Keep until my trial.
Get out.
I choose violence.
Please tell His High Holiness he’s always welcome to visit.
There’s to be a royal announcement?
Why wasn’t I informed?
To stand by my son.
And? Was it just a rumor or something more?

7.text: Its what we've been waiting for our whole lives. It's what Father trained us for, whether he knew it or not.
It's ours now, we just have to take it.
You've been quiet since you came home. Are you angry with me?
Are you afraid of me?

Daenerys Targaryen has chosen Tyrion to be her Hand. Right now, they're sailing across the Narrow Sea, hoping to take back her father's throne. Our little brother, the one you love so much, the one you set free, the one who murdered our father and our first-born son, now he stands beside our enemies and gives them counsel. He's out there somewhere at the head of an armada. Where will they land?
Enemies to the east.
Enemies to the south--Ellaria Sand and her brood of bitches.
Enemies to the west--Olenna, the old cunt. Another traitor.

Enemies to the north. Ned Stark's bastard has been named King in the North and that murdering whore Sansa stands beside him. Enemies everywhere. We're surrounded by traitors. You're in command of the Lannister army now. How do we proceed?
Will the Tyrell bannermen stand alongside a Dothraki horde and Unsullied slave soldiers?
I'm the Queen of the Seven Kingdoms.
I understand we're in a war for survival. I understand whoever loses dies. I understand whoever wins could launch a dynasty that lasts a thousand years.
A dynasty for us, then.
There's nothing to say.
He betrayed me. He betrayed us both. Should we spend our days mourning the dead--mother, father, and all our children?
I loved them. I did. But they're ashes now and we're still flesh and blood. We're the last Lannisters, the last ones who count.
I heard. How could we ever trust a man like that?
You think I listened to Father for 40 years and learned nothing?
Not all of them.
I invited Euron Greyjoy, the new King of the Iron Islands. You said yourself we needed stronger, better allies. There you are.
So does everyone when it suits them. Unlike the Freys, they have ships. And they're good at killing.
Euron Greyjoy didn't come here for that.
A queen.
If not the most humble.
What do you want in return?
I decline your proposal.
You're not trustworthy. You've broken promises to allies before and murdered them at the nearest opportunity. You murdered your own brother.

If the Mad King's daughter takes the Iron Throne, she will destroy the Realm as we know it. Some of you are bannermen of House Tyrell. But House Tyrell is in open rebellion against the Crown. With their help the Mad King's daughter has ferried an army of savages to our shores. Mindless Unsullied soldiers who will destroy your castles and your holdfasts. Dothraki heathens who will burn your villages to the ground, rape and enslave your women, and butcher your children without a second thought. This is how Olenna Tyrell rewards centuries of service and loyalty.

You all remember the Mad King. You remember the horrors he inflicted upon his people. His daughter is no different. In Essos her brutality is already legendary. She crucified hundreds of noblemen in Slaver's Bay. And when she grew bored of that, she fed them to her dragons.
It is my solemn duty to protect the people, and I will but I need your help, My Lords. We must stand together, all of us, if we hope to stop her.
No, I can't say I have. I haven't seen these since Robert had them removed from the Throne Room.
They were his trophies. He couldn't keep them around. They would have made him look small. Sometimes he would come down here and look at them. I believe he brought his whores on occasion.
You've proven yourself the greatest captain on the 14 seas and a true friend to the crown.
And you deserve a proper reward for your heroism.
You shall have what your heart desires --
-- when the war is won.
With Euron Greyjoy commanding our naval forces and Jaime Lannister leading our armies, the sons and daugters of Westeros shall defend our country.

I want you to know I understand. Even though we're enemies, you and I, I understand the fear that drives you. I was there that day when Ser Gregor crushed your lover's head. I close my eyes I can hear the sound of Oberyn's skull breaking.

The sound of your scream. I never heard a sound like that. I thought, that's true love. Oberyn looked beautiful that day. He really did. No one moved like him. No one had such skill with a spear. Even Ser Gregor couldn't stop him. If only he hadn't taunted him. He could have walked away and left poor Ser Gregor to die. But that wasn't your lover's way, was it? Now he's burried somewhere. And here Ser Gregor is stronger than ever. That must be difficult for you. When my daughter was taken from me, my only daughter, well, you can't imagine how that feels unless you've lost a child. I fed her at my own breast even though they told me to give her to the wet nurse. I couldn't bear to see her in another woman's arms. I never got to have a mother. But Myrcella did. She was mine and you took her from me. Why did you do that?
It doesn't matter now.
Your daughter is a beauty too. Brown eyes, those lips. A perfect Dornish beauty.
I imagine she is your favorite.
I know, I know, we're not supposed to have favorites. But still, we're only human. We love who we love.
I'm sorry. I can't understand you. The gag makes it difficult to understand what you're saying. It must be frustrating.
We all make our choices. You chose to murder my daughter. You must have felt powerful after you made that choice.

Do you feel powerful now? I don't sleep very well, not at all really. I lie in bed and I stare at the canopy and imagine ways of killing my enemies. How to destroy Ellaria Sand, the woman who murdered my only daughter. I thought about having Ser Gregor crush your skull the way he did Oberyn's. It would be poetic I suppose but fast. Too fast.
I thought about having him crush your daughter's skull.
She's so beautiful. The thought of this lovely face cracking open like a duck egg, no, it's just not right.
Qyburn, he's the cleverest man I know. Clever enough to learn what poison you used to murder Myrcella. The long goodbye, was that it?
That's the one.
How long does the poison take?
But death is certain?

Your daughter will die here in this cell. You will be here watching when she does. You will be here the rest of your days. If you refuse to eat we will force food down your throat. You will live to watch your daughter rot, to watch that beautiful face collapse to bone and dust all the while contemplating the choices you've made.
Make sure the guards change the torches every few hours. I don't want her to miss a thing.
I am queen of the Seven Kingdoms. I'll do as I please.
Good. And we'll need fresh sheets for the bed.
The Iron Bank didn't send you hear to offer condolences.
The destruction of the Sept of Baelor was a tragic accident.
The Iron Bank wants its gold back.
And we both know gold wins wars. Your vaults are empty. Your late husband's profligacy saw to that.
And the Iron Bank wants to bet on a winner.
That's a fancy way of saying bet. The war has already begun. I've drawn first blood. I decapitated the Dornish snake. My armada owns the Narrow Sea.
Euron Greyjoy is loyal to me.

Her dragons might not be as invulnerable as some think. Now, let's talk about the Targaryen girl. You want to invest in her? I'm guessing the Iron Bank invested considerable gold in the slave trade. How are you profits now that Daenerys has freed all the slaves?
From what I gather she considers herself more of a revolutionary that a monarch. In your experience how do bankers usually fare with revoltionaries?
The Lannisters owe the Iron Bank quite a lot of money but Lannisters always pay their debts. Do former slaves or Dothraki or dragons?
Give me a fortnight. Stay in King's Landing as my honored guest and when you return to Braavos I swear to you my debt will be paid in full.
You're too kind, My Lord.
Is on its way. My brother is supervising its transportation himself.
We must devise a way to raise their spirits.
My only venture at the moment is reestablishing control over this continent and every person on it.
It will indeed. I need to expand my armies, my navies. My hand, Qyburn, had made overtures to the Golden Company in Essos.
That's good to hear. I too would like them to recover some things that belong to me.
How many men did we lose?
It's armies that win wars. We have the Tyrell gold, we have the Iron Bank behind us. We can buy mercenaries.
They're not the same as our men but they'll fight if they're well paid, which they will be.
So what do we do? Sue for peace? I sit on her father's throne, the father you betrayed and murdered. And in her mind she's winning. What sort of offer do you think she'd make?
Maybe we can count on Tyrion to intercede on our behalf by way of apology for murdering our father and our son.
You saw the crossbow, you saw his body.
After all this time it still amazes me --
And this was before or after she drank the poison you so kindly provided her?
And you believed her?
I shouldn't have listened to you. She should have died screaming.
So we fight and die or we submit and die. I know my choice. A soldier should know his.
That won't be necessary.
He's Hand of the Queen. Why are you here?
What did our brother have to say?
To discuss a surrender?
She just won a great victory. Why would she want a truce now?
Are you going to punish him?
Bronn.
He betrayed you. He set up a meeting without your knowledge or consent. Do you think anything of importance happens in this city without me knowing?

I've come to believe that accomodation with the Dragon Queen could be in our immediate interest. She has the numbers. If we want to beat her we have to be clever. We have to fight her like father would have. Dead men, dragons and Dragon Queens, whatever stands in our way we will defeat it ourselves for our house. For this.
You.
Do you remember what father used to say about people?
Never betray me again.
Why isn't she with them?
And the rest of them?
Including our brother.
If anything goes wrong, kill the silver-haired bitch first, then our brother, then the bastard who calls himself king.
Where is she?
Didn't travel with you?
We've been here for some time.
Sit down or leave.
So instead, we should settle our differences and live together in harmony for the rest of our days?
Then why are we here?
I imagine for most of them it would be an improvement.
I don't think it's serious at all. I think it's another bad joke. If my brother Jaime has informed me correctly, you're asking me for a truce.

That's all? Pull back my armies and stand down while you go on your monster hunt. Or while you solidify and expand your position. Hard for me to know which it is with my armies pulled back until you return and march on my capital with four times the men.
The word of a would-be usurper.
What are you talking about?

He's right to be afraid. And a coward to run. If those things come for us, there will be no kingdoms to rule. Everything we suffered will have been for nothing. Everything we lost will have been for nothing. The crown accepts your truce. Until the dead are defeated, they are the true enemy.
In return, the King
(CHUCKLES) I would never ask it of you. You would never agree to it. And if you did, I would trust you even less than I do now. I ask it only of Ned Stark's son. I know Ned Stark's son.
Then there is nothing left to discuss. The dead will come north first. Enjoy dealing with them. We will deal with whatever is left of you.
I shouldn't be surprised, I suppose. She's your kind of woman a foreign whore who doesn't know her place.
So you bring her here with her pet Northerner, whom you've convinced to bow down before her.
And now you've got them both working towards the same goal, the goal you've worked towards your entire life.
the destruction of this family.
You killed our father

Oh, poor little man. Your papa was mean to you. Do you have any idea what you did when you fired that crossbow? You left us open. You laid us bare for the vultures, and the vultures came and tore us apart. You may not have killed Joffrey, but you killed Myrcella, you killed Tommen. No one would've touched them if Father--
I will not hear it, not from you.
I will not hear it!
I will not
It doesn't matter. Your love doesn't matter. Your feelings don't matter. I don't care why you did what you did. I only care what it cost us. It cost us our future.
Not to help my enemies collaborate in my destruction.
What did you hope for? To make Jon Snow submit to your queen.
But eventually, you want everyone to bend the knee to her.
Why?
You said she'd destroy King's Landing.
That's the difference between you. I don't care about checking my worst impulses. I don't care about making the world a better place. Hang the world.

That thing you dragged here, I know what it is, I know what it means. And when it came at me, I didn't think about the world. Not at all. As soon as it opened its mouth, the world disappeared for me, right down its black throat. All I could think about was keeping those gnashing teeth away from the ones who matter most, away from my family. Maybe Euron Greyjoy had the right idea. Get on a boat, take those who matter.

My armies will not stand down. I will not pull them back to the capital. I will march them north to fight alongside you in the Great War. The darkness is coming for us all. We'll face it together. And when the Great War is over, perhaps you'll remember I chose to help with no promises or assurances from any of you. I expect not. Call our banners. All of them.
Ser Jaime.
My lords, I need a moment with my brother.
What are you doing?
Expedition north? I always knew you were the stupidest Lannister. The Starks and Targaryens have united against us, and you want to fight alongside them? Are you a traitor or an idiot?
I'll say whatever I need to say to ensure the survival of our house. You expect me to trust the man who murdered our father.
I saw it burn. If dragons can't stop them, if Dothraki and Unsullied and Northmen can't stop them, how will our armies make a difference?
And I intend to stay amongst the living. Let the Stark boy and his new queen--
Our child will rule Westeros.

The monsters are real. The white walkers, the dragons, the Dothraki screamers all the frightening stories we heard when we were young, they're all real. So be it. Let the monsters kill each other. And while they battle in the North, we take back the lands that belong to us.
And then we rule.
The Targaryens and the Starks already want to kill us all. Most of them will die in the North.
How many dragons did you see at the pit?
What happened to the third?
She came here with her dragons and her Dothraki and her Unsullied. She came here to show us all her power. No, something happened.The dragons are vulnerable.
No, we have something better. We have the Iron Bank. You should've listened more when Father--
Do you really think Euron Greyjoy turned tail and sailed back to the Iron Islands? Do you think he abandoned the chance to marry the queen?
And you conspired with Tyrion, the man who murdered our father without telling me, your queen.
You met with him in secret without my consent. You planned to promote my enemies' interests. That is the definition of conspiracy.
And that will be treason.
Disobeying your queen
I told you no one walks away from me.
There's one more yet to come.

8.text: Good.
Twenty-thousand men, is it?
Horses?
And elephants?
That's disappointing. I was told the Golden Company had elephants.
In any event, you are most welcome here in King's Landing, Captain Strickland.
You are a true friend of the crown and an honored guest.
After the war. That was our agreement.
You want a whore, buy one. You want a queen, earn her.
You're insolent. I've executed men for less.
I wanted those elephants.
You're insulting my late husband?
Robert had a different whore every night, but he still didn't know his way around a woman's body.
You enjoy risking your neck, don't you?
You're not boring, I'll give you that.
You might be the most arrogant man I've ever met. I like that.
But now I want to be alone.
Our message was well-received, then?
You're certain about the dragon?
That must have been glorious.
When the war is won, the Lion shall rule the land, the Kraken shall rule the sea and our child shall one day rule them all.
Of course she is. Keep the gates open. If she wants to take the castle, she'll have to murder thousands of innocent people first.
So much for "the Breaker of Chains."
(to MISSANEDEI) If you have any last words, now is the time.

1.text: We’ve been his guests for over a year and he’s never asked us for anything.
No.
I don’t know.
Thank you, ser. Are you from my country?
Thank you, Magister.
She’s beautiful. … Ser Jorah, I don’t know how to say ‘thank you’ in Dothraki.
Do you know the Common Tongue?
Is ‘no’ the only word that you know?
Ser Jorah?
My son – where is he? l want him. Where is he?
Tell me.
How did my son die?
What do the women say?
Where is Khal Drogo? Show him to me. Show me what l bought with my son's life.
l want to see him now.
The khalasar is gone.
Drogo! (in Dothraki) My sun and stars. (in the Common Tongue, to the rest) Why is he out here alone?
(looking at Drogo’s catatonic expression) This is not life. When will he be as he was?
Leave us.
l have nothing more to fear from this woman. Go.
You knew what l was buying and you knew the price.
This is not God's work. My child was innocent.
l spoke for you. l saved you.
Your life.

(in Dothraki) Do you remember our first ride, my sun and stars? lf you are in there, if you haven't gone away, show me. You're a fighter. You've always been a fighter. l need you to fight now. l know you're very far away, but come back to me, my sun and stars.
(crying) When the sun rises in the west and sets in the east. Then you shall return to me, my sun and stars.
They were not given to me to sell.
l must. You don't understand.

ls that what you fear? (kisses Jorah on the cheek, then speaks to the rest of the Dothraki and Lhazareen who stayed with her) You will be my khalasar. l see the faces of slaves. l free you. Take off your collars. Go if you wish, no one will stop you. But if you stay it will be as brothers and sisters, as husbands and wives.
Ser Jorah, bind this woman to the pyre. You swore to obey me.
I will. But it is not your screams I want. Only your life.
Isn't there anything else?
Have you ever seen a dragon?
Everywhere? Even in the east?
The moon?
Leave me with her. Why did the trader from Garth tell you these stories?
How old were you?
Nine?!
Can you teach me how to make the Khal happy?
Will it take three years?
Finish a man?
Well, she sounds like an interesting woman. I don't think that Drogo will like it with me on top.
I don't think that this is the Dothraki way.
No. No. Tonight I would look upon your face.
From whom?
Tell them all to stop.
Until I command them otherwise.
Not a Queen. A Khaleesi.
No!
Please please, don't hurt him. Tell him I don't want my brother harmed.
What are you doing?
It’s a boy.
I know.
These are my people now. You shouldn't call them savages.
If my brother was given an army of Dothraki, could you conquer the Seven Kingdoms?
But if they did?
And you know these men?
You sold slaves.
Why?
And where is she now?
Hush now. It's all right. Irri, take her and leave us.
Why did you hit her?!
I wasn't commanding you. I just wanted to invite you to supper.
It's a gift. I had it made for you.
Please.
Stop - stop it.
You've no right to a braid. You've won no victories yet.
I am a Khaleesi of the Dothraki! I am the wife of the great Khal and I carry his son inside me. The next time you raise a hand to me will be the last time you have hands.
I hit him. I hit the dragon.
He is still the true King.
No. But the common people are waiting for him. Illyrio said they're sewing dragon banners and praying for his return.
What do you pray for, Ser Jorah?
I pray for home too. My brother will never take back the Seven Kingdoms. He couldn't lead an army even if my husband gave him one. He'll never take us home.
You’re hurt.
A prince rides inside me! And he shall be called Rhaego!
Stop him.
Viserys, please.
He says yes. You shall have a golden crown, that men shall tremble to behold.
No.
He was no dragon. Fire cannot kill a dragon.
According to the prophecy, the stallions will ride to the ends of the world.
The earth does not end at the sea, there are many dirts beyond the sea.
Lands, yes...
It's not a chair. It's a... Throne
A chair for a King to sit upon, or a Queen.
Can't you help me make him understand?
My brother was a fool, I know, but he was the rightful heir to the Seven Kingdoms.
And because he had dragons.
You don't believe it.
Well, I'll come with you.
My son already has his name, but I'll try your summerwine.
Rise. I'd still like to taste that wine.
You honor me, Ser.
I hope to repay your kindness someday.
Is something wrong?
Do as he says.
You will drink.
What will they do to him?
And when he falls?
King Robert still wants me dead.This poisoner was the first. He won't be the last.
I thought he'd leave me alone, now that my brother is gone.
He will not have my son.
What did they do?
I thought the Dothraki didn't believe in money.
Jorah, make them stop.
You heard me.
I do not have a gentle heart, Ser. Do as I command or Khal Drogo will know the reason why.
Bring her to me. And those women there.
I can, and I will.
Mago speaks the truth, my sun and stars. I have claimed many daughters this day, so they cannot be mounted.
It pleases me to keep them safe.
The dragons feeds on horse and lamb alike.
I am Khaleesi. I do command you.
My sun and stars is wounded.
Where are the healers?
She is mine let her speak.
Who are you?
Let her clean your wound, my sun and stars.
(in Dothraki) My lordâ€¦ My sun and starsâ€¦ Drogo.
(in Dothraki) He's tired, that's all. He needs to rest. We've ridden far enough today. We'll camp here.
(in Dothraki) We'll camp here. Tell them Khal Drogo commanded it.
(in Dothraki) Find Mirri Maz Duur. Bring her to me.
(in Dothraki) Bring her to me unharmed or Khal Drogo will hear why you denied me.
Come. He's very strong. No one understands how strong he is.
He can't. He can't. l won't let him.
l won't leave him.
Even if he dies, why would l run? l am khaleesi, and my my son will be khal after Drogo.
l won't leave him.
(in Dothraki) Stop it! l don't want her hurt.
(in Dothraki) l have never been nothing. l am the blood of the dragon.
l think you should wear your armor tonight, ser.
And now you must save him.
Save him and l will free you. l swear it. You must know a way. Some â€“ some magic.
Do it. Save him.
You'll have gold, whatever you want.
My death?
Kill her and you kill your khal.
l am your khaleesi. l tell you what is forbidden.
Take her and leave. Take her!
No one will enter.
Bring him back to me.
l have to save him.
(in Dothraki) This must be.
(in Dothraki) No, you can't.
The baby â€“
â€¦ is coming.

2.text: He said they ate meat.
My brother didn't know anything about dragons. He didn't know anything about anything.
She was Drogo's first gift to me.
I promised to protect them. Promised them their enemies would die screaming. How do I make starvation scream?
Does it ever end?
And you're sure there's no other way?
No one will take my dragons.
(Turns to Jorah) As you are mine.
(Speaking Dothraki) Rakharo, Aggo, Kovarro. Take our remaining horses. You will ride east, you southeast, and you northeast.
(Speaking Dothraki) Cities, living or dead. Caravans and people. Rivers or lakes or the great salt sea. Find how far the Red Waste extends before us, and what lies on the other side.
(Speaking Dothraki) Rokharo, you are my last hope, blood of my blood.
You never have.
Let them try.
Is this a riddle?
Are you trying to frighten me with magic tricks? You want me? Here I am. Are you afraid of a little girl?
(dothraki) This is dark magic, like the magic that took you from me. Took you from me before I could even Maybe I am dead and I just don't know it yet. Maybe I am with you in the Night Lands.
That sounds like something you would do.
Until the sun rises in the west and sets in the east, until the rivers run dry and the mountains blow in the wind like leaves.
This is not my home. My home is across the sea, where my people are waiting for me.
Dracarys.
Come.
Nothing.
Thank you, Xaro Xhoan Daxos. Thank you for teaching me this lesson.
Looks real enough to me. Real enough to buy a ship?
Does it ever end?
(Speaking Dothraki) Rakharo, Aggo, Kovarro.. Take our remaining horses. Find out how far the Red Waste extends before us, and what lies on the other side.
He is blood of my blood.
Who did this?
They will like it far less when I'm done with them.
(Speaking Dothraki) Shh. They cannot kill his soul.
(Speaking Dothraki) Shh. We will build him a funeral pyre.
(Speaking Dothraki) And I promise you, Rakharo will ride with his ancestors tonight.
(Valerian) This isn't your horse.
(Valerian) Qarth?
(Valerian) Will they let us in?
What do you know of this place?
I thought we were welcome.
Horde?
My name is Daenerys
You know me, my lord?
And what should I call you?
The beauty of Quarth is legendary
Qarth.
My friend, we have traveled very far. We have no food, no water. Once I see my people fed, I would be honored
I am not a liar.
Where I come from, guests are treated with respect, not insulted at the gates.
What are you doing? You promised to receive me.
If you do not let us in, all of us will die.

Thirteen! When my dragons are grown, we will take back what was stolen from me and destroy those who have wronged me. We will lay waste to armies and burn cities to the ground. Turn us away and we will burn you first.
Dracarys. Dracarys.
He'll be able to feed himself from now on.
Let him sleep, Doreah.
(amused) He loves you.
Thank you, my friend.
The last time a rich man gave me a dress, he was selling me to Khal Drogo.
Xaro is our host, but we know nothing about him. Men like to talk about other men when they're happy.
It sounds wonderful.
Please excuse me for a moment.
What are they doing?
(Dothraki) We are his guests! You can't pry it or chop it or melt it.
(Dothraki) Not even when we leave.
(Dothraki) Our host saved us from the Red Waste and you want to steal from him? I will hear no more.
My brother used to say the only thing the Dothraki knew how to do was steal things better men have built.
That's not the kind of queen I'm going to be.
What is the House of the Undying?
He's not my manservant and he's not in love with me. He's my advisor and he's my friend.
And what about what a woman wants?
To cross the Narrow Sea and take back the Iron Throne.
Because I promised my khalasar I'd protect them and find them a safe home.
I want them because they're mine by right. The Iron Throne is mine and I will take it.
And how did you get all of this? Did someone give it to you?
So you wanted more than you had and you took it. You're a conqueror, too. You're just less ambitious.
What do you want, Xaro Xhoan Daxos? At the gates of the city, you bled for me. Why?
And behind the door?
And it can all be mine?
All I have to do?
That was a romantic proposal.
The Seven Kingdoms are at war with one another. Four false kings destroying the country.
The usurper is dead.
The Starks fight the Lannisters, and Baratheons fight each other.
The time to strike is now. We need to find ships and an army or we'll spend the rest of our lives rotting away at the edge of the world.
And if I'd listened to that advice outside the gates of Qarth, we'd all be dead by now.
Do not speak to me like I'm a child.
What do you want? Tell me.
Why?
So what would you have me do, as my advisor?
And how do I get the ship?
I look forward to meeting him.
He shouldn't make me wait.
I already have a husband.
And you are far too smart to think that I will succumb to flattery.
Thank you, my lord. You are a gracious host, but there is no servant alive that can bring me what I want.
My birthright. The Seven Kingdoms of Westeros.
I'm not asking you for the kingdoms. I'm asking you for ships.
Whatever you grant me now will be repaid three times over when I retake the Iron Throne.
My father sat there, before he was murdered.
I didn't come here to argue grammar.
Not yet.
There are many there that support my claim.
I left when I was a baby.
The people will rise to fight for their rightful queen when I return.
Do you know lllyrio Mopatis, Magister of Pentos? Yes, we've met.

For my wedding, he gave me three petrified dragon eggs. He believed The world believed that the ages had turned them to stone. How many centuries has it been since dragons roamed the skies? But I dreamt that if I carried those eggs into a great fire, they would hatch. When I stepped into the fire, my own people thought I was mad. But when the fire burned out, I was unhurt, the Mother of Dragons.
Do you understand? I'm no ordinary woman. My dreams come true.
I am not your little princess. I am Daenerys Stormborn of the blood of Old Valyria, and I will take what is mine. With fire and blood, I will take it.

The Spice King refuses me because I'm a bad investment. The Silk King won't support me because of his business with the Lannisters. Why offend his best customer? And the Copper King offers me a single ship on the condition that I lie with him for a night. Does he think I will whore myself for a boat?
Where are they? Where are my dragons?
You are one of the Thirteen.
Nothing? They're more valuable than anything in the world.
There is no we, so why would you help me get them back?
But it did happen under your roof.
I don't care where you've been.
You came back.
Irri is dead.
She's dead. She died alone. She died for me and I couldn't protect her.
We can't find her. She must be dead, too. I led my people out of the Red Waste and into the slaughterhouse.
You went to find me a ship.
"These people"?

And who is to be trusted? Who are my people? The Targaryens? I only knew one, my brother, and he would have let a thousand men rape me if it had got him the crown. The Dothraki? Most of them turned on me the day that Khal Drogo fell from his horse.
The people in Westeros don't know I'm alive.
And then what? They'll pray for my return? They'll wave dragon banners and shout my name? That's what my brother believed and he was a fool.
You are not your brother.
There it is. "Trust me. " And it's you I should trust, Ser Jorah? Only you? I don't need trust any longer. I don't want it and I don't have room for it.
And you are too familiar.
Find my dragons.
Please, they're my children. I'm begging you.
Without me, the dragons will die.
How?
You have my dragons?
But there is no King of Qarth.
Astapor?
They have my dragons. A mother does not flee without her children.
You should sail to Astapor. I'm sure you'll be safe there.
Then serve me. If my dragons are in the House of the Undying, then take me there.
And what of my magic? You saw me step into the fire. You watched the witch burn. What did the flames do to me? Do you remember?
They are my children. And they are the only children I will ever have. Take me to them.

3.text: Not fast enough. I can't wait that long. I need an army
The greatest slave-soldiers in the world. The distinction means a good deal to some people.
It's too beautiful a day to argue.
Don't mock them. They're the first Dothraki who have ever been on a ship. They followed me across the poison water. If they'll do it, others will. And with a true khalasar ...
They may suit my needs. Tell me of their training.
Tell the good master there is no need.
You take a babe from its mother's arms, kill it as she watches, and pay for her pain with a silver coin?
How many do you have to sell?
8,000 dead babies.
Once I own them, these men ...
Once I own an army of slaves, what will I be?
(to Jorah) The warlocks.
I owe you my life, ser.
You know this man?
Perhaps they didn't want to be conquered.
People learn to love their chains.
No.

(speaking Valyrian) You do not owe me your freedom. I cannot give it to you. Your freedom is not mine to give. It belongs to you and you alone. If you want it back, you must take it for yourselves. Each and every one of you.
What does it mean?
It's all right. These people won't hurt me.
(in Valyrian) Fly.
(in Valyrian) Let me pass
To whom?
Give me your water.
Here, drink.
The blood of my enemies, not the blood of innocents.
Do you disagree, Ser Barristan?
Did you know him well, Ser Barristan?
I wish I had known him. But he was not the last dragon.
They did not. I want to buy them all.
Yes. 8,000. And the ones still in training as well.
I will have them all or take none. Many will fall in battle. I'll need the boys to pick up the swords they drop.
I have dragons. I'll give you one.
One.
One.
Done.
I'll take you as well, now. You'll be Master Kraznys' gift to me. A token of a bargain well struck.
You're both here to advise me. I value your advice, but if you ever question me in front of strangers again, you'll be advising someone else. Is that understood?
Do you have a name?
Do you have a family? A mother and a father you'd return to if you had the choice?
You belong to me now. It is your duty to tell me the truth.
I offered water to one of the slaves dying on the Walk of Punishment. Do you know what he said to me? 'Let me die.'
Is it true what Master Kraznys told me about the Unsullied? About their obedience?
And what about you? You know that I'm taking you to war. You may go hungry. You may fall sick. You may be killed.
Yes, all men must die. But we are not men.
Is it done, then? They belong to me?
(speaks Valyrian) Unsullied!
(speaks Valyrian) Forward march!
(speaks Valyrian) Halt!
(speaks Valyrian) A dragon is not a slave.
(speaks Valyrian) I am Daenerys Stormborn of the House Targaryen, of the blood of Old Valyria. Valyrian is my mother tongue.
(speaks Valyrian) Unsullied! Slay the masters, slay the soldiers, slay every man who holds a whip, but harm no child. Strike the chains off every slave you see!
Dracarys.

(speaks Valyrian) Unsullied! You have been slaves all your life. Today you are free. Any man who wishes to leave may leave, and no one will harm him. I give you my word. Will you fight for me? As free men?
These are the ones?
(speaks Valyrian) You did not choose this life. But you are free men now. And free men make their own choices. Have you selected your own leader from amongst your ranks?
(speaks Valyrian) Remove your helmet
(speaks Valyrian) What is your name?
(speaks Valyrian) Grey Worm.

(speaks Valeryan) From this day forward you will choose your own names. You will tell your fellow soldiers to do the same. Throw away your slave name. Choose the name your parents gave you, or any other. A name that gives you pride.
I don't want half my army killed before I've crossed the Narrow Sea.
How many slaves are there in Yunkai?
Then we have 200,000 reasons to take the city.
(speaks Valyrian) Send a man to the city gates. Tell the slavers I will receive them here, and accept their surrender. Otherwise, Yunkai will suffer the same fate as Astapor. GREY WORM
You may approach. Sit.
Good. My Unsullied need practice. I was told to blood them early.
My ship?
And what do you ask in return?
I have a gift for you as well. Your life.

And the lives of your wise masters. But I also want something in return. You will release every slave in Yunkai. Every man, woman, and child shall be given as much food, clothing, and property as they can carry as payment for their years of servitude. Reject this gift, and I shall show you no mercy.
I did, but my dragons made no promises. And you threatened their mother.
My gold. You gave it to me, remember? And I shall put it to good use. You'd be wise to do the same with my gift to you. Now get out.
And what happens to things that don't bend? He said he had powerful friends. Who was he talking about?
Find out.
You know these men?
Is he more titan or bastard?
How many?
Enough to make a difference?
It's hard to collect wages from a corpse. I'm sure the sellswords prefer to fight for the winning side.
I'd like to talk to the Titan's Bastard about winning.
He will. A man who fights for gold can't afford to lose to a girl.
We have no slaves here.
Give me your Second Sons and I may not have you gelded. Ser Barristan, how many men fight for the Second Sons?
We have more, don't we?
I'm only a young girl, new to the ways of war, but perhaps a seasoned captain like yourself can explain to me how you propose to defeat us.
You're very young to be a captain.
Even if your numbers are right, you must admit the odds don't favor your side.
Or you could fight for me.
I would pay you as much and more.
Ride with me and you'll never need another contract. You'll have gold and castles and lordships of your choosing when I take back the Seven Kingdoms.
A fortnight ago, I had no army. A year ago, I had no dragons. You have two days to decide.
(speaks Valyrian) These men are our guests. (Speaks common.) You seem to be enjoying my wine. Perhaps you'd like a flagon to help you ponder.
A barrel, then.
Ser Barristan, if it comes to battle, kill that one first.
How can anyone speak 19 languages?
Yes, well, it was either learn Dothraki or grunt at my husband and hope-- what do you mean reasonably well?
(in Dothraki) Drogo said I spoke Dothroaki like one born to it. It gave him great pride.
Athjahaka.
Athjahakar.
Well, I suppose I'm a bit out of practice.
What do you want?
Let her go.
You were sent here to kill me?
So why haven't you?
What do your captains have to say about that?
Why?
Over what?
You're a strange man.
And this is supposed to impress me?
Why would I trust a man who murders his comrades?
Will you fight for me?
Swear to me.
Where?
[Speaking to Grey Worm in Valyrian] Lo jention mirre nūmāzme ēza, iderenna qopsa verdagon issa.
[Speaking in the Common Tongue (in this case, English) again] You leave tonight.
We’ve been waiting a long time. [BARRISTAN looks at her] Haven’t we? [BARRISTAN shrugs] Well I don’t know, you tell me. How long does it take to sack a city?
And Daario Naharis?

4.text: Ser Barristan.
Where's Daario Naharis? Where's Grey Worm?
Gambling?
How long have they been at it?
What's the prize to winning this stupid contest?
That honor goes to Ser Jorah and Ser Barristan as neither of them kept me waiting this morning. You two will ride in the rear guard and protect the livestock.
The last man holding his sword can find a new queen to fight for.
Have you ever been to Meereen?
And?
And now an army of former slaves is marching to her gates. You think the Great Masters are worried?
You were told to ride at the back of the train.
All right, what is this matter of strategy?
Would you like to walk at the back of the train instead of riding?
Would you like to walk without shoes?
You are a gambler, aren't you?
How many miles are there between here and Meereen?
You will do no such thing. I will see each and every one of their faces. Remove her collar before you bury her.
You speak it very well.
I hope I can prove worthy of her admiration. What can I do for you?
I have outfitted mess halls to feed all former slaves and barracks to shelter them.
My Unsullied will make them safe again in short order my friend, this I promise you.
What is it that you want from me?
You want to return to a man who owned you, like a goat or a chair?

I did not take this city to preside over the injustice I fought to destroy. I took it to bring people freedom. But freedom means making your own choices. I will allow you to sign a contract with your former master. It may not cover a period lasting longer than a year.
Approach my friend.
What was her name?
How old was she?
Three. *in Valyrian* And still no word on Drogon?
*in Valyrian* Meet me in the catacombs.
Are they attacking?
What is he doing?
I have something to say to the people of Meereen. First, I will need this one to be quiet. Do I have a champion?
(valyrian) You are the commander of the Unsullied. I cannot risk you.
Which is why you must remain by my side.
You are my most trusted advisor, my most valued general, and my dearest friend. I will not gamble with your life.
Very well. You have quite an audience. Make it worth their while.
Yes, win or lose, as long as the whole city is watching.
You sure you don't want a horse?
Horses are faster than men.
(valyrian) I am Daenerys Stormborn.

(valyrian) Your Masters may have told you lies about me, or they may have told you nothing. It does not matter. I have nothing to say to them. Only to you. First I went to Astapor. Those who were slaves in Astapor now stand behind me, free. Next I went to Yunkai. Those who were slaves in Yunkai now stand behind me, free. Now I have come to Meereen. I am not your enemy. Your enemy is beside you.

Your enemy steals and murders your children. Your enemy has nothing for you but chains and suffering and commands. I do not bring commands. I bring you a choice. And I bring your enemies what they deserve. Forward!
Fire!
How are the lessons coming?
You'll have to continue later. It's time.
Remind me, Ser Jorah, how many children did the Great Masters nail to mileposts?
Yes, that was it.
I will answer injustice with justice.
Who told you to take the Navy?
So why did you do it?
How many ships?
How many men can they carry?
Would that be enough to take King's Landing?
Please leave me. Not you, Jorah.
It appears my liberation of Slaver's Bay isn't going quite as planned.
You counseled me against rashness once in Qarth. I didn't listen. That all worked out well.
How can I rule seven kingdoms if I can't control Slaver's Bay? Why should anyone trust me? Why should anyone follow me?
I need to be more than that. I will not let those I have freed slide back into chains. I will not sail for Westeros.
I will do what queens do. I will rule.

(speaking Valyrian) You stand before Daenerys Stormborn of the House Targaryen, the First of Her Name, Queen of Meereen, Queen of the Andals and the First Men, Khaleesi of the Great Sea, Breaker of Chains and Mother of Dragons. Don't be afraid, my friend.
I thank him for his prayers.
Tell this man I am sorry for his hardship. I cannot bring back his goats,
but I will see he is paid their value three times over.
Send the next one in.
(Speaking Valyrian) The noble Hizdahr zo Loraq can speak to me himself.
I thank you.
Then it is my honor to receive you.
For that, he has my gratitude. I should be honored to meet him.
Your father crucified innocent children.
I am sorry you no longer have a father, but my treatment of the masters was no crime. You'd be wise to remember that.
And what traditions do you speak of?
And what of the slave children these noble Meereenese crucified? They were rotting in the sun as well. Would you have begged me for their right to a proper burial?
Bury your father, Hizdahr zo Loraq.
How many more?
Send the next one in.
How did you get in here? Your door is well guarded,
Don't do that again.
These are my private quarters. If I want you here, I will summon you.
Tell me why you're here.
I've ordered the Second Sons to patrol the streets to stop the revenge killing.
And as for women, there are thousands in Meereen you can pursue.
You swore me your sword.
So if I command you to stay in Meereen and patrol the streets?
Very well.
Do what you do best.
Take off your clothes.
You're here early.
You don't approve?
You neither approve nor trust.
Didn't you fight for the Golden Company before pledging your sword to my brother?
I trust you.
I could never have faith in a man like Daario. That's why I've sent him and the Second Sons to retake Yunkai.
I have.

That is why I've ordered Daario to execute every master in Yunkai. The masters tear babies from their mothers' arms. They mutilate little boys by the thousands. They train little girls in the art of pleasuring old men. They treat men like beasts, as you said yourself.
And repay the slavers with what? Kindness? A fine? A stern warning?
Let the priests argue over good and evil. Slavery is real. I can end it. I will end it. And I will end those behind it.
And now you are helping me show them to freedom.
The man who came to me the other day about burying his father.

He will accompany the Second Sons and serve as my ambassador to Yunkai. He will tell the masters what has happened in Meereen. He will explain the choice they have before them. They can live in my new world or they can die in their old one.
Well, go and catch Daario before he leaves. Tell him I changed my mind.
No. Tell him you changed my mind.
You think he was spying on you?
The Dothraki think outsiders are ridiculous taking shame in the naked body. They make love under the stars for the whole Khalasar to see.
But you are not Dothraki.
Well, I don't see why it matters. Grey worm isn't interested, none of the unsullied care what's under our clothes.
What?
When the slavers castrate the boys, do they take all of it?
The...the pillar an the stones.
Haven't you ever wondered?
Why did the usurper pardon you?
No, speak to me here. Explain it to me.
The pardon was signed the year we met. Why were you pardoned? Unless you're saying this document was forged.
Why, then?
What was the content of these letters?
What information?
You told him I was carrying Drogo's child?
Yes or no?
Don't call me that. Did you tell him I was carrying Drogo's child?
That wine merchant tried to poison me because of your information.
Because you knew it was poisoned.
You betrayed me from the first.
You sold my secrets to the man who killed my father and stole my brother's throne...
...and you want me to forgive you?

Love? Love? How can you say that to me? Any other man, and I would have you executed. But you, I do not want you in my city dead or alive. Go back to your masters in King's Landing. Collect your pardon if you can.

Don't ever presume to touch me again or speak my name. You have until dusk to collect your things and leave this city. If you're found in Meereen past break of day, I'll have your head thrown into Slaver's Bay. Go. Now.

5.text: Sons of the Harpy?
They’ve never killed before.
I didn’t conquer them. Their own people did.

Then they will have to learn to see things differently, Mossador. He did not risk his life fighting for freedom so cowards in masks could take it away. And I did not take up residence in this pyramid so I could watch the city below decline into chaos. What was the name of the man you lost?
I want him buried with honor. Publicly. In the Temple of the Graces.
Angry snakes lash out. Makes chopping off their heads that much easier. Find the men who did this and bring them to me.
Good.
Concessions?
I’m not a politician. I’m a queen.
I don’t expect the Wise Masters to be happy. Slavery made them rich, I ended slavery.
The fighting pits? Where slaves fought slaves to the death?
No fighting pits.
I do not respect the tradition of human cockfighting.
How many times must I say no before you understand?
Whatever he wants from me he’s not going to get it. If he really believes I’m going to reopen the fighting pits…
What?
Why?
You were sold into slavery, forced to fight to the death for the amusement of the masters, and you’re defending the fighting pits?
That’s why I have the Unsullied patrolling the streets.
I don’t want another child’s bones dropped at my feet. No one’s seen Drogon in weeks. For all I know he’s flown halfway across the world. I can’t control them anymore.
Viserion? Rhaegal?
Easy. Easy. Easy.
We have to go home.
My poor, sweet thing. Does it hurt? (pause) We have to go home. Drogon? Can you take me back to Meereen?
How far did you carry me? (surveys the area)
Drogon, we need to return. My people need me.
Well, there’s no food. At the very least you can hunt us some supper.
It would send a message.
Why?
Perhaps the only thing that gave him pride was knowing that there was someone lower than he was.
Thank you all for your counsel.
About what?
The Mad King? You're here to remind me of my enemies' lies? Consider me reminded.
Go on.
I'm not my father.
I will not have the Son of the Harpy executed without a fair trial.
Why?
He was our prisoner, awaiting trial. You had no right.
There are no more slaves. There are no more Masters.
The Harpy's life was not yours to take. Once, the Masters were the law--
The law is the law. Take him.
A citizen of Meereen was awaiting trial and this man murdered him. The punishment is death.
Leave me.
Drogon...
Everyone looks happy enough from up here. (Barristan chuckles). What?
Why?
He sang to them?
And what did you do?
He was good?
He told me Rhaegar was good at killing people. (Sits down).
And what did you do with the money?
How many others are there?
Will you be joining us, Ser Barristan?
I think I can protect me from Hizdahr Zo Loraq. Go, Ser Barristan. Sing a song for me.
Is that what you used to tell men before you set them to butchering each other for sport?
I do not recognize this tradition.
"Barristan the Bold" they called him. He crossed a continent to serve me. He was a loyal friend. And he died in an alley, butchered by cowards who hide behind masks.
I prefer your earlier suggestion. Round up the leaders of each of Meereen's great families and bring them to me.
(in Valyrian) Walk forward.
(Valyrian) Another step.

(Valyrian) They will eat you, if I tell them to. They may eat you even if I donâ€™t. Children. Some say I should give up on them. (One of the men is mumbling). But a good mother never gives up on her children. She disciplines them if she must.
(Valyrian) But she does not give up on them.
(Valyrian) Who is innocent? Maybe all of you are, (Looks at Hizdahr), maybe none of you are. Maybe, (Touching Hizdahrâ€™s arm), I should let the dragons decide.
Don't want to overfeed them. Tomorrow perhaps.

If I give everyone what they deserve, I'll have no one left to rule. Ser Barristan counseled mercy when I took this city right up to the morning he died. Daario Naharis thinks I should kill the former Masters and let the rest of the city fend for itself. What do you think?
(Sitting down). You are as fit as anyone I know. You know why I'm here. And you know who will suffer the most if this all falls apart. So what do you think?
What about "Valar Morghulis"?

It takes courage to admit fear. And to admit a mistake. I came here to tell you that I was wrong. I was wrong and you were right. About tradition. About bringing the people of this city together. I will reopen the fighting pits. To free men only. Slavery will never return to Meereen, not while I live.
And in order to forge a lasting bond with the Meereenese people, I will marry the leader of an ancient family. (Hizdahr nods). Thankfully a suitor is already on his knees.
Don’t be ridiculous. My marriage to Hizdahr is political. I think he’s smart enough to understand that.
Are you jealous?
I do.
You told me yourself, I can’t fight enemies within and without. So when enemies from without come knocking, I need the city of Mereen behind me. I have no choice.
So what else can I do?
Even if I wanted to do such an inadviseable thing, I couldn’t.
No. I can’t
Of course
I am a queen. Not a butcher.
Sitting through the great games will be bad enough.
I think I’ve seen enough.
I’ve sacrificed more than enough for your traditions.
Get him out of my sight.
Who are you?
You will not speak. How do I know you are who you say you are?
If you are Tyrion Lannister why shouldn’t I kill you? To pay your family back for what it did to mine
So I should welcome you into my service because you murdered members of your own family?
If you’d rather return to the fighting pits just say the word.
And why are you worth meeting? Why should I spend my time listening to you?
I have a very large army and very large dragons.
So you want to advise me. Very well. (looks to Jorah) What would you have me do with him? I swore I would kill him if he ever returned.
Why should the people trust a queen who can’t keep her promises?
Yes, many opportunities.
No. Not until forced to do so.
So I should kill him?
Remove Ser Jorah from the city.
So have you decided yet? Whether I’m worthy of your service?
It’s probably my safest option.
And what would your father do?
Is that why you killed him?
I know what my father was. What he did. I know the Mad King earned his name.
I’m terrible?
Why did you travel to the other side of the world to meet someone terrible?
Which kind is that?
I did reopen the fighting pits. Under my rule murder will once again become entertainment.
Perhaps it won’t come to that.
Varys? King Robert’s spy master?
Jorah sent my secrets to Varys. For 20 years the spider oversaw the campaign to find and kill me.
But you trust him?
The brother who killed my father.
Perhaps I will have you killed after all.
I’m not going to kill you.
No.
You’re going to advise me. (takes his wine cup) While you can still speak in complete sentences.
How to get what I want.
If I want jokes I’ll get myself a proper fool.
I fought so that no child born into Slaver’s Bay would ever know what it was like to be bought or sold. I will continue that fight here and beyond. But this is not my home.
The common people.
Lannister, Targaryen, Baratheon, Stark, Tyrell. They’re all just spokes on a wheel. This one's on top, then that ones on top and on and on it spins, crushing the people on the ground.
I’m not going to stop the wheel. I’m going to break the wheel.
Where have you been?
I’m not putting my money anywhere.
Has your experience ever involved any actual fighting? You, yourself, have you ever tried to kill a man that was trying to kill you?
That is greatness?
One day your great city will return to the dirt as well.
If need be.
If it comes to that they would have died for a good reason.
Someone else’s reason.
Drogon!
Valahd..

6.text: I am Daenerys Stormborn of the House Targaryen, the First of Her Name, the Unburnt, Queen of Meereen, Queen of the Andals and the Rhoynar of the First Men, Khaleesi of the Great Grass Sea, Breaker of Chains and Mother of Dragons.
I will not lie with you. And I will bear no children, for you, or anyone else. Not until the sun rises in the west, and sets in the east.
I was wife of Khal Drogo, son of Khal Bharbo.
I know. I burnt his body.
If you will escort me back to Meereen, I will see that your khalasar is given a thousand horses, as a sign of my gratitude.
You’re not coming with us.
You’re not going to Westeros. You’re staying here with the Second Sons. There’s finally peace in Meereen. You will keep the peace while the people choose their own leaders.
You promised me. “My sword is yours. My life is yours.” This is what I command. If I’m going to rule in Westeros, I’ll need to make alliances. The best way to make alliances is with marriage.
I don’t know. Maybe no one.
I can’t bring a lover to Westeros.
So that’s what you want? To be my mistress?
I can’t.
No one tells me to do anything.
Don’t get angry.
A great number of women, I imagine. Specific orders will be left for you regarding the welfare of Meereen and the Bay of Dragons.
We can’t call it Slaver’s Bay anymore, can we?
Farewell, Daario Naharis.
No tears.
It’s not.
Yes, you really are.
Do you know what frightens me? I said farewell to a man who loves me. A man I thought I cared for. And I felt nothing. Just impatient to get on with it.
Well, you have completely failed to console me.
It’s your counsel I need.
Good. I, um… I had something made for you. I’m not sure if it’s right.
Tyrion Lannister, I name you Hand of the Queen.
What are you doing?! Take your hands off me! I will have your heads!
You have made a mistake. One you will regret. I am the wife of the Great Khal.
Because I am Daenerys Stormborn, the Breaker of Chains, the Queen of Meereen and the Mother of Dragons. My place is not here with you.
Where else would I go? Every khaleesi becomes Dosh Khaleen.
That is more than most have.
I need to make water.
I will never run from Dothraki.
I needed fresh air. The old women stink.
You must have been very young when your Khal died.
Too bad he didn’t die sooner.
Mm-hmm.
They do. Would you like to see them one day?
No, don’t hurt her.
We will never get out of Vaes Dothrak alive.
No. We can do more than that. And you’re going to help me.
Don’t you want to know what I think?
No. I don’t want either of those things.
I know where I am. I have been here before. This is where the Dosh Khaleen pronounced my child the Stallion Who Mounts the World.

This is where Drogo promised to take his khalasar west to where the world ends. To ride wooden horses across the Black Salt Sea as no khal has done before. He promised to kill the men in their iron suits and tear down their stone houses. He swore to me before the Mother of Mountains.

And here, now, what great matters do the Great Khals discuss? Which little villages you’ll raid, how many girls you’ll get to fuck, how many horses you’ll demand in tribute. You are small men. None of you are fit to lead the Dothraki. But I am. So I will.
You’re not going to serve. You’re going to die.
I banished you twice. You came back twice. And you saved my life. So I can’t take you back and I can’t send you away.
Is there a cure?
How long does it take?
I’m sorry. I’m so sorry.
Do not walk away from your queen, Jorah the Andal.
You have not been dismissed. You pledged yourself to me. You swore to obey my commands for the rest of your life.
Well, I command you to find the cure wherever it is in this world. I command you to heal yourself and then return to me. When I take the Seven Kingdoms, I need you by my side.
How many days’ ride to Meereen?
How many ships will I need to bring my khalasar to Westeros?
And who has that many?
Nobody yet.
I take what is mine.
What was I made for?
Wait here.
Will you kill my enemies in their iron suits and tear down their stone houses?
Will you give me the Seven Kingdoms, the gift Khal Drogo promised me before the Mother of Mountains?
Are you with me?
Now and always?
The city is on the rise?
Good. Shall we begin?
I will crucify the Masters. I will set their fleets afire, kill every last one of their soldiers, and return their cities to the dirt. That is my plan.
You don’t approve?
This is entirely different.
We obviously didn’t communicate clearly. We’re here to discuss your surrender, not mine.
My reign has just begun.
Dracarys.
You’ve brought us 100 ships from the Iron Fleet with men to sail them. In return, I expect you want me to support your claim to the throne of the Iron Islands?
And what’s wrong with you?
Has the Iron Islands ever had a queen before?
Lord Tyrion tells me your father was a terrible king.
We do. And both murdered by a usurper as well.
Will their ships be enough?
So why shouldn’t I wait for him?
And I imagine your offer is free of any marriage demands?
And you don’t want the Seven Kingdoms?
And that’s all?
Reasonable.

She’s not demanding, she’s asking. The others are free to ask as well. Our father were evil men, all of us here. They left the world worse than they found it. We’re not going to do that. We’re going to leave the world better than we found it.
You will support my claim as queen of the Seven Kingdoms and respect the integrity of the Seven Kingdoms. No more reaving, roving, raiding, or raping.
No more.

7.text: Shall we begin?
I wish I could remember it.
I always thought this would be a homecoming. It doesn't feel like home.
Good.
Not so many lions.
They cry out for their true queen? They drink secret toasts to my health?
People used to tell my brother that sort of thing, and he was stupid enough to believe them.
If Viserys had three dragons and an army at his back, he'd have invaded King's Landing already.
No.
I never properly thanked you for that.
You served my father, didn't you, Lord Varys?
And then you served the man who overthrew him?
But you didn't serve him long. You turned against him.
So you took it upon yourself to find a better one.

Before I came to power, you favored my brother. All your spies, your little birds, did they tell you Viserys was cruel, stupid, and weak? Would those qualities have made for a good king in your learned opinion?
So you and your friends traded me like a prized horse to the Dothraki.
Who gave the order to kill me?
Who hired the assassins?
Who sent word to Essos to murder Daenerys Targaryen?
To keep yourself alive.
Proven himself loyal? Quite the opposite. If he dislikes one monarch, he conspires to crown the next one. What king of a servant is that?
Swear this to me, Varys. If you ever think I'm failing the people, you won't conspire behind my back. You'll look me in the eye as you have done today, and you'll tell me how I'm failing them.
And I swear this--if you ever betray me, I'll burn you alive.
The Red Priests helped bring peace to Meereen. You are very welcome here. What is your name?
You chose an auspicious day to arrive at Dragonstone.
We've just decided to pardon those who served the wrong king.
The Lord of Light doesn't have many followers in Westeros, does he?
What does your Lord expect from me?
The prince who was promised will bring the dawn. I'm afraid I'm not a prince.
No, but I like it better.
And you believe this prophecy refers to me?
You know him?
He sounds like quite a man.
Very well. Send a raven north. Tell Jon Snow that his Queen invites him to come to Drangonstone...and bend the knee.
That's enough. Tyrion is the Hand of the Queen. You will treat him with respect.
I am not here to be queen of the ashes.
I'm grateful to you, Lady Olenna, for your council. I'm grateful to all of you. But you have chosen to follow me. I will not attack King's Landing. We will not attack King's Landing.
We will lay siege to the capital surrounding the city on all sides. Cersei will have the Iron Throne but no food for her army or the people.
Do I have your support?
Thank you all. Lady Olenna, may I speak with you alone?
I realize you're here out of hatred for Cersei and not love for me. But I swear to you she will pay for what she's done and we will bring peace back to Westeros.
Thank you for traveling so far, My Lords. I hope the seas weren't too rough.
Forgive me --

Forgive me, Ser Davos. I never did receive a formal education, but I could have sworn the last King in the North was Torren Stark who bent the knee to my ancestor Aegon Targaryen in exchange for his life and the lives of the northmen. Torren Stark swore fealty to House Targaryen in perpetuity. But do I have my facts wrong?
No. Of course not. But still, an oath is an oath. In perpetuity means -- what does perpetuity mean, Lord Tyrion?
Forever. So I assume, My Lord, that you're here to bend the knee.
Oh. Well, that is unfortunate. You've travelled all this way to break faith with House Targaryen?

My father was an evil man. On behalf of House Targaryen I ask your forgiveness for the crimes he committed against your family. And I ask you not to judge a daughter by the sins of her father. Our two houses were allies for centuries. Those were the best centuries the kingdom's ever known. Centuries of peace and prosperity with the Targaryens sitting on the Iron Throne and a Stark serving as Warden of the North. I am the last Targaryen, Jon Snow. Honor the pledge your ancestor made to mine. Bend the knee and I will name you Warden of the North. Together we will save this country from those who would destroy it.
Then why are you here?
Did you see three dragons flying overhead when you arrived?
And did you see the Dothraki, all of whom have sworn to kill for me?
But still, I need your help?
Still, that doesn't explain why I need your help.
You told me you liked this man.
In the time since he's met me he's refused to call me queen, he's refused to bow and now he's calling me a child.
As far as I can see, you are the enemy to the north.
The dead?
Is that another figure of speech?
I was born at Dragonstone. Not that I can remember it.

We fled before Robert's assassins could find us. Robert was your father's best friend, no? I wonder if your father knew his best friend sent assassins to murder a baby girl in her crib. Not that it matters now of course. I spent my life in foreign lands. So many men have tried to kill me. I don't remember all of their names. I have been sold like a brood mare. I have been chained and betrayed, raped and defiled. Do you know what kept me standing through all those years in exile? Faith. Not in any gods. Not in myths and legends. In myself. In Daenerys Targaryen. The world hadn't seen a dragon in centuries until my children were born. The Dothraki hadn't crossed the sea. Any sea.
They did for me. I was born to rule the Seven Kingdoms. And I will.
That's fair. It's also fair to point out that I'm the rightful queen of the Seven Kingdoms. By declaring yourself king of the northern most kingdom, you are in open rebellion.
You must forgive my manners. You will both be tired after your long journey. We'll have baths drawn for you and supper sent to your rooms.
Not yet.
And?
All of them?
Dragonglass?
Why are we talking about glass? We just lost two of our allies.
And what does the King in the North want with Dragonglass?
And what do you think of this Army of the Dead and White Walkers and Night Kings?
Which wise man said this?
Are you trying to present your own statements as ancient wisdom?
What was that Ser Davos said about taking a knife in the heart for his people? Did you notice that?
I named them for my brothers Vicerys and Rhaegon. They're both gone now.
You lost two brothers as well?
People thought dragons were gone forever but here they are. Perhaps we should all be examining what we think we know.
He is my Hand.
We all enjoy what we're good at.
You know I'm not going to let Cersei stay on the Iron Throne.
And I haven't changed my mind about which kingdoms belong to the throne.
I will allow you to mine the Dragonglass and forge weapons from it. Any resources or men you need I will provide for you.
You better get to work, Jon Snow.
We need to find Euron Greyjoy's fleet and sink it.
I'm not talking about sending our ships after him.
I wouldn't be alone. I'd have Drogon, Vicerion and Rhaegal. What can anyone do to them?
What about Casterly Rock?
Soon. They will come back to me.
What happened?
Many things?
It's all right.
When?
They were right here standing where we're standing before there were Targaryens or Starks or Lannisters. Maybe even before there were men.
Doing what? Fighting each other?
They fought together against their common enemy. Despite their differences, despite their suspicions, together. We need to do the same if we're going to survive.
And you say you can't defeat them without my armies and my dragons?
I will fight for you. I will fight for the north...when you bend the knee.
They will if their king does. They chose you to lead them. They chose you to protect them. Isn't their survival more important than your pride?
What is it?
That's very good to hear.
Isn't it?
You will stay. All my allies are gone. They've been taken from me while I've been sitting here on this island.
Who won't be able to eat because Cersei has taken all the food from the Reach.
The right plan? Your strategy has lost us Dorne, the Iron Islands and the Reach.
Our enemies? Your family, you mean. Perhaps you don't want to hurt them after all.
Enough with the clever plans.
I have three large dragons. I'm going to fly them to the Red Keep.
My enemies are in the Red Keep. What kind of a queen am I if I'm not willing to risk my life to fight them?
What do you think I should do?
I'm at war. I'm losing.
What do you think I should do?
Dracarys!
Dracarys!
I know what Cersei has told you, that I've come to destroy your cities --

-- burn down your homes, murder you and orphan your children. That's Cersei Lannister, not me. I'm not here to murder. And all I want to destroy is the wheel that is rolled over rich and poor to the benefit of no one but the Cersei Lannisters of the world. I offer you a choice. Bend the knee and join me. Together we will leave the world a better place than we found it, or refuse and die.
Step forward, My Lord.
You will not kneel?
You will not trade your honor for your life. I respect that.
Who are you?
I meant what I said. I'm not here to put men in chains. If that becomes an option many will take it. I gave them a choice. They made it.
I'm not beheading anyone.
Lord Randyll Tarley, Dickon Tarley, I, Daenerys of House Targaryen, First of my name, Breaker of Chains and Mother of Dragons, sentence you to die.
Dracarys.
They're beautiful, aren't they?
They're not beasts to me. No matter how big they get, how terrifying to everyone else, they're my children.
No.
And I have fewer enemies today than I did yesterday.
You're not sure how you feel about that?
How many men did your army kill taking Winterfell back from the Boltons?
We both want to help people. We can only help them from a position of strength. Sometimes strength is terrible. When you first came here Ser Davos said you took a knife in the heart for your people.
So it was a figure of speech?
He is my friend.
Jon Snow, this is Ser Jorah Mormont, an old friend.
You look strong. You found a cure?
It would be my honor.
I'm happy for you. You don't look happy.
You said you don't have enough men.
And give the country to Cersei? As soon as I march away she marches in.
I thought that was what we are trying to avoid.
And how would you get into King's Landing.
Well, it will all be for nothing if we don't have one of these dead men.
I haven't given you permission to leave.
We should be better at saying farewell by now.
But I've grown used to him.
Do you know what I like about you?
You're not a hero.
I don't want you to be a hero. Heroes do stupid things and they die. Drogo, Jorah, Dario, even this Jon Snow, they all try to outdo each other of who can do the stupidist, bravest thing.
Jon Snow's not in love with me.
My apologies.
Yes. That's all.
Your capital will be safe until the northern threat is dealt with. You have my word.
I didn't believe it until I saw them. I saw them all.
A hundred thousand, at least.
Just the King
I'm grateful for your loyalty, but my dragon died so that we could be here. If it's all for nothing, then he died for nothing.
I didn't come all this way to have my Hand
(Nods)
I know. I respect what you did. Wish you hadn't done it, but I respect it.

This place was the beginning of the end for my family. (Speaks Valerian.) A dragon is not a slave. They were terrifying. Extraordinary.
