They filled people with wonder and awe, and we locked them in here. They wasted away. They grew small. And we grew small as well. We weren't extraordinary without them. We were just like everyone else.
I can't have children.
The witch who murdered my husband.
You were right from the beginning. If I had trusted you, everything would be different.
I can't forget what I saw north of the Wall. And I can't pretend that Cersei won't take back half the country the moment I march north.
(Laughs)
And the Unsullied? We can sail with them to White Harbor, meet the Dothraki here on the kingsroad, then ride together to Winterfell.
I've not come to conquer the North. I'm coming to save the North. We sail together.

8.text: Thank you for inviting us into your home, Lady Stark. The North is as beautiful as your brother claimed, as are you.
Whatever they want.
Your sister doesn't like me.
She doesn't need to be my friend but I am her queen. If she can't respect me-
The dragons are barely eating.
They don't like the North.
Go on.
Nobody does. Until they ride a dragon.
Then I've enjoyed your company, Jon Snow.
Whatever you can.
We could stay a thousand years-
No one would find us.
So keep your queen warm.
Don't be afraid.
So you're the man?
The one who saved Ser Jorah when no one else could.
I'll have to make some changes in the Citadel when I take my throne. A great service merits a great reward.
Well, there must be something I could give you.
For what crime?
From the Citadel?
Not Randyll Tarly?
I offered to let him retain his lands and titles if he bent the knee. He refused.
Your brother stood with your father.
Of course.
When I was a child, my brother would tell me a bedtime story about the man who murdered our father.
Who stabbed him in the back and cut his throat. Who sat down on the Iron Throne and watched as his blood poured onto the floor.
He told me other stories as well. About all the things we would do to that man once we took back the Seven Kingdoms and had him in our grasp.
Your sister pledged to send her army north.
I don't see an army. I see one man, with one hand. It appears your sister lied to me.
"We"?
Like you knew your sister?
Perhaps he trusts his little brother to defend him, right up to the moment he slits my throat.
So why have you abandoned your house and family now?
What does the Warden of the North say about it?
Very well.
Either you knew Cersei was lying and let me believe otherwise, or you didn't know at all. Which makes you either a traitor or a fool.
Not for the first time.
Cersei still sits on the throne. If you can't help me take it back, I'll find another Hand who can.
Have you done something to offend me?
Long ago and long forgiven.
When I named him Hand, I didn't know if I'd ever see you again.
I wasn't under the impression you liked him very much.
He's made mistakes. Serious mistakes.
You're advising me to forgive the man who stole your position?
Lady Sansa, I was hoping we could speak alone.
I thought you and I were on the verge of agreement before. About Ser Jaime.
I wish I could have that kind of faith in my advisors.
I didn't ask him to be my Hand simply because he was good.
I asked him to be my Hand because he was good, and intelligent, and ruthless when he had to be. He never should have trusted Cersei.
I thought he knew his sister.
Ours certainly have been.
We have other things in common. We've both known what it means to lead people who aren't inclined to accept a woman's rule. And we've both done a damn good job of it, from what I can tell.
And yet, I can't help but feel we're at odds with one another. Why is that? Your brother.
That bothers you.
All my life, I've known one goal
I'm here because I love your brother and I trust him, and I know he's true to his word. He's only the second man in my life I can say that about.
Someone taller.
I take the Iron Throne.
What is it?
Your sister?
But why aren't you with her?
Ser Davos is perfectly capable of waving a torch on his own. You'll be in the crypt.
There are thousands of them and only one of you. You can't fight as well as they can, but you can think better than any of them. You're here because of your mind. If we survive, I'll need it.
Who's that?
My brother, Rhaegar, everyone told me he was decent and kind. He liked to sing. Gave money to poor children. And he raped her.
That's impossible.
Who told you this?
He saw it?
A secret no one in the world knew except your brother and your best friend. Doesn't seem strange to you?
If it were true, it would make you the last male heir of House Targaryen. You'd have a claim to the Iron Throne.
Gendry.
THAT'S right, isn't it?
Youâ€™re Robert Baratheonâ€™s son.
You are aware he took my family's throne and tried to have me murdered?
Yes, he's dead. His brothers are too. So who's Lord of Storm's End now?
Does anyone?
I think you should be Lord of Storm's End.
No, you are Lord Gendry Baratheon of Storm's End, the lawful son of Robert Baratheon. Because that is what I have made you.
See? You're not the only one who's clever.
To Arya Stark, the hero of Winterfell!
Are you drunk?
He loved me. And I couldn't love him back. Not the way he wanted. Not the way I love you.
Is that all right?
I wish you'd never told me. If I didn't know, I'd be happy right now.

I try to forget. Tonight I did for a while, and then I saw them gathered around you. I saw the way they looked at you. I know that look. So many people have looked at me that way, but never here. Never on this side of the sea.
(angrily) It doesn't matter what you want. You didn't want to be King in the North. What happens when they demand you press your claim, and take what is mine?

(desperately)You can say nothing. To anyone, ever. Never tell them who you really are. Swear your brother and Samwell Tarly to secrecy, and tell no one else. Or it will take on a life of its own and you won't be able to control it or what it does to people. No matter how many times you bend the knee, no matter what you swear.
I want it to be the way it was between us.
Sansa will want to see me gone and you on the Iron Throne.
She's not the girl you grew up with. Not after what she's seen, not after what they've done to her.
Even if the truth destroys us?
It will. I've never begged for anything but I'm begging you. Don't do this. Please.
We can. I've just told you how.
Cersei will make sure they don't believe it. We will hit her hard. We will rip her out root and stem.
No matter how many lords turn against her, as long as she sits on the Iron Throne, she can call herself Queen of the Seven Kingdoms. We need the capital.
All right.
How long do you suggest?
I came north to fight alongside you at great cost to my armies and myself. Now that the time has come to reciprocate, you want to postpone.
THE longer I leave my enemies alone, the stronger they become.
We have won the Great War. Now we will win the Last War. In all Seven Kingdoms, men will live without fear and cruelty under their rightful queen.
You saw my child fall from the sky.
They took Missandei.
Do you believe we're here for a reason, Lord Varys? I'm here to free the world from tyrants. That is my destiny and I will serve it, no matter the cost.

Speaking to Cersei will not prevent a slaughter. But perhaps it's good the people see that Daenerys Stormborn made every effort to avoid bloodshed, and Cersei Lannister refused. They should know whom to blame when the sky falls down upon them.
(in Dothraki) Blood of my blood.
You kept all your promises to me. You killed my enemies in their iron suits.
Your tore down their stone houses. You gave me the Seven Kingdoms.
Torgo Nudho.
(in Valyrian) You have walked beside me since the Plaza of Pride. You are the bravest of men, the most loyal of soldiers. I name you commander of all my forces, the Queen's Master of War.
(in Valyrian) Unsullied. All of you were torn from your mother's arms and raised as slaves. Now you are liberators. You have freed the people of King's Landing from the grip of a tyrant!
(in Valyrian) But the war is not over. We will not lay down our spears until we have liberated all the people of the world!
(in Valyrian) From Winterfell to Dorne, from Lannisport to Qarth, from the Summer Isles to the Jade Sea! Women, men and children have suffered too long beneath the wheel.
(in Valyrian) Will you break the wheel with me?
You freed your brother. You committed treason.
(In Valyrian) Take him.

When I was a girl, my brother told me it was made with 1000 swords from Aegon's fallen enemies. What do 1000 swords look like in the mind of a little girl who can't count to 20? I imagined a mountain of swords too high to climb. So many fallen enemies, you could only see the soles of Aegon's feet.
It was necessary.
I tried to make peace with Cersei. She used their innocence as a weapon against me. She thought it would cripple me.
He conspired behind my back with my enemies. How have you treated people who've done the same to you, even when it broke your heart?
I can't.
We can't hide behind small mercies. The world we need won't be built by men loyal to the world we have.
And it will be. It's not easy to see something that's never been before. A good world.
Because I know what is good. And so do you.
You do. You do. You've always known.
They don't get to choose.

Be with me. Build the new world with me. This is our reason. It has been from the beginning, since you were a little boy with a bastard's name and I was a little girl who couldn't count to 20. We do it together. We break the wheel together.

1.text: A small gift for the new Khaleesi. Songs and histories from the Seven Kingdoms.
Ser Jorah Mormont of Bear Island. I served your father for many years. Gods be good, I hope to always serve the rightful king.
There is no word for ‘thank you’ in Dothraki.
Gently, gently.
The boy did not live.
What is there to tell?
He never lived, my princess. The women say –
They say the child was –
Time enough for that later –
A khal who cannot ride is no khal. The Dothraki follow only the strong. l'm sorry, my Princess.
He seems to like the warmth, Princess.
l don't want you alone with this sorceress.
Drogo will have no use for dragon eggs in the Night Lands. Sell them. You can return to the Free Cities and live as a wealthy woman for all your days.
Khaleesi, my Queen, l vow to serve you, obey you, to die for you if need be, but let him go, Khaleesi. l know what you intend. Do not.
Don't ask me to stand aside as you climb on that pyre. l won't watch you burn.
(bowing) Blood of my blood.
You need to drink, child... And eat.
The Dothraki have two things in abundance
We're still not far from Pentos, your Grace. Magister Illyrio has extended his hospitality. You'd be more comfortable there.
As you wish, your Grace.
Selling to one... Some poachers I caught on my land.
The Dothraki don't believe in money. Most of their slaves were given to them as gifts.
If you rule a city and you see the horde approaching, you have two choices
You want the entire horde to stop? For how long?
You're learning to talk like a Queen.
Shall we return to the Khalasar, Khaleesi?

For a man on horseback, the curved blade is a good thing, easier to handle. It's a good weapon for a Dothrakan. But a man in full plate... the arakh won't get through the steel. That's where the broadsword has the advantage. Designed for piercing plate.
Armor.
Slow.
It's true, but it also keeps a man alive.
I’ve heard that your father was a famous warrior.
He still is. A man of great honor. And I betrayed him.
I don't think she wants to eat dog.
I'll have the boys butcher a goat for supper. I need to ride to Qohor.
Don't worry. I'll catch you. The horde's easy to find.
Vaes Dothrak. The city of the horselords.
The Dothraki have never crossed the Narrow Sea. They fear any water their horses can't drink.
King Robert is fool enough to meet them in open battle, but the men advising him are different.
I fought beside them once, long ago. Now Ned Stark wants my head. He drove me from my land.
Aye.
I had no money and an expensive wife.
In another place, with another man.
Your brother Rhaegar was the last dragon. Viserys is less than the shadow of a snake.
The truth now
The common people pray for rain, health and a summer that never ends. They don't care what games the high Lords play.
Home.
She’s doing well.
“The prince is riding. I have heard the thunder of the hooves. Swift as the wind he rides. His enemies will cower before him… and their wives will weep tears of blood.”
She’s going to have a boy.
She truly is a queen today.
Don’t let them see you carrying a sword in Vaes Dothrak. You know the law.
They don’t belong to you.
Once, perhaps.
And you have all three.
You can go, but you can’t have the eggs.
It means everything to me.
And here I stand.
Come.
Khal Drogo says there is a place for you. Back there.
Put the sword down. They’ll kill us all.
Look away Khaleesi.
Khaleesi…
The Dothraki do things in their own time, for their own reasons.
Forgive me, Khaleesi, but your ancestor Aegon the Conqueror didn't seize six of the kingdoms because they were his right.
Ah well, having a few dragons makes things easier.
Have you ever seen a dragon, Khaleesi? I believe what my eyes and ears report.
No no, don't trouble yourself. Enjoy the market. I'll rejoin you soon enough.
Rakharo.
Put down that cask.
I have a thirst. Open it.
Open it.
Pour.
You first.
Come.
Gold to hire ships, Princess. Ships to sail to Westeros.
Khaleesi?
These men have shed blood for their Khal.
Princess, you have a gentle heart, but this is how it's always been.
Come.
What do you want done with them?
You cannot claim them all, Princess.
Khaleesi.
He will die tonight, Khaleesi.
Even a queen doesn't have that power. We must go quickly. l've heard there's a good port in Asshai.
He's already gone, Khaleesi.

This isn't Westeros, where men honor blood. Here they only honor strength. There will be fighting after Drogo dies. Whoever wins that fight will be the new khal. He won't want any rivals. Your boy will be plucked from your breast and given to the dogs.
(in Dothraki) Rein in your tongue. She is still your Khaleesi.
l think you're right.
(in Dothraki) No further, horselord.
Are you hurt?
Hmm?
Fetch the midwives.
They'll come or l'll have their heads.

2.text: I remember.
A trick I never learned, I'm afraid.
This is further east than I've ever been. But, yes, Khaleesi, everything ends, even the red waste.
If we go south to the land of the Lazarheen, the Lamb Men will kill us and take your dragons. If we go west to the Dothraki Sea, the first Khalasar we meet will kill us and take your dragons.
They are too weak to fight, as are your people. You must be their strength.
No guards. The warlocks kill with sorcery, not steel.
Khaleesi! Khaleesi!
It's all a lie.
Aye, a small ship.
(dothraki) Take all the gold and jewels.
Everything ends, even the red waste.
Khaleesi.
You don't need to see this.
Khal Pono perhaps, Khal Jhaqo They don't like the idea of a woman leading a Khalasaar.
Only that the desert around their walls is called the Garden of Bones. Every time the Qartheen shut their gates on a traveler, the garden grows.
If you heard a Dothraki horde was approaching your city, you might do the same, Khaleesi.
Khaleesi, please be careful.
(speakss Dothraki)
Malakko says the statue is too heavy to carry. Kovarro says that Malakko is an idiot. They can pry out the gems, the rest is pure gold. Very soft. He can chop off as much as we can carry.
It's not the only thing. They're quite good at killing the better men.
Do I know you?
Who are you?
If you cross the sea with an army you bought and a foreign husband who paid for it . . .
To win Westeros, you need support from Westeros.
(laughs)
According to your new friend who earned your trust by cutting his hand?
Rich men do not become rich by giving more than they get. They'll give you ships and soldiers and they'll own you forever. Moving carefully is the hard way, but it's the right way.
I know the opportunity before you seems like the last you'll ever have, - but you must
I only want
To see you on the Iron Throne.

You have a good claim. A title. A birthright. But you have something more than that. You may cover it up and deny it, but you have a gentle heart. You would not only be respected and feared, you would be loved. Someone who can rule and should rule. Centuries come and go without a person like that coming into the world. There are times when I look at you and I still can't believe you're real.
Make your own way. Find your own ship. You only need one. The allies we need are in Westeros, not Qarth.
I'll find it for you. A sound ship with a good captain.
Khaleesi.
As soon as I heard. Do you know anything?
I know. She was a good
Doreah?
I should have been here.
My place is by your side. I shouldn't have left you alone with these people.
They are not to be trusted.
Your people are in Westeros.
They will soon enough.
Trust me, Khaleesi.
You are too young to be so
Forgive me, Khaleesi. No one can survive in this world without help. No one. Let me help you, please. Tell me how.
I didn't come here for lessons.
You have them? Where are they?
Where are the dragons?
Never.
Careful, Khaleesi. Xaro owns this city and the warlocks have a thousand eyes watching for you. I found one. A ship with a good captain. She leaves for Astapor tomorrow.
We cannot stay here.

They're not your children. I know they call you the Mother of Dragons and I know you love them, but you didn't grow them in your womb. They didn't suckle at your breast. They are dragons, Khaleesi. And if we stay in Qarth, we'll die.
You know I would die for you. I will never abandon you. I'm sworn to protect you, to serve.
That's what the warlock wants. He told you so himself. If you enter that place, you will never leave again. His magic is strong.
Until my last breath, I will remember. After I have forgotten my mother's face.
(nods)

3.text: They're growing fast.
We'll be in Astapor by nightfall. Some say the Unsullied are the greatest soldiers in the world.
Do those people have any better ideas about how to put you on the Iron Throne?
You're right. Another lovely day on the high seas.
The Dothraki follow strength above all, khaleesi. You'll have a true khalasar when you prove yourself strong. And not before.
Even the bravest men fear death.
The Unsullied are a means to an end.
They're not men. Not anymore.
Do you think these slaves will have better lives serving Kraznys and men like him or serving you?
You'll be fair to them. You won't mutilate them to make a point.
You won't order them to murder babies. You'll see they're properly fed and sheltered. A great injustice has been done to them. Closing your eyes will not undo it.
(Nods.) I know him as one of the greatest fighters the Seven Kingdoms has ever seen and as the Lord Commander of Robert Baratheon's Kingsguard.
You didn't conquer them. You liberated them.
Khaleesi, this man has been sentenced to death.
And what is she to do for soldiers?
Is it 'we' already, Ser Barristan? If you want to sit on the throne your ancestors built, you must win it. That will mean blood on your hands before the thing is done.
How many wars have you fought in, Ser Barristan?
Have you ever seen a war where innocents didn't die by the thousands?

I was in King's Landing after the sack, khaleesi. You know what I saw? Butchery. Babies, children, old men. More women raped than you can count. There's a beast in every man and it stirs when you put a sword in his hand. But the Unsullied are not men. They do not rape. They do not put cities to the sword unless they're ordered to do so. If you buy them, the only men they'll kill are those you want dead.
Rhaegar fought valiantly, Rhaegar fought nobly, and Rhaegar died.
Khaleesi, please.
Khaleesi, a dragon is worth more than any army.
It was a bitch of a siege.
The second. Thoros of Myr went in alone, waving that flaming sword of his.

Proudest moment of my life. One knee in the dust, the king's sword on my shoulder, listening to the words. 'In the name of the Warrior, I charge you to be brave.' All I could think of was how badly I had to piss.
In full plate metal for 16 hours. Never occurred to me till the fighting was over. I was very nearly the first man knighted to piss on the king's boots.
You swore an oath.
With all my heart.
King Robert wanted her dead.
I suppose no one on the small council could speak sense to him.
No? Doesn't the Lord of the Kingsguard traditionally--
Yeah, I imagine I would, too. Hours spent jabbering about backstabbings - and betrayals the world over.
Still, she'll have to wade through that muck if she wants to rule the Seven Kingdoms.
Which men do you have in mind?
It suffered for a reason. I sold men into slavery.
Our cause? Forgive me, Ser Barristan, but I was busy defending the khaleesi against King Robert's assassins while you were still bowing to the man.
You only joined us a few days ago. I can't speak to your intentions.
You're not Lord here. You're just another exile. And I take my orders from the queen.
Yunkai. The Yellow City.
On the field, with ease. But they won't meet us on the field. They have provisions, patience, and strong walls. If they're wise, they'll hide behind those walls and chip away at us, man by man.
We don't need Yunkai, khaleesi. Taking this city will not bring you any closer to Westeros or the Iron Throne.
200,000 if not more.
I don't know.
They can be trusted to kill you if they're well paid. The Yunkish are paying them well.
Only by the broken swords on their banners. They're called the Second Sons. A company led by a Braavosi named Mero, "The Titan's Bastard."
He's a dangerous man, khaleesi. They all are.
I imagine you're right.
He may not agree to meet.
Mind your tongue.
The Second Sons have faced worse odds and run.
Your men but not you?

Or perhaps you'll lead Grey Worm and me to the slaughter, cutting the head off our army. The masters of Yunkai will pay you your fee and you won't have to split it three ways cause you've already slaughtered your partners.
You command the Unsullied. What do you think?
Very good. We'll prepare.
You're the Queensguard, Ser Barristan. Your place is by the Queen. If we are truly her loyal servants, we'll do whatever needs to be done. No matter the cost, no matter our pride.
There may be others.
[Addressing DAARIO] That’s what you call a few guards?
[Looks at DAENERYS] It was just as you said. They did not believe until it was too late. Their slave soldiers threw down their spears and surrendered.

4.text: They're dragons, Khaleesi. They can never be tamed. Not even by their mother.
There's one on every mile marker between here and Meereen.
A single rider. A champion of Meereen. They want you to send your own champion against him.
They're not meaningless if half the city you intend to take is listening to them.
I've been by your side longer than any of them, Khaleesi. Let me stand for you today as well.
163, Khaleesi.
King Joffrey Baratheon is dead. Murdered at his own wedding.
The Lannisters have more.
It's hard to say. It could be enough. But we're not fighting to make you queen of King's Landing. 10,000 men can't conquer Westeros.
The old houses will flock to whichever side they think will win, as they always have.

There's other news. From Yunkai. Without the Unsullied to enforce your rule, the Wise Masters have retaken control of the city. They've reenslaved the freedmen who stayed behind and sworn to take revenge against you. And in Astapor, the council you installed to rule over the city has been overthrown by a butcher named Cleon who's declared himself "His Imperial Majesty."
You could sail for Westeros and leave it all behind. A boy sits on the Iron Throne. A boy many believe to be a bastard with no right to it. They've never been more vulnerable.
(CHUCKLES)
You're a Targaryen. You're the Mother of Dragons.
What, then?
Khaleesi.
Later than some.
It's not a question of approval, it's a question of trust.
Why would I? The man's a sellsword.
I did.
Daario Naharis killed his captains and dumped their heads at your feet when he grew tired of their commands. How could you ever have faith in a man like that?
You have?
Without you there to rule, Khaleesi, I fear the masters will simply bide their time, wait for the invaders to leave and reassert control.

Herding the masters into pens and slaughtering them by the thousands is also treating men like beasts. The slaves you freed, brutality is all they've ever known. If you want them to know something else, you'll have to show it to them.
It's tempting to see your enemies as evil, all of them, but there's good and evil on both sides in every war ever fought.
I sold men into slavery, Khaleesi.
I wouldn't be here to help you if Ned Stark had done to me what you want to do to the masters of Yunkai.
Hizdahr zo Loraq?
(Nods.)
Yes, Khaleesi.
Ser Barristan.
Have I forgotten a council meeting?
What's this?
Who gave you this?
Have you told her?
Let me speak with her in private.
If we could speak alone.
Who do you think sent this to Meereen? Who profits? This is the work of Tywin Lannister. He wants to divide us. If we're fighting each other, we're not fighting him.
It is not forged.
I sent letters to Varys, the spymaster of King's Landing.
Information.
When you and Viserys arrived in Pentos. His plan to marry you to Khal Drogo. When you were married. When your brother died.
Khaleesi.
Yes.
I stopped you from drinking his wine.
I suspected.
Forgive me. I never meant...please, Khaleesi, forgive me.
I have protected you. Fought for you. Killed for you.
I have loved you.
Daenerys, please.

5.text: Torgo Nudho.
None of that matters now. The longer we sit here bantering the longer Daenerys is out there in the wilderness.
We? You’re a Lannister. The Queen intends to remove your family from power.
You’ve been here for how many days now? I’ve fought for her for years. Since she was little more than a child.
Careful now.
The second time thanks to you.
If I ever kill you your eyes will be wide open.
He’s a foreign dwarf that barely speaks the language. Why would the Meereenese listen to him?
I'm taking you to the Queen.
Your captor.
No.
Then stay awake.
I'm not taking you to your sister.
I am. Queen Daenerys Targaryen. She's the Queen I serve.
What business would you have with the Queen?
We are.
No wine.
I am.
No.
I think you'll be plenty.
No. But the pirates are.
And then they weren't.
"The city of a thousand years, and all that men had learned; The Doom consumed it all alike, and neither of them turned."
Stone Men! Don't let them touch you!
Get behind!
(Faintly). Tyrion? Tyrion. Tyrion. Tyrion. You're all right.
You're heavier than you look. Did any of them touch you?
I suppose that's why they send them there.
We walk, up the coast. With luck, we'll find a fishing village. Maybe another boat.
We've got a long walk ahead of us. I'll get some wood for a fire. Try to get some rest, huh?
I can.
Of course I’m hungry.
I am not your travelling companion.
Do you ever shut up?
Why?
I’m sure you’ve visited many brothels in many cities.
What do you know about my father?
How?
How?
We better keep moving.
Do you believe in anything?
In something greater than ourselves, I mean. The Gods. Destiny. Do you believe there's a plan for this world?

Neither did I. I was a cynic, just like you. Then I saw a girl step into a great fire with three stone eggs. When the fire burned out I thought I’d find her blackened bones. Instead I found her. Daenerys. Alive and unhurt. Holding her baby dragons. Have you ever heard baby dragons singing?
It's hard to be a cynic after that.
No it doesn’t.
First we have to conquer the world.
Then she rules.
She is the rightful heir.
Shh! It’s a slave ship
They probably came ashore for--
Queen Daenerys has outlawed slavery.
I killed a Dothraki blood rider in single combat.
It’s no lie. His name was Qotho. He was bloodrider to Khal Drogo. Take me to Slaver’s Bay, put a sword in my hand, I’ll prove my worth.
Khaleesi, please, I just need a moment of your time. I brought you a gift.
Your Grace, I want to say--
You said whoever wins would fight at the Great Pit in front of the queen. I won.
I’ve been flogged if it makes you happy. I’m the best you’ve got. If I win at the Great Pit how much can you sell me for?
Let me fight for her and I belong to you.
I fight and die for your glory, oh glorious Queen.
This way!

6.text: Ram.
Don’t know anything else that can melt a ram’s horn.
She’s too smart to like it.
I’ve been all over the world. There’s no escaping men like us.
You know why.
Of course it is.
If you grow old.
So do I.
Not an army. A horde.
They have her.
I’m fine.
What?
Makes me sad. You’ll disappoint her before long. She’ll move on.
We need each other right now. After we’re done needing each other --
You didn’t get much discipline as a child, did you?
The road running through the Horse Gate, they call that the godsway.

Eastern Market, Western Market. When Khal Drogo died, she was supposed to come here and join the Dosh Khaleen, the widows of the dead khals. That’s where they would have taken her, the Temple of the Dosh Khaleen.
It’s forbidden to carry weapons in the sacred city.
If they spot us and we’re unarmed, we’ll say we’re traders heading for the Western Market. But if they see weapons…
There’s 100,000 of them down there. We can’t fight our way out. We wait till dark, and then we’ll find her.
Don’t worry. it didn’t touch you.
I know what happens.
Come on.
My friends...We wandered off from the Western Market and got lost. Could you show us the way back?
Wine. Come down to my stall tomorrow, I’ll give you a cask of the Arbor’s finest.
If they find a body with a stab wound, the whole city will be looking for us.
We have to go now.
All we can do is try.
You must send me away.
I don’t know.
I don’t know that either. But I’ve seen what happens when it goes far enough. I’ll end things before that.
Don’t be. All I’ve ever wanted was to serve you. Tyrion Lannister was right. I love you. I’ll always love you. Goodbye, Khaleesi.

7.text: Has she come yet?
The Dragon Queen. Daenerys Stormborn.
How long?
But how long 'till...
Jorah. Jorah Mormont.
There's no need. I've been dead to them for years.
What are you doing?
What is it?
Have you ever done this before?
A bit. Less than before.
I don't know anything about that. I just started feeling better. I assumed it was the rest that did it.
And the climate.
How bad is it?
I surrendered to this sickness the moment I first saw it. I knew it would kill me or I'd kill myself before it could. Daenerys Stormborn convinced me otherwise. The only place for me is with her.
I owe my life to her and you.
Perhaps our paths will cross again?
Your Grace.
I wouldn't be here if I hadn't. I return to your service, my queen, if you'll have me.
With the queen's permission I'll go north and take one.
You asked me to find a cure so I could serve you. Allow me to serve you.
It was supposed to last us the rest of our lives.
Your Grace, I --
We were hoping some of your men could help.
Thoros?
I hardly recognized you.
He was my father.
You returned the favor, as I recall.
Don't you want to know what we're doing?
He was a good man. He deserved a better son. Were you with him at the end?
I can't think of a worse way for him to go. The Night's Watch was his life. He would have died to protect every one of those men, and they butchered him.
Your father wanted to execute me.
He was in the right of course. It didn't make me hate him any less.
Me too.
He gave it to you.
I brought shame to my house. I broke my father's heart.
I forfeited the right to claim this sword. It's yours. May it serve you well and your children after you.
Dragons don't understand the difference between what is theirs and what isn't. Land, livestock, children... Letting them roam free around a city was a problem.

Perhaps you should fly to Winterfell, Your Grace. You have many enemies in the North. Thousands fell fighting your fatherAll it takes is one angry man with a crossbow. He'll see your silver hair on the kingsroad and know that one well-placed bolt will make him a hero. The man who killed the conqueror.

8.text: They could, they just wouldn't.
Forgive me, khaleesi.
Many things.
But you did forgive, despite my failures. When I heard you'd named Tyrion your Hand, it broke my heart.
You made the right choice.
I didn't. His mouth hardly stopped moving between Volantis and Meereen. It was all I could do not to throw him in the sea.
But the mind behind all those words-
As have we all. He owns his and learns from them.
I am. And one other suggestion, if you'll allow me.
We have all we need to win this war.
Please, listen to me. You're the future of our house.
You'll be safer in the crypt. These things we're fighting-
Thank you, my lady.
What have you got there?
You still have a family.
I'll wield it in his memory to guard the realms of men.

1.text: Daenerys! There’s our bride to be! Look – a gift from Illyrio. Touch it. Come on. Feel the fabric. Mmmm. Isn’t he a gracious host?

Illyrio is no fool. He knows I won’t forget my friends when I come into my throne. You still slouch. Let me see. (He pulls off her gown.) You have a woman’s body now. (She endures it as he strokes her breast.) I need you to be perfect today. Can you do that for me? You don’t want to wake the dragon, do you?
When they write the history of my reign, sweet sister, they will say it began today.
Where is he?
Where’s he going?
But he didn’t say anything. Did he like her?
When will they be married?
Is it true they lie with their horses?
Do you take me for a fool?
I know how to play a man like Drogo. I give him a queen and he gives me an army.
So do I. I want us both to go home. But they took it from us. So tell me, sweet sister, how do we go home?
We go home with an army. With Khal Drogo’s army. I would let his whole tribe fuck you, all 40,000 men and their horses too, if that’s what it took.
When do I meet with the Khal? We need to begin planning the invasion.
When?
I piss on Dothraki omens. I waited 17 years to get my throne back.
Make him happy.
I have no interest in hospitality or comfort. I'll stay with Drogo until he fulfils his end of the bargain and I have my crown.
Well, Mormont, as brutish as this life is, I suppose it is preferable to beheading. What did Ned Stark want you for? Buying from a slaver?
Under my reign, you won't be punished for such nonsense. You can rest assured of that.
You dare! You give commands to me? To me? You do not command the dragon. I am Lord of the Seven Kingdoms. I don't take orders from savages or their sluts. Do you hear me?
Kill these Dothraki dogs! I am your King!
A pile of mud. Mud and shit and twigs - best these savages can do.
I'll call them what I like, because they're my people. This is my army. Khal Drogo is marching the wrong way with my army.
Yes, my dear?
They do.
It's entirely possible.

The brave men didn't kill dragons. The brave men rode them. Rode them from Valyria to build the greatest civilization this world has ever seen. The breath of the greatest dragon forged the Iron Throne, which the Usurper is keeping warm for me. The swords of the vanquished, a thousand of them... melted together like so many candles.
Really? Why dragons?
Well, after 15 years in a pleasure house, I imagine just seeing the sky makes you happy.
What have you seen?
A pirate ship?
No, the last one died many years before I was born. I'll tell you what I have seen
I don't know. The Usurper had them smashed to powder, I expect. Scattered to the wind.
Yes, it is. What did I buy you for? To make me sad?
To teach my sister how to be a better lover? You think I bought you to make Khal Drogo happy? You pretty little idiot. Go on then. Get on with it.
You send this whore to give me commands? I should have sent you back her head!
How many times do I have to tell you? You do not command me.
What's this?
Dothraki rags? Are you going to dress me now?
This stinks of manure. All of it.
You would turn me into one of them, wouldn't you? Next you'll want to braid my hair.
You do not talk back to me!
You are a horselord's slut. And now you've woken the dragon...
She has to eat a whole heart? I hope that wasn’t my horse.
She’ll never keep it down.
Tell me what she is saying.
He won’t be a real Targaryen. He won’t be a true dragon.
They love her.
It’s not my law.
Whatever is hers is also mine.
If I sell one egg, I’ll have enough to buy a ship. Two eggs - a ship and an army.

I need a large army… I’m the last hope of a dynasty, Mormont. The greatest dynasty this world has ever seen, on my shoulders since I was five years old and no one has ever given me what they gave to her in that tent. Never. Not a piece of it… How can I carry what I need to carry without it? Hmm? Who can rule without wealth, or fear, or love? Oh, you stand there, all nobility and honor. You don’t think I see you looking at my little sister, hmm? Don’t think I know what you want? I don’t care. You can have her. She can be queen of the savages and dine on the finest bloody horseparts, and you can dine on whichever parts of her you like. But let me go.
You swore an oath to me. Does loyalty mean nothing to you?
And yet here you stand?
Daenerys! Where’s my sister?
Where is she? I’m here for the feast. The whore’s feast.
Get your hands off me! No one touches the dragon!
Khal Drogo! I’m here for the feast.
That is no place for a king.
Keep away from me!
There she is.

They can’t kill us. They can’t shed blood in their sacred city. (moving his sword over everyone in the room, stopping on Daenerys’ stomach) But I can. I want what I came for. I want the crown he promised me. He bought you. But he never paid for you.
Tell him I want what was bargained for or I’m taking you back. He can keep the baby. I’ll cut it out and leave it for him.
What’s he saying?
That was all I wanted. W-what was promised.
No! You cannot touch me! I am the dragon! I am the dragon! I want my crown! Ahh!
No. Dany! Dany, tell them, make them! You can’t!
Dany please!
Go on. Father’s watching.
And your mother.
Don’t think too much, Bran.
Don’t look away.
Father will know if you do.
You did well.
What is it?
Now there are five.
You want to hold it?
Lord Stark? There are five pups. One for each of the Stark children. The direwolf is the sigil of your House. They were meant to have them.
I’m not a Stark. Get on.
Why’s your mother so dead-set on us getting pretty for the king?
Uncle Benjen!
Lady Stark thought it might insult the royal family to seat a bastard in their midst.
So take me with you when you go back.
Father will let me if you ask him, I know he will.
I’m ready to swear your oath.
I don’t care about that.
What’re you doing back there?
You’re Tyrion Lannister. The queen’s brother?
Lord Eddard Stark is my father.
What the hell do you know about being a bastard?
Get out of my way, Sam.
Better than you do.
l'm gonna find my brother and put a sword through King Joffrey's throat. (gets on horseback)
Move.
Move.
Hyah!
Ghost?
l belong with my brother.
They'll kill you if they know you came after me. Go back.
l have to.
I don't care about –
To hell with all of you.
My friends brought me back.
They killed my father.
No.
No.
Beyond the Wall?
I already have one.
Of course I have.
We've guarded the Kingdoms for 8 000 years.
Soon enough.
It's good you've got help.
Impressive.
I have something for you. And it has to be packed very carefully.
Close the door. This is no toy. Be careful you don't cut yourself.
So are you. I had the blacksmith make it for you special. It won't hack a man's head off, but it can poke him full of holes if you're quick enough.
You'll have to work at it every day. How does it feel? Do you like the balance?
First lesson
I'm going to miss you... Careful... All the best swords have names, you know.
I came to say goodbye to Bran.

I wish I could be here when you wake up. I'm going north with Uncle Benjen. I'm taking the black. I know we always talked about seeing the Wall together, but you'll be able to come visit me at Castle Black when you're better. I'll know my way around by then. I'll be a sworn brother of the Night's Watch. We can go out walking beyond the Wall, if you're not afraid.
You Starks are hard to kill.
She was very kind.
It was always my color.
And you, Stark.
Is my mother alive? Does she know about me? Where I am, where I'm going? Does she care?
Why do you read so much?
Is this a trick?
Until your brother killed that King.
Ask me nicely and maybe I'll tell you, dwarf.
The Night's Watch protects the realm from...
It's an improvement.
Everybody knew what this place was and no one told me. No one but you. My father knew and left me to rot here at the Wall all the same.
They hate me because I'm better than they are.
You're leaving?
What kind of reports?
'm ready. I won't let you down.
But I'm better than every...
Don't stand so still. It's harder to hit a moving target. Except for you. You move too much. I could just hold my sword out and let you do the work for me.
I'm sorry to see you leave, Lannister.
Will you stop at Winterfell on your way South?
If you see my brother Bran, tell him I miss him. Tell him I'd visit if I could.
He'll never walk again.
Farewell, My Lord.
Leg, shoulder, leg. Left foot forward. Good. Now pivot as you deliver the stroke. Put all your weight behind it.
Enough! He yielded.
Are you sure you want to do this?
I've had worse.
It's not going to get any easier, you know? You'll have to defend yourself.
The Wall's no place for cowards.
Come stand by the fire. It's warmer.
You're not. You're freezing.
You can't fight. You can't see. You're afraid of heights and almost everything else probably. What are you doing here, Sam?
Yes, he is.
Wellâ€¦ You can't get any worse.
Watch duty. With Sam.
He wasn't hungry.

That's enough. Sam's no different from the rest of us. There was no place for him in the world, so he's come here. We're not going to hurt him in the training yard anymore. Never again, no matter what Thorne says. He's our brother now and we're going to protect him.
No one touches Sam.
I wouldn't doubt it.
Sally on the side?
I didn't think you'd be so upset about it.
As a matter of fact, I'm the same as you.
I came very close once. I was alone in a room with a naked girl, but...
I know where to put it.
Young and gorgeous. A whore named Ros.
Red.
You don't want to know.
Better.
What's my name?
And why is my surname Snow?

I never met my mother. My father wouldn't even tell me her name. I don't know if she's living or dead. I don't know if she's a noblewoman or a fisherman's wife... Or a whore. So I sat there in the brothel as Ros took off her clothes. But I couldn't do it. Because all I could think was what if I got her pregnant and she had a child, another bastard named Snow? It's not a good life for a child.
I build my own fires.
Why is he alone?
There's no rider.
That's my Uncle Benjen's horse.
I want to find my Uncle.
I do, my lord.
Yes, my lord.
Will I serve the Lord Commander's meals and fetch hot water for his bath.
Do you take me for a servant?
May I go?
I see Ser Alliser's revenge, that's all.
I just, I always wanted to be a Ranger.
Just these two, My Lord. Been dead awhile, I'd say.
We should burn them.
Is there any word of my father?
My sisters were in King's Landing too.
Ghost, what's wrong? Is something out there?
Commander?
Stay.
Hello?
Commander!Othor gets back on his feet, pulling out Jon's sword out of his chest. Outside of the room, Ghost goes beserk, trying to get in.
Move move!
How do you know that?
What else did the book say?
Soon, he says.
This is Valyrian steel.
My lord, you honor me, but l can't â€“
Yes, my lord.
l'll apologize to Ser Alliser tonight.
Yes, my lord.
At what?
What is it?
You can't what?
And yet you really want to say. You want to say thatâ€¦
What? What about him?
l should be there. l should be with him.
Sam said you wanted to see me?
No.
He would do whatever was right, no matter what.
Sam told you.
And this is my day? ls that what you're saying?
You do not know. No one knows. l may be a bastard, but he is my father and Robb is my brother.
Who are you?
You're Aemon Targaryen.

2.text: Having a rough time of it?
What happens to the boys?
He marries his daughters. What does he do with his sons?
(Standing off to the side of the room) We're not Southerners.
Jon Snow.
Lord commander.
Jon Snow.
Your steward.
Careful with that. You might cut yourself.
Never swung a sword before, have you? You look like a baby with a rattle.
Stop!
What happens to the boys? What does he do with his sons?
What’re you doing?
Hello, Gilly. What’re you doing?
I'm sorry, Sam knows we're not supposed to -
What? (Stands up).
No it doesn't sound a bit mad, it's impossible.
Sam we can't take her -
It's just not possible.
If it's a boy what? (Gilly looks around and then down, not answering). You want us to risk our lives for you, and you won't even tell us why.
Do what, ask her a question?
Cruel! Sam are you in such a hurry to lose a hand?
No you just want to steal her. What do you think Craster cuts off for that?
We're heading deeper and deeper into wildling territory. We can't take a girl with us. Mormont wouldn't have it. And even if he would, what would we do with her? Who's gonna deliver her baby? You?
I'm sorry Sam, we can't help her.
Lord Commander
I followed him. He took the baby into the woods, the newborn.
No, you don't understand. He's killing them, all the boys.
You know.
Offerings? He's murdering his own children. He's a monster.
I saw it. I saw something take that child.
When will he come?
My uncle told me stories about him.
I heard the Halfhand spent half of last winter beyond the Wall.
So it is possible for someone to survive out here on their own.
I think they were afraid. I think they came here to get away from something. And I don't think it worked.
One blast is for rangers returning. Wildlings is two blasts.
Look. It's Qhorin Halfhand.
A fire.
Where?
Lord Commander, I'd like to join Lord Qhorin.
I've fought and killed a wight. How many rangers can say that?
Ghost, stay with us. Ghost!
He's not a pet.
Ghost is different.
I thought you said you couldn't know wild things.
We could do the same.
My father always said I'm of the North.
I wasn't joking.
(nods)
I'll gladly give my life.
I do.
A girl.
We could question her.
What's your name?
I'm Jon Snow.
No. No, I'll do it.
I'm as much a crow as they are.
Can't. Someone might see the smoke.
I'll find them.
We'll stop here. Too dark to go any farther today.
There's no shelter anywhere.
No fire.
No fire.
Yes.
Yes.
We start again at first light. Get some sleep.
Stop moving.
Stop it!
You're still moving.
(sighs)
Let's move.
I'm a man of the Night's Watch.
Don't call them that.
Neither. Both.
Move!
There are no women of the Night's Watch, no.
No.
Never. We swore an oath.
Would you please shut up?
You're a free woman? I might be your prisoner, but I'm a free woman.
If you're my prisoner, you're not a free woman. That's what "prisoner" means.
It was my choice to say the words.
Of course I like girls. But you chose never to touch them.
That's the price you pay if you want to be a man of the Night's Watch.
Invade your lands? Wildlings raid our lands all the time. Some of them tried to kill my little brother, a crippled boy!
My father was Ned Stark. I have the blood of the First Men. My ancestors lived here, same as yours.
No. No, you serve Mance Rayder, the King beyond the Wall.
Walk.
I know how to do it.
We're close.
We're close.
Nothing happened between you and me.
Turn back around.
That's enough.
Enough!
I couldn't do it. I had the sword on her neck, I just couldn't
The others?
They died because of me.
They'll never trust me.
What?
I didn't.

3.text: (Nods)
Mance was a ranger.
When I'm free, will I be free to go?
What happened to their fathers?
My father told me big men fall just as quick as little ones if you put a sword through their hearts.
Jon Snow.
Your Grace.
The Lord Commander sent me to the Halfhand for seasoning.
He wants me to lead one day.
If I'm a traitor, then you are, too.
(Hesitates.) I want to be free.
We stopped at Craster's Keep on the way north. I saw...
I saw Craster take his own baby boy and leave it in the woods. I saw what took it.

Because when I told the Lord Commander, he already knew. Thousands of years ago, the First Men battled the White Walkers and defeated them. I want to fight for the side that fights for the living. Did I come to the right place?
Ygritte, you know I didn't have a choice. You always knew who I was, what I am.
I have to go home now. I know you won't hurt me.
I do know some things. I know I love you.
I know you love me. But I have to go home now.
Pyp? Sam?
Don't think too much, Bran.
Relax your bow arm.
Yes.
I understand.
You want to protect your people.
No.
What's wrong with him?
It's only horses. No men.
About 300.
(Nods)
Do you think anyone got away?
There are four to a patrol-- two builders to check for structural damage, two rangers to watch for enemies.
It varies. If I knew where on the Wall we were heading, I could tell you.
Three.
(nods)
Castle Black.
Eastwatch-by-the-Sea and the Shadow Tower.
What happens to your eagle after I kill you? Does he drift away like a kite with his strings cut or does he just flop dead to the ground?
1000 men
I don't need you to protect me.
Give it back.
Ygritte! Ygritte!
Ygritte! Seven hells. Ygritte!
Ygritte.
We shouldn't.
I don't know. I just wanted to kiss you there is all.
You seemed to like it.
There's been no one else. Only you.
I was a man of the Night's Watch. How about you? Were you a maid?
Who was he?
Yeah, thanks. I think I've heard enough. We'd best get back. Tormund--
You ever climbed it before?
Aren't you?
You kill someone for them?
Can we not talk about that here?
Did I seem scared the other day?
Only in the beginning.
What secret?
I won't.
(screams)
(grunts)
(grunts)
Take my hand!
About a week, I think.
When we went to Castle Black, we took the kingsroad.
Most of the time, yes.
They don't, really. It's a great honor to carry your house sigil.
Usually it's the young boys banging the drums.
They help the men march.
Well, it's-- it's the rhythm.
No. No, you're just gonna light the biggest fire the North has ever seen to let them know you're coming.
I know you cut me loose on the Wall.
And are you gonna share it with me? The deep wisdom you found inside the head of a bird?
You're gonna scare it off.
It's too far away.
It's a windmill.
Just the men who used to live here.
Winterfell has towers three times that size.
If you're impressed by a windmill, you'd be swooning if you saw the Great Keep at Winterfell.
Fainting.
When a girl sees blood and collapses.
Well not all girls are like you.
I'd like to see you in a silk dress.
So I could tear it off you.
Maybe one day I'll take you to Winterfell.
Ygritte. You won't win. I know your people are brave, no one denies that.
Six times in the last thousand years, a King has attacked the kingdoms. Six times they failed.

Every boy in the North knows it. We grow up learning it. Where the battles were fought, the names of the heroes, who died where. Six times you've invaded and six times you've failed. The seventh will be the same.
You don't have the discipline. You don't have the training. Your army is no army. You don't know how to fight together.
I do. I know it. If you attack the Wall, you'll die. All of you.
Yes, first we'll live.
He breeds them for the Watch.
The Watch protects him.
We just take the horses and go. The old man’s no threat.
The Watch might send a few men looking for a horse thief. They’ll send a lot more to hunt down murderers.
Ygritte!
You were right the whole time.

4.text: Last time I saw him, he was in the courtyard at Winterfell. "He said, " Next time I see you, you'll be all in black." I was jealous of Robb my whole life. (Winces) The way my father looked at him, I wanted that. He was better than me at everything... fighting and hunting and riding and girls. Gods, the girls loved him. I wanted to hate him, but I never could.
(Chuckles)
He's wanted to hang me for a while. Now's his chance.
I've done plenty wrong.
I didn't murder him.
He wanted me to kill him.
The Halfhand believed our only chance to stop Mance was to get a man inside his army.
Then you'd know he'd do anything to defend the Wall. The free folk would have boiled him alive, but letting me kill him...
Aye, I talk like a wildling. I ate with the wildlings. I climbed the Wall with the wildlings. I... I laid with a wildling girl.
I do.
While we sit here debating which rules I broke, Mance Rayder marches on the Wall with an army of 100,000.
100,000. He's united the Thenns, the Hornfoots, the ice-river clans. He has giants fighting for him.
Have you ever been beyond the Wall, ser?
And now you're here. You must not have been very good at your job.

There's a band of wildlings south of the Wall already led by Tormund Giantsbane. I killed their warg and three others. They shot me full of arrows. Their orders are to attack Castle Black from the south when Mance hits it from the north. The signal for the attack will be a bonfire. Mance said it would be the greatest fire the North has ever seen. That's the truth. All the truth.
Do you intend to execute me or am I free to go?
I've been sent to negotiate with you.
The Halfhand ordered me to join your army and bring back whatever information I could to Castle Black. He made me kill him so you'd trust me. I was loyal, to him and to my Night's Watch vows.
She put three arrows in me when I escaped.
Yes.
She's dead.
No.
Ygritte.
That's not wine.
He's dead. He killed my friend Grenn.
Grenn came from a farm.
Grenn and Mag.
Turn your army around and go home.
I told Tormund and Orell. We have more than a thousand men.
No, it's like you said, we don't have the men.
I was sent to discuss terms with the king beyond the wall.
I know he's the king. My father died for him. My name is Jon Snow, your grace. I'm Ned Stark's son.
He was, your grace.
I was this man's prisoner once. He could've tortured me, he could've killed me, but he spared my life. I think my father would've taken him prisoner, listened to what he had to say.
Your grace. If my father'd seen the things that I've seen, he'd also tell you to burn the dead before nightfall. All of them.
He's sworn to treat all wounded men, friend or foe.
No one's going to torture you.
I don't know what happens to the prisoners.
I suppose Stannis does.
I don't have a king.
We're gonna burn the bodies of your dead. Do you want to say any words over them?
Funeral words. I don't know how the Free Folk do it.
Say farewell.
She told you?
Mance Rayder is coming. If the wildlings breach the Wall, they'll roll over everything and everyone for 1,000 Miles before they reach an army that can stop them.
Help him.
And the mutineers stayed?
We need to ride north and kill them all.

It's not about justice. I told the wildlings we had over 1,000 men at Castle Black alone. Karl and the others know the truth as well as we do. How long do you think they'll keep that information to themselves when the wildlings are peeling their fingernails off? Mance has all he needs to crush us, he just doesn't know it yet. As soon as he gets his hands on them, he will. Then he'll throw his full strength at us. And even if every one of us kills 100 wildlings, there's still not a thing we can do to stop them.
Bring it through! And again.
Very nice. Good.
A lot of wildlings fight with a weapon in each hand. First thing you want to do is disarm them to try and even the odds.
Let's see what you can do.
Olly, you just watch for now.
Have you ever held a sword before? OLLY I was the best archer in our hamlet.
You two. Take it slow, try and disarm each other.
You know how to fight. You could have gone easier on him.
Grenn and I were helping them.
Someone has to train them.
My father was highborn. My mother wasn't.
Jon Snow.
You fight well.
She wasn't safe here.
Castle Black could be next.
We have orders. No one's to leave the castle.

And I remember who came after me and brought me home. I know how hard it is, Sam, believe me. When you told me about Bran going beyond the Wall, all I could think about was getting my strength back so I could go and find him.
How fast could they travel? A crippled boy being pulled on a sledge by a simpleton?
The wildlings have joined up with Mance. Every village or sheltered place will be deserted. Except...
Thank you, Ser Alliser.
Ahem, brothers.

I'm going beyond the Wallto Craster's Keep. I'm going to capture the mutineers holed up there or kill them. I'm asking for volunteers to come with me. There's 60 miles of wilderness between here and Craster's and Mance Rayder has an army bearing down on us, but we have to do this. Our survival may depend on us getting to these mutineers before Mance does. They know the Wall. They know our defenses. If Mance learns what they know, we're lost. But if that's not enough, then consider this. If the Night's Watch are truly brothers, then Lord Commander Mormont was our father. He lived and died for the Watch and he was betrayed by his own men. Stabbed in the back by cowards. He deserved far better. All we can give him now is justice. Who will join me?
I can't let a recruit come north of the Wall.
Thank you, brothers.
How many?
Why?
(SIGHS) Get some rest. We move at sundown.
Are you all right? Come with me. Come on.
We lost four brothers?
I count 10 dead mutineers.
Where in seven hells? Come here.
I missed you, boy.
It's not safe for you here on your own. Mance Rayder has an army heading this way and there's worse out there than Mance. Come with us to Castle Black. We can find you work. Keep you safe.
You want to stay here in Craster's Keep?
Greetings.
Come on, Ghost.
Mance's army was closing in on Craster's Keep when we left. We saw their campfires from Osric's Hill. They'll reach the Wall before the next full moon.
We need to prepare.
We should seal the tunnel. Plug it with rocks and ice. Flood it and let it freeze.
We wouldn't.
Have you ever seen a giant, Ser Alliser? I have.
They won't stop them.
The stewards.
No.
The builders.
You couldn't have known.
We can't go after them, you know that. That's what they want.
If they hit Mole's Town, then we're next. Mance's army must be close.
She...she had red hair.
Well what do you want me to say?
So you and Gilly never-
But if she had, you would've? You'd have broken your vows?
What?
I don't think Ser Alliser cares much for interpretation.

It's...there's this person, this whole other person. And you're wrapped up in them and they're wrapped up in you and...you...for a little...for a little while you're more than just you, you're...well I don't know, I'm not a bleedin' poet!
And what did I get for it? An arrow six inches from my heart.
There will.
Go get some sleep, Sam. I'll take this watch.
There we go, boys. That's one. There's two. Come on, let's get the next lot. That's the last of the oil, Ser Alliser.
Yes sir.
It was a difficult decision either way, Ser.
We can't just let them attack the gate!
Those are giants riding mammoths down there. Do you think your cold, rolled steel's gonna stop them?
Archers! Knock your arrows! Draw! Loose!
They won't summit before dawn.
Because I've made that claim.
Knock! Draw! Loose!
Now!
*to Grenn* The outer gate won't hold. Take five men, hold the inner gate.
*grabs Grenn's arm* Hold the gate. If they make it through...
Oil!
What are you doing up here?
Ed. You have The Wall. If they try the mammoths again, drop fire on them. If the climbers get too high, drop the scythe on them.
Two brothers now fight with me.
*to Sam* I don't want you out there.
I need him more than I need you.
No, shh, don't talk.
We'll go back there.
Tormund. It's over, let it end.
Put him in chains. We'll question him later.
Aye, you should've.
For one night.

Great victory? Mance was testing our defenses. He almost made it through. And he has more giants, he has more mammoths. He has a thousand times as many men. They'll hit us again tonight. Maybe we can hold them off for a day or two, but we can never beat them.
I'm going to find Mance.

Who's left to give orders? The Wildling army is only an army because of Mance. He united a hundred warring tribes. Without Mance they lose their leader. They lose their purpose, they go back to fighting each other, scatter back to their home.
I'm going to try.
He'll kill me. If I don't go he'll kill me anyway. They'll kill the rest of us too.
You're right. It's a bad plan. What's your plan?
They held the gate. Get some brothers down here to help you. You need to burn the bodies. Raise the outer gate, then lower it again as soon as I'm out.
I promised Jeor I'd never lose it again. *he hands the sword to Sam* In case I don't come back.

5.text: Get your shield up.
If it wasn’t heavy it wouldn’t stop a sword, now get it up.
Come. Try it again. Drive at me. Keep your shield up. Or I’ll ring your head like a bell.
Good, good, pivot! Don’t forget to pivot! Shield up!
You’re not cold, my lady?
No.
Roose Bolton.
I want a great many things, your grace. But I’m a sworn brother of the Night’s Watch now.
They’re good men.
It’s where she belonged.
They were born on the wrong side of the wall. That doesn’t make them monsters.
The men of the Night’s Watch are sworn to play no part--
Your grace, you want the wildlings to march in your army?
I don’t think that’s likely.
I respect him.
Your grace…
How much time do I have?
Here we are.
This doesn’t have to be our last meeting.
You know what Stannis wants?
Shouldn’t a king be bold?
You told me you weren’t here to conquer. You told me your people have bled enough.

You spent your life convincing 90 clans to come together for the first time in history. Thenns and Hornfoots, the ice-river clans, even the giants. A life’s work uniting them. You didn’t do it for power. You didn’t do it for glory. You brought them together to save them because none of them will survive the winter, not if they’re north of the wall. Isn’t their survival more important than your pride?
Then bend the knee and save your people.
And how many tens of thousands are out there right now? How many women? How many children? And you won’t go out and rescue them because why? You’re afraid of looking afraid.
They’ll burn you alive.

And what happens to your people? You preserve your dignity and die standing, and they’ll sing songs about you. “You’d rather burn than kneel. The great hero.” Until winter comes, and the white walkers come for us all, and there’s no one left to sing.
I think you’re making a terrible mistake.
He raised his hands. And they all stood up at once. Tens of thousands of them, the biggest army in the world.
I’m gonna hope they don’t learn how to climb the wall.
With Longclaw. I saw them shatter steel axes like they were glass. But Longclaw…

Not enough. (pause) The first Lord Commander in history to sacrifice the lives of sworn Brothers to save the lives of Wildlings. How’s it feel to be friends with the most hated man in Castle Black? (smiles)
Here’s to us then. Long may they sneer.
What?
I need you here, Sam. If you leave, who’s left to give me advice I trust?
You know that The Citadel will make you swear off women, too.
Sam?
Sam…
You’ve just been beaten half to death. How did you--
I’m glad the end of the world’s working out for someone.
We don’t have enough men to make any difference.
The wildlings won’t ever fight for Stannis, I told you before--
It’s not their fight!
Stannis?
Are you sure he’s talking about Benjen?
He could be lying.
Where is he?
Olly…
With respect, Your Grace, the free folk will never follow you, no matter what you do. You're the man who burned their king alive.
No. Only one of their own.
The Lord Commander's niece.
"Bear Island knows no king but the King in the North, whose name is Stark." (Jon smiles)
I apologize, Your Grace. Northerners can be a bit like the free folk. Loyal to their own.
Most likely.
Unpleasant, I expect.
I don't doubt it, Your Grace. But I'm a brother of the Night's Watch. I've pledged them my life, my honor, my sword. I don't know what I have left to give you.
I can't. Even if I wanted to, I'm a bastard. A Snow.
It's the first thing I ever remember wanting. I'd daydream that my father would ask the king, and just like that I would never be the bastard of Winterfell again.
I'm going to refuse him.
I swore a vow to the Night's Watch. If I don't take my own word seriously, what sort of Lord of Winterfell would I be?
(Stands up). Your Grace.
Olly is my steward now, as I was Lord Commander Mormont's. I want him to attend my meetings, to learn from men with experience. One day, he might command.
I have. And I thank you for it. You do me great honor. All my life I wanted to be Jon Stark.
But I have to refuse you. I'm Lord Commander of the Night's Watch. My place is here.
I wish I could fight beside you. Believe me, I do. But I swore a sacred vow at the Godswood. I pledged my life to the Night's Watch.
I can imagine no higher praise.
May I ask, Your Grace, how long you plan to stay at Castle Black?

You saved us from Mance Rayder's army. We will never forget that. But it's a question of survival. The Night's Watch can't continue to feed your men and the wildling prisoners indefinitely. Winter is coming.
And the wildlings?
Most of the brothers, yes. There's little love for the free folk here. (Olly stares at him).
I heard it was best to keep your enemies close.
I'm sorry I disappointed him.
As long as he's ruling them.
I’ve sworn to stay clear of the politics of the Seven Kingdoms.
And what needs to be done?
Sam. (Sam looks up. Jon looks at Maester Aemon’s chair). Maester Aemon?

Take good care of him. (To the group). Brothers. As you all know too well, it's long past time to dig a new latrine pit. (Laughter. Jon looks at Alliser). First Builder Yarwyck and I have decided to appoint a latrine captain to oversee this crucial task. (Laughter. After a moment, he continues). Brian. Seems like a good job for a ginger.

Ser Alliser. (Silence). You have more experience than any other soldier at Castle Black. You proved your valour many times over, while defending the Wall from the wildling attack. I name you First Ranger.
Lord Janos. I'm giving you command of Greyguard.
Yes, the fort is in a sorry state. Restore it as best you can. First Builder Yarwyck can spare ten of his -
You mistake me, my Lord. That was a command, not an offer. Pack your arms and armour, say your farewells, and ride for Greyguard.
Are you refusing to obey my order?
Take Lord Janos outside.
Olly, bring me my sword.
If you have any last words, my Lord, now is the time.
(To some of the men sparring). Good.
Never even heard of these people.
And how many men does this Lord Mazin have to send us?
Not him.
He murdered my brother.
How can I help you?
Castle Black is my home now. Night's Watch takes no part in the wars of the Seven Kingdoms.
You're gonna show me some vision in the fire. Forgive me, my Lady. But I don't trust in visions.
I don't think Stannis would like that very much.
I can't.
I swore a vow. (Melisandre looks at him incredulously). I loved another.
I know. But I still love her.
Maester Aemon.
Sam, I'd like to speak to the maester alone.
How are you feeling?
I need your advice. There's something I want to do, something I have to do. But it'll divide the Night's Watch. Bitterly. Half the men will hate me the moment I give the order.
But you don't know what it is.
Where are the rest of the free folk now? (Tormund scoffs). Where have they gone? (No response). Who leads them?
What about you?
What if I unchained you?
Because you are not my enemy. And I'm not yours.
For 8,000 years the Night's Watch have sworn an oath to be the shield that guards the realms of men. And for 8,000 years we've fallen short of that oath. You belong to the realms of men. All of you.
It is.
Because now, (Leans forward), I am Lord Commander of the Night's Watch.

(Stands up). I'd have you go north of the Wall. Gather the remaining free folk wherever they are and bring them back here. I'll open the gates for them and let them through. I'll find them lands to settle south of the Wall.
I don't want them to kneel for me. I want them to fight with me when the time comes.

And how many of your people can't fight? The women, the children, the old, the sick, what happens to them? You're condemning them to death. Worse than death because you're too proud to make peace. Or maybe you're not proud. Maybe you're just a coward.

Your people need a leader. And they need to get south of the Wall before it's too late. We don't have much time and they have less. The walkers are coming and they'll hit your people first. I'm not asking you to make peace to save your skin. Make peace to save your people.
Up on Storrold's Point. I can give you 10 horses and nine other men. You can get there in a week.
I'll talk to King Stannis about lending you his fleet.
Men, women, and children will die by the thousands if we do nothing.
And we've slaughtered theirs.

You were at the Fist of the First Men. If we abandon them, you know what they become. We can learn to live with the wildlings or we can add them to the army of the dead. Whatever they are now, they're better than that.
Thank you. (Olly walks away). Olly. (He stops). If you have something you want to say to me, say it. It's all right.
It's not a trick.
I know what it's like to lose the people you love. I know this is hard for you. But winter is coming. We know what's coming with it. We can't face it alone.
No.
You'll get them back, I swear it. Have a safe journey, Your Grace. And thank you.
First Ranger, you have command of Castle Black.
As always, thank you for your honesty.
Thank you, Sam.
Me too.
Does that make me a fool?
He’s not my prisoner.
We’re allies.
We’re not here to fight. We’re here to talk.

My name’s Jon Snow. I’m Lord Commander of the Night’s Watch. We’re not friends. We’ve never been friends. We won’t become friends today. This isn’t about friendship. This is about survival. This is about putting a 700 foot wall between you and what’s out there.
In normal times we wouldn’t. But these aren’t normal times. The white walkers don’t care if a man’s Free Folk or Crow. We’re all the same to them. Meat to their army. But together we can beat them.
It’s not a trick. It’s a gift for those who join us.
Dragonglass. A man of the Night’s Watch used one of these daggers to kill a walker.
No. But I trust the man.
Come with me and I'll share these weapons.
There are good lands south of the wall. The Night's Watch will allow you through the tunnel and allow your people to farm those lands.
I knew Mance Rayder. He never wanted a war with the Night’s Watch, he wanted a new life for his people. For you. We’re prepared to give you that new life.
If you swear you join us when the real war begins.
He died.

I’m not asking you to forget your dead. I’ll never forget mine. I lost 50 brothers the night that Mance attacked the wall. But I’m asking you to think about your children now. They’ll never have children of their own if we don’t band together. The Long Night is coming and the dead come with it. No clan can stop them. The free folk can’t stop them. The Night’s Watch can’t stop them. And all the southern kings can’t stop them. Only together, all of us, and even then it might not be enough, but at least then we’ll give the fuckers a fight.
How many are with us? 5000?
We’re leaving too many behind.
And he knew them better than I ever will.
Get in line! Get in line!
Hold the line! Hold the line!
Get them to the ship and come back for me!
Now!
You should be on one of those boats.
You have my word. I’ve given orders.
Night’s Watch with me! Move! Move! Move!
The Dragonglass!
The Dragonglass!
Go! Go! Go!
Let’s go now! Now!
It was a failure.
I went to save them, I failed.
I don’t think that fact’s lost on them.
Here’s a silver because the lady likes you.

6.text: When we had feasts, our family would sit up here… and I’d sit down there.
Aye, you’re right. I was luckier than most.
What is that?
Ride south today. If you return to the North, I’ll have you hanged as a murderer.
I’m having the lord’s chamber prepared for you.
I’m not a Stark.

You’re the Lady of Winterfell. You deserve it. We’re standing here because of you. The battle was lost until the Knights of the Vale rode in. They came because of you. You told me Lord Baelish sold you to the Boltons.
And you trust him?
We need to trust each other. We can’t fight a war amongst ourselves. We have so many enemies now.
Well, Father always promised, didn’t he?
The free folk, the northerners, and the Knights of the Vale fought bravely, fought together, and we won. My father uses to say we find our true friends on the battlefield.
The war is not over. And I promise you, friend, the true enemy won’t wait out the storm. He brings the storm.
There’s nothing to forgive, my lord.
They stabbed me. Olly...he put a knife in my heart. I shouldn’t be here.
Nothing. There was nothing at all.
I did what I thought was right. And I got murdered for it. And now I’m back. Why?
I don’t know how to do that. I thought I did, but...I failed.
I’m not a god.
I think so. Hold off on burning my body for now.
If you have any last words, now is the time.
Neither was killing me.
I’m sure you would, Ser Alliser.
You should.
Wear it. Burn it. Whatever you want. You have Castle Black.
My watch is ended.
South.
Get warm.
I did everything I could. You know that.
Aye, I pledged my life to the Night’s Watch. I gave my life.
They killed me, Edd! My own brothers. You want me to stay here after that?
With the peas and onions?
We never should have left Winterfell.
How could we know?
We were children.
You were occasionally awful. I’m sure I can’t have been great fun. Always sulking in the corner while the rest of you played.
There’s nothing to forgive.
All right. All right, I forgive you.
You’d think after thousands of years, the Night’s Watch would have learned how to make a good ale.
Where will we go? If I don’t watch over you, Father’s ghost will come back and murder me.
I can’t stay here, not after what happened.
Should we tell the Boltons to pack up and leave?
I don’t have an army.
They didn’t come here to serve me.
Sansa.
I’m tired of fighting.
It’s all I’ve done since I left home. I’ve killed brothers of the Night’s Watch. I’ve killed wildlings. I’ve killed men that I admire. I hanged a boy younger than Bran. I fought and I lost.
I’m not Lord Commander anymore.

"To the traitor and bastard Jon Snow. You allowed thousands of wildlings past the Wall. You have betrayed your own kind. You have betrayed the North. Winterfell is mine, bastard. Come and see. Your brother Rickon is in my dungeon.

His direwolf's skin is on my floor. Come and see. I want my bride back. Send her to me, bastard, and I will not trouble you or your wildling lovers. Keep her from me and I will ride north and slaughter every wildling man, woman, and babe living under your protection. You will watch as I skin them living. You --
It's just more of the same.
Lord of Winterfell and Warden of the North.
We don’t know that.
We can’t defend the north from the Walkers and the south from the Boltons. If we want to survive, we need Winterfell, and to take Winterfell, we need more men.
There are more than three other houses in the North -- Glover, Mormont, Cerwyn, Mazin, Hornwood. Two dozen more. Together they equal all the others. We can start small and build.
How do you know that?
New dress?
Year, it’s -- I like the wolf bit.
Thank you, Sansa.
Don’t knock it down while I’m gone.

That’s what’ll happen to you if we lose. The Boltons, the Karstarks, the Umbers, they know you’re here. They know that more than half of you are women and children. After they finish with me, they’ll come for you. You’re right. This isn’t your fight. You shouldn’t have to come to Winterfell with me. I shouldn’t be asking you. It’s not the deal we made. I need you with me if we’re gonna beat them, and we need to beat them if you’re going to survive.
Lady Mormont.
I served under your uncle at Castle Black, Lady Lyanna. He was also a great warrior and an honorable man. I was his steward. In fact- -
Stannis Baratheon garrisoned at Castle Black before he marched on Winterfell and was killed. He showed me the letter you wrote to him when he petitioned for men. It said- -
Robb is gone, but House Stark is not. And it needs your support now more than ever. I’ve come with my sister to ask for House Mormont’s allegiance.

Ramsay Bolton cannot be allowed to keep Winterfell, my lady. It is our duty to stop him. Even more so because he holds our brother Rickon Stark as prisoner. What you have to understand, my lady, is that- -
Your uncle fought them at the Fist of the First Men. I fought them at Hardhome. We both lost.
Thank you, my lady. How many fighting men can we expect?
Lord Glover, if you could just hear us out.
The Boltons are traitors. Roose Bolton- -
House Mormont.
We sent raven to Houses Manderly- -
The bulk of the force is made up of wildlings.
Lord Glover.
We’re not staying here long. Another storm could hit any day..
We have to march on Winterfell now while we still can.
Ser Davos is the reason I’m standing here talking to you and he served Stannis for years.
There’s no time.
We fight with the army we have.
You don’t have to be here.
You’re right. There’s no need for a battle. Thousands of men don’t need to die. Only one of us. Let’s end this the old way. You against me.
Aye, you have the numbers. Will your men want to fight for you when they hear you wouldn’t fight for them?
If he was smart, he’d stay inside the walls of Winterfell and wait us out.
It’s his weakness, too. His mean don’t want to fight for him. They’re forced to fight for him. If they feel the tide turning...
We’re digging trenches all along our flanks. They won’t be able to hit us the way that Stannis hit you, in a double envelopment.
A pincer move.
They won’t be able to hit us from the sides.
No. But I wanted to make him angry. I want him coming at us full tilt.
Aye, for what they’re worth.
You’re right.
He’s overconfident.
Aye, and what have I been doing all my life? Playing with broomsticks? I fought beyond the Wall against worse than Ramsay Bolton. I’ve defended the Wall from worse than Ramsay Bolton.
All right, tell me. What should we do? How do we get Rickon back?
We can’t give up on our brother.
Of course he does. What should I do differently?
Aye, that’s good advice.
Well, it is a bit obvious.
When will we have a larger force?! We’ve pleaded with every house that’ll have us! The Blackfish can’t help us! We’re lucky to have this many men!
Now, it’s not enough! It’s what we have! Battles have been won against greater odds.
My lady. You weren’t at the war council.
Any advice?
If I do, if I fall, don’t bring me back.
I’m ordering you not to bring me back.
You’re in my camp. I’m the commander.
How do you know what he commands?
Why?
What kind of god would do something like that?
Get word --
We’re going to bury my brother in the crypt next to my father.

7.text: I want every northern maester to scour their records for any mention of dragonglass. Dragonglass kills white walkers. It's more valuable to us now than gold. We need to find it, we need to mine it, we need to make weapons from it. Everyone aged 10 to 60 will drill daily with spears, pikes, bow and arrow.
Not just the boys.
We can't defend the North if only half the population is fighting.

While we're preparing for attack, we need to shore up our defenses. The only thing standing between us and the Army of the Dead is the Wall and the Wall hasn't been properly manned in centuries. I'm not the king of the Free Folk.
But if we're going to survive this winter together...
Last time we saw the Night King was at Hardhome. The closest castle to Hardhome is Eastwatch-by-the-Sea.
If they breach the wall, the first two castles in their path are Last Hearth and Karhold.
