The Umbers and the Karstarks have fought beside the Starks for centuries. They've kept faith for generation after generation.
I'm not going to strip these families of their ancestral homes because of the crimes of a few reckless sons.
The punishment for treason is death. Smalljon Umber died on the field of battle. Harald Karstark died on the field of battle.

When I was Lord Commander of the Night's Watch I executed men who betrayed me. I executed men who refused to follow orders. My father always said, "The man who passes the sentence should swing the sword," and I have tried to live by those words. But I will not punish a son for his father's sins, and I will not take a family home away from a family it has belonged to for centuries. That is my decision, and my decision is final.
Ned Umber.
Alys Karstark.
For centuries, our families fought side by side on the battlefield. I ask you to pledge your loyalty once again to House Stark, to serve as our bannermen and come to our aid whenever called upon.
Stand.
Yesterday's wars don't matter anymore. The North needs to band together, all the living north. Will you stand beside me, Ned and Alys, now and always?
You are my sister, but I am king now.
When you question my decisions in front of the other lords and ladies, you undermine me.
Of course you can, but--
Do you think I'm Joffrey?
Thank you.
At what?
No.
What did father used to say? Everything before the word "but" is horse shit.
No. No, he never cursed in front of his girls.
All right, I'll stop trying to protect you and you stop trying to undermine me.
And how should I be smarter? By listening to you?
"Cersei of House Lannister, First of Her Name, Queen of the Andals and the First Men, Protector of the Seven Kingdoms--"
Come to King's Landing. Bend the knee or suffer the fate of all traitors.
I'm consumed with the Night King because I've seen him. And believe me, you'd think of little else if you had, too.
There's a thousand miles between us and Cersei. Winter is here. The Lannisters are a southern army. They've never ranged this far north.
You almost sound as if you admire her.
Read the last bit.
It's something he said to me the first night we met. You know him better than any of us. What do you think?
What?
But?
Come in.

This message was sent to me by Samwell Tarley. He was my brother at the Night's Watch. A man I trust as much as anyone in this world. He's discovered proof that Dragonstone sits on a mountain of Dragonglass.
I received this a few days ago from Dragonstone. It was sent to me by Tyrion Lannister.
He's now Hand of the Queen to Daenerys Targaryen. She intends to take the Iron Throne from Cersei Lannister. She has a powerful army at her back and if this message is to be believed, three dragons.
Lord Tyrion has invited me to Dragonstone to meet with Daenerys and I'm going to accept.
We need this Dragonglass, My Lords. We know that Dragonglass can destroy both White Walkers and their army. We need to mine it and turn it into weapons.

But more importantly, we need allies. The Night King's army grows larger by the day. We can't defeat them on our own. We don't have the numbers. Daenerys has her own army and she has dragon fire. I need to try and persuade her to fight with us. Ser Davos and I will ride for White Harbor tomorrow, then sail for Dragonstone.
I know that.
It could be, but I don't believe Tyrion would do that. You know him. He's a good man.

You all crowned me your king. I never wanted it, I never asked for it, but I accepted it because the north is my home. It's part of me and I will never stop fighting for it, no matter the odds. But the odds are against us. None of you have seen the Army of the Dead. None of you. We can never hope to defeat them alone. We need allies, powerful allies. I know it's a risk. But I have to take it.
Daenerys is a queen. Only a king can convince her to help us. It has to be me.
I'm leaving both in good hands.
Yours. You are my sister. You are the only Stark in Winterfell. Until I return, the north is yours.
You don't belong down here.
I have nothing to say to you.
Touch my sister and I'll kill you myself.
The dwarf of Casterly Rock.
You were pissing off the edge, if I remember right. You picked up some scars along the road.
Of course.
She is.
I didn't ask --
She's starting to let on.
As long as you tell me how a Lannister became Hand to Daenerys Targaryen.
My bannermen think I'm a fool for coming here.
True. But I'm not a Stark.
The winds were kind, Your Grace.
I am not.
Break faith? Your father burned my grandfather alive. He burned my uncle alive. He would have burned the Seven Kingdoms.
You're right. You're not guilty of your father's crime. And I'm not beholden to my ancestor's vows.
Because I need your help and you need mine.
I did.
They're hard to miss.

But you haven't stormed King's Landing. Why not? The only reason I can see is you don't want to kill thousands of innocent people. It's the fastest way to win the war but you won't do it. Which means at the very least you're better than Cersei.
Because right now you and I and Cersei and everyone else, we're children playing at a game screaming that the rules aren't fair.
Your Grace, everone you know will die before winter is over if we don't defeat the enemy to the north.
I am not your enemy. The dead are the enemy.
The Army of the Dead is on the march.
You don't know me well, My Lord, but do you think I am a liar or a madman?
The Army of the Dead is real. The White Walkers are real. The Knight King is real. I've seen them. If they get past the wall and we're squabbling amongst ourselves --
-- we're finished.
You'll be ruling over a graveyard if we don't defeat the Night King.
There's no time for that. There's no time for any of this. While we stand here debating --
And why would I do that?

I mean no offense, Your Grace, but I don't know you. As far as I can tell your claim to the throne rests entirely on your father's name. And my own father fought to overthrow the Mad King. The lords of the north placed their trust in me to lead them. And I will continue to do so as well as I can.
Am I your prisoner?
I'm a prisoner on this island.
Except to my ship. They took my ship.
I'm not playing word games with you. The dead are coming for us all.
It's hard for me to fathom. It really is. If someone told me about the White Walkers and the Night King --
You probably don't believe me.
You didn't before. Grumpkins and snarks you called them. Do you remember? You said it was all nonsense.
How do I convince people who don't know me that an enemey they don't believe in is coming to kill them all?
I know it's a good question. I'm looking for an answer.
I need to help prepare my people for what's coming. I can't help them from here. I'd like to leave.
Everyone told me to learn from my father's mistakes. Don't go south. Don't answer a summons from the Mad King's daughter, a foreign invader. And here I am. A northern fool.
What do you mean?
Amazing thing to see.
You've been talking to Tyrion?
He enjoys talking.
I don't.
I never expected that you would.
I haven't either.
Thank you.
So you believe me then about the Night King and the Army of the Dead?
Your Grace.
I wanted you to see it before we start hacking it to bits.
So this is it, all we'll ever need.
There is something else I want to show your, Your Grace.
The Children of the Forest made these.
A very long time ago.
No.
They were here together the Children and the First Men.
Because the enemy is real. It's always been real.
No, I don't think I can.
My people won't accept a southern ruler, not after everything they've suffered.
I would never presume to --

I never thought that dragons would exist again. No one did. The people who follow you know that you made something impossible happen. Maybe that helps them believe that you can make other impossible things happen. Build a world that's different from the shit one they've always known.
But if you use them to melt castles and burn cities, you're not different. You're just more of the same.
Who?
I think she has a good heart.
There's no time for that. I saw the Night King, Davos. I looked into his eyes. How many men do we have in the north to fight him? 10,000? Less?
What?
It doesn't matter.
Of course.
I'm a bastard. My mother and father weren't married.
Why did you leave your homeland?
I'm sorry.
And if you wanted to sail home to Naarth tomorrow --
You believe that?
Is that a Greyjoy ship?
What you did for her is the only reason I'm not killing you.
The queen is gone.
That wasn't the word I was thinking of, but, yes, they are. Gorgeous beasts.
You weren't gone long.
And?
No, I'm not.
Thousands.
Ser Davos gets carried away.
I served with your father. He was a great man.
I thought Arya was dead. I thought Bran was dead.
Bran saw the Night King and his army marching towards Eastwatch. If they make it past the wall --
I need to go home.
We'll fight with the men we have. Unless you'll join us.
I don't think she'll come see the dead at my invitation.
The first White I ever saw was brought into Castle Black from beyond the Wall.
The free folk will help us. They know the real north better than anyone.
They won't have to.
I'm the only one here whose fought them. I'm the only one here who knows them.

With respect, Your Grace, I don't need your permission. I am a king. And I came here knowing that you could have your men behead me or your dragons burn me alive. I put my trust in you, a stranger, because I knew it was the best chance for my people, for all our people. Now I'm asking you to trust in a stranger because it's our best chance.
You survived King's Landing.
Your Grace, this is --
I saw your father once at Winterfell.
You're a lot leaner.
I grew up on stories about them.
Do you know how to use one?
Well, that's a problem.
We could use the help.
If I don't return at least you won't have to deal with the King in the North anymore.
I wish you good fortune in the wars to come, Your Grace.
Heave!
Two.
Both.
Not enough.
You're The Hound. I saw you once at Winterfell.
He's right. We're all on the same side.
We're all breathing.
Are you all right?
Ever been north before?
You've never been down south.
That's the north.
There's not another woman within 100 miles of here.
Davos says he is a strong fighter.
She'll only fight beside us if I bend the knee.
The first time I went north of the wall was with your father.
I was a prisoner of the Wildlings. But we avenged him. I want you to know that every mutineer found justice.
I hate that he died that way. My father was the most honorable man I ever met. He was good all the way through. And he died on the executioner's block.
I heard.
I'm glad he didn't capture you.
Your father gave me this sword. He changed the pommel from a bear to a wolf, but it's still Long Claw.
Lord Commander Mormont thought you'd never come back to Westeros.
But you are back and it's been in your family for centuries. It's not right for me to have it.
I'm not his son.
Who's that?
You knew him?
I serve the north.
The lord of light never spoke to me. I don't know anything about him. I don't know what he wants from me.
Why?
That's all anyone can tell me, I don't know. So what's the point in serving a god that none of us knows what he wants.
So what are you fighting for?
But we all die.
"I am the shield that guards the realms of men."
Aye. Maybe that's enough.
How many people live here?
That's more people than the entire North crammed into that. Why would anyone want to live that way?

This isn't about living in harmony. It's just about living. The same thing is coming for all of us. A general you can't negotiate with. An army that doesn't leave corpses behind on the battlefield. Lord Tyrion tells me a million people live in this city. They're about to become a million more soldiers in the Army of the Dead.
This is serious. I wouldn't be here if it weren't.
We can destroy them by burning them.
And we can destroy them with dragonglass. If we don't win this fight, then that is the fate of every person in the world.
There is only one war that matters the Great War. And it is here.
No.
(SIGHS)
I am true to my word. Or I try to be. That is why I cannot give you what you ask. I cannot serve two queens. And I have already pledged myself to Queen Daenerys of House Targaryen.
I know!
I'm not going to swear an oath I can't uphold. Talk about my father.
I did this. I should go.
No one is less happy about this than I am.
You're not like everyone else. And your family hasn't seen its end. You're still here.
Who told you that?
Has it occurred to you she might not have been a reliable source of information?
So, what now?
It appears Tyrion's assessment was correct. We're fucked.
If we have the Dothraki ride hard on the kingsroad, they'll arrive at Winterfell within the fortnight.

It's your decision, Your Grace. But if we're going to be allies in this war, it's important for the Northerners to see us as allies. If we sail to White Harbor together, I think it sends a better message.
All right.
We went down there to make peace. And it seems to me we need to be honest with each other if we're going to fight together.
It's not. It may seem that way from the outside, but I promise you, it's not true. I've done plenty of things that I regret.
No. Not compared to you.
Our father was more of a father.
And you betrayed him. Betrayed his memory.
(SIGHS) But you never lost him. He's a part of you. Just like he's a part of me.
It's not my place to forgive you for all of it. But what I can forgive, I do. You don't need to choose. You're a Greyjoy and you're a Stark.
So, why are you still talking to me?

8.text: I warned you. Northerners don't much trust outsiders.
Look at you.
You're a man.
Where's Arya?
Queen Daenerys of House Targaryen. My sister, Sansa Stark, the Lady of Winterfell.
We need to send ravens to the Night's Watch as well. There's no sense in manning the castles anymore. We make our stand here.
It's not important.

You did, my lady. It was the honor of my life. Iâ€™ll always be grateful for your faith. But when I left Winterfell, I told you we need allies or we will die. I have brought those allies home to fight alongside us. I had a choice, keep my crown or protect the North. I chose the North.
How did you sneak up on me?
I didn't.
You still have it.
Have you ever used it?
Jealous?
Where were you before? I could've used your help with Sansa.
Sansa thinks she's smarter than everyone.
Now you're defending her?
You?
Yeah. I'm her family too.
She doesn't know you. If it makes you feel any better, she didn't like me either when we were growing up.
What's wrong with them?
I don't know how to ride a dragon.
What if he doesn't want me to?
What do I hold onto?
You've completely ruined horses for me.
We'd be pretty old.
It's cold up here for a southern girl.
"House Glover will stand behind House Stark as we have for a thousand years." Isn't that what he said?
I told you we needed allies.
I never wanted a crown. All I wanted was to protect the North. I brought two armies home with me, two dragons.

Do you think we can beat the Army of the Dead without her? I fought them, Sansa. Twice. You want to worry about who holds what title, I'm telling you it doesn't matter. Without her, we don't stand a chance.
Do you have any faith in me at all?
She'll be a good queen. For all of us. She's not her father.
Sam?
Were you hiding from me?
What are you doing in Winterfell? Or did you read every book in the Citadel already?
What's wrong? Gilly? Is she all right?
Little Sam?
Know what?
I'm so sorry. We need to end this war.
Well, I've executed men who disobeyed me.
I wasn't a king.
I gave up my crown, Sam.
I bent the knee. I'm not King in the North anymore.
What are you talking about?
My father was the most honorable man I ever met. You're saying he lied to me all my life.
Daenerys is our queen.
That's treason.
We need every man we can get.
I thought we'd lost you.
How did you find each other?
The Umbers?
How long do we have?
They're coming.
We have dragonglass and Valyrian steel.
But there are too many of them.
Far too many.
Our enemy doesn't tire.
Doesn't stop. Doesn't feel.
We can't beat them in a straight fight.
The Night King made them all. They follow his command. If he falls Getting to him may be our best chance.
We'll put you in the crypt, where it's safest.
If they're in the field, they're not protecting Bran. We need to be near him. Not too near, or the Night King won't come. But close enough to pursue him when he does.
Let's get some rest.
Your Grace.
No.
Gilly? Little Sam?
If you want to join them.
To protect them.
Now it's just us three.
Lyanna Stark.
He didn't. He loved her.

They were married in secret. After Rhaegar fell on the Trident, she had a son. Robert would have murdered the baby if he ever found out, and Lyanna knew it. So the last thing she did, as she bled to death on her birthing bed, was give the boy to her brother, Ned Stark, to raise as his bastard.
My name. My real name is Aegon Targaryen.
I wish it were.
Bran. He saw it.
And Samwell confirmed it. He read about their marriage at the Citadel without even knowing what it meant.
It's true, Dany. I know it is.

We're here to say goodbye to our brothers and sisters. To our fathers and mothers. To our friends. Our fellow men and women who set aside their differences to fight together and die together so that others might live. Everyone in this world owes them a debt that can never be repaid. It is our duty and our honor to keep them alive in memory for those who come after us and those who come after them for as long as men draw breath. They were the shields that guarded the realms of men. And we shall never see their like again.
No, not in one go.
Vomiting is not celebrating.
Yeah, I didn't have much say in that.
No.
Only a little.
I didn't know Ser Jorah well but I know this. If he could have chosen a way to die, it would have been protecting you.
I told you I don't want it.
I'll refuse. You are my queen. I don't know what else I can say.
I have to tell Sansa and Arya.
She won't.
I owe them the truth.
It won't.
You are my queen. Nothing will change that. And they are my family. We can live together.
The Northmen as well.
We'll surround the city. If the Iron Fleet tries to ferry in more food, the dragons will destroy them. If the Lannisters and the Golden Company attack, we'll defeat them in the field.
(to SANSA and ARYA) The Northern forces will honor their promises and their allegiance to the Queen of the Seven Kingdoms.
What you command, we will obey.
You understand we'd all be dead if not for her. We'd be corpses marching down to King's Landing.
Her men gave their lives defending Winterfell--
I swore myself and the North to her cause.
You don't know her yet.
If you only trust the people you grew up with, you won't make many allies.
Arya -
I've never been a Stark.
I need to tell you something. But you have to swear you'll never tell another soul.
You have to swear it, before I tell you.
Because we're family. Swear it.
(to BRAN) Tell them.
Just a horse. Rhaegal needs to heal. He doesn't need me weighing him down.
(laughs)
This is the North, you know. And the Free Folk are welcome to stay.
It's where he belongs too. A direwolf has no place in the south. Will you take him with you? He'll be happier up there.
I wish I was going with you. This is farewell, then.
I hope it's a girl.
You too, Sam.
It's not safe. Let me send some men with you.
Grey Worm!
It's over.
And what are the queen's commands?
What are you doing here?
Hey, what happened?
(sighs) She's everyone's queen now.
Wait for me outside the city gates. I'll come find you.
No.
(sighs)
Not that I've seen.
You didn't.
I can't justify what happened. I won't try. But the war is over now.
And you've been by her side, counseling her. Until today.
You think our house words are stamped on our bodies when we're born and that's who we are? Then I'd be fire and blood too. She's not her father, no more than you're Tywin Lannister.
Cersei left her no choice.
She saw her friend beheaded. She saw her dragon shot out of the sky.
Ah, it's easy to judge when you're standing far from the battlefield.
What?
I don't know.
What's it matter what I'd do?
(sighs)
"Love is the death of duty."
Maester Aemon said it a long time ago.
That's her decision. She is the queen.
I'm sorry it came to this.
My sisters will be loyal to the throne.
She doesn't get to choose.
I saw them executing Lannister prisoners in the street. They said they were acting on your orders.
Necessary? Have you been down there? Have you seen? Children, little children, burned!
And Tyrion?
Forgive him.
You can. You can forgive all of them, make them see they made a mistake. Make them understand.
Please, Dany.
The world we need is a world of mercy. It has to be.
How do you know? How do you know it'll be good?
I don't.
What about everyone else? All the other people who think they know what's good.
You are my queen. Now, and always.
There's still a Night's Watch?
(sighs)
Was it right? What I did?
It doesn't feel right.
I don't expect we'll ever see each other again.
(nods)
The North is free, thanks to you.
Ned Stark's daughter will speak for them. She's the best they could ask for.
You can come see me, you know, at Castle Black.
You think anyone will dare tell you women aren't allowed?
(chuckles) I don't know.
You have your Needle?
Your Grace. I'm sorry I wasn't there when you needed me.

1.text: Thank you.
Will you shut up?
Would you please shut up.
Do you think Joffrey will like me? What if he thinks I’m ugly?
He’s so handsome.
When would we be married? Soon or do we have to wait?
Why would he say no? He’d be the second most powerful man in the kingdoms.
You left your home to come here. And I’d be queen someday. Please make father say yes.
Please, please. It’s the only thing I ever wanted.
Thirteen, Your Grace.
I think so, Your Grace.
No, Your Grace.
Arya!
Thank you, my lord.
No! Please, no!
You promised to be merciful.
Please let me go home. l won't do any treason, l swear –
How long do l have to look?
lf it please Your Grace.
Or maybe he'll give me yours. (looks defiantly at Joffrey, who cowers)
Pardon me, Ser.
I'm sorry if I offended you, Ser. Why won't he speak to me?
Stay, Lady. I probably shouldn't have any more. Father only lets us have one cup at feasts.
Arya!
He the butcher's boy.
Arya, stay out of this.
No no, stop it, stop it, both of you. You're spoiling it. You're spoiling everything!
Arya!
Arya, leave him alone. My prince, my poor prince, look what they did to you. Stay here, I'll go back to the inn and bring help.
I don't know. I don't remember. Everything happened so fast. I didn't see.
Arya!
He doesn't mean Lady, does he? No no, not Lady! Lady didn't bite anyone! She's good!
Stop them. Don't let them do it. Please! It wasn't Lady!
Practicing for what?
The Hound killed your friend.
You're an idiot.
I haven't played with dolls since I was eight. May I be excused?
What if I have a girl?
What if I only have girls?
Jeyne Poole's mother had five children, all of them girls.
But what if?
And everyone would hate me.
Joffrey does.
Please shut up about it.
Aegon the Conqueror.
Maegor the Cruel.
My grandfather and uncle were murdered here, weren't they?
The Mad King.
Why were they killed?
I don't want to speak to my father, ever.
No, I won't.
I'm sorry. Do I...?
Arya!
Gods, who is that?
And his opponent?
I won't tell anyone. I promise.
At her dancing lessons. The Knight of the Flowers.
Thank you, Ser Loras.
Don't let Ser Gregor hurt him.
I can't watch.
He's going to die.
Ser Loras would never do that! There's no honor in tricks.
Well, why shouldn’t I? We’re in the south.
My mother isn’t from the North.
Why do you care? Do you even have hair under there?
I’ve never seen it.
No. Where are you from anyway, the north or the south?
Oh, wait. I just realized… I don’t care.
Septa.
My prince.
It’s beautiful. Like the one your mother wears.
There’s nothing to forgive.
What?!
What about Joffrey?
Please, Father. Please don’t.
Who cares about your stupid dancing teacher? I can’t go. I’m supposed to marry Prince Joffrey. I love him and I’m meant to be his queen and have his babies.
I don’t want someone brave and gentle and strong. I want him! He’ll be the greatest king that ever was, a golden lion, and I’ll give him sons with beautiful blond hair.
He is not. He’s nothing like that old drunk king.
Wait!
It’s not fair!
Psst, Jorah the Andal.
She didn't forget. She's with her dancing master.
What is it? What's happening?
Stay away from me.
He wouldn't do that. He knows how much I love Joffrey.
No, I'm not.
Robb.
If...if I could see my father, talk to him about...
I only meant that...what will happen to him?
On...on what?
Ser Aron.
Lord Gyles.
Your Grace.
I do.
As it please Your Grace, I ask mercy for my father, Lord Eddard Stark, who was Hand of the King.
Thank you, Your Grace.
No, My Lords. I know he must be punished.
He was badly hurt.
If you still have any affection in your heart for me, please do me this kindness, Your Grace.
He will.
No, stop! Please, someone stop him!
Stop him, stop!

2.text: It was well struck, Your Grace.
Yes, Your Grace.
You can't!
I only meant… it would be bad luck to kill a man on your name day.
He is. A fool - you're so clever to see it. He'll make a much better fool than a knight. He doesn't deserve the mercy of a quick death.
My father was a traitor. My mother and brother are traitors, too. I am loyal to my beloved Joffrey.
They're right. I'm not good enough for him.
But, if he's not marrying me
King's Landing is my home now.
Pardon, Your Grace. I'm sure your dress will be beautiful, Myrcella. I'm counting the days until the fighting is done and I can pledge my love to the King in sight of the gods.
Come in.
Who are you?
I didn't know I needed a new handmaiden. You're not from here.
What are you doing?
I shouldn't have to tell you to do things. You should just do them.
Change my linens, wash my clothing, scrub the floor, empty my chamber pot, brush my hair.
No.
Not now.
Clean the table. Have you ever been a handmaiden before?
For whom?
Lady Zuriff
There is no Lady Zuriff in this city.

I don't know how they did things in that city, but in this city, handmaidens wait on ladies, not the other way around. And I don't have time to answer a thousand questions and teach you how to do your job.
Just brush my hair.
Your Grace, whatever my traitor brother has done, I had no part. You know that. I beg you, please
(Cries.)
I am loyal to King Joffrey, my one true love.
I saw you cry.
My little brother cried when I left Winterfell.
It seems a normal thing.
No.
Please! No! No!
Ow!
I thought they were going to kill me.
He hated me, the man who hit me. I saw it in his eyes. Hated me. He never met me before, but he wanted to hurt me.
Why? Why would a stranger
I would have given them bread if I had it. I hate the king more than any of them.
But you're not the wrong people.
I beg pardon, ser. I should have come to you after to thank you for saving me. You were so brave.
Does it give you joy to scare people?
(gasps)
It was his duty. He never liked it.
Why are you always so hateful?
No, no!
No. Oh, no.
If the Queen sees, I can have Joffrey's children now.
My mother told me, but I thought it would be different.
I thought it would be less Less messy.
I'm fit to bear children for the king?
(nods)
His Grace was not with you?
I love His Grace with all my heart.
But shouldn't I love Joffrey, Your Grace?
She has, my lord, but King Joffrey sent for me to see him off.
I will pray for your safe return, my lord.
Just as I pray for the king's.
Will you slay him yourself?
So you'll be outside the gates fighting in the vanguard?
I'm sorry, Your Grace. You're right, I'm stupid. Of course you'll be in the vanguard. They say my brother Robb always goes where the fighting is thickest. And he is only a pretender.
Joffrey will. The worst ones always live.
I don't know why she wants me here. She's always saying how stupid I am. She hates me.
I doubt it.
Why would she be jealous?
Yes.
But we have guards to defend us.
You said he was here to protect us.
My queen. What are you doing? Praying.
Praying.
For the gods to have mercy on us all.
Yes, Your Grace.
Of course, Your Grace.
Joffrey is my
Your father doesn't believe in the gods?
They are your guests under your protection. You asked them here.
And if the city should fall?
You were Robert's queen.

Don't be afraid. The queen has raised the drawbridge. This is the safest place we can be. Joffrey's not hurt. He's fighting bravely. His knights have rallied behind him. They will save the city. Shall we sing a hymn? Gentle mother, fount of mercy...
Come with me.
The queen said they'd rape everyone.
What are you doing here?
Where?
What about the king?
I'll be safe here. Stannis won't hurt me.
You won't hurt me.

3.text: Dorne. It's going to Dorne.

It's carrying silk and it's supposed to bring back wine in exchange. But it's not coming back. The captain's tired of risking his life so King's Landing lords and ladies can get drunk on better wine than they deserve. He's going to stay in Dorne. Wait out the winter where it's beautiful and warm.
Don't ruin the game.
(pointing to another ship) What about that one there?
Why?
That's not how the game works. You're not supposed to just blurt out the right answer. You've got to invent a story about where the ship is going and why.
Because the truth is always either terrible or boring.
Lord Baelish.
Arya's alive? You said you'd take me home.
I won't tell anyone.
Because I'm a terrible liar. You said so yourself. Please, Lord Baelish. Tell me what to do. Tell me when.
What are you doing?
A list of people you mean to kill?
You should learn to ignore them.
You're a Lannister. I am the disgraced daughter of the traitor Ned Stark.
(laughs)
So how should we punish them?
Ser Eldrick Sarsfield and Lord Desmond Crakehall.
I hear that you're a pervert.

(chuckles) We could sheep shift Lord Desmond's bed. You cut a little hole in his mattress and you stuff sheep dung inside. Then you sew up the hole and make his bed again. His room will stink, but he won't know where it's coming from.
My sister used to do that when she was angry with me. And she was always angry with me.
That's the vulgar word for dung.
Well, you asked me.
He didn't. He didn't want anything. He just takes an interest because he loved my mother.
Littlefinger's not in love with me.
He's too old.
No.
Why? What will you do? I will make him stop.
Send him in.
Ser Loras.
You are too kind, Ser Loras. You probably don't remember the first time we met. At the Hand's tourney, you gave me your favor. A rose, a red rose.
Thank you, Ser Loras.
And I was sorry when I heard of Lord Renly's death, Lady Margaery. He was very gallant.
Lemon cake's my favorite.
I haven't had the pleasure.
Joff-King Joffrey, he-His Grace is very fair and handsome and as brave as a lion
My father always told the truth.
Joffrey. Joffrey did that. He promised he would be merciful and he cut my father's head off. And he said that was mercy. Then he took me up on the walls and made me look at it.
I-I can't. I never meant-my father was a traitor. My brother as well. I have traitor's blood. Please don't make me say anymore.
He's a monster.
Please, don't stop the wedding.
You haven't.
I can't tell you.
I'm sorry, I just can't.
Pig-face? That's ridiculous.
(laughs)
Porridge plague?
But that's awful.
You're-- I believed you! Porridge plague. I'm an idiot.
So what happened to Alanna?
I'm sure she's jealous of you now. You'll be married here in the capital and she'll have to come watch and pretend to be happy that you're queen.
That would make me very happy.
I-- I don't think the queen would let me leave King's Landing.
(nods)
He's such a splendid fighter. Do you have any idea when we might
Joffrey won't let me leave. He's got too many reasons to keep me here.
What is?
Is it?
Many ladies wear it this way.
You still want me to come with you?

Of course. More than anything. But maybe it would be better to wait. I've been thinking how dangerous it would be. Not just for me, but for you. You've been so kind. I'd feel terrible if anything happened to you. I can't tell you how touched I am by your concern for my welfare.
I do, Lord Baelish.
Petyr.
That's a wonderful pin.
I'm very happy about
I feel like I'm in a dream.
No. I had never left Winterfell before I came to King's Landing. But it sounds wonderful. I can't wait to see it. And to leave this place.
Do you think people will like it?

You're right. It's not my wedding. Anyway, from what I can tell, the dressmakers in Highgarden will be far superior to the ones in King's Landing. They'd never make me anything as dull as this for my wedding. Loras likes green and gold brocade.
Will they let me invite my family?
But do you think they will?
Good afternoon, Lord Tyrion. I was just trying on a gown for King Joffrey's wedding.
Of course.
Shae. Please excuse her, Lord Tyrion. She's not from here. But I trust her, even though she tells me not to.
It's all right, really.

Growing up at Winterfell, all I ever wanted was to escape, to come here to the capital. See the southern knights and their painted armor and King's Landing after dark-- all the candles burning in all those windows. I'm stupid. A stupid little girl with stupid dreams who never learns.
How do I make the best of my circumstances? I have to marry him.
No.
He's tried.
He's a Lannister.
I'm sorry. Here I am complaining to you.
My son with him. I'll have to-- we'll have to--
I'm not afraid of the pain. Not after what Joffrey's done to me.
He's a dwarf. And Loras-- Loras.
And that's a good thing?
How do you know all this? Did your mother teach you?
You look very handsome, my lord.
I hope I will not disappoint you, my lord.
I doubt that very much, my lord.
When I have to.
What are you doing?
Will you pardon me, my lord?
Thank you, Your Grace.
Yes, Your Grace.
Is that wise, my lord?
Is that wise, Tyrion?
What?
But your father--
What if I never want you to?

4.text: No, thank you.
No, thank you.
I don't need to eat.
How can you help me?
I lie awake all night staring at the canopy thinking about how they died.
Do you know what they did to my brother? How they sewed his direwolf's head onto his body? And my mother. They say they cut her throat to the bone and threw her body in the river.
Will you pardon me, my lord? I'd like to visit the godswood.
I don't pray anymore. It's the only place I can go where people don't talk to me.
You're drunk.
Ser Dontos. The king's nameday celebration. I'm sorry. I should have remembered.
Anyone would have done the same.
I can't take it. It's very, very kind of you, but I can't.
I'll wear it with pride, Ser Dontos.
We have a new queen.
Can we leave now?
Where are we going?
Lord Baelish?
(shakes her head.)
I didn't murder anyone.
Why did you kill him?
He saved me.
He was helping me because I saved his life.
We're all liars here.
Where are you taking me?
Did you kill Joffrey?
I know it was you.
Well, there was Ser Dontos. You used him to get me out of King's Landing, but you would never trust him to kill the king.
Because you're too smart to trust a drunk.
No.
I just do.
The poison. I don't understand. The Lannisters gave you wealth, power. Joffrey made you the Lord of Harrenhal.
I don't believe you. If they catch you, they'll put your head on a spike just like my father's. You'd risk that just to confuse them?
And what do you want?
Who could trust you?
But how would they know?
Is this the only way into the Eyrie?
It's a pleasure to make your acquaintance, Lady Arryn. My name is Al...
It's wonderful to meet you, Aunt Lysa.
Of course. I understand.
I would never say a thing.
They did, and my father's.
Make him fly?
They did. They made us both. Lord Tyrion didn't want to.
No. - We never...
It's a pleasure to meet you, Robin.
Thank you.
Really?
My mother fat? She never let me have my pudding until I'd finished all my proper food.
They're delicious. Where did you get the lemons? You can't grow them up here.
Yes. I'm very lucky.
Oh, I know he does. I'm so grateful.
Well, I'm half Tully. He loved your family so much.
No.
He loves you, Aunt Lysa. He's married to you.
No.
No, never.
What? No, I told you. Lord Tyrion and I never...
Aunt Lysa, no, I...
Nothing. I'm a virgin.
You're hurting me.

I'm a virgin, I swear it. He loves you, Aunt Lysa. All he says is that I'm stupid. I'm a stupid little girl with stupid dreams who never learns and I'm a terrible liar, so I should always tell the truth. And I swear to you that he has never touched me. Not once, not ever.
Hello, Robin.
I'm building my home, Winterfell. At least I think I am. I haven't been back there in a very long time.
It's a long story.
Yes, you certainly are.
Probably never. My family doesn't live there anymore and someone burned it down.
No, I'm afraid not. It's not high up in the mountains. It's down on the ground.
We don't.
I never did anything with them at all. Girls didn't take part in that where I came from.
I like the sound of that.
All right.
Careful. You've ruined it. Now I'm going to have to rebuild the whole thing.
You did.
Knocking things down isn't fixing them. It's ruining them.
You're being stupid.
Robin, I'm sorry, I--
I hit him.
I shouldn't have done that.
If he tells Aunt Lysa...
I was trying to remember what everything looked like. I'll never see it again.
Why did you really kill Joffrey? Tell me why.
Lord Baelish...
You wanted to see me, Aunt Lysa?
No.
I'm so sorry, Aunt Lysa. I never should have hit Robin, I know it. I promise it won't happen--
I didn't. You don't understand.
He kissed me. I pulled away.
Please!
He can stay.
*to Petyr* I'm sorry, Lord Baelish. I have to tell the truth. *to the council* I'll tell you everything.
My name is not Alayne. It's Sansa Stark, eldest daughter of Lord Eddard Stark. Lord Royce, we met when you came to Winterfell. You were escorting your son Ser Waymar to the Wall.

Lord Baelish has told many lies. All to protect me. Since my father was executed, I have been a hostage in King's Landing. A plaything for Joffrey to torture or Queen Cersei to torment. They beat me, they humiliated me, they married me to the Imp. I had no friends in King's Landing...except one. He saved me. Smuggled me away when he had the chance. He knew I'd be safe here in the Eyrie with my own blood, my Aunt Lysa. The Lannisters have friends everywhere. Even the Vale. He made me swear not to tell anyone my true name.

You knew her well, my lords, my lady. You knew she was a troubled woman. She always loved Lord Baelish. She told me herself. From the moment he arrived at the gates of Riverrun, a boy of eight carrying everything he owned in a little sack. She confessed to me she never loved Lord Arryn. She did as her father commanded, as so many of us have. When the gods finally allowed her to be with Lord Baelish, she was so happy. For a time. My aunt was a jealous lady. She was terrified that Lord Baelish didn't love her anymore. That he would abandon her for a younger woman. And then...one day she saw him kiss me.

It was a peck on the cheek, Lord Royce, nothing more. Lord Baelish is my uncle now, in truth, by marriage. He's always been so kind to me. I was so happy to be here, to be free. All because of him. But my aunt turned on me. She cursed me. Called me a whore. Promised to throw me through the Moon Door. When Lord Baelish tried to calm her, she struck him. She said she didn't want to live anymore. She stood on the edge of that Moon Door. He tried to reason with her. Promised her she was the only one he had ever loved, but she stepped through those doors and she was...*begins sobbing*
Yes?
They would have thrown you through the Moon Door if they found you guilty.
If they'd have executed you, what would they have done with me?
Neither do I.
I know what you want.
Shall we go?

5.text: Goodbye Lord Royce, and thank you for all you’ve done for me.
You told Lord Royce we were going to the Fingers.
But we’re heading west.
If he wanted to betray us, he already would have.
No. Do you trust the carriage driver or the knights escorting us?
So where are we going? To a land where you trust everyone?
I know what Ramsay is. I know what he’ll do to me. (looks to Theon) If I’m going to die, let it happen while there’s some of me left.
Before we left, a maester gave you a raven scroll.
My mother used to say, "dark wings, dark words".
So it was good news.?
I thought you still mourn the death of my beloved Aunt Lysa.
I'll have some.
I don't see what all the fuss is about. Why do men love it so much?
Does it give you courage?
No.
I saw you at Joffrey's wedding bowing to the king.
And sometimes we do. You should leave.
That's Moat Cailin.
On our way down to King's Landing, with my father and Arya and… where are you taking me?
The Boltons have Winterfell. (He nods). The marriage proposal, it wasn't for you?
Roose Bolton murdered my brother. He betrayed my family!
He serves the Lannisters.
I won't go.
Not anymore.
I can't marry him. You can't make me. He's a traitor. A murderer.
No!
No, you can't make me. I will starve myself. I will die before I have to go there.
(Smiles). Lord Bolton.
Thank you.
Father never talked about her. Sometimes I'd find him down here, lighting the candles. They say she was beautiful.
Yes, he chose herâ€¦ and then he kidnapped her and raped her.
Dressed for riding?
Where are you going?
King's Landing?
You can't leave me here!
How do you know?
You don't know that.
You think he'll defeat the Boltons?
And if you're right?
But I, I wouldn'tâ€¦ Wardeness of the North
What if you're wrong? What if Stannis never attacks Winterfell, or he does and the Boltons defeat him?
I don't know how to do that.
His father frightens me.
I expect I'll be a married woman by the time you return.
Oh, I don't need-
But who -
I made it myself.
Who, who are you?
My mother. (Pulls away).
Thank you.
I'd rather have a mother.
What is it?
Theon?
Yes, thank you, my lord.
This isn't a strange place. This is my home. It's the people who are strange.
Why are you doing this?
I'm very happy for you.
What do you want?
What others?
What others?
Hunt?
What was your name again?

And how long have you loved him, Myranda. Did you imagine that he would be with you forever, is that it? Then I came along and ruined it. I am Sansa Stark of Winterfell. This is my home and you can’t frighten me.
Go. I can finish on my own.
Yes?
No.
I’m not touching you.
Do you think I care what he does to you.
I take this man.
Yes.
Lord Tyrion was kind, he was gentle, he never touched me.
No, my lord.
Yes sir.
Theon, wait.
Help me.
Theon
He already hurts me every night. All day I’m locked in this room and every night he comes. It can’t be worse.
What did he do to you?
You betrayed my family!
You have to help me!

My family still has friends in the North. All I have to do is give a signal and they’ll rescue me. Climb to the top of the Broken Tower, light this candle, and put it in the window. Promise me, Theon.
Your name is Theon Greyjoy. Last surviving son of Balon Greyjoy, Lord of the Iron Islands, do you hear me? Theon. Promise me.
But isn’t your step mother pregnant?
What happens if she has a boy?
But he’ll be the heir.
But you’re a bastard, a true born will always have the stronger claim.
Tommen Baratheon. Another bastard.
Why. Why Theon.
Reek. Why did you tell him, Reek?
Good. If it weren’t for you I’d still have a family. If I could do to you what Ramsay did to you right here, right now, I would.
Only what?
Tell me!
Tell me, they weren’t what?!
You didn’t…?
Do you know where they went, Bran and Rickon?
Theon, you have to tell me, do you have any idea where Bran and Rickon--

6.text: I can’t.
But it’s too cold. I can’t. I won’t make it. I’ll die.
No, I won’t make it without you.
And I vow...that you shall always have a place by my hearth and…
Meat and mead at my table. And I pledge to ask no service of you that might bring you dishonor. I swear it by the old gods and the new. Arise.
Mother and Father’s room? You should take it.
You are to me.
He did.
Only a fool would trust Littlefinger. I should have told you about him, about the Knights of the Vale. I’m sorry.
Jon.
A raven came from the Citadel. A white raven. Winter is here.
I’m done with all that. I came here every day when I was a girl. I prayed to be somewhere else. Back then I only ever thought about what I wanted, never about what I had.
I was a stupid girl.
What do you want?
I was wrong.
It’s a pretty picture.
You’ve declared for other houses before, Lord Baelish. It’s never stopped you from serving yourself.
You don’t know which way she went?
How did she look?
No, she wouldn’t be.
I should’ve gone with you while I had the chance.
We just have to make it to Castle Black. Once we’re with Jon, Ramsay won’t be able to touch us.
I won’t let him. I’ll tell him the truth about Bran and Rickon.
When you take the black, all your crimes are forgiven.
You’re not coming with us?
Where will you go?
Will Lord Varys ever come back?
He was nice.
This is good soup. Do you remember those kidney pies Old Nan used to make?
Mmm.
Don’t you wish we could go back to the day we left? I want to scream at myself, “Don’t go, you idiot.”
I spent a lot of time thinking about what as ass I was to you. I wish I could change everything.
I was awful, just admit it.
Can you forgive me?
Forgive me.
Where will you go?
Where will we go?
There’s only one place we can go. Home.
We’ll take it back from them.
How many wildlings did you save?
They owe you their lives.
You think they’ll be safe here if Roose Bolton remains Warden of the North?
Winterfell is our home. It’s ours and Arya’s and Bran’s and Rickon’s. Wherever they are, it belongs to our family. We have to fight for it.
If we don’t take back the North, we’ll never be safe. I want you to help me. But I’ll do it myself if I have to.
That’s all right. There are more important things.
Go on.

"You will watch as my soldiers take turns raping your sister. You will watch as my dogs your wild little brother. Then I will spoon your eyes from their sockets and let my dogs do the rest. Come and see. Ramsay Bolton, Lord of Winterfell and Warden of the North.
His father's dead. Ramsay killed him. And now he has Rickon.
Yes, we do.
I heard him say 5,000 once when he was talking about Stannis’s attack.
You're the son of the last true Warden of the North. Northern families are loyal. They’ll fight for you if you ask.
A monster has taken our home and our brother. We have to go back to Winterfell and save them both.
Yes?
How far is Mole’s Town?
Unharmed? What are you doing here?
To come to my aid? Did you know about Ramsay? If you didn’t know, you’re an idiot. If you did know, you’re my enemy.

Would you like to hear about our wedding night? He never hurt my face. He needed my face, the face of Ned Stark’s daughter. But the rest of me, he did what he liked with the rest of me as long as I could still give him an heir. What do you think he did?
What do you think he did to me?
Yes, he enjoyed that. What else do you think he did?
What else?
Maybe you did know about Ramsay all along.
I thought you knew everyone’s secrets.

The other things he did, ladies aren’t supposed to talk about those things, but I imagine brothel keepers talk about them all the time. I can still feel it. I don’t mean in my tender heart it still pains me so. I can still feel what he did in my body standing here right now.
You said you would protect me.
I don’t believe you anymore. I don’t need you anymore. You can’t protect me. You won’t even be able to protect yourself if I tell Brienne to cut you down. And why shouldn’t I?
What if I want you to die here and now?

You freed me from the monsters who murdered my family and you gave me to other monsters who murdered my family. Go back to Moat Cailin. My brother and I will take back the North on our own. I never want to see you again.
I have an army.
The Umbers gave Rickon to our enemies. They can hang. But the Karstarks declared for Ramsay without knowing they had another choice.
How well do you know the North, Ser Davos?
My father always said Northerners are different. More loyal, more suspicious of outsiders.
The North remembers. They remember the Stark name. People will still risk everything for it, from White Harbor to Ramsay’s own door.
No, but I do.
Jon is every bit as much Ned Stark’s son as Ramsay is Roose Bolton’s. Ant there are also the Tullys. They’re not Northern, but they will back us against the Boltons without question.
My uncle the Blackfish has reformed it and retaken Riverrun.
Ramsay received a raven before I escaped Winterfell.
You heard them. We need more men and my uncle has an army.
Can’t risk Ramsay intercepting it. It has to be you.
Ride for Riverrun. My uncle will talk to you and you’ll know how to talk to him.
What is it?
With Jon?
Jon isn’t Tormund. Jon isn’t Davos, the Red Woman, or Stannis for that matter. Jon is Jon. He’s my brother. He’ll keep me safe. I trust him.
I made it myself. Do you like it?
Good, because I made this for you.
I made it like the one Father used to wear. As near as I can remember.
You’re welcome.
I remember when you were born, my lady. You were named for my Aunt Lyanna. It was said she was a great beauty. I’m sure you will be, too.
I did what I had to do to survive, my lady. But I am a Stark. I will always be a Stark.
I would remind you that House Glover is pledged to House Stark. Sworn to answer when called upon.
And that’s a good thing?
62 Mormonts.
So he’s your most trusted advisor now? Because he secured 62 men from a ten year old?
Stannis who lost the Blackwater, who murdered his own brother, who doesn’t have a head?
It’s not enough. We need more men.
If we went down to Castle Cerwyn, I know that Lord- -
Yes, I do.
How do we know you have him?
You’re going to die tomorrow, Lord Bolton. Sleep well.
So you’ve met the enemy, drawn up your battle plans.

You’ve known him for the space of a single conversation, you and your trusted advisors, and you sit around and make your plans on how to defeat a man you don’t know. I lived with him. I know the way his mind works. I know how he likes to hurt people. Did it ever once occur to you that I might have some insight?
You think he’s going to fall into your trap. He won’t He’s the one who lays traps.
He plays with people. He’s far better at it than you. He’s been doing it all his life.
You don’t know him.

We’ll never get him back. Rickon is Ned Starks trueborn son, which makes him a greater threat to Ramsay than you, a bastard, or me, a girl. As long as he lives, Ramsay’s claim to Winterfell will be contested, which means he won’t live long.
Listen to me, please. He wants you to make a mistake.
I don’t know! I don’t know anything about battles! Just don’t do what he wants you to do.
You think that’s obvious?
If you had asked for my advice earlier, I would have told you not to attack Winterfell until we have a larger force, or is that obvious, too?
It’s not enough!
If Ramsay wins, I’m not going back there alive. Do you understand me?
No one can protect me. No one can protect anyone.
Jon.
Where is he?
Your words will disappear. Your house will disappear. Your name will disappear. All memory of you will disappear.
You haven’t fed them in seven days. You said it yourself.
They were. Now they’re starving.

7.text: The castles committed no crimes. And we need every fortress we have for the war to come. We should give the Last Hearth and Karhold to new families, loyal families who supported us against Ramsay.
And then they broke faith.
So there's no punishment for treason and no reward for loyalty?
They died fighting for Ramsay. Give the castles to the families of the men who died fighting for you.
Will you start wearing a crown?
So I can't question your decisions anymore?
Joffrey never let anyone question his authority. You think he was a good king?
You're as far from Joffrey as anyone I've ever met.
You're good at this, you know.
At ruling.
You are. You are. They respect you, they really do, but you have to--
Why are you laughing?
He never said that to me.
Because he was trying to protect us. He never wanted us to see how dirty the world really is, but Father couldn't protect me and neither can you. Stop trying.
I'm not trying to undermine you.
You have to be smarter than Father. You need to be smarter than Robb. I loved them, I miss them, but they made stupid mistakes, and they both lost their heads for it.
Would that be so terrible?
What does she want?
You've been so consumed with the enemy to the north, you've forgotten about the one to the south.
We still have a wall between us and the Night King. Theres nothing between us and Cersei.
You're the military man, but I know her. If you're her enemy, she'll never stop until she's destroyed you. Everyone who's ever crossed her, she's found a way to murder.
I learned a great deal from her.
What do you want, Lord Baelish?
I am safe. I'm at home, surrounded by friends. I have Brienne to protect me from anyone who would harm me.
At the moment, peace and quiet.
No need to seize the last word, Lord Baelish. I'll assume it was something clever.
We need his men. Without the Vale, Ramsay Bolton would still hold this castle. Littlefinger saved us.
I know exactly what he wants.
Do you think it's really Tyrion? It could be someone trying to lure you into a trap.
"All dwarfs are bastards in their father's eyes." What does that mean?

Tyrion is not like the other Lannisters. He was always kind to me, but it's too great a risk. "The Seven Kingdoms will bleed as long as Cersei sits on the Iron Throne. Join us. Together we can end her tyranny."
You're not suggesting Jon meet with her?
Have you forgotten what happened to our grandfather? The Mad King invited him to King's Landing and roasted him alive.
She is here to reclaim the Iron Throne and the Seven Kingdoms. The north is one of those seven kingdoms. This isn't an invitation, it's a trap.
Then send an emissary. Don't go yourself.
You're abandoning your people. Your abandoning your home.
Whose?
How much do we have?
What does that mean?
What's the longest winter in the past 100 years?
You're telling me we don't have enough food, especially not if the armies of the north come back to defend Winterfell.

We must prepare for that eventuality. Every direction the threat comes from, this is the best place to be. We need to start building up our grain stores with regular shipments from every keep in the north. If we don't use it by winter's end we'll give it back to them, but if the entire north has to flee to Winterfell there won't be enough time to bring wagonloads of grain with them.
Maester Wolkan, you'll see to it?
Are they covering those breastplates in leather?
Well, shouldn't they be once the real cold comes?
So they should be.
You don't know Cersei better than anyone here.
That the woman who murdered my mother, father and brother is dangerous? Thank you for your wise council.
I wish Jon was here.
Your father's last living true born son. You're Lord of Winterfell.
I don't know what that means.
Try, please, for me.
How do you know all of this?
I thought you were the three-eyed raven.
Bran --
I have to go back inside, Bran.
You don't have to. I know where she is.
Yes.
You shouldn't have run from the guards.
He did. I hope he comes back soon. I remember how happy he was to see me. When he sees you, his heart will probably stop.
Everyone who knew his face is dead.
I wish I had.
Your list?
How did you get back to Winterfell?
Yes. It's not a very pleasant one.
No, they're not.
Arya, Bran's home too.
Bran has visions.
Why would you go back there?
Who else is on your list?
He's declared for House Stark.
Why would he give you a dagger?
Why?
The cutthroat after your fall?
He's not a generous man. He wouldn't give you anything unless he thought he was getting something back.
What do you mean it doesn't matter?
If they haven't contributed the right amount of grain to the stores then I'm afraid they'll have to make due with --
You're very kind, my lords, but Jon is our king. He is doing what he thinks is best.
I warned Jon this would happen. He can't leave the north and expect it to just sit and wait for him like Ghost.
Well, he's not making it easy. The northern lords are proud.
And?
Don't do that.
Say what you mean.
Are you angry with me?
I listened to their complaints, which is my responsibility as Lady of Winterfell.
Glover has 500 men. Royce has 2,000. Offend them and Jon loses his army.

Winterfell didn't just fall into our hands. We took it back, and the Mormonts and the Hornwoods and the Wildlings and the Vale, all of us working together. Now, I'm sure cutting off heads is very satisfying, but that's not the way you get people to work together.
How can you even think such a horrible thing?
I have work to do.
I remember.
What?
You don't have to read it. I remember.
They forced me to do it.
You don't know what it was like. I was a child.
They told me it was the only way to save father.
You were there?
And what did you do? Did you come running to the rescue? Did you fight off the Lannisters and save father?
But you didn't. Just like me.

You should be on your knees thanking me. We're standing in Winterfell again because of me. You didn't win it back. Jon didn't win it back. He lost the Battle of the Bastards. The Knight's of the Vale won the battle and they rode north for me while you were off where, traveling the world?
Training. Well, while you were training I suffered things you can never imagine.
You never would have survived what I survived.
What are you doing to do with that letter.
Who did you show it to? Where did you find it?
Arya --
Do you know how happy Cersei would be if she saw us fighting? This is exactly what she wants. This is what she's always wanted, to tear us apart --
You're angry. Sometimes anger makes people do unfortunate things.
No, this is the way he is, the way he's always been. He never asked for my opinion. Why would he start now?
This is his writing, his signature. He pledged to fight for Daenerys Targaryen. He's bent the knee.
What does that have to do with anything?
You think he wants to marry her?
Even if I wanted to, Arya would never go along. She always loved Jon far more than she ever loved me, and she'd kill anyone who betrayed her family.
Do you know what she is now? Do you know what the Faceless Men are?
They're killers. And Arya was one of them. What do you think she's after?
She could want me dead because she thinks I wronged my family.
To kill me for marrying our enemies and betraying my family.
To provide proof of my betrayals. To provide justification after she murders me.
Lady
Have my sister
It's not what I want. It's what honor demands.
That I defend my family from those who would harm us. That I defend the North from those who would betray us.
You stand accused of murder. You stand accused of treason. How do you answer these charges Lord Baelish?
Which charges confuse you? Let's start with the simplest one you murdered our aunt, Lysa Arryn. You pushed her through the Moon Door and watched her fall. Do you deny it?
You did it to take power in the Vale. Earlier, you conspired to murder Jon.
You had Aunt Lysa send a letter to our parents telling them it was the Lannisters who murdered Jon.
You conspired with Cersei Lannister and Joffrey Baratheon to betray our father.
Protected me? By selling me to the Boltons?

Sometimes when I'm trying to understand a person's motives, I play a little game. I assume the worst. What's the worst reason you have for turning me against my sisterThat's what you do, isn't it? That's what you've always done turn family against family, turn sister against sister. That's what you did to our mother.
I'm a slow learner, it's true. But I learn.
(Nods.)
And yet, you betrayed her.
And yet, you betrayed me.
When you brought me back to Winterfell, you told me there's no justice in the world, not unless we make it. Thank you for all your many lessons, Lord Baelish. I will never forget them.
It's just strange. In his own horrible way, I believe he loved me.
You did it.
Does that bother you?
You would have. You're the strongest person I know.
Well, don't get used to it. You're still very strange and annoying.
Father
Me, too.

8.text: Lurking somewhere.
Winterfell is yours, Your Grace.
As soon as we heard about the Wall, I called all our banners to retreat to Winterfell. Lord Umber when can we expect your people to arrive?
You'll have as many as we can spare. Hurry back to Last Hearth and bring your people here.

May I ask, how are we meant to feed the greatest army the world has ever seen? While I ensured our stores would last through winter, I didn't account for Dothraki, Unsullied and two full-grown dragons. What do dragons eat, anyway?
So does Hand of the Queen. Depending on the queen, I suppose.
It had its moments.
Apologies for leaving like that.
We both survived.
Cersei told you her army was coming north to fight for you?
And you believed her?
I used to think you were the cleverest man alive.
Come in.
Lord Glover wishes us good fortune, but he's staying in Deepwood Motte with his men.
"I will stand behind Jon Snow," he said.
"The King in the North."
You didn't tell me you were going to abandon your crown.
And a Targaryen queen.
You know I do.
No, she's much prettier.
Did you bend the knee to save the North or because you love her?
You're right. We can't trust him. He attacked my father in the streets. He tried to destroy my house and my family, the same as he did yours.
You vouch for him?
You would fight beside him?
I trust you with my life. If you trust him with yours, we should let him stay.
Keep them open for as long as you can. There are still people coming in from the countryside.
Brienne has been loyal to me, always. I trust her more than anyone.
Tyrion is a good man. He was never anything but decent towards me.
You never should have either.
Families are complicated.
A sad thing to have in common.
He loves you, you know that.
Men do stupid things for women. They're easily manipulated.
I should have thanked you the moment you arrived. That was a mistake.
Who was the first?
And what happens afterwards? We defeat the dead, we destroy Cersei. What happens then?
What about the North? It was taken from us, and we took it back. And we said we'd never bow to anyone else again. What about the North?
You want us to use you as bait?
Go on. I believe in you.
She could have made you happy, for a little while.
And what's that?
That was a long time ago. I've seen much worse than you since then.
And he got what he deserved. I gave it to him.
Hounds.
Without Littlefinger, and Ramsay and the rest, I would have stayed a Little Bird all my life.
The men we have left are exhausted. Many of them are wounded. They'll fight better if they have time to rest and recuperate.
I can't say for certain, not without talking to the officers.
It's not just our people. It's yours. You want to throw them into a war they're not ready to fight?
Arya's the one that killed the Night King.
And we will never forget them. That doesn't mean that I want to kneel to someone who--
You respect it?
You are. You're just as much Ned Stark's child as any of us.
How can I promise to keep a secret if I don't even know what it is?
I swear it.
Why her?
That doesn't mean she'll be a good queen.
Jon will be Warden of the North, so a good relationship seems likely.
Well, I suppose that's up to him.
What are you worried about? Jon's taking our army with him. Your queen still has her dragons--
You're afraid of her.
I don't want Jon to go down there. The men in my family don't do well in the capital.
Tyrion. What if there's someone else? Someone better?
. . . as are the rest of her advisors.
I always wanted to be there when they execute your sister. Seems like I won't get the chance.
Where's Jon?
So is Lord Tyrion. They were both to be brought to this gathering.
If you look outside the walls of your city, you'll find thousands of Northmen who will explain to you why harming Jon Snow is not in your interest.
You swore to follow a tyrant.
Uncle? Please sit.
Bran has no interest in ruling and he can't father children.

I love you, little brother. I always will. You'll be a good king. But tens of thousands of Northmen fell in the Great War defending all of Westeros. And those who survived have seen too much and fought too hard ever to kneel again. The North will remain an independent kingdom, as it was for thousands of years.
I wish there had been another way. Can you forgive me?
But they lost their king.
Where are you going?

name: Arya Stark
aliases: Lanna of the Canals (television series only)

1.text: Move!
Where’s the Imp?
Arya.
That’s Jaime Lannister. The queen’s twin brother.
Where’s the Imp?
l'm not a boy!
Arry.

(pointing Needle at Hot Pie) You want it? l'll give it to you. l already killed one fat boy. l bet you never killed anyone. l bet you're a liar. But l'm not. l'm good at killing fat boys. l like killing fat boys.
lt was a gift.
Which are you?
Thank you, Nymeria. Septa Mordane says I have to do it again. "My things weren't properly folded", she says. Who cares how they're folded?! They're going to get all messed up anyway.
Watch. Nymeria, gloves.
Shut up. Nymeria, gloves!
A present?
It's so skinny.
I can be quick.
I think so.
I know which end to use.
Sansa can keep her sewing needles. I've got a needle of my own.
What are you doing here? Go away.
He's my friend.
Stop it!
Nymeria!
You've got to go. They'll kill you for what you did to Joffrey. Go on... run. Go! Leave now!
Go!
I'm sorry.
No.
That's not true! She just... Bit him a little. He was hurting Mycah.
That's not what happened!
Liar!
Liar! Liar liar liar!
Liar liar liar!
Lady wasn't there! You leave her alone!
I'm practicing.
The Prince.
He's a liar and a coward and he killed my friend.
The Hound does whatever the Prince tells him to do.
You're a liar. And if you told the truth, Mycah would be alive.
Go away!
Mine.
I wasn't playing. And I don't want to be a lady.
It's called Needle.
Stick 'em with the pointy end.
I was trying to learn. I asked Mycah to practice with me. I asked him. It was my fault.
I hate them! I hate all of them. The Hound, the Queen and the King and Joffrey and Sansa.
So was I! He is a liar.
But how you can let her marry someone like that?
Winter is coming.
I don't hate her. Not really.
I can keep it?
Who are you?
It's too heavy.
What if I drop it?
I'm a girl.
A needle.
Syrio says a water dancer can stand on one toe for hours.
Syrio says every hurt is a lesson and every lesson makes you better. Tomorrow I'm going to be chasing cats.
He says every swordsman should study cats. They're quiet as shadows and as light as feathers. You have to be quick to catch them.
Now that Bran's awake will he come live with us?
He wants to be a knight of the Kingâ€™s Guard. He can't be one now, can he?
Can I be Lord of a holdfast?
No. That's not me.
Why do they call you Littlefinger?
Come on. I'm not gonna hurt you.
I'm not a beggar. I live here.
I want to see my father.

My father is Hand of the King! I'm not a boy. I'm Arya Stark of Winterfell and if you lay a hand on me, my father will have both your heads on spikes! Now are you going to let me by or do I need to smack you on the ear to help with your hearing?
They said they were going to kill you.
I didn't see them, but I think one was fat.
I'm not lying! They said you found the bastard and the wolves are fighting the lions and the savage... something about the savage.
In the dungeons, near the dragon skulls.
Chasing a cat.
I'm a girl!
How many guards does my father have?
You wouldn't let anyone kill him, would you?
I don’t want to practice today.
They killed Jory. My father is hurt. I don’t care about stupid wooden swords.
Yes -
I don’t like dolls and k -
Are you dying because of your leg? Is that why you’re sending us home?
You can’t. I’ve got my lessons with Syrio. I’m finally getting good.
Can’t we take Syrio back with us?
Seven hells.
The lion’s not his sigil, idiot. He’s a stag, like his father.
Come on! (dragging Sansa)
You said right, but you went left.
Only 'cause you lied.
I was so. I watched, but you...
My father wouldn't send you.
And I don't have to go with you if I don't want.
Come with me. Run.
Not today.
Not today. Not today.
Needle.
What do you want?
Leave me be. My father's a lord. He'll reward you.
Stay away!
Could l have one? A lemon one or any of them.
How about a nice fat pigeon?
Do you have any stale ones from yesterday? Or any burnt ones?
Hey, where's everyone going? What's happening?
Who?
Let me go.

2.text: What are you doing here?
How did you know we'd come this way?
How did you kill those guards? Was it hard?
Where?
My dancing master was from Braavos.
I want to. But I can't. I need to find my brother and mother. And my sister. I need to find her, too.
What is it?
Could it buy a horse?
Then what good is it?
Valar Morghulis.
Please don't go, Jaqen.
Valar Morghulis.
(Stops walking). What do you want?
(Walks toward the cave). I have friends.
You should have asked nicely.
They don't scare me.
What are gold cloaks doing this far from King's Landing?
They're looking for me.
If you got within a mile of a battle, you'd fill your pants.
Liar.
So?
(Gendry walks over to get more water). Gendry's an armorer's apprentice. Hot Pie, tell Gendry what makes it a battle.
What do the gold cloaks want with you?
You're a liar.
Then I wouldn't get to insult anyone. (Follows him).
No good's ever come? Who asked questions before?
Who asked questions?
Lord Stark.
What did they ask about?
Who's your mom?
And who was your father?
I'm not a girl!
Stupider. Night's Watch doesn't take girls, everyone knows that.
I am not!
I don't need to take a piss… Lommy and Hot Pie can’t know. No one can know.
My name's not Arry. It's Arya. Of House Stark. Yoren is taking me home to Winterfell.
He was never a traitor! Joffrey is a liar.
No. I mean yes. My mother was a lady, and my sister -
Do not call me milady.
I can't sleep.
I don't like the taste.
How do you sleep?
But you've seen things, horrible things.
How do you sleep when you When you have those things in your head?
I close my eyes and I see them up there. All of them standing there. Joffrey, the Queen and and my sister.
Get up.
No, I'm not afraid.
No!
You want Gendry? You already got him. He loved that helmet.
Dragon fire.
Dead people.
Does anyone live?
Joffrey. Cersei. llyn Payne. The Hound. Joffrey. Cersei. llyn Payne. The Hound. Joffrey. Cersei. llyn Payne. The Hound.
The Mountain. What are you doing?
Joffrey. Cersei. llyn Payne. The Hound.
Polliver. The Mountain.
Safer to travel, my lord.
Maidenpool, my lord.
House Mooton, my lord.
(nods.)
Barrowton, my lord. House Dustin. Two crossed longaxes beneath a black crown.
They call him the Young Wolf.
They say he rides into battle on the back of a giant direwolf. They say he can turn into a wolf himself when he wants. They say he can't be killed.
No, my lord. Anyone can be killed.
(gasps)
I was always a girl.
You're one of them now. I should have let you burn.
I didn't have a choice.
Three what?
I can name anyone and you'll kill him?
The one who tortures everyone.
I don't know his name. They call him the Tickler.
You should stand sideface.
Sideways.
Smaller target.
You're practicing for a fight. You should practice right.
Pardon, my lord.
My father, my lord.
A stonemason.
He taught himself.
Loyalty.
Did... Forgive me, my lord. I shouldn't ask questions.
Did you know your father, my lord?
I'll fetch more wood for the fire, my lord.
The armory, my lord.
Lord Tywin sent me.
Lord Tywin gave it to me.
To take to the armory.
Amory Lorch.
Now!
But he's going to tell Tywin. He's getting away. It has to be now.
Yes, my lord.
I'll bring something else.
No.
I'll eat in the kitchen later.
I eat a lot. I just don't grow.
Have you ever lost before?
(shakes her head)
Dragons?
Aegon and his sisters.
It wasn't just Aegon riding his dragon. It was Rhaenys and Visenya, too.
Rhaenys rode Meraxes. Visenya rode Vhagar.
Visenya Targaryen was a great warrior. She had a Valyrian steel sword she called Dark Sister.
(smiles)
Most girls are idiots.
From my father.
Have you met many stonemasons, my lord?
My mother served Lady Dustin for many years, my lord. She taught me how to speak proper Properly.
Yes.
Where's Jaqen?
Where's Jaqen?
I need him now. Lord Tywin's marching tonight.
He's helping me.
Where?
Where?
Where?
I'm sorry. I'll
(annoyed) Where were you?
Tywin Lannister was right here, and now he's gone.
How long after I give you the name does it take you to kill someone?
He's taking his army to attack my brother. I need him dead right now.
You promised you'd help me.
And you'll kill them? Anybody?
All right. Jaqen H'ghar.
That's right.
I'm not joking. A man can go kill himself.
No.
I'll un-name you.
If you help me and my friends escape.
Fine, Jaqen H'ghar.
A girl will obey.
Shut up. What did you bring?
He didn't say. He just said, "Walk through the gates."
He didn't say anything about the guards.
We have to trust him.
Shut up. Stay here if you're afraid.

3.text: Mind if I keep warm? Frey Soldier #2
But I'm hungry.
I've got money.
It's worth a lot.
Sorry.
From you.
The first man.
(whispers) Valar morghulis.
Would you please shut up about it?
I'm not listening.
Shut up.
Jaqen got us out of Harrenhal, so why are you complaining?
Where are we going?
If we were going north, we should have come to the Red Fork River by now.
It's 100 feet wide. How could we have passed it? If we hit the Red Fork, we can follow it west to Riverrun. My mother grew up there. My grandfather he's a lord. He'll protect us.
Shut up.
Shh.
Don't.
You go on down the road. Just keep on singing so we know where you are. Leave us be and I won't kill you.
What friends?
Who are you?
No, who do you fight for?
I don't drink ale.
We're not children.
Gendry's a smith. He was apprenticed in the armory.
Gendry stole us weapons.
He knows how to use a sword and so do I.
My brothers taught me.
You'll free us?
Why are you helping him? He takes us prisoner and now he's our friend?
What am I?
So I can walk away, then?
You remember the last time you were here?
What are you doing? We're about to leave. Hot PIE
Winterfell.
I'm sure. Hot PIE
What is it?
That's the tail?
Good-bye, Hot Pie.
Hey, Hot Pie. It's really good.
Can I take this hood off yet?
What is it?
Ugh!
You murdered Mycah. The butchers boy. My friend. He was 12 years old. He was unarmed. And you rode him down. You slung him over your horse like he was some deer.
That's a lie! I hit Joffrey. Mycah just ran away.
Kill him!
No! ARYA
Burn in hell!
You can't let him go. He's a murderer. He's guilty.
You can't!
What are you doing?
Why?
Have you lost your mind? When the Lannisters find this place, you think they'll spare the smiths? They'll cave your head in with your own helmet.
You don't have to do this.
Robb needs good men, too. We're leaving tomorrow. And then you--
You just said you were serving Lord Beric.
I can be your family.
Joffrey. Cersei. Ilyn Payne. Ser Meryn. The Hound. What are you going to do with me?
I'm a hostage and you're selling me.
But it is that way.
More is than isn't.
So why don't you?
No.
I thought he killed you.
But how?
Could you bring back a man without a head? Not six times. Just once.
I would. You're alive.
Joffrey. Cersei. Ilyn Payne.
Face, tits, balls-- I hit 'em right where I wanted to.
What?
But I have to aim.
Never aim?
There's someone out there.
I don't like that woman.
What does that have to do with anything?
What are you doing? Let go of him.
Tell them to stop. Come on. He wants to be one of you. He wants to join the Brotherhood. Stop them!
Did the Lord of Light tell you that or did she?
You're not doing this for your god. You're doing it for gold.
You're a witch. You're going to hurt him.
I don't talk to traitors.
But you did. You took the gold and you gave him up.
He's not my one true god.
Death.
But what about Riverrun? It's not south. It's west of here.
You swore.
Why? So you can steal their gold?
I don't care what you swear because you're a liar. You lied to Gendry, you lied to me. You'll lie to anyone. I hope the Lannisters kill you all.
There's no one worse than you.
You're lying.
Is that the Blackwater?
Back to King's Landing to Joffrey and the queen.
But why?
Why would they be at the Twins?
Don't! Don't kill him.
You're so dangerous, aren't you? Saying scary things to little girls. Killing little boys and old people. A real hard man you are.
You're wrong. I know a killer. A real killer.
You'd be like a kitten to him. He'd kill you with his little finger.
No.
Don't kill him! Please. Please don't.
No one’s going to believe you’re a hog farmer if you eat them all.
I know they’re still there.
I’m not afraid.
I knew fear when I saw it in you. You’re afraid of fire.
When Beric’s sword went up in flames, you looked like a scared little girl.
And I know why, too. I heard what your brother did to you. Pressed your face to the fire like you’re a nice juicy mutton chop.
Might do.
Someday I’m gonna put a sword through your eye and out the back of your skull.

4.text: When am I going to get a horse of my own?
The little lady wants away from your stench.
Why don't you have any money? Didn't you steal anything from Joffrey before you left?
You're not very smart, are you?
You're fine with murdering little boys, but thieving is beneath you?
You think I'm gonna escape? Where would I go? I'd be dead by nightfall without you. My family's gone. I've got no one.
I'm hungry. You're hungry.
I know him. The small one. His name is Polliver. He captured us and took us to Harrenhal.
He killed Lommy.
He was my friend. Polliver stole my sword and put it right through his neck. He's still got it.
My sword Needle.
Lots of people name their swords.
My brother gave me that sword.
He killed my friend.
Something wrong with your leg, boy?
Can you walk? I've got to carry you?
Fine little blade.
Maybe I'll pick my teeth with it.
People coming. You can shit later, there’s people coming!
Morning.
About ten more miles.
Are you a knight?
But you know how to use that sword.
Does it have a name?
Mine’s “Needle.”
Who taught you how to fight?
Mine never wanted to. Said fighting was for boys.
My mother’s dead.
You’re not a northerner.
Why didn’t you?
The Bloody Gate’s ten miles.
I don’t care what you swore!
I don’t need saving.
You’re gonna die?
I’ll last longer than you.
I want to see the captain.
I want to go north, to the wall.
I can pay.
I wouldn’t need a cabin. Please, I could work, scrubbing the floors, or…
Where’s home?
Wait, I have something else.
It’s not silver, it’s iron.
Valar morghulis.
Gonna rain soon. Where are we?
You think? You don't have a map?
Maybe we should get one.
How far is it to the Eyrie?
And you're sure we're going the right way?
On your way where?
I'd like to see Braavos one day.
I have friends there.
We were just watering the horses. We'll be on our way. Forgive my father. He was wounded fighting in the war. Our cottage burned down while he was gone and my mother with it.
He's never been the same.
The Tullys of Riverrun.
Father!
I'm so sorry.
Really good.
What did you do?!
You told me you weren't a thief.
He took us in. He fed us and you...
You don't know that.
You're the worst shit in the Seven Kingdoms.
Joffrey. Cersei. Walder Frey. Meryn Trant. Tywin Lannister. The Red Woman. Beric Dondarrion. Thoros of Myr. Ilyn Payne. The Mountain.
I can't sleep until I say the names.
Only the ones I'm going to kill.
If he were here right now, what would you do?
I'm almost done. Only one name left.
The Hound.
Practicing.
No one's going to kill me.
It's not fighting. It's water dancing.
The greatest swordsman who ever lived. Syrio Forel, the First Sword to the Sealord of Braavos.
What do you know about anything?
It was not.
Yes.
He was killed.
Meryn Trant. That's why Ser Meryn...
He was outnumbered.
Syrio didn't have a sword. Or armor. Just a stick.
Could be soldiers.
You shouldn't be sitting out here like this.
So why go on?
