Nothing could be worse than this.
Nothing isn't better or worse than anything. Nothing is just nothing.
My name is Arya. Arya Stark.
You were Yoren's prisoners when he was taking me to the Wall. He told me he'd fuck me bloody with a stick.
He can't be. I don't know his name.
Thank you.
You're doing it wrong. You need to burn away that horrible bit there. Otherwise it's gonna get infected and fester. I know you don't like fire, but if you don't do it right--
It'll only take a second. It won't hurt that much.
Why?
Let me wash it out and help you sew it up at least.
Lots of things make me happy.
Killing Polliver, killing Rorge.
At least I could have been there to watch. I wanted to see the look in his eyes when he knew it was over.
You protected him for most of his life. You think you could have saved him?
That's your stupid pride talking. It's why you'll never be a great killer. I'd have killed Joffrey with a chicken bone if I had to.
You should have let me burn it.
That fleabite's got you walking a lot slower than you used to.
You really think my aunt will pay for me?
I've never even met her.
I'm not a lady.

5.text: You were the first person on my list, you know. For killing Syrio Forel, remember him? Probably not. I’ve gotten a few of the others. The Many Faced God stole a few more for me. I’m glad he left me you. Do you know who I am?
I can’t hear you.
You know who I am. I’m Arya Stark.
Do you know who you are?
You’re no one. You’re nothing.
No! No! No, you don’t die! Don’t die! (sobs)
He was my friend.
But if you’re… (looks to the Jaqen who drank the potion and is seemingly dead) Who’s this?
I can’t see!
What’s happening?! What’s happening?!
He's just a statue.
I'm not afraid.
Thank you for bringing me.
Valar dohaeris.
Hello. Valar Morghulis.
Jaqen Hâ€™ghar gave me this.
Please. I crossed the Narrow Sea. I have nowhere else to go.
But wait!
Cersei, Walder Frey, The Mountain, Meryn Trant. Cersei, Walder Frey, The Mountain, Meryn Trant.
...The Mountain, Meryn Trant.
Turn around and go. (pulls out Needle) Turn around and go.
Nothing's worth anything to dead men.
Who are you? Why were they scared of you?
You said there was no Jaqen H'ghar here.
Well who are you then?
I've been sweeping this floor for days.
I didn't come here to sweep floors.
You said that I could be your apprentice. You said you'd teach me how to a Faceless Man.
I want to serve. (Jaqen stops).
Which one is the Many-Faced God? I see the Stranger. I see the Drowned God. I see the Weirwood Face.
Where are they taking him?
What do you want?
What?
(After a moment, perks up). No one.
Ow! Cunt!
I told you, I'm no - (Gets hit again). Do that again and -
You're about to find out.
(Stands up). I am ready.
What do we do with them after we wash them?
What are they doing with the bodies?
No! I’ve been here for weeks. I’m not scrubbing one more corpse until you tell me why I’m doing it.
When?
When do I get to play the game?
The game. The game of faces.
I didn’t even know I was playing.
No one.
Well who are you? What are you doing here? How’d you get here?
What?
Arya.
Westeros. My family home is Winterfell. I’m the youngest daughter of a great lord. Eddard Stark. He died in battle.
After he was executed I fled the capital. Had to kill a stable boy. Drove my sword through his back.
I stabbed him in the gut. I tried to find my mother and brother. I never did. They were murdered by Walder Frey. An outlaw kidnapped me. A man called Polliver.

A man called the Hound. Sandor Clegane. He tried to sell me but was wounded in a fight. He begged me to kill him but I wouldn’t. I left him in the mountains to die. I wanted him to suffer, I hated him.
I hated him.
I hated him!
That’s not a lie!
Yes.
I’m not playing this stupid game anymore!
Valar dohaeris.

I know. Don’t be afraid. I used to be like you. I was sick. I was dying. But my father never gave up on me. He loved me. More than anything in the world, just like your father loves you. So he brought me here. My father prayed to the many faced god. And I drank the water from this fountain. It healed me.
I’ve devoted my life to him now. You don’t want to hurt anymore. Drink.
My name is Lana. I’m an orphan. When I was 8 I begged enough money to buy my first bucket of oysters, and I sold that bucket and made enough money to buy 2 more.

Iit took a while but I finally saved enough to buy myself an oyster cart. Now every morning I make my way down to the canals. I pass the fish mongers and the bakers. I usually see Lhara, my first customer of the day on my way home. Then I turn left onto Moonsinger Lane--
Left onto Ragman Lane, where I do most of my trade.
How will she serve him?
What will she do there?
See what?
Oysters, clams and cockles!
Oysters clams and cockles! Oysters clams and cockles!
Best in the city.
So why would a captain make the wager in the first place?
If the captain dies, the thin man pays his family a lot of money.
The Many Faced God. You said you didn’t know what I would see at the docks.
And then what?
Oysters, clams, and cockels! Oysters, clams, and cockels! Oysters, clams, and cockels! Oysters, clams, and cock--
Oysters, clams, and cockels! Oysters, clams, and cockels!
Three coppers.
The Thin Man wasn’t hungry today.
Tomorrow.

6.text: Thank you.
I can’t see.
My name is Arya Stark. I want you to know that. The last thing you’re ever going to see is a Stark smiling down at you as you die.
You leave the fighting to the little lords, Wylis. Come along, now. It’s no place for you.
Well, he’s never going to learn to fight because he’s a stable boy. So leave him be.
No one.
No one.
A girl has no name.
A girl has no name.
A girl has no name.
No one.
Arya Stark.
Her father was Eddard Stark. Her mother was Catelyn Stark. She had one sister, Sansa, and four brothers.
Three brothers.
Rob, Bran, Rickon. And a half-brother, Jon.
They may be dead for all a girl knows.
Also dead.
Arya Stark left him to die. He was on her list.
He was not on her list anymore. She’d taken him off it.
She did and she did not.
Yes, she was.
Cersei Lannister, Gregor Clegane, Walder Frey.
Which name would you like a girl to speak?
A girl has no name.
No one.
Who was the first?
Where did they go?
A girl has no desires.
Who?
A girl will poison the rum. Lady Crane is the only one who drinks it.
If a girl could use one of the faces from the hall…
She’s a good actress.
Seems like a decent woman.
No. Who wants her dead?
The younger actress. She’s jealous because Lady Crane is better.
A girl has decided.
Wylis! What’s the matter?
Nothing.
Three times.
No.
You’re very good.
So change it. It would all just be farting, belching, and slapping without you.
The queen loves her son more than anything. And he was taken from her before she could say good-bye. She wouldn’t just cry. She would be angry. She would want to kill the person who did this to her.
Mercy.
I have to go. My father’s waiting for me.
Careful of that one. She wants you dead.
You’re Westerosi.
I want to book passage home.
Why do you care?
I want a cabin. And we’ll leave at dawn.
See you at sunrise.
You’re good at that. Where did you learn?
And good at putting holes in them.
What happened to the actress? The one who wanted you dead.
Mmm.
I can’t.
I don’t think I could remember all of the lines.
You wouldn’t be safe. Not while she’s looking for me.
She doesn’t have a name.
Essos is east and Westeros is west. But what’s west of Westeros?
Nobody does. That’s where all the maps stop.
I’d like to see that.
What’s that?
I don’t want any.
Lady Crane?
Lady Crane?
You told her to kill me.
A girl is Arya Stark of Winterfell and I’m going home.

7.text: When people ask you what happened here, tell them the North remembers. Tell them winter came for House Frey.
That's a pretty song. I've never heard it before.
I don't want to steal your food.
King's Landing.
Not so bad, is it?
What are you doing in the Riverlands?
Oh, no, I couldn't. You don't have enough.
You're a long way from home. I'm sure you've had some adventures, though.
Boy or girl?
Why?
It's really good.
I'm going to kill the queen.
Hello, Hot Pie. Sit down. Who's that for?
Mmm. This is good.
I didn't do that.
One or two.
Big lady?
She found me.
You got any ale?
King's Landing.
I heard Cersei's queen now.
Hmm.
Cersei would do that.
Why would I go there? The Boltons have it.
What?
You're lying.
Thanks for the pie.
Thanks.
Take care of yourself, Hot Pie. Try not to get killed.
Nymeria?
Nymeria, it's me, Arya. I'm heading north, girl, back to Winterfell. I'm finally going home. Come with me.
Come with me.
That's not you.
In there. I live here.
I'm Arya Stark. This is my home.
Send for Maester Llewyn or Ser Rodrick. They'll tell you who I am.
Go ask Jon Snow then, the King in the North. He's my brother
If Jon Snow is gone who is in charge of Winterfell?
Which Lady Stark?
Tell Sansa her sister is home.
I'm getting into this castle one way or another. If I'm not who I say I am, I won't last long. But if I am, and Sansa finds out that you turned me away...
Do I have to call you Lady Stark now?
I didn't run. You need better guards.
It suits you, Lady Stark. Jon left you in charge?
That doesn't look like him. It should have been carved by someone who knew his face.
We're not.
They say you killed Joffrey. Did you?
Me too. I was angry when I heard someone else had done it. However long my list got he was always first.
Of people I'm going to kill.
It's a long story. I imagine yours is too.
Mine neither, but our stories aren't over yet.
You saw me?
So did I.
Most of them are dead already.
Where did you get this?
Littlefinger, he's here?
Why would a cutthroat have a Valyrian steel dagger?
Are you sure? It's Valyrian steel.
Don't fight someone like her in the first place.
It's been awhile since I've trained.
He didn't beat the hound. You did. I want to train with you.
You swore to serve both of my mother's daughters, didn't you?
I won't cut you. Don't worry.
No one.
He didn't. He trusted you to hold it for him.
These are mother and father's chambers.
Nothing.
What?
You always liked nice things. It made you feel better than everyone.
They were insulting Jon and you sat there and listened.
Their opinions are important to you?
Not if they lose their heads first.
And if Jon doesn't come back, you'll need their support, so you can work together to give you what you really want.
You're thinking it right now. You don't want to be, but the thought just won't go away.
My lady.
Father used to watch us from up here. He wouldn't say much. You probably don't remember. You were inside knitting all the time.

One time the boys were shooting arrows with Ser Rodrick. I came out here after and Bran had left his bow behind just lying on the ground. Ser Rodrick would have cuffed him if he saw. There was one arrow in the target. There was no one around, just like now. No one to stop me. So I started shooting. And every shot I had to go out there and get my one arrow and walk back and shoot it again. I wasn't very good. Finally I hit the bullseye. It could have been the 20th shot or the 50th. I don't remember. But I hit the bullseye and I heard this.

I looked up and he's standing right here smiling down at me. I knew what I was doing was against the rules. But he was smiling so I knew it wasn't wrong. The rules were wrong. I was doing what I was meant to be doing and he knew it. Now he's dead. Killed by the Lannisters with your help.

That's your pretty handwriting. Septa Mordane used to crack my knuckles because I couldn't write as well as you. "Robb, I write to you today with heavy heart. Our good King Robert is dead. Killed from wounds he took in a boar hunt --

"Father has been charged with treason. He conspired with Robert's brothers against my beloved Joffrey and tried to steal his throne. The Lannisters are treating me well and providing me with every comfort. I beg you, come to King's Landing, swear fealty to King Joffrey and prevent any strife between the great houses of Lannister and Stark. Your faithful sister, Sansa."
Did they. With a knife at your throat? Did they put you on a rack and stretch you until your bones started to pop?
So was I. I would have let them kill me before I betrayed my family.

And you were stupid enough to believe them. I remember you standing on that platform with Joffrey and Cersei when they dragged father too the block. I remember the pretty dress you were wearing. I remember the fancy way you did your hair.
I was there standing in the crowd near Baelor's statue.
I wanted to.
I didn't betray him. I didn't betray Robb. I didn't betray our entire family for my beloved Joffrey.
I was training.
Oh, I don't know about that. I can imagine quite a lot.
I guess we'll never know.
I don't know yet.
You're scared, aren't you? What are you scared of? You didn't commit any crimes. No one's going to hang you.
Are you scared I'll show it to Jon and he'll be angry? No. That's not Jon. He'll understand. You were just a scared little girl all alone with the wicked Lannisters.

The northern lords will read it. They wouldn't think much of Lady Sansa if they knew how she did Cersei's bidding. What would little Lyanna Mormont say? She's younger than you were when you wrote this. Are you going to say, "But I was just a child"?
Sometimes fear makes them do unfortunate things. I'll go with anger.
Are you sure you want to do this?
And what does honor demand?
All right, then. Get on with it.
My sister asked you a question.
You told our mother
Are you all right?
You did the right thing.
I'm just the executioner. You passed the sentence. You're the Lady.
I was never going to be as good a lady as you. So I had to be something else. I never could have survived what you survived.
I believe that's the nicest thing you've ever said to me.
"In winter, we must protect ourselves. Look after one another."
I miss him.

8.text: You used to be taller.
How did you survive a knife through the heart?
Needle.
Once or twice.
Valyrian steel.
Too heavy for me.
She doesn't like your queen, does she?
She's the smartest person I've ever met.
I'm defending our family. So is she.
Don't forget that.
Leave him be.
First I robbed you.
That was a nice ax you made for him. You've gotten better.
Thanks. So do you.
Stay close to that forge, then.
Don't call me that.
Here's my wish.
Can you make it?
Can you make it or not?
You don't know any other rich girls.
You make my weapon yet?
You should make mine first. And make sure it's stronger than this.
Are you going to be down in the crypt?
But you're a fighter.
You've fought them?
How many?
What are they like?
"Really bad"?
Even a smith's apprentice can do better than "really bad." What do they look like? What do they smell like? How do they move? How hard are they to kill?
I know Death.
He's got many faces.
I look forward to seeing this one.
My weapon?
We're not leaving you alone out there.
Dragonfire will stop him?
Guess I've changed.
What are you doing up here?
No, I mean, what are you doing up here? You joined the Brotherhood. You went beyond the Wall with Jon. You're here now. Why? When was the last time you fought for anyone but yourself?
For a little while.
I'm not spending my final hours with you two miserable old shits.
That for me?
This'll work.
What did the Red Woman want with you?
Why your blood?
Was that your first time?
Your first time with a woman.
Were you with other girls before that in King's Landing?
Or after?
You don't remember?
One? Two? Twenty?
Yes, you did.
We're probably going to die soon. I want to know what it's like before that happens.
I'm not the Red Woman. Take your own bloody pants off.
I am celebrating.
Congratulations.
You'll be a wonderful lord, and any lady would be lucky to have you. But I'm not a lady. I never have been. That's not me.
We need a word.
I respect that.
We needed her. We needed her army, her dragons. You did the right thing. And we're doing the right thing telling you we don't trust your queen.
I'll never know her. She's not one of us.
That's all right. I don't need many allies.
We're family. The four of us. The last of the Starks.
You're my brother. Not my half-brother or my bastard brother. My brother.
What is it?
I swear it.
Me neither.
Don't like heroes.
Felt better than dying. You're heading to King's Landing?
Me too.
Neither do I.
Probably.
I came to kill Cersei. Your queen got there first.
Try telling Sansa.
Jon. She knows who you are. Who you really are. You'll always be a threat to her. And I know a killer when I see one.
Say another word about killing my brother and I'll cut your throat.
I can't.
(chuckles) I'm not going back north.
What's west of Westeros?
No one knows. It's where all the maps stop. That's where I'm going.
Right here.

1.text: Relax your bow arm.
Lad, go run back and get the rest.
There are no direwolves south of the Wall.
What is it?
I hear the prince is a right royal prick.
Go on, Tommy, shave him good. He’s never met a girl he likes better than his own hair.
Uncle Benjen.
I’m good.
Time for bed.
l'll kill them all. Every one of them. l will kill them all.
Renly is not the king.
That doesn't make Renly king. He's Robert's youngest brother. lf Bran can't be Lord of Winterfell before me, Renly can't be king before Stannis.
Now and always.
You've said goodbye to Bran? He's not going to die. I know it.
My mother?
Good. Next time I see you, you'll be all in black.
Farewell, Snow.
I'll make the appointments. We'll talk about it first thing in the morning.
When was the last time you left this room?
He's not going to die, mother. Maester Luwin says the most dangerous time has passed.
Rickon needs you. He's six. He doesn't know what's happening. He follows me around all day, clutching my leg, crying...
Fire. You stay here. I'll come back.
They come into our home and try to murder my brother? If it's war they want...
I'll ride to King's Landing.
Mother, you can't.
What about Bran?
What are you telling him now?
Get your supper. I want some time with him. One time she told me the sky is blue because we live inside the eye of a blue-eyed giant named Macumber.
How do you feel? You still don't remember anything? I've seen you climb a thousand times. In the wind, in the rain... A thousand times. You never fall.
Don't ever say that.
Any man of the Night's Watch is welcome at Winterfell.
I'm not your boy, Lannister. I'm Lord of Winterfell while my father is away.
Why are you here?
Is this some kind of trick? Why do you want to help him?
You've done my brother a kindness. The hospitality of Winterfell is yours.
Not too fast.
Not now.
You’re talking about war.
Only the Lord of Winterfell can call in the bannermen and raise an army.
You want me to march on Casterly Rock?!
And it’s not your duty, because it’s not your House.
Where’s Bran?
Drop the knife. Let him go and I’ll let you live.
Are you all right?
Have you lost your mind? What if you’d missed?
You don’t have the right -
What about her?
We’ll keep her alive.
Treason? Sansa wrote this?
Joffrey puts my father in chains, now he wants his ass kissed?
I won't refuse. His Grace summons me to King's Landing, I'll go to King's Landing.
They've all sworn to defend my father, have they not?
I must be.
Why is that good?
Galbart Glover will lead the Van.
You are welcome to do so, Lord Umber.
My Lord father taught me it was death to bare steel against your Liege Lord.
Shh, it's all right.
South. For father.
The Lannisters have spies everywhere.
Aye, they do.
There must always be a Stark at Winterfell.
I'll send letters whenever I can, but if you don't hear from me, don't be scared.
The River Lords are falling back with Jaime Lannister at their heels.
Mother!
There was no one else.
None of them are Starks.
If you think you can send me back to Winterfell...
There was a letter. From Sansa.
No.
18,000. If I go to King's Landing and bend my knee to Joffrey...
And if I lose?
They were butchered in their sleep.
Well, that makes it simple then.
To do either we need to cross the river and the only crossing is at The Twins.
Where did you find him?
How high did you get?
My father understands mercy, when there is room for it.
Tell Lord Tywin, Winter is coming for him.
You call me boy again.
Go on.
lt's a birthday message to his grand-niece Walda.
He's Grandfather's bannerman. We can't expect his support?
Father rots in a dungeon. How long before they take his head? We need to cross the Trident and we need to do it now.
Have my horse saddled and ready.
My father would do whatever it took to secure our crossing. Whatever it took. lf l'm going to lead this army, l can't have other men doing my bargaining for me.
Well? What did he say?
Huh.
What does he want in return?
Fine, fine. And?
She won't be happy about that. And?
l see. Did you get a look at his daughters?
And?
Can l refuse?
Then l consent.
By the time they knew what was happening, it had already happened.
He's more use to us alive than dead.
lf we do it your way, Kingslayer, you'd win. We're not doing it your way.
l sent 2,000 men to their graves today.

Aye. But the dead won't hear them. (making a speech to his bannermen) One victory does not make us conquerors. Did we free my father? Did we rescue my sisters from the queen? Did we free the North from those who want us on our knees? This war is far from over.

2.text: If I left you with one of my bannermen, your father would know within a fortnight, and my bannerman would receive a raven with a message, "Release my son and you'll be rich beyond your dreams. Refuse and your house will be destroyed, root and stem.”
Oh, I trust them with my life. Just not with yours.
You insult yourself, Kingslayer. You've been defeated by a boy.

You're held captive by a boy. Perhaps you'll be killed by a boy. (Grey Wind enters the cage. Jaime looks very nervous). Stannis Baratheon sent ravens to all the high lords of Westeros. King Joffrey Baratheon is neither a true king nor a true Baratheon. (Jaime focuses back on Robb). He's your bastard son.
My father learned the truth. That's why you had him executed.
Your son killed him so the world wouldn't learn who fathered him. And you... you pushed my brother from a window because he saw you with the queen.
I'm sending one of your cousins down to King's Landing with my peace terms.
No, but he's starting to know me.
It's better than three defeats.
You're Ser Alton Lannister?

I offer your cousins peace if they meet my terms. First, your family must release my sisters. Second, my father's bones must be returned to us so he may rest beside his brother and sister in the crypts beneath Winterfell. And the remains of all those who died in his service must also be returned. Their families can honor them with proper funerals.
Third... Joffrey and the Queen Regent must renounce all claim to dominion of the North. From this time, till the end of time, we are a free and independent kingdom.
Neither Joffrey nor any of his men shall set foot in our lands again. If he disregards this command, he shall suffer the same fate as my father, only I don't need a servant to do my beheading for me.
These are my terms. If the Queen Regent and her son meet them, I'll give them peace. If not, I will litter the south with Lannister dead.
Oh, is he? You'll ride at daybreak, Ser Alton. That will be all for tonight.
You don't have to call me ‘Your Grace’ when no one's around.
I'm glad someone's gotten used to it.
Of course they are.
Men who fought my father.
I need his ships. They say he has 200.
I understand you don't trust Lord Greyjoy.
Yes. And now I'm the one rebelling against the throne. Before me, it was father. You married one rebel and mothered another.
If I trade the Kingslayer for two girls, my bannermen will string me up by my feet.
It's more complicated than that! You know it is.
You can't go to Winterfell.
I'll send Rodrik to watch over the boys, ‘cause tomorrow, you'll ride south to the Stormlands.
Because I need you to negotiate with Renly Baratheon. He's rallied an army of 100,000. You know him. You know his family.

Which of these lords do I trust more than you? If Renly sides with us, we'll outnumber them two to one. When they feel the jaws beginning to shut, they'll sue for peace. We'll get the girls back. Then we'll all go home for good.
We will all be together again soon, I promise.
(Pauses) Give Lord Renly my regards.
I know that.
I love her.
It is important to me.
And that is what would be in store for me with one of Walder Frey's daughters, what you and father had?
Now you're arguing just to argue because you arranged it.
My father is dead. And the only parent I have left has no right to call anyone reckless.
Father, smith, warrior, mother ,maiden, crone, stranger.
I am hers and she is mine from this day until the end of my days.
I’m sending one of your cousins down to King’s Landing with my peace terms.
Men who fought my father.
I need his ships.
We're not executing prisoners, Lord Bolton.
I doubt it.
My father outlawed flaying in the North.
We're not torturing them.
The Lannisters hold prisoners of their own. I won't give them an excuse to abuse my sisters.
You'll die if she doesn't.
Put this in your mouth and lie down. You don't want to watch.
Bite on it. It's better than biting your own tongue, believe me.
What's your name?
Your last name?
You know my family name. You have me at a disadvantage.
They killed my father.
The family he fights for.
I have no hatred for the lad.
You'd have us surrender, end all this bloodshed. I understand. The country would be at peace and life would be just under the righteous hand of good King Joffrey.
If the gods give me strength.
I don't know. We'll go back to Winterfell. I have no desire to sit on the Iron Throne.
I don't know.
First we have to win the war.
You never told me where you're from.
Volantis? You're far from home. The boy was lucky you were here.
Quent.
Lady Talisa.
I'm not sure I'm a lady.
It's hard to keep all the rules straight. But if I remember my lessons, a woman of noble birth is always called a lady. Unless she's a queen or a princess. I could find someone who knows.
Because it's obvious.
I'd call you a liar.
(nods)
Better at amputations, I'm afraid.
Quite a pretty spot.
I couldn't really discuss troop movements with you.
Of course, a spy would deny being a spy.
Mother. Mother, this is Lady Talisa. She's been helping with the wounded. She's been very helpful.
I've missed you.
You surprised me, that's all. I didn't think I'd see you today.
I know.
I know.
I haven't forgotten.
This cannot be true.
Why? Why would Theon
My brothers?
I must go north at once.
How can I call myself king if I can't hold my own castle? How can I ask men to follow me if I can't
There will be no talk. He will die for this.
Tell your son Bran and Rickon's safety is paramount. And Theon, I want him brought to me alive. I want to look him in the eye and ask him why. And then I'll take his head myself.
And what did she say?
And what then?
If every man were held accountable for the actions of every distant relative, Ser Alton, we'd all hang.
You've acted with honor. I thank you for it. Lord Karstark, see that Ser Alton's pen is clean, and give him a hot supper.
Is there room for Ser Alton?
Have the men build him a new pen. Put him in with the Kingslayer for now. Have your boy watch over them.
That will be all.
And my enemies, as some of my bannermen are fond of mentioning.
That's what I tell my bannermen.
If you need help finding these
Continue, my lady.
Yes.
I expect he will.
Come with me to the Crag.
Let the maester show you his stores. I want the wounded men to be treated well, all the wounded men.
You know very well.
I've never met her.
Frey, I suppose. I don't know her first name.
An important bridge.
It was before they killed my father. I still thought I could march south and rescue him in time, but only if I crossed that bridge.
He was the best man I ever met. I know children always think that about their fathers, but

He once told me that being a lord is like being a father, except you have thousands of children and you worry about all of them. The farmers plowing the fields are yours to protect. The charwomen scrubbing the floors, yours to protect. The soldiers you order into battle. He told me he woke with fear in the morning and went to bed with fear in the night. I didn't believe him. I asked him, "How can a man be brave if he's afraid?" "That is the only time a man can be brave," he told me.
He would have liked you.
He didn't care much about gold or glory.
Because we'll never be safe until the Lannisters are defeated. And because I believe in justice.
That would be a start.
How? How?
Tell me this isn't true.
Why?
No! You knew I would not allow it and you did it anyway.
Jaime Lannister has played you for a fool. You've weakened our position. You've brought discord into our camp. And you did it all behind my back. Make sure she's guarded day and night.
Send another 40 with our fastest horses.
Still no word?
Theon has my brothers. If we storm the castle
Send word to your son. Any ironborn who surrender will be allowed to return safely to their homes.
Any ironborn with the exception of Theon Greyjoy. He betrayed our cause. He betrayed me. And we will hunt him down no matter where he runs.

How am I? I've had to arrest my mother. The Lannisters have my sisters. The man I considered my closest friend has seized my home and my brothers. I'm fighting a war and I don't know if I should march south or north.
No. Forgive me. You're being kind. I have no right.
That's not the kind of king I want to be.
I don't know. The good kind. Most kings grew up as princes. They spend their whole lives preparing for the crown. I was raised to be Lord of Winterfell.
I'd like to hear you play the harp.
How did you go from reciting Valyrian poetry to sawing off men's feet?
I don't want to marry the Frey girl.
But you needed that bridge. I hope it's a very beautiful bridge.

3.text: There won't be a siege. The Mountain can't defend a ruin.
The Lannisters have been running from us since Oxcross. I'd love a fight. The men would love a fight. I don't think we're going to get one.
Robb
Find her a chamber that will serve as a cell.
She freed Jaime Lannister. The Lannisters robbed them of their sons and she robbed them of their justice.
What's your name, friend?
Did you ever think you'd marry one?
Never?
Let me guess which one is the good news. ROOSE BOLTON
We'll travel to the funeral together. Lord Bolton will garrison here until we return.

By the time Bolton's bastard-RAMSAY got to Winterfell, the ironborn were gone. They massacred everyone and put the castle to the torch. And BRAN and RICKON have not been found. They may have escaped. Or Theon may have taken them back to the Iron Islands as hostages.
No.
My grandfather's funeral is not a distraction. RICKARD KARSTARK
No. RICKARD KARSTARK
My Uncle Edmure has his forces garrisoned there. We need his men. RICKARD KARSTARK
Have you lost faith in our cause? RICKARD KARSTARK
If you no longer believe- RICKARD KARSTARK
You don't think we can win? RICKARD KARSTARK
Have you not been speaking your mind, Lord Karstark? RICKARD KARSTARK
It's not about glory. Your instructions were to wait for him to come to you.
What value was the mill?
Is he there now? Of course not.

I wanted to draw the Mountain into the west, into our country where we could surround him and kill him. I wanted him to chase us, which he would have done because he is a mad without a strategic thought in his head. I could have that head on a spike by now. Instead, I have a mill.
Willem and Martyn Lannister are 14 years old.
Tywin Lannister has my sisters. Have I sued for peace?
Do you think he'll sue for peace because we have his father's brother's great-grandsons?
How many men did you lose?
We need our men more than Tywin needs his!
You would have. Right here today at this gathering if you had been patient.
You know who isn't? Tywin Lannister.
Bring them in.
Is that all of them? It took five of you to murder two unarmed squires?
Vengeance? Those boys didn't kill your sons. I saw Harrion die on the battlefield and Torrhen--
They were boys! Look at them.
My mother had nothing to do with this. This was your treason.
Leave him.
Escort Lord Karstark to the dungeon. Hang the rest.
This one was only the watcher. Hang him last so he can watch the others die.
Would you make me a liar as well as a murderer?
I'm not fighting for justice if I don't serve justice to murderers in my ranks, no matter how highborn. He has to die.
You tended to their wounds. You brought them supper. Now they're dead.
That didn't stop you from betraying me. And it won't save you now.
Kneel, my lord.
Rickard Karstark, Lord of Karhold, here in sight of gods and men, I sentence you to die. Would you speak a final word?
You were right.
The Karstarks are gone. Almost half our forces. Tywin Lannister knows what he needs to do to make us unravel. Nothing. Only wait.
What can I do? Attack King's Landing? There's nothing he'd like better. He'd crush us in a day.

Winter could last five years. Once my bannermen are home again, sitting by the fire, surrounded by their families, warm and safe, they'll never ride south again. When I gathered my lords together, we had a purpose, a mission. Now we're like a band of bickering children.
What?
Here. And we're here. King's Landing--
I can't force them to meet us in the field and I can't attack them where they're strongest, but I can attack them where they're not.
And Casterly Rock can't run away. I'm going to take their home away from them.

I need men to replace the Karstarks who marched home. There is only one person in this kingdom with that kind of army who hasn't already sided with the Lannisters. The man whose daughter I was supposed to marry-- Walder Frey.
Thank you for riding here so quickly. I know travel isn't easy in these times.
Of course. He deserves as much. I was in the wrong. Black WALDER
We are fighting for the North. Harrenhal is not in the North. It is his once the war is over and we have no further strategic need for it.
We will do whatever we can to give Lord Frey what he needs.
He has every right to be. Please excuse us while we discuss it.
He's a proud man and we've wounded him.
It's all right. You heard him. If you refuse, our alliance with the Freys is dead.
I have a war to fight. We can't win it without them. I have no time to haggle. You said you wanted to make amends for the Stone Mill.
I've won every battle, but I'm losing this war. If we don't do this and do it now, we're lost.
You're paying for my sins, Uncle. It's not fair or right. I'll remember it.
Frey will wait. He knows we're coming.
Edmure is the best match a Frey has had in the history of their house. We should all get some sleep.
If you don't put some clothes on, I can't promise I won't attack you again.
Who are you writing?
Is that Valyrian?
Gaaa? (sighs) Say hello for me.
'Ritsas.'
Does she know her daughter's a queen?
That will be a surprise, I expect.
How am I supposed to sit here planning a war when you're over there looking like that?
I will.
What, now? Are you certain?
Angry? You're my queen.
Maybe one of each.
I love you. Do you hear me? I love you.
No.
If we take Tywin's castle from him, the lords of Westeros will realize he's not invincible. Take his home, take his gold, take his power.
You begged me not to send Theon to negotiate with his father and I ignored your advice.
Now Winterfell is burned to the ground. The North is overrun with Ironborn and Bran and Rickon are gone.
So, Casterly Rock? I'm asking your advice.
If Walder Frey cooperates.
We'll lose the war and die the way father died. Or worse.
We thank you for your hospitality, my lord.
I have come to make my apologies, my lord, and to beg your forgiveness.

My ladies. All men should keep their word, kings most of all. I was pledged to marry one of you and I broke that vow. The fault is not with you. Any man would be lucky to have any one of you. I did what I did not to slight you, but because I loved another. I know these words cannot set right the wrong I have done to you and your house. I beg your forgiveness and pledge to do all I can to make amends so the Freys of the Crossing and the Starks of Winterfell may once again be friends.
Thank you, my lord.
My mother’s alone with Roose Bolton. I should rescue her.
Be kind. She’s finally starting to like you.
Perhaps I’ve made a terrible mistake.
Striking your king is an act of treason.
[Gets up from his seat and addresses WALDER] If you think the time is right, Lord Walder, by all means, let us bed them.
I suppose it does seem strange from a foreigner’s perspective.
It’s tradition. [TALISA stares at ROBB] Without the bedding ceremony, there’s no real proof the lord and lady consummated their marriage.
Boy or girl?
Oh, do you? It seems to me the father should have some say in his son’s naming.
I do.
Mother.

1.text: Mountain lion?
It’s a freak.
Right. Give it here.
I take orders from your father, not you.
The runt of the litter. That one’s yours, Snow.
It’s for the queen, I bet. I hear she’s [sleek as a mink?]
Think of all those southern girls he gets to stab with his right royal prick.
Am l your brother, now and always?
(takes out his sword, bows to Robb) My sword is yours in victory and defeat, from this day until my last day.
Saw what, my lady?
If it comes to that, you know I'll stand behind you.
We have visitors.
Really? If I was cooped up all day with no one but this old bat for company, I'd go mad. Anyway, you don't have a choice. Robb's waiting.
Neither do I. But Robb's Lord of Winterfell, which means I do what he says and you do what I say. Hodor! (Hodor enters, hoisting up Bran and carrying him away) Help Bran down the hall.
Couldn't resist some northern ass? If you like redheads, ask for Ros.
He's not my master.
She wasn't feeling well.
My lady's whereabouts...
Must have been a pretty sight.
We were outnumbered 10 to one.
Careful, Imp.
Famed for their skills at archery, navigation and lovemaking.
Shh... Keep it down. You're not supposed to be inside the castle walls.
Important enough for the likes of you.
Who? the Imp? I'd call him half a nobleman.
Why should I be jealous?
Anyone with a few coppers in his pocket can own you for the night. What's a dwarf like down below? I've always wondered.
Hmm?
Generous tipper. I guess gold is cheap for a Lannister.
I'm a Greyjoy. We've been Lords of the Iron Islands for 300 years. There's not a family in Westeros that can look down on us, not even the Lannisters.
I’ve been Lord Stark’s ward since I was eight years old.
My father fought for the freedom of his people! What did your father do? Fucked a cook and whelped a whore.
I’m not a boy.
I don’t want to pay for it.
When are you gonna tell him?
Blood for blood. You need to make the Lannisters to pay for Jory and the others.
I’m talking about justice.
A Lannister put his spear through your father’s leg. The Kingslayer rides to Casterly Rock where no one can touch -
You’re not a boy anymore. They attacked your father. They’ve already started the war. It’s your duty to represent your House when your father can’t.
I don’t know. It’s not my House.
Tough little lad. In the Iron Islands, you’re not a man until you’ve killed your first enemy. Well done.
He would have killed you and cut Bran’s throat.
To what, to save your brother’s life? It was the only thing to do, so I did it.
Stop! Stop! What are you doing?!
In a turnip cart?
And you can afford that?
There’s a thousand girls like you in King’s Landing.
Yes, you’ll be very popular until some fat lord comes to visit with a big belly and a little prick and he can’t get it up so he knocks all your teeth out.
Don’t be a fool.
Let me see it one more time?
I’m going to miss you!
You're a very lucky girl. Do you know that?
The Iron Islands.
You've never heard of the Iron Islands?
Trust me, My Lord. You're not living in the wilderness anymore.
Lord.
Why? What do you mean why? My father is Balon Greyjoy, Lord of the Iron Islands.
I will be lord after my father.
No, you...You having a go at me? Is that it?
I'm not a Southerner.
You're an impudent little wench, aren't you?
Impudent. It means rude. Disrespectful.
I thought she was our prisoner.
Are you afraid?
Good.
It means you're not stupid.
We had not thought to meet you here, My Lady.
Lord Frey controls that bridge.
Robb's right.
Or so Walder Frey would have you think.
Just march up to his gates and tell him you're crossing. We've got five times his numbers. You can take the Twins if you have to.
Or throw you in a dungeon. Or slit your throat.
Kill him, Robb. Send his head to his father. He cut down ten of our men. You saw him.
The bards will sing songs of their sacrifice.

2.text: A word, Your Grace?
It's not so bad once you get used to it.
The Lannisters are going to reject your terms, you know?

We can fight them in the fields as long as you like, but we won't beat them until you take King's Landing. And we can't take King's Landing without ships. My father has ships and men who know how to sail them.

Men who fought King Robert to free themselves from the yoke of the South, just like you're doing now. I'm his only living son. He'll listen to me. I know he will. I'm not a Stark. I know that. But your father raised me to be an honorable man. We can avenge him together.
I will kill that man. I don't care how many arrows they feather me with, how many spears they run through me, I will kill that horn-blowing cunt before I fall.
I know I'm surrounded. I know that because I stood on the battlements and saw I was surrounded.
Thank you, wise bald man. Thank you for explaining siege tactics to me.
No word from my father?
Send more ravens.
The first time I saw Winterfell

First time I saw Winterfell, it looked like something that had been here for thousands of years and would be here for thousands of years after I was dead. I saw it and I thought, "Of course, Ned Stark crushed our rebellion and killed my brothers. "We never stood a chance against the man who lives here."

Yes, my captors were so very kind to me. You love reminding me of that. Everyone in this frozen pile of shit has always loved reminding me of that. You know what it's like to be told how lucky you are to be someone's prisoner? To be told how much you owe them? And then to go back home to your real father
I will kill that man. I swear to the Drowned God, the Old Gods, the New Gods, to every fucking god in every fucking heaven, I will kill that man.
And what's your counsel, trusted friend?

There's nowhere to run. I'd never make it back to the Iron Islands. And even if I did, even if by some miracle I slipped through the lines and made it home, I'd be a coward. The Greyjoy who ran. The shame of the family.
I won't make it to the Wall. I won't make it 10 feet past the Winterfell gates.
The opportunity for Jon Snow to cut my throat in my sleep.
I've done a lot, haven't I? Things I never imagined myself doing.
You may be right. But I've gone too far to pretend to be anything else.
You hear that? That's the mating call of the Northmen. They want to fuck us. Well, I haven't had a good fuck in weeks. I'm ready for one.
They say every ironborn man is worth a dozen from the mainland.
You think they're right?

We die today, brothers. We die bleeding from 100 wounds with arrows in our necks and spears in our guts, but our war cries will echo through eternity. They will sing about the battle of Winterfell until the Iron Islands have slipped beneath the waves. Every man, woman and child will know who we were and how long we stood. Aggar and Gelmarr, Wex and Urzen, Stygg and Black Lorren. Ironborn warriors will cry out our names as they leap onto the shores of Seagard and Faircastle.
Mothers will name their sons for us.
Girls will think of us with their lovers inside them.
And whoever kills that fucking horn-blower will stand in bronze above the shores of Pyke!
What is dead may never die!
We won’t beat them until we take King’s Landing, and we can’t take King’s Landing without ships. My father has ships, and men who know how to sail them.
I’m his only living son. He’ll listen to me.
(Removes his jacket). Looks smaller.
(Removes more of his clothes). They'll be waiting for me on the docks.

Anyone who matters, (Takes off his shirt), this is a big day for them. They haven't had much to get excited about since I left. It's a hard place the Iron Islands always has been. It's cold and it's wet.
They say hard places breed hard men, (Unbuttons his pants), and hard men rule the world.
(Kneels down). Try smiling with your lips closed. (She does). Hmm, better.
(Taking off his pants). I don't blame him.
Quit talking about your father. He's right about us. Our wives from the Iron Islands, they're for breeding. That's not enough for us. That's why we take saltwives, from the women we capture.
Your place is on this ship.
I haven't paid you.
Pears and oranges. Wine from the Arbor. And the heir to Pyke of the Iron Islands. (The man makes no response). The only living son of Balon Greyjoy. (The man continues to make no response). Me.
I need to get to Pyke.
I bet you can.
None like you.
You don't know what you're like. You need someone to teach you. Know who I am?
Have my things sent up to the castle.
You should give me the reins, I'm a better rider than you. I've been on horseback for the last nine years.
Don't you worry about my hands. (Theon begins fondling her). The sea's in my blood.
I have a proposal for my father. One that will make him king again. And me after him. You may stay at the castle tonight, if you're lucky.
An order, from your future king. You can tell your grandchildren about this night.
Father.
A man. Your blood and your heir.
Lord Stark is gone.
What's done is done. I've brought you a proposal from Robb Stark.
If my clothes offend you, I will change them.
Gold.
(Steps forward). My blood is salt and iron.
The offer he makes, is one I proposed.
I've lived with him, hunted with him, fought at his side, he thinks of me as a brother.
I forget nothing. I remember my brothers. And I remember when my father was a king.
I will lead the attack myself.
I'm your son. Your only living heir. Who else?
I told you to wait outside. (The person who entered is revealed to be Yara). How did you get past the guards?
Yara?
She can't lead an attack!
You're a woman!
You won't stand a chance against the Lannisters on your own.
What are you doing here?
You lying bitch.
Recognize you? How could I? The last time I saw you you looked like a fat little boy.
Why didn't you tell me?
Father.
And what's my role in all this?
A ship? You give her 30 and I get one?
I'm to fight fishermen?
Father, I fought with Robb Stark. I know his men. He won't give up the North so easily.
What do you know of it, woman? I'm a proven warrior.

I'm not protecting anyone. I just wonder if it's not wiser to wait. Why risk going against the North if they would be our allies? Rise up against them and they could destroy us. But if we pledge fealty to them, they'll give us Casterly Rock.
We do not sow.
You act as if I volunteered to go. You gave me away, if you remember. The day you bent the knee to Robert Baratheon. After he crushed you. Did you take what was yours then?
You gave me away! Your boy! Your last boy! You gave me away like I was some dog you didn't want anymore. And now you curse me because I've come home.
I have no other family.
I would.
What is dead may never die.
You're the crew of the Sea Bitch? I'm your commander. Welcome.
Stop. Stop! Your captain commands you to stop!
The Stony Shore, to raid their villages. There'll be spoils in it for you, and women, if you do your jobs well.
I do. Your captain.
You could do that, take the ship, head out on your own. And I will hunt you down, drag you back here in chains and hang you for a traitor.
Thank you. Kind of you to come see me off.
You'd better get out there. Wouldn't want her to set sail without you.
Who are you?
Why aren't you with the rest of them? Or did they send you to row me out and dump me halfway in the sea? That would be good for a laugh.
And how am I supposed to prove myself by pillaging piss-poor fishing villages?
And yet that's the task my father has given me to prove that I'm a true Iron Islander.
The Stony Shore's not far from Torrhen's Square.
No, we could. We could never hold it for more than a few days. As soon as Winterfell got word that we'd taken Torrhen's Square, the Starks would send their men to take it back. And then
Take me to my ship.
I've taken your castle.
It's Prince Theon now. Get up. You have to get dressed. I've taken Winterfell. I took it. I'm occupying it. I sent men over the walls with grappling claws and ropes.
To take the castle.
And he sent me back to Pyke. I'm a Greyjoy. I can't fight for Robb and my father both. Where's Hodor?
Find the halfwit.
My men are bringing your people together in the courtyard.
So you and I can go down and tell them - how you've yielded Winterfell to me.
Yes, you will.
The castle is mine. But these people are still yours. You'll yield to keep them safe, to keep them alive. That's what a good lord would do. Think carefully about what you want to say.
Louder. Say Prince Theon.
Listen to your little lord, Farlen. He has more sense than you do.
My father has donned the ancient crown of Salt and Rock and declared himself King of the Iron Islands. He claims the North as well by right of conquest. - You are all his subjects.

If you serve me as loyally as you served Ned Stark, I will be as good to you as he ever was. Betray me, and you will wish you hadn't. Maester Luwin, send a raven to Pyke informing my father of my victory here. And one to Deepwood Motte to my sister. Inform her that she's to bring You are a maester of the Citadel, sworn to serve the Lord of Winterfell, are you not?
I am the Lord of Winterfell as Bran just informed you. Send the ravens.
I see you've finally learned how to address your betters. What do you want? I was brought here a captive.
I'm the one who took you. What of it?
Serve me how? I need fighters, not kitchen sluts.
So you can bury it in my neck? Do you take me for a fool? Get up.
You'll all go about your tasks as usual. And in a few days' time
Ser Rodrik, it grieves me that we meet as foes.
They are not my people.
My brothers are dead. They died fighting Stark men, men like you.
Among them, but not one of them. I was his hostage, taken from my home.
He's not. He's dead. The Seven Kingdoms are at war. And Winterfell is mine.
You've served this house faithfully, old man. But keep talking and I'll
Take him to the cells. Lock him up
I'll lock him in a cell until he rots.
Ser Rodrik, I sentence you to death!
The old man couldn't keep his mouth shut.
He disrespected me in front of my men. That was his decision, not mine.
You'll address me as Prince Theon or you'll be next.
You don't give commands anymore, little lord.
Any last words, old man?
Why on earth would I trust the word of a lying little savage like you?
All wildlings are liars and savages with no loyalty to anything or anyone.
How? And don't tell me to put a spear in your hand.
I'm a prince now, and you'd do well
Like what?
You know things? Like what? How to eat dirt?
Wait outside.
I always wondered what you had under there.
I'm not killing you. That's your price.
What do you want then, other than your miserable life?
Well, you shall have it, then. But only if you serve me well.
A cripple? You let a cripple escape? The boy can't walk, but somehow he slipped past you?
The giant? Hodor? Oh, that's all right, then. You let a halfwit escape with a cripple. And Rickon, too? The little one?
Right. Get the horses and the hounds.
Enjoying your first hunt?
With hunting, there's blood at the end.
I was a little boy when I was torn away from my home and brought here. So I kept my word. I never ran away. If I find them soon enough, I won't hurt them. Well, I'll hurt them, but I won't kill them.
They have no value to me missing.
Robb's in the Riverlands. My sister's in Deepwood Motte. She'll get here long before they do. And Ned Stark always said 500 men could hold Winterfell again 10,000.
The hounds have the scent. Come, Maester, don't look so grim. It's all just a game.
Try again.

I'm looking at spending the rest of my life being treated like a fool and a eunuch by my own people. Ask yourself, is there anything I wouldn't do to stop that from happening? The hounds will find the scent again. I'll beat them until they do. I'll whip every man here until I have both those boys in hand. And once I've got them, the pampered little shits It's better to be cruel than weak.
Where are they?
The Stark boys. Where are they?
Think harder.
(nods)
Go back to Winterfell. Take him back.
I told you what would happen. All of you. I told you what would happen if you served me loyally. And what would happen if you did not.
If there are any who still question whether your new lord means what he says, here is the answer to your question.
Envy isn't attractive.
You should be proud of your brother's achievement. I took the great castle of Winterfell with 20 men.
I treated the Stark boys with honor, and they repaid me with treachery.
Before I had to kill them, - I treated them -
Exactly.
They made me a promise
Don't call me
If I hadn't killed them, the Northerners would think me weak.
I'm warning you.
You haven't brought enough men. How am I supposed to defend Winterfell with just this lot?
Is this a joke? Winterfell is the heart of the North.
He won't find out. We've killed all the ravens. We have all the horses. I've taken Winterfell. And I will keep Winterfell.
I don't intend to die.
We should bury them.
If they haven't got the damn message yet, a few more days won't help. As you say. But it don't hurt to let 'em rot a while longer.
Gold for the farmer. For his trouble.

3.text: (cries)
Kill me.
Kill me.
Kill me!
(groans)
Theon Greyjoy.
Th-- Theon Greyjoy.
Please.
Reek. My name is Reek.
Where am I? Who are you? What do you want?
Stop! Stop!
(screaming) About what?
I don't know what you want.
What truth?
I took it to-I took it-
No one. I took it on my own.
To take the North while it was vulnerable.
Hold it. Rule it.
Why did you do that?
I took it to bring glory to my house and my father.
(panicking) Wait. Wait, wait, wait. I took it because I hated the Starks. I hated them for holding me prisoner. I wanted to hurt them.
What are you doing?
Please.
I'll tell you anything. Just take it off. Please. Please, just take it off.
Yara?
No, don't go. Please, please. No, please don't leave me. Please, please. Please, please don't go! Please. Please. Don't leave me. Please don't go.
I can ride.
I'll make you a Lord of the Iron Islands for this.
Come on. Come on. Come on. Come on. Come on.
Come on! Come on! Come on! Come on.
No! No! No, no, no!
No, please! No, no, no! No, don't!
No, please! No! No!
How far is it to Deepwood Motte?
She sent you to save me?
Why would you risk your life for me?
Those men, they said my father knew what they were doing to me. Did he?
My sister's men are loyal to her. We don't need to hide from them.
(chuckles)
I was just thinking how jealous I was when my father told Yara to take this place.
Raid fishing villages. He didn't trust me. Thought I was a Stark. Ha. I could never be a Stark. Robb Stark always reminded me of that.
Didn't have to. All he had to do was be. Be who he was born to be. His life fit him better than his clothes. How could someone like that ever be a brother to me? He's the King in the North.
And me my father gave me a choice and I made it. I could never be a Stark. But ironborn, that's what I was born to be. I paid the iron price for Winterfell. I murdered those boys.
Never found them. Just some poor orphans living with a farmer. I let Dagmer slit their throats and I let him burn the bodies so I could keep Winterfell and make my father proud.
It is. My real father lost his head at King's Landing. I made a choice and I chose wrong. And now I've burned everything down.
Yara.
What? No, I didn't.
You can't! No, please stop! No!
Wa--
(whimpering)
Please.
I'll tell you everything, please.
(groans)
If I win, you'll let me go?
Please.
The North.
Deepwood Motte.
Last Hearth.
Karhold!
No. It was just a guess.
Torrhen Karstark.
He was your brother. Your father is Lord Rickard Karstark.
You swore to tell me if I--
Lord Rickard Karstark is Robb Stark's bannerman. I betrayed Robb. That's why you're torturing me.
(screams louder than before)
(screams in desperation)
Please, cut it off! Cut it off! Cut it off!
(groans)
(coughs)
Where is he?
Please.
He sent you.
Please.
Help me. If he comes back
(moaning)
(cries)
Please. No. No! Mercy, please! Please, mercy! Mercy!
No! No! No! Please, no! No! No! No, please! Please!

4.text: A fine shot, master. My lady.
I'm sorry, my lord.
I don't know, my lord.
No, my lord. Just two farm boys.
Yes, my lord.
Jon Snow is at Castle Black.
No!
You can't trick me. Tell him. Tell him you couldn't trick me.
Not Theon! Reek! Reek! My name is Reek!
No, you can't! You can't!
No, I don't believe her! I know who I am! I'm Reek! Reek! Loyal Reek! Good Reek! I've always been Reek!
I'm Reek! Loyal Reek!
Reward?
I-- I didn't want them to take me. I was so scared. I didn't want them--
(gasps)
Yes, of course, my lord.
But how can--
Pretend to be who?
I'm Theon Greyjoy, son of Balon, heir to the Iron Islands.
I'm Reek.
I'm Reek.
Always. Forever.
Yes.
I was born on Pike to Balon Greyjoy. His third and last-living son. I am your prince. I swear it by the drowned god. What is dead may never die.
Lord Bolton took me captive after Winterfell. He sent me to treat with you in good faith as your fellow Ironborn.

You are fading from sickness. You are badly outnumbered and you're hundreds of miles from the sea. Lord Bolton implores you to protect your men and abandon this fortress you can no longer hold. Do this and he will be just and fair with you as he is being with me. The Boltons will give you safe passage to the stony shore.
My own father, your king, surrendered years ago to Robert Baratheon. I watched him bend the knee. There was no shame there. He fought with honor, as did you.
I'm sorry, I didn't hear...
*scared* You don't know.
*whispering* Reek. Reek.
Reek.
Yes. Have your men raise the white flag and open the gates. You're going home.
Yes m'lord. Will we go home now?

5.text: Go with her. Please.
He’s coming back.
You shouldn't be here.
No, my lord.
(Stuttering). She saw me.
Sansa. Lady Sansa. She came to the kennels.
Yes. I'm sorry, master. Forgive me. I didn't think -
(Turns around). Yes, master.
(After a moment, stuttering). I'm sorry.
I'm sorry.
For killing your brothers.
I’ve come to escort you to the Godswood, my lady. If you please, my lady, will you take my arm?
Lord Ramsay, he said I'm to take your arm.
Please. He’ll punish me.
Sansa of the House Stark comes here to be wed. A woman grown, trueborn and noble. She comes to beg the blessings of the gods. Who comes to claim her?
Theon of House Greyjoy. Who was… who was her father’s ward.
Not Theon, my lady. Reek.
You’re his wife now.
Do what he says. Do what he says or he’ll hurt you.
It can. It can always be worse.
Please…
I’m sorry. I’m sorry!
He’ll see us. You don’t know him.
Reek, my lady, Reek!
Not Theon. There is no Theon. Reek.

I was helping you. You were trying to escape, there is no escape. Not ever. Theon Greyjoy tried to escape. The master knew. He knows everything. He hunted him, he caught him, he strapped him to a cross, and cut away piece after piece until there was no Theon left.
I deserved everything. I deserve to be Reek. I did terrible things. Turned on Robb. Captured Winterfell. Killed those boys.
They weren’t “those boys”, they were Bran and Rickon. They were your brothers, you’d know them since they were born.
They weren’t. They were only--
I can’t..
I can’t, not unless the master says...
They weren’t...
They weren’t Bran and Rickon! I couldn’t find them. It was two farm boys. I killed them and burned them so no one would know.
I can’t talk to you anymore.
Not Theon, Reek!

6.text: We can’t stop.
We have to cross here.
It’s the only way to throw off the hounds.
I’ve seen what his hounds do to a person. This way is better.
Over here. Come on.
Sansa. Sansa.
Stay here. I’ll lure them away.
You will. Go north, only north. Jon is Lord Commander at Castle Black. He’ll help you.
Dead.
She broke her leg jumping from the ramparts. I left her to die in the snow.
We shouldn’t be lighting fires. It’s not safe. He won’t stop hunting us.
Jon will have me killed the moment I step through the gate.
And the truth about the farm boys I killed in their place? The truth about Ser Rodrik, who I beheaded?
And the truth about Rob, who I betrayed?
I don’t want to be forgiven. I can never make amends to your family for all the things that I’ve done. They’ll keep you safer than I ever could.
I would have taken you all the way to the Wall. I would have died to get you there.
May I take one of the horses?
Home.
I escaped.
I escaped.
I’m sorry.
I know. I know and I’m sorry.
He broke me. He broke me into a thousand pieces.
You don’t know.
Where else could I go?
No, no. I only heard he died after we docked.
I didn’t know.
I don’t want to be king.
I should’ve listened to you. You’re the only one --
You should rule the Iron Islands. Let me help you.
I am Theon Greyjoy...last living son of Balon Greyjoy.
And she is your rightful ruler. Those of you that have sailed under her, and there are many of you here, you know what she is.
She is a reaver!
She is a warrior!
She is ironborn!
We will find no better leader. This is our queen.
That would have been hard to do. You weren’t here. Last I heard, you were gallivanting around the world having a grand old time.
You were gone. Yara was here. Being Ironborn. Leading Ironborn. Getting ready to bring us back to glory.
Why did we have to come here?
I don’t want one.
You think Uncle Euron’s hunting for us?
He’ll find us.
I don’t want any.
Some bad years?
If I got justice, my burnt body would hang over the gates of Winterfell.
It was a long time ago.
I didn’t murder the Stark boys. But I did things that were just as bad or worse.
Not my claim. Hers.
I’m not fit to rule.
Our Uncle Euron returned home after a long absence. He murdered our father and took the Salt Throne from yara. He would have murdered us if we had stayed.
There are and Euron is building more. He’s going to offer them to you.
The Iron Fleet isn’t all he’s bringing. He also wants to give you --
He murdered our father and would have murdered us. He’ll murder you as soon as you have what he wants.
All of them.
Your ancestors defeated ours and took the Iron Islands. We ask you to give them back.

7.text: It's fine.
Whatever my queen demands.
Euron has her.
I couldn't save her. I tried.
Jon. I didn't know you were here.
Sansa, is she all right?
I should be.
Euron has her. I came to ask the queen to help get her back.
Where did she go?
Jon.
Can I speak with you?
What you did in King's Landing, what you said... You could've lied to Cersei about bending the knee to Daenerys. You risked everything to tell an enemy the truth.
You've always known what was right. Even when we were all young and stupid, you always knew. Every step you take it's always the right step.
Not compared to me, you haven't.

I always wanted to do the right thing. Be the right kind of person. But I never knew what that meant. It always seemed like there's like there was an impossible choice I had to make. Stark or Greyjoy.
He was.
I did.
But the things I've done.
When I was Ramsay's prisoner, Yara tried to save me. She's the only one who tried to save me. (SNIFFLES) She needs me now.
All of us chose to follow Yara. We left the Iron Islands for Yara. She would never leave one of us behind. We're not leaving her behind.
She's not dead.
She's our queen
I did. I ran from my uncle.
We're done with all that.
Yara did. She made a pledge. We're going to find her, and we're going to set her free.
Not for me. For Yara!

8.text: Daenerys went north.
You're my queen. I go where you command.
What is dead may never die.
My queen.
She only has a few ships, and she couldn't sail them here. So, she's sailing to the Iron Islands instead, to take them back in your name.
I want to fight for Winterfell, Lady Sansa, if you'll have me.
He won't be. I'll stay with him. With the Ironborn. I took this castle from you. Let me defend you now.

1.text: Jon said he was a deserter.
Our way is the old way?
Is it true he saw the White Walkers?
So he was lying?
Where will they go? Their mother’s dead.
NO!
Please, father!
What about you?
I saw the king! He’s got hundreds of people!
But he’s coming right now! Down our road!
I promise.
What?
Come on, you.
Ten
lt had three eyes. lt told me to come with him, so l did. We went down into the crypts and my father was there.
You're afraid. Just like Hodor.
You've lived beyond the Wall. What are you scared of? l'm a crippled boy and l'm willing to go.

That's my grandfather, Lord Rickard. He was burned alive by the Mad King, Aerys. That's Lyanna, my father's sister. King Robert was supposed to marry her, but Rhaegar Targaryen kidnapped her. Robert started a war to win her back. He killed Rhaegar, but she died anyway. That's where l saw Father.
Rickon!
What are you doing down here? Come back up with us.
How many times have l told you? He's in King's Landing with Sansa and Arya.
Saw him when?
I hate your stories.
Those weren't my favorites. My favorites were the scary ones.
Maybe we do.
I did though. It's true, isn't it... what Maester Luwin says about my legs? I'd rather be dead.
I'd rather be dead.
I don't want to see anyone.
I don't want to go.
Kneel, Hodor.
Yes. Well, I mean I did like to.
I'm not a cripple.
Will I really be able to ride?
The Iron Islands. Sigil - a Kraken. Words - "We do not sow".
The Greyjoys.
Sigil - a stag. - A crowned stag now that Robert's King.
Words - "Ours is the fury". Lords - the Baratheons.
The Westerlands - sigil - a lion.
Words - "A Lannister always pays his debts."
Lords - the Lannisters.
I don't know them.
"Unbowed, unbent, unbroken".
"Righteous in wrath".
"Family, duty, honor".
"Family, duty, honor"... Is that the right order?
Family comes first?
How can she protect the family, if she's not with her family?
And then she left!
Why did she leave?
Do you know where she is now? Today?
Then how can you promise me she'll be home soon?
I'll never shoot another arrow.
You need legs to work a bow.
Really?
Come on, Dancer. (to his horse)
Robb?
I’m not alone, my brother is with me.
I can’t. The saddle, the straps.
I’m Brandon Stark of Winterfell and if you don’t let me be, I’ll have you all killed!
Robb!
No, don’t.
Yes, it doesn’t hurt.
What is it? What's happened?
Where are you going?
But it's the middle of the night.
They have more men than we do.
Can't I come with you? I can ride now. You've seen me riding.
I will.
How long have you been hiding out there?
They'll be back soon.
Please watch over Robb.
What are you doing here?
You're not a slave.
Well, your friend did put a knife to my throat.
What did you mean about hearing the Gods?
It's only the wind.
Go back and find your clothes, Hodor.
Are there really giants beyond the Wall?

2.text: King Robb. And it's not his war. He didn't choose it.
Joffrey killed my father, your liege lord. Do you remember your vows, Ser?
I didn't like the way he was talking about Robb.
Don't have any pain.
That way.
I don't dream.
I don't. Heard some of the men talking about the comet. (Bran looks up at the comet). They say it's an omen. They say it means Robb will win a great victory in the South.
The dragons are all dead. They've been dead for centuries.
Osha, what are you doing?
Tell us what medicine to get from your chambers.
They burned it down. They burned everything.
I don't want to leave you.

Every night it's the same. I'm walking and running, but I'm not I'm not me. I'm running through the godswood, sniffing the dirt, tasting blood in my mouth when I've made a fresh kill, howling. Old Nan used to tell me stories about magical people who could live inside stags, birds, wolves.
So she was lying? They don't exist?
No, my dreams are different. Mine are true. I dreamt of my father dying. And Rickon had the same dream.
We can send two orphan boys from Winterstown home with you to help watch over your flock if you can give them room and board.
(to RICKON) Stop it. If that's everyone, I'm going to go for a ride before dark.
Hodor.
We have to help them.
If we can't protect our own bannermen, why should they protect us? Go, Ser Rodrik. Take the men you need.
So, what does it mean?
I did ask him. He'd never heard of a three-eyed raven.
You're lying.
You know what it means.
You didn't give me an honest answer.
Well, it's not far off.

I dreamt that the sea came to Winterfell. I saw waves crashing against the gates and the water came flowing over the walls It flooded the castle. Drowned men were floating here, in the yard. Ser Rodrik was one of them.
I know. It's just a stupid dream.
Osha. The three-eyed raven, what do they say about it north of the Wall?
Theon?
Why?
You went with Robb.
I don't know.
Why?
I won't.
I won't. I'll never yield. We'll fight you and throw you out.
Theon. Did you hate us the whole time?
I've yielded Winterfell to Theon.
I've yielded Winterfell to Prince Theon. You all know me.
Farlen, you be silent.
All of you should do as he commands.
Why?
No! You said no harm would come to them if I yielded.
No! No! Theon! Please. Ser Rodrik!
I'm begging you.
Stop. Stop! Stop right now!
Please, stop this. Please stop him.
You said no harm would come! You said no harm would come. Theon, please.
Theon, please don't.
I'll do anything, please! No, please stop it!
We couldn't risk going to the kitchens.
And if Theon found out, he'd hang them.
Wait, I know that farm. I sent those two Winterfell orphans there.
We can't risk it. If Theon tracks us here, he'll torture them until he finds out where we are.
They'll be after us with hounds.

3.text: Don't, Hodor.
Maybe we shouldn't stay.
There are a lot of stories about this place. Horrible stories.
So did I. Once.
You ever heard about the Rat Cook?

Just a cook in the Night's Watch. He was angry at the king for something, I don't remember. When the king was visiting the Nightfort, the cook killed the king's son, cooked him into a big pie with onions, carrots, mushrooms and bacon. That night he served the pie to the king. He liked the taste of his son so much, he asked for a second slice. The gods turned the cook into a giant white rat who could only eat his own young. He's been roaming the Nightfort ever since, devouring his own babies. But no matter what he does, he's always hungry.
It wasn't for murder the gods cursed the Rat Cook or for serving the king's son in a pie. He killed a guest beneath his roof. That's something the gods can't forgive.
Hodor.
My brother, he's in the Night's--
No, I'm not.
Take us north of the Wall.
I don't want to. I have to.
Please, Sam. I have to go north. I have to.
What is it?
Why? What are they for?
Take it, Hodor.
I wish I could. I really do.
Father?
Why not?
It's all right, Hodor.
No, it was the three-eyed raven.
I tried to kill it, but I couldn't. There was a boy.
But you asked.
I didn't ask for black magic dreams.
We don't know who might be after us. No one even knows we're alive.
No.
Where's Rickon and Hodor?
What's out there?
It's all right. The wolves will protect him.
Only when I'm asleep.
It's not just wolves. Sometimes in my dreams there's a-
You've seen it?
Does it have anything to do with warging?
Seeing things that haven't happened yet?
When my father died, I dreamt it.
You have the sight, too?
Your father is Howland Reed? Yeah.
He saved my father's life during the rebellion.
What else have you seen?
How?
Mother.
Mother, I need to find it. It's here. It's calling me.
Mother! Mother!
You're both very good at skinning rabbits.
Stop it!
You've been fighting since you met. Just stop it.
You've been nasty to her every day. Of course she's nasty back.
First time I met you, you held a knife at me. We can't fight each other. We'll never make it to the Wall. I want you both to make peace.
Osha!
He's having one now?
You saw him? At Castle Black?
It's all right, Osha.
The raven's been coming to me ever since I fell from that tower. He wants me to find him. I don't have my legs anymore. This is what I have now.
What if I belong in the North? What if I fell from that tower for a reason?
You don't understand. You don't know.
The Gift, I think. Brandon The Builder gave all this land south of the Wall to the Night’s Watch for their sustenance and support. Maester Luwin taught me that.
Wildlings.
Sorry. But they come over the Wall and raid, steal, carry off women.
I don’t see any.
How are we going to get past the Wall? My uncle said it’s 700 feet high.
How did you get past it?
It would take us two months to get to the Bay of Seals.
Even Hodor’s not strong enough to climb the Wall with me on his back.
My uncle said the gates were sealed with ice and stone when the castles were deserted.
Hunting.
[To Hodor] Hush, Hodor. No, no more Hodoring.
Hodor, calm down.
Hodor, be quiet.
Hodor, calm down. Hodor, be quiet!
Nothing. I don’t know.
I can’t do it by choice. I don’t know how. It happens in my dreams.
I can’t.
[Looks at JOJEN] You were right. I can get inside Summer’s mind whenever I want.
They can’t do that north of the Wall?
[Looks at RICKON] When I was looking through Summer’s eyes, I saw Jon.
He was with the wildlings. They tried to kill him but he got away.
For all we know, Castle Black’s already under attack. If this many wildlings got through-
Everything Jojen told me is true. You saw what I did to Hodor. I have to find the three-eyed raven.
Don’t worry, I’m not asking you to come with me. It won’t be safe for Rickon.
No. You and Osha and Shaggydog head for the Last Hearth. The Umbers are our bannermen. They’ll protect you.
Right now, I have to protect you.
Robb’s at war and I’m going beyond the Wall. If something happens to us, you’re the heir to Winterfell.
[Looks at OSHA] Will you know how to find the last Hearth?
You don’t have to do any of this.
You’re leaving now? It’s the middle of the night.

4.text: Jojen. Jojen! Look, Jojen, look.
Help them! Now!
Help them!
Who are you?
You’re the three-eyed raven.
I didn’t want anyone to die for me.
You’re going to help me walk again?
Why did you wake me?
I was hungry.
I was just eating.
Hodor, take me to the tree.
I know where we have to go.
Do you hear that?
I'm going out there.
I'm going.
Summer, he's hurt. They've caught him in a trap.
I didn't see, but they have my brother's wolf. They have Ghost.
They're Night's Watch. Look. Jon might be here.
No.
I'm not leaving without Summer.
The east side of the keep.
I'm Brandon Stark! I'm Brandon Stark of Winterfell.
They already have stopped me.
You've seen it, too.
We will.
Stop.
Stop. Stop!
Stop! Please.
Please, get off her!
Please! Please, leave her alone!
Please, stop. Stop.
What are you doing? Leave her alone!
No!
Is Jon with you?
Hodor. Hodor, get his knife. Cut me loose.
Hodor, get his knife. Hodor. Cut me loose, Hodor.
Jojen and Meera, free them. Go!
Jon.
Jon!
He's my brother.
Hodor.
We need to free Summer. And we need to go.

6.text: Thank you, Uncle Benjen.
I’m the Three-Eyed Raven now. I have to be ready for this.
They were all so happy.
My Aunt Lyanna. I’ve seen her statue in the crypt. My father never talked about her.
Hodor?
Hodor talks?
Please, a little longer.
You finally show me something I care about and then you drag me away.
I wasn’t drowning. I was home.
Wylis.
I saw you as a boy. You could talk. What happened?
Where’s Meera?
You shouldn’t be here. It’s not safe outside the cave.
I saw that Hodor wasn’t always Hodor.
His real name is Wylis. And he could talk and fight and -- and then --
What’s wrong?
The Three-Eyed Raven says there’s a war coming.
That’s my father.
Ser Arthur Dayne.
Father said he was the best swordsman he ever saw.
He’s better than my father.
But Father beat him.
I know he did. Heard the story a thousand times.
He stabbed him in the back.
What’s in the tower?
I want to see where he’s going.
Father!
Why did you do that? Take me back there. I want to go back.
He heard me.
He heard me.
What’s in that tower? I want to go back there.
Why do I want to return? So I can be a cripple again? So I can talk to an old man in a tree?
So why did you?
I don’t want to be you.
Learn what?
It was you. You made the White Walkers.
From whom?
What?
He saw me, the Night King! He saw me!
I don’t know. He was close, but --
But he can’t get in.
I’m sorry. I didn’t mean to.
The time for what?
But am I ready?
Meera. They found us.
Who are you?
Uncle Benjen. The last letter Jon wrote me said you had been lost beyond the Wall.
How?
Dragonglass. A shard of dragonglass plunged into your heart.
I didn’t have time to learn. I can’t control anything.

7.text: You were at the Fist of the First Men. You were at Hardhome. You've seen the Army of the Dead. You've seen the Night King. He's coming for us. For all of us.
Hello, Sansa.
Yes. I need to speak to him.
I can never be the Lord of Winterfell. I can never be lord of anything. I'm the three-eyed raven.
It's difficult to explain.

It means I can see everything. Everything that's ever happened to everyone. Everything that's happening right now. It's all pieces, fragments. I need to learn to see better. When the long night comes again I need to be ready.
The three-eyed raven taught me.
I told you it's difficult to explain.

I'm sorry for all that's happened to you. I'm sorry it had to happen here at our home. It was so beautiful that night. Snow falling just like now. And you were so beautiful in your white wedding dress.
I'll stay a bit longer.
Do you know who this belonged to?
Chaos is a ladder.
I'm not Lord Stark.
Maester Wolkan built it for me so I can move around more easily.
You're leaving?
No, I don't.
Thank you.
For helping me.
I'm not really, not anymore. I remember what it felt like to be Brandon Stark, but I remember so much else now.
You came home.
I saw you at the crossroads.
I see quite a lot now.
I thought you might go to King's Landing.
Cersei is on her list of names.
Littlefinger gave it to me.
He thought I'd want it.
Because it was meant to kill me.
Someone very wealthy wanted me dead.
It doesn't matter.
I don't want it.
It's wasted on a cripple.
Ravens. We need to send ravens.
You held a knife to his throat.
You said, "I did warn you not the trust me."
Come in.
Samwell Tarly.
I remember everything.
You helped us get beyond the Wall. You're a good man.
I became the Three-Eyed Raven.
I can see things that happened in the past. I can see things happening now all over the world. Why did you come to Winterfell?
He's on his way back to Winterfell with Daenerys Targaryen. You you saw this in a vision?
He needs to know the truth.
About himself. No one knows. No one but me. Jon isn't really my father's son He's the son of Rhaegar Targaryen and my aunt.
Dornish bastards are named Sand.
Are you certain?
Robert's Rebellion was built on a lie. Rhaegar didn't kidnap my aunt.
He loved her. And she loved him.
And Jon - Jon's real name.
He's never been a bastard.

8.text: Almost.
We don't have time for all this. The Night King has your dragon.
He's one of them now. The Wall has fallen, the dead march south.
Waiting, for an old friend. It's time to tell Jon the truth.
I'm not his brother. He trusts you more than anyone. Now's the time.
The things we do for love.
You weren't sorry then. You were protecting your family.
You still would be, if you hadn't pushed me out of that window. And I would still be Brandon Stark.
No. I'm something else now.
I'm not angry at anyone.
You won't be able to help us in this fight if I let them murder you first.
How do you know there is an afterwards?
Yes, he will.
He'll come for me. He's tried before, many times, with many Three-Eyed Ravens.
An endless night. He wants to erase this world, and I am its memory.
His mark is on me.
