He always knows where I am.
No. We need to lure him into the open before his army destroys us all. I'll wait for him in the Godswood.
I don't know. No one's ever tried.
No.
Stranger than most.
It's a long story.
It's the same as the one Daeron Targaryen built for his crippled nephew 120 years ago. I liked that one.
I'm not Lord of Winterfell.
I don't really want anymore.
You shouldn't envy me. Mostly I live in the past.
It's your choice.
Why do you think I came all this way?
Lord Tyrion you will be my Hand.
And I don't want to be king.
I choose you.
Yes, I can. I'm king.
He just got it. He's made many terrible mistakes. He's going to spend the rest of his life fixing them.
You were exactly where you were supposed to be.
We appear to be missing a Master of Whisperers. And a Master of Laws. And a Master of War.
And Drogon? Any word?
Perhaps I can find him. Do carry on with the rest.
(smiling) I'm sure it will.

1.text: Very amusing. lsn't it a funny song? Thank you for your rendition. l imagine it was even better received at that tavern.
Tell me, which do you favor - your fingers or your tongue?
Fingers or your tongue? lf you got to keep one, which would it be? Or l could just cut your throat.
Good. Tongue it is.
Ser llyn, who better than you to carry out the sentence?
l'm done for the day. l'll leave the rest of the matters to you, Mother.
You look quite nice.
Your Grace. l'm King now.
Walk with me. l want to show you something.
And as soon as you've had your blood, l'll put a son in you. Mother says that shouldn't be long.
(pointing at one of the heads) This one's your father. This one here. Look at it and see what happens to traitors.
l was. l gave him a clean death. Look at him.
Mother says l'm still to marry you. So you'll stay here, and obey. Look at him!
Well?
As long as it pleases me. Do you want to see the rest?

That's your Septa there. (shot of the impaled head of a woman with the traditional Septa headscarf) l'll tell you what, l'm going to give you a present. After l raise my armies and kill your traitor brother, l'm going to give you his head as well.

My mother tells me a king should never strike his lady. Ser Meryn.Ser Meryn strikes Sansa repeatedly with the back of his (armoured) hand, leaving her lip bloodied. Sansa notices the stone bridge Joffrey is on leads to a street some feet below. She moves forward to lunge him from the edge, but she’s stopped by the Hound.
Will you obey now? Or do you need another lesson? l'll look for you in court.
My lords. Shall we begin?
Better-looking bitches than you're used to, Uncle. My mother's been looking for you. We ride for King's Landing today.
What good will my sympathies do them?
The boy means nothing to me. And I can't stand the wailing of women.
I'm telling mother!
You can't...

He speaks damn well with his sword though. Ser Ilyn Payne, the King's justice. The royal executioner. What is it, sweet lady? Does the hound frighten you? Away with you, dog. You're scaring my lady. I don't like to see you upset. The sun is finally shining. Come walk with me.
My princess can drink as much as she wants. Don't worry... You're safe with me.
Your sister? And who are you, boy?
A butcher's boy who wants to be a Knight, eh? Pick up your sword, butcher's boy. Let's see how good you are.
I'm your prince, not your lord, and I said pick up your sword.
And you're not a Knight. Only a butcher's boy. That was my lady's sister you were hitting, do you know that?
I won't hurt him... Much. Filthy little bitch!
I'll gut you, you little cunt!
Please don't.
Then go! Don't touch me.
Yes it is! They all attacked me and she threw my sword in the river.
Shut up!
It's ugly.
I'm not like him. I didn't fight off anything. It bit me and all I did was scream. And the two Stark girls saw it, both of them.
Do I have to marry her?
I don't want to.
We allow the northerners too much power. They consider themselves our equals.
I'd double their taxes and command them to supply 10,000 men to the royal army.

Why should every lord command his own men? It's primitive, no better than the hill tribes. We should have a standing army of men loyal to the Crown, trained by experienced soldiers... Instead of a mob of peasants who've never held pikes in their lives.
I'd crush them. Seize Winterfell and install someone loyal to the realm as Warden of the North. Uncle Kevan, maybe.
For me. I'm their King.
I'm not asking.
So you agree... The Starks are enemies?
My lady. I fear I have behaved monstrously the past few weeks. With your permission?
You’ll be queen one day, it’s only fitting that you should look the part. Will you forgive me for my rudeness?

You’re my lady. One day we’ll be married in the throne room. Lords and ladies from all over the Seven Kingdoms will come, from the last hearth in the North, to the salt shore of the south. And you will be queen over all of them. I’ll never disrespect you again. I’ll never be cruel to you again. Do you understand me? You’re my lady now, from this day, until my last day.
I command the council to make all necessary arrangements for my coronation.
Liar!
Kill him! Kill all of them, I command it!
You let my father die.
Come forward, My Lady.
Let her speak.
He said I wasn't the King. Why did he say that?
Anything else?
Your sweet words have moved me.

My mother wishes me to let Lord Eddard join The Night's Watch. Stripped of all titles and powers, he would serve the realm in permanent exile. And My Lady Sansa has begged mercy for her father. But they have the soft hearts of women. So long as I am your King, treason shall never go unpunished. Ser Ilyn, bring me his head!

2.text: (Quietly) Well struck… (Louder) Well struck, Dog.
Did you like that?
I already said it was well struck.
Who's next?
Are you drunk?
Two cups? (Dontos nods). That's not much at all. (Joffrey gestures to some wine). Please, have another cup.
Yes, to celebrate my name day. (Smiles) Have two, have as much as you like.
Ser Meryn, help Ser Dontos celebrate my name day. See that he drinks his fill.
What did you say? Did you say I can't?
What kind of stupid peasant's superstition...
(Sighs). Take him away. I'll have him killed tomorrow, the fool.
Did you hear My Lady, Ser Dontos? (Ser Dontos is forced onto his feet). From this day, (Standing up), you'll be my new fool.
I've been here, ruling the kingdoms.
We heard you were dead.
Her loss? Her father was a confessed traitor!
What work? (Bronn and the tribesmen follow Tyrion. Joffrey stands up). Why are you here?
Returning this room to its proper appearance. Say what you will about the Targaryens, they were conquerors. That is a seat for a conqueror. It needs a room to match it, not vines and flowers.
With luck, she's dead in a ditch somewhere.
I think they might. They're weak. They put too much value on their women. (Walks towards the throne).
The King does not ask; He commands. And my grandfather's stupidity in the field of battle is the reason Robb Stark has Uncle Jaime in the first place.
We're at war. All our lives are in danger. I heard a disgusting lie about Uncle Jaime. And you.
It's not a claim. The throne is mine.
Someone believes it. Father had other children? Besides me and Tommen and Myrcella?
I'm asking if he fucked other women when he grew tired of you. How many bastards does he have running -
What you just did is punishable by death. You will never do it again. Never. (Joffrey begins to walk away). That will be all, Mother.

I, Joffrey of the House Baratheon, first of my name, the rightful King of the Andals and the First Men, Lord of the Seven Kingdoms and Protector of the Realm, do hereby proclaim my grandfather, Tywin Lannister, the savior of the city and the Hand of the King.
Lord Petyr Baelish, step forward.

For your good service and ingenuity in uniting the Houses of Lannister and Tyrell, I declare that you shall be granted the castle of Harrenhal with all its attendant lands and incomes to be held by your sons and grandsons from this day until the end of time.
Ser Loras Tyrell.
Is this what you want, Lady Margaery?
I, too, have heard tales of your beauty and grace, but the tales do not do you justice, my lady. It would be an honor to return your love, but I am promised to another. A king must keep his word.
I would like to heed your wishes and the wishes of my people, but I took a holy vow.
The gods are good. I am free to heed my heart. Ser Loras, I will gladly wed your sweet sister. You will be my queen and I will love you from this day until my last day.
I heard a disgusting lie about uncle Jaime… and you. Father had other children?
How many bastards does he have running around?
You're here to answer for your brother's latest treasons.
Ser Lancel, tell her of this outrage.
Killing you would send your brother a message.
But my mother insists on keeping you alive. Stand. So we'll have to send your brother a message some other way. Meryn.
Leave her face. I like her pretty.
Meryn, my lady is overdressed. Unburden her.
If you want Robb Stark to hear us, we're going to have to speak louder.
I'm punishing her.
You can't talk to me like that. The king can do as he likes!
What are you doing here, dog?
And? What is it?
My nameday has passed.
No. Her. Touch her.
Could you hit her?
My uncle sent you?
Use this.
Harder.
I said harder. He'd want me to get his money's worth.
Oh, I want him to find out. You will bring her to his chambers when you're finished and show him what you've done, or the same thing will happen to you.
Begin.
Harder!
You sound like a little cat mewling for his mother. Princes don't cry.
Did you say something, my lady?
So?
Is your little brother a prince?
Not really relevant then, is it? Come, dog.
Who threw that? I want the man who threw that. Find who did that and bring him to me!
Just kill them! Kill them all!
What are you doing? I want these people executed!
Traitors! - I'll have all their heads.
You can't insult me.
You can't
They attacked me!
You're talking to a king!
Let them have her.
You're the Master of Whisperers. You're supposed to know everything.
The Stark forces are distracted. Now is the time to strike.
If my Uncle Stannis lands on the shores of King's Landing, I'll ride out to greet him.
They say Stannis never smiles. I'll give him a red smile from ear to ear.
Sansa.
Sansa, come here.
Your king rides forth to battle. You should see him off with a kiss.
My new blade. Hearteater, I've named it. Kiss it.
You'll kiss it again when I return and taste my uncle's blood.
If Stannis is fool enough to come near me.
A king doesn't discuss battle plans with stupid girls.
Your brother's turn will come. Then you can lick his blood off Hearteater, too.
Why isn't it here now? They're coming.
Hound, tell the Hand that his king has asked him a question.
If I tell the Hound to cut you in half, he'll do it without a second thought.
There they are.
What are you doing? We need to attack them.
There's only one ship. Where are the rest of them? Where are the rest of them?
They're coming. They're coming ashore.
There are too many.
Dog, I command you to go back out there and fight.
What would you have me do?
What did my mother say exactly? Did she have urgent business with me?
Ser Boros, Ser Mandon, stay with my uncle and represent the king on the field of battle.

3.text: Why have we stopped?
Joffrey
No.
Please, sit. Sit. I do apologize, my lady. Small council meetings. At what point does it become treason to waste the king's time?
That's a lovely gown, my lady.
Shall I have them bring you a shawl, my lady?
My mother's always had a penchant for drama. Facts become less and less important to her as she grows older. Our lives were never truly in danger.
Well, as Ser Loras said, Lady Margaery has done this sort of... charitable work before. I'm sure she knows what she's doing.
Show him. Come on, show him.

Robb Stark is dead. And his bitch mother. (to Pycelle) Write back to Lord Frey. Thank him for his service and command him to send Robb Stark's head. I'm going to serve it to Sansa at my wedding feast.
Yes, I did. I'm going to have it served to Sansa at my wedding feast.
Everyone is mine to torment. You'd do well to remember that, you little monster.
I could have your tongue out for saying that.
I am the king! I will punish you.
My father won the real war. He killed Prince Rhaegar. He took the crown while you hid under Casterly Rock!
I'm not tired.
I'm not tired!
Make it tighter here.
No flowers. I said no flowers. All these are wrong. Bring others.
Bloody flowers. On the king.
Who?

She's an ideal match. With the Tyrells beside us, we'll crush the Northerners. Hang their lords, burn their strongholds, sow their fields with salt, and no one will think of rebelling for another century.
Yes, she is.
Not to me.
This is becoming one of the most boring conversations I've ever had.
She married Renly Baratheon because she was told to. That's what intelligent women do-what they're told.
I don't need to do anything.
Better. Much better.
Send her in.
I'm leaving on a hunting trip. I just wanted to make sure you had everything you need before I left.
Good. Good. How are you finding life in the capital? It must be quite a change after Renly's camp.
And the bedside of a traitor? Is that a place for a lady?
What was your duty to this traitor as you saw it?
You failed to do this.
You think one ought to speak kindly of a traitor merely because he's had a sword put through his heart?
What makes you say this?
No, he was a known degenerate.
Mmm. I've considered making his perversion punishable by death.
Yes. I am.
Do you like it? I just had it made. Probably one of the finest weapons in the Seven Kingdoms.
It's a new design. Much easier to load. There's no crank. You use this lever to draw the string.
The bolt goes here.
And then you just aim and
It's not unheard of.
Could you do it? Could you kill something?.
Yes.
Yes.
Rhaenyra Targaryen was murdered by her brother, or rather his dragon. It ate her while her son watched. What's left of her is buried in the crypts right down there.
Over there in that urn, the ashes of Aerion Targaryen. Aerion Brightflame they called him. He thought drinking wildfire would turn him into a dragon.
He was wrong. And, of course, there's the Mad King, killed by my uncle. Would you like to see where the last Targaryens are buried?
The tomb's just up here.
My father didn't want them here. He was going to have their bodies burned and thrown in the Blackwater, but the High Septon convinced him otherwise.
I couldn't agree more.
Open the doors.
Grandfather.
Yes. I'd like a report on the meetings of my small council.
I've been very busy. Many important matters require a king's attention.
You've been holding the council meetings in the Tower of the Hand instead of the small council chamber.
May I ask why?
So if I wanted to attend a council meeting, I would now have to climb all the stairs in the Tower of the Hand?
Tell me about the Targaryen girl in the east and her dragons.
Is it true?
Don't you think we ought to do something about it?
And the biggest was the size of a carriage.
But how do we know these dragons are just curiosities and not the beasts that brought the whole world to heel?
But I haven't been counseled.
I should be consulted about such things.
Your father's gone. As the father of the realm, it is my duty to give you away to your husband.
I've got a lifetime for that.
Congratulations, my lady.
Well, you've done it. You've married a Lannister. Soon you'll have a Lannister baby. It's a dream come true for you, isn't it? What a glorious day.
I suppose it doesn't really matter which Lannister puts the baby into you. Maybe I'll pay you a visit tonight after my uncle passes out. How'd you like that?
You wouldn't? That's all right. Ser Meryn and Ser Boros will hold you down.
Time for the bedding ceremony.

Where's your respect for tradition, Uncle? Come, everyone. Pick her up and carry her to her wedding bed. Get rid of her gown. She won't be needing it any longer. Ladies, attend to my uncle. He's not heavy.
There will be if I command it.
What did you say? What did you say?

4.text: Yes, yes, one guard at the... the thing. Go on.
By my leave. They know I saved the city. They know I won the war.
I broke Stannis on the Blackwater. Pity you weren't there to help, Uncle.
Busy getting captured.
Ser Jaime Lannister. (Chuckles)
Someone forgot to write down all your great deeds.
Is there? For a 40-year-old knight with one hand? How can you protect me with that?
A handsome goblet, my lord. Or shall I call you Father?
A book?
Now that the war is won, we should all find time for wisdom. Thank you, Uncle.
So they say.
Such a great sword should have a name. What shall I call her?
Widow's Wail. I like that. Every time I use it, it'll be like cutting off. Ned Stark's head all over again.
With this kiss, I pledge my love.
Very good. Very good. Off you go.
Everyone. The queen would like to say a few words.
You're the one who put a sword through Renly Baratheon.
A shame. I'd knight the man that put an end to that deviant's life.
Yes, yes.
A gold dragon to whoever knocks my fool's hat off.

Everyone, silence! Clear the floor. There's been too much amusement here today. A royal wedding is not an amusement. A royal wedding is history. The time has come for all of us to contemplate our history. My lords... my ladies...
I give you. King Joffrey... Renly, Stannis, Robb Stark, Balon Greyjoy. The War of the Five Kings.

Well fought. Well fought. Here you are. Champion's purse. Though you're not the champion yet, are you? A true champion defeats all the challengers. Surely there are others out there who still dare to challenge my reign. Uncle How about you? I'm sure they have a spare costume.
It did not spill.
Well, how does he expect me to toast without wine? Uncle, you can be my cupbearer seeing as you're too cowardly to fight.
It's not meant as an honor.
Bring me my goblet.
What good is an empty cup? Fill it.
Kneel. Kneel before your king.
Kneel. I said... kneel!
My queen.
Uncle. Where are you going? You're my cupbearer, remember?
No, no, no. No, you're perfect the way you are. Serve me my wine.
Well, hurry up. This pie is dry.
Mm, good. Needs washing down.
No. (coughing) No, you'll wait here... un...
It's nothing.
(gags)

1.text: Rough night, Imp?
I didn’t pick you for a hunter.
It’s not hunting if you pay for it.
Do as you're bid, child.
Here, girl. (cleans her bloody lip with a rag)
Save yourself some pain, girl. Give him what he wants.
You'll be needing that again.
The Prince will remember that, little lord.
Do I frighten you so much, girl? Or is it him there making you shake? He frightens me too. Look at that face.
He hasn't been very talkative these last 20 years. Since the mad King had his tongue ripped out with hot pincers.
He ran... Not very fast.
I'm no Ser.
Who do you think sent me?

2.text: The girl is right. What a man sows on his name day, he reaps all year.
Your uncle left your nameday present and asked me to see that you got it.
Look inside, Your Grace.
And they want the same for you.
You're all right now, little bird. You're all right.
The little bird's bleeding. Someone take her back to her cage. See to that cut.
I didn't do it for you.
Brave? A dog doesn't need courage to chase off rats.
No, it gives me joy to kill people.
Spare me. You can't tell me Lord Eddard Stark of Winterfell never killed a man.
Is that what he told you? He lied. Killing is the sweetest thing there is.
You'll be glad of the hateful things I do someday when you're queen and I'm all that stands between you and your beloved king.
You think you're a hard man?
Oh, there's women in the ground. I put some there myself. So have you. You like fucking and drinking and singing. But killing, killing's the thing you love. You're just like me.
Only smaller.
Your Lord Imp's going to miss you.
The king has asked you a question.
Let's go. Stannis is sending us fresh meat. You, too.
Any of these flaming fucking arrows come near me, I'll strangle you with your own guts.

Any man dies with a clean sword, I'll rape his fucking corpse. He and LANCEL engage with the sieging forces. They each cut down a number of Baratheon men before LANCEL is struck in the chest by an arrow. He stumbles and screams. Panting, he retreats.
Someone bring me a drink.
Fuck the water. Bring me wine.
Eat shit, dwarf.
I lost half my men. The Blackwater's on fire.
Fuck the Kingsguard. Fuck the city. Fuck the king.
The lady is starting to panic.
Not here for long. I'm going.
Someplace that isn't burning. North, might be. Could be.
He can die just fine on his own.
I can take you with me. Take you to Winterfell.
I'll keep you safe. Do you want to go home?

Look at me. Stannis is a killer. The Lannisters are killers. Your father was a killer. Your brother is a killer. Your sons will be killers someday. The world is built by killers. So you'd better get used to looking at them.
No, little bird, I won't hurt you.

3.text: Where did you get the knife?
Is that the first man you've killed?
Next time you're going to do something like that, tell me first.
Thoros? The fuck you doing here?
Girl.
What in seven hells are you doing with the Stark bitch?
You think you're good with that bow, you little twat?
A coward's weapon. I like to fight up close. I like to see a man's face when I put the steel in him.
Looks like every other shit inn on the road.
You look like a bunch of swineherds.
You're still swineherds and tanners and masons. You think carrying a crooked spear makes you a soldier?
Beric Dondarrion? You've seen better days.
Stark deserters. Baratheon deserters. You lot aren't fighting in a war. You're running from it.
Untie these ropes and we'll find out. What are you doing leading a mob of peasants?
Ned Stark is dead. King Robert is dead. My brother's alive.
You're fighting for ghosts.
You found god? Is that it?
If you mean to murder me, then bloody well get on with it.
I wasn't at the Mummer's Ford. Dump your dead children at some other door.
Do you take me for my brother? Is being born Clegane a crime?
I never touched the Targaryen babes. I never saw them, never smelled them, never heard them bawling. You want to cut my throat, get on with it! But don't call me murderer and pretend that you're not.
Aye, he was a bleeder.
I was Joffrey's sworn shield. The boy attacked the prince.
Then I should have killed you. Not my place to question princes.
So, who will it be? Should we find out if your fire god really loves you, priest? Or you, archer? What are you worth with a sword in your hand? Or is the little girl the bravest one here?
(shouts)
(shouts)
Looks like their god likes me more than your butcher's boy.
I want my gold.
Piss on that! You're nothing but thieves.
Come try it, archer. I'll shove those arrows up your ass.
Kick all you like, wolf girl. Won't do you no good.
I'll give you one try, girl.
Kill me and you're free. But if I live, I'll break both your hands. Go on, hit me. Hit me hard.
Sulk all you want. The truth is, you're lucky. You don't want to be alone out here, girl. Someone worse than me would find you.

Ha, you never knew my brother. He once killed a man for snoring. There's plenty worse than me. There's men who like to beat little girls, men who like to rape them. I saved your sister from some of them.
Ask her, if you ever see her again. Ask her who came back for her when the mob had her on her back. They would have taken her every which way and left her there with her throat cut open.
The Blackwater? Where do you think I'm taking you?
Fuck Joffrey. Fuck the queen. That's the Red Fork. I'm taking you to the Twins.
Because your mother and brother will be there and they'll pay me for you.

Those outlaws you love so much never told you? The whole countryside is yapping about it. Your uncle is marrying one of the Frey girls. So quit trying to bash my skull in and we might just make it there in time for the wedding.
Remember what happens to children who run. I'm your father and I'll do the talking.
Need a hand?
Dead rats don't squeak.
More than anyone you know.
That so?
That him?
Good.
You're very kind. Someday it'll get you killed.
Best part of the animal.
Don’t worry, they’re still there.
You check every five minutes like you’re afraid they’re gonna move.

Of course you are. You’re almost there and you’re afraid you won’t make it. The closer you get, the worse the fear gets. No point in trying to hide behind that face. I know fear when I see it. Seen it a lot.
That give you some ideas?
Go ahead then. You might get away. Might even make it there on your own. They’re just over the river. The closest you’ve been to family since Ilyn Payne snipped your daddy’s neck.
Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa.
Got salt pork for the feast.
It doesn’t sound like it’s over.
Got pig’s feet, too [ARYA looks up].
It’s too late.

4.text: The little lady wants a pony.
Horses aren't easy to come by. Even if they were, you think I'm gonna put you on your own horse? Watch the only thing of value I've got in the world ride away?
No.
I'm not a thief.
A man's got to have a code.
You've got an aunt in the Vale. Your rich Aunt Lysa. After I sell you to her, maybe she'll have enough left over to buy you that pony you want so much.
Five horses, five men. More than I feel like killing on an empty stomach.
What the fuck's a Lommy?
Got what?
Needle? Of course you named your sword.
Lots of cunts.
What are you... get back here.
Get back here.
I don't care if he ate your friend. We're not going in there.
I could ask the same of you. What are you doing up here?
No need. The war's over.
None taken.
She's all right. I've had better.
I'm not going to King's Landing.
Fuck the king.
Here I am. Bring me one of those chickens.
You paid for it?
Not a penny.
I'll still take that chicken.
You're a talker. Listening to talkers makes me thirsty.
Ah. And hungry. Think I'll take two chickens.
I understand that if any more words come pouring out of your cunt mouth, I'm gonna have to eat every fucking chicken in this room.
Someone is.
You want something?
I asked if you wanted something.
You’re paid by the Lannisters. You’re here for the bounty on me.
No? Fancy sword you’ve got there. Where’d you get it? I’ve been looking at Lannister gold all my life. Go on, Brienne of fucking Tarth, tell me that’s not Lannister gold.
You heard the girl! She’s not coming with you.
You’re not a good listener. Valyrian steel-- I’ve always wanted some Valyrian steel.

Safety?! Where the fuck’s that? Her aunt in the Eyrie’s dead. Her mother’s dead, her father’s dead, her brother’s dead. Winterfell’s a pile of rubble. There’s no safety, you dumb bitch. If you don’t know that by now, you’re the wrong one to watch over her.
Aye, that’s what I’m doing.
I’m not a knight.
You’re still here? [Coughs] Big bitch saved you.
No, not you. You’re a real killer. With your water dancing, and your needle.

Unless there’s a Maester hiding behind that rock, aye, I’m done. I’d skin you alive for wine. [Arya offers water.] Fuck water! Killed by a woman. (Chuckles) I bet you liked that. Go on, go after her. She’ll help you. Going out alone, you won’t last a day out there.

You remember where the heart is? Fuck it. I’m ready. Go on, girl. Another name off your list. You kept promising me. I cut down your butcher’s boy, the ginger. He was begging for mercy. Please sir, please don’t kill me, please, please. Bled all over my horse. Saddle stunk of butcher’s boy for weeks. And your sister, your pretty sister. I should’ve taken her. That night the Blackwater burned, I should’ve fucked her bloody. At least I’d have one happy memory! Do I have to beg you? Do it. Do it.
Kill me. Kill me! Kill me! Kill me!
Near Fairmarket, I think.
No, I don't have a map.
Just point out the next map shop you see and I'll buy you one.
Far.
Believe me, girl, I want you there as soon as I can. Get my gold, be on my way.
Why do you care? Might book passage across the Narrow Sea. Fight as a sellsword. Second Sons, could be. Seems like a good fit for me.
Why Braavos?
I doubt it.
What do you want?
If I'm standing on it, it's my land.
You got to do all seven of the fuckers?
And we ask the Stranger not to kill us in our beds tonight for no damn reason at all.
Call that a fight? Slaughtering livestock more like.
Guest right don't mean much anymore.
You got any ale?
How can a man not keep ale in his home?
What'll you pay? I don't have much. But I have hidden a bit of silver from the bandits. Fair wages for fair work?
(Nods) Fair wages for fair work.
Get your horse saddled.
I wasn't.
Aye, he took us in. He's a good man and his daughter makes a nice stew. And they'll both be dead come winter.
I do know it. He's weak. He can't protect himself. They'll both be dead come winter. Dead men don't need silver.
There's plenty worse than me. I just understand the way things are. How many Starks they got to behead before you figure it out?
Would you shut up?
The names of every fucking person in Westeros?
(CHUCKLES) Hate's as good a thing as any to keep a person going. Better than most. We come across my brother, maybe we can both cross a name off our list.
I'd tell him to shut the fuck up so I can get some sleep. Go on, get it over with, your list of doomed men.
Go on.
The hell you doing?
What, ways to die?
They will if you Nance around like that. That's no way to fight.
Dancing? Maybe you ought to put on a dress. Who taught you that shite?
Braavos. (SCOFFS) Greasy-haired little bastard, I bet. They all are.
I bet his hair is greasier than Joffrey's cunt.
Was? He dead?
How?
Who by?
Meryn Trant? The greatest swordsman who ever lived killed by Meryn fucking Trant?
Any boy whore with a sword could beat three Meryn Trants.

The greatest swordsman who ever lived didn't have a sword? (LAUGHS) All right. You have a sword. Let's see what he taught you. Go on, do it for your Braavosi friend. Dead like all the rest of your friends.
Your friend's dead and Meryn Trant's not 'cause Trant had armor and a big fucking sword. (SCOFFS)
Could be food.
Who were "they"?
That's not gonna get better.
A bad way to go. Haven't you had enough?
(Shakes his head.) Her captor. Bringing her to her aunt for ransom.
So do I.
That's where the heart is. That's how you kill a man.
The fuck you doing?
Guess that's what the king does when you tell him to fuck off.
And you thought you were going to collect it? Didn't think very hard, did you?
This day's really not working out the way you planned. He on your little list?
What's your name?
You're learning.
Rat cunts. Fucking whore.
No fire.
No fire!
Shut up about it. Shut up about everything. Thanks to you, I'm a walking bag of silver anywhere the Lannisters hold sway. Which is everywhere between where we are now and where we're going.

I'm as stupid as that hog you stuck back in the village, getting myself cut and stabbed and bitten. No reward is worth this much trouble. Wish I'd never laid eyes on you. You say your brother gave you that sword.
My brother gave me this. It was just like you said a while back. Pressed me to the fire like I was a nice juicy mutton chop.

Thought I stole one of his toys. I didn't steal it. I was just playing with it. The pain was bad. The smell was worse. But the worst thing was that it was my brother who did it. My father, who protected him... told everyone my bedding caught fire. You think you're on your own?
I thought it'd make me happy, but it doesn't. Not really. Nothing makes you happy.
Like what?
So you're sad because you didn't get to kill Joffrey yourself. Is that it?
Aye, nothing in the world beats that look.
I wasn't the damn wine taster. Little shit deserved to die, but poison...poison's a woman's weapon. Men kill with steel.
*laughs* I'd pay good money to see that. *grunts and rubs his neck*
It's a fleabite.
Well, we won't have to walk too much further.
Aye, she'll pay.
Doesn't matter. You're her blood. Family, honor, all that horseshit. It's all you lords and ladies ever talk about.
The bloody Hound, Sandor Clegane. And his...traveling companion Arya Stark, niece of your lady Lysa Arryn.

6.text: Just one.
He was a woman.
I’m used to it.
Hate.
Aye, there’s a reason. I’m a big fucker and I’m tough to kill.
I’ve heard that before. Man was talking about a different god, though.
You’re in the wrong line of work.
You didn’t know me back in my time. You don’t know the things I’ve done.
If the gods are real...why haven’t they punished me?
“Seven save you, friends.”
They don’t believe in your Seven. They’re from the Brotherhood. They follow the Red God.
Sure, you do. You’ve got food, you’ve got steel even if you say you don’t. And you’ve got women.
You do.
Even if it’s to protect yourself?
You don’t cure it by dying, either.
It’s gonna be a cold night. We’ll need firewood.
Where’s the other one? The one with the yellow cloak.
Those are your last words, fuck you? Come on, you can do better.
You’re shit at dying, you know that?
Chasing them. You?
Any particular reason?
Same reason. I was helping build it. They killed a friend of mine.
Not anymore. They’re mine.
Fuck your name. They’re mine. I killed you once before, Dondarrion. Happy to do it again.
Drop that arrow, you bloody girl.
Tougher girls than you have tried to kill me.
Two.
hanging? All over in an instant. Where’s the punishment in that?
We all bloody die.
Except this one here. I’ll only gut one of them.
I’ll chop off one hand.
Bunch of nancies.
There was a time I would have killed all seven of you just to gut these three.
He’s not.
Got anything to eat?
I prefer chicken.
I tried joining. Didn’t work out for me.
Lots of horrible shit in this world gets done for something larger than ourselves.
And you’re going to go stop them?
Last time you saw me, you wanted to execute me.
I beat you because I’m better than you, Beric. I was better than you before you started yammering on about the Lord and I’m better than you now.

7.text: You've got real powerful magic to figure that out. Did the Lord of Light whisper that in your ear? "It's snowing, Thoros. It's windy. It's gonna be a cold night."
Don't like that shit. It's too sweet.
Experience.
These people don't want us here.
I don't like the look of it.
I'll tell you what doesn't scare me
They don't.
With death.
Doesn't matter now.
I've known you a long time, Dondarrion.
And I always thought you were dull as dirt.
You're not bad. I don't hate you. Don't like, but you're not bad.
But there's nothing special about you.

So why does the Lord of Light keep bringing you back? I've met better men than you, and they've been hanged from crossbeams, or beheaded, or just shat themselves to death in a field somewhere. None of them came back. So, why you?
And?
Your Lord.
If he's so all-powerful, why doesn't he just tell you what the fuck he wants?
It's my fucking luck I end up with a band of fire worshippers.
There's no divine justice, you dumb cunt. If there was, you'd be dead...and that girl would be alive.
What do you want?
I don't want to look in the damn flames.
I keep asking and no one wants to tell me.
Logs burning.
Ice. A wall of ice. The Wall.
It's where the Wall meets the sea. There's a castle there.
There's a mountain. Looks like an arrowhead. The dead are marching past.
Thousands of them.
Burying the dead.
Not really.
We ask the Father to judge us with mercy. We ask the Mother to... Fuck it, I don't remember the rest. I'm sorry you're dead. You deserved better. Both of you.
For fuck's sake, will you shut your hole. Are we coming with you or not?
Sounds all right so far.
Was she naked too?
It could have been worse.
But they didn't, did they? So what you whinging about?
Your lips are moving and you're complaining about something. That's whinging.
This one's been killed six times. You don't hear him bitching about it.
Fuck off.
I don't give two shits about Wildlings.
Gingers I hate.
Don't point your fucking finger at me.
I didn't trip. I was pushed.
Will you fuck off?
Do you want to suck my dick? Is that it?
Cock.
I bet you do.
Brienne of Tarth.
You're with Brienne of fucking Tarth?
How does she look at you? Like she wants to carve you up and eat your liver?
We've met.
How did a mad fucker like you live this long?
That's what I saw in the fire.
A mountain like an arrowhead.
We're getting close.
Fuck off.
Not yet. You came pretty close.
You and me both.
Where?
Who's protecting her if you're here?
It won't be me.
Anyone touches it, I'll kill you first.
I left this shit city because I didn't want to die in it. Am I going to die in this shit city?
And this is all your idea. Seems every bad idea has some Lannister cunt behind it.
Remember me? Yeah, you do. You're even fucking uglier than I am now. What did they do to you? Doesn't matter. That's not how it ends for you, brother.

8.text: You're saying you're good, is that it?
You know who makes weapons for the wildlings? Cripples and cocksuckers. Which one are you?
I heard you were here. You left me to die.
You're a cold little bitch, aren't you? Guess that's why you're still alive.
You never used to shut up. Now you're just sitting there like a mute.
What's it look like?
I fought for you, didn't I?
Oh, for fuck's sake. May as well be at a bloody wedding.
Was he on your list?

Thoros isn't here anymore, so I hope you're not about to give a sermon. Because if you are, the Lord of Light's gonna wonder why he brought you back 19 times just to watch you die when I chuck you over this fucking wall.
Where are you going?
You can still smell the burning bodies, and thatâ€™s where your head is at.
I'm sure you do.
Of course it's about that, you twat. Why shouldn't it be? The dead are dead. You're not.
Don't touch me.
I'm not done with my drink.
This is my drink.
There's only one thing that'll make me happy.
That's my fucking business.
Used to be you couldn't look at me.
Yes, I've heard. Heard you were broken in. Heard you were broken in rough.
How?
You've changed, Little Bird.
None of it would have happened if you'd left King's Landing with me. No Littlefinger, no Ramsay none of it.
For fuck's sake.
Not anymore. I don't like crowds.
Why not? They all love you now. You're the big hero.
It must have felt good sticking a knife in that horned fucker.
I have some unfinished business.
I don't plan on coming back.
Gonna leave me to die again if I get hurt?

1.text: Mmh. It is true what they say about the Northern girls.
I did hear something about that.
And the other brother?
There’s the pretty one. And there’s the clever one.
I hear he hates that nickname.
Clever girl.
Have you?
The gods gave me one blessing.
Should I explain to you the meaning of a closed door in a whorehouse, brother?
She has odd cravings, our sister.
I’m sorry, I’ve begun the feast a bit early. And this is the first of many courses.
Close the door!
Your uncle’s in the Night’s Watch.
Preparing for a night with your family. I’ve always wanted to see the Wall.
My greatest accomplishment. You – you’re Ned Stark’s bastard, aren’t you?
Did I offend you? Sorry. You are the bastard, though.

And Lady Stark is not your mother. Making you a bastard. Let me give you some advice, bastard. Never forget what you are. The rest of the world will not. Wear it like armor. Then it can never be used to hurt you.
All dwarves are bastards in their fathers’ eyes.
If I get through this without squirting from one end or the other, it will be a miracle.
The greatest in the land. My spear never misses.
The Stark boy appears to be less green than we'd hoped.

There's your peace. Joffrey saw to that when he decided to remove Ned Stark's head. You'll have an easier time drinking from that cup than you will bringing Robb Stark to the table now. He's winning – in case you hadn't noticed.
Half wrong. l'm new to strategy, but unless we want to be surrounded by three armies, it appears we can't stay here.
And do what?
Heads, spikes, walls. Why not my uncle? Why not anyone? Why me?
So it would seem.
No, he said l couldn't take you with me to King's Landing. He was very specific on that point.
What?
l believe he used the word "whore".

My father's probably the most powerful man in the country. Certainly the richest. He has all Seven Kingdoms in his pockets. Everyone everywhere always has to do exactly what my father says. He's always been a cunt. l believe the ladies of the court could learn a great deal from a girl like you. Why don't you come with me, be the Hand's lady? Because the King needs a Hand and the Hand – (Shae kisses Tyrion)
Before you go, you will call on Lord and Lady Stark and offer your sympathies.
None. But it is expected of you. Your absence has already been noted.
One word and I'll hit you again.

Go! Tell her. But first you will get to Lord and Lady Stark and you will fall on your knees in front of them and tell them how very sorry you are, that you are at their service, and that all your prayers are with them. Do you understand?
Do you understand?
I hope so. If he forgets, be a good dog and remind him. Time for breakfast...
Bread. And two of those little fish. And a mug of dark beer to wash it down. And bacon, burnt black.
Beloved siblings.
Apparently not.
The Maester says the boy may live.
Only the gods know for certain. All the rest of us can do is pray. The charms of the north seem entirely lost on you.
Where's your sense of wonder? The greatest structure ever built, the intrepid men of the Night's Watch, the wintry abode of the White Walkers.
And go celibate? The whores would go begging from Dorne to Casterly Rock. I just want to stand on top of the Wall and piss off the edge of the world.
Speaking for the grotesques, I'd have to disagree. Death is so final, whereas life... Life is full of possibilities. I hope the boy does wake. I'd be very interested to hear what he has to say.
My dear brother, you wound me. You know how much I love my family.

Rapers. They were given a choice no doubt... Castration or the Wall. Most choose the knife. Not impressed by your new brothers? Lovely thing about the Watch... You discard your old family and get a whole new one.
Look at me and tell me what you see.

What you see is a dwarf. If I'd been born a peasant they might've left me out in the woods to die. Alas, I was born a Lannister of Casterly Rock. Things are expected of me. My father was the Hand of the King for 20 years.

Yes, until my brother killed him. Life is full of these little ironies. My sister married the new King and my repulsive nephew will be King after him. I must do my part for the honor of my house, wouldn't you agree? But how? Well, my brother has his sword and I have my mind. And a mind needs books like a sword needs a whetstone. That's why I read so much. And you? What's your story, bastard?
A bastard boy with nothing to inherit, off to join the ancient order of the Night's Watch, alongside his valiant brothers-in-arms.

Yes yes, against grumpkins and snarks and all the other monsters your wet nurse warned you about. You're a smart boy. You don't believe that nonsense... Everything's better with some wine in the belly.
A charming man.
And how's that going, Commander Mormont?
Good news or bad?
I'm looking at you. You've got an interesting face. Very distinctive faces. All of you.
It's just I think they would look marvelous decorating spikes in King's Landing. Perhaps I'll write my sister, the Queen, about it.
Grenn's father left him too... Outside a farmhouse when he was three. Pyp was caught stealing a wheel of cheese. His little sister hadn't eaten in three days. He was given a choice
It's a lucky thing none of them were trained by a master-at-arms like your Ser Rodrik. I don't imagine any of them have ever held a real sword before they came here. Your brother Bran. He's woken up.
You're joking?
And how do a bear's balls taste?
Do Dornish girls count? So you roam the Seven Kingdoms, collaring pickpockets and horse thieves and bringing them here as eager recruits?
They have a better chance finding feed than glory.
You don't have enough men to be an army and aside from Yoren here, none of you are particularly funny.
Do you think I'm plump? Listen, Benjen... May I call you Benjen?
I'm not sure what I've done to offend you. I have great admiration for the Night's Watch. I've great admiration for you as First Ranger.

But... I don't believe that giants and ghouls and White Walkers are lurking beyond the Wall. I believe that the only difference between us and the wildlings is that when the Wall went up, our ancestors happened to live on the right side of it.
I think he's starting to like me. "Going below"?
So you're heading down to King's Landing too.
Let's share the road. I could use some decent company.
Not this time. We'll be staying at the finest castles and inns. No one turns away a Lannister.
Eight... no, nine.
They say the winter of my birth was three years long, Maester Aemon.
Yes, and the fishermen of Lannisport say they see mermaids.
It's either me or this cold. And it doesn't appear to be going anywhere.
I expect I will. Gods know there aren't many feather beds between here and King's Landing.
Of course.
If you're going to be a cripple, it's better to be a rich cripple. Take care, Snow.
I must say I received a slightly warmer welcome on my last visit.
Any man of the Night's Watch, but not I, eh, boy?
Then you might learn a lord's courtesy.
So it's true. Hello Bran. Do you remember anything about what happened?
Curious.
Would your charming companion be so kind as to kneel? My neck is beginning to hurt.
Do you like to ride, Bran?
What of it? With the right horse and saddle, even a cripple can ride.

Then I'm not a dwarf. My father will rejoice to hear it. I have a gift for you. Give that to your saddler. He'll provide the rest. You must shape the horse to the rider. Start with a yearling and teach it to respond to the reins and to the boy's voice.
You will. On horseback you will be as tall as any of them.
I have a tender spot in my heart for cripples, bastards and broken things.
Spare me your false courtesies, Lord Stark. There's a brothel outside your walls. There I'll find a bed and both of us can sleep easier.
Come to see me off, Greyjoy? Kind of you. Your master doesn't seem to like Lannisters.
No, of course not. What happened here? Where is lady Stark? Why didn't she receive me?
She's not in Winterfell, is she? Where did she go?

My lady? Your loyalty to your captors is touching. Tell me, how do you think Balon Greyjoy would feel if he could see his only surviving son has turned lackey? I still remember seeing my father's fleet burn in Lannisport. I believe your uncles were responsible?
Nothing prettier than watching sailors burn alive. Yes, a great victory for your people. Shame how it all turned out.
A stupid rebellion then. I suppose your father realized that when your brothers died in battle. Now here you are, your enemy's squire.

I've offended you. Forgive me, it's been a rough morning. Anyway, don't despair. I'm a constant disappointment to my own father and I've learned to live with it. Your next tumble with Ros is on me. I'll try not to wear her out.
My men can sleep in the stable. As for myself, I don't require a large room.
Is there nothing I can do... to remedy this?
There's a clever man. You can manage food, I trust? Yoren, dine with me.
Nothing would more likely ruin my supper. Lady Stark! What an unexpected pleasure. I was sorry to have missed you at Winterfell.
I envy your father all his fine friends, but I don't quite see the purpose of this.
This isn't the Kingsroad. You said we were riding for Winterfell.

Very wise. They'll be out in droves, looking for me in the wrong place. Word's probably gotten to my father by now. He'll be offering a handsome reward. Everyone knows a Lannister always pays his debts. Would you be so good as to untie me?
Why not? Am I going to run? The hill tribes would kill me for my boots. Unless a Shadowcat ate me first.
Ah... the Eastern Road. We're going to The Vale. You're taking me to your sister's to answer for my imagined crimes. Tell me, Lady Stark. When was the last time you saw your sister?
She's changed. She was always a bit touched, but now... you might as well kill me here.
Neither am I! I had nothing to do with the attempt on your son's life!
What sort of imbecile arms an assassin with his own blade?
Why? Am I starting to make sense?
Untie me. If I die, what's the point?
Well, I'm willing if she is.
The Eyrie. They say it's impregnable.
I like you.
Oh? Did I kill him too? I've been a very busy man.
If any harm comes to me, my brother, Jaime, will see that they do.
Mord! Turnkey! Mord! Mord!
How would you like to be rich?
My family is rich. We have gold, lots of gold. I’m prepared to give you lots of gold.
Well, I don’t have it here.
Mord! Mord! Mord! Mord! Mord!
About the gold -
Listen to me! Listen to me! Sometimes possession… is an abstract concept. When they captured me they took my purse, but the gold is still mine.
Where? I don’t know where, but when they free me -

Have you ever heard the phrase “Rich as a Lannister”? Of course you have. You’re a smart man. You know who the Lannisters are. I am a Lannister. Tyrion, son of Tywin! And of course, you have also heard the phrase, “a Lannister always pays his debts.” If you deliver a message from me to Lady Arryn, I will be in your debt. I will owe you gold. If you deliver the message and I live, which I very much intend to do.
Tell her I wish to confess my crimes.
Yes, my lady. I do, my lady.

Where do I begin, my lords and ladies? I’m a vile man, I confess it. My crimes and sins are beyond counting. I have lied and cheated, gambled and whored. I’m not particularly good at violence, but I’m good at convincing others to do violence for me. You want specifics, I suppose. When I was seven, I saw a servant girl bathing in the river. I stole her robe. She was forced to return to the castle, naked and in tears. I close my eyes, I can still see her tits bouncing. When I was ten, I stuffed my uncle’s boots with goatshit. When confronted with my crime, I blamed a squire. Poor boy was flogged and… I escaped justice. When I was twelve, I milked my eel into a pot of turtle stew. I flogged the one-eyed snake. I skinned my sausage. I made the bald man cry into the turtle stew, which I do believe my sister ate. At least I hope she did. I once brought a jackass and a honeycomb into a brothel -
Confessing my crimes.
Oh, I’m very sorry. I don’t know anything about all that.
Is this how justice is done in the Vale? you accuse me of crimes, I deny them, so you throw me in a cell to freeze and starve? Where is the King’s Justice? I’m accused and demand a trial.
I understand the law.
No need to bother Lord Robin. I demand a trial by combat.
Agreed.
Now I demand a champion. I have that right, same as you.
I wouldn’t be too glad, ser. I name my brother, Jaime Lannister.
Send a raven for him, I’m happy to wait.
Do I have a volunteer?
Anyone?... Anyone?
Not this little man. This little man is going home. I believe you have something of mine.
A Lannister always pays his debts.
If I'm going to die, it may as well be with a song in my heart.
Starve, most likely.
What do you want, Bronn? Gold? Women? Golden women?
Though I would treasure your friendship.
Come, share our fire.
I am Tyrion son of Tywin of Clan Lannister.
In my own bed, at the age of 80 with a bellyful of wine and a girl's mouth around my cock.
No no no no no! My, my House is rich and powerful.
Half a man maybe, but at least I have the courage to face my enemies.
That trinket is worth more than everything your tribe owns.
The Vale of Arryn.
From here it might be best if Bronn and I continue alone.
And feed it to the goats, yes.
Uncle. Father.
Sorry to disappoint you.
May I present My Lord Father, Tywin son of Tytos of House Lannister.
We have our differences, Jaime and I.
And the Starks? Lord Eddard?
How did my sweet sister persuade the King to imprison his dear friend Ned?
My sister rules, you mean.
Maybe. Though the boy does have a certain belligerence.
Oh, do continue. Didn't mean to interrupt.
Shagga likes axes.
The vanguard? Me and the tribesmen on the front lines?

Ferocious? Last night a Moon Brother stabbed a Stone Crow over a sausage. Three Stone Crows seized the Moon Brother and opened his throat. Bronn managed to keep Shagga from chopping off the dead man's cock, which was fortunate, but even still, Ulf is demanding blood money, which Shagga and Gunthor refuse to pay.
Surely there are ways to have me killed that would be less detrimental to the war effort.
lt appears l'm not hungry after all. Excuse me, my lords.
Where did you find one so pretty at this hour?
Took her? From whom?
And he didn't have anything to say about it?
Well, the odds of me living long enough for him to retaliate have just dropped drastically. We'll be at the vanguard tomorrow.
Who are you?
What did your mother call you?
My mother died giving birth to me.
What sort of accent is that?
For-

What do l want from you? l want you to share my tent. l want you to pour my wine, laugh at my jokes, rub my legs when they're sore after a day's ride. l want you to take no other man to bed for as long as we're together. And l want you to fuck me like it's my last night in this world. Which it may well be.
One - safety. No one will hurt you for as long as you're mine. Two - the pleasure of my company, which l have heard is spectacular.
And three - more gold than you can spend if you lived a thousand years. Do you accept my proposal?
No.
Ah! Damn you, woman. Are you immune to pain?
Let's play a new game.
Does it involve the potential for losing fingers?
No! No fire games, no knife games. Let's do something l'm good at.
l happen to be a great judge of character.
lt's not. Here's how it works - l make a statement about your past. lf l'm right, you drink. lf l'm wrong, l drink. And no lying. l'll know if you're lying.
Fine. Bronn first. Your father beat you.
You killed your first man before you were 12.
You've been north of the Wall.
And you once loved a woman many years ago, but it turned out badly so you've never let yourself love again. Oh, wait, that's me. (Tyrion drinks) Your turn, my mysterious foreign beauty.
lt's fun! Look at the fun we're having. Your mother was a whore.
All right. Your father left the family when you were very young, never to return.
And we've established the rules about lying?
You wanted a different life. You came from somewhere and you wanted to be elsewhere.
So, specificsâ€¦ You wanted to be elsewhere, but how would you get there? l don't believe the life of the Silent Sisters is for you. So, what's a lowborn girl to do?
Are you sure â€“
My dear lady, if l have offended you, l apologize.
Fine, fine. Ask away. Try to penetrate the enigma that is me.
That's not how the game works.
How did you hear that?
Another night, perhaps.
lt's not a pleasant story.

So l was 16. My brother Jaime and l were riding, when we heard a scream. She ran out onto the road, clothes half torn off, with two men on her heels. Jaime scared away the men easily enough, while l wrapped her in my cloak. She was too scared to send off on her own, so while Jaime hunted down the rapers l took her to the nearest inn and fed her. Her name was Tysha. She was a wheelwright's orphan. And she was hungry. Together we finished off three chickens and a flagon of wine. lmpossible as it seems, there was a time when l was unaccustomed to wine. l forgot how afraid l was around girls. how l was always waiting for them to laugh at me or look away embarrassed, or ask me about my tall, handsome brother. l forgot about everything but Tysha. And somehow l found myself in her bed.

lt didn't last long. l didn't know what the hell l was doing. But she was good to me. She kissed me afterwards and sang me a song. And by morning l was deep enough in love to ask for her hand. A few lies, a few gold coins, one drunken septon and there you have it - man and wife. For a fortnight anyway, until the septon sobered up and told my father.

Not quite. First, my father had Jaime tell me the truth. The girl was a whore, you see. Jaime had arranged the whole thing - the road, the rapers, all of it. He thought it was time l had a woman. After my brother confessed, my father brought in my wife and gave her to his guards. He paid her well - a silver for each man. How many whores command that kind of price? He brought me into the barracks and made me watch. By the end, she had so much silver that the coins were slipping through her fingers and rolling on to the floor.
Really? l was 16, drunk and in love.
As l said, l was young and stupid.
What is it? What do you want?
What?
Get my squire!
lf l die, weep for me.
l'll know.
Stay low?
l was born lucky. Tribesmen of the Vale, gather round! Stone Crows! Black Ears! Burned Men! Moon Brothers! And Painted Dogs! Your dominion over the Vale begins now! Onward, to claim what is yours!
To battle!
l'm alive?
Did we win?
How did our tribesmen do?
lt's nice to see them getting along.
Good of you to notice. l hear we won.
Did we get the Stark boy, at least?
Where was he?
And where are they?

2.text: Beloved nephew.
We looked for you on the battlefield. (Joffrey sits down). You were nowhere to be found.

What a fine job you've done. (Turns to Myrcella). Look at you. (Kisses her). More beautiful than ever. (Turns to Tommen). And you! You, you're going to be bigger than the Hound, but much better looking. (Tyrion smiles. He and Myrcella laugh). This one doesn't like me.
Me, too, dear. Death is so boring, especially now with so much excitement in the world. (Looks at Sansa). My Lady, I'm sorry for your loss.
But still her father. Surely having so recently lost your own beloved father you can sympathize.
Of course you are.
Well, (Gulps down his wine), enjoy your name day, Your Grace. Wish I could stay and celebrate, but there is work to be done.
Don't get up. More ravishing than ever, big sister. (Kisses Cersei on the cheek). War agrees with you. Forgive the interruption, carry on.

(Sits down) It's been a remarkable journey. I, (grabs a glass), pissed off the edge of the Wall, I slept in a sky cell. (Pours himself wine). I fought with the hill tribes. So many adventures, so much to be thankful for.
Yes., well, I, do believe the Hand of the King is welcome at all small council meetings.
Yes, but in his absence…
If I were capable of tricking father, I'd be emperor of the world by now. You brought this on yourself. (Cersei sits down).
Quite right. You did nothing when your son called for Ned Stark's head. Now the entire North has risen up against us.
Did you? You failed. That bit of theater will haunt our family for a generation.
Who's won every battle he's fought. Do you understand we're losing the war?
Nothing. But I know people. And I know that our enemies hate each other almost as much as they hate us.
Joffrey is King.
I'm only here to advise him. And if the King listens to what I say, the King might just get his Uncle Jaime back.
You love your children. It's your one redeeming quality. That and your cheekbones. The Starks love their children as well. And we have two of them.
One?
Disappeared? What, in a puff of smoke? We had three Starks to trade. You chopped one's head off and let another escape. Father will be furious. It must be odd for you to be the disappointing child.
A bit corpsey, yes.
I thought you wanted to come here.
You love the smell of dead bodies and shit?
You can smell cum from the balcony?
And so did the country.
Yes, well, you need to be careful. No one can know you're here.
You can't trust anyone in King's Landing. They're all liars; good liars, bad liars, one or two great liars.
Me? I'm not from here. I'm a slave to the truth.
Why do you think I am so little? I'm being, (Lays down on the bed with Shae), crushed beneath the weight of all that truth.
Ned Stark actually slept on this, as if the poor man didn't suffer enough. One of the many changes we'll have to make around here.
Pod.
Pod! Find Bronn or Varys. Tell them I am here with Maester Pycelle. Tell them I am very much alive.
What happened?
Where am I?
Why should I believe you?
To create strife between my sister and me.
Pod.
Would it be excessive of me to ask you to save my life twice in a week?
You're a good lad. Get Bronn, tell him I want four of his most loyal gold cloaks outside my door at all times.
Then my hill tribesmen.
Don't want to swim too close to a drowning man? And I thought we were friends.
It was good of you to come.
Believe me, you don't.
(shakes his head)
Well?
I'm a monster as well as a dwarf. You should charge me double.
That was the arrangement we made. I pay you and you lie to me.
Leave?
What would we do in Pentos?
I want to go with you.

I can't. I do belong here. These bad people are what I'm good at. Outtalking them, outthinking them. It's what I am. And I like it. I like it more than anything I've ever done. Are you going to leave?
You brought this on yourself.
Do you understand we’re losing the war?
It was quite a battle.
(Begins to pour wine). Strange things do happen. You should taste her fish pie.
Men like Lord Varys and I can't let our disadvantages get the best of us. We'll make a fisherman of him yet. (Takes a sip).
Your discretion is legendary, where your friends are concerned.
I don't like threats.
I'm not Ned Stark. I understand the way this game is played.
And I am not. Threaten me again and I will have you thrown into the sea.
You've perfected the art of tearing up papers. Give him his father's bones back, at least, as a gesture of good faith.
Safe travels, cousin.
You have a deft hand with diplomacy.
Lord Commander asks that we send more men to man The Wall.
Cold winds are rising, and the dead rise with them.
According to the Commander, one of these dead men attacked him in his chambers. (The other stop leaving). Mormont doesn't lie.
Apparently you burn him.
I don't know what I believe, but here's a fact for you. The Night's Watch is the only thing that separates us from what lies beyond the Wall.
Leave us, Podrick. I believe we know how to pour our own wine.
Myself, I prefer the improper ones.
You know your wines, my lord.
Call me Tyrion, please. I'm sure you're getting used to fine dinners, now that you're a lord.
Wars have been started for less.
I heard there was some trouble in Littlefinger's brothel the other night.
Yes, of course. City Watch must keep the peace. Only, I hadn't realized peace depended on killing babies.
Quite right. Especially the queen's orders.
No, but who else would want to murder King Robert's bastards? She's always been a jealous woman.
You've heard the awful rumors about my brother and sister.
That's good of you, but you have heard them. I suppose people who do believe that filth, consider Robert's bastards to be better claimants to the throne than Cersei's children.
I appreciate your loyalty. Tell me.
The fool! He had no idea you were already bought.
I'm not questioning your honor, Lord Janos. I'm denying its existence.
Dwarf? You should have stopped at imp. And yes, you will stand here and take it from me, unless you'd like to take it from my friend here.
I intend to serve as Hand of the King until my father returns from the war, and seeing as you betrayed the last Hand of the King, well, I just wouldn't feel safe with you lurking about.
The queen regent. And you're a fool to believe she's your friend.
No, we shan't.

There's a ship leaving for East Watch by the sea tonight. From there, I'm afraid it's rather a long walk to Castle Black. I hope you enjoy the Wall. I found it surprisingly beautiful, in a brutal, horribly uncomfortable sort of way.
His name is Bronn... and he is the new commander of the City Watch.
To the new Commander.
If I told you to murder, an infant girl say, still at her mother's breast, would you do it without question?
I have every right. I am the King's Hand.
Listen to me, Queen Regent, you're losing the people. Do you hear me?

You might find it difficult to rule over millions who want you dead. Half the city will starve when winter comes. The other half will plot to overthrow you. And your gold-plated thugs just gave them the rallying cry, “The Queen slaughters babies.” (Cersei says nothing). You don't even have the decency to deny it.
It wasn't you who gave the order, was it? Joffrey didn't even tell you. Or did he tell you? I imagine that would be even worse.
I'm no king, but I think there's more to ruling that that.
(Tries not to laugh). As has Jaime repeatedly, according to Stannis Baratheon.
She was my mother too.
Keep your voice down.
I don't intend for you to stay here. I might be able to bring you into the castle kitchens. Again, only temporary.
But you wouldn't be a cook. You'd pose as a scullion.
Kitchen wench.
Yes, but
Your lion wants to see you alive. We've come to a dangerous place. My sister wants to hurt me. She'll look for any weakness she can find. She can't know about you.
It's a compliment, my lady.
Language can be a bit tricky here.
Oh! Thank the gods. I haven't had a proper shit in six days.
Right. I'm so grateful to have a man of your vast knowledge and wisdom on my side.
I can trust you, Pycelle, can I not?
These are perilous times. And the crown must forge new alliances. And these alliances must often be sealed in matrimony.
I'm trusting the council with these plans, but the Queen mustn't know. We can't have her meddling in affairs that could determine the future of the realm. There's too much at stake.
I'm brokering an alliance with House Martell of Dorne. Princess Myrcella will wed their youngest son when she comes of age, ensuring their loyalty and their army, should we need it.
But remember, the Queen mustn't know.
I plan to marry Princess Myrcella off to Theon Greyjoy.
Precisely. Theon's father loathes the Starks and will convince the boy to come to our side. Greyjoy can destroy the Northern army from within and we can have his father's ships.
But remember, you must tell no one.
I plan to wed Princess Myrcella to Robin Arryn of the Vale. Lysa is not fond of me. But perhaps the promise of a royal match will convince her to let bygones be bygones.
For men in our position, holding grudges can be an encumbrance, don't you think?
Who better?
The gratitude of the people of Westeros for helping to end this war, the adoration of the King for bringing the Vale back into the fold and Harrenhal.
Never took you for a superstitious man. By all means, tear it down and rebuild. You'll be able to afford it. I plan to make you Lord of the Riverlands.
You served my family well in the matter of the succession.
I need you to deliver Lysa Arryn. I didn't need Janos Slynt. It's settled, then?
Good. Oh. And remember
Myrcella's a princess. Some would say she was born for this.
Dorne is the safest place for her.
That's why we need to seduce them. We're going to need their support in the war your son started.
A guest.
It's done, Cersei.
You cannot stop it.

Just how safe do you think Myrcella is if this city falls? Do you want to see her raped, butchered like the Targaryen children? Make no mistake. They'll mount her pretty little head on a spike right beside yours.
No, afraid not. Sorry about that.
Yes, I fear so. Sorry about that, too.
That's a shame. You were to be the centerpiece of my next deception. My brother Jaime rots in a northern stockade. I would see him released. That's where you come in.
No, he won't. But his mother might. How would you like to see your beloved Cat again?
Find him?
No, you don't.
You disappoint me, Grand Maester.
So loyal that you told the Queen about my plans to send Myrcella to Dorne.
See, I told Varys that I was giving the Princess to the Greyjoys. I told Littlefinger that I planned to wed her to Robin Arryn. I told no one that I was offering her to the Dornish. No one but you.
Cut off his manhood and feed it to the goats.
Well, make do.
How long have you been spying for my sister?
I don't like his beard.
How many Hands have you betrayed, Pycelle? Eddard Stark? Jon Arryn?
So you poisoned him?
But you let him die, made sure he succumbed.
Get him out of my sight. Throw him in one of the black cells.
For your trouble.
Good. One of my better ideas.
The Council has a reputation for serving past Hands poorly. I don't mean to follow Ned Stark to the grave.
Why, am I about to hear one?
Depends on the sellsword.
He has a sword, the power of life and death.
I've decided I don't like riddles.
What is the meaning of this?
What kind of knight beats a helpless girl?
Someone get the girl something to cover herself with. She is to be your queen. Have you no regard for her honor?
For what crimes? She did not fight her brother's battle, you half-wit.
The Mad King did as he liked. Has your Uncle Jaime ever told you what happened to him?
I'm not threatening the king, ser. I am educating my nephew. Bronn, the next time Ser Meryn speaks, kill him. That was a threat. See the difference?
I apologize for my nephew's behavior. Tell me the truth. Do you want an end to this engagement?
Lady Stark, you may survive us yet.
You think dipping his wick will cure what ails him?
Your visits are too few, cousin.
So it is. Will you take a cup with me? I find that mulled wine helps me sleep.
If my sister was so concerned for Pycelle, I would have thought she'd come herself.
And you've received these instructions directly from Cersei?
And you've waited this long to deliver the information?
Cersei must have great trust in you, allowing you into her chamber during the hour of the wolf.
She must be very glad to have you helping her from dusk till dawn.
Ah. Lavender oil. She always loved lavender oil, even as a girl.
An anointed knight, yes. Tell me, did Cersei have you knighted before or after she took you into her bed? What? Nothing to say? No more warnings for me, ser?
Have you ever given any thought to what King Joffrey will have to say when he finds out you've been bedding his mother?
Did she take you against your will? Can you not defend yourself, knight?
Did he tell you to fuck her, too?

Hated every moment of it, is that what you'll have me believe? A high place in court, a knighthood, my sister's legs spreading open for you at night. Oh, yes, it must have been terrible. Wait here. His Grace will want to hear this.
Save it for Joffrey. He loves a good grovel.
No, I think not.

You heard me. My father told you to obey my sister. Obey her. Stay close to her side. Keep her trust. Pleasure her whenever she requires. No one ever need know, as long as you keep faith with me. I want to know what Cersei is doing, where she goes, who she sees, what they talk of, everything. And you will tell me.

Oh, rise, rise. Let us drink to our understanding. Oh, you don't have a cup. Oh, well. Smile, cousin. My sister is a beautiful woman, and it's all for the good of the realm. Go back and tell her that I beg her forgiveness, that I want no more conflict between us and that, henceforth, I shall do nothing without her consent.
Oh, I'll give her Pycelle.

Yes, I'll release him in the morning. Cersei can keep him as a pet, if she wants, but I will not have him on the Council. I could swear that I had not harmed a single hair on his head, but that would not, strictly speaking, be true. Stay within one table length.
Accounts differ. Most seem to implicate Catelyn Stark in some way.
Some say it was one of his own Kingsguard, while still others say it was Stannis himself who did it after negotiations went sour.
It's not what Varys says. He says Renly's army is flocking to support Stannis, which would give Stannis superiority over us on both land and sea.
And I say Father raised you to have too much respect for money. Stannis Baratheon is coming for us, sooner rather than later.
She'll be safer in Dorne.
It so happens that I am. Myrcella is a sweet, innocent girl and I don't blame her at all for you.
Schemes and plots are the same thing. They are going to attack us. We need to be ready.
May I ask specifically what the king has in mind?
It's important that we talk about this.
Wildfire? You wouldn't lie to me, would you, cousin?
That's a lie right there.
Tell me, if the vile allegations against my brother and sister are true, do you think it will make Jaime more likely to kill you or less likely? When I tell him you're fucking her, I mean.
The smart money would be on more likely.
But then perhaps his own unnatural urges will give him sympathy for yours.
I suppose there's only one way to find out.
When did she tell you this?
Swear to me on what?
But I don't care about your life.
All right, all right. Enough. Even torturing you is boring. Just get out.
Oh, Lancel, tell my friend Bronn to please kill you if anything should happen to me.
Stannis has more infantry, more ships, more horses. What do we have?
Well, I've never actually been able to kill people with it.

He hasn't sent a raven in weeks. He's very busy. Being repeatedly humiliated by Robb Stark is time-consuming. We won't be able to hold the city against Stannis, not the way Joffrey's planning on holding it.
It's hard to argue with his assessment.
The king is a lost cause. It's the rest of us I'm worried about now.
You have to admire his imagination.
What? Demon monkey?
Blame me? I'm trying to save them.
Demon monkey.
I remember reading an old sailors' proverb, "Piss on wildfire and your cock burns off. "
My companion takes issue.
How much do you have?
My friend remains unconvinced.
I'm afraid I have to concur with my advisor, Wisdom Haylene. The contents of this room could lay King's Landing low. You won't be making wildfire for my sister any longer. You'll be making it for me.
Get the Prince back to the Keep now.
Move. Move!
Where's Sansa?
You blind, bloody fool.
We've had vicious kings and we've had idiot kings, but I don't know if we've ever been cursed with a vicious idiot for a king.
I can, I am.
They threw a cow pie at you, so you decided to kill them all? They're starving, you fool. All because of a war you started.
And now I've struck a king. Did my hand fall from my wrist? Where is the Stark girl?
If she dies, you'll never get your Uncle Jaime back. You owe him quite a bit, you know.
Take some men and go and find the Stark girl.
Are you hurt, my lady?
Well done, Clegane.
Since when do you light your own candles?
Stannis Baratheon's fleet has been spotted sailing north past Tarth, 200 ships.
Yes, that's more than we have. He'll be at our gates within five days, four if he has the wind.
"Rain fire on them from above." You're quoting Father, aren't you?

Call it tactics, not strategy. But, yes, he does have a good mind for it. The best mind, some would say. Sadly, he's not here. It's just you, me and Joffrey, the Lord of the Seven Kingdoms and Protector of the Realm.
He needs to start acting like a king. This war you started is coming to our doorstep. And if the entire city wants Joffrey dead
I thought the girls might help him.
I was wrong. If we can't control him
It's hard to put a leash on a dog once you've put a crown on its head.
The boy is more Robert than Jaime.
Sins?
You've beaten the odds. Tommen and Myrcella are good, decent children, both of them.
Yes, but do you have to do it here?
You should start wearing the gold cloak.
You're commander of the City Watch. You shouldn't be dressed like a common
Well, you're not sneaking through alleyways any longer. You're supposed to stand out.
Fine, fine. No gold cloak.
What?
What? What? Why are you staring at me?
To help me plan the defense of King's Landing.
Stannis will be here any day.
"An History of the Great Sieges of Westeros. " By Archmaester Shevelathin. Shevelatesh.
I did not know. And how did you accomplish this marked drop in thievery?
For questioning?
We talked about this.

Stannis knows King's Landing. He knows where the walls are strongest, and he knows which gates are weakest. The Mud Gate. A good ram will batter it down in minutes, and it's only 50 yards from the water. That's where he'll land.
Pig shit.
Thank you, Podrick.
I have a certain sympathy for odd little boys.

Excellent lamprey pie. Were you slaving away in the kitchen all day? I hear Joffrey plans on fighting. An inspiration for the troops. The young king in his shining armor fighting to defend the capital against the wicked old rebel.
Younger boys are off fighting his war.
What is he, 17? Remember Jaime at 17?
It's not on the throne, either, sadly for all of us.
No, I'd say you possess above-average intelligence.

He'll have his Kingsguard protecting him. He has the finest armor gold can buy. He needs to be out there. The men will fight more fiercely seeing their king fighting beside them instead of hiding behind his mother's skirts. Any dessert?
Because he has thousands of spies in his employ. Because he knows everything we do before we do it.
Neither do you.
It's not that little.
Why are you smiling?
And why are you happy?
I thought you preferred blondes.
Why do you care who I fuck?
This is madness. Stannis will be here in days. You need me.
Where did you find her?
You've forgotten the most important thing about whores.
You don't buy them, you only rent them.
And how do I know you haven't killed her already?
I'm sorry they hurt you. You must be brave.
I promise I will free you.
Never.
I will hurt you for this. A day will come when you think you're safe and happy, and your joy will turn to ashes in your mouth. And you will know the debt is paid.
Shae!
You're beautiful.
We have to be more careful.
There are people who want to hurt me.
I would kill for you. Do you know that? I expect I'll have to before this is over. You're mine.
Promise me.
To strike? My dear nephew, you do see these men preparing the walls for siege? You do understand Stannis Baratheon sails this way?
A brave choice, Your Grace. I'm sure your men will line up behind you.
Imagine Stannis' terror.
You're an intelligent man. I'd like to think I'm an intelligent man.
I wish we could converse as two honest, intelligent men.
What do you want? Tell me.
My brother was the youngest Kingsguard in history. My sister became queen at the age of 19. When I reached manhood, my father put me in charge of all the drains and cisterns in Casterly Rock.
The water never flowed better. And all the shit found its way to the sea. I never expected to have any real power. So when my father named me acting Hand
I do. Last thing I expected.
I'd like to keep playing it. If Stannis breaches the gates, the game is over.
The Lord of Light wants his enemies burned, the Drowned God wants them drowned. Why are all the gods such vicious cunts? Where is the god of tits and wine?
We should sail there immediately.
A girl at the edge of the world is the least of our problems.
One game at a time, my friend.
If the city falls, Stannis will burn every Lannister he can find. Of course I'm afraid.
I'm a Lannister. I don't have a choice in all this. But it's not your war.
You can't fuck your way out of everything.
A wedding.
"Is that it?" Nice touch. As if you don't know the name of every boy in town.
I'm entirely sure you're entirely sure what I'm suggesting.
Oddly enough, I do.
There must be 20 miles of tunnels beneath the city.
I'm not escaping. Strange as it sounds, I'm the captain of the ship, and if the ship goes down, I go with her.
Well, I'm not.
What of it?
Blood spells, curses, shape-shifting. What do you think?
Mmm, don't take it personally. I don't entirely trust myself.
No, I don't believe you have.
Remember, wait till the ships
They must be far enough in
I chopped wood once. No, I watched my brother chopping wood.
Nor you, my friend.
Of course we are. Just because I pay you for your services doesn't diminish our friendship.
Oh! "Enhances." Fancy word for a sellsword.
Lady Sansa and Sheila.
Shae, yes. Surely my sister has asked you to join the other highborn ladies in Maegor's holdfast.
Always been a great romantic, my nephew.
Will you?
Stay safe, my lady.
On the way.
Ser Lancel, tell the Hound to tell the king that the Hand is extremely busy. LANCEL
