If there's no future, then why are we here? Why did you allow me to come?
Yes, no, not what you hoped for, but you must have hoped for something.
Mm, not like this.
Yes.
Because I think she will make the world a better place.
She knows herself. She chose an advisor who would check her worst impulses instead of feeding them.
You're pregnant.

8.text: You should consider yourself lucky. At least your balls wonâ€™t freeze off.
Because I have balls, and you don't.

If anyone survives the war to come, we'll have Jon Snow to thank. He risked his life to show us the threat is real. Thanks to his courage, we have brought with us the greatest army the world has ever seen. We have brought two full-grown dragons. And soon, the Lannister army will ride north to join our cause.
I know, I know, our people haven't been friends in the past. But we must fight together now or die.
My lord. My lady.
The Lady of Winterfell. Has a nice ring to it.
Last time we spoke was at Joffrey's wedding. Miserable affair.
Yes, it was a bit hard to explain why my wife fled moments after the king's murder.
Many underestimated you. Most of them are dead now.
I'm sure you weren't thrilled to hear the Lannister army's marching north. You have every right to be fearful of my sister. No one fears her more than I do. But I promise, you'll be safe-
She did.
She has something to live for now. I believe she wants to survive.
One of the better sigils. Beats an onion, anyway.
And our queen is grateful.
I sense that you're leading to a proposal.
They do make a handsome couple.
I'm not that old.
Not as old as him.
Our queen respects the wisdom of age.
What is that?
Your Grace, I know my brother-
He came here alone, knowing full well how he'd be received. Why would he do that if he weren't telling the truth?
I was a fool.
I suspect one of you will be wearing this before it's all over.
Well, here we are.
Together again.
And the masses rejoice.
She's your new queen too.
They remember what happened the last time Targaryens brought dragons north. They'll come around once they see Daenerys is different.
She is.
I am.
It's hard to blame her. I made a mistake common to clever people. I underestimated my opponents.
Cersei told me the pregnancy had changed her. A chance for you both to start again. And I believed her.
Was she lying about the baby too?
She never fooled you. You always knew exactly what she was, and you loved her anyway.
So we're going to die at Winterfell. Not the death I would've chosen. I always pictured myself dying in my own bed, the age of 80, with a belly full of wine and-
My cock.
At least Cersei won't get to murder me. I'm sure I'll feel some satisfaction denying her that pleasure while I'm being ripped apart by dead men.
Maybe after I'm dead I'll march down to King's Landing and rip her apart.
How will he find you?
When the time comes, Ser Davos and I will be on the walls, to give you the signal to light the trench.
Your Grace, I have fought before, I can do it again. Alongside the men and women risking their lives.
Do you need help?
You've had a strange journey.
I'd like to hear about it.
If only we were trapped in a castle in the middle of winter, with nowhere to go.
I wish Father were here.
I would love to see the look on his face when he realizes his two sons are about to die defending Winterfell.
I remember the first time we were here, the first time I saw this hall.
You were a golden lion. I was a drunken whore-monger. It was all so simple.
I was speaking in relative terms.
Of course I miss it.
It's not. Things would be easier if it were.
The perils of self-betterment.
To contemplate your imminent death. You've come to the right place. You want some of this piss? It's not bad. It's not good either.
And you?
Ser Davos, join us.
Would you like a drink?
It's strange, isn't it? Almost everyone here's fought the Starks at one time or another. And here we are in their castle, ready to defend it. Together.
I think we might live.
I-I do. How many battles have we survived between us? Ser Davos Seaworth. Survivor of both the Blackwater and the Battle of the Bastards.
Mm. Ser Jaime Lannister, fabled hero of the Siege of Pyke.
Hear, hear! Ser Brienne of Tarth. Defeated the Hound in-Pardon me, Lady Brienne.
Ser Brienne of Tarth! Knight of the Seven Kingdoms!
No, let's stay a bit longer.
How about a song? One of you must know one. Ser Davos?
Ser Brienne?
Mmm.
And a Lord of Storm's End who will be forever loyal to you.
I'm sure you had your reasons.
So did you?
I don't imagine thinking about that subject will leave you any happier than before.
Then you're in luck. We may have defeated them, but we still have us to contend with.
This is clever. Even better than the saddle I designed for you.
You know our history better than anyone. That will be useful as Lord of Winterfell.
You're the only surviving trueborn son of Ned Stark.
You don't want it.
I envy you.
(drunkenly) Your turn.
Drink.
Go again.
Because it's my game.
Drink.
Drink.
Mm!
No!
You're a virgin.
At no point in the past, up until this very moment, have you slept with a man. Or a woman.
The objective here is to remove Cersei without destroying King's Landing.
I watched the people of King's Landing rebel against their king when they were hungry, and that was before winter began. Give them the opportunity and they will cast Cersei aside.
Once the people see that Cersei is our only enemy, her reign is over.
So if all are in agreement Jon and Ser Davos will ride down the Kingsroad with the Northern troops and the bulk of the remaining Dothraki and Unsullied.
A smaller group of us will ride to White Harbor, and sail from there to Dragonstone with our queen and her dragons accompanying us from above.
Ser Jaime has chosen to remain here, as a guest of the Lady of Winterfell.
So she's going to stay here with you?
I'm happy. I'm happy that you're happy. I'm happy that you'll finally have to climb for it.
Do you know how long I've waited to tell tall-person jokes? To climbing mountains.
What's she like down there?
I haven't been with a woman for years. Give me a morsel.
I am the Imp, and I demand to know.
Ser Bronn of the Blackwater. Where's your drink? What are you-- What are you doing up North?
You're supposed to be south.
That's a bit rude.
You're a knight, thanks to me.
I'm just trying--
See, I don't believe you'd do that, after all--
You broke my nose!
How do you know?
May I speak?
We made a deal long ago. Do you remember?
Highgarden. You could be Lord of the Reach.
It's better than being dead.

You have my word. None of this means a thing until we take King's Landing. We ride south in the morning. We could use an officer with knowledge of the city's defenses. BRONN; (chuckles) Oh, no. No, my fighting days are done. But I still got a few killing days left, you hear me? I'll come find you when the war is done. Till then, don't die.
My lady.
"My lord" is the standard response.
You know she loves your brother.
You seem determined to dislike her. A good relationship between the Iron Throne and the North has been the core of every peaceful, prosperous reign we've ever known.
I don't expect him to spend much time here going forward.
Sansa, look at me.
With Jon in the capital, you'll be the true power in the North. I'd feel much better about the future if I left here today believing that you and Daenerys were allies.
She's your queen too.
You don't have to be her friend. But why provoke her? How is that in the best interest of your family, - or the North, or--?
Every good ruler needs to inspire a bit of fear.
No, but as your brother once told me, he's not a Stark.
Are you all right?
Her people love her, you've seen that. You've seen how they fight for her. She wants to make the world a better place. I believe in her.
Think of the past 20 years. The war, the murder, the misery. All of it because Robert Baratheon loved someone who didn't love him back.
Including us? Eight.
She loses the North. She loses the Vale, Sansa will make sure of that.
He doesn't want the throne.
He loves our queen. And she loves him. If we marry them, they could rule together.
That never stopped a Targaryen before.
Something she has in common with every monarch who ever lived.
We are advisors to the queen. Worrying about her state of mind is our job. We still have to take King's Landing. Maybe Cersei will win and kill us all. That would solve our problems.

It could be a fortnight before Jon and the allied armies make it to King's Landing. In the meantime, demand Cersei surrender. Offer her her life in exchange for the throne. If there's a chance to avoid the coming slaughter, we should make the effort.
She's a girl who walked into a fire with three stones and walked out with three dragons. How could she not believe in destiny?
And how do you know she wasn't?
He doesn't want the throne. That's why he bent the knee.
We're discussing treason.
Of course I've thought about it. Thoughts aren't treason.
Joffrey was a man. I don't think a cock is a true qualification, as I'm sure you'd agree.
What about my earlier proposal? They could rule together as king and queen.
He could temper her worst impulses.
How many kings and queens have you served? Five? Six? I've lost count.
At a certain point, you choose a person you believe in, and you fight for that person.
I believe in our queen. She'll make the right choice. With the help of her loyal advisors.
What is the realm? A vast continent, home to millions of people, most of whom don't care who sits on the Iron Throne.
So, what happens to her?
Please. Don't.
Queen Daenerys demands Cersei's unconditional surrender and the immediate release of Missandei of Naath.
Qyburn, you're a rational man.
We have a chance here, perhaps our last chance, to avoid carnage.
Help me. I don't want to see this city burn. I don't want to hear the screams of children burning alive.
I-- I don't want to hear it. Help me save this city.
Your queen.
Her reign is over. You understand this. Help her understand it.

I know you don't care about your people. Why should you? They hate you and you hate them. But you're not a monster. I know this. I know this because I've seen it. You've always loved your children. More than yourself, more than Jaime more than anything. I beg you. If not for yourself, then for your child. Your reign is over, but that doesn't mean your life has to end. It doesn't mean your baby has to die.
I'll find you later.
I'm going alone.
I freed my brother. And you slaughtered a city.
Did you bring any wine?

Ah... Well... thank you for coming to see me. Our queen doesn't keep prisoners for long. I suppose there's a crude kind of justice. I betrayed my closest friend and watched him burn. Now Varys's ashes can tell my ASHES
So is there life after death?
I should be thankful. Oblivion is the best I could hope for. I strangled my lover. I shot my own father with a crossbow. I betrayed my queen.
I did. And I'd do it again, now that I've seen what I've seen. I chose my fate. The people of King's Landing did not.
Is it? When you heard her talking to her soldiers, did she sound like someone who's done fighting?
She liberated the people of Slaver's Bay. She liberated the people of King's Landing. And she'll go on liberating until the people of the world are free and she rules them all.
Until today. Varys was right. I was wrong. It was vanity to think I could guide her. Our queen's nature is fire and blood.

My father was an evil man. My sister was an evil woman. Pile up all the bodies of all the people they ever killed, there still won't be half as many as our beautiful queen slaughtered in a single day.
The moment the gates fell, the battle was over.
And she burned down a city for it.
Would you have done it?
You've been up there, on a dragon's back. You've had that power. Would you have burned the city down?
(scoffs) Yes, you do. You won't say because you don't want to betray her but you know.
It matters more than anything. When she murdered the slavers of Astapor, I'm sure no one but the slavers complained. After all, they were evil men.

When she crucified hundreds of Meereenese nobles, who could argue? They were evil men. The Dothraki khals she burned alive? They would have done worse to her. Everywhere she goes, evil men die and we cheer her for it. And she grows more powerful and more sure that she is good and right. She believes her destiny is to build a better world for everyone. If you believed that if you truly believed it, wouldn't you kill whoever stood between you and paradise?
I know you love her. I love her too. Not as successfully as you. But I believed in her with all my heart. Love is more powerful than reason. We all know that. Look at my brother.
You just came up with that?

Sometimes duty is the death of love. You are the shield that guards the realms of men. And you've always tried to do the right thing. No matter the cost, you've tried to protect people. Who is the greatest threat to the people now?
It's a terrible thing I'm asking. It's also the right thing. Do you think I'm the last man she'll execute? Who is more dangerous than the rightful heir to the Iron Throne?
And your sisters? Do you see them bending the knee?
Why do you think Sansa told me the truth about you? Because she doesn't want Dany to be queen.
No. But you do. And you have to choose now.
It's not for you to decide.
(nods) You're right. And no one's any better for it. But it's not for you to decide. Jon committed his crime here. His fate is for our king to decide. Or our queen.
You're the most powerful people in Westeros. Choose one.
Me? The Imp? Half the people hate me for serving Daenerys, the other half hate me for betraying her. Can't think of a worse choice.
I've had nothing to do but think these past few weeks. About our bloody history. About the mistakes we've made.

What unites people? Armies? Gold? Flags? Stories. There's nothing in the world more powerful than a good story. Nothing can stop it. No enemy can defeat it. And who has a better story than Bran the Broken? The boy who fell from a high tower and lived. He knew he'd never walk again, so he learned to fly. He crossed beyond the Wall, a crippled boy, and became the Three-Eyed Raven. He is our memory, the keeper of all our stories. The wars, weddings, births, massacres, famines. Our triumphs, mm, our defeats, our past. Who better to lead us into the future?
Good. Sons of kings can be cruel and stupid, as you well know. His will never torment us. That is the wheel our queen wanted to break.
From now on, rulers will not be born. They will be chosen on this spot by the lords and ladies of Westeros to serve the realm.

I know you don't want it. I know you don't care about power. But I ask you now, if we choose you will you wear the crown? Will you lead the Seven Kingdoms to the best of your abilities from this day until your last day?
To Brandon of House Stark I say aye.
All hail Bran the Broken, First of His Name, King of the Andals and the First Men, Lord of the Six Kingdoms and Protector of the Realm.
N-- No, Your Grace, I don't want it.
I don't deserve it. I thought I was wise, but I wasn't. I thought I knew what was right, but I didn't. Choose Ser Davos. Choose anyone else.
Giving you to the Unsullied would start a war. Letting you walk free would start a war. So our new king has chosen to send you to the Night's Watch.
The world will always need a home for bastards and broken men.

You shall take no wife, hold no lands, father no children. The Unsullied wanted your head of course, but Grey Worm has accepted the justice of a life sentence. Sansa and Arya wanted you freed, but they understand our new king needs to make peace. No one is very happy. Which means it's a good compromise, I suppose.
What we did.
Ask me again in 10 years.
I wouldn't be so sure. A few years as Hand of the King would make anyone want to piss off the edge of the world.
That's not-- Uh--
What's this?
I suppose I come in for some heavy criticism.
Oh, he's kind to me. Never would've guessed.
He's not kind?
He what? What does he say about me?
Your Grace.
Yes, Your Grace. Suitable prospects will be brought to you for an audience in the coming weeks.
As you wish, Your Grace.
(clearing his throat) We serve at your pleasure, King Bran the Broken, ruler of the Six Kingdoms and Protector of the Realm. Long may he reign.
That will improve.
Ser Bronn of the Blackwater, Lord of Highgarden, Lord Paramount of the Reach and Master of Coin, would you say the crown's debt to you has been paid?
Good. Time to start incurring a new one. We have hungry people to feed. Can we expect some assistance in this regard?
Lord Davos, we have an armada to rebuild and ports to repair.
Find the best builders and set them to the task.
I once brought a jackass and a honeycomb into a brothel.

1.text: lt's hard for them to simper and bow without heads.
And what would you do, my friend, if you found yourself sitting up there?
You must be one of the few men in the city who isn't a man.
When they castrated you, did they take the pillar with the stones? l've always wondered.
l picture a gash. Like a woman's. ls that about right?
Must be strange for you, even after all these years… a man from another land, despised by most, feared by all.
But you carry on whispering in one king's ear and then the next. l admire you.
A useful talent, l'm sure you'd agree.
Playing our roles.
Long may he reign. My king. (bows)
But we have a Kingdom to look after. I've hoped to meet you for some time, Lord Stark. No doubt Lady Catelyn has mentioned me.
All too well. I still carry a token of his esteem from navel to collarbone.
It wasn't the man that I chose, my Lord. It was Catelyn Tully. A woman worth fighting for, I'm sure you'll agree.
We are the lords of small matters here.
Mmm, how much?
I'll have to borrow it. The Lannisters will accommodate, I expect. We already owe Lord Tywin 3 million gold. What's another 80,000?
I'm telling you the Crown is six million in debt.
The Master of Coin finds the money. The King and the Hand spend it.
As you will. But still, we'd best make our plans.
Cat! Go on. Go upstairs. (to his whores)
I meant no disrespect to you of all people.
No one will come looking for you here. Isn't that what like you wanted? I'm truly sorry... about the locale.
A dear friend told me.
Well well, this is an historic day. Something you don't know that I do. There's only one dagger like this in all of the Seven Kingdoms. It's mine.
At least it was, until the tournament on Prince Joffrey's last nameday. I bet on Ser Jaime in the jousting, as any sane man would. When the Knight of the Flowers unseated him, I lost this dagger.
Tyrion Lannister. The Imp.
Good news? Perhaps you'd like to share it with your wife?
Is she?
I thought that she'd be safest in here. One of several such establishments I own.
The Starks... Quick tempers, slow minds.
The mere suggestion that the Queen's brother tried to kill your boy would be considered treason.
Which Lord Tyrion will say was stolen from him. The only man who could say otherwise has no throat, thanks to your boy's wolf.
I'll try to keep you alive, for her sake. A fool's task, admittedly, but I've never been able to refuse your wife anything.
Don't tell anyone. I have a reputation to maintain.
I will?
And every inn in the city is full and the whores are walking bow-legged.
I hear you're reading a boring book.
He never stops. Do you know Ser Hugh of the Vale? Not surprising. Until recently, he was only a squire... Jon Arryn's squire. He was knighted almost immediately after his master's untimely death.
I promised Cat that I'd help you.

A singularly bad idea. Do you see that boy there? One of Varys's little birds. The Spider has taken a great interest in your comings and goings. Now look there. That one belongs to the Queen. And do you see that Septa pretending to read her book?
No. She's one of mine. Is there someone in your service whom you trust completely?

The wiser answer was no, my Lord. Get a message to this paragon of yours... Discreetly. Send him to question Ser Hugh. After that, you might want him to visit a certain armorer in the city. He lives in a large house at the top of the street of Steel.
I have my observers, as I said, and it's possible that they saw Lord Arryn visit this armorer several times in the weeks before his death.
Distrusting me was the wisest thing you've done since you climbed off your horse.
Lover's quarrel?
An old friend of the family. I've known your mother a long long time.
No, it's quite all right. When I was a child I was very small and I come from a little spit of land called The Fingers, so you see, it's an exceedingly clever nickname.
Ser Gregor Clegane. They call him the Mountain. The Hound's older brother.
Ser Hugh of the Vale. He was Jon Arryn's squire. Look how far he's come.

Not what you were expecting? Has anyone ever told you the story of the Mountain and the Hound? Lovely little tale of brotherly love. The Hound was just a pup, six years old maybe. Gregor a few years older, already a big lad, already getting a bit of a reputation. Some lucky boys just born with a talent for violence. One evening... Gregor found his little brother playing with a toy by the fire... Gregor's toy, a wooden knight. Gregor never said a word, he just grabbed his brother by the scruff of his neck and shoved his face into the burning coals. Held him there while the boy screamed, while his face melted. There aren't very many people who know that story.
No, please don't. If the Hound so much as heard you mention it, I'm afraid all the knights in King's Landing would not be able to save you.
100 gold dragons on the Mountain.
Now what will I buy with 100 gold dragons? A dozen barrels of Dornish wine? Or a girl from the pleasure houses of Lys?
And tell me, Lord Renly, when will you be having your friend?
Loras knew his mare was in heat. Quite crafty, really.
No honor but quite a bit of gold.
You do move quietly.
You look a bit lonely today. You should pay a visit to my brothel this evening. First boy is on the house.
Am I? All those birds that whisper in your ear, such pretty little things. Trust me, we accommodate all inclinations.
I'm a purveyor of beauty and discretion, both equally important.
All desires are valid to a man with a full purse.
Strictly speaking, such a thing would not be in accordance with the King's laws.
Tell me. Does someone, somewhere, keep your balls in a little box? I've often wondered.
Since you last saw me or since I last saw you?
Saw me with your own eyes?
Council business. We all have so much to discuss with Ned Stark.
One shudders at the thought.
But you know something? I do believe that I have seen you even more recently than you have seen me.
Yes. Earlier today, I distinctly recall seeing you talking to Lord Stark in his chambers.

And not long after that when I saw you escorting a certain foreign dignitary... Council business? Of course you would have friends from across The Narrow Sea. You're from there yourself, after all. We're friends, aren't we, Lord Varys? I'd like to think we are. So you can imagine my burden, wondering if the King might question my friend's sympathies… To stand at a crossroads where turning left means loyalty to a friend, turning right, loyalty to the realm.
To find myself in a position where a simple word to the King --
To a small council meeting?
Jorah Mormont's a slaver, not a traitor. Small difference, I know, to an honorable man.
When you find yourself in bed with an ugly woman, best close your eyes, get it over with. Cut her throat. Be done with it.
His Grace went on about you at some length after you took your leave. The word "treason" was mentioned.
When do you return to Winterfell?
If you're still here come nightfall, I'll take you to see the last person Jon Arryn spoke with before falling ill. If that sort of thing still interests you.
It won't take more than an hour. But as you please.
Brothels make a much better investment than ship, I've found. Whores rarely sink.
Well, he has more than you, for a start.
Does it matter? If you fuck enough women, some of them will give you presents.
He was the King's Hand. Perhaps Robert wanted them looked after. He was overcome with fatherly love.
What's the meaning of this, Lannister?
My Lords! I'll bring the City Watch!
Fish. The sigil of House Tully. (whispers to Ned) Isn’t that your wife’s House - Tully - my Lord Hand?
(whisper) That sounds like someone we know. The Mountain.
I’ve heard him called “Tywin Lannister’s mad dog.” I’m sure you have as well. (whispering to Ned) Can you think of any reason the Lannisters might possibly have for being angry with your wife?
It would be almost as brazen as attacking the Hand of the King in the streets of the capital.
A bold move, my Lord, and admirable. But is it wise to yank the lion’s tail? Tywin Lannister is the richest man in all the Seven Kingdoms. Gold wins wars, not soldiers.
No no no no! Is that what they teach you up in the North? And you-- wherever you're from, do you have any idea how ridiculous you sound? Either of you understand a thing that I'm saying?
Let's start over, shall we? You be the man and you be the woman.
I'm saving myself for another.
A stupid saying.
No, not really. Impeccable bloodlines though.
For many years. Most of my life really.
Oh no. He got himself killed before the wedding.
Oh, everything, my dear. Everything there is.
My Lord protector.
So when the King dies...
So it would seem. Unless...
And he cannot take the throne without your help.
You are now Hand of the King and Protector of the Realm.
You'll need someone to share these burdens. I assure you, my price would be modest.
Only if we lose.
We only make peace with our enemies, my Lord.
So it will be Stannis and war?
So why did you call me here? Not for my wisdom, clearly.
Look at you. You know what you want me to do.
All is accomplished. The City Watch is yours.
Now!
I did warn you not to trust me.
The girl is innocent, Your Grace.
A naked Knight, apparently.
Do you deny your father's crime?

2.text: We have enough wheat for a five-year winter. If it lasts any longer, (Shrugs indifferently), we'll have fewer peasants.
Your Grace.
Of course, Your Grace.
If she's escaped the capital, Winterfell seems the logical destination.
Curious.
Well, you could ask Varys where she is. He'll have an answer for you. Whether you believe it,,, Myself, I have always had a hard time trusting eunuchs. (Smiles) Who knows what they want?
Yes.
I'm glad you like it. Some people are fortunate enough to be born into the right family. Others have to find their own way.

When boys and girls live in the same home, awkward situations can arise. Sometimes, I've heard, even brothers and sisters develop certain affections. And when these affections become common knowledge, well, that is an awkward situation, indeed. Especially in a prominent family. But prominent families often forget a simple truth, I've found.
Knowledge is power.
You honor me beyond words, Your Grace. I shall have to acquire some sons and grandsons. The crowd laughs
My lady. My sincerest condolences.
You shouldn't say that. You'll be good enough for many things. He'll still enjoy beating you. And now that you're a woman, he'll be able to enjoy you in other ways as well.

He'll let you go home? Joffrey's not the sort of boy who gives away his toys. You have a tender heart, just like your mother did at your age. I can see so much of her in you. She was like a sister to me. For her sake, I'll help get you home.
Look around you. We're all liars here. And every one of us is better than you.
That's why they're called wildlings.
One moment, my friend. A moment.
Please accept my sincerest apologies. Ramka will take good care of you.
Shhh. Did he hurt you?
Who?
Ah, yes, that was poorly handled. Sometimes those with the most power have the least grace.

You know, you remind me of another girl. A lovely thing I once acquired from an Elysium pleasure house. Beautiful, like yourself, and intelligent as yourself. But she wasn't happy. She cried, often. I asked her why but, we didn't have the kind of rapport that you and I have. Yes, it was quite sad. Girls from Elysium pleasure houses are expensive. Extremely expensive. And this one wasn't making me any money. I hate bad investments. Really, I do. They haunt me. I had no idea how to make her happy, no idea how to mitigate my losses. A very wealthy patron, he offered me a tremendous amount of money to let him transform this lovely, sad girl. To use her in ways that never occur to most men. And you know what occurs to most men. I would not say he succeeded in making her happy but my losses were definitely mitigated. (Stands up). Take tonight off to mourn Mhaegen’s child. I’ll see you tomorrow. But you’ll be happy? (Roz nods and smiles). That makes me happy.
Tell no one what?
She imprisoned you. She tried to execute you. And you offer her son a princess?
And I suppose you want me to broker this agreement?
Yes, I could sing this song to Lysa, if I cared to. What's in it for me?
Harrenhal is cursed.
With a single stroke, you'd make me one of the greatest lords in the realm.
So did Janos Slynt, and he was given Harrenhal, too. Until you snatched it away.
(Nods.)
The Queen mustn't know.
I don't appreciate being made a fool of, dwarf. If Myrcella marries the Martell boy, she can't very well marry Robin Arryn, can she?
And Harrenhal, I suppose that's off the table as well.
Leave me out of your next deception.
Robb Stark will never release the Kingslayer.
Your Grace.
I'm a practical man.
And who would you have me be loyal to? Your brother's corpse?
You still have many friends at court, Your Grace, many who believe Ned Stark erred by not supporting your claim.
I would give priority to my head.

I understand that you don't like me, and while that saddens me greatly, I did not come here today seeking your affection. When you march on King's Landing, you may find yourself facing a protracted siege or open gates.
Your Grace.
All of these tents look the same to me. -Would you be so kind
"Your tent"? Not "Our tent"? The king snores, perhaps? Or simply prefers solitude? Pressures of command, no doubt. Four kings vying for the throne.
If war were arithmetic, the mathematicians would rule the world. I did notice your brother entering His Grace's tent just now.
And on the night of your wedding, who was by the king's side then?
Your marriage is quite interesting. Not only to me, but to the realm. The marriage of a wealthy girl always breeds interest, if nothing else.
I've been unlucky in my affections, sadly.
You may have heard false reports.
Betrayed? I wanted him to serve as Protector of the Realm. I begged him to seize the moment.
No, my lady.
Cat, I've I've loved you since I was a boy. It seems to me that fate has given us this chance
Do you want to see your girls again? Sansa, more beautiful than ever? And Arya, just as wild as ever?
Both girls are healthy and safe. For now. But you know the Queen and you know Joffrey. I fear for their longevity if they remain in the capital.
The Lannisters will trade your daughters for the Kingslayer.
I'm not bringing these terms to him. I'm bringing them to you.
Robb has surprised them all with his skills in battle, but he's not a mother. Consider it, Cat. You may not get another chance. I've brought you a gift.
Your husband was an honorable man. He should rest beside his family in the crypts beneath Winterfell. You may not believe
My lord, my lady.
Stannis will be here in an hour. When he arrives, Renly's bannermen will flock to him. Your former companions will fight for the privilege of selling you to their new king.
You will note that I am standing here talking to you, not Stannis.
Stannis.
Tell me, Ser Loras, what do you desire most in this world?

I have always found that to be the purest of motivations, but you won't have a chance to put your sword through Stannis, not today. You'll be cut to pieces before he sets foot on solid ground. If it is justice that you want, be smart about it.
He was, Your Grace.
Do you want to be a queen?
Lord Tywin.
Thank you.
I traveled here directly from Renly Baratheon's camp.
So they say. There has been talk of other forces at work. Dark forces.
It is my belief that a moment of chaos affords opportunities lost soon after.
After the Lannisters and the Starks, the Tyrells command the largest host. Their lands are the most fertile in the Seven Kingdoms, - feeding horses and soldiers.
The Tyrells have not yet declared for any of the surviving kings. Loras wants revenge. He blames Stannis for Renly's death. And Margaery
Yes, she does.
They did. And perhaps that treason should be punished one day, after Stannis and Robb Stark are defeated.
If you will allow me to represent your family's interests, I believe that an advantageous agreement TYWIN
They have.
It's only wine.
Tonight, with your leave.
On your son Tyrion's directive, I met with Catelyn Stark.
He had an interesting proposal for her concerning her daughters.

3.text: Lovely day for it. Watching the ships.
Might I speak with Lady Sansa alone for a moment?
I saw your mother not long ago. She's very eager to see you. And your sister.
You said King's Landing was your home. You are the property of the crown. Stealing you would be treason. If you were to tell just one person ...
How do I know?
I'm waiting for word on an assignment that will take me far away from the capital. When I set sail, I might be able to take you with me. But you'll need to be ready to leave on a moment's notice.
For which I am extremely grateful to you, my lord. Lady Arryn and I have known each other since we were children. She has always been positively predisposed toward me.
Titles do seem to breed titles.
I'm surprised you're surprised. This is the safest place in the city.
Thank you, my dear.
I hear you owe that boy a significant debt.
You should have him knighted.
If only. I owe you a significant debt. Our redheaded friend. You secured her release when the queen detained her.
Apparently, Her Grace believed that you two had some sort of special relationship.
I know.
I know. But how would the queen get that idea?
Keep a low profile.
Well, you are richer than I am.
They're only numbers. Numbers on paper. Once you understand that, it's easy to make them behave. Trivial even. You want a real challenge? Try whores.
Your Grace.
Of course, Your Grace.
I see. And have you shared these suspicions with Lord Tywin?
Myself, I often find them a hindrance.
I shall do my best.
I assure you that it will.
That didn't take long.
Is he? And who's the lucky girl?
She may not be the grandest ship in the world or the fastest, but she's mine. I've always wanted a ship. Now I want a dozen. Strange, isn't it?
It doesn't matter what we want, once we get it, then we want something else. Your hair is different.
Lady Margaery wears it that way.
I have good news. I'll be leaving the city soon.
It's not a question of what I want. It's what you want. You want to go home, don't you?
I hope you know that I'm your friend, Sansa. Your true friend.
Petyr.
If you wish to stay, then of course you will stay.
We'll speak again when I return.
There aren't There aren't even 200. I've counted.
Early days, my friend. It is flattering, really you feeling such dread at the prospect of me getting what I want.

You're so right. For instance, when I thwarted your plan to give Sansa Stark to the Tyrells. If I'm going to be honest, I did feel an unmistakable sense of enjoyment there. But your confidant, the one who fed you information about my plans, the one you swore to protect, you didn't bring her any enjoyment. And she didn't bring me any enjoyment. She was a bad investment on my part. Luckily, I have a friend who wanted to try something new. Something daring. And he was so grateful to me for providing this fresh experience.
The realm? Do you know what the realm is? It's the thousand blades of Aegon's enemies. A story we agree to tell each other over and over till we forget that it's a lie.
Chaos isn't a pit. Chaos is a ladder.
(voice over) Many who try to climb it fail and never get to try again. The fall breaks them.
(voice over) And some are given a chance to climb, but they refuse. They cling to the realm or the gods or love. Illusions. Only the ladder is real. The climb is all there is.

4.text: Petyr... Are you hurt, my lady?
Good. Good. I'm sure you've had quite a fright. Rest easy. The worst is past. Ser Dontos shouts up from his boat.
Softly, my friend... Voices carry over water.
Shh. You don't want the queen to hear, do you? 1,000 gold cloaks are searching for you. And if they found you, how do you think they would punish the girl who murdered the king?
I know. I know. But you must admit it looks suspicious. The king who executed your father, who tormented you for years, and you fled the scene of his murder.
Because he was a drunk and a fool and I don't trust drunk fools.
Saved you? My lady, he followed my orders. Every one of them. And he did it all for gold. Money buys a man's silence for a time. A bolt in the heart buys it forever.
Yes, and he gave you a priceless necklace that once belonged to his grandmother. The last legacy of House Hollard.
I had it made a few weeks ago. What did I once tell you about the capital?
Come, my lady. I know you've had a difficult day. But you're safe now. I promise you that. You're safe with me and sailing home.
I'm getting married to your Aunt Lysa. She's waiting for us at the Eyrie. You'll be safe there.
Did I kill Joffrey? I've been in the Vale for weeks.
And who helped me with this conspiracy?
Why not?
Then perhaps it was your husband.
How do you know?
You're right. He wasn't involvedi n Joffrey's death. But you were. Do you remember that lovely necklace Dontos gave you? I don't suppose you noticed that a stone was missing after the feast.
A man with no motive is a man no one suspects. Always keep your foes confused. If they don't know who you are or what you want, they can't know what you plan to do next.
So many men they risk so little. They spend their lives avoiding danger. And then they die. I'd risk everything to get what I want.
Everything. My friendship with the Lannisters was productive. But Joffrey, a vicious boy with a crown on his head, is not a reliable ally. And who could trust a friend like that?

I don't want friends like me. My new friends are predictable. Very reasonable people. As for what happened to Joffrey, well, that was something my new friends wanted very badly. Nothing like a thoughtful gift to make a new friendship grow strong.
Pull up your hood. A memorable shade.
You know what kind of stories poor men enjoy the most? Ones about rich girls they'll never meet.

The mountains are impassable. If you want to get to the Eyrie, you need to go through the Bloody Gate. It doesn't matter how large your army is, if you attack this gate, you do it on this road, three men abreast and get slaughtered like goats. The first Lords of the Vale didn't have much, but they had these mountains and they knew how to use them. And the fortress they built here has never been overcome. Not once in 1,000 years. Know your strengths, use them wisely, and one man can be worth 10,000.
Lord Petyr Baelish and his niece Alayne.
My lord.
Oh. I have brought you a gift.
My lady.
Go. We'll speak soon.
Arranging for the ascension of King Tommen I, extricating Sansa, getting her here alive.
Ought we not... inform the Lords of the Vale about the ceremony?
I do think that we could wait until...
Like it was yesterday.
The deed is done. Faded into nothing. Only speaking of it can make it real.
Tonight it is, then.
Let me bathe and dress for the occasion. Once I'm presentable, I'll call on the septon immediately.
Children.
Yes, I saw.
No, his mother should have a long time ago. Consider it a step in the right direction.
Let me worry about Aunt Lysa.
A lot can happen between now and never. If you want to build a better home, first you must demolish the old one.

I loved your mother more than you could ever know. Given the opportunity, what do we do to those who've hurt the ones we love? In a better world, one where love could overcome strength and duty, you might have been my child. But we don't live in that world.
You're more beautiful than she ever was.
Call me Petyr.
Lysa! Let her go.
Let her go.
I'll send her away. I swear on my life. I swear to all the gods. Let her go, Lysa.
Oh, my sweet wife. My sweet, silly wife.
I have only loved one woman... only one, my entire life. Your sister.
A great-grandfather from Braavos, yes. I suppose all of our ancestors came from somewhere else originally.
The beauty of the Vale is matched only by the nobility of its great families. Lady Arryn often told me that you were her rock, Lord Royce.
My lord...
Lady Arryn invited me. She and I have been close since childhood.
Of course. Her suicide shattered us all.
She was always prone to melancholy. My lady wasn't meant for a world as brutal as ours.
A girl with no learning and scattered wits. I assure you, she would be of no help.
Let me fetch her.
My lady...
You want justice, Lord Royce. I can hardly complain about that. I want the same.

For Lysa, no. But for her son? Only 20 years ago, the knights of the Vale rode behind Jon Arryn, Ned Stark, Robert Baratheon. They fought together to overcome the Mad King. And since then, Arryn and Royce, Corbray, Waynwood, all the great houses of the Vale watched from the corner. A timid boy at a tavern brawl.
I want to know which side you're on. Do you support the Lannisters, the house that executed your friend Ned Stark?
No? Catelyn Stark begged her sister for support and Lysa refused. By staying out of the fray, you've allowed Tywin Lannister to destroy his rivals on every compass point. Who stands against him now?
I'd have you back Robin Arryn, Lord of the Vale.
And sickly little boys sometimes become powerful men.
I adored Lysa with all my heart. But she loved her son so much, she became overprotective. He needs to learn how to swing a sword. How to ride a horse.
Yes, it's time. Time for him to tour the Vale, to visit all the castles in his domain. Time for Robin to leave the nest.
First time I saw you, you were just a child. A girl from the North come to the capital for the first time. Not a child any longer. Why did you help me?
That's not an answer.
I don't know.
Better to gamble on the man you know than the strangers you don't? And you think you know me?
Do you?
You shouldn't be.

It wasn't safe for her inside. People die at their dinner tables. They die in their beds. They die squatting over their chamber pots. Everybody dies sooner or later. Don't worry about your death. Worry about your life. Take charge of your life for as long as it lasts. That is what it means to be Lord of the Vale.

5.text: Lord Arryn will never be a great warrior.
Some boys develop more slowly. He’s still young.
He has other gifts.
The gift of a great name. Sometimes that’s all one needs.
I have no doubt that upon my return, Robin’s skills will have improved immeasurably.
I did.
We are.
Lord Royce may be as honorable as he thinks he is, but he’s not alone in that castle. Do you trust all those knights and ladies, stable boys and serving girls?
No. But I pay them well, and they’ve seen what happens to men who disappoint me.
So a land so far from here, even Cersei Lannister can’t get her hands on you.
You are becoming an observant young lady.
An old saying. Inaccurate in this case.
My marriage proposal has been accepted.
Do you like the taste?
It gives some men courage.
We've met. With Renly Baratheon. What did he say about you? He said, "You're a loyalty comes free of charge." Someone appears to have paid quite a bit for it since then.
Please, Lady Brienne. No need for such formality. (Brienne gets up) You are Catelyn Stark's sworn sword?
Strange. I knew Cat from the time we were children. She never mentioned you.
Ah, yes. You were accused of killing him.
But you were accused.
Then what did happen?
A shadow? With a face? (scoffs) This woman swore to protect Renly; she failed. She swore to protect your mother; she failed. Why would I want somebody with your history of failure guiding Lady Sansa?

Because I am her uncle. I married her Aunt Lysa shortly before my belovedâ€™s untimely death. We're family now, and you're an outsider. Forgive me, Lady Brienne, but experiences made me wary of outsiders.
We don't want our new friend wandering the countryside alone. The roads of these parts aren't safe. Why don't you stay?
Yes. A bit shabby, isn't it? You've been here before.
Home.
(Shakes his head). No.
He did.
For now.
Winterfell is your home.
Always. You're a Stark. Dyeing your hair doesn't change that. You're Sansa Stark. The eldest surviving child of Ned and Catelyn Stark. Your place is in the North.
You're not marrying Roose Bolton. No, you'll be marrying his son and heir, Ramsay. One day he'll be Warden of the North and you will -
Sansa -

(Grabbing her). I won't force you to do anything. Don't you know by now how much I care for you? Say the word and we turn the horses round, but listen to me. Listen. (Quietly). You've been running all your life. Terrible things happened to your family and you weep. You sit alone in a darkened room, mourning their fates. You've been a bystander to tragedy from the day they executed your father. Stop being a bystander, do you hear me? Stop running. There's no justice in the world. Not unless we make it. You loved your family. Avenge them.
I hope so too. I've become quite fond of Lady Sansa during our travels together. She’s suffered enough.
I've heard very little about you. Which makes you quite a rare thing, as lords go.
He seems pleased.
(They begin walking). I assure you she's still a virgin. Tyrion never consummated the marriage. By the law of the land, she's no man's wife. Inspect her, if you must.
Then I have delivered everything I've promised.

The Lannister name doesn't mean what it once did. Tywin is dead. He kept his house in power through sheer will. Without him, Jaime has one hand and no allies, Tommen is a soft boy, not a king to fear.
Queen Margaery adores Sansa. Cersei is Queen Mother, a title whose importance wanes with each passing day.
A message for me, you say. Strange that the seal is broken.
Every ambitious move is a gamble. You gambled when you drove a dagger into Robb Stark's heart. It appears that your gamble paid off. You're Warden of the North.

The Eyrie is mine. The last time the lords of the Eyrie formed an alliance with the lords of the North, they brought down the greatest dynasty this world has ever known. I'd like to borrow one of your birds. Cersei will expect a reply.
I thought I might find you here. (Sansa turns to him). Your Aunt Lyanna.

I saw her once. I was a boy, living with your mother's family. Lord Whent had a great tourney at Harrenhal. Everyone was there. The Mad King, your father, Robert Baratheon. And Lyanna, she was already promised to Robert. You can imagine what it was like for me, a boy from nowhere, with nothing to his name, watching these legendary men, tilting at the lists. The last two riders were Barristan Selmy and Rhaegar Targaryen. When Rhaegar won, everyone cheered for the prince. I remember the girls laughing when he took off his helmet and they saw that silver hair. How handsome he was. Until he rode right past his wife, Elia Martell, and all the smiles died. I've never seen so many people so quiet. He rode past his wife, and he lay a crown of winter roses in Lyanna's lap. Blue as frost. How many tens of thousands had to die because Rhaegar chose your aunt?
Come. (Takes her arm). Let's speak somewhere the dead can't hear us. (They begin walking away).
I am.
King's Landing.
Cersei sent for me. (They stop). We must not let her sniff out any trouble.
I know how hard it is to live with people you despise, believe me. But it won't be for long.
(They begin walking again). Stannis Baratheon garrisons at Castle Black. He'll march south to King's Landing before the winter snows block his way. But first, he has to take Winterfell.
I do. Once he liberates these lands from the Boltons he'll rally your father's bannermen to his cause. With the North behind him, Stannis can finally take the Iron Throne.
He has a larger army. He's the finest military commander in Westeros. A betting man would put his money on Stannis. (They stop). As it happens, I am a betting man.
Stannis takes Winterfell, he rescues you from the most despised family in the North. Grateful for your late father's courageous support for his claim, he names you Wardeness of the North.
You are the last surviving Stark. He needs you.
Then you will take this Bolton boy, Ramsay, and make him yours.
Of course you do. He's already fallen for you.

He should, he's a dangerous man. But even the most dangerous men can be outmaneuvered. And youâ€™ve learnt to maneuver from the very best. (Puts a hand on her shoulder). I return before too long. (Puts a hand behind her head). You'll be strong without me. (She nods, and he kisses her). The North will be yours. Do you believe me?
Yes? (Lancel approaches him) Lancel Lannister.
That’s quite a family to abandon.
Well done.
I’m here on urgent business for the Queen Mother. Should I send word that I’ll be delayed?
We both peddle fantasies, Brother Lancel. Mine just happen to be entertaining.
Do you think it’s wise, your Grace, arresting the heir to Highgarden?
Of course. And the Faith were armed on your orders.
House Tyrell won’t tolerate these insults.
One’s choice of companion is a curious thing.
Lysa was a good woman. A kind woman.
I know how hard it can be to lose both of your parents at such a young age.
Young Lord Robyn heeds my advice. And I have always counseled loyalty to the throne.

There is another matter, your Grace. Something so urgent I couldn’t trust the words to a raven. You once charged me with finding Arya Stark. To my shame I failed you. But I have found Sansa Stark. Alive, and well, and home again. In Winterfell.
My sources are well placed. They tell me Roose Bolton plans to marry her to his son, Ramsay, a bastard recently legitimized by King Tommen.
Indeed. As reward for stabbing his own king in the heart.
Marrying his son to the last of the Starks gives him more legitimacy in the North than an alliance with a hated southern house.
I would counsel patience, your grace.

Stannis Baratheon is also a traitor, marching with his army on Winterfell. Let Stannis and Roose battle, let the enemies of the throne slaughter each other and when they’re done seize Winterfell from whichever thief survives.
That is why it is critical to strike soon, while the victor still licks his wounds. Surely your Uncle Kevan could muster a force.
Ser Jaime, then.
Perhaps I can help. The Knights of the Vale are some of the best fighters in Westeros, trained to battle in the ice and the snow.
You wouldn’t risk a single Lannister soldier or a single coin from the Royal Treasury. What do you have to lose, a brothel keeper?
Name me Warden of the North.
I’ll not rest until the lion flies over Winterfell.
As I said. I live to serve.
I’m sorry about the locale.
It felt like the safest place.
It was an establishment like no other. The sheer range of appetites catered to, desires that didn’t exist until we invented them.
The past is the past. The future is all that’s worth discussing. The future of House Tyrell.
I promise you..
Cersei summoned me to King’s Landing. I dared not refuse her.

A piece of info that she know that I had. Neither silence nor lies were an option. But I have other information of which she is unaware. And as you say, our interests are aligned. I have a gift for you.
The same kind I gave Cersei. A handsome young man.

6.text: Forgive me, my lady… if you’re at prayer.
You were a child.
I thought you knew what I wanted.

No, you weren’t. Every time I’m faced with a decision, I close my eyes and see the same picture. Whenever I consider an action, I ask myself will this action help to make this picture a reality? Pull it out of my mind and into the world? And I only act if the answer is yes. A picture of me on the Iron Throne… and you by my side.
News of this battle will spread quickly through the Seven Kingdoms. I’ve declared for House Stark for all to hear.

The past is gone for good. You can sit here mourning its departure or you can prepare for the future. You, my love, are the future of House Stark. Who should the North rally behind? A trueborn daughter of Ned and Catelyn Stark born here at Winterfell or a motherless bastard born in the south?
My lord. Come and see.
I missed your name day. Go on.
A gyrfalcon. The greatest and rarest of birds.
Indeed I was.
On our way to the Fingers, we were set upon by a large force of Bolton men. Seemed to know exactly when we were traveling and exactly whom we were transporting.
Tell me, Lord Royce, how many people knew of my travel plans with Sansa Stark? I shared my intentions with you and no one else.
Your home is the Vale. The Lord of the Vale stands before us. And only his judgment concerns me.
Lord Royce has served the Vale well. He;s enjoyed a distinguished military career. If we could trust his absolute loyalty, he would make a capable commander in the wars to come.
I think he deserves one more chance. What do you say?
That was my instinct as well.
Our lord has spoken. Gather the Knights of the Vale. The time has come to join the fray.
Sansa. Lady Brienne. When I heard you had escaped WInterfell, I feared the worst. You have no idea how happy I am to see you unharmed.
I rode north with the Knights of the Vale to come to your aid. They’re encamped at Moat Cailin as we speak.
I can’t begin to contemplate --
He beat you.
Sansa, I --
Did he cut you?
I didn’t know.
I made a mistake, a horrible mistake. I underestimated a stranger.
I’m so sorry.
And I will. You must believe me when I tell you that I will.
Do you want me to beg for my life? If that’s what you want, I will. Whatever you ask that is in my power, I will do.
Then I will die.

I would do anything to undo what’s been done to you. I know that I can’t. Will you allow me to say one more thing before I go? Your great-uncle Brynden the Blackfish has gathered what remains of the Tully forces and retaken Riverrun. You might consider seeking him out. The time may come when you need an army loyal to you.
Your brother’s army.
Half-brother.

7.text: I've heard she beat the Hound in single combat. She's a very impressive woman.
I want you to be happy. I want you to be safe.
What about happy? Why aren't you happy? What do you want that you do not have?
My lady.
My lady.
I delivered his bones myself. I presented them to Lady Catlyn as a gesture of goodwill from Tyrion Lannister. It seems like a lifetime ago. Do give Lord Tyrion my best when you see him.

I was sorry when he died. Your father and I had our differences but he loved Cat very much. So did I. She wasn't fond of you, was she? Well, it appears she vastly underestimated you. Your father and brothers are gone, yet here you stand King in the North. Last best hope against the coming storm.
Forgive me. We have never talked properly. I wanted to remedy that.
Not even thank you? If it weren't for me you'd have been slaughtered at that battlefield. You have many enemies, My King, but I swear to you I'm not one of them. I love Sansa as I loved her mother.
Command suits you. The northerns are all facing north worried about the threat beyond the wall.
I know Cersei better than anyone here. If you turn your back on her --
I only meant to say --
One of two things will happen. Either the dead will defeat the living, in which case all our troubles come to an end. Or life will win out. And what then?

Don't fight in the north or the south. Fight every battle everywhere always in your mind. Everyone is your enemy, everyone is your friend, every possible series of events is happening all at once. Live that way and nothing will surprise you. Everything that happens will be something that you've seen before.
This is for you.
The last man who wielded it meant to cut your throat, but your mother fought him off.

The other dagger, the one that took her life, I would have stopped that dagger with my own heart if I could have. I wasn't there for her when she needed me most. But I am here for her now. To do what she would have done, to protect her children. Anything I can do for you, Brandon, you need only ask.

No. That very question was what started the War of the Five Kings. In a way, that dagger made you what you are today. Forced from your home, driven out to the wilds beyond the Wall. I imagine you've seen things most men wouldn't believe.
To go through all of that and make your way home again only to find such chaos in the world, I can only imagine --
I'm sorry to have disturbed you, Lord Stark.
Are you sure this is the only copy at Winterfell?
Lady Stark thanks you for your service.
It's not easy for ravens to fly in these storms. Perhaps Jon tried to send word earlier.
I can't believe he'd surrender the Northern crown without consulting you.
I've heard gossip that the Dragon Queen is quite beautiful.
Jon is young and unmarried. Daenerys is young and unmarried.
An alliance makes sense. Together, they'd be difficult to defeat. He was named King.
You are family, too. Would Arya really murder her own sister?
Only by reputation. They worship the God of Death, I believe. I never trust godly men.
She's your sister
Why did she come to Winterfell?
Why did she unearth the letter Cersei made you write?
And after she murders you, what does she become?
Lady Sansa, forgive me I'm a bit confused.
I did it to protect you.
Whatever your aunt
I know of no such letter.
I deny it! None of you were there to see what happened. None of you knows the truth.
Lady Sansa, I have known you since you were a girl. I've protected you.
If we could speak alone, I can explain everything.
Sansa, please.
Give me a chance to defend myself. I deserve that.
I am Lord Protector of the Vale and I command you to escort me safely back to the Eyrie.
Sansa, I beg you! I loved your mother since the time I was a boy.
I loved you. More than anyone.
Sansa! (GASPS) I--

2.text: (Looks to Stannis) Not now.
Stannis is our king. We follow where he leads, even if we don't like the path.
I don't serve the others. I serve Stannis.
What's the truth?
A harmless courtesy, Your Grace.
Your Grace, the Lannisters are the true enemy. If, for the time being, you could make peace with your brother -
Well, many have already declared for him; Mace Tyrell, Randyll Tarly.
And how many ships has the Lord of Light got in his fleet?
I'm sure he doesn't, but we do if we're going to war. If not Renly, Your Grace, join forces with Robb Stark.
(Whispers to Cressen) Don't.
You'll have your gold when we take the treasury at King's Landing.
Because you're a smart gambler. Stannis has proved himself in war. Twice. His baby brother has never set foot on a battlefield. Neither has the false king, Joffrey.
Stannis has just begun the fight. His bannermen will rally to his cause. There's no man in the Seven Kingdoms more honorable than Stannis Baratheon. Or more worthy of loyalty.
Matthos.
Of course you do. Every time you leave harbor, you're leaving on a promise. A promise that somewhere on the seas, somebody's got some gold and you can take it from them.
As is mine. You're not the young man, Salladhor. And correct me if I'm wrong

You want to spend your last few years on the sea, stealing from Pentoshi cheesemongers and Midanese silk merchants, then go. They're out there waiting for you. That's easy. What I'm offering you is hard. Come with me and plunder the greatest city in Westeros. You'll be the richest man in Lysene. And the most famous. They'll be singing songs about you as long as men have voices to sing.
It is. (Matthos rolls his eyes).
The queen?
He's young yet. I promise you the gold. I promise you the glory. I cannot promise you the queen.
He is the one true king.
Get me to the gates of King's Landing and I will.
As soon as his God wills it.
Oh you and your mother.
I wish I had a God, truly! I'm not mocking you, but I've seen men pray to every God there is. Pray for wind, pray for rain, pray for home. None of it works!
I wasn't praying.

You want me to have a god, fine. King Stannis is my god. He raised me up and blessed me with his trust. He gave you a future I could never have imagined. You know how to read, you'll be a knight someday. You think your fire god commanded all that? It was Stannis. Only Stannis.
Don't tell him that.
Your Grace.
Salladhor Saan will join our fleet. 30 ships. His men know how to fight.
Does seem the wiser choice.
Salladhor Saan is an old friend, I've known him 30 years. I've never trusted him.
At once, Your Grace.
Come.
Your Grace.
Well, life's been good since you hacked them off, Your Grace. And it's four less fingernails to clean.
Pardon?
It reminds me of where I come from and where I am now. It reminds me of your justice. It was an honest punishment and you were good with the cleaver.
A lesson I've tried to teach my son.
To me? Gods, no. But if your red woman told him to leap from the crow's nest
I've lived within the law for 17
Any shore, any night. What am I bringing ashore?
I am true to Your Grace and always will be, but surely there are other ways, cleaner ways.
Someone once told me the night is dark and full of terrors.
I'd say my parts are mixed, my lady, good and bad.
And which are you?
Well, that must be very nice for you.
I do.
Don't talk about my wife.
Strange that this Lord of Light asks you to work in the shadows.
These weren't here before. They've barred the passage.
Gods protect us.
Your Grace.
I'm sorry about your brother, Your Grace, I wanted to let you know that people grieve for him.
I need to speak to you - about what I saw in that cave.
Your Grace, I --
And I've never known you to hide from the truth.
I've come to tell you that what I saw.
Nothing is worth what this will cost you, not even the Iron
When do we sail for King's Landing?
And will you bring Lady Melisandre with you?
If you take King's Landing with her by your side, the victory will be hers.
Loyal service means telling hard truths.
She's a foreigner preaching her foreign religion. Some believe she whispers orders in your ear and you obey.
You won those bannermen from Renly. Don't lose them to her.
Your Grace, I'm honored, but my time on the sea was spent evading ships, not attacking them. The other lords won't be happy.
If the wind holds, we'll reach King's Landing in a day.
Can't make promises for the wind, Your Grace.
I thank you, Your Grace.
My son wishes me to change it. Three mermen with tridents, something like that. I understand why the older families look down at me.
My father was a crabber.
Well, sons of lords don't like to break bread with sons of crabbers. Our hands stink.
Many fought bravely for your brother. Many fought for the Mad King.
Some are happy to do it to my face.
No one has forgotten, Your Grace.
He was only a boy.
(exhales)
And potatoes. Some salted beef, I believe.
I was relieved they did not.
Your Grace, I pray I serve you well.
Aye, but we have the wind. She'll blow us straight to the gates.
King's Landing hasn't been home for 20 years. I spent most of my life dodging the royal fleet. And now I'm sailing right at them.
Of course, there are several royal fleets at the moment.
Gods be good.
But not over them?
Well, first, we have to put it there.

Our army outnumber theirs 5-to-1. Those walls have never been breached, and the men guarding the walls, when they see you, they don't see a liberator, they see a stranger come to set their city on fire.
I've never known bells to mean surrender. They want to play music with us? Let's play. Drums.
Where are their ships?
Lord Varys knows what you had for breakfast three days ago. There are no surprises here.
Maybe.
Archers, stand to! Man the below! - Nock.
Draw! Hold.
(confused) There's no one on board.
Wildfire. Steer clear! Steer clear!
Matthos! Get down!

3.text: Here. Here! Help me!
I was in the battle at Blackwater. I was a captain and a knight.
The one true king of Westeros ... Stannis Baratheon.
(Nods)
No, the wildfire took him. I saw it.
If I was a good father, he'd still be here. Stannis lives?
Will you take me there?
This war is not over.
We're both sworn to King Stannis.
Stannis never gives up. Never. Now he will regroup ...
What?
You're a smuggler.
Take me back there, please.
Maybe not, but I could carve her heart out.
You call me friend. You drank with me on my wedding day.
I have to stop her. Please, do this for me.
Your Grace.
Not yet.
Your Grace, you are the rightful king. Not only by blood. You're an honorable man, a just man. And there is still a war to fight.
By burning prisoners alive?
I do not judge people for the gods they worship. If I did, I'd have thrown you in the sea before you ever set foot on Dragonstone.
You are my enemy.
( gasps )
( growls ) This woman is evil! She's the mother of demons.
Your Grace!
She will destroy us all!
Your Grace!
How are you keeping?
It was just a bit of blood.
I'm not a highborn.
A recent state of affairs. I was born in Flea Bottom just like you.
I lived below the Street of Flour.
The shit that poured from their privy pipes flowed down the side of Aegon's Hill along Tanner's Row and right in front of my front door on Gin Alley.
The Street of Steel, with your armor and your knights? Pfft. You lived in the fancy part of town. And here we are now. Two boys from Flea Bottom in the castle of a king.
If you mistrust fancy people so much, why were you in such a hurry to trust her?
She does know her way around a man's head, I'll give her that.
Oh, that's a long story.
Many years ago I helped King Stannis out of a difficult situation. He rewarded me with a lordship. And this.
I didn't want to be a lord. I nearly didn't accept.
I did it for my son. I didn't want him to step over a river of shit every time he stepped through his front door. I wanted him to have a better life.
He's dead.
Following me.
'To His Grace King Stannis Baratheon. Invaded-- inv-- invit-- invited to the name day celebration for Rylene Florent on the first nigit--'
'First night of the full moon.' Why is there a G in night?
Well, your father's not going to go to that.
I've been trying to stay out of those dungeons my whole life.

Aye, old Balerion's definitely better than anything your cousin Rylene's got on offer. But now that I'm your father's Hand again, I have to keep him informed. The king does not have time for this drudgery. 'To all the lords and knobble men of Westeros.'
'Noblemen of Westeros, the Nig-- the Night's Watch implores'
Stay here. Bar the door.
And you take credit because you dropped a leech into the fire?

Your Grace, the world has got so far bent. I've seen things crawl out of nightmares, but my eyes were open. I don't know if Robb Stark died because of the Red Woman's sorcery or because at war men die all the time, but I do know that uniting the Seven Kingdoms with blood magic is wrong. It is evil. And you are not an evil man.
Aegon Targaryen.
On the back of his dragon Balerion the Dread.
You do not need to burn the boy. If what you say is true, a drop of his blood killed Robb Stark--
His name is Gendry. He's a good lad. A poor lad from Flea Bottom who happens to be your nephew.
Everything.
You're leaving.
Yes, but not on you.
Aim for that star. Don't stop. There's bread and water. Go slow with it. If you finish it off, no matter how thirsty you get, don't drink seawater.
Row for a full day and night and you'll reach Rook's Rest. You'll want to stop there. Don't. She'll find you.
You must keep the coast on your left side until you reach King's Landing.
They were looking for me for 20 years. Do they know your face?
I'd worry more about the Red Woman.
The other way.
You ever been in a boat before?
Don't fall out. Go on.
Because it's right. And because I'm a slow learner.
When you get to Flea Bottom, have a bowl of brown for me.
No. I let him go.
Aye, I do.
There has got to be another way.
I don't know, Your Grace. I can't see the future in the fire.
I understand. But since you haven't yet unnamed me Hand of the King, it is my duty to advise you against it. You're gonna need me.

It's from Maester Aemon of the Night's Watch. Their Lord Commander is dead. Took a ranging party north and never made it back. One lad did, though. What he saw beyond the Wall-- it's coming for all of us.
Matthos taught me before he died so I could be of better service to you.
You can't stop him alone. You need someone to rebuild your army for you, someone to convince this lord and that lord to fight for you, to bring sellswords and pirates to your side.
Princess? Gods, what are you doing here?
Bert?
Go back to your room. You're not supposed to be here. If your father knew--
I am, child. I disobeyed my king, your father, and now I'm paying the price.
Aye. So they did.
Thank you, my lady. I'm sure it's a fine book, but it's wasted on me.
My lady, I can't read the words.
No. No. No.
Go. We can't.
(laughs) I wouldn't know where to start.

'And tho-- and thowg V-v-visenya Targaryen rod-- rode Vhagar-- Vhag--' Fuck me. 'Visenya Targaryen rode Vhagar, the smallest of the dragons, though still large enog-- enough-- enough to swallow a horse whole.
' Your Grace.
Two meals a day. Cold for breakfast, hot for supper. I cannot complain.
Well, it's sad to say, but I've seen worse.
I'm sorry about your son. Didn't get the chance to tell you before. Good lad. Loyal lad.
(nods)
I didn't know she'd been gone.
Why?
She's going to kill him.
Forgive me, Your Grace, I'm not a learned man, but is there a difference between kill and sacrifice? The boy is your nephew.
Because he has your blood in his veins.
Renly wronged you. Renly declared himself king when the throne belonged to you. He raised an army, stole your bannermen. This boy has done you no harm. He's an innocent.
Your Grace, why did you come to see me today?
I swear it. I can't swear never to speak against her.

Quite little, Your Grace. Verging on none. You could have freed me yesterday or tomorrow, but you came to me now before this boy is put to the knife because you knew I'd counsel restraint. You came to hear me say it because you believe it yourself. You're not a man who slaughters innocents for gain or glory. When my son was five he said to me, 'I don't ever want to die. ' I wanted to say to him, 'You won't, child. You won't ever.' I hated the idea of him lying awake in the dark, afraid. I think mothers and fathers made up the gods because they wanted their children to sleep through the night.

4.text: This is Stannis Baratheon, the one true king of the seven kingdoms.
What are men of the Night's Watch doing in a Wildling camp?
You're speaking to the one true king boy. You'll address him as your grace.
Lord Florent was your brother by law. STANNIS; He was an infidel.
He worshipped the gods of his fathers and their fathers before him. They were the gods of your fathers, too.
How many ships did he bring to your 'cause? How many men?
I'm sure they're more than grateful, my queen.
Your Grace.
Joffrey?
I will find you an army, Your Grace. I've been working day and night...
I've rallied House Peasebury to your 'cause.
House Musgood.
And House Haigh.
Westeros is not the world, Your Grace. We need to look east for ships and men. 10,000 skilled soldiers fight for the Golden Company.
They've never broken a contract.

We're willing to use blood magic to put you on the throne, but we're not willing to pay men to fight? Now the Red Woman's magic is real. Her visions and prophecies may be, too, but I've never heard of visions and prophecies winning a war. Soldiers win wars. Soldiers on the ground. It's dirty on the ground.
Not yet.
I'm sorry, Princess.
The Hand of the King doesn't have much leisure time.
That happened once, weeks ago. You're your father's daughter, no mistake. Bloody relentless, the both of you.
"The Life and Adventures of Elyo Grivas. First Sword of Braavos."
Thank you very much.
No, I was never a pirate. I was a smuggler.
Well, if you're a famous smuggler, you're not doing it right.
Your father lacks an appreciation of the finer points of bad behavior. So do the Braavosi.

Of course. Almost got beheaded by a First Sword of Braavos. I tried to explain to him the difference between pirates and smugglers, but he didn't seem any more interested in the distinction than your father. I suppose if you work for the Iron Bank of Braavos and each one of your gold barges is worth half a kingdom, you tend not to be overly concerned with the kind of distinction...
I need you to write a message.
It's too important for me. I need a smart person to do it. Go on.
To the offices of the Iron Bank of Braavos from Stannis Baratheon the one true king of Westeros.
I need to get their attention. Go on. Write.
Who would pass the Bloody Gate?
Stand to.
Welcome back, Lord Baelish.
Your Grace, if you'd like to sit, I'm sure that--
Easterners have a difference sense of time, I've often found. Once I was waiting for Salladhor Saan here in Braavos. Together, we were going to run three shiploads of the finest--
This is Stannis of the House Baratheon, King of the Andals and the First Men, Lord of the Seven Kingdoms and Protector of the Realm.
My lord.
Well, strictly speaking, I didn't do the thieving. That would be the pirates. I just moved what they stole from one place to another. {DAVOS removes his right glove to show the stubs of his fingers.

This is the payment that was demanded by King Stannis for my crimes. I consider it an honest accounting. He's an honest man and he's your best chance to get back the money you've sunk into Westeros. Which is a lot, I imagine. Wars are expensive.
As long as Stannis lives, the war is not over. Who's the real power in King's Landing?
Humor me.

Begging your pardon, I think it's a problem for now. There's only one reliable leader left in Westeros. Stannis. He's got the birthright. He's in his prime. He's a tried and tested battle commander. And he doesn't just talk about paying people back, he does it.
You think they ever met a pirate who didn't tell them that joke?
Only half rotted.
No time, I'm afraid. We sail at sunrise.
You, me-- we.
You won't be alone. And you won't be poor.
There's a chest of the good stuff left back at your house. I gave it to your wife.
(laughs) I'll see you at sunrise.

5.text: I’ve been talking to your sworn brothers. Many of them love you.
Many don’t. You were seen taking the body of a wildling girl north of the Wall. Why?
Some of the Night’s Watch feel you have too much affection for the wildlings.
It’s a fair offer. More than fair.
He came to your aid. Stannis. Now he needs you!
The wildlings will make a difference!
You saved their bloody lives. If they’re going to live in the Seven Kingdoms, safe behind our wall, they ought to fight for the damn place.
Shireen? The princess?
I guess that means youâ€™re unarmed.
Tonight, the Night's Watch elect a new Lord Commander. Ser Alliser Thorne is going to win.
Unpleasant man. He thinks you're a traitor. What's your life going to be like on the Wall with Thorne in command?
He sees something in you. (Jon looks up). Might not be apparent from his tone, but it's the truth. He believes in you.
The king is a complicated man. But he wants what's right for the Seven Kingdoms.
He's the one true king. He has the blood right to that throne.
Have you now? (Turning to Olly). How does the Night's Watch vow go again? I bet you've got it memorized since you got here.
Not that bit, the bit at the end.

Wait, that's enough. “The shield that guards the realm of men.” That's what you swore to be. Now I'm not a learned man, but the best way of helping the most people might not be sitting in a frozen castle at the edge of the world. It just might mean wading in the muck, getting your boots dirty, and doing what needs to be doing.
As long as the Boltons rule the North, (Stands up), the North will suffer. Just one man's opinion.
What?
Uh, Your Grace. Wouldn't it be better to wait? When Jon Snow returns with the wildlings, we could have thousands more men.
I'll choose a dozen men to stay and guard the queen and the princess.
It's a tough road ahead, Your Grace. Won't they be safer -
As you wish, Your Grace.
Beg your pardon?
First things first. It's a long march ahead. And then we have to take the castle.
Aye, princess, but you won't be anywhere near -
Yes, my queen.
Well, I am. When the battle comes, promise you'll protect me.
40 horses died in the night. We’ll lose more come sunset. We’re running out of food. We can’t open the supply line until the snow clears.
The Stormcrows rode off last night.
We still have a hard march to Wintefell and we won’t be marching anywhere in this weather.
This isn’t our time, we should head back to Castle Black when the snow clears.
Your Grace..
It’s better to wait for the right time than to risk everything.
Your Grace. (leaves)
A band of 20 men, maybe less. They were in and out before anyone spotted them, burnt our food stores to the ground, all our siege weapons were destroyed, dozens of tents were--
We’re still getting a count, but hundreds are dead.
The northerners know more about their land than we ever will.
Unless there’s a thaw, we can’t press forward to Winterfell, and we don’t have enough food to get us back to Castle Black.
Forgive me, Your Grace, I never claimed to be an expert in military matters. But if we can’t march forward, and we won’t march back…
You sent for me, Your Grace.
Your Grace, you’ve named me your Hand.
The King’s Hand should never abandon the King, especially in a time of war.
A boy with a scroll could deliver this message.
Your Grace, perhaps Queen and Princess Shireen could accompany me.
At least let me take Shireen. A siege is no place for a little girl.
What’s this one now?
Well that sounds like a proper story.
But the dragon only saw a dumb man, holding a mirrored shield.
Thus ending the dragonslaying career of Ser Byron Swann. I made you something, Princess.
Do you like it?
You’re very welcome.
Of course I will.

Because you deserve it. My son was always on me trying to teach me to read. Gods, I was stubborn about it. Made it this far without reading, seemed to me I could make it to the grave. I wish I had listened to them. This is my own poor way of saying thank you for teaching me to be a grown up. (beat) I’ll be gone for a few days, Princess. I’ll want to hear all about the dance of dragons when I’m back.

6.text: Help me get him inside.
How many of your brothers do you think you can trust?
Does the wolf know you?
We need all the help we can get.
I can’t speak for the flames, but he’s gone.
He’ll have seen we didn’t come. Thorne will have made it official by now. Castle Black is his.
We don’t have the numbers.
It’s not enough. I didn’t know Lord Commander Snow for long, but I have to believe he wouldn’t have wanted his friends to die for nothing.
We need to fight, but we don’t need to die. Not if we have help.
You’re not the only ones who owe your lives to Jon Snow.
Hear that, lads? Nothing to fear.
And some mutton. I’d like some mutton.
I’m not much of a hunter. I’ll need some food if I’m gonna make it south without starving.
Thank you, Ser Alliser. We’ll discuss amongst ourselves and come back to you with an answer.
Boys, I’ve been running from men like that ll my life. In my learned opinion, we open that door --
Aye, but we don’t need to make it easy for them.
There’s always the Red Woman.
You haven’t seen her do what I’ve seen her do.
Tell him. Tell him who it belonged to.
Tell him what you did to her. Tell him!
Why?
You burned a little girl alive!
If he commands you to burn children, your Lord is evil!
I loved that girl like she was my own. She was good. She was kind. And you killed her!
