The only way for what? They all died anyway! You told everyone Stannis was the one. You had him believing it, all of them fooled. And you lied.
Aye, you were wrong. How many died because you were wrong?
I ask your leave to execute this woman for murder. She admits to the crime.
If you ever come back this way, I will execute you myself.
I’ve never been much of a fighter.
Apologies for what you’re about to see.
I'm sorry, my lady. I didn’t mean to interrupt.
I assume you know why I’m here.
It’s about the Lord Commander.
Does he have to be?
Do you know of any magic...that could help him? Bring him back?
Can it be done?
How?
Have you seen it done?
But it was. It could be now.
Not for you? I saw you drink poison that should’ve killed you. I saw you give birth to a demon made of shadows.
Fuck him, then. Fuck all of them. I’m not a devout man, obviously. Seven Gods, drowned gods, tree gods, it's all the same.
I’m not asking the Lord of Light for help.I’m asking the woman who showed me that miracles exist.
Have you ever tried?
Easy, easy. Easy.
What do you remember?
The lady brought you back.
You were dead. And now you’re not. That’s completely fucking mad, seems to me. I can only imagine how it seems to you.
I don’t know. Maybe we’ll never know. What does it matter? You go on. You fight for as long as you can. You clean up as much of the shit as you can.
Good. Now go fail again.
My lady.
Will you stay here at Castle Black?
You serve Jon Snow now?
Forgive me, my lady, I thought that was Stannis.
What happened down there?
And Shireen? What happened to the princess?
My lady, I’m Ser Davos Seaworth.
That’s in the past now.
Who did?
Aside from the Starks and the Boltons, the most powerful houses in the North are the Umbers, the Karstarks, and the Manderlys.
The Umbers and the Karstarks have already declared for the Boltons, so we’re not doing so well there.
I beg your pardon, my lady, but they know that a Stark beheaded their father. I don’t think we can count on them either.
Precious little, my lady.

They may well be loyal, but how many rose up against the Boltons when they betrayed your family? I may not know the North, but I know men. They’re more or less the same in any corner of the world and even the bravest of them don’t want to see their wives and children skinned for a lost cause. If Jon’s going to convince them to fight alongside him, they need to believe it’s a fight they can win.
I don’t doubt it. But Jon doesn’t have the Stark name.
I didn’t know the Tullys still had an army.
That’s good. The Blackfish is a legend. His support would mean a great deal. Stark, Tully, a few more houses, almost starts to look like a winning side.
If it please, my lady, I understand how you feel.
Davos, my lady, of House Seaworth.
You needn’t ask your maester about my house. It’s rather new.

You never thought you’d find yourself in your position. Being responsible for so many lives at such a young age. I never thought I’d be in my position. I was a crabber’s son, then I was a smuggler. And now I found myself addressing the lady of a great house in time of war. But I’m here because this isn’t someone else’s war. It’s our war.

Your uncle, Lord Commander Mormont, made that man his steward. He chose Jon to be his successor because he knew had the courage to do what was right, even if it meant giving his life. Because Jeor Mormont and Jon Snow both understood that the real war isn’t between a few squabbling houses. It’s between the living and the dead. And make no mistake, my lady, the dead are coming.

As long as the Boltons hold Winterfell, the North is divided. And a divided North won’t stand a chance against the Night King. You want to protect your people, my lady. I understand. But there’s no hiding from this. We have to fight and we need to do it together.
If they’re half as ferocious as their lady, the Boltons are doomed.
Stannis camped here on his way to Winterfell.
He was the most experienced commander in Westeros. He chose this place for a reason. Those mountains are a natural fortification. There’s a stream down there for the horses.
Aye, the snows defeated Stannis as much as the Boltons did.
2,000 Wildlings. 200 Hornwoods, 143 Mazins- -
It’s not what we’d hoped for. But we still have a chance if we’re careful and smart.
For fuck’s sake.
Friends, this is not worth fighting over!
This’ll be it, now. Right now, we don’t need to be fighting.
Hold on.
That’s not his way. He knows the North is watching. If the other houses sense weakness on his part, they’ll stop fearing him. He can’t have that. Fear is his power.
It’s crucial that we let them charge at us. They’ve got the numbers, we need the patience. If we let him buckle our center, he’ll pursue. Then we’ll have him surrounded on three sides.
We should all get some sleep.
You think there’s hope?
It wasn’t the Boltons defeated Stannis. It was Stannis himself. I loved the man. He lifted me up and made me something. But he had demons in his skull whispering foul things.
What?
No, it’s a manner of speaking. Not actual demons.
Maybe that was our mistake, believing in kings.
No, he’s not.
No, thanks. It does sound delicious, but I better keep a clear head. I can never sleep the night before a battle.
I walk. Think and walk. Think and walk until I’m far enough away from camp that no one can hear me shitting my guts out.
Prepare to charge! Prepare to charge!
Go! Go! Follow your commander!
We’ll just kill our own men. Stand down.
We may as well be taking shits back here.
Follow!
With me, lads! Break their line!

7.text: Sounds like a charmer. Of course, the casual mention of a Dothraki horde, a legion of Unsullied and three dragons, a bit less charming.
Fire kills Whites, you told me. What breathes fire?
No, too dangerous.
But if the Army of the Dead makes it passed the Wall, do we have enough men to fight them?
Davos Seaworth.
Unluckily for me.
Where are you from? I can't place the accent.
Ah. I hear it's beautiful down there. Palm trees and butterflies. I haven't been myself.
This place has changed.
This is Jon Snow.
He's King in the North.
Apologies. I have a Flea Bottom accent, I know. But Jon Snow is King in the North, Your Grace. He's not a lord.
I wasn't there, Your Grace.
Not to defeat Cersei. You could storm King's Landing tomorrow and the city would fall. Hell, we almost took it and we didn't even have dragons.
You don't believe him. I understand that. It sounds like nonsense.

But if destiny has brough Daenerys Targaryen back to our shores, it has also made Jon Snow King in the North. You were the first to bring Dothraki to Westeros. He was the first to make allies with Wildlings and northmen. He was named Lord Commander of the Night's Watch. He was named King in the North. Not because of his birthright. He has no birthright. He's a damn bastard. All those hard son's of bitches chose him as their leader because they believe in him.

All those things you don't believe in, he faced those things. He fought those things for the good of his people. He risked his life for his people. He took a knife in the heart for his people. He gave his own --
If we don't put asside our enmities and band together we will die. And then it doesn't matter whose skeleton sits on the Iron Throne.
You'll want to discuss this amongst yourselves. Perhaps --
What do you think of her?
I believe you know of whom I speak.
A good heart? I've noticed you starring at that good heart.
Fewer.
Speaking of good hearts, Missandei of Naarth.
King Snow, isn't it? No? That doesn't sound right. King Jon?
Is the custom different in Naarth?
The sounds liberating.
If I may, how did a slave girl come to advise Daenerys Targaryen?
That was good of her. Of course you're serving her now, aren't you?
You'll forgive me if I switch sides.
We heard your uncle attacked your fleet. We thought you were dead.
Your sister?
Is that possible?
I can smuggle you in, but if the Goldcloaks were to recognize you, I'm warning you, I'm not a fighter.
They won't follow Ser Jorah.
You can't lead a raid beyond the wall. You're not in the Night's Watch anymore. You're King in the North.
Last time I was here you killed my son with wildfire.
There's a path to the left that hugs the cliff. The guards hardly ever patrol it. Too many steps.
I've got my own business in Flea Bottom.
Then we're fucked. Best hurry.
I wasn't sure I'd find you.
I thought you might still be rowing.
I looked in shops, taverns, brothels. I should have known to come straight to the Street of Steel.
I haven't been here in years. Why should they recognize me? Sometimes I hardly do. Nothing fucks you harder than time.
Anybody give you any trouble?
Don't be so sure. Safety is never a permanent state of affairs. Bad things are coming.
I think you need to understand --
You should know what you're heading into.
You might want to bring one of those swords.
Keep your father's name to yourself. The situation is complicated enough already.
I told you, Clovis, if we don't get out of here soon someone is going to --
No weapons, friends. I promise. What can I do for you?
It is.
Still five gold dragons?
I can't say it was a pleasure doing business with you.
Not more gold.
Come and have a look.
Fermented crab.

Fermented crab. One bucket of this triples the brothel's earnings for the week. A man thinks he's done, he's ready to go back to his loving family, but before he gets his britches up his lady of the hour pops a tiny spoon of that into his mouth. Five minutes later, he's back in the race. Here, have a taste.
I'd hurry to your favorite establishment or you'll put a whole in that chainmail.
I really wouldn't try anymore until you see how the first bite hits you.
Perhaps there's some arrangement?
This is Gendry.
We're leaving today. The king's got a lot on his mind.
He doesn't need to be thinking about harboring the bastard of a dead king.
You're just Clovis, a smith who's come to pay his respects before he heads off to work at the Winterfell forges.
Begging your pardon, Your Grace.
Yet again.
He was meant to keep that to himself.
Don't be a fool. You're not a soldier.
He can handle himself.
As my father used to say, it's better to be a coward for a minute than dead for the rest of your life.
Yeah. Nobody mind me. All I've ever done is live to a ripe old age.
I've been failing at that job of late.
I'll be staying behind. I'm a liability out there as you well know.
Our reasons aren't your reasons.
Maybe it still is.
I wish you hadn't done that.
Any ideas as to how we might change that state of affairs?

8.text: Can't argue with that.
Not so long ago, the Starks and the Karstarks were slaughtering each other on the battlefield. Jon Snow brought peace to the houses.

Her gratitude is lovely, but that's not my point. The Northmen are loyal to Jon Snow, not to her. They don't know her. The Free Folk don't know her. I've been up here a while, and I'm telling you, they're stubborn as goats. You want their loyalty, you have to earn it.
A proposal is what I'm proposing. On the off chance that we survive the Night King, what if the Seven Kingdoms, for once in their whole shit history, were ruled by a just woman and an honorable man?

You are now. Look, I made it through most of my years without ever getting near a fight, but then I survived the Battle of the Bastards. Right outside these walls. If I can live through that, you can live through this. They'll outfit you with weapons at the forge. Right that way.
Which way do you want to go?
I'm sure a lot of people would.
We'll hold off the rest of them for as long as we can.
The dragons should give us an edge in the field.
Well, what do we have here?
No, not for me, thanks. Came here for this.
I figured I could wait to die freezing my balls off out there or wait to die nice and warm in here.
Maybe I will have that drink.
All without a shred of combat ability.
We're out of wine.
You'll pray for a quick death.
To Lord Gendry Baratheon of Storm's End.
The last time I saw her, I told her I'd kill her if I ever saw her again.
I did. I do.

Never got the chance. She did it to herself. Or her god did it to her. Lord of Light. We play his game for him, we fight his war and win, and then he fucks off. No signs, no blessings. Who knows what he wants?
And what if I'm not trying to be happy?
Thank you. I feel much better.
We all did.
That's right, you did.
How much more defeated do you want them to be? They're on their knees.
Look around you, friend. We won.
Easy, men. Easy! Easy.
Jon. We should speak with the queen.
Friends, please. We've been cutting each other's throats long enough. Torgo Nudho. Am I saying that properly?

If it weren't for you and your men, we would've lost the war with the dead. This country owes you a debt it can never repay, but let us try. There is land in the Reach. Good land. The people that used to live there are gone. Make it your own. Start your own house with the Unsullied as your bannermen. We've had enough war. Thousands of you, thousands of them. You know how it ends. We need to find a better way.
Who, then?
I'm not sure I get a vote, but aye.
Your Grace.
Long may he reign.
We have. These projects will begin as soon as the Master of Coin and Lord of Lofty Titles provides funding.
"Any more."

1.text: You can't!
They'll put out the word. They'll send out ravens. People will come after you. Do you know what happens to deserters?
What are you going to do?
You can't leave us now. We need you here.
l won't let you go.
No.
Did we get him?
But we're your brothers now.
"Hear my words and bear witness to my vow"
Samwell Tarly, of Horn Hill. I mean, I was of Horn Hill. I've come to take the black.
I yield. Please, no more.
Did he hurt you?
You can call me Sam... If you want. My mother calls me Sam.
I wanted to. I just couldn't.
I'm a coward. My father always says so.
You're right. I'm sorry. I just... Wanted to thank you.
Hello. Ser Alliser said I'm to be your new watch partner. I should warn you, I don't see all that well.
No, that's all right. I'm fine.
I don't like high places.

On the morning of my 18th nameday, my father came to me. "You're almost a man now," he said, "but you're not worthy of my land and title. Tomorrow, you're going to take the black, forsake all claim to your inheritance and start north. If you do not," he said, "then we'll have a hunt and somewhere in these woods your horse will stumble and you'll be thrown from your saddle to die. Or so I'll tell your mother. Nothing would please me more." Ser Alliser's going to make me fight again tomorrow, isn't he?
I'm not going to get any better, you know?
I know for a fact that some of the officers go to that brothel in Mole's Town.
Don't you think it's a little bit unfair? Making us take our vows while they sneak off for a little sally on the side?
It's silly, isn't it? What, we can't defend the Wall unless we're celibate? It's absurd.
Why not? Because I'm fat? But I like girls just as much as you do. They might not like me as much. I've never... been with one. You've probably had hundreds.
I find that hard to believe.
You didn't know where to put it?
Was she... Old and ugly?
What color hair?
I like red hair. And her... Her...
That good?
Oh no. So why exactly did you not make love to Ros with the perfect...
Jon Snow?
Because... You're a bastard from the north.
So... You didn't know where to put it?
It is a bit nippy.
I miss girls.
One blast for a Ranger returning, two for Wildlings, three for...
You're allowed to look happy.
I wish I could help you, but I'm no Ranger.
There's honor in being a steward.
my lord, might I go as well?
No, my lord.
The Night's Watch is my house now.
Jon, wait! Don't you see what they're doing?
I thought you were caught stealing a wheel of cheese for your starving sister?
Could you sing me a song, Pyp? I'd like to hear a song.
Now listen to me. The old man is the Lord Commander of The Night's Watch.
I always wanted to be a Wizard.
What's he got there?
Gods be good!
The smell.
There is none.
Jon, no! Jon, stop, put it down!
They were touched by White Walkers.
I read about it in a book. A very old book in Maester Aemon's library.
The White Walkers sleep beneath the ice for thousands of years.
I hope The Wall is high enough.
l - l can't.
l'm really not supposed to say.
There was a raven. l read the message to Maester Aemon. lt's your brother Robb.
He's heading south. To war. All his bannermen have rallied to his side, they'll keep him safe.

2.text: Nothing's killed me yet.
You offered me a ride!
Are those girls?
I haven't seen a girl in six months.
That's foul.
Hmm?
If you step back and think about it, the thing about Gilly that's so interesting is
No, truly. The thing about her that I find so interesting is that after all that Craster's done to her, she's still got hope that life might get better.
And the thing about you that I find so interesting is absolutely nothing.
It's Jon and the Halfhand. They're back.
Wait! Wait for me!
Grenn!
Edd!
Seems a bit greedy for one man to have so many wives. Wouldn't two, or three, be enough for him?
Nothing like the sight of a woman walking away.
I'm sure that's nice too.
You were with her? How many times?
Wish I'd grew up on a farm.
Oh, oh. Right. I'm sorry. I just wanted to make sure you weren't hurt. (Long pause).
This is Gilly, she's one of Craster's daughters.
She's pregnant. (Gilly encourages Sam to continue). We have to take her with us, when we leave.
I know it sounds a bit mad.
The Lord Commander, (Jon tries and fails to interrupt Sam), we are sworn to protect -
Why did you do that?
You were cruel.
I didn't touch her!
I can't steal her, she's a person not a goat.
I could try. (Jon looks down, annoyed). What? I've read about it. A bit.
Lord Commander
Gilly.
I I wanted to give you something. It belonged to my mother.

Please. I want you to. My mother used it for sewing. She'd let me sit with her in her chamber while she sewed and I'd read to her. My father put a stop to it when he found out. It's the only thing I have of hers. She gave it to me before I left for the Wall.
I'm not giving it away. I'm giving it to you. Keep it safe for me. Till I come back.
Beautiful, isn't it? Gilly would love it here.
The Fist of the First Men. Think of how old this place is. Before the Targaryens defeated the Andals, before the Andals took Westeros from the First Men.
Thousands and thousands of years ago, the First Men stood here where we're standing all through the long night. What do you think they were like, the First Men?
And three for White Walkers. It's been a thousand years, but that's the only time they blow the horn three times.
Well I read it in a book.
I don't see very well.
I could take up Jon's duties while he's gone, my lord. It would be no trouble.
(panting) I'm not cut out for this sort of work.
Where do you think Jon is right now?
He's not dead. No, Jon's a great fighter.
He's got a Valyrian steel sword.
And Qhorin Halfhand is the greatest ranger alive.
The First Men made these marks. Help me with it.
That's a Night's Watch cloak.
Oh. Must be dragonglass.
The maesters call it obsidian.

3.text: ( Panting and breathing heavily. )
Brother?
(Shakes his head.)
Don't kill me!
To Castle Black. I'm a brother of the Night's Watch.
Who's your brother?
You're Jon's brother. The one who fell from the window.
I've been around Ghost enough to know a direwolf when I see one. And I've heard all about Hodor.
I'd be dead if it wasn't for Jon. If you're his brother, you're my brother, too. And anything I can do to help you, I will.
What? Why in the world would you want to go--
Come with us. There are steps carved into the south side of the Wall. Hodor can carry you to the top. We'll walk straight to Castle Black.
If Jon is alive, then Castle Black's where he'll be. It's the safest place for you.
What I know is what I saw. And if you saw it, too, you'd run the other way.
How do you know all that?
But you're going to stop them?
We found them at the Fist. Someone buried them a long time ago. Someone wanted us to find them.
Killing white walkers.
Well, I suppose someone had to be the first.
And the archer. I got lucky with one of them. There are more. Many more. And for every one of them, the dead men, more than you could count. I wish you'd come with us.
I know how this must look. What I meant was--
Maester.
Maester.
She hasn't chosen a name yet.

He's not my child, Maester Aemon. She's one of Craster's wives. I remember every word of the oath. Night gathers and my watch begins. I am the shield that guards the realms of men. The realms of men. That means her as well as us. We didn't build 500 miles of ice walls 700 feet high to keep men out. The night is gathering, Maester Aemon. I've seen it. It's coming for all of us.
Miles better.
Jon! Jon! Jon, it's us.
Hush, now. You're home. Carry him inside. Gently.
No.
I can't.
You don't care. EDDISON TOLLETT
You left me. When the white walkers came, you left me.
(nods)
Ghost?
I'm sorry. He's beautiful.
He's beautiful. Does he have a name?
Are you going to give him one?
Gilly.
I wanted you to have it.
Craster's got his daughters to feed.
We can't just show up and steal all his food. We're brothers of the Night's Watch, not thieves.
Quickly. Quickly.
No, we have to go. Now!
But the more wood, the bigger the fire.
Huh. You know your fires.
It doesn't get so cold down in the Reach. And there were servants, of course.
Oh, I found something at the Fist of the First Men. Buried treasure. Thousands of years old. I think.
I'm not sure that it does anything. It's beautiful, though, isn't it?
Not so far. A few more days.
Bigger. So big you can't even see the top sometimes. It's hidden in clouds.

I'm not. It's 700 feet high, all made of ice. On a warm day you can see it weeping. Castle Black is nice enough. They keep a fire burning in the long hall day and night. And Hobb makes venison stew with onions. Very tasty. Sometimes, one of the brothers will sing. Dareon sings best.
No. No, no, no. Not very well.
Oh, all right. Let's see.

Oh ahem. (sings) The father's face is stern and strong / He sits and judges right from wrong / He weighs our lives, the short and long / And loves the little children / The mother gives the gift of life / And watches over every wife / Her gentle smile ends all strife /And she loves her little children.
It's getting dark. We could stay here for the night.
How hard can it be to build a fire?
He winked at me before.
I saw him wink at me.
I suppose it's a rather philosophical difference between a wink and a blink.
Well, I mean, there's no real difference.
You thought of a name yet? It would be easier to refer to him if he had a name.
What? No. This is just the way I talk.
Don't you think he should have a name?
Let's see, there's Duncan, Kevan, Jon Guymon, Feldan, Tristifer.
Uh, yes. Maybe that's not--
That's a lovely idea, but Mormont's a last name.
Well, it's a family name. For instance, I'm Samwell Tarly. Samwell is my birth name and Tarly is my family name. You see? So my father is also a Tarly.
No, Randyll Tarly.
Please don't name him Randyll.
Different manner of cruel.
I'll be back. I just want to look.
Go inside. Go back inside. I'll--
Stay back!
You stay back!

We're west of Castle Black, but the Nightfort's closest to us. It was the first castle on the Wall. The Watch abandoned it during the reign of King Jaehaerys I. Too big, impossible to maintain. Other than Castle Black itself, the Nightfort's the perfect castle for us. It's got a secret sally port, the Black Gate, as old as the Wall itself. No one's used it for centuries, most likely. It leads through the Wall right down into the Nightfort, if no one knows how to find it, which, it just so happens I do.
I read about it in a very old book.
Yes.

4.text: Sometimes I want to hate you.
Well, you're better than me at everything. Except reading.
They're... they're ready for you.
No one's going to hang you. You've done nothing wrong.
She's not a whore.
They all think I'm lying.
Killing the white Walker.
But you're the only one that saw it. And they all think you're just a...
Well, a wildling.
It's not a very nice word, I suppose.
So... are you all right? No one bothering you?
I worry about it sometimes. All the time.
100 men, one woman.
That's the only thing they think about.
I'm not being silly. There's 100 men lying awake at night picturing you.
What about me? Gilly? I worry about you.
For what?
I don't know if you're safe here. They're my brothers, but some of them were thieves before they came here. Some of them were rapers. You saw what they did at your father's keep.
Maybe you'd be safer in Mole's Town.
Bored of you? I... I want to protect you.
He's seen some adventures, hasn't he?
That's right. She'll clean and cook and look after the other girls' babies.
No other work.
No other work.
I promise to come back and visit whenever I can. You'll be safer here. Who's gonna protect you at Castle Black? Me?
This is different. They're brothers of the Night's Watch and I can't just stab them in the back and I can't run away, which is what we did at Craster's.
You have to trust me. It's for the best.
Oh, Gilly. Please don't.
I should neverhave taken her away.
She's not safe out there. I should have known. You told us there were wildlings south of the Wall. If they're raiding the smaller villages, Mole's Town could be next.
I should go back for Gilly.
I remember when you disobeyed orders and rode south to help Robb.
I wish I could have convinced him to come back with me. I tried. Really, I did.
I don't know. They'd pass wildling villages. They could try to find shelter at one of them.
Craster's? You think Bra nmight have found...
All right, Jon?
I should never have left her there.
Of course I could've known. They were raiding the villages close by.
She's dead because of me.
Little Same. As if I'd cut their throats myself.
She might have.
What was she like?
Oh? How big were her feet?

I want you to tell me what it was like to have someone. To be with someone. To love someone and have them love you back. We're all gonna die a lot sooner than I'd planned. You're the closest I'll ever get to know it.
No...she just had a baby! ...and she never offered.
The interesting thing is, our vows never specifically forbid intimate relations with women.

"I shall take no wife" yes, that's in there, there's no denying that. "I shall father no children" it's very specific. But what our vows have to say about other...activities...is open to interpretation.
Anyway, there's nothing for him to interpret. We didn't. So what's it like?
No, you're really not.
There'll be arrows for all of us soon I imagine.
They've already done the worst thing to me they could ever do.
Maester Aemon. How did you know-
Let me help you.
Maester Faull
But what he says about what they do...it's all true. It's exactly what the survivors of their raids report.
I don't love her.
No.
You were?
I'm sorry Maester, I didn't mean it like that.
Who was she?
Pyp! Open the gate.
Yes!
Oh, Pyp. Open the fucking gate!
Yes, well, best get used to it.
Are you alright? Shh, you're alright. Yeah, of course you are my brave little fella.
I'm so so sorry. I didn't know until I got back.
Never.
Anyone who tries to throw you out will be having words with me. From now on, wherever you go, I go too.
You'll be safe down here. I'll check on you as soon as I can.
I'm not leaving you!
I...I didn't mean in the same room.
Help my brothers.
I can't just hide here with you while they're fighting out there.
Look. I am a man of the Night's Watch, Gilly. I made a promise to defend The Wall and I have to keep it, because that's what men do.
I promise you I won't die.
There's a lot more Wildlings on the other side of the wall than this side. We've got us some weapons and things. This is the perfect place for us to be.
Of course I'm afraid, there's a band of Wildlings coming to kill us.

I didn't know I was going to kill it, but I had to do something I didn't have any choice, he was going to kill Gilly and take the baby. If someone had asked me my name right then, I wouldn't have known. I wasn't Samwell Tarly anymore. I wasn't a Steward in the Night's Watch or son of Randyll Tarly or any of that. I was nothing at all. And when you're nothing at all, there's no more reason to be afraid.
Yes, well, I'm not nothing anymore.
Did you get one?
Yeah?
If you keep missing we will.
Oh, is it over?
Well then. *hands Pyp a loaded crossbow*
You're alright. You're alright. I'll get help. Shh, shh. Maester Aemon is coming, he's gonna make it alright.
*to Grenn* We need more men down here.
But we need men here.
*to Olly* Get me to the top! You hear me?!
Your name's Olly, right? Listen to me Olly, get me to the top and when we give a signal, bring us back down. Do you hear me?
And find a weapon, Olly. Fight them!
The Wildlings are over the walls. Ser Alliser has fallen. The castle walls can't stand much longer.
You can't protect me forever. There won't be anywhere to hide if the castle falls.
We need you boy.
Woah! It's me. It's me. I promised you, didn't I?
We held them off.
This is a great victory.
Where are you going?
To...you can't do that. No one gave you any orders.
Without Mance? You're going to kill him?
They'll never let you within a hundred yards of him. And if you did, even if you managed to kill him.
He won't just kill ya. They'll boil you. They'll filet you. They'll make it last days!
What are you doing?
Jon. Come back.

5.text: Well, I’m hardly a new recruit. How many brothers can say they’ve killed a white walker and a Thenn? I might be the first in history!
If Ser Alliser is chosen as the new Lord Commander… he hates the wildlings.
All the wildlings.
It’s not a sure thing. Ser Denys Mallister has commanded the Shadow Tower for 20 years, and people say he’s a good man. He’s running against Ser Alliser--
I told you. Wherever you go, I go, too.
So what are you gonna do?
But… the Dragonglass?
But… you killed a White Walker.
He’s made of Valyrian steel. How many Valyrian steel swords are left in the Seven Kingdoms?
You were friends with me when I first got here. And I wasn’t winning any elections back then.
I wanted to ask you something. To ask something of you. Send me, Gilly, and the baby to Oldtown so I can become a Maester. That’s what I’m meant to be, not this.
Well, there’s Edd.

I’ll be more use to you as a Maester. More use to everyone now that Maester Aemon’s gone. The Citadel has the world’s greatest library. I’ll learn about history, strategy, healing. And other things. Things that will help when they come.

If Gilly stays here then she’ll die. And the baby that she named after me will die. And I’ll end up dying, too, trying to protect them. Which means that the last thing that I’ll see in this world will be the look in her eyes when I fail them. (pause) I’d rather see a thousand White Walkers than see that.
Thank you.
They’ll bloody try.
What?
Very carefully.
I’ll come back.
To my return.
Hmm! Did you know that the youngest Lord Commander in history, Osric Stark, was elected at the age of 10?
I only said that the more time you spend practicing, the faster you'll be able to read.
Three?! Who taught you, your mother?
Did you ever see them?
Your Grace.
He'll make you a Stark with the stroke of a pen?
You deserve this. You do. I couldn't be happier for you.
But you'd be Lord of Winterfell.
Maester Aemon.
Her name is Gilly. Brother Slynt knows her quite well. They cowered together in the larder during the battle for the Wall.
A wildling girl, a baby, and Lord Janos. I found him there when the battle was over in a puddle of his own making.
Whilst Lord Janos was hiding with the women and children, Jon Snow was leading.

Ser Alliser fought bravely, it is true. And when he was wounded, it is Jon who saved us. He took charge of the wall's defense. He killed the Magnar of the Thenns. (a man next to Sam nods) He went North to deal with Mance Rayder, knowing it almost certainly meant his own death. Before that, he led the mission to avenge Lord Commander Mormont. Mormont himself chose Jon to be his steward. He saw something in Jon, and now we've all seen it, too. He may be young, but he's the commander we turned to when the night was darkest.
He apologizes for not being here. He's not feeling well.
Alright, alright! Enough of that.
Lord Ashford. (Jon signs). Lady Caulfield. (Jon signs). Lord Smallwood.
They haven't heard of you either. (Jon signs). But we need men and they have some.
(Chuckles, looking at the next letter). More than Lord Wibberley.
I know, I'm sorry, but we need men and supplies. And Roose Bolton is the Warden of The North.
We swore to be the Watchers on the Wall. We can't watch the Wall with 50 men. And we can't get more men without help from the Warden of the North.
Apologies, my Lady.

"And though Daenerys maintains her grip on Slaver's Bay, forces rise against her from within and without. She refuses to leave until the freedom of the former slaves is secure." She sounds like quite a woman.
Don't say that, Maester Aemon.
(Standing up) There is good farmland in the Gift. (Laughter). Land that no one uses now. A dozen abandoned villages.
Every book there is?
Well, no. There are thousands and thousands of books out there. This library is rather small, actually.
My father's not the most literate man. They say the Citadel has the largest library in the world.
The Citadel? In Oldtown.
Gilly, look at me. You know how to do a hundred things I can never do. You can build a fire with wet wood. You can cook. You can stitch a wound.
Well -
It's where they train the maesters.
I wanted to be one when I was young. Instead, I became a man of the Night's Watch. Far more adventure up here anyway. I wouldn't have met you.
Ah, Your Grace.
I am, Your Grace.
I did, Your Grace.
With a dagger made of dragonglass.
What the maesters call obsidian -
I don't know. I've been going through all the old manuscripts hoping to find something, and all I've learned is that the children of the forest used to hunt with dragonglass.
I've seen it, Your Grace.
The army of the dead. And when they come -
Safe travels, Lord Commander.
Oh, and…
It’s Dragonglass. It’s what I used to kill the White Walker. I hope you don’t need them.
His little brother, Aegon. He became king.
You don’t know that.
I’ll stay too. He’s always been good to me. I can’t leave him now.

His name was Aemon Targaryen. He came to us from King’s Landing, a Maester of the Citadel, chained and sworn. And a sworn brother of the Night’s Watch, ever faithful. No man was wiser or gentler or kinder. At the Wall a dozen Lord Commanders came and went during his years of service, but he was always there to counsel them. He was the blood of the dragon, but now his fire has gone out. And now his watch has ended.
Get your hands off her. Brother Derryk. Brother Brand. I believe you both have guard duty tonight.
Gilly go on, Get back to your room and lock the door.
I’m warning you.
I said get your hands off her.
I killed a White Walker. I killed a Thenn. I’ll take my chances with you.
I’m alright.
I will not. They would’ve… I don’t know what they would have done
No. They were tiring out. I had them in the palm of my hand.
What kind of man would I be if I ran away when I saw someone hurting you?
Of course I will. And I’ll take care of you, too.
Stay. Please.
Oh. Oh my.
No.
How are you?
You know what I mean.
Are you scared?
Me too.
Who’s there?
Come in.
Not to worry. Men brawl from time to time. It’s only natural.
You’re a good lad.
Now then. How can I help?
Yes?
We’ve been fighting them for years.
Wildlings are people, just like us. There are good ones and bad ones.
Olly...
I’ve seen the army of the dead. I’ve seen the white walkers, and they’re coming for us, for all the living. And when it’s time we’ll need every last man we can find.
Jon’s taking a risk, but he has to. We don’t stand a chance otherwise. Sometimes a man has to make hard choices, choices that might look wrong to others but you know are right in the long run.
With all my heart.
Try not to worry Olly. I’ve been worrying about Jon for years. He always comes back.
It wasn’t.
You didn’t fail him, or him, or her. Every one of them is alive because of you, and no one else.

6.text: Hello.
From Lord Commander Snow at Castle Black.
I’m-- I’m to be the new maester.
He died.
Maester Aemon became quite ill shortly after the election. He’s since passed away. Which is why I’m here.
Yes, well, I suppose that life is irregular.
Yes. Yes, I’m fine.
I don’t think so.
Yeah, they do.
No. No, no, no. The Citadel doesn’t admit women. There won’t be a place for you there or for Little Sam.
The Citadel isn’t Castle Black. I don’t have a Jon Snow or a Maester Aemon to help me bend the rules.
By yourself? With a baby and no money?
To my home. Horn Hill. My father’s -- well, my father, but my mother’s a kind woman and my sister’s lovely. They’ll take care of you both.
I said that because I want you and Little Same to be safe. That’s all I want -- to become a maester so I can help Jon when the time comes so you’ll be safe
I don’t care about them. Well, no, I do, but I don’t really. I care about you and him.
I’d feel better if you threw something at me and stormed off.

Oh, yes. Once you get south of the Riverlands, very different sorts of trees start to take over. Maple, elm, beech, poplar. The odd willow. And of course now that summer’s over, you’ll start seeing the autumn colors coming in. Still, you’ll find more green here than anywhere else.
I didn’t think I’d ever come back here after my father made me renounce my title and inheritance and, well, threaten to kill me if I didn’t. A person just doesn’t feel welcome at that point.
And I certainly didn’t expect to be introducing him to my family. So you know what to tell them.
Yes, now that’s very important. If he thinks that Little Sam is his grandchild, he’ll take you in. He’ll get an education. He’ll learn to read. And you can help teach him. Huh?
I told them I met you in the North.
Well, it wasn’t a very large piece of parchment.
The thing is...my father doesn’t like wildlings. He hoped I’d make a man of myself by “killing some bloody wildlings,” so it’s probably a good subject to avoid if at all possible.
Oh, hello, Mother.
Oh.
Talla? Gods, you’re a woman now.
Oh, um, Mother, this is Gilly.
Oh, and this, this is our son Samwell.
Where is Father? And Dickon?
It’s beautiful. You’re beautiful.
This venison, it’s very tasty. Is it from today’s hunt?
Oh, of course. Sorry. Long journey.
Oh, that’s a fair distance.
Oh, yes. Yes. A good amount. North of the Wall, you don’t hunt, you don’t eat.
Rabbits. Sometimes squirrels. I say “we,” it’s my friend Jon mostly. Sometimes Edd. Oh, and Gilly. She’s- - she’s quite a good hunter as well. Um, huntress.
Oh, yes. Yes, please. Thank you, Mother.
I travelled south under orders from the Lord Commander. He wants me to- -
Yes. And once I have my chain, I’ll return to Castle Black.
Gilly.
I’m sorry I let him treat you that way. I was afraid he’d turn you and Little Sam away.
First light.
Say good-bye to him for me.
Good-bye, Gilly.
We’re leaving.
Get your things.
We belong together. All of us.
Oh, they’ll understand.
She won’t mind. Looks better on you anyway.
It’s my family’s sword.
He can bloody well try.

7.text: Archmaester, I was wondering...
I was wondering if you had considered my proposition.
I asked you if, in light of what I've seen in the North, if I could have access to the restricted area of the library.
No.

Archmaester, with respect, I've seen them--the Army of the Dead. The white walkers. W was sent here to learn how to defeat them, but everyone in the Citadel, those who will even talk to me, they all doubt the walkers ever existed in the first place.
Sources in the restricted area?
So, you believe me.
That makes you the only person south of the Twins who does.
The dead don't.
The Targaryens used dragonglass to decorate their weapons without even knowing what the First Men used it for.
It's a map of Dragonstone. The Targaryens built their first stronghold there when they invaded Westeros.
A mountain of it. Beneath the ground. Stannis told me, but I didn't think... This is important. Jon needs to know.
Who?
Haven't heard anything.
Pardon, Archmaester. I met Stannis Baratheon's daughter at Castle Black. She had Greyscale as a baby and was cured. Isn't there some way --
No.
No.
Should we send word to your family, Ser...
Mormont?
Archmaester, I wanted to --
I wanted to ask you --
Possibly something a bit more poetic?
Archmaester, if I could just have a moment.
I may have found a way to treat Ser Jorah. There are two recorded cases of advanced Greyscale being cured. I found the procedure in the Study of Rare Diseases by Archmaester Pilos.
Oh, you are?
Oh.
Hello.
You're Jorah Mormont. You're the only son of Jeor Mormont.
My name is Samwell Tarley. I'm a sworn brother of the Night's Watch training to serve as maester of Castle Black. I knew your father. I was with him when he died. You're not dying today, Ser Jorah.
Drink this.
Rum. Drink it all, please. I'm afraid this is going to hurt.
If you could take off your shirt.
If you wouldn't mind, bite down hard. I'm sorry but no one knows I'm here. If they hear you screaming then we're both finished.
No. No one else will try, so I'm the best you've got. Have a seat. I'm going to remove the entire layer of infected tissue, then apply a medicinal ointment to the --
Shh, shhh. Again, I'm sorry. Please try not to scream.
I suppose I'll find out this evening.
Where will you go?
Your father saved me more than once. It's the least I could do.
I hope they do.
Yes.
No one.
I seem to remember you.
I did.
I read the books and followed the instructions.
Thank you, Archmaester.
Brandon Stark --
-- the crippled boy.
I let him through the Wall years ago. I saw him go beyond the wall.
Somehow a crippled boy survived for years beyond the wall when no one else could. Not the Night's Watch, not the Wildlings, no one. Perhaps we ought to listen to what he has to say.

Everyone in Westeros trusts and respects you. If you tell people the threat is real they'll believe it. If you advise all the lords to send their men north to hold the wall they'll do it. And if you tell every maester in the Citadel to search every word of every faded scroll about the long night, they may find something that lets us defeat the Army of the Dead for good.
Archmaester, please. It's real. I've seen it.
Archmaester --
No.
None anymore.
It's when a man sets asside his lawful wife.

These maesters, they set me to the task of preserving that man's window counting and anullments and bowel movements for all eternity while the secret to defeating the Night King's probably sitting on some dusty shelf somewhere completely ignored. But that's all right, isn't it. We could all become slavering, murderous imbecils enthralled to evil incarnate as long as we can have access to the full records of High Septon Meynard's 15,782 shits.
I'm tired of reading about the achievements of better men.
I wasn't sure if you'd remember me.
Oh, well, thank you, but, um, I'm not sure that I am. What happened to you beyond the Wall?
Oh! I don't know what that means.
Um, Jon's the one to lead the fight against the dead. I know he is. But he can't do it alone, so I've come here to help him.
Oh.
The truth about what?
It's not.
At the Citadel, I transcribed a High Septon's diary. He annulled Rhaegar's marriage to Elia. He wed Rhaegar and Lyanna in a secret ceremony.
It's what the High Septon wrote in his private diary. I don't know why he'd lie. Is this something you can see?

8.text: Oh!
Um. Which man am I, Your Grace?
Oh, it's my honor to serve you, Your Grace.
If it's not too much trouble, I could use a pardon.
Um, I borrowed a few books from the Citadel.
And also a sword.
From my family. It's been in House Tarly for generations.
It would've been mine anyway, eventually, but my father had other ideas.
You know him?
Well At least I'll be allowed home again, now that my brother's the lord.
Hm. Thank you, Your Grace. For telling me. And m- May I?
What are you doing out here?
No, no. You're his brother. Shouldn't you tell him?
I'm sorry, I know I'm not supposed to be down here.
Of course not.
She's good.
Don't you know?
Daenerys. She executed my father and brother. They were her prisoners.
She didn't tell you.
Would you have done it?
You've also spared men. Thousands of wildlings when they refused to kneel.
But you were. You've always been.
I'm not talking about the King in the North. I'm talking about the King of the bloody Seven Kingdoms.
Bran and I worked it out. I had a High Septon's diary. Bran had whatever Bran has.
Your mother was Lyanna Stark.
And your father- your real father was Rhaegar Targaryen. You've never been a bastard. You're Aegon Targaryen, true heir to the Iron Throne. I'm sorry, I know it's a lot to take in.

No. Your father- Well, Ned Stark. He promised your mother he'd always protect you. And he did. Robert would have murdered you if he knew. You're the true king. Aegon Targaryen, Sixth of His Name, Protector of the Realm, all of it.
She shouldn't be.
It's the truth. You gave up your crown to save your people. Would she do the same?
Why? What does he want?

That's what death is, isn't it? Forgetting. Being forgotten. If we forget where we've been and what we've done, we're not men anymore. Just animals. Your memories don't come from books. Your stories aren't just stories. If I wanted to erase the world of men, I'd start with you.
Have you told her yet?
Mm-hmm. Being careful. Biding your time. Waiting for the perfect-
They'll be safe down in the crypt.
Everyone seems to forget that I was the first man to kill a White Walker. I've killed Thenns.
I've saved Gilly more than once. I stole a considerable number of books from the Citadel library, survived the Fist of the First Men. You need me out there.
Well, calling you "fucked" wouldn't be strictly accurate.
Think back to where we started. Us, Grenn, Pyp.
Oh, I'm sorry, I didn't mean to-
It's called Heartsbane. It's my family sword.

Yes. And I'd love to defend them with it. But I can't really hold it upright. Your father, he taught me how to be a man. How to do what's right. This is right. It's Valyrian steel. I'd be honored if you'd take it.
I'll see you when it's through.
I hope we win.
(to GENDRY) Uh, hold on.
Yes, well, the nights have been getting longer and there wasn't that much to do in Oldtown. There's only so many books a person can read, so we--
You're the best friend I ever had.
Why just us?
Um-- We represent all the great houses, but whomever we choose, they won't just rule over lords and ladies. Maybe the decision about what's best for everyone should be left to well, everyone.
Aye.
A Song of Ice and Fire. Archmaester Ebrose's history of the wars following the death of King Robert. I helped him with the title.
Oh, I wouldn't say that.
He -
I don't believe you're mentioned, ahem.
Your Grace.
He was last spotted flying east, toward--
Long may he reign.
Grandmaester, ahem, it is my theory, based on my years of work on the Casterly Rock sewers, that clean water leads to a healthier population.
The Archmaester has done some research on this subject and it turns out--
Uh the Archmaester is less than enthusiastic about the salutary effects of brothels.

2.text: For the night is dark and full of terror.
He wasn't my beloved brother. (Matthos looks up). I didn't love him, he didn't love me.
A lie. Take it out.
Jaime Lannister, the Kingslayer. Call him what he is.
Make it Ser Jaime Lannister, the Kingslayer. Whatever else he is, the man's still a knight.

When Eddard Stark learned the truth, he told only me. I'll not make the same mistake. Send copies of that letter to every corner of the Realm, from the Arbor to the Wall. The time has come to choose. Let no man claim ignorance as an excuse.
I'll not make peace with Renly while he calls himself King.

Who would steal the northern half of my kingdom. I've always served thieves according to their desserts, as you well know, Ser Davos. Joffrey, Renly, Robb Stark, they're all thieves. They'll bend the knee or I'll destroy them.
You said you saw my victory in the flames.

The flames lied. And I'm no better than a savage trusting in a fire god. I fought for your god in Blackwater Bay. I led my men to the gates of the seventh hell as their brothers burned alive, and for what? Attacked from behind by Tywin Lannister and the Tyrells. If you see so much in your flames, why didn't you warn me?
You claimed to speak for a god.
You talk about war as if you understand it.
Have you? Show me how you fight.
Show me.
Where's your god now? Will he save you? Where is your god?
I murdered my brother.
He wasn't your brother.
You promise these things, but you don't know. None of us know.
I see fire.
Send copies of that letter to every corner of the realm.
How did it fare with your pirate?
In my experience, pirates prefer fighting unarmed men.
It won't be a choice this time. Do you trust him?
Well if he does his job, he'll have his share. Leave us.
What did you say to him?
Why?
Yeah.
Tell your lord to burn them then.
My little brother has a hundred thousand men according to the scouts. Men whose allegiance rightly belongs to me.
Faith? In a real war, the side with the greater number wins nine times out of ten.
I cannot defeat my brother in the field, and I can't take King's Landing without the men he stole.
I've said the words, damn you! I burnt the idols.
I have a wife. I took a vow.
(Gasps). A son?
Lady Stark, I had not thought to find you in the Stormlands.
Who else might it be?
My own.
Watch yourself, Renly.
That's twice I've warned you.
It is strange to find you beside my brother, Lady Stark. Your husband was a supporter of my claim. Lord Eddard's integrity cost him his head. And you sit beside this pretender and chastise me.
The Iron Throne is mine by right. All those that deny that are my foes.

For the sake of the mother who bore us, I will give you this one night to reconsider. Strike your banners, come to me before dawn, and I will grant you your old seat in the Council. I'll even name you my heir until a son is born to me. Otherwise I shall destroy you.
You think a few bolts of cloth will make you king?
We shall see, Renly. Come the dawn, we shall see.
Do your knucklebones bring you luck?
Fewer.
Four fewer fingernails to clean. Never understood why you had to wear them.
You were a hero and a smuggler. A good act does not wash out the bad, nor a bad the good.
Does he listen?
She has a name. I trust you've not forgotten your smuggler's tricks.
I want you to be a smuggler this time.
The red woman. No one must know what you do and we'll not speak of this again.
Cleaner ways don't win wars.
What is it?
Fools love a fool. I grieve for him as well, for the boy he was, not the man he grew to be.
I thought I made it clear to you there'd be no need to speak to me on this matter.
I've never known you to need to hear a thing twice.
You've come to lecture me on truth?
All my brother's bannermen have come to my side. Except the Tyrells, who fled like cowards. They won't be able to resist us now. Soon I shall be sitting on the Iron Throne.
I'll hear no more about it.
As soon as I've consolidated my troops. We'll make short work of the Lannisters' fleet. Once Blackwater Bay is cleared, we'll deliver our troops to their doorstep and take the city.
That's not your concern.
I never thought I'd have reason to doubt your loyalty. Was I wrong?
Oh, truth again. All right, what's the truth? The hard truth?
What do you believe?
We set out for King's Landing without Lady Melisandre. And you lead the fleet into Blackwater Bay.
Most of those lords should consider themselves lucky I don't hang them for treason. Hard truths cut both ways, Ser Davos.
Will it hold?
I admire you, Ser Davos.
Pleased to hear it. Some highborn fools call you Onion Knight and think they insult you. So you take the onion for your sigil, sew it on your coat, fly the onion flag.
Do you? Why?
And?
And where were those lords when Storm's End starved?
You defend these men who insult you behind your back.

We were forgotten. Robert and Ned Stark, they were the heroes. The glorious rebels marching from battle to battle, liberating towns from the yoke of the Mad King, while I held Storm's End with 500 men.
No? Robert did. He gave Storm's End to Renly after the war. Renly never fought a day in his life.
Then why'd he give him Storm's End?

First, we ate the horses. We weren't riding anywhere, not with the castle surrounded. We couldn't feed them, so fine, the horses. Then the cats. Never liked cats. So fine. I do like dogs. Good animals. Loyal. But we ate them. Then the rats. The night before you slipped through, I thought my wife was dying. She couldn't speak anymore, she was so frail. And then you made it through the lines. Slipped right through in your little black sailboat with your onions.
Every man in Storm's End wanted to kiss you that night.

Robert told me to hold Storm's End, so I held it. Then he told me he was giving it to Renly, so I gave it up. Insult or no, I gave it up. Because Robert was my older brother, and he was the king and I've always done my duty. But now, I'm the rightful king by every law of Westeros. And when I sit the Iron Throne, you'll be my Hand.
I expect you'll be the first crabber's son to wear the badge.
Prepare to land.
The dwarf has played his little trick.
He can only play it once.
Thousands.
Come with me and take this city!
To the Mud Gate, go now!
Get the ladders up!
Stand and fight! Stand and fight, damn you!
No!

3.text: I heard you were dead.
I had hoped to speak to you alone, Your Grace.
We are alone.
I am fighting.
Take him to the dungeon and lock him in a cell.
The usurper Robb Stark is dead. Betrayed by his bannerman.
Do you know who had this table carved and painted, Ser Davos?
And do you know how Aegon Targaryen conquered Westeros?

He had a smaller fleet than the kings he faced and a smaller army, but he had three dragons. Dragons are magic, Ser Davos. My enemies have made my kingdom bleed. I will not forget that. I will not forgive that. I will punish them with any arms at my disposal.
What is the life of one bastard boy against a kingdom?
The boy must die.
You don't deny it?
What other way?! Tell us about this other way.
Very well, Ser Davos Seaworth. I, Stannis of the House Baratheon, First of My Name, Rightful King of the Andals and the First Men, sentence you to die.
Why am I gonna need you?
When did you learn to read?
I've made my decision.
(chuckles) You see, Ser Davos? You've been saved by that fire god you like to mock. You're in his army now.
You refuse to tell me where you're going?
How long will you be gone?
You're abandoning me.
Then serve me.
My enemies think they've destroyed me. They're laughing at me the way Renly laughed at me. I want Joffrey dead. I want Robb Stark dead. Make me another son.
Why?
I'm not so easily killed. Men have been trying for years.
(whispering) I want you.
You told me your magic requires a king's blood.
I'm the one true king.
My lady.
I meant to come sooner. The battle--
Yes, of course.
I believed that once.
Selyse. I've broken a sacred vow. I've sinned.
I've wronged you. I have shamed you.
You don't understand. The Red Woman-- the Lady Melisandre--
That's not true.
She's my daughter. I want to see her.
Shireen.
You've grown since I last saw you.
No.
He did. He fought bravely.
He won't be visiting, child.
Ser Davos is a traitor. He's rotting in a dungeon cell for his crime. Best forget him.
Half Robert, half lowborn.
What do you mean to do with him?
Then why bathe him and dress him in fine clothes? If it needs to be done, do it. Don't torture the boy.
No.
You've slaughtered many lambs?
They feeding you enough?
You don't belong in a place like this.
Yeah.
Melisandre's returned.
Came back with a bastard boy. Robert's bastard boy.
She says there's power in king's blood.
Sacrifice him.
What of it? We're at war. Why should I spare the son of some tavern slut Robert bedded one drunken night?
So did Renly.

How many boys live in Westeros? How many girls? How many men? How many women?The darkness will devour them all, she says. The night that never ends. Unless I triumph. I never asked for this. No more than I asked to be king. We do not choose our destiny, but we must do our duty, no? Great or small, we must do our duty. What's one bastard boy against a kingdom?
I came to free you. If you swear never to raise your hand to the Lady Melisandre again.
You have little regard for your own life.

I saw a vision in the flames. A great battle in the snow. I saw it. And you saw whatever she gave birth to. I never believed, but when you see the truth, when it's right there in front of you as real as these iron bars, how can you deny her god is real?
The usurper Robb Stark. The usurper Balon Greyjoy. The usurper Joffrey Baratheon.

4.text: You're the king beyond the wall?
You know who I am?
It is customary to kneel when surrendering to a king.
I'll have thousands of your men in chains by nightfall, I'll have nowhere to put them and nothing to feed them. I'm not here to slaughter beat dogs. Their fate depends on their king.
Take these men away.
Your father was an honorable man.
What do you think he'd have done with him?
Very well. *to Davos* Take him.
I ordered him to tear down his idols. He disobeyed.
A good deal more than you.
Meat's off.
Serve fish, then. We're on an island.
I hate a good many things, but I suffer them all the same.
Of course I remember.
She's a child.
She's my daughter. You will not strike her.
You're a literary man now. What do you make of that?

The usurper Joffrey Baratheon. I said those words when I tossed a leech into the fire. A leech filled with bastard blood. A bastard you set free. I am now faced with a great opportunity and I am powerless to take advantage of it.
What progress have you made?
House Peasebury.
House Musgood.
House Haigh. They don't have enough men between them to raid a pantry.
The Golden Company?
They're sellswords.
We don't have any gold.
If I do not press my claim, my claim will be forgotten. I will not become a page in someone else's history book. I'm running out of time, Ser Davos. Which means you're running out of time. -
We've been here since midday.
He shares no blood with me. He is a bastard born of incest. As was his brother before him.
It's not a story. It's the truth.
Gold you loaned him.
More than any man living.
None.

67. And when he dies, who's in command? A half-grown boy, the product of incest? Cersei Lannister, a queen whose people despise her? Jaime Lannister, a man best known for killing the king he was sworn to protect? When Tywin's gone, who do you back?

5.text: You know who rules at Winterfell now?
The traitor who plunged a dagger into Robb Stark’s heart. Don’t you want to avenge him?

No matter. I shall take back the North from the thieves who stole it. Tywin Lannister is dead. He can’t protect them now. I shall mount Roose Bolton’s head on a spike. But if I’m to take Winterfell I’ll need more men.
I’m not talking about the damn Night’s Watch. I’m talking about the wildlings.
If they swear to follow me, I’ll pardon them. We’ll take Winterfell. Once the North is won, I’ll declare them citizens of the realm. I’ll give them land to live on.
I’ll offer them their lives and their freedom if Mance kneels before me and swears his loyalty.
You admire him, don’t you?
He likes you. Convince him to bend the knee...
...or he burns.
Nightfall. The sun drops fast this time of year. Hurry, Jon Snow.
Mance Rayder, you’ve been called the King Beyond the Wall. Westeros only has one king. Bend the knee, I promise you mercy.
Kneel and live.
We ride for Winterfell.
Prepare to form up.
Tell me.
How many?
Speak up. It can’t be worse than mutiny.
Cut her down.
Get the men into marching formation. On to Winterfell.
Trench here. Another one 300 yards from the castle wall. Hurry them along. And send out a foraging party immediately. The siege begins at sunrise.
Bolton has women fighting for him.
I did.
Go on, do your duty.

I ordered Mance Rayder burnt at the stake. You prevented that order from being carried out. You showed mercy to Mance Rayder. A king's word is law. Perhaps you should ask Ser Davos how much mercy I show to lawbreakers. Show too much kindness, people won't fear you. If people don't fear you, they don't follow you.
Who then? You?
Do you know this wretched girl Lyanna Mormont?
Lady of Bear Island, and a child of 10. I asked her to commit her house to my cause, that's her response.
That amuses you?
I know. My brother Robert went on often and loudly about how difficult it was to control them - even with your father's help.
Your bravery made him look weak. He'll punish you for it. I don't punish men for bravery. I reward them.
You can give me the North.
Kneel before me. Lay your sword at my feet. Pledge me your service and you'll rise again as Jon Stark, Lord of Winterfell.
Lord Commander.
(To Olly as he closes the door). I'd like to speak alone.
Very well. (They all sit down). Have you considered my offer?
Say the word and you will be.
I'm giving you a chance to avenge your family. To take back the castle where you grew up. To rule the North.
You're as stubborn as your father. And as honorable.
I didn't mean it as praise. Honor got your father killed. (Stands up). But if your mind’s made up, I won't try to persuade you.
Are you bored of us already?
I know it. We march on Winterfell within the fortnight. Before the snows trap us here.

They'd rather burn than fight for me, so be it. I leave their fate to you. You could execute them, that's the safest course. (After a moment). Or you could see if this Tormund fellow is more willing to compromise than Mance ever was. I assume the brothers of the Night's Watch would rather see the wildlings dead.
You're the Lord Commander. Your decision.
You have many enemies in Castle Black. Have you considered sending Alliser Thorne elsewhere? Give him command of Eastwatch-by-the-Sea.
Whoever said that didn't have many enemies.
Lord Commander of the Night's Watch.
Perhaps, but that wasn't Ned Stark's way.
Not your fault.
We must. To beat the snows.
I won't. I need you.
(Walking away). And you, my Lady, what do you need?
Are you lonely?
My father used to tell me that boredom indicates a lack of inner resources.
I know Castle Black is no place for a child, but I -
Why do you say that?
She shouldn't have said that.

When you were an infant, (Stands up and walks around his desk), the Dornish trailer landed on Dragonstone. His goods were junk except for one wooden doll. He'd even sewn a dress on it in the colors of our House. No doubt he'd heard of your birth, and assumed new fathers were easy targets. I still remember how you smiled when I put that doll in your cradle, (Shireen smiles), and you pressed it to your cheek. (Looks down. Shireenâ€™s smile drops). By the time we burnt the doll, it was too late. (Walks to the table and adjusts the objects on it). I was told you would die. Or worse, the grayscale would go slow. (Turns to her). Let you grow just enough to know the world before taking it away from you. Everyone advised me to send you to the ruins of Valyria to live out your short life with the Stone men, before the sickness spread to the castle. I told them all to go to hell. (Shireen smiles). I called in every maester on this side of the world. Every healer, every apothecary. They stopped the disease and saved your life. Because you did not belong across the world with the bloody Stone men. (Walks towards her). You are the Princess Shireen of House Baratheon. And you are my daughter.
Fewer.
Nothing.
You're Samwell Tarly?

Your father is Randyll Tarly. He defeated my brother at the Battle of Ashford. Only battle Robert ever lost. I told him he shouldn't go so far west so soon, but he never listened. Fine soldier, your father. You don't look like a soldier. But I'm told you killed a white walker.
How?
Dragonglass?
I know what it is. We have it in Dragonstone. Why would obsidian kill a walker?
The Lady Melisandre told me that death marches on the Wall.
Seen what?
We have to know how to fight them. (After a moment). Keep reading, Samwell Tarly.
It's time.

If Jon Snow returns with the wildlings. We can't wait that long. We have the advantage, more men, more horses, all fed and rested. But every day we wait, the odds shift in Bolton's favor. This could turn to winter at any moment. We have to act now. Give the order. We march at sunrise.
No need, they're coming with us.
Here? Half these watchmen are killers and rapists. No, they march with us.
I hope you know what you're doing with these wildlings. I need those ships.
What else?
500 men.
Sell swords, loyal to nothing but gold.
And?
I retreated from King’s Landing, Ser Davos. If I retreat again, I become “The King Who Ran.”
Winter is coming. Those arent just the Stark words, it’s a fact. If we march back to Castle Black, we winter at Castle Black. And who can say how many years this winter will last.
This is the right time, and I will risk everything. Because if I don't, we’ve lost. We march to victory or we march to defeat, but we go forward only forward,
I don’t know what I saw.
And you, do you trust yourself?
Are you sure?
We don’t have Robert’s bastard here.
Have you lost your mind?
There must be another way. Leeches or something.
She’s my daughter.
Get out.
Horses?
20 men rode into our camp without a single guard sounding the alarm?
Put last night’s guards in chains, either they fell asleep or they were conspiring with the enemy. Find out the truth and then hang them.
We’re not returning to Castle Black.
Have the dead horses butchered for meat.

Find you some healthy horses and a few good men to guard you, I’m sending you back to Castle Black. Tell the Lord Commander to send food, supplies, fresh horses, in return when I take the throne I’ll make sure the Night’s Watch has all the men it requires. He can guard all 19 castles if he so wishes.
Yes.
You’re not abandoning me, you’re obeying a command.
And if Jon Snow refuses a boy with a scroll, what does the boy say? I didn’t name you hand for your expertise in military matters, ride for Castle Black, don’t come back empty handed.
My family stays with me.
My family stays with me.
No. What are you reading?
What’s it about?
“The dance of dragons”? Why is that a dance?
Doesn’t make much sense.
If you had to choose between Rhaenyra and Aegon, who would you have chosen?

Sometimes a person has to choose. Sometimes the world forces his hand. If a man knows what he is and remains true to himself, the choice is not choice at all. He must fulfill his destiny and become who he is meant to be. However much he may hate it.
You don’t even know what I’m talking about.
Yes there is.
Forgive me.
There’s no other way. She has King’s blood.

2.text: Lord of Light, come to us in our darkness. We offer you these false Gods.
Take them and cast your light upon us. For the night is dark and full of terrors.
After the long summer, darkness will fall heavy on the world. Stars will bleed.
The cold breath of winter will freeze the seas.
And the dead shall rise in the North.
You smell of fear, fear and piss and old bones. Do you want to stop me? Stop me.
In the ancient books, it's written that a warrior will draw a burning sword from the fire. And that sword shall be Lightbringer. Stannis Baratheon, warrior of light, your sword awaits you.
For the night is dark and full of terrors.
Stannis does not need to beg this lord or that lord for support. The Lord of Light stands behind him.
He has no need for ships.
The night is dark and full of terrors, old man, but the fire burns them all away. Your Grace.
l I did. I still see it.
The Lord of Light only allows me glimpses.
Will you quit the war just because you've lost a battle?
I've been fighting far longer than you.
Inside you.
We murdered him. Share the weight with me.

This war has just begun. It will last for years. Thousands will die at your command. You will betray the men serving you. You will betray your family. You will betray everything you once held dear. And it will all be worth it because you are the Son of Fire. You are the Warrior of Light. You will sweep aside this pretender and that one. You will be king.
Let me show you.
Look into the fire, my king. Look.
Keep looking. Do you see? Do you see, my king?
Is it as you remember my lord?
Everything looks bigger when you're a child. I remember my father's cabin, felt like a palace when I was little. Now look at it.
Who will?
I love the cold and wet.
Then you'll be king before long.
My father doesn't trust you Iron islanders.
He says that you're all reavers and rapers. And that no matter how many women you have, you'll never be satis-
Capture me! Take me with you when you go ashore. Make me your saltwife.
Not after you leave. Father will punish me. He'll call me a whore.
The Lord of Light shines through you, young warrior.
I told him death by fire is the purest death.
Because it is true. You're troubled my king.
These armies are but toys for the Lord of Light.
I tell him nothing! I pray for his commands and I obey.
You must have faith.
Then we must be the ten.
I have seen the path to victory in the flames. At first, you must give yourself to the Lord of Light.
You must give... all of yourself.
She's sick. Weak. Shut away in the tower. And she disgusts you. And she's given you nothing. No sons. Only stillborns. Only death. (Whispers in his ear). I will give you a son, my King.
He's dead. He was my son. My sister was three days ago. My husband, the day before that.
(nods)
Please, Polliver. Some food. Just a crust of bread.
The king has taken for his sigil the fiery heart of the Lord of Light.
You should kneel before your brother. He's the Lord's chosen, born amidst salt and smoke.
Look to your sins, Lord Renly. The night is dark and full of terrors.
Are you afraid, Onion Knight?
You've carried more unpleasant cargo in your time. Are you a good man, Ser Davos Seaworth?
If half an onion is black with rot, it's a rotten onion. A man is good or he is evil.
Oh, good. I'm a knight myself, of sorts, a champion of light and life.
Do you love your wife?
Yet you have known other women.
I'm not. I'm talking about other women. Like me, Ser Davos. You want me. You want to see what's beneath this robe.
And you will.
Shadows cannot live in the dark, Ser Davos. They are servants of light, the children of fire. And the brighter the flame, the darker they are.
They can't bar our passage.
There's only one god, Ser Davos, and he only protects those who serve him.
And you must visit the night market. The Qartheen night market is like no night market you've ever seen.
The Meereenis think they have a night market. I will take you there myself.
That is strange.
Please, Your Grace, give us some food!
Children, come inside, quick. Come on.

3.text: Ah, look, crow coming!
How would you punish the infidels, Ser Davos?
I'm not your enemy.

Was it me you fought on Blackwater Bay? Did I set your ships ablaze? I wasn't there when the wildfire killed our men by the thousands. I could have saved those men. You would have taken the city, Stannis would now sit upon his rightful throne, and you would stand beside him. But I wasn't there because you convinced your king to leave me behind. Do you hear them screaming? All those burning men in the water crying for their mothers, for their gods for help? Until the moment the Blackwater swallowed them.
Don't despair, Ser Davos. What I told your son is true.
Death by fire is the purest death.
You've chosen the darkness, Ser Davos.
I will pray for you.
I take no credit. I have faith and my faith has been rewarded.
And our king is still no closer to the Iron Throne. A great gift requires a great sacrifice.
Your mercy saved the boy's life. You feel good about that?
You saved one innocent. How many tens of thousands have you doomed?
Take him away.
My king.
This War of Five Kings means nothing. The true war lies to the north, my king. Death marches on the Wall. Only you can stop him.
He's right. You need him. He has a part to play in the war to come.
They need some water.
Here we are.
That's it. You're nearly there. One more push should do it.
I don't know yet. The fires will show me.
I don't know.
I will never abandon you. You are the Son of Fire. I am sworn to serve you.
When I return, you will understand.
I cannot.
You don't have the strength. It would kill you.
Your fires burn low, my king.
There is another way. A better way.
Yes.
You are. But there are others with your blood in their veins. You will sit on the Iron Throne, but first there must be sacrifices. The Lord of Light demands it.
Lady Margaery!
We come as friends.
Valar morghulis.
(speaks Valyrian) You are Thoros of Myr.
(speaks Valyrian) The High Priest gave you a mission. Turn King Robert away from his idols and towards the Lord of Light. What happened?
(speaks Valyrian) You quit, you mean. The heathen continue to slaughter each other and you continue to get drunk.
How many times has the Lord brought him back?
(speaks Valerian) That's not possible.
(speaks Valerian) You should not have this power.
You've been to the other side.
You have someone He needs.
You are more than they can ever be. They're just foot soldiers in the great war. You will make kings rise and fall.
I see a darkness in you. And in that darkness, eyes staring back at me-- brown eyes, blue eyes, green eyes. Eyes you'll shut forever. We will meet again.
Wildfire. I should have been here.
Do you miss it?
Your father's house.
Haven't you ever wondered where your strength came from? Your talent for fighting?
Mine was a slave. So was I. Bought and sold, scourged and branded, until the Lord of Light reached down, took me in his hand and raised me up.
Your blood is noble.
There. Your father's house.
The bastard of Robert of the House Baratheon, First of His Name, King of the Andals and the First Men. Why do you think the gold cloaks wanted you? There is power in a king's blood.
Show the boy to his chambers. Have the maids draw him a bath and find him some decent clothes. I'll come visit you soon.
You know what I mean to do with him.
Have you ever slaughtered a lamb, my king?
If the lamb sees the knife, she panics. Her panic seeps into her meat, darkens it, fouls the flavor.
And none have seen the blade.
Have you ever seen one like it?
It's shocking, isn't it, the first time you encounter real wealth? When I was your age, I lived on one bowl of stew a day. And stew is a kind word for it.
Here, taste this.
You think I'm trying to poison you?
Where do you think it's from?

Doesn't matter, does it? It's the real thing or it's not. You only need a tongue to tell the difference. Go on, have some more. You still don't trust it. You think this is all a mistake and that you'll have to pay somehow for every bite you take.
There are no mistakes. Not for us.

Your father chose your mother because the Lord of Light willed it. He willed it so you could be here right now with a power inside you you can't even begin to understand. And He brought me here to draw it from you and birth it into the world. We're both a part of His plan. He wants this for us. No, He demands this of us.

According to whom? The Silent Sisters? With their stern looks, muzzled mouths, and dried-up cunts? What have their gods done for you? Hmm? When you pray to them, what's their answer? A god is real or he's not. You only need eyes to see.
Death is coming for everyone and everything. A darkness that will swallow the dawn. And we can stop it, you and I.
Let me show you what you have inside you. Come fight death with me.
You have to trust me.
Don't fight, don't fight. They won't take much.
I told you there's power in the blood of kings. And you have so much blood.
You can blame Ser Davos. He didn't believe in the power of king's blood. He wanted a demonstration.

4.text: Tywin… my lion...
This way, my lady.
Hear us now. Accept these tokens of our faith, my lord, and lead us from the darkness.
Lord of Light, show us the way...
Lord of Light, protect us, for the night is dark and full of terrors.
It's all I knew when I was a child.
Until he found me.
Every mother should fear for her child's soul.
Were you sleeping, Princess?
Did you watch the ceremony on the beach?
And it frightened you?
They're in a better place now, Princess. The fire cleansed them of the sins of the world.
Women scream when they give birth. Afterward they are filled with joy.
You have so many questions, don't you? So did I when I was a child. I was much like you. Only I wasn't a princess.
No. But I suffered in other ways, sweet girl, believe me. What do you know of the gods?
Lies and fables. Septons speak of seven gods. There are but two... a god of light and love and joy and a god of darkness, evil, and fear. Eternally at war.
There's only one hell, Princess. The one we live in now.
No, don't. Don't, please.
Come in, my queen. Please.
You could never disturb me.
Could you bring me that vial over there? The blue one.
No, no, no. Not that one. You don't even want to touch that one. Next to it. That's the one.
When I looked into the flames this morning, the Lord spoke to me. He said, "Tonight, you will have your last good bath in a long while. Make it count." A joke. Not a very good one, I'm afraid.
That's because most jokes are lies and you're devoted to the truth.
Not always.

Most of these powders and potions are lies. Deceptions to make men think they witnessed our Lord's power. Once they step into his light, they will see the lie for what it was-- a trick that lead them to the truth. A pinch of this powder in a bonfire will send a flaming column screaming towards the sky. And this one creates a black smoke that will make the bravest man piss himself with fear. And a drop of this in any man's wine will drive him wild with lust.
No. Don't be upset. Men never crave what they already have.
It's only flesh. It needs what it needs.
I understand how you feel.
But that is impossible.
You don't need powders and potions, my queen. You don't need lies. You are strong enough to look into the Lord's light and see his truth for yourself.
However harsh it is. However hard for us to understand. You don't need my help, but I will need yours soon. When we set sail, your daughter must be with us. The Lord needs her.

5.text: The king wants a word.
Never. The Lord’s fire lives within me, Jon Snow.
Feel.
Are you a virgin?
Good.
Your grace. The bastard of Winterfell.
Man or woman, young or old, lord or peasant, our choices are the same. We choose light, or we choose darkness. We choose good, or we choose evil. We choose the true god or the false.
Free folk, there is only one true king, and his name is Stannis. Here stands the king of lies. Behold the fate of those who choose the darkness.
The Lord of Light has made good on his promise, my king. His fires have melted the snows away. The way ahead is clear.
And you will take it. The Lord has shown me Bolton banners burning. You will receive what is yours by right.
I’ve had half as many cocks as the queen!
I'll bring you a bowl of hot water. You must want to wash.
Welcome home, Lady Stark. (Quieter) The North remembers.
Thank you ever so for the soup!
(Valyrian) Lord cast your light upon us.
(Valyrian) For the night is dark and full of terrors.
(Valyrian) I was once as you are now.
(Valyrian) Bought and sold, (Varys approaches Tyrion), scourged and branded...
(Valyrian) The Lord of Light hears your voice. He hears the king as he hears the slave; he hears the Stone Men in their misery...
(Valyrian) He has sent you a saviour! From the fire she was reborn to remake the world! The Dragon Queen!
Filthy bastard!
(Walking towards them). Those scars mean nothing to the Lord of Light.
Her father is the Lord's chosen King. And her father's blood runs through her veins.
You march on Winterfell soon?
