Once before you put your faith in Ser Davos and left me behind. I hope you won't make that mistake again.
You only need faith, my King.
To serve my Lord.
Lord Commander.

Come with us when we ride south. (Walks forwards). None of us know the castle as well as you do. Its hidden tunnels, its weaknesses, its people. Winterfell was your home once. Don't you want to chase the rats out of it? (Turns to Jon).
There's only one war. Life against death. Come. Let me show what you're fighting for. (Walks in front of Jon).
No visions. No magic. Just life.
Do you feel my heart beating? This power in you, you resist it, and that's your mistake. Embrace it.
The Lord of Light made us male and female. Two parts of a greater whole. We are joining this power. Power to make life, power to make light, and power to cast shadows.
Then we shouldn't tell him. (Starts unbuttoning Jonâ€™s coat).
Why?
The dead don't need lovers. Only the living.
You know nothing, Jon Snow.
(Speaking another language) Sons of the Harpy.
Beg pardon, my lady. I've come to refill the wash basin.
(Closes the door). You still have friends in the North. If you're ever in trouble, light a candle in the highest window of the broken tower.
You're not alone.
You saw it yourself, my king, when you stared into the flames. A great battle in the snow.
You do know. Trust yourself.
I trust in the Lord.
I have seen myself walk along the battlements of Wintefell. I have seen the flayed men banners lowered to the ground.
But sometimes sacrifices must be made to ensure victory. I have shown you the power of king's blood. The Usurper Robb Stark. The Usurper Joffrey Baratheon.
No, we have someone better, and your blood runs through her veins.
Do you doubt me still? After all that you’ve seen?
There is only one way. You must become king before the Long Night begins. Only you can lead the living against the dead. All your life has led us to this moment. To this decision.
It will all be over soon, Princess.
The year is now, my Lord. For you we offer up this girl, that you may cleanse her with your fire and that its light may lead our way.
Accept this token of our faith, my lord and lead us from the darkness. Lord of Light show us the way!
Lord of Light protect us, for the night is dark and full of terrors!

6.text: Ser Davos.
I saw him in the flames, fighting at Winterfell.
Could have been worse, Jon Snow. You had a family. You had feasts.
The Princess Shireen.
We burned her at the stake.
The army was trapped. The horses were dying. It was the only way.
I only do what my Lord commands!
We are standing here because of him. Jon Snow is alive because the Lord willed it.
So did her father. So did her mother. Her own blood knew it was the only way.
I didn’t lie. I was wrong.

I’ve been ready to die for many years. If the Lord was done with me, so be it, but he’s not. You’ve seen the Night King, Jon Snow. You know the great war is still to come. You know the army of the dead will be upon us soon. And you know I can help you win that war.
Come in.
You interrupt nothing.
I will after you tell me.
The former Lord Commander.
What are you asking?
If you want to help him, leave him be.
There are some with his power.
I don’t know.
I met a man who came back from the dead, but the priest who did it -- It shouldn’t have been possible.
Not for me.
Everything I believed, the great victory I saw in the flames, all of it was a lie.
You were right all along. The Lord never spoke to me.
I never had this gift.
Please.
Afterwards, after they stabbed you, after you died, where did you go? What did you see?
The Lord let you come back for a reason. Stannis was not the prince who was promised, but someone has to be.
If you’re going to torture me, just call them back and get on with it.
Ser Davos.
I will do as Jon Snow commands.
He’s the prince that was promised.
There was a battle. Stannis was defeated.
Long live King Tommen and bless you, Queen Margaery!
Sweet girl.
I’m not a soldier.
Don’t lose.
I’ll have to try.
I am not your servant, Jon Snow.
I serve the Lord of Light. I do what he commands.
I interpret his signs as well as I can. If the Lord didn’t want me to bring you back, how did I bring you back? I have no power. Only what he gives me and he gave me you.
I don’t know. Maybe you’re only needed for this small part of his plan and nothing else. Maybe he brought you here to die again.
The one we’ve got.

7.text: Queen Daeneys, I was a slave once, bought and sold, scourged and branded. It is an honor to meet the Breaker of Chains.
I am called Melisandre.
No, it didn't.
The Long Night is coming. Only the prince who was promised can bring the dawn.
Prophecies are dangerous things. I believe you have a role to play, as does another. The King in the North, Jon Snow.

As Lord Commander of the Night's Watch he allowed the Wildlings south of the Wall to protect them from great danger. As King in the North he has united those Wildlings with the northern houses so together they may face their common enemy.
Summon Jon Snow. Let him stand before you and tell you things that have happened to him, the things that he has seen with his own eyes.
I've done my part. I've brought ice and fire together.
My time whispering in the ears of kings has come to an end.
Neither of us is common folk anymore. I did not part on good terms with the King in the North, or his advisor.
Because of mistakes I made. Terrible mistakes. I would only be a distraction if I stayed.
Volantis.
I will return, dear spider. One last time.
I have to die in this strange country, just like you.

8.text: Thank you.
I have to go down and get another barrel.
Drink!

1.text: Ham. How many days in a row must a man be expected to start his day with ham? Bring me some beer at least. You look exhausted. Was your moonlight ride that tiring?
l didn't say it was your honor.

And you're gonna bring him back to life, are you? No? Good. We've had enough of that sort of thing. Beyond the Wall, the Rangers are reporting whole villages abandoned. At night they see fires blazing in the mountains from dusk until dawn. A captured wildling swears their tribes are uniting in some secret stronghold, to what ends the gods only know. Outside Eastwatch Cotter Pyke's men discovered four blue-eyed corpses. Unlike us, they were wise enough to burn them. Do you think your brother's war is more important than ours?
When dead men and worse come hunting for us in the night, do you think it matters who sits on the lron Throne?
Good. Because l want you and your wolf with us when we ride out beyond the Wall tomorrow.

l'll not sit meekly by and wait for the snows. l mean to find out what's happening. The Night's Watch will ride in force against the wildlings, the White Walkers and whatever else is out there. And we will find Benjen Stark, alive or dead. l will command them myself. So l'll only ask you once, Lord Snow, are you a brother of the Night's Watch or a bastard boy who wants to play at war?
I don't need him to be charming. I need him to turn this bunch of thieves and runaways into men of the Night's Watch.
Slowly. A raven came for Ned Stark's son.
Both.
We've been capturing wildlings, more every month. They're fleeing south. The ones who flee... say they've seen the White Walkers.
One of our own rangers swore he saw them kill his companions. He swore it right up to the moment Ned Stark chopped his head off.
Your sister sits by the side of the King. Tell her we need help.
You came to us as outlaws, poachers, rapers, killers, thieves.
Here you begin anew.
You'll want to take your vow before a heart tree as your Uncle did.
You'll find a Weirwood a mile North of the Wall. And your old Gods too, maybe.
Does house Tarly keep the old Gods?
As you wish, lad.
It's Othor, without a doubt.
Any sign of Benjen or the rest of his party?
Mmm.
I want Maester Aemon to examine them first.
Bring me a horn of ale, Snow, and pour one for yourself.
Sit.
I hope you're not thinking of doing anything stupid.
I'm sure they'll be treated gently.
I told you not to do anything stupid. You're confined to quarters. Go.
Snow!?
When does Aemon think you'll be able to use that hand?
Good. You'll be ready for this, then. l thought a wolf was more appropriate for you than a bear so l had a new pommel made. lt's called Longclaw. Works as well for a wolf as a bear, l think.

lt was my father's sword, his father before him. The Mormonts have carried it for five centuries. lt was meant for my son Jorah. He brought dishonor to our House, but he had the grace to leave the sword before he fled from Westeros.
Oh, you can. And you will. l wouldn't be standing here if it wasn't for you and your beast. A bloody dead man tried to kill me, so you'll take it. l'll hear no more about it. ls that understood?
Right. Now, don't think this means l approve of this nonsense with you and Alliser Thorne. That's a man's sword. lt'll take a man to wield it.

No, you won't. l sent him to King's Landing yesterday. The hand that your wolf tore off that thing's wrist â€“ l've ordered Thorne to lay it at the feet of this boy king. That should get young Joffrey's attention. And it, uh, puts a thousand leagues between you and Thorne. Now go and put your sword somewhere safe and bring me my supper.

2.text: Wait outside.
Now!
Leave us.
What did you do?
What business is that of yours?
Wildlings serve crueler gods than you or I. Those boys are Craster's offerings.
Aye, many a time that monster has been the difference between life and death for our rangers, your uncle among them. We have other wars to fight out there. Like it or not, we need men like Craster.
Yeah. Whatever it was, I daresay you'll see it again. Now, ready my horse. We leave at dawn.
Don't lose it again.
He's not here yet. He'd have seen us, blown the horn.
The Halfhand does things in his own time.
Most of them are true.
The whole winter. He was north of the Skirling Pass when the snows came. Had to wait for the thaw.
Well, possible for the Halfhand.
Where?
How many wildlings have joined him?
You saying we should fall back to the Wall?
We need to get rid of those lookouts.
Aye. You killed a wight. You also let an old man beat you bloody and take your sword.
Well, I hope you make a better ranger than you do a steward. Go on.

3.text: Did you send the ravens?
Tarly, look at me. Did you send the ravens?

That was your job. Your only job. We need to get back to the Wall. It's a long march. We know what's out there, but we have to make it, have to warn them or before winter's done, everyone you've ever known will be dead.
What is this? Get up, Tarly. Is he all right?
That's enough. Tarly, I forbid you to die. Do you hear me?
Rast you're responsible for him.
Make sure he gets back alive. If he doesn't, you don't. Move on!
We've come a long way.
We can talk inside.
You are a godly man?
His name was Bannen. He was a good man, a good ranger. He came to us from-- where did he come from?
He came to us from White Harbor. Never failed in his duty. He kept his vows the best he could. He rode far, fought fiercely. We shall never see his like again.
And now his watch has ended.
(shakes his head)
I'm glad for you.
As soon as our wounded are strong enough.
Wait outside.
I told you to wait outside.
Enough! Out!
The gods will curse us for this. By all the laws--
Unhand her.
I shall have your head for this.

1.text: You can have my room.
Your first? You need a woman. Nothing like a woman after a fight.
Give me 10 good men and some climbing spikes... I'll impregnate the bitch.
I’ll stand for the dwarf.
No. He did.
Will you shut up? There's hill tribes all around here.
I should just take your food and leave you here.
You don't think I'd do it, do you?
Fair enough.
Tyrion. Tyrion. Tyrion.
You wouldn't know him.
l took her.
From, uh, Ser What's-his-name? l don't know. Ginger cunt, three tents down.
He said something.
Oh, well. l, uh, think l'll go and find myself one.
Drink.
There's a Braavosi knife game l could teach you.
Not if you win.
This sounds like a boring game.
But my mother hit harder.
lt was a woman. (Tyrion drinks. Shae looks at Bronn, surprised.) She swung an axe at me.
Work.
The whole shit-stained world could drink off that one.
Our lord here used to be married.
You hear lots of things playing dice with Lannister soldiers.
l'm guessing the lady and l can tell more unpleasant stories than your lordship.
For three chickens, l should hope so.
Well, l imagine that was the end of all that.
l would have killed the man who did that to me.
You're sleeping through the war.
They stole a night's march on us. They're a mile north.
You don't have a squire.
Stay low.
lf you're lucky, no one will notice you.
You're a shit warrior.
You're alive.
We wouldn't be having this conversation if we didn't.
Yeah, good.

2.text: Can't imagine why.
The lads will escort you. The streets aren't safe at night, my lord.
Boys?
Without question? No. I'd ask how much.
Oh, aye. And he has company. Filthy old stoat. Almost hate to interrupt.
No, I don't.
Careful, now. We don't want to get blood all over your pretty white cloak.
The little king's backed up. Clogged from balls to brains.
There's no cure for being a cunt. But the boy's at that age. And he's got nothing to do all day but pick wings off flies. Couldn't hurt to get some of the poison out.
It will be my pleasure.
There's that mind of yours you keep going on about.
Good thing. I'd be out of a job. What about your father?
Not after what he did to your birthday present.
He's talking about you.
People think you're pulling the king's strings. They blame you for the city's ills.
You don't need to convince me.
(scoffs)
If I could tell you how many crazy old men I've seen pushing carts around army camps making grand claims about jars full of pig shit. No offense meant.
To do what?
If you could get real soldiers to man the catapults, then maybe you'd hit your target one time in ten, but all the real soldiers are in the Riverlands with your father.

I don't know if you've ever seen a battle, old man, but things can get a bit messy. 'Cause when we're flinging things at Stannis, he's flinging them right back at us. Men die, men shit themselves, men run, which means pots falling, which means fire inside the walls, which means the poor cunts trying to defend the city end up burning it down.
Well, he's not living anymore. And all his pots of wildfire didn't help him, did they? Men win wars, not magic tricks.
This is a shit idea.
I like to keep me hands clean.
I don't want to wear a gold cloak.
A cloak slows you down in a fight. Makes it hard to move quietly. And the gold catches the light, so you're nice and easy to spot at night.
We had a deal and wearing a gold cloak wasn't part of it.
What?
(scoffs) You don't want me cleaning me nails. You don't want me looking your way. Why am I here?
And one of these explains how to beat him?
Chevalteesh. I'd swap all your books for a few good archers.
Me and the lads rounded up all the known thieves.
No. It's just the unknown thieves we need to worry about now.

Aye, we talked about it. Have you ever been in a city under siege? Maybe this part's not in your books. See, it's not the fighting that kills most people. It's the starving. Food's worth more than gold. Noble ladies sell their diamonds for a sack of potatoes. Things get bad enough, the poor start eating each other.
The thieves, they love a siege. Soon as the gates are sealed, they steal all the food. By the time it's all over, they're the richest men in town.
(nods)
We could throw books at his men.
We don't have that many men, either.
To the boys!
Drunk Lannisters.
Thank you very much.
Well, now let's see. First time, I was five. My mam smacked me with an iron poker.
It wasn't me she was aiming at. She was trying for my little brother. Now he was a real pest.
Second time, I was nine. Got in a scrap with a few older boys. They won. Third time
Eh, you don't want to know about the third time.
Don't feel sorry for him. He'll be halfway up your arse before the night's through.
Welcome, friends. This round's on me.
(whispering) I don't think he likes me.
I know it.
It's warm in here. We've got beautiful women and good brown ale. Plenty for everyone. And all you want is to put one of us in the cold ground with no women to keep us company.
And quicker. Eh?
Aye I expect he will someday.
One more drink before the war? Shall we?
The ships are in the bay.
I know what "in" means. Do you know how to use that?
I saw you kill a man with a shield. You'll be unstoppable with an ax.
Don't get killed.
Oh, are we friends now?
Enhances it, really.
Been spending time with fancy folks.

3.text: What if you took off that bit there?
Trouble is, I've never had much imagination.
I didn't hear that.
Back away. Keep backing away till you're outside this establishment. Then back away some more.
I will murder you, boy.
Oh, look at these two shining warriors. Ser Taryn Mant and... Ser Whosit of Whocares.
Ser Bronn of the Blackwater.
Pod.
That's exactly who I am. And you're a grub in fancy armor who's better at beating little girls than fighting men. Now, I have an appointment with Lord Tyrion.
As much as I appreciate a walk in the sunshine, your lordship, I am wondering why you sent for me.
I've been doing that for a while now.
I grow poor protecting you.
Briefly.
And now my pockets are empty. You've given me a taste for the finer things. And if you want me to carry on protecting you, you'll need to pay more.
We are. But I'm a sellsword. I sell my sword. I don't loan it out to friends as a favor.
Double.
I'm a knight now. Knights are worth double.
Which means you can afford it.
Come on, I'm here later. Come on.
Tonight, then. Looks like dull reading.
It's an opinion I share with some of the finest men I know.
Unless Lord Twatbeard made up a bunch of numbers to hide what he's really up to.
She's not bad with second-timers, either.
Pace yourself, lad.
Let me guess. He's not a magician.
He's stealing it?
What's wrong with that?
Seeing as it's his grandson's ass on the throne, I imagine he'll forgive that debt.
I've never borrowed money before. I'm not clear on the rules.
And what if I don't?
But what if I don't?
The lad's practically skipping.
He's a squire. You don't pay him.
Maybe they're trying to curry some favor with the new Master of Coin.
What did you tell them?
Of course they seemed to like it. They're paid to seem to like it.
What are you saying? These ladies enjoyed him so much, they gave him the time for free?
She's a foot taller than you.
What's the youngest you've ever had?
How much older?
You're a lord, she's a lady. And a beauty at that. I don't see the problem.
Shae is a whore. Are you gonna marry her? Eh? How did marrying a whore work out for you the first time?

You want Shae, keep her. Wed one and bed the other. All you have to do is get a son in the Stark girl. He'll be Lord of Winterfell one day. You can rule the North in his name. You'll have two women and a whole kingdom of your own.
You waste time trying to get people to love you, you'll end up the most popular dead man in town. (chuckles) You want to fuck that Stark girl. You just don't want to admit it.
You pay me to kill people who bother you. Evil notions come free.

4.text: How many Dornishmen does it take to fuck a goat?
Seems to me the smart place to meet travelers is in a tavern. That way, one party is late, the other party can drink some ale inside.
If he's so damned important, how come they sent you to meet him?
And just in case the Martells of Dorne are looking to spill some Lannister blood, it may as well be yours, eh?
Oh.
Yellow balls?
I need a sigil.
Some accomplished diplomacy that was. Now where?
How do you plan on finding a single Dornishman in a city this big?
I'd probably go to sleep, but I'm getting old.
It started that way, aye. Now I'm a knight.
Killed the right people, I suppose.
He tells me you shit gold just like your father.
There's this knight, Leygood, got thunderbolts on his shield.
Right here is where I fuck his wife. She's a screamer, that one. If they don't hear her, they won't hear us.
I've never seen Valyrian steel before. She's a beauty. The problem is, if you fight with an edged blade, I'll have to.
And if I fight with an edged blade, I'll have no one left to pay me.
Best time to attack a man.
Mind yourself. JAIME; If I still had my right hand...
Plan on growing it back?
All taken care of.
Aye, she's on it.
No one knows she's there but you, me, and Varys.
Because if someone follows me without an invitation, I'm the last person they ever follow.
She's gone. I know you don't want to believe it, but she is. Now, go drink till it feels like you did the right thing.
That was me knocking your ass to the dirt with your own hand.
You learned to fight like a good little boy. I'll bet that thrust through the MadKing's back was pretty as a picture. You want to fight pretty or you want to win?
All the time. He got used to it.
No. Oh, he hated the little twat, sure. But who didn't? And poison's not his style. Or murder, for that matter. You want to know for sure, why don't you ask him?
You haven't been to see him yet, eh?
Your brother ever tell you how I came into his service?

Aye. But only when Lady Arryn demanded the trial take place that day. You were his first choice. He named you for his champion because he knew you would ride day and night to come fight for him. You gonna fight for him now?
Compliments of Lord Tyrion. His axe from the Blackwater.
What are you waiting for, a kiss? Ready the lady's horse.
My lord.
Do you like 'em? Eh? Gloves are doeskin. Softer than a virgin's thighs.
I've been a bit busy.
My lonesome bachelor days are over. I'm to wed Lollys Stokeworth.
I wouldn't say I had a single sort of girl.
If I wanted wits, I'd marry you.
Falyse. Aye, I did know about the older sister.
Falyse is 40 and barren.
She does. Unless she happens to perish before her father. Then Lollys gets the castle.
What? Ladies fall from their horses and snap their pretty necks all the time.
You once said if anyone ever asked me to sell you out, you'd double their price.
One of each will do. But if you want me to kill the Mountain for you, it'd better be a damn big castle.
I have gold. What can I buy with gratitude?
Your sister's a Lannister, too.

If and may and could. It's bloody cold up north. Lollys is soft and warm. And close. If I gave you the choice between fucking Lollys and fighting the Mountain, you'd have your britches down and your cock out before I could blink.

I'd be a bloody fool if he didn't frighten me. He's freakish big and freakish strong. And quicker than you'd expect for a man of that size. Maybe I could take him, dance around until he's so tired of hacking at me, he dropped his sword, get him off his feet somehow. But one misstep... ...and I'm dead. Why should I risk it?
Aye, I'm your friend. And when have you ever risked your life for me?
I like you, pampered little shit that you are. I just like myself more.
I'm sorry it has to be this way.
We had some good days together.
What will you do?
I hope to hear them sing it one day.

5.text: Maybe I’ll come visit you sometime.
Don’t wait too long. I’ve a noble woman to marry back home.
Don't who?
They certainly do, my dear. They certainly do.
It's a fine place, isn't it? A fine place. I never thought I'd end up settling down in a place like this.
Pardon?
Oh.
You know what I think? I think you're a good person. And your sister is a mean person.
I've been all over the world. And if there's one thing I've learned, it's that meanness comes around. People like your sister, they always get what's coming to them eventually. One way or another.
Jaime fucking Lannister.
Ser Jaime.
I was very sorry to hear about your father.
Run along, love.
Just get on with it.
What you're here for. There's no way this little visit could possibly mean anything good for me.
Lollys will be marrying Ser Wyllis Bracken.
We made a deal, your sister and I.
How is this good for me?
Return from where?
Why are we on a merchant ship? Why no Lannister sails?
You ever been to Dorne?
I have. The Dornish are crazy. All they want to do is fight and fuck. Fuck and fight.

(Gets up, walking to his knife). There's nothing like a good fight to get you in the mood for fucking. (Pulls out his knife from the sandbag). And there's nothing like a fuck-mad Dornish girl to clear your head for the next fight. It's how the two work together. And we're gonna do a lot of fighting, I am sure. Well, I am. But I don't imagine we'll get to stick around for the rest. Not after we've kidnapped their princess.
(Incredulously) Your niece?
I've been doing this sort of thing a long time. I'm good at it. (Sits down).
I know. Why are you here? Why not send 40 of me, or an army? Unlike most folks, you actually got one.
That still doesn't explain why you're doing it.
(Gets up starts walking). If I'm putting something of a lit together, a one-handed man, (Grabs some rope and walks back), who happens to be one of the most recognizable faces in Westeros, is not -
(Sheaths his sword). You set your brother free, didn't you? I bet your sister didn't like that.
Well, if you ever see the little fucker, (Lays down), give him my regards.
Breakfast.
That would have been a shit way to die.
Aye. But your lot like to give the singers a good ending.
No? Two knights, off to rescue a princess. Sounds like a good song to me.
In my own keep, drinking my own wine, watching my sons grovel for my fortune.
I've had an exciting life. I want my death to be boring. How do you want to go?
She want the same thing?
The captain to that shipâ€¦ What was he, Braavosi?
And he's headed to Oldtown?
What's to stop him from docking down the coast and telling the locals that Jaime Lannister's in Dorne?
I'm not sure you understand how much people hate your family in this part of the world.
And I bet he swore all kinds of oaths to get it. But you won't be around if he breaks them.
How many you count?
How many you think you can take?
Fucked in the arse. (Both get up). Hiya! (The riders approach them). Morning, lads. Glad we found you.
Cooper. (Points to Jaime). This is Darnell.
Accent gave me away? Flea Bottom. Whelped and whipped.
Our ship capsized in the night. We managed to swim ashore. It was a near thing, really.
Dolphins maybe.
Boys, there's no need for this. Just, point us in the right direction. We'll find our way home.
That one should be slow enough.
Nice move! (Jaime turns to him).
You had a wonderful teacher.
Always wanted a Dornish stallion. Beasts can run a day and night without tiring. We'll ride to the Water Gardens with a nice breeze in our face.
Birds have to eat too.
Do you know how long it will take us to dig all those holes?

The Dornishman’s wife was as fair as the sun and her kisses were warmer than spring. The Dornishman’s blade it was made of black steel and its kiss was a terrible thing. The Dornishman’s wife would sing as she bathed in a voice that was sweet as a peach...
I’m coming to the best part.
This song really is all about the ending.
Once we got the princess, then what?
That explains the golden hand.
Well, she’s made herself at home.
Why don’t you let them have some time alone, son?
Let’s not do something stupid.
That was something stupid.
Oh for fuck’s sake.
You fight pretty good for a little girl.

Brothers oh brothers, my days here are done, the Dornishman’s taken my life. Bur what does it matter, for all men must die, and I’ve tasted the Dornishman’s wife! Yes I’ve tasted the Dornishman’s wife!
It’s against my code to hurt a woman.
I wouldn’t say you beat me.
Wonderful. Wouldn’t feel right to leave Dorne without a new scar.
No great hurry. Dornish women are the most beautiful women in the world.
I said Dornish women. I didn’t say you.
I’ve seen quite a few women in all the Seven Kingdoms.
Well now, in King’s Landing there was an absolutely gorgeous...
Was I?
Was there? My memory’s not what it was earlier.
You seem concerned with it. You must really like me.
My head… You don’t even wanna know what’s going on in…
It’s nothing. It’s the dry air.
You.
Am I going to be happy at the end of this walk?
The most beautiful woman in the world.
Only the one.
Prince. Sorry about the other day.
I’m glad to hear it. The pie looks good.

6.text: You don’t even have to do anything, do you?
You just sit there, a rich slab of beef, and all the birds come pecking.
She doesn’t want me. She wants your golden fingers up her twat.
They have their eyes on you, cunt.
Not blonde enough?
Maybe I’m not in the mood.
Fuck it.
No need to call me ser just because I’m an anointed knight.
Now, that is a sorry attempt at a siege. Someone needs to teach those sad twats how to dig trenches.
Oh, no. Not me. I’m just an upjumped sellsword.
Aye, knights don’t get paid.
That’s like saying I have a bigger cock than anyone in the Unsullied army.
You promised me a lordship and a castle and a highborn beauty for a wife.
Don’t say it. Don’t fucking say it.
Good thing we’re friends or we’d be fucking you in the ass right now.
Have your lads start digging perimeter trenches. Set pickets every hundred yards. And work double-time on those siege towers and trebuchets.
A parley or a fight?
You’ve got one hand. My money’s on the old boy.
Getting a bit old to be a squire, aren’t we?
Podrick fucking Payne. I thought you’d be dead by now.
Are they in there?
You think they’re fucking?
Why not? I’d fuck her. You’d fuck her, wouldn’t you?

Oh. Well, he’d fuck her, that’s for sure. And she’s fuck him, don’t you think? The way she looks at him. The way all women look at him is frankly irritating. I preferred working with the little brother on that account. Come on, you’re the one with the magic cock.
You must have shown it to her by now.
Is she? Oh.
Then how come an old cunt like me can still sneak up and murder you?
Now, that’s the truth, isn’t it? You want to learn that sort of fighting?
All right, let’s start with your footwork.
Show me your stance.
Now, listen to me, Pod. See how your feet are about a yard apart?
Lesson number one, assume everyone wants to hit you. ‘Cause they do, Pod. Everyone wants to hit a fucking squire. Do it again. Come on, don’t sulk.

7.text: You just won the biggest prize in the world. What could you possibly have to be upset about? Come on. You can tell me. Queen of Thorns give you one last prick in the balls before saying goodbye?
There is no more High Septon.
There is still the question of my prize.
It's not a castle.
How about that one? It's available.
I beg to differ.
Oh, is that why you're so fucking glum, eh? All your new riches weighing you down?
Right. Just not to me.
Yes, I'm sure Queen Cersei's reign will be quiet and peaceful.
Like what?
I'm not much for shoveling weight.
Come on. Your father's not here.
Men shit themselves when they die. Didn't they teach you that at fancy lad school?
Well, I learned it when I was 5.
Listen.
In line now!
Get back to King's Landing.
You're a commander, not a damned infantryman. These fuckers are about to swamp us.
Go get it then.
Where are you?
Come on you fucker.
What the fuck were you doing back there?
You saw the dragon between you and her?
And?
Listen to me, cunt. Till I get what I'm owed, a dragon doesn't get to kill you. You don't get to kill you. Only I get to kill you.
You're fucked.
No, I do not. Dragons are where our partnership ends. I'm not going to be around when those things start spitting fire on King's Landing.
Best well jump back in that river.
All the more reason for you to train. Unless you plan on fighting Dothraki 12 year olds.
And here I am ready to train.
I don't think you want people to see how you look swinging that thing yet.
Oh, you won't be swinging it at me.
I'll leave you to it.
Oil?
How many barrels?
Get 500 more.
I still enjoy it when they call me "my lord."
If we live that long. Men without cocks. You wouldn't find me fighting in an army if I had no cock. What's left to fight for?
I spent my life around soldiers. What do you think they spend that gold on?
Not without a cock, you don't.
Yet, your brother--
I think we're about to be the downtrodden.
Welcome, my lords. Your friends arrived before you did.
I've been sent to escort you all to the meeting.
Come on! You can suck his magic cock later.
I'm sure your new queen--
Don't you worry about me. I'm doing all right. Looking after myself.

I put yourself at risk. Important difference. It's your head Queen Cersei's offered a bag of gold for, it's not mine. Now, thanks to me, she's got two traitors' heads coming right through her door. She can lop them both off as soon as she gets tired of the clever words that pour out their pieholes. All thanks to Ser Bronn of the fucking Blackwater. If that's not looking after myself, I don't know what is.
Yeah, you, too.
Come on, Pod. Let's you and me go have a drink while the fancy folks talk, eh?

8.text: I am the only man you ever met who shot a dragon.
Nearly killed it.
All right, can we stop talking about the fucking dragons now?
You're kidding me.
Sorry, ladies. Another time perhaps.
Which girl?
She once gave me a castle and a wife, then rectified me right out of them.
So, she wants to murder someone, but she can't send her soldiers. If it's the Dragon Queen she's after-
Yeah, well, good luck with that.
That fucking family.
I knew you were fucking her. A pair of tall, blond toffs. Must be like looking in the mirror.
Oh, this? This is for you. For both of you.
You boys are a pair of gold-plated cunts. Do you know that?
Year after year, I've shoveled Lannister shit, - and what do I have to show?
Thanks to me. And that title's worth as much as a blond hair from your brother's ballsack.
Shut your mouth.
I've never hit a dwarf before, but say another word and I will belt you.
You couldn't do it on your best day, you one-handed fuck. And your best days are long gone.
I did not break your nose.

Because I've been breaking noses since I was your size, and I know what it sounds like. Now listen. Your sister offered me Riverrun. Nice big castle, good lands, plenty of peasants who do what they're told.

I knew your sister was dead the second I saw those dragons. Now, your army may be torn to shit, but I'd still bet on your Dragon Queen to win. And it just so happens I'm a betting man. If Cersei's dead, she can't pay up.
Mmm, that's good. Of course, the odds change if the Dragon Queen's Hand turns up dead. Maybe a few of her top generals get picked off one by one. All of a sudden -
Why not? Only death will shut you up.
If anyone offered me money to kill you, you'd pay me double. What's double Riverrun?
The way I see it, I only need one of the Lannister brothers alive.

No? Who were your ancestors, the ones who made your family rich? Fancy lads in silk? They were fucking cutthroats. That's how all the great houses started, isn't it? With a hard bastard who was good at killing people. Kill a few hundred people, they make you a lord. Kill a few thousand, they make you king. And then all your cocksucking grandsons can ruin the family with their cocksucking ways.
Highgarden. Give me your word.
Your Grace.
The farther away, the better.
Long may he reign.
In full, my lord Hand.
Indeed we can.
The Master of Coin looks forward to helping the Master of Ships, but first he has to ensure we're not wasting coin, or soon there won't be no more coin.
You Master of Grammar now too?
The strong live and the weak don't.
Oh, speaking of builders, all the best brothels burned down. The Master of Coin is willing to fund reconstruction.
Well, I imagine he isn't using them properly.
I think that's a very presumptuous statement.

1.text: When you imagine yourself up there, how do you look? Does the crown fit? Do all the lords and ladies simper and bow, the ones who sneered at you for years?
A man with great ambition and no morals… l wouldn't bet against you.
l must be one of the few men in this city who doesn't want to be King.
Oh, you can do better than that.
Have you? Do you spend a lot of time wondering what's between my legs?
l am flattered, of course, to be pictured at all.
Am l? That is good to know. Do you lie awake at night fearing my gash?
And l admire you, Lord Baelish. A grasper from a minor House with a major talent for befriending powerful men – and women.
So here we stand in mutual admiration and respect.
(Joffrey arrives, Varys bows) Serving a new King.
My king.
Lord Stark.
I was grievously sorry to hear of your troubles on the Kingsroad. We are all praying for Prince Joffrey's full recovery.
His Grace has many cares. He entrusts some small matters to us that we might lighten the load.
You are the King's Hand, Lord Stark, we serve at your pleasure.
Lady Stark.
To see you again after so many years is a blessing. Your poor hands.
Knowledge is my trade, my Lady. Did you bring the dagger with you, by any chance? My little birds are everywhere. Even in the north. They whisper to me the strangest stories. Valyrian steel.
I must admit I do not.
Dreadful.
The realm prospers from such events, my Lord. They give the great a chance at glory, and the lowly a respite from their woes.
How is your son, my Lord?
But his mind is sound?
A blessing then. I suffered an early mutilation myself. Some doors close forever... others open in the most unexpected places. May I?

If the wrong ears heard what I'm about to tell you, off comes my head. And who would mourn poor Varys then? North or South, they sing no songs for spiders. But there are things you must know. You are the King's Hand and the King is a fool... your friend, I know, but a fool... and doomed unless you save him.
I didn't trust you.
The Queen is not the only one who has been watching you closely. There are few men of honor in the capital. You are one of them. I would like to believe I am another, strange as that may seem.
The same sort as Jon Arryn. The tears of Lys, they call it. A rare and costly thing, as clear and tasteless as water. It leaves no trace.
Some dear friend, no doubt. But which one? There were many. Lord Arryn was a kind and trusting man. There was one boy... all he was he owed to Jon Arryn.
Pity what happened to him, just when his life seemed to be going so nicely.
Someone who could afford it.
He started asking questions.
He's found one bastard already. He has the book. The rest will come.
The gods alone know. The fools tried to kill his son. What's worse, they botched it. The wolf and the lion will be at each other's throats. We will be at war soon, my friend.
This Hand is not the other.
"Delay," you say. "Move fast, " I reply. This is no longer a game for two players.
The first to arrive and the last to leave. I admire your industry.
We all have our qualities.
I think you're mistaking business with pleasure.
Oh, I'm sure. Lord Redwyne likes his boys very young, I hear.
Though I suppose beauty is a subjective quality, no? Is it true that Ser Marlon of Tumblestone prefers amputees?

And I heard the most awful rumor about a certain lord with a taste for fresh cadavers. Must be enormously difficult to accommodate that inclination. The logistics alone... to find beautiful corpses before they rot.
Strictly speaking.
Do you know, I have no idea where they are? And we had been so close. But enough about me. How have you been since we last saw each other?
Now the last time I saw you, you were talking to the Hand of the King.
Eyes I own.

Everyone's well aware of your enduring fondness for Lord Stark's wife. If the Lannisters were behind the attempt on the Stark boy's life and it was discovered that you helped the Starks come to that conclusion... To think... A simple word to the Queen...
Oh.
Have you?
Was that you under the bed?
Oh, please.
Disturbing news from far away. Haven't you heard?
No rumor, my Lord. The princess is with child.
Ser Jorah Mormont. He is serving as adviser to the Targaryens.

I understand your misgivings, my Lord. Truly, I do. It is a terrible thing we must consider, a vile thing. Yet, we who presume to rule must sometimes do vile things for the good of the realm. Should the gods grant Daenerys a son, the realm will bleed.
I wonder, Ser Barristan, who gave the king this wine?
Such a dutiful boy to make sure his Grace did not lack refreshment.
I'm afraid those birds have flown.
I fear Lord Renly has left the city.
Lord Stark, you must be thirsty.
I promise you it isn't poisoned.
The younger one seems to have escaped the castle.
Still engaged to Joffrey.
And would again, My Lord.
Ah, the children. It is always the innocents who suffer.
The wrong brother sadly.
Not today, My Lord.
The Realm, My Lord.
Your father has proved to be an awful traitor, dear.
We have nothing but gratitude for your long service, good Ser.
A child's faith Such sweet innocence.
You've seen better days, my lord.
No, no, many still love you. Sansa came to court this morning to plead for your life.
You do me wrong, my lord. Your blood is the last thing l want.

When l was still a boy - before they cut my balls off with a hot knife - l traveled with a group of actors through the free cities. They taught me that each man has a role to play. The same is true at court. l am the master of whisperers. My role is to be sly, obsequious and without scruples. l'm a good actor, my lord.
l could. But will l? No. As l said, I'm no hero.
Peace. Did you know that your son is marching south with an army of Northmen? Loyal lad. Fighting for his father's freedom.

Boys have been conquerors before. But the man giving Cersei sleepless nights is the king's the late king's brother. Lord Stannis has the best claim to the throne. He is a proven battle commander and he is utterly without mercy.
Sansa pleaded so sweetly for your life. lt would be a shame to throw it away. Cersei is no fool. She knows a tame wolf is more use to her than a dead one.

l want you to serve the realm! Tell the queen you will confess your vile treason, tell your son to lay down his sword and proclaim Joffrey as the true heir. Cersei knows you as a man of honor. lf you give her the peace she needs, and promise to carry her secret to your grave, l believe she will allow you to take the black and live out your days on the Wall with your brother and your bastard son.
Pity. Such a pity. What of your daughter's life, my lord? ls that a precious thing to you?

2.text: The peasants say, a long summer means an even longer winter.
Your father has named Lord Tyrion to serve as Hand in his stead while he fights -
My Lord, may the Old Gods watch over your brother and all our northern sons.

The walls of my Holdfast will not stand the winter. The stones were last mortared in the time of King Aerys, and I'm afraid the masons today are not fit to carry their fathers' hammers. When I was a boy, I remember seeing them put up a new tower at Torrhen's Square in a summer. Men worked back then. Today, my Holdfast looks like it was built by drunk children. At night you can hear the wind howling through the gaps. And the Gods forbid it rains. Why, I might as well sleep beneath a waterfall.
Generally, yes, but I've sent all the young men off to fight Robb Stark's war.
Maybe not, My Lord, but he called in his Banners, and took the men.
Of course I remember!
I - I believe it will.
No need for that, my dear.
I'm not like most men.
(laughs)
I would like you to tell me if working for Lord Baelish has been all you'd hoped it would be.
You wouldn't remember me if we had?
And I think you remember all of them. I think your true talents are wasted on them.
You're afraid. Why? Nothing dangerous down there.
And, unlike your current employer, I protect those who work for me. I don't abuse them to satisfy royal whims or force them to abuse each other.
I thought you said you knew who I was.
Littlefinger looks at you and sees a collection of profitable holes. I see a potential partner.
Oh, you should be. He's a dangerous man. But everyone has their weaknesses. Your current employer hides his very well, but not as well as he thinks.
Why would I lie about it?
Where before there was nothing but love. Ser Mandon Moore tried to kill you on your sister's orders. If it weren't for your squire's bravery, you'd be a dead man.
I'm afraid your friend has been relieved of his command of the City Watch. The gold cloaks are now firmly in the hands of your father or your sister. It varies from cloak to cloak.
Have gone home. Your father paid them quite handsomely. I'm afraid we won't be seeing each other for some time, my lord.
We are. Podrick, would you mind?
There are many who know that without you this city faced certain defeat. The king won't give you any honors, the histories won't mention you, but we will not forget.
Come along now, Podrick.
Your father has named Lord Tyrion to (Cersei scoffs) serve as hand in his stead.
My lord.
We were just speaking of your bravery in the victory against the Stark auxiliary forces.
I heard you suffered a terrible head wound. The northerners are such fearsome warriors.
To find so lovely creature working in your father's kitchen. It almost beggars belief.
How can you tell?

I am glad your new friend was able to accompany you to the capital. Friends are such an important part of life. Unfortunate that your father didn't want her to come. But rest easy my lord, I am very good at keeping secrets for my good friends.

How unspeakable of me to go on and on, when all you want to do is rest. I will leave you. (Kisses Shae’s hand). Welcome to Kings Landing, my dear. The city is made brighter by your presence. We have a council meeting, my lord.
Who threatened you?
Ned Stark was a man of honor.
You might be disappointed in the results. The storms come and go. The big fish eat the little fish. And I keep on paddling. Come, my lord. We shouldn't keep the queen waiting.
Trouble with the wildlings?
Somewhat less wild these days. It seems they've stopped killing each other and started following this King-Beyond-the-Wall.
How do you kill a dead man?
Ooh. "The Queen mustn't know." I love conversations that begin this way.
Theon Greyjoy? Forgive me, my lord, but how? He grew up a ward of Winterfell. He fights for Robb Stark.
You'll be pleased to know our mutual friend is doing quite well in Lady Sansa's service.
And it seems the Grand Maester has found his way into a black cell? Well played, My Lord Hand. But should I be worried? Janos Slynt, Pycelle. The Small Council grows smaller every day.
Power is a curious thing, my lord. Are you fond of riddles?
Three great men sit in a room. A king, a priest and a rich man. Between them stands a common sellsword. Each great man bids the sellsword kill the other two. Who lives, who dies?
Does it? He has neither crown nor gold nor favor with the gods.
But if it's swordsmen who rule, why do we pretend kings hold all the power? When Ned Stark lost his head, who was truly responsible? Joffrey? The executioner? Or something else?
Power resides where men believe it resides. It's a trick, a shadow on the wall. And a very small man can cast a very large shadow.
My Lord Hand. Commander. I must compliment you on the gold cloaks' performance these last few weeks. Did you know there has been a marked drop in thievery?
Given the circumstances, my lord, I believe extreme measures are warranted.
Ah. "The Great Sieges of Westeros." Thrilling subject. Shame Archmaester Ch'Vyalthan wasn't a better writer.
And if Stannis does attack the Mud Gate, what is our plan?
We don't have that many books.
What do we have?
No man can be in all rooms at all times. I have many little birds in the North, my lord, but I haven't heard their songs since Theon Greyjoy captured Winterfell.
I am trying.
Oh, no one disputes that, my lord, not even the multitudes who despise you.
I wish we could, too.
If we're going to play, you'll have to start.
A most highborn plumber.
You're quite good at being Hand, you know? Jon Arryn and Ned Stark were good men. Honorable men. But they disdained the game and those who played. - You enjoy the game.
And you play it well.
They say he burns his enemies alive to honor the Lord of Light.
In the Summer Isles, they worship a fertility goddess with 16 teats.
This morning, I heard a song all the way from Qarth beyond the Red Waste. Daenerys Targaryen lives.
She has three dragons. But even if what they say is true, it'll be years before they are fully grown. And then there will be nowhere to hide.
I've always hated the bells. They ring for horror. A dead king, a city under siege.
Exactly. Podrick, is that it?
I'm not entirely sure what you're suggesting.
Do you trust him?
Good.
The map you asked for.
Closer to 50. The Targaryens built this city to withstand a siege and to provide escape if necessary.
That is good to hear. Though I'm sure many captains say the same while their ship is afloat. You look well suited for battle, my lord.
For all our sakes, I hope you are wrong. My little birds tell me that Stannis Baratheon has taken up with a red priestess from Asshai.
You don't believe in the old powers, my lord?
I think you believe in what you see and in what those you trust have seen. You probably don't entirely trust me.
And yet I have seen things and heard things, things you have not, things I wish I had not. I don't believe I've ever told you how I was cut.

One day, I will. The dark arts have provided Lord Stannis with his armies and paved his path to our door. For a man in service to such powers to sit on the Iron Throne, I can think of nothing worse. And tonight, I believe you are the only man who can stop him.

3.text: Your Grace, Lady Sansa is your aunt by marriage.
When did you come to this strange country?
You were only a child.
You've been a good influence on our mutual friend, you know. He used to drink from sundown to sunup, visit three brothels a night, gamble away his father's money. Now it's just the drinking.
She is a sweet young thing. None of this is her fault.
No, I expect not.

We break bread with them, but that doesn't make us family. We've learned their language, but we'll never be their countrymen. If you let yourself believe that a foreign girl with no name could spend her life with the son of Tywin Lannister--
You have one name. As do I. Here only the family name matters.

Diamonds. I'd tell you to beware carrying so much wealth, but you know how to protect yourself. Get on one of those ships. Sail to Pentos or Lys or Myr. You can buy a house with these diamonds, a very large house. Hire servants. Start a new life, a good life, far from here. The mysterious foreign beauty. You'll have suitors lining up.

Tyrion Lannister is one of the few people alive who could make this country a better place. He has the mind for it, he has the will, he has the right last name. And you-- you are a complication. I know you love him. And I know it's true love not bought by gold and silver. I'm not asking you to leave him for money. I'm asking you to leave because your presence in the capital endangers him. This will never be your home, my lady. Find a true home somewhere far from here while there's still time.
We are trying, my lord.

Robb Stark and most of his bannermen are in Riverrun for the funeral of his grandfather Lord Hoster Tully. In Stark's absence, Roose Bolton holds Harrenhal, which would seem to make him Lord of Harrenhal, in practice if not in name.
Oh, Lord Tyrion. Come in, come in.
Oh, always in confidence.
Oh, no. It's a wonderful time.
End your life?
Proof? Will there be a trial?
I have no proof, only whispers. Before all this nastiness, I was going to tell you the story of how I was cut. Do you want to hear it still?

As a boy, I travelled with a troupe of actors through the Free Cities. One day in Myr, a certain man made my master an offer too tempting to refuse. I feared the man meant to use me as I'd heard some men used small boys. But what he wanted was far worse. He gave me a potion that made me powerless to move or speak, yet did nothing to dull my senses. With a hooked blade he sliced me, root and stem, chanting all the while. He burned my parts in a brazier. The flames turned blue and I heard a voice answer his call. I still dream of that night. Not of the sorcerer, not of his blade. I dream of the voice from the flames. Was it a god? A demon? A conjuror's trick? I don't know. But the sorcerer called and a voice answered. And ever since that day, I have hated magic and all those who practice it. But you can see why I was eager to aid in your fight against Stannis and his Red Priestess. A symbolic revenge of sorts.
You do not possess at the moment.

But influence is largely a matter of patience, I have found. Once I had served the sorcerer's purpose, he threw me out of his house to die. I resolved to live to spite him. I begged. I sold what parts of my body remained to me. I became an excellent thief and soon learned that the contents of a man's letters are more valuable than the contents of his purse. Step by step, one distasteful task after another, I made my way from the slums of Myr to the small council chamber. Influence grows like a weed. I tended mine patiently until its tendrils reached from the Red Keep all the way across to the far side of the world where I managed to wrap them around something very special.
Hello, my old friend. It's been a long time. I have no doubt the revenge you want will be yours in time if you have the stomach for it.
Is he very large?
Extraordinary.
We're talking about the same Podrick? The quiet boy in Lord Tyrion's service? Seems a bit simple?
What did he do to them?
So what did they say?
Huh. Prodigies appear in the oddest of places. And what did Littlefinger say about this loss of income?
Ah, yes, to pursue his enduring love of the Lady Arryn and the title that comes with her. Sad, really. Is that all it takes to make our friend lose interest in poor Sansa Stark?
What makes you say so?
Ah. You can read. Rare for a woman in your profession.
Of course. I'm missing something obvious you're about to point out?
Who is important enough to Littlefinger to merit a featherbed besides Littlefinger? Could he be bringing one of his girls?
How do you know?
Prodigies in odd places indeed.
My lady. I wanted to personally welcome you to King's Landing. The city has been made brighter by your presence.
A little obvious, perhaps.
Might I sit?
You've taken an interest in Sansa Stark.
Is she?
She has, sadly. Well, forgive me for wasting your time, then. I thought we shared certain hopes for her well-being.
I choose my allies carefully and my enemies more carefully still.
Neither. A babe in the woods. I admired her father.
I could not help Lord Stark. Perhaps I can help his daughter.
You're not the only one who has taken an interest in her.
Indeed. She'd make a lovely match for the right suitor.
Littlefinger is not long for the capital. A confidant of mine has told me that when he goes, Sansa Stark goes with him.
Littlefinger was born with no lands, no wealth, no armies. He has acquired the first two. How long before he has the army?
Perhaps you'll laugh, but I know him better than most and this is the truth. Littlefinger is one of the most dangerous men in Westeros. If Robb Stark falls, Sansa Stark is the key to the North.
Which seems such a shame. Why should a man with such a low reputation steal away such a lovely bride?
Actually, I rather enjoy him. But he would see this country burn if he could be king of the ashes.
You are too kind. I believe I have a possible solution.
1000 blades taken from the hands of Aegon's fallen enemies, forged in the fiery breath of Balerion the Dread.
Ha, I'm sure you have. Ugly old thing. Yet it has a certain appeal. The Lysa Arryn of chairs. Shame you had to settle for your second choice.
Thwarting you has never been my primary ambition, I promise you. Although who doesn't like to see their friends fail now and then?
I did what I did for the good of the realm.
But what do we have left once we abandon the lie? Chaos. A gaping pit waiting to swallow us all.

4.text: What have you done? Quickly. Trust me, my friend, I’ve brought you this far.
I'm afraid foreigners aren't welcome at such exclusive affairs.
Ahem.
Shae has been noticed. Sansa's maid saw you with her. She already told your sister. It's only a matter of time before your father hears.

No, I will not. How long do you imagine your father and sister would let me live if they suspected me of lying? I have no pet sellsword to protect me. No legendary brother to avenge me. Only little birds who whisper in my ear.
No one weeps for spiders or whores. I have friends across the sea who could help her.
Your father has promised to hang the next whore he finds you with. Have you ever known your father to make an idle threat?
Your Grace.
Sandor Clegane has been spotted in the Riverlands, my lord.
My birds tell me the Hound slaughtered five of our soldiers. I believe the phrase "fuck the king" was uttered.
10 silver stags seems a generous bounty.
More whispers from the east, my lord.
Daenerys has taken up residence in Meereen. She has conquered the city and rules as its queen.

She commands an army of Unsullied, my queen. Some 8,000 strong. She has a company of sellswords-- the Second Sons. She has two knights advising her-- Jorah Mormont and Barristan Selmy. And she has three dragons.
No longer. He appears to be fully devoted to her. As for Ser Barristan, it would seem he took his dismissal from the Kingsguard a bit harder than anticipated.
A child with two seasoned warriors counseling her and a powerful army at her back, Your Grace.
Most certainly, my Lord Hand.
Prince Oberyn.
Only Varys. I'm not actually a nobleman. No one is under obligation to call me lord.
You seem quite knowledgeable about the Unsullied. Did you spend much time in Essos?
May I ask why?
Most of us aren't princes.
I have an ear for accents. I've lost my accent entirely.
It's a long story.
People I trust.
(shakes his head)
Not at all. But I was never interested in girls, either.
Nothing.
Not me. When I see what desire does to people, what it's done to this country, I am very glad to have no part in it. Besides, the absence of desire leaves one free to pursue other things.
I'm afraid I do, my lord. He said, "Perhaps you should speak more softly to me, then. Monsters are dangerous and just now kings are dying like flies."
Yes. After we received word of Robb Stark's death. He didn't seem gladdened by the news. Perhaps his marriage to Sansa Stark had made him more sympathetic to the northern cause.
Sadly, my lord, I never forget a thing.

5.text: Apologies.
I saved your life. If they catch you, they catch me. I cannot say I feel overly guilty about leaving you in that “fucking crate”.
No. I only know what it’s like to pick up your shit and throw it overboard.

The home of my colleague. Ilyrio Mopatis. A merchant. He and I met many years ago, through mutual friends. A group of people who saw Robert Baratheon for the disaster he was. We tried to do what was best for the realm by supporting the Targaryen restoration. And thus began the chain of mistakes that has led us both here. Things have gotten worse, not better. Westeros needs to be saved from itself.
My lord?
You already drank yourself across the Narrow Sea.
Because we are talking about the future of our country.
Imp, half-man.
There are faster ways to kill yourself.
You are many things, my friend, but not a coward.
Your brother asked me to.
Refuse the Kingslayer? A dangerous proposition.
I didn’t do it for you. I did it for the Seven Kingdoms.
I don’t believe in saviors. I believe men of talent have a role to play in the war to come.
You have many admirable qualities, self-pity is not one of them. Any fool with a bit of luck can find himself born into power. But earning it for yourself, that takes work.
I think you are. You have your father’s instinct for politics, and you have compassion.
I never said you were perfect.
Peace. Prosperity. A land where the powerful do not prey on the powerless.
Perhaps. And perhaps we’ve grown so used to horror we assume there’s no other way. If you sat on the Iron Throne, would you spread misery throughout the land?

No, you won’t. But you could help another climb those steps and take that seat. The Seven Kingdoms need someone stronger than Tommen, but gentler than Stannis. A monarch who can intimidate the high lord and inspire the people. A ruler loved by millions with a powerful army and the right family name.

Who said anything about him? You have a choice my friend. You can stay here at Ilyrio’s palace and drink yourself to death, or you can ride with me to Mereen, meet Daenerys Targaryen, and decide if the world is worth fighting for.
I thought we were so happy together until you abandoned me.
The birds sing in the west, the birds sing in the east. If one knows how to listen. They tell me you’ve already found favor with the Mother of Dragons.
Information is the key. You need to learn your enemies’ strengths and strategies. You need to learn which of your friends are not your friends.
If only. (beat) A grand old city, choking on violence, corruption, and deceit. Who could possibly have any experience managing such a massive, ungainly beast?
Oh, I know.
Yes, best be careful. You might accidentally consume some solid food.
You don't like it?
You can't. Cersei has offered a lordship to the man who brings her your head.
Are we really going to spend the entire road to Volantis talking about the futility of everything?
The road to Meereen.
I told you. A ruler.
You were quite good, you know. At ruling. During your brief tenure as Hand.
Still, a man of talent.
Yes, but showed great promise in other areas as well.
Why?
People follow leaders. And they will never follow us. They find us repulsive.

And we find them repulsive, which is why we surround ourselves with large, comfortable boxes to keep them away. And yet, no matter what we do, people like you and me are never really satisfied inside the box. Not for long.
No.
Volantis is a large city.
The likelihood of you being spotted here increases a hundredfold.
I'm not sure how many new ways I can find of saying this.
It's a perfectly good face.
If anyone recognizes you, you'll lose more than that.

Yes. The Volantene masters are very organized. (Shot of a man with a fly tattooed onto his cheek). Flies for dung shovelers. (Shot of a man with a hammer tattooed onto his cheek). Hammers for builders. (Shot of a man inspecting women with tears tattooed onto their cheeks). Tears for whores. Lest they forget.
(Aside) We should keep moving.
Thank you.
Someone who inspires priests and whores is worth taking seriously.
Where're you going?

6.text: You walk like a rich person.
You walk as though the paving stones were your personal property. I used to steal from people like you when I was a boy.
She thinks you want to eat her baby.
Mhysa means mother in Valyrian.
Who wrote it?
The Sons of the Harpy?
She did fly away on a dragon and not come back.
The Sons of the Harpy planned their attack in the fighting pits very carefully, which means they take orders from someone.
My little birds have already taken wing. Soon they’ll return, singing songs of men in gold masks.
Fire and blood.
I do not make dwarf jokes.
So, the fleet. It’s been burned.
Astapor and Yunkai have stopped asking us for aid.
The Masters have retaken both cities. Outside of Meereen, the whole of Slaver’s Bay has returned to the slavers.
Do they know that?
If we could have the room.
You look lovely today, my dear. You really do. How you climbed all those steps without breaking a sweat.
I am not a torturer.
Though it so often is what people deserve.

And it does provide answers. But they’re usually the wrong answers. My job is to find the right answers. Do you know how I do that? I do it by making people happy. I’d like to make you happy, Vala. That’s your name, isn’t it, Vala?

That’s all right. I know who you are and what you’ve done. You’ve done a lot. You’ve sacrificed your body for a cause, which is more than most people do. And you’ve helped the Sons of the Harpy murder the Unsullied and the Second Sons.

I understand. Well, that makes perfect sense from your perspective. I have a different perspective, of course. I think it’s important that you try to see things from my perspective just as I will try to see them from yours. Because that is the only way that I can make you and Dom happy. That is how you pronounce it -- Dom? I’m afraid I don’t really speak the language. Such a handsome boy. Those big, brown eyes. Good luck keeping the ladies away.

Children are blameless. I have never hurt them. Your boy is in no immediate danger, this I swear to you. But between us, dear, you did conspire to kill the queen’s soldiers. We both know the penalty for that crime. How will poor Dom get on without his mother? And with his breathing problem.

Yes, from your perspective, this is a problem. There is a third option, though. A ship leaving tomorrow for Pentos. I’ve already booked passage for a woman and her young son. I’ll even throw in a bag of silver to help you start again.
Though I’m afraid we’ll have to ask one of our leather-clad friends back in to carry it. Far too heavy for me. The boat sails at dawn. You need to decide now. A new life for you and Dom or…
Sorry. I was busy learning who funds the Sons of the Harpy. Some things you can’t rush.
The good masters of Astapor. And the wise masters of Yunkai. With help from their friends in Volantis.
Of course. Man can be fickle, but birds always trust.
In the last fortnight since our pact with the Masters, how many killings have been carried out by the Sons of the Harpy?
And how many Masters have been butchered by the free men.
So it’s safe to say that a fragile peace has taken hold.
For now is the best we get in our profession.
Considering the city was on the brink of civil war, I’d say it’s a good start.
Sounds like quite the hero. Where would we find him?

A man named Stannis Baratheon was anointed as the chosen one by one of your priestesses. He, too, had a glorious destiny. He attacked King’s Landing and was soundly defeated by the man standing beside me. Last I had heard, he’d been defeated again, this time at Winterfell and this time for good.
I suppose it’s hard for a fanatic to admit a mistake. Isn’t that the whole point of being a fanatic? You’re always right. Everything is the Lord’s will.
And you, an honest servant of the lord, why should I trust you to know any more than the priestess who counseled Stannis?
Would you?
You made a pact with fanatics.
If you shaved your beard with a straight razor, you’d say the razor worked. That doesn’t mean it won’t cut your throat.
I know.
If I don’t return, you’ll know I was wrong.
We need friends in Westeros. And we need ships.
She’ll come back. She has to. My heart’s been broken too many times already.
I’ll walk the rest of the way myself. I can’t go off on a secret mission in the company of the most famous dwarf in the city.

7.text: I remember that storm. All the dogs in King's Landing howled through the night.
Cersei controls fewer than half the Seven Kingdoms. The lord of Westeros despise her. Even before your arrival, they plotted against her. Now...
They joined our side, my queen, because they believe in you.
I did.
I had a choice, Your Grace--serve Robert Baratheon or face the headman's axe.
Robert was an improvement on your father, to be sure. There have been few rulers in history as cruel as the Mad King. Robert was neither mad nor cruel. He simply had no interest in being king.
Until your marriage to Khal Drogo, Your Grace, I knew nothing about you, save your existence and that you were said to be beautiful.
Which you turned to your advantage.
King Robert.
Your Grace, I did what had to be done to--

The kind the realm needs. Incompetence should not be rewarded with blind loyalty. As long as I have my eyes, I'll use them. I wasn't born into a great house. I came from nothing. I was sold as a slave and carved up as an offering. When I was a child, I lived in alleys, gutters, abandoned houses. You wish to know where my true loyalties lie? Not with any king or queen, but with the people. The people who suffer under despots and prosper under just rule. The people whose hearts you aim to win. If you demand blind allegiance, I respect your wishes. Grey Worm can behead me or your dragons can devour me. But if you let me live, I will serve you well. I will dedicate myself to seeing you on the Iron Throne because I choose you. Because I know the people have no better chance than you.
I swear it, my queen.
I would expect nothing less from the Mother of Dragons.
She once served another who wanted the Iron Throne. It didn't end well for Stannis Baratheon, did it?
And why do you think the Lord of Light singled out this Jon Snow aside from the visions you've seen in the flames, that is?
I wondered why you weren't there to meet our guests. You begged us to summon the King in the North. Don't you want to see him again?
Strange. You spoke so highly of Jon Snow but when he arrives you hide on a cliff. I didn't take you for a bashful girl.
Oh, I doubt that. Give us common folk one taste of power we're like the lion who tasted man. Nothing is ever so sweet again.
Why?
So where will you go?
Good. If you don't mind my saying, I don't think you should return to Westeros. I'm not sure you'd be safe here.
My Lady --
Our Iron Born and Dornish allies were attacked on route to Dorne.
Two or three ships escaped. The rest sunk our captured. Ellaria and the sand snakes dead or captured. The Greyjoys are dead or captured.
Your Grace, he's already destroyed a good portion of our fleet. To send our remaining ships after him --
The Unsullied will be there soon.
A difficult situation. They know we're coming.
Not burn him alive alongside his son.
That's what I used to tell myself about her father. I found the traitors but I wasn't the one burning them alive. I was only a purveyor of information.

It's what I told myself when I watched them beg for mercy, "I'm not the one doing it." As the pitch of their screams rose higher, "I'm not the one doing it." When their hair caught fire and the smell of the burning flesh filled the Thone Room, "I'm not the one doing it."
And she never will be... with the right counsel. You need to find a way to make her listen.
Jon Snow.
It's a sealed scroll for the King in the North.
Nothing good.
The Wall has kept them out for thousands of years. Presumably --
Anything you bring back will be useless unless Cersei grants us an audience and is somehow convinced not to murder us the moment we set foot in the capital.
Fair point. How do you propose to find one?
And that would be double what now, exactly?

8.text: You take great offense at dwarf jokes, but love telling eunuch jokes. Why is that?
The Karstarks.
You overestimate our influence. Jon and Daenerys don't want to listen to lonely old men.
Of course she does. Respect is how the young keep us at a distance, so we don't remind them of an unpleasant truth.
Nothing lasts.
And the Golden Company has arrived in King's Landing, courtesy of the Greyjoy fleet. The balance has grown distressingly even.
Thankfully, she's losing allies by the day. Yara Greyjoy has retaken the Iron Islands in her queen's name. The new Prince of Dorne pledges his support.
How many others know?
Well, then it's not a secret anymore. It's information. If a handful of people know now, hundreds will know soon. Then what happens?
No, it's worse than that. He has the better claim to the throne.
I'm not sure it matters what he wants. The fact is, people are drawn to him. Wildlings, Northmen. He's a war hero.
She's his aunt.

No, but Jon grew up in Winterfell. Is marrying your aunt common in the North? You know our queen better than I do. Do you think she wants to share the throne? She does not like to have her authority questioned.
I worry about her state of mind.
Your Grace. I promised you I would look you in the eye and speak directly if I ever thought you were making a mistake. This is a mistake.
(nods)

Cersei needs to be destroyed, but if we attack King's Landing with Drogon and the Unsullied and the Dothraki, tens of thousands of innocents will die. That is why Cersei is bringing them into the Red Keep. These are the people you came here to protect. I beg you, Your Grace. Do not destroy the city you came to save. Do not become what you have always struggled to defeat.
I've served tyrants most of my life. They all talk about destiny.
Perhaps that's the problem. Her life has convinced her that she was sent here to save us all.
Then there's the problem of Jon Snow. Perhaps it's actually a solution. You know them both. Tell me, who do you think would make a better ruler?
Have you considered the best ruler might be someone who doesn't want to rule?
Don't pretend you haven't thought about it.
He's temperate and measured. He's a man, which makes him more appealing to the lords of Westeros, whose support we are going to need.
And he's the heir to the throne. Yes, because he's a man. Cocks are important, I'm afraid.
She's too strong for him. She'd bend him to her will, as she already has.
As you have? You're drinking quite a lot. A Targaryen father and a Stark mother. Jon's the one man alive who might actually be able to keep the North in the Seven Kingdoms.
You've always known my reasons.
Even if you know it's a mistake?
You know where my loyalty stands. You know I will never betray the realm.

Millions of people, many of whom will die if the wrong person sits on that throne. We don't know their names, but they're just as real as you and I. They deserve to live. They deserve food for their children. I will act in their interest, no matter the personal cost.
I've spoken as honestly as I can. Each of us has a choice to make. I pray we choose wisely.

1.text: Hand of the King?
And your father said you couldn't take anyone with you to King's Landing?
He knew my name?
He said, "Don't bring Shae with you to King's Landing"?
Are you ashamed of me? Are you afraid that l'm dancing around the court with my tits out?
I’m funny now? l'm Shae, the funny whore.
l know what a Hand needs.
ls that why l'm here? So we can talk about our mothers?
Foreign.
What do you want from me?
And what do l get?
Who told you this? Women you paid?
Let's start with your last night in this world.
Are you in agony, my lion?
You look like you're in agony. The fire is burning your pretty soft skin.
Just used to it.
What are you good at?
l don't want to play this game.
What brought you up there?
l don't want to play.
Drink.
Drink.
Drink!
Drink.
Drink! And don't talk about my mother and father ever, or l will carve your eyes from your head.
My turn.
Who were you in love with?
l don't care the way the game works.
Married?
Not another night. This night.
Oh, maybe l will cry.
You should have known she was a whore.
A girl who was almost raped doesn't invite another man into her bed two hours later.
You are still young and stupid.
You'll be dead. How will you know?

2.text: This city stinks Like dead bodies.
And shit.
I love it.
And cum and garlic and rum.
I love the stink. I love the noise. Cities make me want to fuck.
This is where I belong.
No one will know.
What about you?
Truth? (Laughs) You are the biggest little liar I have ever met.
My love.
Good of me? Of course I come.
I want to see you.
Have you looked?
I will be the first.
You are a mess.
You think I'm here for money?
Oh. I'm a poor little rich man and nobody loves me, so I make jokes all the time and pay them to laugh. Fuck your money. Let's leave.
Leave King's Landing. They tried to kill you. They will try again. Going into wars, fighting soldiers, you're terrible at this. Let's take a boat to Pentos and never come back. You don't belong here.
Eat, drink, fuck, live.
So do it. Your father, your sister, all these bad people, they can't stop you. Forget about them. Come with me.
You have a shit memory. I am yours and you are mine.
You make me wait a long time, but your friend keeps me company.
And I tell him the story of how we meet.
I don't think Lord Varys likes fish pie.
I can always tell.
You won't let me leave this room. You won't let me -
Why? You think your father can hear me? He's 300 miles away!
Every man who has tasted my cooking has told me what a good whore I am.
Scullion? What is a scullion?
A kitchen wench?
Cleaning pots? Is that how my lion wants to see me?
I'm the weakness?
How is being a weakness a compliment?
Oh. I'm too stupid to understand. The stupid foreign girl. I am not a kitchen wench.
I'm Shae, My Lady. Your new handmaiden.
No.
Waiting for you to tell me what to do.
What things?
You said to brush
Your chamber pot is empty.
Yes.
Lady Zuriff.
Lady Zuriff.
She wasn't in this city.
Do you want me to leave?
Shh. It's not deep.
They thought so, too.
Of course he did.
You are everything he will never have. Your horse eats better than his children. It doesn't matter now. He's dead.
Don't say these things. If the wrong people hear you
Don't trust anybody. Life is safer that way.
It's all right. Give me that.
Help me flip it over.
Where are you going?
You'll say nothing to anyone. Do you understand?
I've been waiting all night. What is wrong?
Then why do you look sad?
Don't be afraid. I can take care of myself.
I know. I won't let them. I'll cut off their faces. I will.
I'm yours.
I'm yours, and you are mine.
Are you afraid, my lion?
I won't let them hurt you.
It is now.
I have so far. Do you remember what you said when you met me in your tent? That I should make love to you like it was your last day on this earth.
Shae.
And you, my lion.
Some of those boys will never come back.
Shh. Come, my lady.
Maybe she hates you less than she hates everyone else.
Maybe she's jealous of you.
I'm not thirsty, Your Grace.
A few weeks, Your Grace.
(smiles)
Ten years ago, Your Grace.
Shae, Your Grace.
When I was 13, I
You must go. Run to your chamber and bar your door. Stannis won't hurt you. This one will.
I need to say goodbye to someone.
No one is raping me.
Go. Run.

3.text: Why Dorne?
I met some people in Dorne who weren't so beautiful and warm.
I told you, I don't want to play.
That one? It's going to Volantis.
Because when I got on a ship in Volantis, it looked like that one.
Why should I make up a story when I know the truth?
Yes. And you're his...?
He's an important person.
Yes.
And where is that?
I always do.
When I was 13.
I stopped being a child when I was nine. My mother made sure of that.
And now I'm his wife's servant. I brush her hair and clip her nails and empty her chamber pot.
I love that girl. I would kill for her. Do you think that makes it easier for me?
She's young and she's beautiful and highborn.
I have a name.
What do you want from me, Lord Varys?
Why do you want me to leave?
Lord Varys.
If he wants me to leave, he can tell me himself.
I still don't believe it.
Men only want one thing from a pretty girl.
Love is not the thing he wants.
They never see it that way. He didn't ask you to do something for him? Spy on someone or?
If he does ask you for anything or try anything or touch you, I want you to tell me.
My lion.
But you said I should come to you with any problems.
No.
I'm worried about Sansa. When she spoke with Lord Baelish, his friend warned me about him.
I don't know her name.
How do you know her?
She's a whore.
You fucked her.
And was she good? Did you like her?
That Sansa shouldn't trust him.
We have to protect her.
A great beauty? Oh, a great beauty?
You pervert. You want her? This child?
But you are.
I didn't force you to open your mouth and make words come out.
Oh, the cruelty. Shae is so cruel to me.
Now do you think I'm cruel?
I don't think they will even notice it.
I'm sure he does.
They haven't asked my opinion.
No.
Why do you need to speak to her alone?
Chains?
Golden chains.
Do I need a ship?
Am I going somewhere?
So, am I invited to your wedding?
No? She's a beautiful girl. You said so yourself.
Is that what you will tell yourself when you fuck her?
Does not rule the world. We can still go across the Narrow Sea.
