And I'm Shae the funny whore.
While I empty her chamber pot and lick your cock when you're bored?
No? What will it be like?
Children? You think I want children who can never see their father? Who would be killed in their sleep if their grandfather found out about them?
I'm not your lady.
I'm your whore. And when you are tired of fucking me, I will be nothing.
I brought your breakfast.

4.text: You need to eat something.
Pigeon pie.
Lemon cakes?
You love lemon cakes.
Tell her she needs to eat.
She needs to eat.
My lion.
What does it look like I'm doing? Come here.
I know. I know. We have come to a dangerous place. Have you forgotten me? Do you know how long it's been?
I want you. Don't you want me?
What things?
You need to relax.
Don't you want to relax?
What's wrong?
It's never a good time. You have your child bride now.
Do you love her?
That's not an answer.
You tried to ship me away.
Give me diamonds and make me disappear.
If you want me to leave, just say it. Say it!
You want me to stay?
You want me on the desk? What's wrong, my lion?
What should I call you?
Our friendship?
What? You'll have your own cabin, of course, and across the Narrow Sea a house, servants.
What is this?
She doesn't want you.
You don't want her.
What are you afraid of?
You are. You are afraid of your father and your sister. You're going to run from them all your life? I need you to leave.
I'm not afraid of them. I'm not going to run.
We will fight them together. It's like you said, I am yours and you are mine.
How many whores have you been with?
Shae.
I swear it.
Yes. Tyrion Lannister.
I was handmaiden to his wife Lady Sansa.
I know that he's guilty.
He and Sansa planned it together.
She wanted revenge for her father, her mother, her brother. She blamed their deaths on the king. Tyrion was happy to help. He hated Joffrey. He hated the queen. He hated you, my lord.
He stole poison from the Grand Maester's chamber to put in Joffrey's wine.
I wasn't just her maid. I was his whore.
His whore.

He stole me. I was with another man, a knight in your lordship's army. But when Tyrion arrived at the camp, he sent one of his cutthroats into our tent. He broke the knight's arm and brought me to Lord Tyrion. "You belong to me now," he said. "I want you to fuck me like it's my last night in this world."
Did I what?

I did everything he wanted. Whatever he told me to do to him. Whatever he felt like doing to me. I kissed him where he wanted. I licked him where he wanted. I let him put himself where he wanted. I was his property. I would wait in his chambers for hours so he could use me when he was bored. He ordered me to call him "my lion," so I did. I took his face in my hands and said, "I am yours and you are mine."
I am a whore. Remember? That was before he married Sansa. After that, all he wanted was her. But she wouldn't let him into her bed. So he promised to kill King Joffrey for her.

1.text: It’s too hot, my lady.

2.text: With all my heart, Your Grace. I have come to love you from afar. Tales of your courage and wisdom have never been far from my ears. And those tales have taken root deep inside of me.
Loras! Highgarden!
Now, now, my love. My brother fought valiantly for you.
You are very welcome here, Lady Stark. I'm so sorry for your loss.
As is your right. You are a king.
Thank you, Your Grace.
You think so? I can't decide how I like it better. This way, or this way.
Here, let me.
Do you want my brother to come in and help?
He could get you started. I know he wouldn't mind. Or I can turn over and you can pretend I'm him.
There's no need for us to play games. Save your lies for court. You're going to need a lot of them.

Your enemies aren't happy about us. They want to tear us apart. And the best way to stop them is to put your baby in my belly. We can try again later. You decide how you want to do it, with me, with me and Loras, however else you like. Whatever you need to do. You are a king.
Lord Baelish.
It would be my pleasure. It took me weeks to learn my way around the camp. Twice I walked in on officers in stages of undress. And the moment I learn which tent is mine, we're on the move again.
I am not tutored in warfare, but basic arithmetic favors the side with the greater numbers.
The place of a Kingsguard is by the king's side.
You seem quite interested in our marriage.
You've never married, have you?

That is sad. Though perhaps it's for the best. The whole notion of marriage seems to confuse you, so allow me to explain. My husband is my king, and my king is my husband. Here is your tent, Lord Baelish. Good night.
We need to go home. Loras.
There's no time for this.
Brienne of Tarth murdered Renly.
You can't stay here.
You can't avenge him from the grave. Bring the horses. Please.
He was very handsome.
"Your Grace." Calling yourself king doesn't make you one. And if Renly wasn't a king, I wasn't a queen.
No. I want to be the queen.

3.text: My lady. We should have guards, my lady.
Why?
Pardon me.
Stop, my lady. You'll ruin your dress.
I have others.
And your mother?
Bad men wanted to come into this city and do terrible things, but your father stopped them.
Whenever you look at this knight, I want you to remember your father.
And what do knights swear to do? Protect the weak and uphold the good. Your father did that. Be proud of him.
Was your father a soldier, too?
You should be proud, too. Under King Joffrey's leadership, your fathers saved the city. They saved us all. From now on, we're going to take care of you. All of you.
Come to me for whatever you need to feed them, clothe them, or house them. Directly to me.
Your Grace.
( laughs )
The climate is a bit more forgiving back in Highgarden, Your Grace.
I am touched by your concern, Your Grace. Luckily for us Tyrells, our blood runs quite warm. Doesn't it, Loras?
Loras, isn't the queen's gown magnificent? The fabric, the embroidery, the metalwork. I've never seen anything like it.
Yes. I paid a visit to an orphanage the High Septon told me about.
The lowest among us are no different from the highest if you give them a chance and approach them with an open heart.

Hunger turns men into beasts. I'm glad House Tyrell has been able to help in this regard. They tell me 100 wagons arrive daily now from the Reach. Wheat, barley, apples. We've had a blessed harvest. And, of course, it's our duty to assist the capital in time of need.
(to a maid) It's more your color. You take it.
Thank you.
(to LORAS) You're such a dear.
Come. Lady Sansa, it is my honor to present my grandmother the Lady Olenna of House Tyrell.
Renly was brave and gentle, Grandmother. Father liked him and so did Loras.
Grandmother! What will Sansa think of us?
I'm to be his wife. I only want to know what that means.
She's terrified, Grandmother. Just look at her.
You wanted to see me, Your Grace?
That's very thoughtful, Your Grace. I have everything I could want.
A welcome one. A military encampment is no place for a lady.
Your Grace, I tried to do my duty as a wife, that is all.
The duty of any wife to any husband-to provide him with children.
Why? I-I would not speak ill of the dead, Your Grace.
No. I do beg your pardon. The subtleties of politics are often lost on me. Renly I don't believe he was interested in the company of women.

Whenever I wanted to make a child with him, he-he had so many excuses, so many late-night war councils. He never wanted to try. Except one evening, after he'd had far too much wine to drink, he suggested something-something that sounded very painful and couldn't possibly result in children. Maybe the fault was with me.
It's such a relief to hear you say so, Your Grace.
As is your right. You must do whatever you need to do.
You are the king.
It's beautiful. Will you show me how it works?
Would you take me hunting sometime? Forgive me, Your Grace. I know a hunt is no place for a woman.
My father would never let me before- JOFFREY
May I? Please.
I imagine it must be so exciting to squeeze your finger here and watch something die over there.
I don't know, Your Grace Do you think I could?
Would you like to watch me?
(laughs)
Oh, no, it's quite all right, Your Grace. I'd love to see their tombs, really. It's like taking a walk through history.
This is so exciting.
(laughs)
I'm glad he did. I'm sorry, Your Grace. I know they did terrible things at the end, but their ancestors built this. Sometimes severity is the price we pay for greatness.
Shall we go and see them? If you give them your love, they will return it a thousandfold. I've spoken with them. I know how they feel about you. You led the defense of King's Landing. They adore you.
Do you like it, Nana?
Ahem. I didn't mean to disturb you.
We'd like some privacy, please. If you wouldn't mind waiting back inside the keep. Or if you'd be kind enough to give me your names, I'll ask the king to speak with you himself.
What did you pray for?

Why not? I'll tell you what I prayed for in the sept this morning. Let's see, for my family's health and happiness, for an end to the war, for a short winter. Boring and traditional, I'm afraid. And you?
My cousin Alanna was the most beautiful girl I'd ever seen. When I was 12, I was all elbows and knees and Alanna looked like a goddess sent to torture me. Pig-face, she called me.
I think it had something to do with my nose. Whenever she passed me in the halls, she'd oink.
So I prayed that she'd catch a horrible skin disease. A week after that, she came down with porridge plague.
You don't have it in the North? Your skin starts to look like boiled oats and eventually your face slides off and you die in agony.
(nods, laughs)
Don't say that. No, you're not.
Oh, she grew up to be the most beautiful woman and married a handsome lord and they have darling children and live in a castle by the sea. It's all terribly frustrating.
I want us to be friends, good friends.
You must see Highgarden. You'd love it there. I know you would. We have a great masquerade the night of the harvest moon. You should see the costumes. People work on them for months.

The Queen Regent, you mean. Once I marry Joffrey, I'll be queen. And if you were to marry Loras. . . Oh, your place would be at Highgarden, wouldn't it? We would be sisters, you and I. Would you like that?
I'll plant the seed as soon as Joffrey and I are married. It should grow quickly.
And only one to let you go. Because it will please me.
Lady Sansa, Lord Tyrion to see you. Should I--
Come on. Come walk with me.
I remember the first time I saw you in the throne room. I'd never seen anyone who looked so unhappy. I want very much for you to be happy, Sansa, and so does my grandmother.
You would have been happy at Highgarden. But women in our position must make the best of our circumstances.
Has Lord Tyrion mistreated you?
Has he been kind to you?
You don't want him, though.
Far from the worst Lannister, wouldn't you say?
My son will be king Sons learn from their mothers. I plan to teach mine a great deal. And your son, if I'm not mistaken, your son might be the Lord of Casterly Rock and the North someday. What?
If it's the pain you're worried about--
What is it, then? He's rather good-looking even with the scar. Especially with the scar.

Some women like tall men. Some like short men. Some like hairy men. Some like bald men. Gentle men, rough men, ugly men, pretty men, pretty girls. Most women don't know what they like until they've tried it. And, sadly, so many of us get to try so little before we're old and gray. Tyrion may surprise you. From what I've heard, he's quite experienced.
It can be. We're very complicated, you know. Pleasing us takes practice.
Yes, sweet girl. My mother taught me.
You look radiant, Your Grace.
It's the word that came to mind.
We're going to be sisters soon. We should be friends.
A better dancer than a singer, I'm afraid.
Of course. They play it so often here at court.
Not as well as you, I'm sure.
(nods)
Gone.

4.text: The wedding is in a fortnight, Grandmother. You can't say no to everything.
Perhaps I should just let Joffrey choose it for me. End up with a string of dead sparrow heads around my neck.
A shadow?
Joffrey is our king now.
And you've given none.

We are so fortunate to enjoy this marvelous food and drink. Not all among us are so lucky. To thank the gods for bringing the recent war to a just end, King Joffrey has decreed that the leftovers from our feast be given to the poorest in his city.
Lady Brienne. So good of you to come.
That's not true, my love. Brienne had nothing to do with it.
Thank you. I hope we see more of you.
Your Grace.
My love, come back to me. It's time for my father's toast.
(Standing) Look, the pie.
Wonderful. Wonderful. My hero.
He's choking!
So am I the queen?
Clawing at his own throat, looking to his mother to make stop... it was horrible.
What was it like?
One of my husbands preferred the company of men and was stabbed through the heart. Another was happiest torturing animals and was poisoned at our wedding feast... I must be cursed.
But I would have been the queen.
I can't believe you're going. Leaving me alone here with these people.
(laughs)
No. Have they even agreed to the match? No one tells me anything.
(laughs)
Mm-hmm.
(laughs)
Well, he could have done.
You don't know, Grandmother.
What? I don't understand.
Kingsguard.
I'm not a visitor, Your Grace. Word has itI'm to be your bride.
Did you know that people in arranged marriages often never meet until their wedding day? Before we decide to spend our lives together, we ought to get to know one another. Don't you think?
It can be our secret. Hmm? If we're going to be man and wife, we'll have a few secrets from her, I hope. So, Your Grace...
Hello. Aren't you a proper fellow?
Very handsome.
That's very cruel. You don't strike me as cruel.
That's a relief. Because you know what happens when we marry?
When we marry, I become yours. Forever. It's getting late. I should go. May I come and visit you again? All right, then.
Remember, our little secret.
Your Grace.
Long may he reign.
He sits the throne like he was born to it.
No, he wasn't.
He was my husband. My king.
Your Grace, I feel...
No.
It would be some consolation, wouldn't it? For all the horror that put him there.
He has you.

Oh. After all that's happened... it sounds strange, I know, but I am... I haven't even given any thought to it, what comes next. It would be a great honor, of course. But I will have to speak to my father about it.
We may be faced with an alarming number of weddings soon.
I won't even know what to call you. Sister? Or Mother? Hmm.

5.text: We’re late for dinner as it is.
I’m very hungry.
What’s your name?
I’m afraid my brother is keeping the king waiting, Olyvar.
Perhaps you might consider being a bit more discreet?
In any event… (throws Loras his clothes) you shouldn’t keep your intended waiting.
Lucky you.
You think I want that woman married to my brother?
Perhaps.
Perhaps?
No. You were lovely.
Yes. (Chuckles).
No, no, no. You're very sweet. The sweetest king who ever lived.
Wouldn't that be glorious? (They laugh. Tommen leans in to kiss her). Shouldn't we rest a little while? Just to catch our breath, there's no rush, is there?
No, I'm fine. I just want you all to myself. I want to know everything there is to know about King Tommen First of His Name.
So strange… Husband.
I understand. But it's not your fault, you know that, don't you? You mustn't feel guilty.
(Sits up). I love to sail.
I think we're going to be very happy, you and I.
Living in a tower so high, it touches the clouds. Of course my grandmother couldn't wait to go home. The capital is not for everyone, I suppose. Does your mother like it here?
It's so wonderful to have her watching over you. A lioness guiding her cub. (Pours them some wine).
You are. And the king. (Hands him win). But you'll always be her baby-boy.

I adore how she has always been so generous with me, so kind. And the horror she's had to injure. (Sits down and begins to comb her hair). Losing her husband, her eldest child and her father. It's no wonder she's so protective of you. She'll never let you out of her sight.
I said, "Darling, surely 4 times is enough, are you trying to set a new record?" (Laugher). And he said, "Well, what is the record? I'm sure we can break it."
Mother! (Gets up and hugs Cersei). Welcome.
Can we bring you anything to eat or drink? I wish we had some wine for you. It's a bit early in the day for us.
You are very sweet.
I absolutely adore him. You raised a gallant young man. I'm forever grateful.
Ecstatic. I really am. Exhausted, to be honest, but what can I expect, he is half lion, half stag. (Margaery’s friends laugh).
Oh, forgive me, I haven't been at Court for long, I get so confused. What's the proper way to address you now? Queen Mother or Dowager Queen?
In any event, judging from the King's enthusiasm, the Queen Mother will be a Queen Grandmother soon.
Can you imagine the celebrations? They'll ring the bells all day and night.
Why is my brother in a cell?
We both know who did. (Walks away). You told me she was returning to Casterly Rock.
She's jealous you're not hers anymore. Arresting my brother is her revenge.
(Scoffs). Oh, my sweet, sweet King. (Sits down). Do you have any affection for me at all?
I can't bear to think of my brother locked away in some grimy cell.
Do you promise?
You're the King of the Andals, the Lord of the Seven Kingdoms, the Protector of the Realm. And you let a band of fanatics imprison your brother by law.
Are you? When?
You don't know?
(Walking out). I have to send word to Grandmother.
I need to be with my family, Your Grace. (Continues walking).
Everyone knew about him and Renly.
But he was the king’s brother.
Cersei is behind this.
You call me forward?
I am the queen.
They are lies.
All of them.
Yes, I swear it.
What?
Tommen! Tommen!
You can’t do this, I am the queen! Tommen, Tommen! I am your queen, how dare you!
I know you did this.
Lies come easily to you. Everyone knows that. But innocence, decency, concern? You’re not very good at those, I’m afraid. Perhaps that’s why your son was so eager to cast you aside for me.
I don’t want to see you again.
Leave.
Get out you hateful bitch!

6.text: I’d like to see my brother.
Please. How is he? At least tell me that.
I am the queen and I demand to see my brother.
My brother, can you tell me how he is?
I have nothing to confess.
None of us are.
Faith is the way, Father.
You mutilated him. You gave me your word.
And where is the queen mother?
There’s something wrong.
Cersei is not here. Tommen is not here. Why do you think they are not here?

Forget about the bloody gods and listen to what I’m telling you. Cersei understands the consequences of her absence and she is absent anyway, which means she does not intend to suffer those consequences. The trial can wait. We all need to leave.
Loras. Stay with me.
Let me through. Let me through. Get out of my way.
Let us through!
I’d go to my brother, my husband, my family.
Quality takes time.
And one day you walked through a graveyard and realized it was all for nothing and set out on the path to righteousness. Book of the Stranger, verse 25.
Septa Unella reads it to me. At me.
So what did you do?
Who?
Loras. Loras.
Listen to me. You need to stay strong.
You are strong. You are the future of our house, the future of our family.
Shh. Have you -- have you told them that? That you don’t care?
They want me to help you. They want me told help tear you down. That’s why he’s letting me see you, I know it is. And if either of us give in to what they want, then they win.
All right.
No, Your Grace.
We’ll be together again soon and everything will be better than it was before.
Have you spoken to him at all, the High Sparrow?
Yes, I have. He’s not quite what we thought he was, is he?
You think I’m mad. I sound mad.
He is. There’s something about him. His way of looking at the world. It’s not an easy thing admitting to yourself what you really are. It’s taken me a while. He’s helped me.

Ah, yes, I visited their hovels and I fed them soup and I made sure I was seen doing it. I never gave them what they really needed, though. I’ve had lots of time to think about how good I was at seeming good. All those stories I told myself about who I was and why I did the things I did. There were so many lies in those stories.
It’s all right. It really is. It’s such a relief to let go of those lies.

I love my brother. I will always love my brother. His soul is pure and perfect. His sins don’t erase that purity, they only obscure it. He just needs to atone for them. We all do. Sooner or later, one way or another. The gods have a plan for us all.
The Book of the Mother, Your Holiness. Chapter three, verse 12.
“Smoothing what was jagged, so does a woman’s love calm a man’s brute nature. A wife salves her husband’s wounds, a mother sings her son to sleep.”
For year I pretended to love the poor, the afflicted. I had pity for them, but I never loved them. They disgusted me.
Of course.
No.
It’s just...the desires that once drove me no longer do.
Forgive me. Sometimes the truth path is hard to find.
My grandmother?
Septa Unella has been my true friend and counselor.
Grandmother.
Grandmother, please.
You marched against the High Sparrow, against the Faith.
The gods could have punished you and Father, but they didn’t. They showed mercy.
Loras’s only hope is to confess his crimes and repent. If he does, the Faith will allow him to return to Highgarden. He’ll have to renounce his name and title...
...and live his life as a penitent.
He can begin again.
As a free man.
I am the queen. It is my duty to serve my husband the king.
But you should leave, Grandmother. Your place is at home.
You must.
Go home. Find comfort in prayer and good works.
The Mother watches over us all.
Seven blessings to you, Grandmother.
Shall we pray?

1.text: They have my son.

(shouting) They have my son! Get out, all of you. (to Tyrion) Not you. You were right about Eddard Stark. lf he were alive, we could have used him to broker a peace with Winterfell and Riverrun, which would have given us more time to deal with Robert's brothers. But now – madness. Madness and stupidity. l always thought you were a stunted fool. Perhaps l was wrong.

No one will stay here. Ser Gregor will head out with 500 riders and set the Riverland on fire from God's Eye to the Red Fork. The rest of us will regroup at Harrenhal. And you will go to King's Landing.

Rule. You will serve as Hand of the King in my stead. You will bring that boy king to heel, and his mother too, if needs be. And if you get so much as a whiff of treason from any of the rest – Baelish, Varys, Pycelle…
You're my son. Oh, one more thing. You will not take that whore to court. Do you understand?
Attacking him was stupid.
Lannisters don't act like fools.
Why is he still alive?
Ned Stark.
Why is he still alive?
Clean...
You spend too much time worrying about what other people think of you.
Now that's what you want people to think of you.
When you hear them whispering "Kingslayer" behind your back, doesn't it bother you?
The lion doesn't concern himself with the opinions of the sheep.
He's a Lannister. He might be the lowest of the Lannisters, but he's one of us.
No, it's not an opinion, it's a fact!
Hmm.
The rumors of your demise were unfounded.
And who are these Companions of yours?
This is Shagga Son of Dolf, Chieftain of the Stone Crows.
You left us no choice. The honor of the House was at stake.
Is our hostage.
Robert Baratheon is dead.
A green boy.
The wolf rushes into the lion's jaws.
It is said that the men of the Mountain clans are great warriors.
The boy may lack experience and sense, but he does have a certain mindless provincial courage.
l do hope your savages are going to be of some use, otherwise we've wasted good steel on them.
When the battle commences, you and your wildlings will be in the vanguard.
When soldiers lack discipline, the fault lies with their commander.
There'll be no more discussion on the matter.
You're wounded.
Huh! The scouts were wrong. There were 2,000 Stark bannermen, not 20 [thousand].
He wasn't here.
With his other 18,000 men.

2.text: Thank you, Your Grace.
What's this?
Evidently not. Why are these prisoners not in their cells?
Are we so well-manned that we can afford to discard able young bodies and skilled laborers?
You, do you have a trade?
He'll do no such thing. This one's a girl, you idiot, dressed as a boy. Why?
Smart. More than I can say for this lot. Get these prisoners to work. Bring the girl. I need a new cupbearer.
The Starks understand winter better than we ever will. The cold won't beat them.

And I'm sure if those same spies snuck into our own encampments, they would report growing discontent amongst the Southern lords. This is war, no one's content. We've underestimated the Stark boy for too long. He has a good mind for warfare, his men worship him. And as long as he keeps winning battles, they'll keep believing he is King in the North. You've been waiting for him to fail. He is not going to fail, not without our help. So how do we stop him?
Yes, I think you would, Reginald. And because you're my cousin, I might even let you wake from that sleep. Go, I'm sure your wife must miss you.
Well, then you'd better start riding. Go, before I change my mind and send her your head.
If your name wasn't Lannister, you'd be scrubbing out pots in the cook's tent. Go!
Not wine, water. We'll be here for some time. Girl, where are you from?
And who are the Lords of Maidenpool? Remind me.
And what is their sigil?
A red salmon. I think a Maidenpool girl would remember that. You're a Northerner, aren't you?
Good. One more time, where are you from?
And what do they say of Robb Stark in the North?
And?
And do you believe them?
Fetch that water.
Can you read?
Can you read?
This letter detailing our infantry movements was meant for Lord Damon of House Marbrand. It was sent to Lord Marlyn of House Dormand.
Girl, fetch me the History of the Greater and the Lesser Houses. It's the one on this
My cupbearer can read better than you.
To whom does House Dormand owe allegiance?

To the Starks of Winterfell! Who have 20,000 men and my son! I judged you might be good for something more than brutalizing peasants. I see I overestimated you. If you ever put my son's life at risk again, I'll Leave us.
Put the book away, girl. Maybe you should devise our next battle plan while you're about it.
Mmm. Give us the room.
(to Arya) Clear all this.
(not amused) Baelish.
Wine?
What news from the capital?
Ah, the late King Renly. Rather a short reign. Murdered by a woman, I hear.
Here. Men love to blame demons when their grand plans unravel.
You say that as if you were the first man alive to think it. Yes, a crisis is an opportunity. What other brilliant insights have you brought me today?
Yes, yes, yes.
Wants to be queen.
House Tyrell rebelled against the Iron Throne. Against my grandson.
(to Arya) More wine for Lord Baelish.
You would ride there yourself?
I'll have an answer by nightfall. That'll be all, girl.
And what else?
Why?
Hmm.
Who taught you to read?

Hmm. I taught my son Jaime to read. The maester came to me one day, told me he wasn't learning. He couldn't make sense of the letters. He reversed them in his head. The maester said he'd heard tell of this affliction and that we simply must accept it. Ha! After that, I sat Jaime down for four hours every day until he learned. He hated me for it, for a time. For a long time. But he learned. Hmm. Where is your father? Is he alive? Who was he?
A stonemason who could read? Hmm.
Quite a man. What killed him?
You're a sharp little thing, aren't you?
No. But you've already begun.
I did. I grew up with him. I watched him grow old.
He loved us. He was a good man, but a weak man. A weak man who nearly destroyed our house and name. I'm cold.
Mmm.
Guard!
Wolfsbane. A rare substance. This is no common assassin.
I don't care if you hanged 100. A man tried to kill me. I want his name and I want his head.

Pretentious name for a band of outlaws. We can't allow rebels behind our lines to harass us with impunity. We look like fools and they look like heroes. That's how kings fall. I want them dead, every one.
Burn the villages, burn the farms. Let them know what it means to choose the wrong side.
Mmm. Is that mutton?
Don't like mutton.
Leave it. Are you hungry?
Of course you are. Eat.
It's bad manners to refuse a lord's offer. Sit. Eat.
You're small for your age. I suppose you've been underfed your whole life.
Mmm. This will be my last war. Win or lose.
Do you think I'd be in my position if I had lost a war?
But this is the one I'll be remembered for. The War of Five Kings, they're calling it. My legacy will be determined in the coming months.

Do you know what legacy means? It's what you pass down to your children and your children's children. It's what remains of you when you're gone. Harren the Black thought this castle would be his legacy. The greatest fortress ever built.
Yes. Dragons happened.

Harrenhal was built to withstand an attack from the land. A million men could have marched on these walls, and a million men would have been repelled. But an attack from the air with dragon fire Mmm-mmm. Harren and all his sons roasted alive within these walls. Aegon Targaryen changed the rules. That's why every child alive still knows his name
Mmm?
Correct. A student of history, are you?
I'm sure I knew that when I was a boy.
Hmm. She's a heroine of yours, I take it?
Aren't most girls more interested in the pretty maidens from the songs? Jonquil with the flowers in her hair?
You remind me of my daughter. Where did you learn all this stuff about Visenya and her Valyrian steel sword?
He was a well-read stonemason. Can't say I've ever met a literate stonemason.
Careful now, girl. I enjoy you, but be careful. Take that back to the kitchen. Eat what you want.
And, girl.
"M'lord.
" Lowborn girls say "m'lord," not "my lord. " If you're going to pose as a commoner, you should do it properly.
You're too smart for your own good. Has anyone told you that?
Go on.
Surrender the Iron Throne?
No, a king who runs will not be king for long. He's a Lannister. He'll stand and fight. Stannis, two days from the capital and the wolf at my doorstep.
Ha! The last time the scouts assured us of Stark's movement, he lured us into a trap. Which is why my son is his prisoner.
Too close to Casterly Rock.
He's a boy and he's never lost a battle. He'll risk anything at any time because he doesn't know enough to be afraid.

We'll ride at nightfall. I want a full night's march before he knows we're on the move. Clegane, you'll maintain a garrison here at Harrenhal. Track down this brotherhood and destroy them. The girl has proven herself a good servant. She'll stay on with you. See that he doesn't get drunk in the evenings. He's poor company when he's sober, but he's better at his work.
The battle is over. We have won.

3.text: Am I enjoying it?
( chuckles ) Yes. I heard how happy you were. ( blows ) You brought a whore into my bed.
I sent you here to advise the king. I gave you real power and authority. You chose to spend your days as you always have, bedding harlots and drinking with thieves.
What do you want, Tyrion?
Maester Pycelle assured me your wounds were not fatal.

Jugglers and singers require applause. You are a Lannister. Do you think I demanded a garland of roses every time I suffered a wound on a battlefield? Hmm? Now, I have seven kingdoms to look after and three of them are in open rebellion. So tell me what you want.
You want Casterly Rock?

( sighs ) We'll find you accommodations more suited to your name and as a reward for your accomplishments during the battle of Blackwater Bay. And when the time is right, you will be given a position fit for your talents so that you can serve your family and protect our legacy. And if you serve faithfully, you will be rewarded with a suitable wife. And I would let myself be consumed by maggots before mocking the family name and making you heir to Casterly Rock.

Why? You ask that? You, who killed your mother to come into the world? You are an ill-made, spiteful little creature full of envy, lust, and low cunning. Men's laws give you the right to bear my name and display my colors since I cannot prove that you are not mine. And to teach me humility, the gods have condemned me to watch you waddle about wearing that proud lion that was my father's sigil and his father's before him. But neither gods nor men will ever compel me to let you turn Casterly Rock into your whorehouse. Go, now. Speak no more of your rights to Casterly Rock. Go.
Oh, one more thing. The next whore I catch in your bed I'll hang.
Any man who must say, 'I am the king' is no true king. I'll make sure you understand that when I've won your war for you.
The king is tired. See him to his chambers.
Grand Maester, perhaps some essence of nightshade to help him sleep.
Not you.
You're a fool if you believe he's the most powerful man in Westeros.
You really think a crown gives you power?
Mm-hmm.
Mm-hmm.
Which he got from me. Do you disapprove?
But to slaughter them at a wedding. Explain to me why it is more noble to kill 10,000 men in battle than a dozen at dinner.
To end the war. To protect the family. Do you want to write a song for the dead Starks? Go ahead, write one. I'm in this world a little while longer to defend the Lannisters, to defend my blood.

Good. Let them remember what happens when they march on the south. All the Stark men are dead. Winterfell is a ruin. Roose Bolton will be named Warden of the North until your son by Sansa comes of age.
I believe you still have some work to do on that score.
One way or another, you will get that girl pregnant.
Shall I explain to you in one easy lesson how the world works?

The house that puts family first will always defeat the house that puts the whims and wishes of its sons and daughters first. A good man does everything in his power to better his family's position regardless of his own selfish desires.
Does that amuse you?
Easy for me, is it?
The day that you were born. I wanted to carry you into the sea and let the waves wash you away. Instead, I let you live. And I brought you as my son. Because you're a Lannister.
What news of Jaime?

20,000 unwashed northerns have known about his escape for weeks. Collectively, you control more spies and informants than the rest of the world combined. Do you mean to tell me that none of you has any notion of where he is?
Try harder. What do we have, then?
Well, let him have it. The name suits our purposes far more than that useless pile of rubble. The Lord of Harrenhal will make a worthy suitor for the widow Arryn.
You'll leave for the Eyrie as soon as possible and bring Lysa Arryn into the fold. Then the young wolf can add his own aunt to the list of people who have taken up arms against him.
Fully agreed. Which is why I'm naming you new Master of Coin.
It would appear to be a position that best suits your talents.
You wanted to speak to me?
What about him?
When Catelyn Stark took Tyrion prisoner what did I do in response?
And if I would start a war for that lecherous little stump, what do you think I am doing for my oldest son and heir?
Whatever I can.
You're still here.
Why?
All right. Contribute.
The Tyrells helped us defeat Stannis Baratheon. The Tyrells saved your life, your children's lives.

Good. I wish you knew how to manipulate him. I don't distrust you because you're a woman. I distrust you because you're not as smart as you think you are. You've allowed that boy to ride roughshod over you and everyone else in this city.
I will.
You're late.
Our business concerns her, too. Sit.
Never mind that now. We have something important to discuss.
Your sister has learned that your new friends the Tyrells are plotting to marry Sansa Stark to Ser Loras.
Your jokes are not appreciated.
I bring them into the royal fold and this is how they repay me, by trying to steal the key to the North out from under me.

The Karstarks have marched home. The young wolf has lost half his army. His days are numbered. Theon Greyjoy murdered both his brothers. That makes Sansa Stark the heir to Winterfell. And I am not about to hand her over to the Tyrells.

There's nothing to refuse. This is a plot. Plots are not public knowledge. And the Tyrells won't carry this one out until after Joffrey's wedding. We need to act first and kill this union in its crib.
We find Sansa Stark a different husband.
I can and I do.
Do you intend on mistreating her? The girl's happiness is not my concern, - nor should it be yours.
There, you see? You will wed her, bed her, and put a child in her. Surely you're capable of that.
You wanted to be rewarded for your valor in battle. Sansa Stark is a finer reward than you could ever dare hope for. And it is past time you were wed.
Only too well.
Tyrion will do as he's bid. As will you.
You'll marry Ser Loras.
The boy is heir to Highgarden. Tyrion will secure the North, you will secure the Reach.
Yes, you will. You're still fertile. You need to marry again and breed.
You're my daughter! You will do as I command and you will marry Loras Tyrell and put an end to the disgusting rumors about you once and for all.
Not another word. My children. You've disgraced the Lannister name for far too long.
Why?
Is rich, the most beautiful woman in all seven kingdoms and the mother of the king.
Old?
The years punish us as well, I promise you that. My stomach remains quite strong, however. The only thing that might turn it are details of your grandson's nocturnal activities. Do you deny them?
And a boy with his affliction should be grateful for the opportunity to marry the most beautiful woman in the kingdoms and remove the stain from his name.
Of course.
No.
Never.
Perhaps Highgarden has a high tolerance for unnatural behavior.
I will not breathe further life into a malicious lie by discussing it.
I don't care what people believe. And neither do you.
Now, if the rumors about my children were true, then Joffrey is no king at all and House Tyrell is throwing its prized flower into the dirt.
The uncertainty makes you uncomfortable. All right. I'll remove it for you.
If you refuse to marry Loras to Cersei, I will name him to the Kingsguard. I'm sure you're familiar with the Kingsguard vows. He will never marry. He will never have children.
The Tyrell name will fade. And Highgarden will go to the children of Joffrey and Margaery.
I would have my grandson protected by a skilled warrior who takes his vows seriously. So, shall I draw up the order? Or do you consent to this marriage?
Your Grace.
You wanted to speak to me?
You're welcome to attend the meetings of your small council, Your Grace. Any or all of them.
Of course.
I have, yes.
The Tower of the Hand is where I work. To walk from there to here would take time, time I could otherwise spend productively.
We could arrange to have you carried.
Where did you hear about this?
Apparently so.
When I was Hand of the King under your father's predecessor, the skulls of all the Targaryen dragons were kept in this room. The skull of the last of them was right here. It was the size of an apple.
Yes, and the creature to whom it belonged died 300 years ago. Curiosities on the far side of the world are no threat to us.
Because we have been told as much by the many experts who serve the realm by counseling the king on matters about which he knows nothing.
You are being counseled at this very moment.
From now on, I will see to it that you are appropriately consulted on important matters whenever necessary. Your Grace.
You seem rather drunk.
This isn't about your wedding. Renly Baratheon had a wedding. Your wife needs a child, a Lannister child, as soon as possible.
If you're going to give her one, you need to perform.
More than once.
You can drink, you can joke, you can engage in juvenile attempts to make your father uncomfortable, but you will do your duty.
I believe we can dispense with the bedding, Your Grace. I'm sure Tyrion did not mean to threaten the king.
Your uncle is clearly quite drunk, Your Grace.

4.text: Mm-hmm.
It is.
There are three living smiths who know how to rework Valyrian steel. The finest of them was in Volantis. Came here to King's Landing at my invitation.
From someone who no longer had need of it.
And now we have two.
The original weapon was absurdly large. Plenty of steel for two swords.
You'll have to train your left hand.
You'll never be as good.
You can't serve in the Kingsguard with one hand.
The war is over. The king is safe. The king is never safe.
Other knights protected the king while you were a prisoner. They will continue to do so when you go home.
You'll return to Casterly Rock and rule in my stead.
I am the King's Hand. My place is here. I don't expect to see the Rock again before I die.
You won't be breaking anything. There is a precedent to relieve a Kingsguard of his duties. The king will exercise that prerogative.
No?
I don't believe I asked you a question.
If you think your bloody honor comes before...
What do you want?
For 40 years I've tried to teach you. If you haven't learned by now, you never will. Go. If serving as a glorified bodyguard is the sum of your ambition, go serve.
Keep it.
A one-handed man with no family needs all the help he can get.
Not another word. We've been over this, the matter's closed.
You are betrothed to Loras Tyrell. Still betrothed to Loras Tyrell and you will marry Loras Tyrell as soon as Tommen marries Margaery.

Jaime cannot marry or inherit lands. Tyrion's sentence will be carried out tomorrow. You have, on several occasions, made great claims about your commitment to this family's future. Your role in that future is more vital now than it ever was.

When you were nine years old, I was called to the capital. I decided to take your brother with me and not you. You insisted that you would not be left at Casterly Rock under any circumstances and if you recall-
Do you think you'll be the first person dragged into a sept to be married against her will?
No.
And how will you do that?
And what truth would that be?
Known what?
No, no, no, no, no.
I don't believe you.

Tyrion! Put down the crossbow. Who released you? Ah, your brother ,I expect. He always had a soft spot for you. Come, we’ll go and talk in my chambers. Is this how you want to speak to me? Shaming your father has always given you pleasure…

Yes. But you refused to die. I respect that, even admire it. You fight for what’s yours. I’d never let them execute you; is that what you fear? I’d never let Illyn Payne take your head. You’re a Lannister. You’re my son.
Who?
Bah, Tyrion. Put down that crossbow.
It doesn’t matter.
She was a whore!
And what? You’ll kill your own father in the privy? No. You’re my son. Enough of this nonsense…
Enough. We’ll go back to my chambers and speak with some dignity.
What, are you afraid of a dead whore?
You shot me. You’re no son of mine.
Have her brought to the Tower of the Hand before the wedding.
One of only two Valyrian steel swords in the capital, Your Grace, freshly forged in your honor.
Bit much, wouldn't you say?
Proportionate to what?
People who spend their money on this sort of nonsense tend not to have it for long.
Shall we stick golden roses in half the meat pies to commemorate your generosity?
I'm not worried about the Iron Bank.
You're in rather a good mood.
I won't ask why.
Prince Oberyn.
Charmed.
Please give him our regards. With any luck, the gout will abate with time and he will be able to walk again.
Noblemen in my part of the country don't enjoy the same lifestyle as our counterparts in Dorne.
Find her. Bar the gates of the city. Seize every ship in the harbor.
No one leaves the capital! No one!
Your brother is dead. Do you know what that means?
I'm not trying to trick you.
Yes, you will become king. What kind of king do you think you'll be?
Mm, I think so as well. You've got the right temperament for it. But what makes a good king? Hmm? What is a good king's single most important quality?

Hmm. Baelor the Blessed was holy. And pious. He built this sept. He also named a six-year-old boy high septon because he thought the boy could work miracles. He ended up fasting himself into an early grave because food was of this world and this world was sinful.

Yeah. A good king must be just. Orys I was just. Everyone applauded his reforms. Nobles and commoners alike. But he wasn't just for long. He was murdered in his sleep after less than a year by his own brother. Was that truly just of him? To abandon his subjects to an evil that he was too gullible to recognize?
No.

Yes. Strength. King Robert was strong. He won the rebellion and crushed the Targaryen dynasty. And he attended three small council meetings in 17 years. He spent his time whoring and hunting and drinking until the last two killed him. So, we have a man who starves himself to death, a man who lets his own brother murder him, and a man who thinks that winning and ruling are the same thing. What do they all lack?
Yes!

Yes. But what is wisdom? Hmm? A house with great wealth and fertile lands asks you for your protection against another house with a strong Navy that could one day oppose you. How do you know which choice is wise and which isn't? You've any experience of treasuries and granaries or shipyards and soldiers?

No. Of course not. A wise king knows what he knows and what he doesn't. You're young. A wise young king listens to his counselors and heeds their advice until he comes of age. And the wisest kings continue to listen to them long afterwards... Your brother was not a wise king. Your brother was not a good king. If he had been, perhaps he'd still be alive. Now, as the king, you will have to marry. Do you understand why?
Yes, but why? To further the family line. Do you know how that happens?
Yes, but has anyone explained the details to you?
Prince Oberyn.
May we have the room?
No, thank you.
No, thank you.
Are you?
Which way is that?
Some believe the king choked.
I hear you studied poisons at the Citadel.
Your hatred for my family is rather well known. You arrive at the capital, an expert in poisoning, some days later my grandson dies of poisoning.
You spoke with Tyrion in this very brothel on the day that you arrived. What did you discuss?
What did you discuss?
For which you blame me.
Here I stand unarmed, unguarded. Should I be concerned?
Men at war commit all kinds of crimes without their superiors' knowledge.
Categorically.
I'm sure he would enjoy speaking with you.
I could arrange for this meeting.
There will be a trial for my son. And as custom dictates, three judges will render a verdict. I will preside. Mace Tyrell will serve as the second judge. I would like you to be the third.
Not long ago, the Tyrells sided with Renly Baratheon. Declared themselves enemies of the throne. Now they are our strongest allies.
I will also invite you to sit on the small council to serve as one of the new king's principal advisors.

We are not the Seven Kingdoms until Dorne returns to the fold. The king is dead. The Greyjoys are in open rebellion. A wildling army marches on the Wall. And in the East, a Targaryen girl has three dragons. Before long, she will turn her eyes to Westeros. Only the Dornish managed to resist Aegon Targaryen and his dragons.
We need each other. You help me serve justice to the king's assassins and I will help you serve justice to Elia's.
When will the wedding take place in your mind?
A fortnight?
No jugglers, no jousting dwarves, no 77-course meals.
And your wedding to Loras?
Shortly?
I know you don't like them. I didn't like your husband. Used to pat me on the back a lot. I didn't trust him.
You don't need to make formal alliances with people you trust.
Ourselves alone.
The Tyrells are our only true rivals in terms of resources and we need them on our side.
Robert had me funding him. Wars swallow gold like a pit in the earth.
Do you know how much gold was mined in the Westerlands this past year?
Go on, your best guess.
Doesn't matter. The answer is the same.
Our last working mine ran dry three years ago.
The crown owes the Iron Bank of Braavos a tremendous amount of money.
A tremendous amount.
The Iron Bank is the Iron Bank. There is no someone.

And a temple is comprised of stones. One stone crumbles and another takes its place. And the temple holds its form for 1,000 years or more. That's what the Iron Bank is... a temple. We all live in its shadow and almost none of us know it. You can't run from them. You can't cheat them. You can't sway them with excuses. If you owe them money and you don't want to crumble yourself, you pay it back. Vesting the Tyrells in the crown will help a great deal in this respect.
I know you're building a strong case against Tyrion. And as a mother, that is your right. But as a judge, I cannot discuss the trial with you.
The trial begins this afternoon. We only have the morning for affairs of state. Shall we begin?
What would it take to make the common soldier stupid enough to try his luck with the Hound?
Make it 100. What else?
The Targaryen girl?
Joffrey didn't die on his watch. Dismissing him was as insulting as it was stupid.
Dragons haven't won a war in 300 years. Armies win them all the time. She must be dealt with.
Eventually, if it comes to that. Can your little birds find their way into Meereen?
Mmm. Lord Tyrell, be a good man. Fetch my quill and paper.
Tyrion of the House Lannister, you stand accused by the Queen Regent of regicide. Did you kill King Joffrey?
Did your wife, the Lady Sansa?
How would you say he died, then?
So you would blame the bakers?
The crown may call its first witness.
Silence.
Silence! You will not speak unless called upon. You're dismissed, Ser Meryn.
By whom?
Grand Maester, you examined King Joffrey's corpse. Was it without question poison that killed him?
Was this one of the poisons stolen from your store?
Thank you, Your Grace, for the courage of your testimony.
You're excused, Lord Varys.
One.
We will adjourn for now.
Toll the bells in an hour's time.
I've condemned no one. The trial is not over.
I know nothing of the sort.
He killed his king.
It won't be murder. It'll be justice.
I'm performing my sworn duty as Hand of the King. If Tyrion is found guilty, he will be punished accordingly.
No, he'll be punished accordingly.
I'm well aware of your oath.
What happens to my dynasty if I spare the life of my grandson's killer?
Done.

When the testimony's concluded and a guilty verdict rendered, Tyrion will be given the chance to speak. He'll plead for mercy. I'll allow him to join the Night's Watch. In three days' time, he'll depart for Castle Black and live out his days at the Wall. You'll remove your white cloak immediately. You will leave King's Landing to assume your rightful place at Casterly Rock. You will marry a suitable woman and father children named Lannister. And you'll never turn your back on your family again.
And you have mine.
The crown may call its next witness.
State your name.
Do you swear by all the gods that your testimony will be true and honest?
Do you know this man?
How do you know him?
This man stands accused of murdering King Joffrey. What do you know of this?
Silence! Continue.
How did you come to be in his service?
Silence. Silence!
You wish to confess?
Tyrion. Do you wish to confess?
You admit you poisoned the king?
You are not on trial for being a dwarf.
Have you nothing to say in your defense?
Ser Meryn. Ser Meryn. Escort the prisoner back to his cell.
*standing up* The gods have made their will known. Tyrion Lannister, in the name of King Tommen of the House Baratheon, First of His Name, you are hereby sentenced to death.

2.text: Father, smith, warrior, mother ,maiden, crone, stranger.
I am his and he is mine from this day until the end of my days.
Shhh
The rot's set in.
Shh.
The rot will spread. If we don't take the foot now
Your men are not my men, my lord.
Talisa.
You want to know what side my family fights on?
That boy lost his foot on your orders.
That boy did?
Do you think he's friends with King Joffrey? He's a fisherman's son that grew up near Lannisport. He probably never held a spear before they shoved one in his hands a few months ago.
That should help his foot grow back.
You're going to kill Joffrey?
And then what?
So who will?
You're fighting to overthrow a king, and yet you have no plan for what comes after?
Volantis.
He was unlucky that you were.
Your Grace.
Westerosi customs are still a bit foreign to me.
Why are you so sure I'm of noble birth?
What if I told you my father sold lace on the Long Bridge, and my mother, my brother and I lived with him above our shop?
Not very noble to accuse a lady of dishonesty.
I always thought I was a brilliant liar.
Will we be here long?
I'm not a spy.
You're right. You've found me out. I'm writing a letter to the Lannisters. "The young wolf is on the move. " Perhaps you'd join me. If you've got time, of course, for, well
Lady Stark.
Maegyr.
An uncommon name here. An old name in Volantis. Excuse me, my lady. Your Grace.
Your Grace. A minute of your time?
I've been treating your wounded men.
They're not my enemies.

I've already run through the supplies I brought with me. Some are easily replaced. Egg yolks, turpentine, oil of roses. But some are not. I need silk for stitching. I need fennel root for those with fever, willow bark. Mostly I need milk of the poppy. You saw what it was like to amputate a foot without any. I assume there will be more loss of limb before this war is over.
I know where to find them. I'm sorry, I shouldn't interrupt you.
You're riding to the Crag to negotiate a surrender?
The Crag will have a maester and he will have what I need.
If I could write a list.
I don't think that will be
Is she beautiful?
What's her name?
I'm sure you'll be very happy.
And you're marrying her for a bridge?
Ah.
When I speak to people from the North, they all loved your father.
Children do not always think that about their fathers, believe me.
I wish I could have met him.
(chuckles) Most lords worry more about their gold and their glory than the charwomen scrubbing their floors.
And you? You think I'm fighting this war so they'll sing songs about me? I want to go home. I want the men following me to go home.
Then why don't you?
Chopping off Joffrey's head, you mean.
Your pardon, my lord. Your Grace.
How are you?
I'm sorry. It was a stupid question. I'm sorry.
You have every right. You're a king.
What kind do you want to be?
I was raised to be a proper little lady, to play the harp and dance the latest steps and recite Valyrian poetry.
No. No, you would not.

When I was 12, my mother and father went to a wedding. Weddings in Volantis last for days, you know. And they left me with my little brother. The second afternoon they were gone was the hottest day in the three-year summer. We couldn't bear to be inside, so we ran down to the Rhoyne. Every child in Volantis was in the Rhoyne that day. The rich, the poor, we were all there. Naked, screaming, racing to the little islands. Drummers were playing for coppers on the east bank. I was treading water, talking to a friend, when I realized I hadn't seen my brother. I called his name. Then I started screaming his name. And then I saw him floating face down. My heart just stopped. I was I dragged him from the water. My friend helped me, I think. I don't even remember. He was so little. Then we pulled him onto the riverbank. And I screamed at him and I shook him. And he was dead. Just dead. A man ran over. He had a fish tattoo on his face. In Volantis, the slaves have tattoos. So you know what they are without having to talk to them. And this man worked on a fishing boat. And he pushed me out of the way. You have to understand, for a slave to push a highborn girl, that's death for the man, a terrible death. But he pushed me out of the way, and he started pressing on my brother's chest again and again and again, until my brother spat out half of the Rhoyne and cried out. And the man cradled his head and told him to be calm. I decided two things that day. I would not waste my years planning dances and masquerades with the other noble ladies. And when I came of age, I would never live in a slave city again. I'm sorry, Your Grace. You told me of your problems and I've blathered on.
I don't want you to marry her.

3.text: Talisa
This needs to be cleaned and closed.
You're lucky to be alive.
My mother always told me you Westerosi were a grim lot. Grim, bearded, stinking barbarians that would row across the Narrow Sea and steal us from our beds.
I never thought I'd marry anyone at all.
Not until I met the king of the grim, bearded, stinking barbarians.
Lord Bolton.
Whoa, whoa.
I'm not afraid of her. May I help you, Lady Stark?
I'm sorry, I shouldn't have-
You've made them before?
Did they work?
(Nods.)
Which boy?
And he lived.
Hold still.
I don't know. What do they say about him?
True.
True. You're a Lannister, aren't you?
Martyn Lannister. You've nothing to fear. My husband doesn't eat children. Unless it's a full moon. It's not a full moon tonight, is it? See? Nothing to fear.
Your mother's right. If you do this, the Karstarks will abandon you.
And more boys will keep dying until this war is over. You need Karstark men to end it.
Come to bed.
Don't let him.
We could ride north. Take your land back from the Greyjoys. Wait out the winter.
Give them a new purpose.
Oh, I don't know. I don't even know where Winterfell is.
What is it?
Can you do it?
I've spent the last two years nursing wounded men, watching them bleed and die. I'm not afraid of wet shits.
Attack. Attack.
My mother.
Gaaa.
Rytsas.
That was close enough.
Not yet.
Many surprises for her.
Will you come with me one day to Volantis? When all this is over?
I promise. I know she'd love to meet you. And her grandchild.
Are you angry with me?
And I have your little prince or princess inside me.
Don't get greedy.
Can you leave the war for one night?
[Looking at the band and talking to LOTHAR] They’re good, aren’t they?
Your mother is less in need of rescue than any woman I’ve ever met.
And I like her. But if she had her way, I would be back in Volantis, playing my harp and you would be sitting over there [Looks at EDMURE and ROSLIN], eating blackberries out of Roslin Frey’s hand.
No, don’t. Don’t insult them.
That is a very strange custom.
It seems normal to you?
No, but there are other ways of providing proof.
I don’t know. But if it’s a boy, I know what we should name him.
Eddard. [Catches ROBB by surprise] Don’t you want to teach little Ned Stark how to ride horses?

2.text: We should be there by sundown. Won't be a fun night for you. Mance knows how to make crows sing. If you know what to say, you might just make it through the night. Not talking's not the way to go.
You can tell Mance that's the man who killed Qhorin Halfhand.
Come along, Jon Snow.
Time to meet the King-beyond-the-Wall.
Ygritte.
I gave you my name.
You ought to burn them you killed.
Burn them or maybe you'll need those swords again.
The free folk.
Hundreds and thousands. More than you've ever seen, crow.
Qhorin Halfhand.
They'd take your head off your shoulders if they was feeling kind. If not, they'd kill you slow.
You never killed a woman before, did you? You don't need to do it. Mance would take you. I know he would. There's secret ways. The crows would never catch us.
Will you burn me? After?
Strike hard and true, Jon Snow, or I'll come back and haunt you. That's cold.
Do it. Bastard, do it!
You can't do it. We both know it.
The sun's going down, Jon Snow. And your friends are nowhere close.
Call for them. Go on. Call loudly.
Your brothers desert you? I can tell you which way to go.
Here? There's no shelter here.
There is if you know where to look. The cold could kill us both. If you light a fire
But a fire is
Have it your way.
We'll stay warmer if we stay close.
Bet you freeze to death before I do. Bet your life.
Think they're out looking for you?
Think they'll find you?
You're brave. Stupid, but brave.
I'm just trying to get comfortable.
Was I? I didn't notice that time.
Did you pull a knife on me in the night?
What's the matter? Can't be the first time you pressed your bone against a woman's arse.
It is the first time. How old are you, boy?
You're a boy who's never been with a girl. Don't your stones start to hurt if your bone never gets
What, stones? Or bone?

I heard they get all swollen and bruised if you don't use them. Of course, maybe that's just what the lads say when they want me feeling sorry for them. As if I'd feel sorry for them. Are there no girl crows?
So the lads just do it with each other?
Never?
You have sheep at the Wall? With your hands, then? No wonder you're all so miserable.
Would you please shut up? You think you're better than me, crow. - I'm a free woman.
And you think you're free? You swore some stupid oath and now you can never touch a girl.
So you don't like girls?
So instead of getting naked with a girl, you'd prefer to invade our lands
Yhey're not your lands! We've been here the whole time. You lot came along and just put up a big wall and said it was yours.
So why are you fighting us?

You think we're savages because we don't live in stone castles. We can't make steel as good as yours, it's true, but We're free. If someone tried to tell us we couldn't lie down as man and woman, we'd shove a spear up his arse. We don't go serving some shit king who's only king because his father was.

We chose Mance Rayder to lead us. He was a crow, same as you, but he wanted to be free. You could be free, too. You don't need to live your whole life taking commands from old men. Wake up when you want to wake up. I could show you the streams to fish, the woods to hunt. Build yourself a cabin and find a woman to lie with in the night.
You're a pretty lad. The girls would claw each other's eyes out to get naked with you.
I could teach you how to do it.
You know nothing, Jon Snow.
How long till we get back to your crows?
What, a day? A half-day? You don't know, do you? Do you even know where they are?
What do you think they'll say when they hear about you and me?

"I swear it, Old Master King Crow, ser, "we were only close together for warmth. "And then I felt it, right up against me backside like a club. "I can show you the bruise on me tailbone. "And before I knew what was where, his his "Well, it was all out in the open, all angry as you like. "And I didn't want to want it, but oh, I did! "And he spread me legs and ruined. "The shame of it. "Now I can never marry a perfumed lord. "What will me poor savage father say?"

"And I thought that we were done, but he said, "'Turn back around." I'll tell you what, Jon Snow. Since it's gonna be your word against mine, and since you can't talk about it without blushing, we may as well just JON
I'll keep you warm enough.
Are you that afraid of it?
It's nice and wet and warm.
It don't have teeth.
All right! All right. Gods, you're dull.
Should have took me while you had the chance.
I've brought you a present, Lord of Bones.
Mance will want to question this one. Knows all about where the crows are and what they're planning.
He could have killed me half a dozen times.
He's a bastard of Winterfell, Ned Stark's son.
I don't know. I think he'll want to decide for himself.
He runs, I'll do it meself.
We're even now, Jon Snow.

3.text: First time you've seen a giant, Jon Snow?
Well, don't stare too long. They're shy. When they stop being shy, they get angry. And when they're angry, I've seen them pound a man straight into the ground like a hammer on a nail.
You're wearing the wrong color.
In your hearts, all you crows want to fly free.
Sure, you will.
And I'll be free to kill you. Got no respect, this lot. Got no fathers to slap 'em when they're foul.
Some of them were killed by crows like you. Don't look so grim, Jon Snow. If Mance Rayder likes you, you'll live another day. And if he don't...
This baby killed Qhorin Halfhand. He wants to be one of us.
(grunts)
You know nothing, Jon Snow.
What, you've never met a warg?
You said there was dead crows.
He's no crow.
I'm not afraid of you.
Of course you do. Who stopped Rattleshirt when he was about to cut your throat? Who vouched for you with Mance? It seems you owe me a debt.
Well, I stole it. It's mine. If you want it, come steal it back.
Is Orell right? Are you still a crow? It's time you proved yourself.
You swore some vows. I want you to break 'em. I want you to see me.
All of me.
We should.
Why are you still dressed? You know nothing, Jon Sno--
That thing you did with your mouth-- is that what lords do to their ladies in the South?
Hmm.
Aye, I liked it some. Who taught you that?
A maid. You were a maid.
What do you think?

Just a boy. He came trading with his brothers. He had red hair like me. Kissed by fire. But he was weak. Not like you. That was the first one. Then there was this Thenn boy. Spoke no Common, but gods, he was built like a mammoth.
I'm not done with you yet.
How long's it been since you had a bath?
Let's not go back. Let's stay here a while longer. I don't ever want to leave this cave, Jon Snow. Not ever.
No. But Tormund's done it half a hundred times. You're afraid.
Aye. It's a long way up and a long way down. But I've waited my whole life to see the world from up there. Here, sit down.
I brought a pair for you. They're too big for you, but they're good.
Nah. I didn't kill him, but I bet his balls are still bruised.
He wasn't good to me the way you're good to me. He didn't do that thing you do with your tongue.
'Can we not talk about that here? I'm Jon Snow. I've killed dead men and Qhorin Halfhand, but I'm scared of naked girls.'
You were trembling like a leaf.
Only in the beginning. You're a proper lover, Jon Snow. And don't worry. Your secret's safe with me.
Do you think I'm as dumb as all those girls in silk dresses you knew growing up? You're loyal and you're brave. You didn't stop being a crow the day you walked into Mance Rayder's tent.

But I'm your woman now, Jon Snow. You're going to be loyal to your woman. The Night's Watch don't care if you live or die. Mance Rayder don't care if I live or die. We're just soldiers in their armies and there's plenty more to carry on if we go down.
It's you and me that matters to me and you. Don't ever betray me.
'Cause I'll cut your pretty cock right off and wear it 'round my neck.
You staring at my ass, Jon Snow?
You all right?
(screams)
(screams)
(screams)
(screams)
How far are we?
You think? You don't know?
You and your roads. Is that how you lot do your fighting? You march down the road banging drums and waving banners?
How do the men holding the banners fight?
And the drummers-- is that a great honor, too?
So what good are they?
How?

Oh, you mean right foot, left foot, right foot, left foot, right foot? You need help remembering that? When Mance gives the signal and we hit Castle Black, we won't be banging on drums to let them know we're coming.
You know nothing, Jon Snow.
No, he didn't tell me anything. He barely talks.
What, you're jealous?
And you're one of my own? I've never heard a kind word from your mouth.
(nods)
Don't touch me.
I'm not gonna scare it. I'm gonna kill it.
(smiles)
Is that a palace?
Windmill. Who built it? Some king?
They must have been great builders, stacking stones so high.
'I'm Jon Snow and I'm from Winterfell. My daddy was a fancy lord and I lived in a tower that touched the clouds.'
What's swooning?
What's fainting?
Why would a girl see blood and collapse?
Well, girls see more blood than boys. Or do you like girls who swoon, Jon Snow? (gasps) Oh, a spider! Save me, Jon Snow.
My dress is made of the purest silk from Tralalalaleeday.
Would you?
Well, you rip my pretty silk dress, I'll blacken your eye.
Or maybe one day I'll take you there. After we've taken our land back.
You know nothing--
And how do you know that?
Mance is different.
You don't know that.
All of us.
You're mine as I'm yours. And if we die, we die. But first we'll live.
How’s he keep folks from stealing them?
He’s an old man. A spear through the heart’s a better way to die than coughing up your last with no one but your horses to hear.
[Looks at Jon] Do it. Do it.
No!

4.text: Do you plan on sitting here scratching your balls till winter?
You sent a man over the Wall at the full moon. If he's not back yet, he's not coming back.
Yeah, well, he's a liar.
I did.
I'm not anybody's.
Yes.

I know you never fucked a bear. You know you never fucked a bear. Right now I don't wanna think about the bear you never fucked. Right now all I want to think about is each one of these arrows finding its way into a Crow's heart.

Good. The longer we wait, the more arrows I'll have. When they came up here, to our land, and put up a big wall and said it was their's. Then they started hunting us down. But this time, we're the one's doing the hunting.
Back in those villages I killed just as many of them as you did. More, I reckon.
I probably killed him already.
And if not. The only thing left of him is gonna be his fun-bits hanging around me neck.
What, you been thinkin' about that ginger minge? Wondering what it tastes like?
Jon Snow is mine. *shouting* Anyone else tries to kill him, I'll have an arrow for them. *to Styr* And not one of your bald friends is fast enough to stop me.
Most of their men are up top. Didn't count more than twenty down there. Leftovers. They've got a little fat one and a little bony one manning the front.
Well, we'll be up and over before they know what's happened.
Jon Snow.
Do you remember that cave?
We should've stayed in that cave.
You know nothing, Jon Snow.

name: Gendry
aliases: Ser Gendry of the hollow hill

1.text: Your like picking on the little ones, do you? l've been hammering an anvil these past 10 years. When l hit that steel, it sings. Are you gonna sing when l hit you? (Hot Pie leaves, scared. Gendry talks to Arya alone) This is castle-forged steel. Where'd you steal it?
lt don't matter now. Where we're going, they don't care what you've done. They've got rapers, pickpockets, highwaymen, murderers.
Armourer's apprentice. But my master got sick of me, so here l am.
It's not for sale.
I made it for me.
He just asked me questions is all, my Lord.
About my work at first, if I was being treated well, if I liked it here. But then he started asking me about my mother.
Who she was, what she looked like.
She died when I was little. She had yellow hair. She'd sing to me sometimes.

2.text: Yoren said none of us were should go near of those three.
Hmm? Then you're stupid. They scare me.
What are you doing?
Now who told you that.
How'd you know he was a knight?
You don't have to be a knight to have armor. Any idiot can buy armor. (Arya smiles).
‘Cause I sold armor.
(Turning around) No idea.
(Walking to camp fire). You shouldn't insult people that are bigger than you.
Well, I don’t care what any of them want. No good's ever come of their questions.
How can someone so small be such a huge pain in my ass?
The Hand of the King. Er, hands of the King. Lord Arryn came first, a few weeks before he died. And then Lord Stark came, a few weeks before he died.
See? Asking me questions is bad luck. (Walks back to river). You'll probably be dead soon.
My mom.
Just my mom. Worked in a tavern. Died when I was little.
He could be one of those gold-hatted bastards, for all I know. What about you, anyway? You thought they were after you, why? Did you kill someone, or is it just because you're a girl?
(Walks back to camp fire). Yes you are. You think I'm as stupid as the rest of them?
That's true. You're still a girl.
Well, pull your cock out and take a piss then.
They won't. Not from me.
He was your father. The Hand. The traitor.
So you're a highborn, then. You're a lady.
You were a lord's daughter and you lived in a castle. Look, all that about cocks. I should never have said that. I've been pissing in front of you and everything. I should be calling you milady.
As milady commands. (Arya pushes him). Well, that was unladylike.
Get up.
I can fight.
No, all the dragons are dead.
They take someone every day?
I'm not from the village.
I don't know what that is.
Smith, my lord.
Sideface?
Why?
Am I fighting someone?
You need him?
Shut up.
What about the guards?
What, he left that bit out? It's a pretty important part, don't you think?
Trust him? You trusted him to fight with us when you set him free and he ran.
Arry, don't.

3.text: Great. Never better.
I should have known. Every time a highborn asks my name, it's trouble. We're not really people to you, are we? Just a million different ways to get what you want.
She called you Ser. I heard it.
Sure, you were. You're my friend. You're here to help.
How far below? How close to the Red Keep were you?
Gin Alley.
Yeah, we've come a long way. We're all the same, really. She went to great pains to point that out to me.
You're me. Never been with a woman. Never talked to a woman, really. And then she comes at you-- big words, no clothes. What would you have done?
So how'd you become a lord?
Better not, then. I'm a bit busy.
You see? Highborns.
Why did you?
Does he?
How'd he die?
What are you doing?
Is this some kind of trick?
I know not to drink seawater.
Where should I go?
The gold cloaks are looking for me.
No.
No.
You know how to swim?
No.
Why are you doing this?
I'm just trying to understand.
Jaqen H'ghar offered you three kills.
But just explain it to me. He offered to kill any three people you wanted. Dead. All you had to do was give him the names. Anyone. You could have picked King Joffrey.
You could have picked Tywin Lannister.
But you could have ended the war.
North.
Maybe we already passed it.
Could be a minstrel.
King's Landing. Tobho Mott's shop.
That's because he's twice as good.
If I had a proper forge, I could make it good as new.
You're what?
Yes, it is.
Well, be safe.
You don't burn your fingers.
I'd have some.
What is this place?
Arya, don't!
Just mending Lord Beric's armor.
I'm going to stay on and smith for the Brotherhood.
The Lannisters wanted to kill me long before I joined the Brotherhood.
I want to. They need good men.

What? Serve him? I've served men my entire life. I served Master Mott at King's Landing and he sold me to the Watch. I served Lord Tywin at Harrenhal, wondering every day if I'd get tortured or killed. I'm done serving.
He may be their leader, but they chose him. These men are brothers. They're a family. I've never had a family.
You wouldn't be my family. You'd be 'my lady.
Yeah, nothing tricky about it. Just need decent steel.
(laughs)
You told me this was a Brotherhood. You told me I could be one of you.
What happened?
After all the running and fighting, here I am, back where I started.
King's Landing?
Never had a father. Never wanted one.
I'm lowborn. As low as can be. My mother was a tavern wench.
I was born in Flea Bottom.
Are you saying my father, he was some lord or
I'm just a bastard.
I've never seen anything like any of this. Not in my life.
In Flea Bottom we called them bowls of brown. We'd pretend that the meat in them was chicken. We knew it wasn't chicken.
That's good.
That's really good.
I couldn't even guess.
That thought had crossed my mind, yeah.
I'm a mistake. I'm only here because my father grabbed my mother instead of the girl next to her in the tavern.
I don't understand. This-- this doesn't seem very religious.
What are you doing?
What--? Get it away. Get it off me.
Why are you doing this?
No. No, no, no, no! Not there. Not there!
Please. Please, Your Grace. My lord!
(cries out)

7.text: Weren't you worried about the Goldcloaks?
Here I am arming Lannisters. I never get a second look. You were right. Safest place for me was right under the queen's nose.
You came to get me. You want me to come with you.
I'm ready. Let's go.
Don't you think I've been thinking about it every swing of the hammer... how happy I am making weapons for the family that killed my father? They tried to kill me.
I've been getting ready. I never knew what for, but I've always known I'd know it when it comes.
I don't know much about swinging swords, but this --
-- this I know.
Who should I say I am?
That they are. I try to stay away from them to avoid good men such as yourselves.
I understand.
You don't have to worry.
Understood.
It's Gendry, Your Grace. I'm Robert Baratheon's son. Bastard son.
Our fathers trusted each other. Why shouldn't we?
I met yours in my shop.
You're a lot shorter.
All I ever knew was they fought together and won. Ser Davos told me where you're going, Your Grace, and why. Let me come with you.
No, but I'm a fighter. And he won't be needing a smith with a sword like that.
I prefer a hammer.
I owe you my life. Twice over. But if what you said is true about what's out there, I can't wait out this war.
Don't trust them. Don't trust any of them.
They're the Brotherhood. And the last thing their Lord told them to do was sell me to a Red Witch to be murdered.
How can we be?
Never seen snow before.
How do you live up here? How do you keep your balls from freezing off?
You sold me to a witch.
I wanted to be one of you. I wanted to join the Brotherhood but you sold me off like a slave. Do you know what she did to me? She strapped me down on a bed, she stripped me naked --
-- and put leeches on me.
Yes. Thank you. I know that.
She wanted to kill me. They would have killed me if it wasn't for Davos --
I'm not whinging.

8.text: Hey, careful, lads. We need every last bit of it.
Are these the last of the wagons?
All right, let's get it all to the forges.
It isn't easy making a blade that big with dragonglass.
I'm just saying it's a tricky material to-
Yeah, thanks. So have you.
I mean, you look good.
It's not a bad place to grow up, if it wasn't so cold.
Is that a command, Lady Stark?
As you wish, milady.
What do you need something like this for?
You already have a sword. What's that?
It's Valyrian steel. I always knew you were just another rich girl.
Don't you have something better to do?
Just as soon as I'm done making a few thousand of these.
It's strong enough.
It's going to be safer down in the crypt, you know.
No, but-
I've done my share.
I did. Some of them.
A few. That was enough.
Bad. Really bad.
Look, I know you want to fight. And I know you're not scared of rapers or murderers or-This is different. This is-This is death. You want to know what they're like? Death. That's what they're like.
I'll get right on it.
Last time you saw me, you wanted me to come to Winterfell. Took the long road, but…
She wanted my blood for some kind of spell.
I'm Robert Baratheon's bastard. I didn't know until she told me. Then she tied me up, stripped me down, put leeches all over me.
No, yeah, I've never had leeches put all over my cock.
What? I-I didn't-I wasn't with her.
Yes, I was.
Well, I didn't keep count.
Three.
Arya, I-
Have you seen Arya?
I just want to thank her for--
Look, it's not about that.
Yes, Your Grace.
(nods)
I didnâ€™t even know he was my father until after he was dead.
I donâ€™t know, Your Grace.
I can't be. I'm a bastard.
Don't shoot.
It's nighttime, it's freezing, and everyone's celebrating. You should be celebrating with them.
Yeah, I am too. I'm not Gendry Rivers anymore. I'm Gendry Baratheon, Lord of Storm's End. By order of the queen.

I don't know how to be lord of anything. I hardly know how to use a fork. All I know is that you're beautiful, and I love you, and none of it will be worth anything if you're not with me. So be with me.
Be my wife. Be the Lady of Storm's End.
Aye.

3.text: I smell a crow.
What do we want with a baby crow?
That half-handed cunt killed friends of mine. Friends twice your size.
Plenty of little men tried to put their swords through my heart. And there's plenty of little skeletons buried in the woods. What's your name, boy?
Your Grace?
Don't panic, boy. This isn't the damned Night's Watch where we make you swear off girls.
Can't believe this pup killed the Halfhand.
