Shouldn't be long now.
We're finally going to war, old friend?
We'll meet again.
Orell says there are crows patrolling on the Wall. Tell me what you know.
(sighs) There are 19 castles guarding the Wall. How many are manned?
How many men remain in Castle Black?
I like you, boy. But if you lie to me, I'll pull your guts out through your throat.
We'll find out soon enough.
Used to be you couldn't find a tree within a mile of the Wall. Crows would come out every morning with axes.
Sink your metal deep and make sure it holds before taking your next step. And if you fall, don't scream. You don't want that to be the last thing she remembers.
Look out!
Just seeing if you can take a hit, lad.
(grunts)
(grunts)
No!
Most men fuck like dogs.

No grace, no skill. A few dozen thrusts and done. You need to be patient. Give her time. Your cock shouldn't go near her till she's slick as a baby seal. And then you go inside, but slowly. Don't jam it in like you're spearing a pig. (laughts) Come on! Hey, come on.
What’s one old man doing with eight horses?
And proper steel.
I hope so. Killing crows in their castle is tough. Killing them out here in the open, that’s what we do.
Spread out. Surround the hut and move in.
Clear the barn!
Thunder.
Maybe it's ghosts.
That won’t help you, grandpa.
Where you riding?
No, it doesn’t matter now.
You understand.
Go on, boy.
Go on!
Kill him!
He’s one of them!
Do you hear me?
You’re not gonna die for one of them.

4.text: You plan on killing all the crows yourself?
We wait for Mance's orders.
And what is it you want? March on Castle Black with just this lot? Your pretty crow said 1,000 men are nesting there.
He is? Shouldn't it be "he was"? You said you put three arrows in him.
I've seen you slip a shaft through a rabbit's eye at 200 yards. If that boy's still walking, it's 'cause you let him go.
Thenns. I fucking hate Thenns.
Mance sent you?
How did you find us?
You came from the south, not the north.
Help yourself.
I'll answer to Mance. I won't answer to you.
Your old blind man patched me up. Why?
You want me alive so you can torture me?
So how do we die? Hanging? Beheading? Drop us from the top of the wall?
Who decides?
He your king now?
You spent too much time with us, Jon Snow. You can never be a kneeler again.
Words? What kind of words?
Do what?
The dead can't hear us, boy.
Snow. Did you love her? She loved you.
No. All she ever talked about was killing you. That's how I know. She belongs in the North. The real North. You understand me?
Did I ever tell you about her? My Sheila?

Oh that was a night to remember. Of course, I'd had a good bit to drink *laughs* the fangs were sharp, but she knew how to use them. And she was nice and soft down below. No, she was no ordinary beast. Many's the man who--
We could be waiting here a while.
Let's kill some Crows!
*yells* Come on! *puts out the fire*
You, over there.
This is how a man ends.
I should've thrown you from the top of your wall boy!

5.text: They followed Mance. They won't follow anyone else.
Hard to lead when you're in chains.
Why would you do that?
You sure seemed like my enemy when you were killing my friends.
And now everything is going to change?
Why now?
What would you have me do, (Leans forward), Lord Commander?
They won't kneel for you and neither will I.
The day I ask my people to fight with the crows is the day my people cut my guts from my belly and make me eat them.
(Stands up). Easy thing to say to a man in chains.
Most of them are at Hardhome. You know where that is?
We'll need ships.

All right, then. You're coming with me. You're the Lord Commander of the Night's Watch. They need to hear it from you. They need to know the ships they are boarding wonâ€™t be torched in the middle of the sea. You come with me, or I don't go.
You trust me Jon Snow?
We are fools together now.
Lord of Bones. Been a long time.
War.
We should gather the elders find somewhere quiet to talk.
I’m not giving an order.
I don’t fight for the crows.
Gather the elders and let’s talk.

None of you saw Mance die! I did. The Southern King who broke our army, Stannis, wanted to burn him alive to send him a message. Jon Snow defied that cunt’s orders. His arrow was mercy. What it did took courage, and that’s what we need today
He’s prettier than both my daughters, but he knows how to fight. He’s young, but he knows how to lead. He didn’t have to come to Hardhome. He came because he needs us. And we need him.
This is the way.
I’m not good at counting.
The free folk are stubborn. You know how long it took Mance to band them together. 20 fucking years.
They’re running out of food and there’s nothing to hunt. They’ll come around.
If they get through, everyone dies !
Wun Wun, to the sea.

6.text: We didn’t invade. We were invited.
Until you.
Took a lot of knives. I’ll have my men get the wood for a fire. Bodies to burn.
They think you’re some kind of god. The man who returned from the dead.
I know that.
I saw your pecker. What kind of god would have a pecker that small?
How many men does he have in his army?
That can march and fight? 2,000. The rest are children and old people.
If it weren’t for him, none of us would be here. All of you would be meat in the Night King’s army. And I’d be a pile of charred bones just like Mance.

The crows killed him because he spoke for the free folk when no other southerners would. He died for us. If we are not willing to do the same for him, we’re cowards. And if that’s what we are, we deserve to be the last of the free folk.
We’re not clever like you southerners. When we say we’ll do something, we do it.
It’s not his men that worry me. It’s his horses. I know what mounted knights can do to us.
You and Stannis cut through us like piss through snow.
Good.
Rest, Jon Snow. We need you sharp tomorrow.
I’ve never seen these Bolton fuckers fight. And they’ve never seen the free folk fight, so, yes, there’s hope. You want to avenge your king, don’t you?
You saw these demons?

Oh. Well, you loved that cunt Stannis and I loved the man he burned. Mance didn’t have demons in his skull. He didn’t torch people or listen to some red witch. I believed in him. I thought he was the man to lead us through the Long Night. But I was wrong just like you.
Jon Snow’s not a king.
I need a good drink to help me sleep the night before a fight. You want some? I have a jug of sour goat’s milk stronger than any of that grape water you southern twats like sucking on.
So what do you do all night?
Happy shitting.
Run and fight!
Hey!
Fuck this, come on!

7.text: You want us to man the castles for you?
Then that's where I'll go. Looks like we're the Night's Watch now.
You're a lucky man.
Isn't it your job to talk him out of stupid fucking ideas like this?
How many queens are there now?
And you need to convince the one with the dragons or the one who fucks her brother?
How many men did you bring?
The big woman?
You are.
You really want to go out there again?
You're not the only ones.
My scouts found them a mile south of the Wall. Said they were on their way here.
They want to go beyond the Wall too.
You're a fucking Mormont? Like the last Lord Commander?
He hunted us like animals.
Beautiful, eh? I can breath again. Down south the air smells like pig shit.
I've been to Winterfell.
You have to keep moving. That's the secret. Walking is good, fighting is better, fucking is best.
We have to make due with what we've got.
This one is maybe not so smart.
Good. That's more important than being smart.
Smart people don't come up here looking for the dead. So, you met this Dragon Queen, huh? And?

You spent too much time with the free folk and now you don't like kneeling. Mance Rayder was a great man, a proud man. The king beyond the wall never bent the knee. How many of his people died for his pride?
Youâ€™re the one they call the dog.
They told me you were mean. Were you born mean or you just hate Wildlings?
Gingers are beautiful. We are kissed by fire. Just like you.
Did you trip into the fire when you were a baby?
Ever since you've been mean.
I don't think you're truly mean. You have sad eyes.
Dick?
Ah. Dick. I like it.
Nope. It's pussy for me. I have a beauty waiting for me back at Winterfell. If I ever get back there. Yellow hair. Blue eyes. Tallest woman you've ever seen. Almost as tall as you.
You know her?
Well, not with her yet, but I see the way she looks at me.
You do know her.
I want to make babies with her. Think of the great big monsters. They'd conquer the world.
I'm good at killing people.
Yeah. The crows keep telling me I'll get used to it.
Come on! Run! Run!

8.text: I've always had blue eyes!
His army's between us and Winterfell. We're on foot.
If the horses last, we'll get there before the dead.
We just have to hope the Night King doesn't come first-
My little crow.
Almost.
The dead got there first.
We had to travel around them to get here. Whoever's not here now is with them.
Before the sun comes up tomorrow.
The big woman still here?
We're all going to die.
But at least we die together.
It could be our last night in this world, you know.
Brought my own.
They call you "King Killer."
They call me "Giantsbane." Want to know why?
I killed a giant when I was 10. Then I climbed right into bed with his wife.
When she woke up, you know what she did? Suckled me at her teat for three months. Thought I was her baby. That's how I got so strong. Giant's milk.
She's not a ser? You're not a knight?
Why not?
Fuck tradition.
I'm no king. But if I were, I'd knight you 10 times over.
Mm-mm.
All of it.
We have to celebrate our victory.
Yes, it is.
Ah! To the Dragon Queen!
I'm fine!
I saw him riding that thing.
No. No. I saw him riding that thing.
I did. That's why we all agreed to follow him. That's the kind of man he is.
(laughing) He's little but he's strong. Strong enough to befriend an enemy and get murdered for it!
Most people get bloody murdered, they stay that way.
Not this one.
Ah! He comes back and keeps fighting. Here, north of the Wall, and then back here again. He keeps fighting. He keeps fighting.
He climbed on a fucking dragon and fought. What kind of person climbs on a fucking dragon? A madman or a king!
We did it! We faced those icy fucks. Looked right into their blue eyes, and here we are. Now, which one of you cowards shit in my pants?
Maybe you should be.
Well, Clegane it's time to drown our sorrows.
You're not gonna ride the dragon south?
(scoffs). You weigh as much as two fleas fucking.
I'm taking the Free Folk home. We've had enough of the south. The women down here don't like me.
It isn't home. We need room to wander. I'll take them back through Castle Black as soon as the winter storms pass. Back where we belong.
So would you.
You never know.
You've got the North in you. The real North.

2.text: Walk.
One or two tried.
Not interested.
I don't serve the Starks. I serve Lady Catelyn.
Burying them.
I think these women would understand if I don't care what you think.
Traveling a prisoner.
If you've quite finished up
All right, we'll be going.
The Starks.
No, stealing is a crime.
To Riverrun.
Steal from the Tullys, it's their dungeons you rot in.
I don't give the orders. He must be important to someone.
I hope you gave them quick deaths.
If this is the Kingslayer, I think I'd know about it.
He's not the Kingslayer. Sorry to disappoint you. If he was, I'd only be traveling his head.
Two quick deaths.
I don't serve the Starks. I serve Lady Catelyn. I told you I'd take you to King's Landing, and that's what I'm going to do. Stay.
Your Grace, I ask the honor of a place in your Kingsguard.
I will be one of your seven, pledge my life to yours, and keep you safe from all harm.
And you should kneel when you approach the King.
At once, Your Grace. Shall I return after?
If you'll follow me, my lady.
I fought for my king. Soon I'll fight for him on the battlefield. Die for him if I must. And, if it please you, Brienne's enough. I'm no lady.
No! No.
I won't leave him.
Not that way.
It looked like Stannis.
In the shape of Stannis.
Will you stay there long, my lady?
I never knew my mother.
It's a bloody business.
Once you're safely back amongst your own people, will you give me leave to go, my lady?
I swore a vow.
I only held him that once as he was dying.

I do not know your son, my lady. But I could serve you, if you would have me. You have courage. Not battle courage, perhaps, but, I don't know, a woman's kind of courage. And I think that when the time comes, you will not hold me back. Promise me that you will not hold me back from Stannis.
Then I am yours, my lady. I will shield your back and give my life for yours, if it comes to that. I swear it by the Old Gods and the new.
No farther.
Don't enter without an invitation, man.
Threatening my lady is an act of treason.
Your son returns at dawn, my lady?
The Kingslayer won't last the night. The more they drink, the angrier they'll get. And when the Karstarks draw their swords Who wants to die defending a Lannister?
Brienne of Tarth.
Your crimes are past forgiveness, Kingslayer.
You've harmed others, those you were sworn to protect, the weak, the innocent.
You will not provoke me to anger.
I've never seen you fight.
All my life men like you have sneered at me. And all my life I've been knocking men like you into the dust.
Do you take me for an idiot? In!
Maybe one day we'll find out, Kingslayer.

3.text: Yes.
By putting one foot in front of the other.
I'm here to take you to King's Landing and bring back Lady Stark's daughters in exchange. Dull is fine.
If Lady Stark is unhappy with any aspect of my service, I'm sure she'll let me know. She's an honest woman.
Not your concern, Kingslayer.
How would you know?
Move.
Gods, no.
Shut your mouth.
I knew him as well as anyone. As a member of his Kingsguard, he trusted me with everything. He would have been a wonderful king.
I did not fancy him.
I'm not interested in foul rumors.
Shut your mouth!
South. You?
And you.
He doesn't.
We're not doing it. He's an innocent man.
Silence, Kingslayer.
Good luck.
Be quick about it.
Get up.
Get up now.
You were armed when we were taken.
All my life I've been hearing, 'Jaime Lannister, what a brilliant swordsman.' You were slower than I expected. And more predictable.
And I'm a woman. I was still beating you.
Maybe you were as good as people said once. Or maybe people just love to overpraise a famous name.
Would I?
You think I care about my teeth?
What does it matter?
If you were a woman, you wouldn't resist? You'd let them do what they wanted?
My lord, I am Brienne of Tarth. Lady Catelyn Stark commanded me to deliver Ser Jaime to King's Landing.
(screams)
He's going to fall. He's going to fall off his horse. Someone help him.
Stop!
Eat. What are you doing?
You can't die. You need to live to take revenge.
You coward. A little misfortune and you're giving up.
You lost your hand.
You have a taste-- one taste of the real world where people have important things taken from them and you whine and cry and quit. You sound like a bloody woman.
I know what you did for me. You told them Tarth was full of sapphires. It's called the Sapphire Isle because of the blue of its water. You knew that. Why did you help me?
Thank you, my lord. Roose BOLTON
What are you doing here?
There's another tub.
Why should I care how you die?
Don't you mock me.
You need trust to have a truce.
Of course.
If this is true why didn't you tell anyone? Why didn't you tell Lord Stark?
Help! Help! The Kingslayer!
Yes. Most kind of them. You're a Stark bannerman, Lord Bolton. I am acting on Lady Stark's orders to return Jaime Lannister to King's Landing. Roose BOLTON
I am charged with bringing Ser Jaime to--
I thought you were gone.
Have they told you what they plan to do with me?
With Locke?
When Catelyn Stark released you, we both made a promise to her. Now it's your promise. You gave your word. Keep it and consider the debt paid.
Good-bye, Ser Jaime.
Ah!
I will not.
Hold my legs.
Pull him up!

4.text: My lady. My lady. Please pardon me for interrupting. My name is Brienne of Tarth.
My lady, I know this is a very busy time for you, but if I could just have a moment.
A shadow with the face of Stannis Baratheon. I swear to you by all the gods it was Stannis. He plunged his sword through Renly's heart and disappeared. One day, my lady, I will avenge our king.
I meant no offense.
There she is.
And? You made a promise.
To keep them safe.
A complication does not release you from a vow.
Look me in the eye and tell me that you think she'll be safe in King's Landing.
Podrick. Podrick! Where are the horses?
What sort of hobble?
If you did it like I taught you then the horses would be here.
It’s at least thirty miles to the Eyrie from here. You’re carrying the saddle bags.
Morning!
I like your sword. Are we getting close to the bloody gate?
Did you hear that Podrick? Only about ten more miles to the Bloody Gate.
No.
I do.
“Oathkeeper.”
Good name.
My father.
Mine said the same. But I kept fighting the boys anyway. Kept losing. Finally my father said, “If you’re going to do it, you might as well do it right.”
Seven blessings. I’m Brienne of Tarth, this is Podrick Payne.
You’re Arya Stark.
I swore to your mother I would bring you home to her.
I know. I wish I could’ve been there to protect her.
I know, but I swore a sacred vow to protect her.
She commanded me to bring Jaime Lannister back to King’s Landing.
I’m not paid by the Lannisters.
Jaime Lannister gave me this sword.
I swore to your mother by the Old Gods and the New -
Arya!
She is.
Come with me Arya. I’ll take you to safety.
And that’s what you’re doing? Watching over her?
I have no wish to kill you Ser.
Arya! Arya! ARYA! Where is she?
Why weren’t you watching her?
Which way Pod? Which way did she go?
Arya!
Your Grace. My king. - My queen.
I'm no lady, Your Grace.
Apologies, Your Grace. I never did master the curtsy.
I just wanted to congratulate you both and wish you good fortune. The country has been at war too long. I hope your reign is long and peaceful.
As you say, Your Grace.
In truth, he rescued me, Your Grace. More than once.
Not such a fascinating story, I'm afraid.
I don't serve your brother, Your Grace.
Your Grace.

"Ser Jaime Lannister. Knighted and named to the Kingsguard in his 16th year. At the sack of King's Landing, murdered his king Aerys II. Pardoned by Robert Baratheon. Thereafter known as the Kingslayer."
Valyrian steel.
I can't accept this.
I'll find her. For Lady Catelyn. And for you.
I don't need a squire.
He'll slow me down.
Oathkeeper.
Didn't they teach you how to ride a horse?
Perhaps you should have stayed with him. It's not going to be a pleasant journey for you. It could take weeks to get to the Wall, depending on the weather.
Well, Lady Sansa's brother's at Castle Black. If I were her, that's where I'd go. Feel free to stop at any point.
I've made it this far in the world without a squire. I don't see why I need one now.
I'm not a knight. And I'm not a slaver, either. I don't own you.
I am releasing you from that oath. That means you could leave.
What do you think will happen if you leave?
Did you remove the skin?
Have you ever cooked a rabbit before?
Did you ever cook anything for Lord Tyrion?
What are you doing?
I've been removing my own armor for quite some time, thank you very much.
What exactly did you do for Lord Tyrion?
Oh. Whilst in Lord Tyrion's service, did you ever do anything remotely related to combat?
Who?
How did you kill a Kingsguard?
Bloody ridiculous. Help me with these straps.
Bit of comfort never hurt anyone. We've been sleeping in ditches the last few weeks. I think we can treat ourselves to a featherbed for the night and a hot meal not cooked by you.
Just don't start expecting silk underclothes. Not working for your former lord any longer.
Don't get drunk.
No, this will do nicely, thank you. Kidney pie is wonderful.
No.
We're looking for someone.
A girl, tall, red hair, very pretty. Her name is Sansa Stark, but she may be using a different name.
I pledged my life to their mother Catelyn Stark. I swore to her I'd bring her daughters home.
What?
You wouldn't be screwing your face up like that if it was nothing.
You're not interesting enough to be offensive.
What about? Not kidney pie.
No one's seen Arya Stark since her father was beheaded. She's presumed dead.
When was that?
So what happened to her?
The quick version.
Um, you were saying?
Her mother's dead, grandfather's dead, Walder Frey is the new lord of Riverrun. The Brotherhood isn't going to Riverrun.
Why the Eyrie?
Sansa could be there, too.
You sure about this?

5.text: Us? The only reason you’re here is that Jaime Lannister told me you weren’t safe in the capital. You’re hundreds of miles from King’s Landing. No one knows what you look like. No one cares. You’re safe.
Do you even know what a squire is?
I’m not a knight. That means you’re not a squire.
I don’t care, I’m not your mother.
I found Arya. She didn’t want my protection.

Will you shut your mouth? I didn’t ask for advice. I don’t want anyone following me. I’m not a leader. All I ever wanted is to fight for a Lord I believed in. The good lords are dead and the rest are monsters.
How do you know it’s Stannis?
I do not fight for the Boltons. I’m Brienne of Tarth. I was Kingsguard to Renly Baratheon. I was there when he was murdered by a shadow with your face. You murdered him? With blood magic?

In the name of Renly of House Baratheon, First of his Name, Rightful King of the Andals and the First Men, Lord of the Seven Kingdoms, and Protector of the Realm, I, Brienne of Tarth, sentence you to die. Do you have any last words?
What is it?
You sure?
Littlefinger?
Ready the horses.
Find more.
Lord Baelish, Lady Sansa, my name is Brienne of Tarth.

Lady Sansa, before your mother's death, I was her sworn sword. I gave my word I would find you and protect you. I will shield your back and keep your council, and give my life for yours if need be. I swear it by the old gods and the new.
I was.
It was after Renly's murder.
I tried to save him.
By men who didn't see what happened.
He was murdered by a shadow. A shadow with a face of Stannis Baratheon.
Why should you have any say in her affairs?
Lady Sansa, if we can have a word alone--
Please, my lady. If I could explain--
Neither of us wanted to be there. Sometimes we don't have a choice.
Podrick! (Podrick screams as he loses control of the horse)
Down, Podrick, down!
Podrick?
You can stand now.
Wary of strangers, as she should me. I saw her riding on the East Trail with Littlefinger. Weâ€™ll follow them.
I swore to their mother Iâ€™d protect those girls.
Do you think sheâ€™s safe from Littlefinger?
Get your horse.
We don't. We go around. (She turns her horse and begins leaving).
Doesn't matter. I know where they're going.
Aren't you getting a bit old to be a squire? How did you end up squiring for the Imp?
Well, he's not here to complain about it, is he?
He borrowed it?
As punishment. For both of you.
(Walks away to get firewood). Yes, all of your lords were very kind to you. All except me. Sorry you have to squire such a nasty person.
I'm sorry I'm always snapping at you.
You want to be a knight, Pod?
Starting tomorrow, we'll train with the sword twice a day, before we ride in the morning and after we camp for the evening. (Sits down). And I'm going to show you how to ride properly.
I can't knight you, but I can teach you how to fight.
I was.
He was.

(After a few moments). When I was a girl, my father held a ball. I'm his only living child, so he wants to make a good match for me. He invited dozens of young lords to Tarth. I didn't want to go, but he dragged me to the ballroom. (Pauses). And it was wonderful. None of the boys noticed how mulish and tall I was. The shoved each other, and threatened to duel if they thought it was their turn to dance. And whispered in my ear how they wanted to marry me and take me back to their castles. (Smiles). My father smiled at me and I smiled at him. I'd never been so happy. (Her smile drops). Till I saw a few of the boys sniggering. And then they all started to laugh, they couldn't keep the game going any longer. They were toying with me. ‘Brienne the Beauty’, they called me. Great joke. And I realized I was the ugliest girl alive. A great lumbering beast. I tried to run away, but Renly Baratheon took me in his arms. “Don't let them see your tears,” he told me. “They’re nasty little shits. The nasty little shits aren't worth crying over.” He danced with me and none of the other boys could say a word. And he was the king's brother after all.

Yes, Pod, he liked men, I'm not an idiot. He didn't love me, he didn't want me, he danced with me because he was kind and he wouldn't see me hurt. He saved me from being a joke. From that day until his last day. And I couldn't save him in return. Nothing's more hateful than failing to protect the one you love. One day, I will avenge King Renly.
A shadow with the face of Stannis Baratheon. I know it was Stannis. I know it in my heart. Stannis is a man, not a shadow. And a man can be killed.
(Turns around). Better off with the Boltons who murdered her mother and brother? Sansa's in danger even if she doesn't realize it.
Thank you. You've lived here a long time?
Did you know Lord Eddard?
Not all of them. I know who's inside that castle.
I'm not talking about the Boltons. I need to get a message to her. To Sansa Stark.
Someone who swore to keep her safe.
Her mother.
That doesn't release me from an oath. I served Lady Catelyn. I serve her still. Who do you serve?

6.text: Lady Sansa, I offer my services once again. I will shield your back and keep your council and give my life for yours if need be. I swear it by the old gods and the new.
I saw her with a man. I don’t think he hurt her. She didn’t want to leave him, he didn’t want to leave her.
I spent three days looking for her. She disappeared.
She looked good. She wasn’t exactly dressed like a lady.
What happened at Winterfell?
It was a difficult choice, my lady.
We’ve all had to make difficult choices.
I saw what happened. I saw Stannis’ forces defeated in the field.
We’ve met before. I was Kingsguard to Renly Baratheon. Before Renly was assassinated with bloodmagic.
Yes, it’s in the past. It doesn’t mean I forget. Or forgive. He admitted it, you know.
Stannis. Just before I executed him.
Lady Sansa asked you a question.
I’ve sworn to protect you, my lady.
We can send the Blackfish a raven.
I don’t like leaving you here alone.

Not him. He seems trustworthy. A bit brooding, perhaps. I suppose that’s understandable, considering. The others, though. Davos and the Red Woman helped a man murder his own brother with blood magic. And when Stannis paid for his crime, where were they? Already out looking for a leader with better prospects. And that wildling fellow with the beard --
Then why did you lie to him when he asked you how you learned about Riverrun?
You have a keen military mind, Pod.
My name is Brienne of Tarth. Please inform Ser Jaime Lannister I’ve come to speak with him. Tell him I have his sword.
Why would you assume that?
I don’t think you know many girls like her.
I’ve come for the Blackfish.
Lady Sansa desires to take her ancestral seat back from the Boltons and assume her rightful position as Lady of Winterfell.
The Tully army.
The Tullys are rebels because they’re fighting for their home?
As a reward for betraying Robb Stark and slaughtering his family.
You’re a knight, Ser Jaime. I know there is honor in you. I’ve seen it myself.
I do no such thing. Take Riverrun without bloodshed. Ride south with your mission complete and your army intact.
Allow me to enter Riverrun under a flag of truce. Let me try to persuade the Blackfish to give up the castle.
Because you’ll allow him to lead the Tully forces safely north.
No.
I need your word. If I persuade him to abandon the castle, you’ll grant us safe passage north.
You gave it to me for a purpose. I’ve achieved that purpose.
one last thing, Ser Jaime.
Should I fail to persuade the Blackfish to surrender, and if you attack the castle, honor compels me to fight for Sansa’s kin.
To fight you.
I have a signed letter from your niece Sansa Stark.
As I have said, my name is- -
He always spoke highly of you.
Riverrun cannot stand against the Lannisters and the Freys.
He’s not my friend.

Ser Jaime kept his word to your niece Catelyn Stark. He sent me to find Sansa, to help her as Catelyn wanted. He gave me this sword to protect her. That is what I have done and I will continue to do until the day I die.
You have more than she does.
Tell her I failed.
Come with us.
Your family is in the North. Come with us. Don’t die for pride when you can fight for your blood.

7.text: Nope.
Nope.
Why is he still here?
He wants something.
I did next to nothing.
I'm not a --
Thank you, Podrick.
Don't lunge.
Don't go where your enemy leads you.
Up.
And don't --
Nice sword. Very nice dagger.
I can go and find the Master of Arms for you, My Lady.
Move aside, Podrick.
You can't use that, My Lady. It's too small.
I'll try not to.
Who taught you to do that?
I thought you were dead.
I was only trying to protect her.
She's alive. Arya.
Winterfell.
The only one that needs protecting is the one that gets in her way.
Ser Jaime.
We both saw what just happened. We both saw that thing.
Oh, fuck loyalty!
This goes beyond houses and honor and oaths. Talk to the queen.

8.text: You don't know me well, Your Grace.

But I know Ser Jaime. He is a man of honor. I was his captor once. But when we were both taken prisoner and the men holding us tried to force themselves on me, Ser Jaime defended me. And lost his hand because of it.
Without him, my lady, you would not be alive. He armed me, armored me, and sent me to find you and bring you home because he'd sworn an oath to your mother.
I do.
I would.
Ser Jaime.
He's all right. Still has a lot to learn.
I am. It's, uh-It's good ground.
The rise, it should give us some advantage.
If we can keep a tight formation, we might be able to beat them back.
What are you doing?
I think you know.
We have never had a conversation last this long without you insulting me. Not once.
No!
I better get back.
Oh, we didn't mean to interrupt. We were just looking for somewhere warm to-
I don't think that's wise.
The battle might start at any moment.
Half cup.
No, thank you. I should try and get some sleep.
All right. Just a bit.
Yes, well, I'm glad you're here.
Here fighting with us. Glad you survived Eastwatch.
At least we'll die with honor.
Women can't be knights.
Tradition.
I don't even want to be a knight.
I told you I was.
I did.
Why does he get to go again?
Wrong! Wrong, wrong, wrong! Drink!
You're drinking wine, but you prefer ale!
I have to piss.
Please pardon me for a moment.
I didn't drink?
I drank.
This is not the game. This is only drinking.
It's the first thing I learnt when I came to the North. Keep your fire going. Every time you leave the room, put more wood on.
Piss off.
It grows on you.
(almost whispering) You sound quite jealous.
Oh, move aside.
What are you doing?
I've never slept with anyone before.
I told you--
Euron Greyjoy ambushed Queen Daenerys and her fleet. One of the dragons was killed, several ships destroyed, Missandei captured.
They're going to destroy that city. You know they will.
You're not like your sister. You're not. You're better than she is. You're a good man and you can't save her. You don't need to die with her. Stay here. Stay with me. (voice breaking) Please. Stay.
Aye.
Ser Podrick.
Long may he reign.
I think we can all agree that ships take precedence over brothels.

3.text: Well, the girls weren't lying. You had a good-sized cock.
What? No. Pork sausage. You think I'm some sort of savage?
People talk about phantom limbs. An amputee might have an itch where his foot used to be. So I've always wondered do eunuchs have a phantom cock?
Next time you think about naked girls, would you feel an itch?
Sorry. I shouldn't make jokes. My mother taught me not to throw stones at cripples.
But my father taught me to aim for their head.
Sorry, what?
A little louder.
You're no good to me dead. We need you.
You don't look like a Theon Greyjoy anymore. That's a name for a lord. But you're not a lord, are you? You're just meat.
Stinking meat.
You reek. Reek! That's a good name for you. What's your name?
What's your name?
What is your name?!
Your sister sent me.
I'll come for you tonight when the castle sleeps.
Keep quiet.
If you can't ride, we don't stand a chance.
You're sure?
Ride east. Follow the rising sun. Your sister's waiting for you.
We're not in the Iron Islands. Go.
Come, my lord.
You're a long way from home and winter is coming.
Not far, my lord. Your sister is waiting for you there.
Yes. I served them, the men who were torturing you. I did what they told me and waited for the right moment.

I grew up on Saltcliffe, my lord. I was only a boy when they took you away. My father brought me and my brothers up to the bluffs so we could watch the ship that carried you off. I remember the look on my father's face when he told us, 'That's Balon Greyjoy's last living son.' And those are the words I heard over and over again when I saw what they were doing to you.
I-- I don't know, my lord. They-- they never told me much.
Not all those are your sister's men. Some of them are loyal to your father.
What is it?
What did he tell you to do?
He lorded it over you?
The Stark boys?
Maybe it's not too late.
Not everything, my lord. She's up here.
Shh. Wait.
I brought him back. He killed the others.
Put him back where he belongs.
Sorry. Were you sleeping?
Wa--? Wa--? Water? You want some water. I wish I had some for you.
So let's play a game. Which body part do you need the least?
Please is not a body part.

But you've already told me everything. Remember? Your daddy was mean to you. The Starks didn't appreciate you. One good bit, though. The Stark boys, they're still alive. Wouldn't that be a hunt to remember? You failed, but I'm a better hunter than you.
Now how about your little finger? You don't use that for much, do you? No? Good. Let's start with that.

You've been wondering why you're here. Haven't you? Where you are. Who I am. Why I'm doing this to you. So guess. If you guess right, I'll tell you. By the old gods and the new, I swear it. You win the game if you can figure out who I am and why I'm torturing you and I win the game if you beg me to cut off your finger.
If you think this has a happy ending, you haven't been paying attention.
You say please again and you'll wish you hadn't. You first. Where are we?
Too vague.
Terrible guess.
Now, where?
Do I look like a fucking Umber to you?
Karhold? How did you know that? Did you see any banners flying when we came in?
Very good, Lord Theon. And who am I?
He's dead. Strangled by the Kingslayer.
You're right.
Yes. You win.
Of course, you forgot to ask one question. You forgot to ask if I'm a liar.
I'm afraid I am.
Everything I told you is a lie.
This isn't happening to you for a reason. Well, one reason-- I enjoy it.
I win.
I'm sorry. I'm sorry. Terrible timing.
But I was getting jealous.
Well? Should we see this cock everyone's always going on about?
Everyone knows you love girls. I bet you always thought they loved you back.
Your famous cock must be very precious to you. Would you say it's your most precious part?
This is mercy. I'm not killing you. Just making a few alterations.

4.text: Tansy! Tansy! Tansy!
Tansy! Tansy!
There you are.
Tansy!
If you make it out of the woods, you win! Run, Tansy, run!
Tansy.
Tansy, Tansy, Tansy!
Good girls. Down, girls. Down. Well done. You, too.
You brought her down. That's what matters. A fine shot. Wasn't it, Reek?
Oh, sweet. Don't cry. It will be over soon.
We have to reward the hounds, love. They did all the hard work.
But you made Myranda feel jealous.
You can see that your presence has become a bit of a problem.
Rip her! Rip her! Rip her!
Not so pretty now.
Father. Welcome home.
A pleasure, Mother.
With the hounds. I'll have a look at him.
I hear you took a hand from the Kingslayer.
(laughs)
Father.
I trained him. He was a slow learner, but he learned.
Peeled a few bits. Removed a few others.
We've been flaying our enemies for 1,000 years. The flayed man is on our banners.
I already asked. Lord Greyjoy refused. Savages have no...
You made me acting Lord of the Dreadfort. I acted.
Theon was our enemy. But Reek, Reek will never betray us.
Reek, how could you let me stand before my father unshaven? It's disrespectful.
Give him the razor.
If I'm not a Bolton, Father, what does it matter?
Go on, Reek. A nice close shave.
Reek, tell Father where are Bran and Rickon Stark?
Reek, did you murder the Stark boys?
And crisped them so no one would know.
The Starks have always ruled the North. If Bran and Rickon are alive, the country will rally to their side now that Robb Stark is gone.
Oh, that's right, Reek. Robb Stark is dead. Sorry. I know he was like a brother to you. But my father put a knife through his heart. How do you feel about that?
Even if he doesn't, he's half Stark himself. Could be a threat.
This is turning into a lovely evening.
You've got bigger balls than he ever did. But with those big balls of yours...
how fast can you run?
I have a treat for you. A reward.
Yes, Reek. Those creatures who came in the night, they wanted to take you away. And you didn't let them. You remained loyal.
Yes, yes, Reek. It's a bath. For you. Remove those rags. Now.
The britches, too, Reek. Take them off.
Do you love me, Reek?
Good. Because I need you to do something for me. Something very important. There's a castle, you see. Some bad men hold this castle. I need your help to take this castle back.
I need you to play a role. To pretend to be someone you're not.
Theon Greyjoy.

Bracken. Mmm, strong. As long as they're in the see. But when you take them out of the water, no bones. They collapse under their proud weight and slum into a heap of nothing. You'd think they'd know that. Unfortunately they're not very bright. What do you tell them?
And what are you really?
Are you sure? You do look very much like a lord. Formidable, proud.
Until when?
That's right. Until you're rotting in the ground. Remember what you are and what you're not. Bring me Lord Kenning.
You didn't really think I'd let them go did you? It's falling out of fashion. Fileting. Sad, but true. Traditions are important. Where are we without our history, eh?
I believe we will. To our new home.
Moat Cailin is yours, Father.
No.
Unimportant. A cripple, a young boy. None of the northern lords have seen them. Dead most likely. Most of the Ironborn have fled the North. Now more will follow, thanks to you. Tell me what you see.
Moors, fields, hills.
Tell me what you see.
Nothing.
Ramsay Snow.
You honor me. I swear I will uphold your name and your tradition. I will be worthy of you, Father, I promise.
Come, Reek, I'll be needing a bath.

5.text: Looks like we’re done here.
And I accept your surrender.
Let’s head back. My wife must be lonely.
You can't hold the North if you let these lesser lords insult us.
Lord Cerwyn refused to pay. Said the Warden of the North would always be a Stark, and he'd be damned if he kissed a traitor's boot.
I flayed him living, along with his wife and brother. Made his son watch.
The new Lord Cerwyn paid his taxes.
Our pact with the Lannisters protects -
It's an honor to meet you, my Lady.
She really is lovely. I hope I can make her happy.
I'll never hurt her. You have my word.
I haven't been a lord very long. I was a bastard.
Yes, father. And thank you, Lord Baelish. I'm forever in your debt. (Bows).
Come back here. Myranda.
I'm going to marry her. That will involve looking at her from time to time.
And I meant it. When I was a bastard named Snow. But I'm a Bolton now. What I want is no longer the primary consideration. I'm furthering a dynasty.
Of course I do. I'm not blind.
You think she's pretty, too. I'm looking forward to our wedding night. But don't worry, I'll have plenty of time for you.

(Laughs). You're the kennel master's daughter. Who are you going to marry, the stable keeper's son? (She tries to hit him, but he restrains her). You're mine. You're not going anywhere. Unless I have to listen to more of your jealousy. Jealousy bores me. You remember what happens to people who bore me. You're not going to bore me, are you, Myranda?
You smell particularly ripe this evening. Pour me some wine.
Do you have something to tell me?
Reek.
Who?
She saw you?
Come here.
You mustn't keep secrets from me, Reek. Get on your knees.
Give me your hand.
I forgive you.
Allow me.
Mother.
My lady, we are all a family, we northerners. Our blood ties go back thousands of years. So I'd like to drink to our wedding. May our happiness spread from Moat Cailin to the Last Hearth.
You're right. Very strange. More wine, please.

I heard you two had reunited. A fitting place for it. (Theon begins pouring wine). I like to imagine that the last time you spoke was in this very room. Are you still angry with him after he - what he did? Don't worry. The North remembers. I punished him for it. He's not ironborn anymore. Not Theon Greyjoy anymore. He's a new man. A new person, anyway. Aren't you, Reek?
That's his new name, Reek.
Because Reek has something to say to you. Don't you, Reek? (He gestures Theon over). An apology. Apologize to Lady Sansa for what you did. Apologize for murdering her two brothers.
Look at her, Reek. An apology doesn't mean anything if you're not looking the person in the eye.
Sorry about what?

There, over and done with. Doesn't everyone feel better? I do. That was getting very tense. Whew. (Theon turns to leave). You know what, my lady? What with him having murdered your brothers and the rest of your family gone Reek here is the nearest thing to living kin that you have left. Reek. You will give away the bride. Someone has to. What better person? Good? Good?
Wonderful. (Sips wine).
How can you be sure?
That she's pregnant. I mean how can you tell?
So how did you manage it?
Getting her pregnant.
Of course, but how did you find it?
And if it's a boy?
My position is quite clear. I'm your son until a better alternative comes along.
Why would I? She had me, she died. And here we are.
Yes.
Ramsay of House Bolton. Heir to the Dreadfort and Winterfell. Who gives her?
Are you pleased my lady?
Good. I want you to be happy. My father said you’re still a virgin.
Why? Why are you still a virgin? Afraid of dwarves?
You’re not lying to me?
Lying to your husband on his wedding night, that would be a very bad way to start a marriage. We are man and wife now, we should be honest with each other, don’t you think?
Good. Now take off your clothes.
Oh, no no no. You stay here Reek. You watch. (to Sansa) Do I need to ask a second time? I hate asking a second time.
Reek? I told you to watch.
You’ve known Sansa since she was a girl. Now watch her become a woman.
Yes, Reek?
My beautiful wife.
When my father told me we were marrying I half expected a fat, bearded beast. Do you know how pleased I was when I saw you? You’ve made me very happy.

Our scouts report that Stannis Baratheon rides for Winterfell. He’s a respected commander. His troops are loyal and battle tested. He’s hired thousands of foreign sell swords to bolster his army. But this storm was a stroke of luck for us northerners. Our people are used to fighting in frost. His army’s out there now, suffering in the snow. One day I’ll be Lord of Winterfell, and Warden of the North. You’ll be my Lady and Wardeness.
What of it?
Then I’ll have a baby brother.
I’m Lord Bolton’s eldest son.
I’ve been naturalized by a royal decree of--
Bastards can rise high in the world. Like your half-brother Jon Snow. Born The Bastard of Winterfell, now the Lord Commander of the Night’s Watch.
You didn’t know? Yes, he’s done very well for himself. Ah. I near forgot why I asked you to join me. Come, my lady.
Your Northern friend. Reek told me you wanted to leave.
Why? Winterfell is your home and I am your husband.

Tough old bird. Everyone talks when I start beating them. But this one. Her heart gave out before I got to her face. We do breed them tough in the North. Bring my wife back to her chamber. It’s far too cold out here for a lady. You should hold on to your candles. The nights are so long now.
Stannis isn’t from the North. You are, father. I think you’re missing an opportunity to show the people of the North how House Bolton treats southern invaders.
That we not sit and wait to let Stannis to decide what type of fight this is going to be. That we hit first, and hit hard, and leave a feast for the crows.
I don’t need an army. I need 20 good men.

6.text: She was 11 the first time I saw her.
The kennelmaster’s daughter. She smelled of dog. I wasn’t much older, but everybody was already afraid of me. You certainly were.
Myranda wasn’t, though. What could I do to her that those hounds couldn’t? She was fearless. There was nothing she wouldn’t do.
Your pain will be paid for a thousand times over. I wish you could be here to watch.
Buried, burned?
This is good meat. Feed it to the hounds.
No.
No.
I have a team of men after them with some of my best hounds. They won’t get far.
They obviously had help.
We know where she’s going. Her brother’s at Castle Black.
So was I, Father.
Castle Black isn’t defended on the southern side. And the few men left are barely men at all. Farm boys and thieves. With a small force we could storm the castle, kill Jon Snow --
We don’t need every house in the North. The Umbers, the Manderlys, and the Karstarks. command more soldiers than all the other houses combined. With their support, none could challenge us.
Congratulations, Father. I look forward to meeting my new brother.
Thank you for saying that. It means a great deal to me.
Maester Wolkan, send ravens to all the Northern houses. Roose Bolton is dead. Poisoned by our enemies.
How did he die?
Send for Lady Walda and the baby.
There he is.
May I hold him?
Little brother.
Of course. Follow me, Mother.
I am Lord Bolton.
I prefer being an only child.
The Umbers are a famously loyal house.
When my father became Warden of the North, your house refused to pledge their banners.
My beloved father, the Warden --
My father was poisoned by our enemies.
Why have you come to Winterfell, Lord Umber?
So now you’ve come seeking help?
Pledge your banners to House Bolton. Swear loyalty to me as Warden of the North and we will fight together to destroy the bastard and all his wildling friends.
Traditionally a bannerman kneels before his lord.
Why would I trust a man who won’t honor tradition?
Then it appears we're at a bit of an impasse.
A girl, I hope. I prefer redheads.
I like them wild.
Who’s this?
How do I know that’s Rickon Stark?
Welcome home, Lord Stark.
They've cleaned you up nicely. You know who I am?
Yes. A lord. You’ve seen my banners?
Does that worry you at all?
No.
You served the Starks?
The Starks have been gone for a long time, but you kept protecting Rickon.
Be that as it may, Rickon's not yours to sell anymore. He’s mine. So what use could I possibly have for you?
Are you sure you know what that is?
You’re a good talker.
I like that.
You’re a much better talker than Theon Greyjoy.
I had to work hard to get him talking. But he talked. They all do.
He told me everything. All about the Stark boys. Who helped them escape, and how she did it.
My beloved wife. I’ve missed you terribly.

Thank you for returning Lady Bolton safely. Now, dismount and kneel before me, surrender your army and proclaim me the true Lord of Winterfell and Warden of the North. I will pardon you for deserting the Night’s Watch. I will pardon these treasonous lords for betraying my house. Come, bastard, you don’t have the men, you don’t have the horses, and you don’t have Winterfell. Why lead those pour souls into slaughter? There’s no need for a battle. Get off your hose and kneel. I’m a man of mercy.

I keep hearing stories about you, bastard. The way people in the North talk about you, you’re the greatest swordsman who ever walked. Maybe you are that good. Maybe not. I don’t know if I’d beat you. But I know that my army will beat yours. I have 6,000 men. You have, what, half that? Not even?
He’s good. Very good. Tell me, will you let your little brother die because you’re too proud to surrender?
Now, if you want to save —
Do you like games, little man? Let’s play a game. Run to your brother. The sooner you make it to him, the sooner you get to see him. That’s it. That’s the game. Easy. Ready? Go.
No, you have to run, remember? Those are the rules.
Now.
Loose!
It’s time, go.
Their army’s gone.
We have Winterfell. They don’t have the men for a siege. All we have to do is wait.
I’ve reconsidered. I think that sounds like a wonderful idea.
Ah. Sansa. Hello, Sansa. Is this where I’ll be staying now? No. Our time together is about to come to an end. That’s all right. You can’t kill me. I’m part of you now.
My hounds will never harm me.
They’re loyal beasts.
Sit. Down! Down! Down! Down! Down!

2.text: This is our place. Our husband keeps us safe. Better to live free than die a slave.
You shouldn't touch me.
You're very brave.
Sam said you could help.
Please sir, please. I can still run if I have to.
I'm going to have a baby, if it's a boy I…
You're leaving.
I can't take it.
You You shouldn't give it away.

3.text: Sam! Sam!
Gilly. Don't hurt us.
Come with us. There's nothing north but death.
The walker came for my Baby. And Sam--
I swear to you, my lord--
Gilly.
Yes, my--
Master.
His name is Sam.
Thank you Maester. I can cook and clean and I can--
(desperate) What is it? What is it?
Shh, shh, shh.
You woke him.
Shh!
No.
Why?
Here.
You said to hold it for you until you came back. You're back.
I don't want your stupid thimble. I want to save my baby's life. Can you do that? Can you?
I don't have time for you. I don't have time for anyone but him because he doesn't have much time.
What's happening? I'm not going out there.
Follow me. I know the best way. Come on.
You've got too much wood in there.
It needs to breathe. Take off that big log.
Someone built your fires for you growing up?
I knew you were highborn.
What does it do?
How much longer?
Is the Wall as big as they say?
You're playing with me.
Do you sing?
Sing me a song.
It doesn't matter. Come under the furs. We can keep each other warm.
I doubt it.
He blinked.
A what?
A wink is on purpose.
Sometimes do you talk fancy on purpose to confuse me?
I'll build that fire.
I don't know many boys' names.
Craster.
Mormont.
Why is it a last name?
His name is Samwell Tarly, too?
Randyll is a handsome name.
Is your father cruel like mine?
Not Randyll, then.
Don't. Don't go out there.
It's come for the baby.
No, you can't have him! No!
No!
How do you know all that?
You know all that from staring at marks on paper?
You're like a wizard.
Our father used to tell us that no wildling ever looked upon the Wall and lived. Here we are. Alive.

4.text: About what?
You're not lying. I'll never forget the way it screamed.
A what?
My father hated that word.
I don't know. It makes me sound a bit dangerous, doesn't it?
I get a lot of looks. I hear them making their jokes. But no one's touched me if that's what you mean.
Why do you worry about it?
They've got other things to think about.
You're being silly.
What about you?
Thank you.
For worrying about me.
So what are you saying?
Are you bored of me?
I'll get these to Hobb. Keep an eye on little Sam.
Thank you.
Sam.
No.
He's dead.
North of here.
You protected me north of the Wall.
Best for you.
Yes.
I'm sorry it woke you up.
Don't you ever touch him.
Shut your mouth.
No it's not.
They killed everyone! Everyone but me and my baby. And they're out there. I saw them on the way here, they may have seen me, they may have followed me please!
If they find the boy, you don't know what they'll do.
Sam, is that you?!
It was horrible.
Don't let them send me away, Sam.
I know there's no women allowed.
You're leaving me again?
You're going up there and we're staying down here. That's leaving. You said from now on we'd stay together.
What are you going to do out there?
How?! You going to fight the Free Folk when they come? They'll kill you. In Molestown they killed everyone.
Why not? You won't matter up there, you will down here.
Promise me you won't die.

5.text: Shouldn’t you be training, too?
That one hates me.
Don’t let them send us away.
Sam! Don’t let them send us away.
You can’t leave, they’ll execute you.
Snake. Snake... S! It's an S!
I know "S".
Well, you're a wonderful teacher. (to Sam) Very patient!
That's alright. We're doing just fine. I'm sure you and Ostrich Stark have a lot to talk about.
How old were you when you learned to read?
What do you call it in the South, what happened to your face?
I don't know. But two of my sisters had it. They both died. How did they cure you?
My father made them move out of the keep into the huts outside. None of us were allowed to go near them. But we heard them. Especially at night. They started to sound... not like themselves.
Only once at the end. They were covered with it. Their faces, their arms. They acted like animals. My father had to drag them out to the woods on a rope.
Is this every book there is?
In the world.
Where you grew up, were there more books?
Where's that?
I'm sorry I don't know things.
I can wash the linens. I can sweep the floor.
Why does the Citadel have the biggest library?
Like Maester Aemon?
Get some sleep, Sam. You’ll have to speak for him tomorrow.
Get some sleep. I’ll watch over him.
Leave me alone.
Leave him alone!
Sam! Sam! Sam!
Sam!
You’re not.
The next time you see something like that you leave it alone.
I know they would have killed you if Ghost hadn’t come.
Don’t be stupid Sam, you’re not a fighter.
Just promise me that whatever happens you’ll take care of little Sam.
I need more water.
Am I hurting you?
Are you sure?
Does it hurt?
Good.
I’m not the one who got punched and kicked in the face.
I’m good.
A little.
I need to check on baby Sam.

6.text: You all right?
Did I ever tell you I used to think the sea was called the see because it was nothing but water as far as the eye could see?
Sea, see. They’re spelled different, but they sound the same.
It was before I learned how to read, obviously.
Sam, are you going to be sick?
Won’t be long. We’ll be in the south soon. I’m excited to see Oldtown. Captain says it’s the most beautiful city in Westeros. Are you going to vomit again?
I stayed at Castle Black. There’s no women allowed there.
I’ll stay in Oldtown, then.
So if we’re not going to Oldtown, where are you taking me?
“Wherever you go, I go, too.” That’s what you said.
Us and everyone else in the world.
I know that, Sam. And he does, too. You're the only one who ever has.
If you think it’s for the best, we trust you.
I’d never do that to the father of my son.
It’s so green.
You’re nervous. You’re a nervous talker.
That’s not any better being a nervous mute.
That Little Sam is your baby.
What did you tell your family about me?
Did you tell them how far north?
You didn’t tell them where I’m really from? You didn’t tell them I’m a wildling?
I think we’re here.
I am happy to know you, Lady Tarly.
Yes, of course.
It’s hard to walk in this.
He can wield a sword. He killed a Thenn. He killed a White Walker.

I saw it with my own eyes on our way down to Castle Black. He drove a dagger into the walker’s heart. He risked his own life to save mine more than once. He’s a greater warrior than either of you will ever be.
The Night’s Watch came to our keep.
North of the Wall.
I’m not angry at you. I’m angry that horrible people can treat good people that way and get away with it. When do you have to go?
You’re not what he thinks you are, Sam. He doesn’t know what you are.
Sam?
What?
I don’t have any things.
What are you doing?
What about your mother and sister?
Your sister’s dress.
Sam. That’s your father’s sword.
Sam. Won’t he come for it?

7.text: You should really sleep, Sam.
"Legends of the Long Night."
What is it?
That's dragonglass?
Do you know how many steps there are in the Citadel?
Guess how many windows are in the Great Sept of Baelor.
That's true. This High Septon Meynard, he recorded everything. He even recorded his own bowel movements. What does "annulment" mean?
Meynard says here that he issued an anullment for Prince Rhaegar and remarried him to someone else at the same time in a secret ceremony in Dorne. Is that a common thing --
Steps. That number was steps.
Are you sure you want to do this? You always wanted to be a maester.

8.text: When the time comes, you'll be down in the crypts.
They're the safest place to be. Through that archway right over there.
That's good to hear. I'm going to be in the crypt with my son, and I'd feel a lot better with you down there to protect us.
I'm sure he knows how it happens, Sam. If it's a boy, we want to name him Jon.

3.text: Daario Naharis
I hope the old man is better with a sword than he is with a lie. You have 8,000 Unsullied.
You have no ships. You have no siege weapons. You have no cavalry.
You talk too much.
8000 unsullied stand between her and your cock.
She'll tell me whatever you pay her to tell me.
I like them very much. I just refuse to pay them. And I'm no whore, my friend.
I fight for beauty.
The gods gave men two gifts to entertain ourselves before we die-- the thrill of fucking a woman who wants to be fucked and the thrill of killing a man who wants to kill you.
Do you hear me? Follow my voice. I'm right here.
You have something for me?
Valar morghulis.
No screaming or she dies.
You.
Don't scream, lovely girl.
(nods and chuckles)
I don't want to.
You should ask them.
We had philosophical differences.
Your beauty. It meant more to me than it did to them.
I'm the simplest man you'll ever meet. I only do what I want to do.
Yes.
They ordered me to murder you. I told them I preferred not to. They told me I had no choice. I told them I am Daario Naharis. I always have a choice. They drew their swords and I drew mine.
(nods)
The Second Sons are yours and so is Daario Naharis. My sword is yours, my life is yours, my heart is yours.
There.
There, it's a back gate. My men use it when they visit Yunkai's bed slaves.
I have no interest in slaves. A man cannot make love to property.
This is where we enter the city. Very few guards, they know me. They let me inside.
I kill the guards. I take your two best men and lead them through the back streets, which I know well, and open the front gates.
Then comes the army. Once the walls are breached, the city will fall in hours.
You have a very suspicious mind. In my experience, only dishonest people think this way.
When you hear a songbird’s whistle, you come. I’m a great whistler, the greatest in the land.
Daario Naharis.
That one was quick.
I doubt it. The Yunkish prefer to let their slaves do their fighting for them.
The city is yours, my queen.

4.text: Ser Worm is stronger than he looks. But I can see his arms beginning to shake.
The honor of riding by your side on the road to Meereen.
(in valerian) You like this girl? Must be frustrating.
(in valerian) I'd rather have no brains and two balls.
Yes, my queen. But I need to speak to you about something important. A matter of strategy.
A dusk rose.
And this one's called lady's lace.
Harpy's Gold. No tea from this one. Beautiful but poisonous.
Your Grace.

I was the last to join your army. I'm not your general or a member of your Queensguard or the commander of your Unsullied. My mother was a whore. I come from nothing. And before long, I will return to nothing. Let me kill this man for you.
Why would I want a horse?
Horses are dumber than men.
The Second Sons took the Meereenese Navy.
No one.
I heard you liked ships.
but your window is not.
I swam to an island a mile offshore for these.
Never met a woman who didn't like wildflowers.
Forgive me, my queen. I live to serve you.

I came to ask a favor. I only have two talents in this world-- war and women. You are staying here in Meereen to rule. That is a wise decision. I respect it. But here in Meereen, I cannot pursue my talents.
You've ordered us to be night watchmen.
There is only one, and she does not want me.
My sword is yours till the day I die.
I'll stay in Meereen and patrol the streets. Send me to kill your enemies. Any enemy anywhere. Let me do what I do best.
Jorah the Andal. Are you here to see our queen? She's in a good mood.

5.text: When did the Unsullied start patrolling the streets of Meereen? Looks like your friends haven’t been behaving themselves.
You should reopen the fighting pits.

My mother was a whore, I told you that. She liked to drink pear brandy. The older she got, the less she made selling her body, the more she wanted to drink. So one day when I was 12, she sold me to a slaver she fucked the night before.
I was a bad child. I wasn’t big, but I was quick. And I loved to fight. So they sold me to a man in Tolos who trained fighters for the pits. I had my first match when I was 16.

I’m only here because of those pits. I learned to fight like a Dothraki screamer, a Norvoshi priest, a Westerosi knight. Soon I was famous. 10,000 men and women screamed my name when I stepped into the pit. I made so much money for my master he set me free when I died. I joined the Second Sons, and then I met you.

You’re the queen. Everyone’s too afraid of you to speak truth. Everyone but me. You’ve made thousands of enemies all across the world. As soon as they see weakness, they’ll attack. Show your strength here, now.
Anyone with a chest full of gold can buy an army of Unsullied. You’re not the Mother of Unsullied. You’re the Mother of Dragons.
A dragon queen with no dragons is not a queen.
Does he always talk so much?
No, but he is.
Our queen would be dead if not for him.
You missed a good scrap.

(gestures to Tyrion) He’s right. The Queen exiled Jorah. (gestures to Jorah) And he’s right, Jorah saved her life. Perhaps she feels differently about him now. Perhaps not. The only way we’ll know is if we ask her.
Forgive me, but why would we bring you?
Have you ever tracked animals in the wilderness?
Can you fight?
Are you good on a horse?
So mainly you talk?

Which I respect. But you would not help us on this expedition. You would help us here in Meereen, though. (to Missandei, Grey Worm, and Jorah) None of us have any experience governing a city, except for him. You want to prove your value to the queen? Prove it right here in Meereen.
They wouldn’t. They will listen to Grey Worm.
He is, he’s the toughest man with no balls I’ve ever met. But you still can’t go. The people believe in you. They know you speak for the queen.

And Missandei. Our queen trusts no one more than Missandei. Certainly not me. The queen’s closest confidant, the commander of the Unsullied, and the foreign dwarf with the scarred face. Good fortune, my friends, Meereen is ancient and glorious. (to Tyrion) Try not to ruin her. (to Jorah) Looks like it’s you and me, Jorah the Andal. Let’s find some good horses. We have so much to talk about.
The Unsullied are too conspicuous.
Anyone can see you coming from a mile off. Of course you haven't found any Sons of the Harpy. You haven't, have you?

My Second Sons, on the other hand, they drink, they whore, fight in the streets--they blend in. They overhear things in taverns, follow people from the taverns to nice, quiet alleys, break a few fingers, overhear a few more things. Before you know it...
In a hurry? You're afraid?
Right. That's your problem. You understood fear once, long ago, but you've forgotten what it means. Someone who's forgotten fear has forgotten how to hide.
Fear is useful that way.
The Son of the Harpy has no more valuable information.
Because I questioned him.
Which is what I keep telling her to do to you.

We could pull back to the pyramid district, secure it, and use it as a base from which to operate. Then we clean the city out, neighborhood by neighborhood, street by street, until the rats have nowhere left to hide.
How long before the king of Mereen comes to claim my pillow?
I think the Sons of the Harpy have stopped killing because their leader was made king.
Do you think I’m petty enough to speak ill of a man just because he represents competition?
You’re right. My motivations are entirely impure.
Doesn’t make me wrong.
Everyone has a choice. Even slaves have a choice. Death or slavery.
Marry me instead.
Why not? You’re our queen, you can do as you like.
Then you are the only person in Mereen who’s not free.
I know I’m here to serve my queen and not to give advice, but can I make one more suggestion?
On the day of the Great Games, gather all the great masters, and wise masters, and worthy masters you can find, and slaughter them all.
All rulers are either butchers or meat.
That one, the smaller man, no question, that’s where you should put your money.
People used to bet against me when I fought in the pits. (looks at Hizdahr) He would have bet against me. Common novice mistake.

Whenever I got into the pit against a beast like that one, the crowd saw me, all skin and bone back then, then they saw a pile of angry muscles ready to murder me. They couldn’t get their money out fast enough. But the pile of angry muscles never had any muscles here (he puts a dagger to his neck) or here (he puts the dagger to Hizdahr’s neck). And the big men were always too slow to stop my dagger from going where their muscles weren’t. Yes, whenever I saw a beast like that one, standing across from me making his beast faces, I knew I could rest easy.
Shut your mouth.
Protect your queen!
The other side, follow me!
Protect your queen!

6.text: Goat?
You think our friend got him?
We’re on the right path, then.
Perhaps she’s tired of being queen. I don’t think she likes it very much.
Maybe she’s flown somewhere else, somewhere far away from men like us.
There’s no escaping her, eh? You keep coming back. Why?
isn’t it frustrating wanting someone who doesn’t want you back?
You’re a romantic. I admire that. Sometimes I look at you and I think, “So that’s what I’ll be like when I grow old.”
If I grow old. I hope I do. I want to see what the world looks like when she’s done conquering it.
Huh, an army?
Dothraki?
Your ships are nearly ready. I saw them painting the sails.
I’m curious to see how the Dothraki do on the poison water.
New strategy? You want the Second Sons to attack from the west coast? If we take Casterly Rock, the Lannisters will have nowhere to run when you hit King’s Landing.
Fuck Meereen. Fuck the people. I’m here for you, not them.
Who are you marrying this time?
But you need to lure all the noble houses to the table? Are you a queen or fish bait?
A king wouldn’t think twice about it.
I’m not proud. I don’t care what perfumed aristocrat sits beside you in the throne room. I don’t want a crown. I want you.
I love you. And I make you happy. You know I do. Bring me with you. Let me fight for you.
The dwarf told you to do this.
Clever fellow. Can’t argue with his logic. I’m no use to you over there.
I’m not angry. I’m full of self-pity. Who comes after you? Who can ever follow Daenerys Stormborn, the Mother of Dragons?
Bay of Dragons?
You’ll get that throne you want so badly, I’m sure of it. I hope it brings you happiness.
I pity the lord of Westeros. They have no idea what’s coming for them.
You all right? Why don’t you sit and catch your breath?
I don’t think you could ride the dragon. 20 years ago, maybe.
Our queen. She’s wild, you know. Don’t let her size fool you. It’s hard enough for me and I’m a young man. You, I don’t think your heart could take it.
Must make you angry that our queen chose me.
We’ll all disappoint her before long.
Oh, I don’t want to fight you, Jorah the Andal. What do I have to gain? If I win, I’m the shit who killed an old man. If I lose, I’m the shit who was killed by an old man.
None.
What are you doing?
Isn’t it forbidden to sneak into their city and steal their khaleesi?
You’re asking a dog to hand over his teeth.
I’m very attached to this knife.
You know what happens?
I’ll do it myself.
I should have been born a Dothraki.
Told you, I’m very attached to this knife.
You all right?
Huh.
She’ll give us away.
Everything all right?
A week at best.
Dothraki and all their horses, the Unsullied, the Second Sons- - 1,000 ships easily. Probably more.
Nobody.
So we ride for Meereen and after that we sail for Westeros. What then?
You weren’t made to sit on a chair in a palance.
You’re a conqueror, Daenerys Stormborn.

3.text: The Unsullied have stood here for a day and a night with no food or water.
They will stand until they drop.
Such is their obedience.
(speaking Valeryan) The Westrosi woman is pleased with them, but speaks no praise to keep the price down. She wished to know how they are trained.

They begin their training at five. Every day they drill from dawn to dusk until they have mastered the shortsword, the shield, and the three spears. Only one boy in four survives this rigorous training.
Their discipline and loyalty are absolute. They fear nothing.
( speaking Valyrian )
( speaking Valyrian ) The knight says even brave men fear death.
( speaking Valyrian ) Truly, master?
Missandei
He begs you attend to this carefully, Your Grace.
My master points out that men don't need nipples.

To win his shield, an Unsullied must go to the slave marts with a silver mark, find a newborn and kill it before its mother's eyes. This way, my master says, we make certain there is no weakness left in them.
( speaking Valyrian ) She is offended. She asks if you pay a sliver coin to the mother for her dead baby.
My master would like you to know that the silver is paid to the baby's owner, not the mother.
( Missandei speaking Valyrian )
Master Kraznys asks that you please hurry. Many other buyers are interested.
(speaking Valyrian) This is Daenerys Targaryen, the Stormborn, the Unburnt, the Queen of the Seven Kingdoms of Westeros, Mother of Dragons. It is to her you owe your freedom
It is old Ghiscari, khaleesi. It means 'mother'.
All? Did this one's ears mishear, Your Grace?
(speaking Valerian) She wants to buy them all.
There are 8,000 Unsullied in Astapor. Is this what you mean by all?
Master Greizhen says they cannot sell half-trained boys. If they fail on the battlefield, they will bring shame upon all of Astapor.
Master Kraznys says you cannot afford this.
Your ship will buy you Because Master Kraznys is generous.
The gold you have left is worth 10.
But good Master Kraznys will give you 20.
The Dothraki you have with you--
The Dothraki you have are not worth what they cost to feed, but Master Kraznys will give you three Unsullied for all of them.
Master Kraznys asks how you propose to pay for the remaining 7,877 unsullied.
(speaking Valerian)
They want the biggest one.
(speaking Valerian) She asks that you give me to her, as a present. She asks that you do this now.
This one's name is Missandei, Your Grace.
No, Your Grace. No family living.
Yes, Your Grace. Lying is a great offense. Many of those on the Walk of Punishment were taken there for less.
There are no masters in the grave, Your Grace.
All questions have been taken from them. They obey, that is all. Once they are yours, they are yours. They will fall on their swords if you command it.
Valar morghulis.

The master says they are untested. He says you would be wise to blood them early. There are many small cities between here and there, cities ripe for sacking. Should you take captives, the masters will buy the healthy ones and for a good price.
And who knows? In 10 years, some of the boys you send them may be Unsullied in their turn. Thus all shall prosper.
(speaks Valyrian)
It is done.
You hold the whip.
Yes, khaleesi. The officers.
All Unsullied boys are given new names when they are cut-- Grey Worm, Red Flea, Black Rat. Names that remind them what they are-- vermin.
Now comes the noble Razdal mo Eraz of that ancient and honorable house, master of men and speaker to savages, to offer terms of peace.
Noble lord, you are in the presence of Daenerys Stormborn of House Targaryen, Queen of the Andals and the First Men, Khaleesi of the Great Grass Sea, Breaker of Chains, and Mother of Dragons.
Will the noble lord take refreshment?
Yes, Your Grace.
It only took Your Grace a year to learn Dothraki reasonably well.
Dothraki is difficult for the mouth to master. So guttural and harsh.
Athjahakar.
Ath-ja-hakar.
(nods)
Your High Valyrian is very good, Your Grace. The gods could not devise a more perfect tongue. It is the only proper language for poetry.
(gasps)

4.text: Since midnight, Your Grace.
Several times, Your Grace, with Master Kraznys.
They say 1,000 slaves died building the Great Pyramid of Meereen.
If they're smart, Your Grace.
Your Grace.

*in Valyrian* You stand before Daenerys Stormborn, the Unburnt, Queen of Mereen, Queen of the Andals and the Rhoynar and the First Men. Khaleesi of the Great Grass Sea, Breaker of Chains and Mother of Dragons.
*in Low Valyrian* The Queen says you may approach.
*translating* I have brought you. He came from the sky. The black one. The winged shadow. He came from the sky and...
*translating* My girl. My little girl.
Zala, your grace.
Three.
He says that we're an army of men without man parts. He claims you are no woman at all, but a man who... hides his cock in his own asshole.
He is very brave, Your Grace.
Isles. Summer Isles.
(speaks Valyrian) I am from an island called Naath.
"When did they take me?" I was five years old.
I remember when they rowed us away from shore. How white the beaches were. How tall the trees. And I remember my village burning. Smoke rising into the sky. Do you remember your home?
That's not true. Perhaps one day you will return to the Summer Isles.
Kill the masters.
Very well, Your Grace.
The Queen says you may approach and speak.
He is a goatherd. He says he prayed for your victory against the slave masters.
(speaks Valyrian)
It was your dragons, he says. They came this morning for his flock.
He hopes he has not offended Your Grace, but now he has nothing.
(translates)
There are 212 supplicants waiting, Your Grace.
No, not spying.
Yes your grace.
No.
He was interested.
I believe he was interested.
All of it?
I don't know, your grace.
Yes, your grace.
*in Valyrian* You don't need to apologize.
*in Valyrian* No.
To me.
I don't remember teaching you the word precious.
Do you remember the name you were given at birth?
When they cut you, do you remember that?
I'm sorry. I'm sorry they did that to you.
It's a terrible thing to do to a boy.
*in Valyrian* Grey Worm.
*in Valyrian* I'm glad you saw me.

5.text: Torgo Nudho.
I wanted to speak with you.

White Rat, the Unsullied who… I have heard they found his body in a brothel. I have heard that more than one Unsullied has been known to visit Meereen’s brothels. May I ask you why? Why would an Unsullied go to a brothel?
(Valyrian) A bit “rusty”.
You are not strong enough to go anywhere.
It’s true. Only the Unsullied can keep the peace in Meereen. If you leave, half the city will consume the other half.
Glory?
You're still too weak. (He lays back down).
(Valyrian) Three days.
(Valyrian) You failed no one. You fought bravely. Youâ€™ll fight again. (In Common Tongue) Are you ashamed? You were ambushed, outnumbered. There was no way you could have known.
All men fear death.
Now you have given the Masters what they deserve.
Your Grace, I think that I am not fit to have an opinion on these matters.

I can only tell you what I have seen, Your Grace. (Sitting down). I have seen you listen to your counselors. I have seen you lean on their experience when your own was lacking and weigh the choices they put before you. And I have seen you ignore your counselors, because there was a better choice. One that only you could see.

6.text: They are not eating. They haven’t touched any food since Queen Daenerys left.
How do you know this?
Many times.
Never.
Who said this?
My master Kraznys would sometimes make us play games.
Only the girls.
We do not drink.
You found out?

We cannot. The Masters only speak one language. They spoke it to me for many years. I know it better than my mother tongue. If we want them to hear us, we must speak it back to them. May it be the last thing they ever hear.
Possibly?
Our queen tried to make peace with the Masters and they tried to murder her.
How many days were you a slave?
Not long enough to understand.
She refused them because hundreds of thousands of men, women, and children still lived in chains.
You promised the slavers they could keep slavery.
Seven years is not a short time for a slave.
The people know who brought them freedom.
You seem happy.
I will be happy when our queen returns.
I have tried wine before. It made me feel funny.
I do not know any jokes.
A joke is like a story, Torgo Nudho. Not a true story, necessarily.
I do.
Two translators are on a sinking ship.
The first says, “Do you know how to swim?” The second says, “No, but I can shout for help in 19 languages.”
You don’t even know what a joke is.
More jokes.
The Masters have come for their property.
That changes nothing.
Our queen insists that one of you must die as punishment for your crimes.

7.text: Your Grace, forgive me, but your translation is not quite accurate. That noun has no gender in High Valyrian, so the proper translation for that prophecy would be the prince or princess who was promised will bring the dawn.
You leave tomorrow. Were you going to say goodbye?
But you don't know when that will be.
I wish you good fortune.
Why?
I don't.
That's what I am? Your weakness?
I believe it.
I do too.
I want to see you. Please.
Welcome to Dragonstone. Our queen knows this is a long journey. She appreciates the effort you have made on her behalf. If you wouldn't mind handing over your weapons.
Please, this way.
I was born on the Island of Naarth.

You stand in the presence of Daenerys Stormborn of House Targaryen, rightful heir to the Iron Throne, rightful Queen of the Andals and the First Men, Protector of the Seven Kingdoms, the Mother of Dragons, the Khaleesi of the Great Grass Sea, The Unburnt, The Breaker of Chains.
They can still do something to you. It only takes one arrow.
And what will they face?
Your Grace, there's still no word from the Unsullied.
He better.
Many things.
Ser Davos, Lord Snow.
Forgive me, but may I ask a question?
Your name is Jon Snow, but your father's name was Ned Stark?
We don't have marriage in Naarth so the concept of a bastard doesn't exist.
I was stolen away by slavers.
She bought me from my master and set me free.
I serve my queen because I want to serve my queen. Because I believe in her.
Then she would give me a ship and wish me good fortune.
I know it. All of us who came with her from Essos, we believe in her. She's not our queen because she's the daughter of some king we never knew. She's the queen we chose.
Why did they build it?

8.text: Hello.
Naath. I'd like to see the beaches again.
My people are peaceful. We cannot protect ourselves.
When the people find out what we have done for them, that we saved them--
No!
Dracarys.

4.text: Beautiful. But pale.
Timid. Timid bores me.
(Laughs) Not timid.
This one will do nicely.
Oh, I'm not a lady.
A lie anywhere. Why not use the right words? I'm a bastard. She is a whore. And you're what? A procurer.
Oberyn.
Oberyn, don't.
Come with me, lover.
My lord. My lady.
We are everywhere in Dorne. I have 10,000 brothers and sisters.
No?
That's quite all right, lover. It's more for you.
Children.
He is a prince of Dorne. Girls and boys will line up to fuck him till the day he dies.
Call my name if you need me, lover.
You're going to fight that?
He is the biggest man I've ever seen.
Don't leave me alone in this world.

5.text: Forgive me child. I wish you all the happiness in the world.
Remove myself from my path, or I'll take that long axe and shove it--
Your brother was murdered, and you sit here at the Water Gardens, staring at the sky and doing nothing.
Your brother--
