What will you do about his death.
You would have me go to war?
The whole country would have you go to war.
The Sand Snakes are with me. They have the love of their people. They will avenge your father while you sit here in your chair doing nothing.
Oberyn is dead. And this Lannister girl skips about the Water Gardens eating our food, breathing our air. How many of your brothers and sisters do they have to kill?
And how long will that be?
Unbowed, unbent, unbroken. For Oberyn.
What are you doing in Dorne?
No, you want to break bread with the Lannisters.
The word of a Kingslayer.
No wonder you can’t stand. You have no spine.
You write like a 7 year old.
He didn’t try to make you pay?
Then maybe he’s changed. The Queen will be thrilled to know you’ll be bringing her daughter home
You love her very much, don’t you?
I wasn’t talking about her.

You think I disapprove. Why? Because people disapprove of that sort of thing where you are from? They disapproved of Oberyn and me where you are from. Here, no one blinked an eye. 100 years ago, no one would have blinked an eye at you if you had been named Targaryen. It’s always changing, who we’re supposed to love and who we’re not.The only thing that stays the same is that we want who we want.
I know your daughter had no part in the terrible thing that happened to the man I loved. Perhaps even you were innocent of that.

6.text: And men.
The gods are not fools. You would have been a lousy adventurer. And Oberyn, pfft, he would have been a terrible ruler.

When was the last time you left this palace? You don’t know your own people. Their disgust for you. Elia Martell raped and murdered, and you did nothing. Oberyn martell butchered, and you did nothing. You’re not a Dornishman. You’re not our prince.
Your son is weak just like you. And weak men will never rule Dorne again.
You have nothing to fear from us, Lady Olenna.
The Lannisters have declared war on House Tyrell. They have declared war on Dorne. We must be allies now if we wish to survive.
You’re absolutely right. I chose the wrong words. It is not survival I offer. It is your heart’s desire.
Vengeance. Justice.

7.text: It's called war. You don't have the stomach for it, scurry back into hiding.
She was a Lannister. There are no innocent Lannisters. My greatest regret is that Oberyn died fighting for you.
How can you drink this piss? When we reach Sunspear I'll treat you to a Dornish red, the best in the world. Have you ever been to Dorne?
A boy in every port?
Could we get some more?
I'm developing a taste for it.
So, you're going to be Queen of the Iron Islands.
And what will you be, handsome?
Oh, I see. Your protector.
So if someone gets too close to you --
-- hold that person back.
Why are you standing all the way over there then? A foreign invasion is under way. It seems like you don't need a protector.
Kill us! Get it over with!

2.text: Is Joffrey going to kill Sansa's brother?
No. I don't think so.
They're still fighting.
The Kingswood?
Like what?
Stags aren't evil. They only eat grass.

4.text: It means I'll become king.
A good king?
Holiness?
Justice.
No.
What about strength?
Wisdom.
Wisdom is what makes a good king.
No.
A king needs a queen.
Yes.
I don't think so. It's all relatively straightforward.
I'm all right.
Ser Pounce?
How did you get past the Kingsguard?
I don't think you're supposed to be here. Mother doesn't allow me to have visitors at night.
Yes. But if my mother found out...
Yes? Tell me a secret.
That's Ser Pounce.
Joffrey didn't like him. He threatened to skin him alive and mix his innards up in my food so I wouldn't know I was eating him.
No. I don't think I am.
We say our vows in front of the High Septon. And after the ceremony, there's a feast.

I, Tommen of the House Baratheon, First of my Name, King of the Andals and the First Men, and Lord of the Seven Kingdoms, do hereby recuse myself from this trial. Tywin of the House Lannister, Hand of the King, Protector of the Realm, will sit as judge in my stead. And with him Prince Oberyn of the House Martell and Lord Mace of the House Tyrell. And if found guilty... may the gods punish the accused.

5.text: Did I hurt you?
It all happened so fast.
I was scared maybe I hurt you, it sounded
This is what I want to do all day, every day for the rest of my life.
Of course not. Are you hungry? Shall I have them bring you some cake or pomegranate juice?
King Tommen. It still sounds strange to me. Does Queen Margaery sound strange to you?
Wife. (They laugh). Sometimes it feels odd. I'm the king, I've married the most beautiful woman in the world, (She chuckles), and it's all because my brother died.
I don't feel guilty. That's what's odd.
Do you like to sail?
I do, too.
I do, too.
I don't think so. She told me never to trust anyone in King's Landing.
Well, but I'm a man now.
I suppose.
Do you ever miss Casterly Rock?
That's where you grew up. (They stop). You always told me that you liked the people there better. You said that King's Landing smelled of horse dung and sour milk.
The way that you talked about it, I always thought that you missed it. That you... That it was your real home.
I want you to be happy, mother.
But wouldn't you be happier in Casterly Rock?
I, I don't know. I, I didn't order it.
(Standing up). Are you saying my mother is behind this?
Aren't you and mother getting along?
(Takes her hand). Of course I do. You're my Queen.
I'll set him free for you.
I demand that Ser Loras be freed now!
Well, no... But you armed the Faith Militant. You gave the High Sparrow an army.
Then can I tell Margaery you'll have Ser Loras released?
You mean, kill them? Here, in the sept?
We'll find another way.
My Queen?
There was no way to free Ser Loras without violence.
I'm going to speak to the High Sparrow.
I--I don't know.
He was praying just now.
Will you come back later? (Margaery stops).
Of course.
She’s in a prison cell and there’s nothing I can do. I am the king! The queen is in prison and there’s nothing I can do!
I’ll call in the army. I’ll take back the sept and kill every last one of them. I’ll start a war if I have to.
I love her. I love her. I can’t help her.
I will speak to the high sparrow. There must be something--
I know.

6.text: All right. I’m ready.
I have to go, I’m-- I’m late for the trial.
She grew up.
Have we caught Prince Trystane’s killers? I expect it was Mother.
Yes, she would.
Of course not.
They told me she wouldn’t be allowed in the sept. If she had tried --
Don’t you think I know that? I’m sorry. But I can’t.
When the Faith Militant seized her and Margaery, what did I do? When they paraded her through the streets like a whore, what did I do?
The king is supposed to be the Protector of the Realm. If I can’t even protect my own wife or my own mother, what good am I?
I want to see my wife.
Mother.
Gold.
I’m sorry for keeping you here. I shouldn’t have, but I was -- I didn’t want to lose you again.
I know I should have come sooner. I wanted to. I was wrong.
No, it isn’t.

I should have executed all of them. I should have pulled down the sept onto the High Sparrow’s head before I let them do that to you, as you would have for me. You raised me to be strong...and I wasn’t. But I want to be. Help me.
My mother would like to see her daughter’s final resting place.
When will it be possible?
You’ve cut off her hair and marched her naked through the streets in front of the whole city. That wasn’t a full atonement?
I want you to let her see Myrcella’s resting place.
I am the king.
And what does that mean to you?
My mother who is unclean? My mother who still needs to atone after all you’ve put her through?
Yes.
Of course.
I still don’t understand why you want to put her through any more than she's already endured.
My grandfather once said something similar. Except for the part about the gods.
Thank you for your counsel, Grand Maester. That will be all for now.
I’ve been thinking about the High Sparrow.

We need to be careful in dealing with such a man. To prevent things from escalating any further. We have to be careful not to antagonize him. He has Margaery. We can’t put her at risk. He’s dangerous.
You don’t like Margaery, do you?
Mother...there’s something I want to tell you. Something the High Sparrow told me.
I promised him I wouldn’t tell anyone. If he found out I told --
Is there no other way?
Of course I’m afraid for her! It just seems very dangerous.
She’s always been very devoted to the poor and the unfortunate.
Have they hurt you? Have they mistreated you?
I’ve missed you. More than you could know.
Better how? Soon the- - walk of atonement. He says there’s no other way.
Yes, a few times. Have you?
No. No, you don’t. You- - you could never. You’re right, he’s not. He’s a lot more- -
What are you talking about? You’re a good person. You’ve always been a good person. You’re the best person I know.
I was just telling him about your devotion to the poor.
I don’t understand.
What about Loras?
The crown and the faith are the twin pillars upon which the world rests. Together we will restore the Seven Kingdoms to glory.
When you attack the Faith, you attack the Crown. Anyone who attacks the Crown is unfit to serve as Lord Commander of the Kingsguard.
I have to answer to the gods.
The Crown’s decision on this matter is final.
You have served your house and your king faithfully for many years. And you will continue to do so. But not in this city.

Lords and ladies, the Faith and the Crown are the two pillars that hold up this world. One collapses, so does the other. The Father judges us all. If you break his laws...you will be punished. After conferring with His Holiness the High Septon, we have determined that Loras Tyrell and Cersei lannister’s trial will be held in the Great Sept of Baelor on the first day of the Festival of the Mother.

Furthermore, after much prayer and reflection, the Crown has decided that from this day forward, trial by combat will be forbidden throughout the Seven Kingdoms. The tradition is a brutish one, a scheme devised by corrupt rulers in order to avoid true judgment from the gods. Cersei Lannister and Loras Tyrell will stand trial before seven septons as it was in the earliest days of the Faith. Seven blessings to all.

2.text: Waiting for you.
After all the things you have seen, this is your question?
No harder than taking a new name, if you know the way. Show me how. I want to be able to do it, too.
If you would learn, you must come with me.
Far and away across the Narrow Sea to Braavos.

To be a dancing master is a special thing, but to be a faceless man, that is something else entirely. The girl has many names on her lips. Joffrey, Cersei, Tywin Lannister, llyn Payne, the Hound. Names to offer up to the Red God. She could offer them all one by one.
Then we must part. A man has duties as well. Here.
A coin of great value.
It is not meant for the buying of horses.
If the day comes when you must find me again, just give that coin to any man from Braavos and say these words to him, "Valar Morghulis."
Jaqen is dead. Say it again. Valar Morghulis.
Good.
Farewell, Arya Stark.
(Whispers) Boy.
(Whispers) Lovely boy.
A man has a thirst. The man does not drink for a day and a night. A boy could make a friend.

A man does not choose his companions. These two, they have no courtesy. A man must ask forgiveness. (Pause). You're called Arry. (Arya nods). This man has the honor to be Jaqen H'ghar. Once of the Free City of Lorath.
(Quietly) The boy has more courage than sense.
Boy, come here. Boy! - Sweet boy, help us.
Come back here! Help us, boy! A man can fight! Free us!
Quick, give it to me. Give me the ax. Give me that.
A girl says nothing.
A girl keeps her mouth closed. No one hears, and friends may talk in secret, yes? A boy becomes a girl.
And I was always aware. But the girl keeps secrets. It is not for a man to spoil them.
And you fetch water for one of them now. Why is this right for you and wrong for me?
You did. I did. And here we are.
A man pays his debts. A man owes three.

The Red God takes what is his, lovely girl. And only death may pay for life. You saved me and the two I was with. You stole three deaths from the Red God. We have to give them back. Speak three names and the man will do the rest. Three lives I will give you, no more, no less, and we're done.
A man has said.
A man needs a name.
That is enough. Go now, girl. Your master is thirsty.
A girl has named a second name. A man will do what must be done.
A girl cannot tell a man when exactly he must do a thing. A man cannot make a thing happen before its time.
(sighs)
A man has patrol duty.
A girl owes one more name. The Red God demands it. Give the man a name.
A minute, an hour, a month. Death is certain, the time is not.
This a man cannot do.
Help was not promised, lovely girl. Only death. There must be others. Give a name, any name.
By the Seven New Gods and the Old Gods beyond counting, I swear it.
A girl gives a man his own name?
Gods are not mocked. This is no joking thing.
Un-name me.
Please?
Thank you.
This would require more than one life. This is not part of our bargain.
A girl lacks honor. If I do this thing, a girl must obey.
A girl and her friends will walk through the gate at midnight.

5.text: A girl has taken a life. The wrong life.
You were.
That man’s life wasn’t yours to take. A girl stole from the Many Faced God. Now a debt is owed.
Only death can pay for life.
He was no one.
No one at all. Just as a girl should have been before she took a face from the hall.
The faces are for no one.
You are still someone.
And to someone…
...the faces are as good as poison.
There isn't. A man is not Jaqen H'ghar.
No one. And that is who a girl must become.
Valar dohaeris.
Good.
No? Why come, then?
A man teaches a girl. (Stands up). Valar dohaeris. All men must serve. Faceless men, most of all. (Walks away).
A girl wants to serve herself. Here we serve the Many-Faced God, to serve well. A girl must become no-one.
There is only one god. A girl knows his name. And all men know his gift.
What are you doing?
A girl is not ready.
For what? For whatever you want. To be a Faceless Man. To be no one.
Whose sword is that? It belongs to Arya Stark. Arya Stark's sword, Arya Stark's clothes, Arya Stark's stolen silver. A man wonders how is it that no one came to be surrounded by Arya Stark's things?
Who are you?
Who are you?
And where did you come from?
A lie.
A lie.
A lie.
The girl lies. To me. To the Many Faced God. To herself. Does she truly want to be no one?
We never stop playing.
Is the girl ready to give up her ears, her nose, her tongue, her hopes and dreams, her loves and hates, all that makes a girl who she is, forever?
No. The girl is not ready to become no one. But she is ready to become someone else.
Lana is very impressive. Very industrious. She will make a fine servant for the Many Faced God.
She will no longer turn left onto Ragman Lane. She will turn right and go to Ragman Harbor.
She will see.
How can a man tell a girl this. If he knew what she would see, there would be no reason to send her.
The man is a gambler. He wages that his sailor's ship will make it to its destination. It is a strange wager for the captain. He only wins if he loses his life.
A girl tells a man that she has seen.

But perhaps the gambler loses his bet and decides that he doesn’t have to pay after all. A destitute woman and her small child, what can they do to such a man if he keeps their money for himself? To whom can they turn for recourse?

A man had no idea what she would see and what she would not. A girl named Lana will return to the docks. She will watch the gambler. She will come to know as much about him as she knows about herself.
A gift for the Thin Man.
Perhaps she is, perhaps she’s not.
It is all the same to the Many Faced God.
And?
Perhaps that’s why the man is thin.
Tomorrow.
A girl has work to do.

6.text: Who are you?
If a girl says her name, a man will let her sleep under a roof tonight.
If a girl says her name, a man will feed her tonight.
If a girl says her name, a man will give her eyes back.
Come.
Leave it. A girl is not a beggar anymore.
If a girl tells me her name, I will give her eyes back.
Come.
If a girl is truly no one, she has nothing to fear.
Who are you?
She has a point.
None of the first Faceless Men were born to lords and ladies. They began as slaves in the mines of Valyria.

He was no one. The Many-Faced God taught him how to shed his face and how to give the gift. The man taught others in exchange for their service. Many served, many more gifts were given. Soon all the masters and overseers were gone and the Faceless Men fled.

Here. They founded the Free City of Braavos and built this house. These were the faces they wore in life when they were not wearing others. The first Faceless Men. And now a girl is one of them, if a girl desires.

An actress who calls herself Lady Crane. She performs at the theater in Sheelba Square. A girl has been given a second chance. There will not be a third. One way or another, a face will be added to the hall.
A girl is not ready.
So a man has heard.
Does death only come for the wicked and leave the decent behind?
That does not matter. The price was paid.
A girl must decide if she wants to serve the Many-Faced God.
A servant does not ask questions.
And?
A shame. A girl had many gifts.
Don’t let her suffer.
Yes. But here you are. And there she is.
Finally a girl is no one.

2.text: Five Lannisters dead for every one of ours. They're dead. Take everything they've got. We've nowhere to keep all these prisoners. Barely enough food to feed our own.
Of course, Your Grace. The officers will be useful. Some of them may be privy to Tywin Lannister's plans.
Well, we'll learn soon enough. In my family, we say, "A naked man has few secrets. "A flayed man none."
We're not in the North.
The high road's very pretty, but you'll have a hard time marching your army down it.
Surely one of our men needs your attention more than this cub.
Your Grace. My lady. News from Winterfell.
We've had ravens from White Harbor, Barrowton and the Dreadfort. I'm afraid it is true.
Because the Greyjoys are treasonous whores.
We've heard nothing of them. But Rodrik Cassel is dead.
There's still a war to win, Your Grace.
You are a king. And that means you don't have to do everything yourself.

Theon holds the castle with a skeleton crew. Let me send word to my bastard at the Dreadfort. He can raise a few hundred men and retake Winterfell before the new moon. We have the Lannisters on the run. If you march all the way back north now, you'll lose what you gained. My boy would be honored to bring you Prince Theon's head.
Too many prisoners.
We've sent a dozen ravens. None have returned. My bastard is only a few days from Winterfell. Once he captures the castle
He wouldn't dare hurt the boys. They're his only hope of escaping the North with his head.
A touch of mercy is a virtue, Your Grace. Too much
I expect his countrymen will turn on him the minute they hear the offer.
My lady.

3.text: We should set the siege lines 1,000 yards from Harrenhal.
I imagine the Mountain will defend whatever Tywin Lannister tells him to defend.
The debt will be repaid, my friend. For them and for your sons.
The Kingslayer won't remain free for long. My best hunters are after him.
The Blackfish escaped.
As you say.
You'll be needing a new young girl.
(grunts)
He ignored my advice at every turn. If he'd been a trifle less arrogant--
(nods)
Forever young.
At some point perhaps. But Winterfell's in ruins.
I sent my bastard Ramsay to root him out. Robb Stark offered amnesty for the ironborn if they gave us Theon.
Ramsay delivered the terms. The ironborn turned on Theon as we knew they would. They handed him over trussed and hooded. But Ramsay-- well Ramsay has his own way of doing things.
Ser Jaime isn't well. Take him to Qyburn.
I see my men have finally found you something appropriate to wear.
I should send you back to Robb Stark.
Wars cost money. Many people would pay a great deal for you.
You're right. Perhaps the safest thing to do is to kill you both and burn your bodies.
King Robb is keeping your father quite busy. He doesn't have time for anything else.

As soon as you're well enough to travel, I will allow you to go to King's Landing as restitution for the mistakes my soldiers made. And you will swear to tell your father the truth, that I had nothing to do with your maiming.
I don't partake.
Oh, she won't be going with you.
You are charged with abetting treason.
You're in no place to insist on anything. I would have hoped you'd learned your lesson about overplaying your position.
Never do, my lady. Dulls the senses.
Aye. Lord Walder let me choose any of his granddaughters and promised me the girl’s weight in silver as a dowry. So I have a fat, young bride.
Well, she’s made me very rich.
Every bride suffers the same. I’m sure you endured yours with grace.
The Lannisters send their regards.

4.text: Walda, this is Ramsay Snow, my bastard.
See that the horses are fed, watered, and rubbed down. And take Lady Walda to her chambers.
Where is your prize?
What did you do to him?
You flayed him.
This was Balon Greyjoy's son and heir.

My banners, not yours. You're not a Bolton. You're a Snow. Tywin Lannister has given me the North. But he won't lift a finger to help me take it. As long as the ironborn hold Moat Cailin, our armies are trapped south of the Neck. Theon was a valuable hostage, not your plaything. I wanted to trade him for Moat Cailin.
You sent terms to Balon Greyjoy without my consent?
I had to smuggle myself into my own lands thanks to the Greyjoys. I needed Theon. I needed him whole.
I placed far too much trust in you.
You murdered them and displayed their corpses at Winterfell.
You ready for a hunt?
Their bastard brother. He could be sheltering them. He may know where they are.

You want to prove yourself a Bolton? Gather whatever men you can and ride for Moat Cailin. Bring this creature of yours. Maybe he'll be of some use. Take the Moat for the family, for our family, and I'll reconsider your position.

Not nothing. The North. Ride 700 miles that way, you're still in the North. 400 miles that way. 300 miles that way. The North is larger than the other six kingdoms combined. And I am the Warden of the North. The North is mine. Now tell me, what is your name?
No, not Ramsay Snow. *hands Ramsay a scroll* Open it. From this day until your last day, you are Ramsay Bolton, son of Roose Bolton, Warden of the North.

5.text: We can't hold the North with terror alone.
I sent you there to collect taxes, not bodies.
He left you no choice.
And?
(After a moment). I have something important to tell you. Stop eating and listen.
We don't have enough men to hold the North if the other Houses rise up against us. Do you understand that?

I had a pact with Tywin Lannister, and Tywin Lannister is dead. The remaining Lannisters are a thousand miles away dealing with that fact. They've never once in the history of the Seven Kingdoms sent their army this far north. If you think they will for us, you're a fool. We become a great house by entering in alliances with other houses, and parleying those alliances into greater power. The best way to forge a lasting alliance isn't by peeling a man's skin off. The best way is marriage. (Stands up). Now that you're a Bolton by royal decree, it's time you married a suitable bride. And as it happens, I found the perfect girl to solidify our hold in the North.
Lady Sansa, welcome.
May I introduce my son, (Stands aside), Ramsay Bolton?
(Approaching). And you're not anymore. Allow me a moment alone with Lord Baelish.
Shouldn't he be?
I leave that to the brothel keeper. It's her name I need, not her virtue.
And you prepared for the consequences. When the Lannisters hear I've wed Sansa Stark to Ramsay.
The Queen will be enraged.

And yet she still has friends. Men in important places, whom she can ask for favours. (They stop, and Roose holds up a letter). A message for you, from Cersei Lannister. A rider arrived from Eyrie, shortly before dawn. Apparently, she thinks you're still in the Vale.

I'm sure you understand my position, Lord Baelish. If you received word in the night from the Queen Mother, it does make me question our new alliance. The Lannisters made you one of the great lords of Westeros. Yet, here you are in the North, undermining them. Why gamble with your position?
I had Tywin Lannister backing. Who supports me now? You?
I'd like to read the reply.
I trust you find your chamber suitable, my lady.
(Raises his cup). To your wedding.
Yes, yes, very good.
Walda and I have some good news as well, since we're all together.
From the way she's carrying, Maester Wolkan says it looks like a boy.
Sure of what?
Maester Wolkan has assured us beyond all doubt.
Manage what?
I imagine you're familiar with the procedure.
You disgraced yourself at dinner, parading that creature before the Stark girl.
You're worried about your position.
You've never asked me about your mother.

She was a peasant girl. Pretty in a common sort of way. She was the miller's wife. Apparently they had married without my knowledge or consent. So I had him hanged and I took her beneath the tree where he was swaying. She fought me the whole time. She was lucky I didn't hang her, too. A year later she came to my gates with a squalling baby in her arms. A baby she claimed was mine. I nearly had her whipped and the child thrown in the river. (Stands up). But then I looked at you and I saw then what I see now. You are my son. (After a moment). Stannis Baratheon has an army at Castle Black. But he won't stay for long. He wants the Iron Throne, and the road to King's Landing comes right through Winterfell. He means to take the North. But the North is ours. It's yours and mine. Will you help me defeat him?
Who comes before the Old Gods this night?
Lady Sansa, will you take this man?

And how high can Stannis’ horses jump? Our walls have been full repaired our walls have been reinforced. We have enough food for six months. We are more prepared for a siege than they could have ever been. All we have to do is wait for them to freeze, starve, and mutiny.
You disagree?
And what do you recommend?

A smart commander does not surrender a defensive advantage. As long as we stay behind these walls they can’t touch us. Not to mention that the snow is so deep that we couldn’t get an army through if we wanted to.

6.text: Your command of the cavalry was impressive. Thanks to you, the false king Stannis Baratheon is dead. Do you know who struck the killing blow?
A shame. I’d reward the man. Still, a great victory. Do you feel like a victor?

I rebelled against the crown to arrange your marriage to Sansa Stark. Do you think that burning wagons in the night and mowing down tired, outnumbered Baratheons is the same as facing a prepared and provisioned Lannister army?

A reckoning will come. We need the North to face it. The entire North. They won’t back us without Sansa Stark. We no longer have Sansa Stark. You played your games with her. You played your games with the heir to the Iron Islands and now they’re both gone.
I’m glad to hear it. Without Sansa, you won’t be able to produce an heir. And without an heir, well…
...let’s hope the maesters are right and Lady Walder’s carrying a boy.
Half a dozen men? Your best hunters?
I didn’t think lady Sansa killed them all by herself. Thank you for this report, Lord Kastark.
Jon Snow is a bastard, not a Stark.
Murder the Lord Commander of the Night’s Watch? You’d unite every house in the North against us.
If you acquire a reputation as a mad dog, you’ll be treated as a mad dog. Taken out back and slaughtered for pig feed.
You’ll always be my firstborn.

5.text: You wish to make a confession?
Your Grace will be dealt with according to her sins.
Name him.
Your cousin. And the King’s squire.
You had a husband.
His sins do not pardon your own.
Other men?
No others?
Speaking falsehoods before the Gods is a great crime. You understand this?
There are those who say your children were not fathered by King Robert. That they are bastards born of incest and adultery.
Good. But these are terrible charges. And the realm must know the truth of them. If Your Grace has given honest testimony, your trial will prove your innocence.
To a single sin. Others you have denied. Your trial will separate the truths from the falsehoods.
You have taken the first step on a path back to righteousness. In light of this, I will permit you to return to the Red Keep.
The Mother is merciful. It is her you should thank.
Good.
After your atonement.

A sinner comes before you. Cersei of House Lannister, mother to his Grace King Tommen, widow to his Grace King Robert. She has committed the acts of falsehood and fornication. She has confessed her sins and begged for forgiveness. To demonstrate her repentance, she will cast aside all pride, all artifice, and present herself as the gods made her, to you. The good people of the city. She comes before you with a solemn heart. Shorn of secrets. Naked before the eyes of gods and men. To make her walk of atonement.

High Sparrow? Sounds ridiculous, doesn't it? Like Lord Duckling, or King Turtle. (Laughs). So, it's meant to. We're often stuck with the names our enemies give to us. (Prepares soup for the next person in line). The notion that we are all equal in the eyes of Seven doesn't sit well with some, so they belittle me.
Seven blessings to you, my dear. It's only a name, quite an easy burden to wear. Far easier than hers. (Prepares soup for the next person in line).
Because I gave them away to someone who needed them more. We all do that. It stops us from forgetting what we really are.
Everyone? I have a hard enough job reminding myself. Oh, I tell them no one's special. And they think I'm special for telling them so.
It would be comforting to believe that, wouldn't it? The Gods sent you here to tempt me? I hope not. I had assumed you'd only come here to arrest me. For that incident with the High Septon.
Hypocrisy is a boil. Lancing a is never pleasant. Although, they could have been more careful with the blade.
I wouldn't presume to know your thoughts on the matter.
No. (Smiles).
I could say that our minds are temples to the Seven and should be kept pure. But the truth is, (Chuckles), I don't like the taste.
(After a moment). How may I serve?
Wars teach people to obey the sword, not the Gods.
Well, the Faith Militant was disarmed more than two centuries ago.
An army that defends the bodies and souls of the common people.
An honor I never expected. Or indeed, ever wished for.
All sinners are equal before the Gods.
May the Father judge him justly. (Smiles).
You are aware of the rumors concerning you and Renly?
You were said to be despondent when he died. Witnesses said that you refused to leave his bedside, even as Stannis’ army closed in
Wasn’t Joffrey your king? He was anointed by the 7, not Renly.
Wearing Renly’s armor.
Do you deny all of the charges against you? Fornication, buggery, blasphemy.
You never lay with Renly Baratheon.
Nor any other man.
That will be all Ser Loras.
Faith calls Queen Margaery forward.
Yes. We have some questions for you.
You are. And according to Law of the Seven, neither kings nor queens are exempt from testimony at a holy inquest.
How do you respond to these charges against your brother?
All of them?
Queen Margaery, in the presence of the gods, do you swear that your brother is innocent of these charges against him, to the best of your knowledge?
Thank you, your grace.
Do you know this man?
How did you come to meet?
And what occurred in his chamber?
You laid with him?
Is there anyone else who can support your claim?
The Faith is satisfied that there is enough evidence to bring a formal trial for Ser Loras... and Queen Margaery.
Bearing false witness before the gods is as grave a sin as any. Take her.
It’s not as good a name as Queen of Thorns, I’ll admit.
You should have the decency to kneel before the gods
For me, it’s the knees. You?
Huh.
The people always do the dirty work.
A useful talent.
Your grandson and granddaughter swore sacred vows and lied. The Father judges us all. Sons of high lords, sons of fishermen. If you break his laws you will be punished.
You don’t give commands here, Lady Olenna.
I imagine this is strange for you. Everyone you meet has a hidden motive, and you pride yourself on slitting in and out. But I’m telling you a simple truth
By the holy text. The seven pointed star. If you don’t have one in your library I’ll give you my own.
Then you’ll remember the passages concerning buggery and perjury. Your grandchildren will be punished in the same manner as anyone who breaks the sacred laws.
Yes. The Gods’ laws must be applied to all equally.

Have you ever served the field, Lady Olenna? Have you ever reaped the grain? Has anyone in House Tyrell? A lifetime of wealth and power has left you blind in one eye. You are the few. We are the many. And when the many stop fearing the few…
And?

Well she and her brother are both being held under fair suspicion. A trial will be held for each of them to determine if they are guilty of any acts that might constitute a violation of the tenants of the faith.
Seven septons. As it was in all trials before the Targaryens.
I will.
Then they will be at The Mother’s mercy.
It depends on the situation. The acts themselves, the degree of contrition.
Did you know this chapel is one of the oldest structures in King’s Landing?
Baelor built his sept around it. But men worshipped here long before him.
Who carved this altar do you know?

No one does. There’s no name on it. Or anywhere else in the chapel. The people who built this place didn’t inflict their vanity on the people who came after them. The way Baelor did with that great gilded monstrosity out there. Their faith was clean.

A young man came to us not long ago, broken in body and spirit. He had so much to strip away, so much weighing him down. But piece by piece he unburdened himself. Let go of vanity, pride, sin, now his soul is so light he will float through the Seven Heaves like a bird.
And he has much to say about you.

6.text: Septa Unella.
Our other guests need you.
Septa Unella can be overzealous at times. I’ll speak with her.

It isn’t Ser Loras that brings me here. Your husband misses you dearly. The love between a man and wife is sacred. It reflects the love the gods have for all of us. But sin leads us away from the sacred. And only confession can purge sin.
So you believe you are pure? Perfect? Wholly without sin?
You have started down the path. But you have many miles to go..
Ser Loras Tyrell. Are you prepared to stand trial and profess your guilt or innocence before the Seven?
To which crimes will you be confessing?
The gods’ judgment is fierce, but also fair. The Warrior punishes those who believe themselves beyond the reach of justice. But the Mother shows her mercy to those who kneel before her.
You understand fully what this means?
Brother Loras…
...I ask you to dedicate your life to the seven gods.
Will you fight to defend your faith against heretics and apostates?
I’ve kept my word. Once the queen mother’s trial is concluded, Brother Loras is free to leave.
It appears the queen mother doesn’t wish to attend her own trial.
You have nothing to fear, Your Grace. The trial will begin shortly.
If the accused is not here, she will be tried regardless. We cannot escape the justice of the gods--
Your Grace. Lord Commander.
The gods wait for Queen Margaery to confess her crimes and seek their mercy. The king must wait as well.
On the contrary. I fear a great deal. The Father, the Mother, the Warrior.
Do you know why we use these stones? To remind us not to fear death. We close our eyes on this world and open them on the next.
In truth, I fear that, too.
Your sister sought the gods’ mercy and atoned for her sin.
You would spill blood in this holy place?
Go on, then. I deserve it. We all do. We are weak, vain creatures. We live only by the Mother’s mercy.
I don’t. They’d never reach me before you struck.
No doubt many of us would fall. But who are we, hmm? We have no names, no family. Every one of us is poor and powerless. And yet together, we can overthrow an empire.
Oh, your Grace.
Oh, I'm, sorry, your Grace. That’s not possible. Not yet.
When she's fully atoned for her sins.
No. She must stand trial before seven septons, so we can learn the true extant of her sins.
You are.
It means a great deal to me. The crown and the faith are the twin pillars of the world. Do you know who told me that? Your mother.

How do you think the Mother Above first came to us? How did men and women first come to feel the Mother’s presence? It was through their own mothers. There is a great deal of falsehood in Cersei, you know that. But when she speaks of you, the Mother’s love outshines it all. Her love for you is more real than anything else in this world. Because it doesn’t come from this world. But you know that. You’ve felt it. You’ve seen her when she talks to you.
It’s a great gift. One I never had. Envy. One more thing for me to atone for.
You Grace, may I? Do you mind? It's my knees.
When your mother made her walk of atonement, she did it to get back to you.
It’s not what I want. It’s what the gods want. They make their will known to us and it’s up to us to either accept or reject it.
Please.
If we’re to be just and good, then we accept it, all of us, even kings. A true leader avails himself of the wisest council he can. And no one is wiser than the gods.
The gods worked through him whether he knew it or not. As they work through your mother. There’s so much good in all of us. The best we can do is to help each other bring it out.
If I were to let you leave right now, where would you go? What would you seek out?

Of course, but for you, that means seeking out money, finery, power. Seeking out your family means seeking out sin. I’m not maligning you. I sought those things out, too. To the exclusion of all else. My father was a cobbler. He died with I was young and I took over his shop. He was a simple man and he made simple shoes. But I found that the more work I put into my shoes, the more people wanted them. Fine leather, ornamentation, detailing, and time. Time most of all. Dozens of hours spent on a single pair.

Yes. I imagine you’ve worn a year of someone’s life on your back. The highborn liked to cover their feet with my time and they paid well for the privilege. I used their money to buy a taste of their lives for myself. Each time I indulged, I felt myself ascending to something better.
You know The Seven-Pointed Star.

Yes, yes, she does enjoy reading at people. You’re close. But it wasn’t a graveyard. It was a feast. I bought old fine wine and young pretty girls and invited my friends to come share it all. We passed around the wine, passed around the women, and soon we fell into a stupor. I woke before dawn. I could barely stand. Everyone else was asleep on the couches or on the floor, lying in heaps next to their fine clothes. The truth of their bodies laid bare. I could smell them beneath the incense and the perfume and the fine food that had already started to turn. And I saw it with perfect clarity. I saw what my sins were. The gold I had, the wine I drank, the women I used, my ceaseless struggle to maintain my position. It was all part of a story. A story I was telling myself about who I was. A collection of lies that would disappear in the light. The people I was trying to climb away from, the beggars in the street, the poor, they were closer to the truth than I ever was.
I left to go and find them. I didn’t even put on my shoes. I walked out the door and never went back.
Come, let’s go and see him.
Your brother.
You’re afraid for her?

She’ll be protected the entire way. The Faith Militant are very stern with those who overstep their bounds. And Queen Margaery isn’t your mother. I suspect the gods will predispose the common people to gentleness on her behalf. She’s truly opened her heart to them.
And now she’s devoted to the gods as well. Would you like to see her?

Rich or poor, noble or common, if we win, we must atone. Margaery of House Tyrell came to us a sinner. She stood before the gods in the holy sept and lied. She turned a blind eye to her brother’s sins. She disgraces her house, the king, and herself.
Lord Tyrell.
Ser Jaime.
I don’t have the authority to give them to you. And you don’t have the authority to take them.
The gods don’t recognize his authority in this matter.
To die in the service of the gods would please each and every one of us. We yearn for it. But there is no call for it today. There will be no walk of atonement.
Queen Margaery has already atoned for her sins by bringing another into the true light of the Seven.
Together we announce a new age of harmony. A holy alliance between the Crown and the Faith.
Your Grace. What are we reading today?
Ah, “As water rounds the stones, smoothing- -”

You learn quickly. There are some who know every verse of the sacred text, but don’t have a drop of the Mother’s mercy in their blood and savages who can’t read at all who understand the Father’s wisdom.
They are hard to love.
The poor disgust us because they are us, shorn of our illusions. They show us what we’d look like without our fine clothes. How’d we smell without perfume.
Can I ask you about a personal matter?
The king mentioned that since your reunion, you haven’t joined him in the marriage bed.
You have a duty, Your Grace. To your husband, your king, your country, to the gods themselves.
Congress does not require desire on the woman’s part, only patience. The king must have an heir if we are to continue our good work.
Hard to find and harder still to walk upon. But you’ve made great progress. I only pray your grandmother follows your lead.
Yes. The Queen of Thorns is a remarkable woman, a strong woman, and an unrepentant sinner. You must teach her the new way as she taught you the old. Or I fear for her safety, body and soul.

3.text: (speaks Valyrian) This one has the honor
(speaks Valyrian) Grey Worm.

(speaks Valeryan) "Grey Worm" gives me pride. It is a very lucky name. The name this one was born with was cursed. That was the name he had when he was taken as a slave. But Grey Worm is the name this one had the day Daenerys Stormborn set him free.
[In Valyrian] I trust him.

4.text: (in valerian) You are not a smart man, Daario Naharis.
*in Valyrian* Sailors saw him flying over the Black Cliffs three days ago, my queen. Nothing since then.
(SPEAKING VALYRIAN) Allow me this honor, mother of dragons. I will not disappoint you.
My name is Grey Worm. I come from the Summer "Ills."
Summer Isles. (speaks Valyrian)
(speaks Valyrian) When they took you?
You remember your home?
(Shakes his head.) Unsullied. Always Unsullied. Before Unsullied, nothing.
I don't want return. (Speaks Valyrian.)
Kill the masters.
Missandei is teacher good, my queen.
(speaking Valyrian.) All men must die.
(speaking Valyrian.) But I promise you, a single day of freedom is worth more than a lifetime in chains.

(speaking Valyrian.) This one is called Grey Worm. I was taken as a baby by the Masters of Astapor, raised and trained as Unsullied. Now I fight for Daenerys, the Mother of Dragons and Breaker of Chains.
(speaking Valyrian.) There are three slaves in this city for every Master. No one can give you your freedom, brothers. If you want it, you must take it.
Missandei. *in Valyrian* I have come to apologize.
*in Valyrian* I hope I didn't frighten you.
The lessons you give I in Common tongue, these are precious to I.
To me.
Jorah the Andal, he teaches I...he teaches me this word.
I remember nothing. Only unsullied.
Why? Why sorry?

*approaches Missandei* If the masters never cut me, I am never unsullied. I never stand in the Plaza of Pride when Daenerys Stormborn orders us to kill the masters. I never am chosen to lead the unsullied. I never meet Missandei from the Island of Naath. I am sorry I...for today. I am sorry.
*in Valyrian* So am I.

5.text: White Rat, your grace.
Missandei hin Naath.
Why do you come?
I do not know. I must go.
Jorah the Andal.
You should not be here.
Our queen ordered him exiled from city.
I am sorry. Sorry I am not there to fight for my queen.
I’ll come with you. I’ll find our queen.
I am.
No one here. We go.
Unsullied fear nothing.
We all guard tonight.
(Valyrian) How long have I been here?
Ser Barristan?
(Valyrian) I failed him. I failed my men, I failed my queen.
This is not why. Wounded in war, there is no shame for this. I am ashamed because when the knife go in and I fall to the ground, I am afraid.
No, not death. I fear I never again see Missandei from the Island of Naath.

6.text: We are searching for the men who burned the ships, but nobody saw anything.
If a dragon does not want to eat, how do you force him to eat?
Patrol. When I am going on patrol with the Unsullied. What we see on patrol. Who we captured on patrol.
Games are for children.
We conquered Asatapor and Yunkai once. We will do it again and execute the Masters.
If we do not fight them, how can we stop them?
So we will fight them?
You invite the enemy into our city?
I don’t make peace with the queen’s enemies. I kill the queen’s enemies.
Not anymore.
Do not use me for your lies.
They respect me because they know who I am. They know I am loyal.
I am loyal to my queen, not you. If you betray her work, you are my enemy.
You are wrong to trust these men.
You don’t know them. You don’t understand them. We are not human in their eyes. They look at me and see a weapon. They look at her and see a whore.
You will not use them. They will use you. That is what they do.
None.
Two, but that was the day of the pact. Since then, nothing.
For now.
Unsullied never drink.
Rules.
Tastes like it has turned.
The Starks and the lannisters, i thought these were enemies.
That is the worst joke I ever heard.
I am soldier all my life. You think I never hear joke?
I make joke.
No more talking from you. Your talking gave us this.
You’re trying to tell me what the army should do. You do not know what the army should do.
We’ll not go to the beach. If we go to the beach, the Masters will take the pyramid. The pyramid is the only place in the city we can defend. We stay here.
We wait for them to come to us. Then we fight them.
...fight and die for the masters who would never fight and die for you, or go home to your families.

7.text: Forgive me, my queen. A red priestess from As'shai has come to see you.
Enter.
I will see you when I return.
No one knows.
Missandei --
It is hard for me to say goodbye to you.
You know why.
You are my weakness.

When Unsullied are young their masters learn their fears. One boy is scared of dogs. One boy hates high places. One is frightened of the ocean. They make the boy sleep with dogs or climb a cliff. They throw him in the water. If he learns to swim, good. If he drowns, good. Either way, strong Unsullied. But I had no fears. I was never the biggest, never the strongest, but I was bravest always.
Until I meet Missandei from the Isle of Naarth. Now I have fear.
No.
There are supposed to be more than this. Many more.
Where are they? Where are the rest of the Lannisters?

8.text: When Daenerys takes her throne there will be no place for us here. I am loyal to my queen. I will fight for her until her enemies are defeated, but when the war is over and she has won, do you want to grow old in this place? Is there nothing else you want to do, nothing else you want to see?
Then I will take you there.
My people are not peaceful. We will protect you.
Half are gone.
Get to the skiff.
Now!
Missandei? Missandei!
Missandei!
We will storm the city, my queen. We will kill your enemies. All of them.
In the name of the one true queen, Daenerys Targaryen, I sentence you to die.
These men are prisoners. It is not over until the queen's enemies are defeated.
They are breathing.
I obey my queen's commands, not yours.
"Kill all who follow Cersei Lannister." These are free men. They chose to fight for her.
He is our prisoner.
We will decide what we do with our prisoners. This is our city now.
And you will find thousands of Unsullied who believe that it is.
We do not need payment. We need justice. Jon Snow cannot go free.
You are not here to speak! Everyone has heard enough words from you.
Make your choice, then.
You cannot.
This man is a criminal. He deserves justice.
It is not enough.
(in Valyrian) Good. We sail for the isle of Naath.

1.text: Mommy? Is that the bad man?
He's little.
You can't hurt us! No one can hurt us here! Tell him, mommy! Tell him!
Mommy... I want to see the bad man fly.
What happened next?!
Make the bad man fly!
Is it over?
Can I make the little man fly now?
I'm hungry.
But I'm hungry!

4.text: Uncle Petyr!
Look what Uncle Petyr brought me.
Mummy said they killed your mother and they chopped off your brother's head.
They killed my father, too, with poison. I wanted to make the little Lannister baby man fly, but Mother said I couldn't.
Through the Moon Door.
(GIGGLES)
What are you doing?
Why did you leave?
I stay here in the Eyrie. Mother says it's dangerous on the roads and I have to keep myself safe because I'm the Lord of the Vale and the Lord of the Vale is a very important person.
When will you go back?
Oh. Does Winterfell have a Moon Door?
That sounds dangerous. How do you make people fly?
What do you do with all the bad people and the scary people and the people you don't like?

Well, I'm Lord of the Vale. When I grow up, I'll be able to fly anybody who bothers me. Or you. When we get married, you can tell me if you don't like somebody and then we can bring them back here and, whoosh! Right through the Moon Door.
Let's put a Moon Door in your Winterfell.
It can go in here in this big tower.
I didn't ruin it.
It was already ruined because it didn't have a Moon Door. I was fixing it.
I didn't ruin it!
I didn't ruin it!
I've never left home before, Uncle Petyr. I'm afraid to leave.
The Lord of the Vale belongs in the Eyrie, Mother said. She said it's not safe outside.

6.text: Uncle Petyr!
A falcon!
Shall we throw him through the Moon Door?
Do you believe him, Uncle Petyr?
Fine.
She’s my cousin. We should help her.

8.text: Aye.

1.text: Do the dead frighten you?
You don’t think he’ll ask us how they died? Get back on your horse.
It’s a good thing we’re not children. You want to run away south, run away. Of course, they will behead you as a deserter … If I don’t catch you first. Get back on your horse. I won’t say it again.
Your dead men seem to have moved camp.
What is it?

5.text: My sons have had swords in their hands from the time they could walk. This one…
Great warrior? He sings a sword like a girl with palsy.
He’s 13. Boys go to war at 13.
Does he?
I have done nothing more than my duty, my lady.
He’ll be safe here. As for his skills, I make no promises.

6.text: Last time I saw you, Baelish, you told me you were taking Sansa Stark home with you to the Fingers.
And yet not long ago, we received reports that she has been married to Ramsay Bolton in Winterfell.
Do you take me for a fool?
Slander a man in his own home, you might find yourself crossing swords with him.
My lord. My lord, I have always been faithful to House Arryn. To your father, to your mother, and now to you.
You can trust my absolute loyalty, my lord.

7.text: The Umbers and the Karstarks betrayed the North. Their castles should be torn down with not a stone left standing.
Your Grace, with respect I must agree with Lady Sansa. I remember the Mad King all too well. A Targaryen cannot be trusted, nor can a Lannister.
For the current occupants of the castle it's enough food for a year, perhaps more.
Very wise, My Lady.
No, My Lady.
They should indeed. Pardon me, My Lady.
You there, why isn't there leather on these?
The Knights of the Vale came here for you, Lady Stark.

8.text: My lady.
The moment we can get the last infantryman out onto the field, we should shut the gates.
I'll ask my horse.
Aye.

1.text: You bring him here without permission? You pollute my home with his presence? Your aunt has done a bad thing, Robin, a very bad thing. You remember her, don't you? Isn't he beautiful? And strong too. Jon knew it. His last words were, "the seed is strong." He wanted everyone to know what a good, strong boy his son would grow up to be. Look at him, the Lord of all the Vale.
To stay away from them! Not to bring one here!
It is.
He's Tyrion the Imp of House Lannister. He killed your father. He murdered the Hand of the King!
You will watch your tongue! These men are Knights of the Vale. Every one of the loved Jon Arryn. Every one of them would die for me.
Shh... Shh... Shh, my sweet boy. He's just trying to frighten us. Lannisters are all liars. No one will hurt my baby.
Perhaps you will, my little love.
Ser Vardis, my sister's guest is weary. Take him down below so he can rest. Introduce him to Mord.
You wish to confess your crimes?
Skycells always break them. Speak, Imp. Meet your gods as an honest man.
Silence!
What do you think you’re doing?
You’ve had your little joke. I trust you enjoyed it. Mord, take him back to the dungeon. But this time find a smaller cell, with a steeper floor.
If you’re tried and found guilty, then by the king’s own laws you will pay with your life.
We have no executioner in the Eyrie. Life is more elegant here. Open the Moon Door.
You want a trial, my Lord Lannister. Very well. My son will listen to whatever you have to say, and you will hear his judgement. Then you will leave, by one door or the other.
You have that right.
Ser Vardis… You’re quiet. Did you want to avenge my husband?
You demanded a trial by combat.
The Kingslayer is hundreds of miles from here.
The trial will be today.
I think that we can assume that no one is willing -
You don’t fight with honor!
He sent it to me, not you.
A war? Your son against the Lannisters?
Family means everything to me.
Hush now, darling. You just ate.
Soon, love, soon.
Go on, sweet. Time for your bath. I'll feed you after.
Of course I fear for the safety of my son!
The knights of the Vale will stay in the Vale where they belong, to protect their Lord.

4.text: Lord Baelish.
A beautiful gift for a beautiful boy.

Oh, do take down that hood, child. Don't you think know who you are? You think I'd let my intended leave the Eyrie on urgent business without knowing what that business was? I let him go so he could bring you here to me.
My flesh and blood.
You mustn't call me that in front of anyone else.
No one can know you're here. It would put us in a very precarious position.
The Lannisters want to destroy us. They've been trying for years. Now they know what it feels like.
And on top of everything else, they made you marry that filthy troll.
I don't believe that for a moment. Did he force himself on you?
Good. Robin, this is your cousin Sansa. But you're not to call her Sansa in front of anyone but Uncle Petyr and myself. Do you understand? Sansa, this is my son Robin.
Robin, show Sansa to her chamber. Take the back stairs.
What took you so long?
She's here. We've spent more than enough time on her for one evening.
Let's get married tonight.
There's only one Lord of the Vale. The others can all hang. Lurking and simpering on the stairs like buzzards the moment my husband died, trying to get their claws in me.
I'm done waiting, Petyr. We had our wedding night many years ago. Or don't you remember?

What wife would do for you the things I've done for you? What wife would trust you the way I've trusted you? When you gave me those drops and told me to pour them into Jon's wine, my husband's wine... when you told me to write a letter to Cat telling her it was the Lannisters...
(nods)
(LAUGHS)
I'm warning you. I'm going to scream when my husband makes love to me. I'm going to scream so loud, they'll hear me clear across the Narrow Sea.
Your mother always had a sweet tooth, you know?

Oh, yes. At suppertime, she would go straight for honey cakes, candied almonds, custard. Anything sweet. Eventually, your grandfather had to assign a septa to watch her at meals. Cat was the firstborn daughter after all. It was important that she remain desirable so Father could arrange a good match for her and she was starting to get fat.

This is before she married your father and moved to the North. By the time you were born, your father's austerity had become hers. Marriage changes people. I didn't mean for you to stop. Go on, enjoy them. How do you like them?

Oh, gods, no. Petyr had three crates brought all the way from King's Landing. He knew you liked lemon cakes. He's so kind. He really cares for you. Think where you'd be without him. In their clutches and tried for murder.
He feels responsible for you.
Why? Why does he feel responsible for you?
Loved your mother.
That's what you wanted to say.

Your mother never loved him. Never. Cat always went straight for the sweetest thing. The most obvious thing. Your Uncle Brandon. Your handsome, arrogant, cruel Uncle Brandon. He almost killed Petyr in a duel. And your mother loved him anyway. And now Petyr is risking his life to save you, the daughter of a woman who didn't love him no more than those whores in his brothels. Has he told you about them?
He hasn't told you about the vile things they do with their bodies? The vile things they let him do with their bodies?
Are you pregnant?
I wasn't asking about Tyrion. What have you let Petyr do with your body?
Your young, pretty body.
Don't lie to me.
I'll know if you lie.

Shh. Shh. Shh. It's all right. It will all be all right. You'll be a widow soon. They'll execute that dwarf for murdering the king and you'll be free to marry Robin. You'll be the Lady of the Vale. Hmm.
Come here, Sansa.
Do you know how far the fall is?

Neither do I, precisely. Hundreds of feet. It's fascinating what happens to bodies when they hit the rocks from such a height. The impact breaks them right apart. Like eggs dropped on the floor. Sometimes pieces remain intact. You'll find the head sitting on its own. Every hair in place. Blue eyes staring at nothing. I know what you did.
Don't be coy with me, you little whore. You kissed him. You kissed Petyr.
I saw you! You can't lie to me because I saw it with my own eyes.
Liar! Whore! He is mine!
My father, my husband, my sister, they all stood between us and now they're all dead. That's what happens to people who stand between Petyr and me. Look down! Look down! Look down! Look down!
You want her? This empty-headed child?
She's just like her mother. She'll never love you. I lied for you. I killed for you. Why did you bring her here? Why?

1.text: Is Bran going to die?

2.text: I'm glad you're not dead.
When will Joffrey and Sansa be married?
Mother says I'll have a new gown for the ceremony and another for the feast. But yours will be ivory, since you're the bride.

5.text: I’ll never take it off again.
Do you think mother will like him.
And you really believe that?
She likes you.
No you don’t.
I know what you’re trying to say.
I do.
I know. About you and mother. I think a part of me always knew. And I’m glad. I’m glad that you’re my father.
What if he says no?
Do you want to marry me because our families arranged it, or do you…
We can’t. Not yet.
You know why not. Someone will see.
How many other girls have you walked through these gardens?
They don’t go squinty, and you didnt answer the question.
Uncle Jaime? I don’t understand, what are you doing here?
Trystane is my intended.
No!
You hurt him!
I don’t want to!
You looked different when I left. You had more hair.
He’ll be alright.
Why is it happening at all?
This is my home, this has been my home for years. I didn’t want to come here but she told me to. I did what she said, I did my duty and now she’s forcing me to go back?
It’s not complicated at all, it’s simple. I love Trystane, I’m going to marry him, and we’re staying right here.
Of course you don’t! You don’t know me!
Uncle.
You don’t like it?
Not at all. The Dornish climate agrees with me.

3.text: Lord, cast your light upon me. Protect me in the darkness. Burn away my sins. Help me serve you. Use me as you will. For the night is dark and full of terrors.
I have prayed day and night for you to come to me.
I know of your troubles, My king. The Lady Melisandre has told me everything.
You mustn't despair. Your claim is true. You will be victorious.
You are the one god's champion and the finest man I've ever known.
No.
You're doing god's work.
I know, Stannis. The Lady Melisandre has told me everything. No act done in service of the Lord of Light can ever be a sin. When she told me, I wept with joy.
Oh, my sweet boys. Petyr, Tommard, Edric. I thank god every day for bringing Melisandre to us. She gave you a son. I gave you - nothing.
So you've come to see her as well? There is no need. You must keep away from such distractions.
You are a king. You don't need my permission.

4.text: (Chanting with the others) Yours are the stars that guide us.
(to STANNIS) Did you see? Their souls. It was their souls. Our lord took them. Did you see?
Did you see, Ser Davos? They're with our lord now. Their sins all burned away. Did you see?
Our larders are almost empty.
You hate fish.

(to MELISANDRE) When Storm's End was under siege and I was starving, Stannis boiled soup for me from books. The binding glue is made from horses. One morning, he shot two seagulls on the beach. I've never tasted anything as good as grilled seagull. Do you remember?
Have you ever known true hunger, my lady?
Until you found the Lord of Light?
I fear for our daughter's soul.
She's a stubborn little beast.
You barely know her. You think she's sweet because she smiles when you visit. She's sullen and stubborn and sinful. Why else would the Lord of Light have seen fit to mark her face? She needs the rod.
As you command. Perhaps the Lady Melisandre could speak with her.
Oh.
I didn't mean to disturb you, my lady.
I just wanted to speak with you before we left.
It was. I-- humor isn't my strength.
If they're lies, my lady, aren't they best avoided?
Did you use it with Stannis?

No act done in service of the Lord can ever be called a sin. I thank God every day for bringing you to us. And Stannis to you. He wants to bring Shireen with us. I think that would be ill-advised. My daughter has heretical tendencies, as you're well aware. I don't know if her doubt is real or simply meant to spite me, but whichever the case, she should stay home.
Hmm.
Why?

5.text: You need to stay away from that girl.
She's a wildling.
She's a wildling. Your father defeated their people. He executed her king for treason. They could strike at him by striking at you.
You have no idea what people will do. All your books and you still don't know.
You think highly of this boy.
A bastard by some tavern slut.
I should have given you a son.
Whose then? (Looks at their daughter Shireen). I gave you nothing but weakness. (Turns back). And deformity. (Stannis shakes his head).
My Lady.
That's enough talk of battle, Ser Davos. You'll scare the child.
It’s what the Lord wants. It’s a good thing. A great thing.
If we don’t act then we’ll all starve here all of us, but if we make this sacrifice…
I can’t.
No...

3.text: Night
I don't know. There just is.
My books are better than these boring scrolls. You could read about Balerion the Dread. They say you can still see his skull in the dungeons beneath the Red Keep. I'd like to see that someday.
'His fangs were as long as bastard swords.'
' Noblemen.'
What is it?
Why are they ringing the bells? Are we being attacked?
(sings) Under the sea I know, I know/ Oh, oh, oh
(sings) The birds have scales / And the fish take wing / I know, I know / Oh, oh, oh
Father!
Mother said you fought in a battle. Did you win?
Did the Onion Knight come back with you?
He hasn't come to visit me. He said he'd bring me back a present from the capital.
Why not? He's my friend. Look.
He made this for me. But don't tell Mother I have it. It's a secret. Mother doesn't like the Onion Knight.
Onion Knight. Ser Onion Knight.
Shh, you'll wake Bert.
He's the fat one. He's on guard duty tonight. He likes to drink wine and sleep a lot.
he said you Were a traitor. Are you?

I don't care. You're my friend. You must get bored down here. I brought you something to read. It's about Aegon and his dragons. Aegon used to live here. Did you know that? And the Targaryens built this castle.
You can hide the book under your cloak. It's a good one. I'll bring you more.
Take it. I have more.
You can't?
I'll teach you. I'll come when Bert's on duty and teach you.
It's easy. It'll be fun.
Why not? What will they do, lock us in cells?

At the beginning. This word is Aegon. When you see A, E, and G together like that, it sounds like egg. And the title of the whole book is 'An History of Aegon the Conqueror and His Conquest of Westeros.'

(singing) It's always summer / Under the sea / I know I know / Oh, oh, oh. / The birds have scales / And the fish take wing / I know I know / Oh, oh, oh. / The rain is dry / and snow falls up / I know, I know / Oh, oh, oh. / The stones crack open / The water burns / The shadows come to dance / My lord / The shadows come to play / The shadows come to dance / My lord / The shadows come to stay.

4.text: Come in.
(Shakes her head)
I heard it.
Ser Axell was my uncle. He was always kind to me.
But they screamed.
Afterward they aren't ash and bone.
And you didn't have this.
I read "The Seven-Pointed Star."
There are no seven heavens and no seven hells?
You're late.
I thought you weren't coming.
You won't be a very good Hand if you see the word knight and say "ka-nigit."
It's a new one today. Lots of tricky words. But I think you can manage.
You'll never read well if you move your lips. That's how children do it.
I like this one. It's full of sword fights and pirates. You were a pirate once.
What's the difference?
My father says a criminal is a criminal.
You've sailed to Braavos?
What was that for?
You should write it yourself. It's good practice.
But that's not you.

5.text: Come on. You know this one. It looks like an animal.
Right, very good!
You'll learn, I promise. I taught Ser Davos, and old people are terrible at learning new things.
Three.
No. Old Maester Cressen did. I had a lot of time to practice. My mother kept me inside because... (trails off)
Greyscale. What do you call it north of the Wall?
I don't remember. I was a baby. Lots of people came and tried, I think. Whatever they did, it went away. What happened to your sisters?
What did he do to them in the woods?
Mother.
Why?
Her name's Gilly. She's nice. I'm teaching her to read.
Gilly wouldn't do that.
(Turns around, holding something). Just bored.
(Looks up). Were you bored a lot, too?
I like it. (Walks to a table). I thought I'd be left at home. I know mother didn't want to bring me. (Picks up an X from the table).
She told me, "I don't want to bring you."
Are you ashamed of me, father?
(On horseback). Do you think Father will let me go down into the crypt?
At Winterfell. All the Kings in the North are buried there. Bran the Builder and King Dorren and-
Is there going to be a battle?
I'm not scared.
(Smiling). I promise.
"The Dance of Dragons

Ser Byron Swann wanted to kill the dragon Vhagar. He polished his shield for a week, til the steel was like a mirror. Then he crouched behind it, and crept forward, hoping the dragon would only see his own reflection.
And burnt him to a crisp.
He’s beautiful.
Thank you.
Will you make me a doe, too, so that he can have company?
But why am I getting a present?
You’ll just have to read it yourself.
Father. Aren’t you cold?
The Dance of Dragons.

It’s the story of the fight between Rhaenyra Targaryen and her half-brother Aegon for control of the Seven Kingdoms. Both of them thought they belonged on the Iron Throne. When people started for declaring for one of them or the other, their fight divided the kingdom in two. Brothers fought brothers. Dragons fought dragons. By the time it was over, thousands were dead. And it was a disaster for the Targaryens as well. They never truly recovered.
That’s just what they call it.
I think it’s poetic.
I wouldn’t have chosen either. It’s all the choosing sides that made things so horrible.
It’s alright, father.
It doesn’t matter. I want to help you. Is there any way I can help?
Good, I want to. I’m the Princess Shireen of House Baratheon and I’m your daughter.
Where’s my father? I want to see my father.
Where’s my father? No you can’t do this, father where are you?!
Let me see my father! Where are you, please?!
Mother, please mother! Mother, please mother!
Mother, don’t do this please! Please help! Don’t do this! Please, father! Mother, help!

1.text: And you look tired from the road. I told them this meeting could wait another day, but...
Winter may be coming, but I'm afraid the same cannot be said for my brother.
My brother instructs us to stage a tournament in honor of Lord Stark's appointment as Hand of the King.
"Counting coppers," he calls it.
If you can't keep the King's peace, perhaps the City Watch should be commanded by someone who can.
I'll take that bet.
Or you could even buy a friend.
Such a shame, Littlefinger. It would have been so nice for you to have a friend.
What are you two conspiring about? Well, whatever it is, you'd best hurry up. My brother is coming.
We should have had them both killed years ago.
Robert will rant for a few days, but he won't do anything. He adores the man.
Are you sure this won't hurt?
And you prefer me like this?
If you want hairless, maybe you should find a little boy.

My brother thinks that anyone who hasn't been to war isn't a man. He treats me as if I'm a spoiled child. Oh, and you're not? Loras Tyrell, the Knight of the Flowers? How many wars have you fought in? Oh, and how much did your father spend on that armor of yours?
All I ever hear from Robert and Stannis is how I'm not tough enough, how I squirm at the sight of blood.
His eye was dangling out of the damn socket!
Easy for you to say. Not everyone is such a gifted swordsman.
I could work at fighting all day, every day, and still never be as good as you.
Everywhere?
It needs to be done, unpleasant as it is. Robert's rather tasteless about it. Every time he talks about killing her, I swear the table rises six inches.

He does have a deep, abiding lust for her money. You have to give it to the Lannisters, they may be the most pompous, ponderous cunts the gods ever suffered to walk the world, but they do have outrageous amounts of money.
Not as much as the Lannisters.

Robert's threatening to take me hunting with him. Last time we were out there for two weeks, tramping through the trees in the rain, day after day. All so he can stick his spear into something's flesh! Oh. but Robert loves his killing. And he's the King.
Because he loves his killing and he used to be good at it.
Be serious.
I'm fourth in line.
Stannis?
He's still my older brother.
What are you doing?!
You cut me!
A simpler time.
Sounds exhilarating.
Once, I think.
Those were some lucky girls.

What days were those? The ones where half of Westeros fought the other half and millions died? Or before that, when the Mad King slaughtered women and babies because the voices in his head told him they deserved it? Or way before that when dragons burned whole cities to the ground?
I suppose it was all rather heroic. If you were drunk enough and had some poor Riverlands whore to shove your price inside and “make the eight.”
Ned! It's Robert.
Lord Stark, a moment.
He named you Protector of the Realm.He did.
She won't care.
Strike! Tonight while the castle sleeps.
Saving the Seven Kingdoms from Cersei and delivering them to Stannis?
This isn't about the bloody line of succession.
Yes, he's a good soldier. Everyone knows that. So was Robert.

2.text: Well fought. Approach.
Rise. Remove your helm.
You are all your father promised and more, my lady. I've seen Ser Loras bested once or twice, but never quite in that fashion.
That he did, my queen. But there can only be one champion. Brienne of Tarth, you may ask anything of me you desire. If it is within my power, it is yours.
What?
Done. Rise, Brienne of the Kingsguard.
Lady Catelyn. I'm pleased to see you. May I present my wife, Margaery of House Tyrell?
My lady, I swear to you I will see the Lannisters answer for your husband's murder. When I take King's Landing, I'll bring you Joffrey's head.
There's no need for that. Lady Stark is an honored guest.
Don't worry, my lady. Our war is just beginning.
Gerard. How's your foot?
Good man.
I have 100,000 men at my command. All the might of the Stormlands and the Reach.
Why?
Brienne, escort Lady Catelyn to her tent. She's tired from her journey.
That won't be necessary. I would pray awhile. Alone.
That must hurt.
What? What is it?
Brienne is a very capable warrior. And she's devoted to me. You're jealous.
I'll make it up to you.
And Margaery's a virgin?
I should warn you, I've had quite a bit of wine.
You look very beautiful.
It's a lovely gown.
You certainly don't need it.
Although, some say the beauty most desired is the beauty concealed.
Must be the wine.
I'm sorry.
What?
I don't know what you're talking about.
(Sighs.)
Well, if it isn't my favorite whoremonger. Pray I haven't kept you waiting long.
Now you do the Lannisters' bidding, is that it? Tell me, was my brother's body even cold before you secured your newest patron?
Just not a loyal one.

I don't like you, Lord Baelish. I don't like your face. I don't like the words that come oozing out of your mouth. I don't want you in my tent one minute more than necessary. So tell me, why are you here?
You can trust Brienne. Her loyalty comes without charge.
Now I understand. You know I have the numbers. You know I'm marching on King's Landing. When I take the throne, you hope to retain your position. And your head.
(snorts)
Can that truly be you?
When I saw your standard, I couldn't be sure. Whose banner is that?
I suppose if we used the same one, the battle would be terribly confusing. Why is your stag on fire?
Ah, you must be this fire priestess we hear so much about. Mmm, brother, now I understand why you found religion in your old age.
No, no, I'm relieved. I never really believed you were a fanatic. Charmless, rigid, a bore, yes, but not a godly man.
Born amidst salt and smoke? - Is he a ham?

The whole realm denies it, from Dorne to the Wall. Old men deny it with their death rattle and unborn children deny it in their mother's wombs. No one wants you for their king. You never wanted any friends, brother. But a man without friends is a man without power.
Look across those fields, brother. Can you see all those banners?
No. The men holding those bolts of cloth will make me king.
Would you believe I loved him once?
You swear it?

Then I see no reason for hostility between us. Your soncan go on calling himself King in the North. The Starks will have dominion over all lands north of Moat Cailin, provided he swears me an oath of fealty.
The same Ned Stark swore to Robert 18 years ago. Cat, their friendship held the kingdoms together.
In the morning, I'll destroy my brother's army.
When that's done, Baratheon and Stark will fight their common enemy together, as they have done many times before.
Negotiate with Stannis? You heard him out there. I'd have better luck debating the wind.
Please bring my terms to your son. I believe we are natural allies. I hope he feels the same. Together we could end this war in a fortnight.
All these kings fighting for the throne, and this Stannis has the smallest army. Why would I bet on the man with the worst chance?
And yet, they both have larger armies.
What is the world coming to when smugglers must vouch for the honor of kings.
You think I'm insulted? I am a pirate. I'm an excellent pirate. I don't sail for promises.
That's a promise that always comes true.
Only the clever ones.
Salladhor Saan is a good name for songs.
One thing, I want the queen.
Cersei, I want her. I'll sail with your fleet, all 30 of my ships, and if we don't drown at the bottom of Blackwater Bay, I will fuck this blonde queen and I will fuck her well.
I'm not going to rape her, I'm going to fuck her.
You don't know how persuasive I am. I never tried to fuck you.

I've been all over the world, my boy, and everywhere I go, people tell me about the true god. They all think they found the right one. The one true god is what's between a woman's legs, and better yet a queen's legs.
I never thought you'd have a true believer for a son.

You Westerosee are funny people. A man chops off your fingers and you fall in love with him. (They laugh). I'll sail with you, Davos Seaworth. You are the most honest smuggler I ever met. Make me rich.

3.text: I thought you were dead. Everyone thought you were dead. And your son?
He may have swam ashore as you did.
I'm so sorry, my friend. I, too, have lost a son. There is nothing worse in this world. But, Davos, you were a good father.
He licks his wounds at Dragonstone.
There is nothing for me at Dragonstone.
Not for you, maybe. But for Salladhor Saan, the war is over.
I am sworn to no man. I promised you 30 ships and you promised me riches and glory. I delivered the ships.

He's a broken man. His fleet lies at the bottom of Blackwater Bay. They say he sees no one ... not his generals, not even his wife. Only the Red Woman whispering in his ear, telling him what she sees in the flames and burning men alive.
They built a great fire when Stannis returned. All those who spoke against her she called servants of darkness. They say she sang to them as they burned.
I'm a pirate.
Servants of darkness. I'm thinking Dragonstone is a good place for us to avoid.
You cannot turn Stannis against her.
You could try. If you fail, they will burn you. If you succeed, they'll burn you. And you've only just come back to life. Stay alive a little longer, my friend.
And you drank with me on four of my wedding days, but I don't ask you for favors.
When you are dead, I will gather your bones in a little sack and let your widow wear them around her neck.

2.text: “And I declare upon the honor of my house that my beloved brother Robert le-”

“That my brother Robert left no trueborn heirs; the boy Joffrey, the boy Tommen, and the girl Myrcella, being born of incest between Cersei Lannister and her brother Jaime Lannister. By right of birth -"
"And her brother Jaime Lannister, the Kingslayer. By right of birth and blood, I do this day lay claim -"
(Adding Ser) "Ser Jaime Lannister, the Kingslayer. By right of birth and blood, I do this day lay claim to the Iron Throne of Westeros. (Stannis nods). Let all true men declare their loyalty.”

(Reading a letter) My brother Robert left no trueborn heirs, the boy Joffrey being born of incest between Cersei Lannister, and her brother Jaime Lannister. By right of birth, and blood, I do this day lay claim to the Iron Throne of Westeros.
Mind your words, pirate. (They all stop walking).
This war isn't about you. We're not attacking King's Landing so that you can rape the queen.
As if she would just let you!
Stannis is the rightful king, and the Lord of Light. The one true god.
You believe your king can win?
When will the King have a sail?
He's my God too, and yours. But you were too blind to see. (As they walk). Let me teach you how to read.
It won't take long. You already know the letters. The holy books are much more persuasive than I can be.
But you always came home.
(They reach their horses). But I was. Every night that you were at sea, I lit a candle and I prayed, for you.
(As Davos is mounting his horse). Stannis is my king, but he's only a man.
Your Grace.
That's it. The tide's against us.
You're coming home.
This is the royal fleet. And you're not a smuggler anymore, you're the high captain.
