Not after tonight. When the sun rises, Stannis will sit on the Iron Throne and you will be his Hand.
God. Father, there is only one and he watches over us.
Over all of us. The people of King's Landing did not choose the false king, Joffrey Baratheon. They will be glad to see his head on a spike.
Our ships outnumber theirs 10-to-1.
I have faith in the Lord of Light. I have faith in our cause. And I have faith in my captain.
They're welcoming the new king.
Drums!
It was wise to attack at night. We took them by surprise.
If it's true there is dissension in their ranks, maybe their sailors have mutinied.
There's only one ship.
(To Davos) We need to stop her!
(Walks forward, interrupting Melisandre). All you men were named in the Light of the Seven! Is this how you treat the Gods of your fathers? Are you so eager to spit on your ancestors?
This woman will lead him into a war he cannot win.
(Scoffs) King. Since that boar killed his brother, every lord wants a coronation.
As do I, but loyal service means telling hard truths. He's surrounded by fools and fanatics, but he trusts you, Davos. (Davos picks up the sword and inspects it). If you tell him the truth…
(Stands up). I owe you an apology, my King. My duty is to serve. You have chosen the new God over the Old Gods. May the Lord of Light watch over us all. Shall we drink together?
A cup of wine to honor the one true God.

6.text: Prince Doran.
Oh.
According to our records, Jeor Mormont is Lord Commander.
We received no report from the maester at Castle Black.
This is irregular.
The archmaester will discuss these irregularities with you. In the meantime, you are permitted to use the library. Follow me.
No women or children!

4.text: Hello.

5.text: Thank you, Ramsay.
(Raises her cup). To your wedding.
It must be difficult for you being in a strange place.
We're going to have a baby.

6.text: Cavalry, charge!

8.text: We need more horses and wagons, if it please my lady.
And my lord.
And my queen. Sorry.

3.text: Shh.
So did the septons, only they lied about it.
There's no one here but you, me, and Violet.
Oh, come on. Let us see it. Everybody talks about it.
Who sent us?
We heard so much about it. (giggles)
Well, he's been through so much. Look at his poor face.
And how can we make him feel better?
Maybe he doesn't know how we are.
Oh. I felt something. Oh, Lord Greyjoy.
Mmm.
What? You like her better?
I was here first.

4.text: (laughing) I can't see her, Ramsay.
Where is she?
I only wounded her.
She thinks she's pretty. Let me put one through her face.
Me jealous of her?
Yes!
Yes! Yes!

5.text: My lady. I have come to escort you back to your chamber.

Die? (lowers the bow) Who said anything about dying? You can’t die yet. Your father was Warden of the North, and Ramsay needs you. Though I suppose he doesn’t need all of you. Just the parts he’ll use to make his heir. Until you’ve given him a boy or two and he’s finished using them. (raises bow) He’s got incredible plans for those parts. So. Shall we wait for him to come back, or shall we begin now?
You’re leaving it to me? Good. Let’s begin.
Stop! Stop!
I saw you staring at her.
You said you'd marry me.
Do you think she's pretty?
Perhaps I'll marry, too.
(Smiles). Never.
I like your dress. Who made it for you?
Really?
I'm Myranda, the kennel master's daughter. May I? (Takes Sansaâ€™s arm and inspects her sleeve). Oh, wonderful. The stitching. Who taught you?
I'm sorry for what happened to her.
It's good that she taught you. It was a gift. Now every time you wear something you made, you can remember her.
I know. It's not the same. Still, it's good to remember. Remember the way things were. I almost forgot. There's something else to help you remember.
Down there at the end.
That would spoil the surprise. Go ahead, it's perfectly safe. You won't believe it when you see it.
Lord Ramsay sent me to draw your bath, my lady. You want to be clean and fresh for your new husband don’t you?
You’re so beautiful. But if you need to keep him happy. Ramsay gets bored easily. You dont want to end up like... Well, like the others.
I shouldn’t gossip. It’s good to see the red again. No point in hiding anymore.

Let’s see. There was Kiera. The blacksmith’s daughter. She was tall. Like you. Lovely figure. But she talked and talked and talked and… Ramsay got tired of that. Then there was Violet. She had gorgeous blond hair. But she got pregnant and, well, that was boring. Then Tamsay. Such a sweet girl. Of course sweet girls get a bit dull after a while, don’t they? Ramsay let me come with him on that hunt.
Mm. Have you ever seen a body after the dogs have been at it? Not so pretty. But it’s your wedding day, why am I talking about such things?
Myranda.
Are you done with your bath, my lady?

3.text: Looks like your woman's getting the better of you, if you can call that a woman.
You sure he's the one?
Give the man his silver.
Enough to buy me a new head? If the King in the North hears I had the Kingslayer and let him go, he'll be taking it right off. I'd rather he takes yours.
I'll take the big bitch first. When she's good and wet, you lot can finish her off.
Catelyn Stark's a treasonous cunt. Orders were to take the Kingslayer alive. Nobody said shit about you.
Take her over there where it's dark. I'd like a little privacy.
A big dumb bitch from who cares where. Never been with a woman that big.
I know what they are.
Bring her back here.
Unbesmirched.
Fancy word for a fancy man.
I bet you did.
Your father, he'd pay your weight in gold to get you back?
Aye, you have both.
Hard to argue with that.
None of us are. Unchain Ser Jaime from the tree.
Suppose you'll be wanting something to eat.
I think we've got a spare partridge on the fire.
Bring the bird over here and the carving knife. Will this work as a table, my lord?
On the stump.
You think you're the smartest man there is. That everyone alive has to bow and scrape and lick your boots.
And if you get in any trouble, all you've got to do is say 'my father' and that's it, all your troubles are gone.
Have you got something to say?
Careful. You don't want to say the wrong thing. You're nothing without your daddy, and your daddy ain't here. Never forget that.
Here, this should help you remember.
Depends if he's had any practice. Is that the sort of thing you and your sister go in for, Kingslayer? She loosened you up for us?
Oh, enough. Here.
Can't say that I've ever seen a man drink horse piss that fast.
Do that again and I'll take your other hand.
On your knees. Lord Bolton, I give you the Kingslayer.
No, my lord, he has it here.
Send it to his father? Roose BOLTON
Safe journey, Kingslayer. Nothing to say? I liked you better before. I don't remember chopping your balls off, too. And don't you worry about your friend. We'll take good care of her.
Well, this is one shameful fucking performance. Stop running and fight.
I thought you'd gone.
We've only got one bear.
All you lords and ladies still think that the only thing that matters is gold.
This makes me happier than all your gold ever could. And that makes me happier than all her sapphires. So go buy yourself a golden hand and fuck yourself with it.
What the fuck are you doing to my bear?
The bitch stays.
She belongs to me. Lord Bolton's orders.

4.text: Word travels. How he screamed. You would have loved it.
Your pet rat have any thoughts on which way they went after Winterfell?
Who the fuck is Jon Snow?
He wouldn't have learned anything that way.
A bastard, eh? Took you for highborn.
Name's Locke.

What brought you up here? A sense of duty. I wanted to do my part for the safety of the realm. I was a game warden in the Stormlands. Fed a prized partridge to my hungry kids. I was stupid enough to get caught. Chose the Wall over losing my hand. Figured I wouldn't have to suck up to any highborn cunts here.
Guess I was wrong.
Snow. I don't mean to interrupt. Thorne wants to see you.
Then let me say my vows. If it's a fight you're heading for, then you need men who know how.
Brothers.
11 men. Most of them already drunk. No guards posted. They don't seem to have a care in the world. We'll carve them up like walnut pie.
Have you seen what I can do with a knife?
There's a hut on the West Side of the keep. We should steer clear of it.
They've got some hounds chained up inside. Closer we can get without the dogs sniffing us, the better.
Rescue party is here, lads. Lady.
Aye. I'll take you to him.
You're Brandon Stark?
The little crippled lord. We're going for a ride, boy.
Keep talking and I'll cut your friends' throats. Starting with the idiot. Do you hear? Do you hear?

1.text: What do you want?
Oh, spare me. Your boy's too proud to come before me himself. What am l supposed to do with you?
Who asked you? You're not Lord Frey yet, not until l die. Do l look dead to you?
l need lessons in courtesy from you, bastard? Your mother would still be a milkmaid if l hadn't squirted you into her belly.
We're talking right now. Fine. Out! All of you!
Huh. Your father didn't come to the wedding.
Huh. Didn't come to the last one, either. Or the one before that. Your family has always pissed on me.
Don't deny it. You know it's true. The fine Lord Tully would never marry any of his children to mine.
l didn't need reasons. l needed to get rid of sons and daughters. You see how they pile up? Why are you here?
Why should l let him?
There will be 20,000 corpses when Tywin Lannister gets here. Don't try and frighten me, Lady Stark. Your husband's in a cell beneath the Red Keep and your son's got no fur to keep his balls warm.

Oh, yes, l said some words. And l swore oaths to the crown too, if l remember right. Joffrey's king now, which makes your boy and his corpses-to-be nothing but rebels, it seems to me. lf l had the sense the gods gave a fish, l'd hand you both over to the Lannisters.
Stark, Tully, Lannister, Baratheon. Give me one good reason why l should waste a single thought on any of you?

3.text: 'The late Walder Frey,' old Hoster called me because I didn't get my men to the Trident in time for battle. He thought he was witty. Look at us now, Tully. You're dead, your daughter-Catelyn's dead, your grandson's dead, your son spent his wedding night in a dungeon and I'm Lord of Riverrun. (laughs)
An old man on the run with no allies. I have Tywin Lannister backing me. Who does he have?

They all laughed at me, all those high lords. They all thought they were better than me. Ned Stark, Hoster Tully. People snigger when I marry a young girl, but who said a word when Jon Arryn married the little Tully bitch?
Yeah. Got that to look forward to.
And you, the Warden of the North. No more Starks to bow and scrape to. Must have been torture following that stupid boy all over the country.
Calling himself the Young Wolf. How's that for pomposity?
Well, here's to the Young Wolf! (howls)
Will you move to Winterfell now that the war's over?
Yeah. What happened up there? I heard the Greyjoy boy seized the place. I heard he killed all the ravens. And after that, nothing.
Oh. And?
My honored guests, be welcome within my walls and at my table. I extend to you my hospitality and protection in the light of the Seven.
Don't beg my forgiveness, your Grace. It wasn't me you spurned, it was my girls.
One of them was supposed to be queen, now none of them are.
This is Arwyn, my daughter. My daughter Walda, my daughter Derwa, my daughter Waldra.
My eldest granddaughters Ginia and Neila.
Serra and Sarra, granddaughters, twins. You could have had either. Could have had both for all I care.
My granddaughter Marianne. My granddaughter Freya. My granddaughter...W-W-Wertha? Waldra? Waldina?
Fine. And here's my youngest daughter Shirei, though she hasn't bled yet. Clearly you don't have the patience for all that.
Very good.
There she is. Come closer, let me have a look at you.
Still can't see you. Old eyes.

Love. That's what the Starks of Winterfell call it, eh? Heh. Very honorable, I call it a pretty face. Mmmm, very pretty. Prettier than this lot, that's for sure. Very shapely as well. Oh, you try to hide her under that dress. If you wanted to hide her, you shouldn't have brought her here in the first place.
I can always see what's going on beneath a dress. Been at this a long time. I bet when you take that dress off, everything stays right where it is. Doesn't drop an inch.
Your king says he betrayed me for love. I say he betrayed me for firm tits and a tight fit.

And I can respect that. When I was your age, I'd have broken fifty oaths to get into that without a second thought. Well, I've enough room in the hall for you lot. We'll set up tents outside with food and ale for the rest of your men.
Well, let's get ready. The wine will flow red and the music will play loud and we'll put this mess behind us.
[Addressing ROBB loudly so everybody can hear] Your Grace.

The Septon has prayed his prayers, some words were said and Lord Edmure has wrapped my daughter in a cloak. But they are not yet man and wife. A sword needs a sheath [Everybody laughs]. And a wedding needs a bedding [Everybody cheers]. What does my sire say?
Your Grace.
I feel I’ve been remiss in my duties.
I’ve given you meat and wine and music but I haven’t shown you the hospitality you deserve. My king has married and I owe my new queen a wedding gift.
The King in the North arises, heh heh.
[Angrily] You already swore me one oath right here in my castle. You swore by all the Gods, your son would marry my daughter!
And why I would let him do that?
I’ll find another.

6.text: For House Lannister!
For House Frey!
May we stand together through the centuries, good friends to the last.
And when we drive our swords through our enemies’ hearts, may we speak the words of our alliance, “The Freys and the Lannisters send their regards.”
This came together rather well. Your father would be pleased.
Edmure is back in a cell. Can’t go killing my son by law. It wouldn’t be right. Give the family a bad name.
So the famous Blackfish killed by footsoldiers, eh? Legendary warrior, everyone said.
I’m a bit old for all that.
The purpose of fighting is defeating your enemies, isn’t it?
I’ve defeated mine. Riverrun belonged to House Tully for a thousand years. Now it’s mine. What do you call that? Victory.

Go on, mock me, boy. You think I mind? The Tullys mocked me for years. The Starks mocked me. Where are they now? You talk about war as if you’re an expert but the one battle I remember you fighting, you were captured by Robb Stark, the Young Wolf. But it doesn’t matter. Here we are now, two kingslayers. We know what it’s like to have them grovel to our faces and snigger behind our backs. We don’t mind, do we? Fear is a marvelous thing.
You’re not one of mine, are you?
Didn’t think so. Too pretty.
Where are my damn moron sons? Black Walder and Lothar promised to be here by midday.
Well, what are they doing, trimming their cunt hairs? Tell them to come here now.
What…
You’ve lost it?
It’s a castle, not a bloody sheep. Presumably you still know where it is. You didn’t lose Riverrun. You let the Blackfish take it from you.

You did lose the Blackfish after the Red Wedding. You had him right here in this hall and you let him leave. Then when I told you to hunt him down and kill him, you couldn’t find him. That’s what it means to lose something. Now he’s come back and taken Riverrun.
For 300 years we kissed Tully boots, swore oaths to them and their stinking fish banners. Not again. Riverrun is ours. Take it back.
We’ve got 10 times as many men as the damn Blackfish.
If I want excuses, I’ll put her in charge. They’re laughing at us. All across the Riverlands right down to King’s Landing, they’re laughing at us.
I hear it in my sleep! I’m not dead yet, unfortunately for you. And I’ll not leave this world until they all choke on that laughter. Take that castle back.
Oh, he’ll yield.

You’ll show him the knife you used to kill Robb Stark’s child in his whore mother’s belly, and you’ll show him the knife you used to open his niece’s throat. And you’ll remind him who it was that got married at the Red Wedding in the first place. His nephew.
Cheer up, Lord Edmure. You’re going home.

7.text: You're wonder why I brought you all here. After all, we just had a feast. Since when does old Walder give us two feasts in a single fortnight?
Well, it's no good being lord of the Riverlands if you can't celebrate with your family. That's what I say!

I've gathered every Frey who means a damn thing so I can tell you my plans for this great house now that winter has come. But first, a toast! No more of that Dornish horse piss! This is the finest Arbor gold! Proper wine for proper heroes!
Stand together!
Not you. I'm not wasting good wine on a damn woman.
Maybe I'm not the most pleasant man. I'll admit it. But I'm proud of you lot. You're my family, the men who helped me slaughter the Starks at the Red Wedding.

Yes, yes. Cheer. Brave men, all of you. Butchered a woman pregnant with her babe. Cut the throat of a mother of five. Slaughtered your guests after inviting them into your home. But you didn't slaughter every one of the Starks.
No, no, that was your mistake. You should have ripped them all out, root and stem.
Leave one wolf alive and the sheep are never safe.

3.text: Our father has instructed us to tell you that his alliance with the North can continue if his terms are met. Lord Frey requires a formal apology for your violation of your sacred oath to marry one of his daughters.
Our father requires Lord Edmure to wed one of his daughters-- Roslin.
Father is old. It will put his heart at peace if he could see her wed to a good husband. Black WALDER
They ought to be because they cost enough.

6.text: He surprised us. He knows the castle better than anyone.
The Brotherhood Without Banners is rallying the commoners against us, raiding our supply trains and camps.
He’ll never yield, Father.
Come out and fight us, Blackfish. Yield the castle or we’ll hang him.
This is your last warning. Yield the castle.
Ser Jaime. We didn’t know you were coming.
Walder.
Apologies, Ser Jaime.
Do as he says.

3.text: The roads are crawling with cutthroats and bandits. But when the King of the North summons us, we come.
And there's something else.
Not what, whom.
You want to count her teeth? We depart for the Twins in the morning. We need an answer before we leave and a wedding not more than a fortnight thereafter or this alliance is at an end.

6.text: Yes, father.
I don’t think it’s fair to blame us- -
We don’t have the men.
The Mallisters have risen against us. And the Blackwoods.
Riverrun can withstand a siege for a year.
You think I won’t do it, old man?
I sliced your niece’s throat from ear to ear. And where were you? Running and hiding like a fucking coward. Yield the castle or I cut his throat.
Whoa, whoa.
Edmure is a prisoner of House Frey.
I don’t give a rat’s- -
Those are our siege towers- -

2.text: I'm heading that way. I can take you there.
You been at sea long? Or were there just no women where you came from?
You don't know what I'm like.
You think I offer free rides to every man in jewelry. Lord Greyjoy.
Nine years. Do you still know your way around a ship? Have these hands ever touched a rope?
Your blood will be in the sea if I don't watch where I'm going.
Is that an offer from my future king?
I don't imagine it will be a story fit for children.
Anything with a cock is easy to fool.
So good to see you, brother. This is a homecoming I'll tell my grandchildren about.
You're the one in skirts.
I live here. Are you angry with me, brother?
It's not my fault you didn't recognize me.
You were a fat little boy, too, but I recognized you.
I wanted to see who you were first. And I did.
Father.
I've always wanted a castle.
The Sea Bitch. We thought she'd be perfect for you.
Be careful of their nets.
They won't even know we're there - until it's too late.
You'd have our father bow down to your other family?
Don't you? Make your choice, Theon, and do it quickly. Our ships sail with or without you.
Stop. We yield.
Congratulations on your first command.
Oh, I'm not here for you. I was just on my way to Red Harbor. I've got 30 ships. There's nowhere to put them here. Too narrow.
That would never happen. My crew would wait on deck for a year if I asked them to. This lot, though Enjoy the Stony Shore.
Why, it's the Prince of Winterfell.
What envy?
You're a great warrior. I saw the bodies above your gates. Which one gave you the tougher fight, the cripple or the six-year-old?
You treated them with honor? By butchering them?
You seized their home, as is your right. We're ironborn, we take what we need.
Then you made them prisoners in their home and they ran away. Is that treachery? I'd call it bravery.
Your little boy prisoners made you a promise and you got mad when they broke it? Are you the dumbest cunt alive?
A cunt. A dumb cunt who killed the only two Starks in Winterfell. You know how valuable those boys were?
You are weak. And you're stupid.
Go on, then. Warn me.
You're not. I've come to bring you home. Father wants a word.

Aye, it is, hundreds of miles from the sea. We're islanders, baby brother. Had you forgotten that? Our power comes from our ships. And now that you've decorated your walls with the bodies of the Stark boys, every man in the North wants to see you hanged. When Robb Stark finds out
(to her men) Leave us.
Theon, you're my blood. We both loved our mother. We both endured our father. Come home with me. Don't die here alone.

You were a terrible baby, do you know that? Bawling all the time, never sleeping. And one night, you just wouldn't shut up, screaming like a dying pig. I walked over to your crib, I looked down at you. I wanted to strangle you. And you looked up at me and you stopped screaming. You smiled at me. Don't die so far from the sea.

3.text: He's your son.
He's your son. He's my brother. He's a Greyjoy.
And I've made mine. I'm going to pick the fastest ship in our fleet.
(voiceover) I'm going to choose the 50 best killers on the Iron Islands.
(voiceover) I'm going to sail up the Narrow Sea all the way to the Weeping Water. I'm going to march on the Dreadfort. I'm going to find my little brother and I'm going to bring him home.

4.text: "I give you until the full moon to order all ironborn scum out of the North and back to those shit-stained rocks you call home. On the first night of the full moon, I will hunt down every islander still on our lands and flay them living, the way I flayed the 20 ironborn scum I found at Winterfell. In the box you'll find a special gift-- Theon's favorite toy. He cried when I took it away from him. Leave the North now or more boxes will follow with more Theon. Signed Ramsay Snow, natural born son of Roose Bolton, Lord of the Dreadfort and Warden of the North."
They skinned our countrymen and they mutilated my brother, your prince. Your prince. Everything they've done to him, they've also done to you.
As long as they can hurt our prince with impunity, the word ironborn means nothing.
Theon Greyjoy.
I'm here for Theon Greyjoy. Take me to the dungeons.
Thank you.
This way!
We're going home.
It's all right. It's me, Yara.
I'm not tricking you, Theon. I'm saving you.
If they catch us in here, we're trapped. Help me with him.
You're Theon Greyjoy.
Aah! Theon!
Give me my brother and no more of your men will die.
Make for the ship, now.
My brother is dead.

6.text: The Glovers have retaken Deepwood Motte.
They died fighting to a man.
What is dead may never die.
But they did and our invasion died with them. Deepwood Motte was our last stronghold on the mainland.
Why? For more pinecones and rocks?
We can defeat anyone at sea, but we’ll never hold lands and castles against mainland armies.
I won’t apologize for trying to rescue Theon.

Where is your kingdom? We took those castles because the northerners marched off to war. That war is over. The last time we provoked them too far, I watched from that window as they breached our walls and knocked down our towers. I lost two brothers that day.
I’m going to find out who did this. I’m going to feed them to the sharks while they live. I swear it by the Salt Throne.
My father would’ve wanted me to rule.
They told me you were home and I didn’t believe it. “Theon Greyjoy?” I said. “He’s dead. He’s been dead a long time." He let you go?
I can’t hear you.
Look at me. Look at me! Men died trying to rescue you. Good men. My men.
You were my brother. You’re a spoiled little cunt, but you were my brother and I risked everything for you and you betrayed me.
Stop saying that.
I know.
He send us one of those pieces. That’s why I came for you.
Why did you come here?
You heard father was dead and thought you’d claim the crown?
You happen to show up on Pyke right before the Kingsmoot?
You think any Ironborn wants you to be king? After what you’ve done?
What do you want?
That doesn’t matter anymore. Stop crying. Look at me. Tell me what you want.
I am Yara Greyjoy, daughter of Balon Greyjoy, King of the Iron Islands. I claim the Salt Throne.

There are many things we’ve never done. We’ve never made our mark upon the world. The great lords of Westeros pay us no mind until our little raids buzz through their kingdoms long enough to become a nuisance. Then they swat us down. They conquer us, humiliate us, and go right back to forgetting we exist.
We are a sea people.
Our god is a sea god.
When I am queen, we will build a fleet that —
I am not finished!
When did you return, Uncle?
I’m glad you’re here. Now I know what my first act as queen will be. To execute the man who killed my father.
I will build the largest fleet the world has ever seen.
You’re going to seduce the Dragon Queen?
Some of us still like it. Have a drink at least.
Don’t go far, love.
I’ll find you in a bit.
Nothing on the Iron Islands has an ass like that. Doesn’t interest you anymore?
I’m sorry. I won’t joke about it. I’ll never hurt you, little brother. Don’t you know that?
Of course he is. As long as we’re alive, we’re a threat.
It’s a great big world and we have fast ships. Drink.
I don’t care what you want. Drink.
Drink it all.
You’re Ironborn, Theon. I know you’ve had some bad years.
But I’m tired of watching you cower like a beat dog. Drink the goddamn ale.
Now listen to me. I need you. The real Theon Greyjoy, not this rat shit pretender. Can you find him for me? Drink.
You escaped, do you hear me? You got away and you’re never going back. We’ll get justice for you.
Fuck justice, then. We’ll get revenge. Drink.

Listen to me. If you’re so broken that there’s no coming back, take a knife and cut your wrists. End it. But if you’re staying, Theon, I need you. We’re gonna sail to Meereen. We’re gonna make a pact with this Dragon Queen. And we’re gonna take back the Iron Islands.
Are you with me? Are you really with me?
Now, since it’s my last night ashore for a long while, I’m gonna go fuck the tits off this one.
And he paid for them.
No more than Westeros.
You and I have that in common.
His big cock, I think he said. Euron’s offer is also an offer of marriage, you see. You won’t get one without the other.
I never demand, but I’m up for anything, really.
We’d like you to help us murder an uncle or two who don’t think a woman’s fit to rule.
That’s our way of life.
No more.

7.text: If you want the Iron Throne, take it. We have an army, a fleet, and three dragons. We should hit King's Landing now. Hard. With everything we have. The city will fall within a day.
You have mine.
A few times. Never stayed long.
A boy, a girl. Depends on the port.
I thought it wasn't for you.
He's not your servant.
Once I kill my uncle.
He'll be my advisor, my protector.
He might have to intervene.
Until they've made their intentions known.
Stay here.
Euron.
Your mother is below deck. Keep her safe.

8.text: Why don't you just get it over with and kill me?
Are we in King's Landing?
You picked the losing side.
Euron can't defend the Iron Islands, not if he's in King's Landing with all his men and his ships.
We can take our home back.
Daenerys will need somewhere to retreat if they can't hold the North. Somewhere the dead can't go.
You want to go to Winterfell. To fight for the Starks. Go. What is dead may never die.
But kill the bastards anyway.
Some of you may be quick to forgive. The Ironborn are not. I swore to follow Daenerys Targaryen.
She freed us from a tyrant. Cersei is gone because of her, and Jon Snow put a knife in her heart. Let the Unsullied give him what he deserves.
Aye.

6.text: What is dead may never die.
Has the custom changed since I’ve been gone? Aren’t you supposed to repeat the words?
I don’t mock the Drowned God. I am the Drowned God. From Oldtown to Qarth, when men see my sails, they pray.
You’re old, brother. You've had your time. Now let another rule.
They did.
I needed silence.
I am the storm, brother. The first storm and the last. And you’re in my way.
I’m Euron Greyjoy.
I claim the Salt Throne.
Niece.
Nephew. Little Theon.
Heard you managed to fuck things right into the ground. Captured a castle you couldn’t keep. Got yourself taken prisoner. Even heard you have no cock.
Explains why you think a woman can be king.
A few days ago. I had some things to take care of. Long overdue.

I did. I killed him. Threw him right over a rope bridge and watched him fall. He was leading us nowhere and we would still be heading there if it weren’t for me. No one loved him. No one wanted to follow him. He led ius into two wars we couldn’t win. I apologize to you all for not killing him years ago.
Gallivanting? That the sort of thing you start to say once your dick gets chopped off?
Did the great lord of Westeros teach you words like that?
And how will she do that?

Right idea, except I’m the one who’s going to build the Iron Fleet because I’m the one who knows how to use it. I’ve been all over the world. I’ve seen more of it than all of you combined. And across the sea there is a person who hates the great lords of Westeros just as much as we do. Someone with a large army, three large dragons, and no husband. I’m going to build that fleet and I’m going to gallivant right over and give it to Daenerys Targaryen along with my big cock.
I’m not going to seduce her. The Iron Fleet will seduce her. And together we’re going to take the Seven Kingdoms. I wasn’t born to be king. I paid the iron price and here I stand.
Where are my niece and nephew? Let’s go murder them.
Won’t be enough to save them.

Go back to your homes. Chop down every tree you can find. Quarter-saw the timber and start building. I want every man bending planks. I want every woman spinning flax for sails. Build me a thousand ships and I will give you this world.

7.text: The moment I was chosen Lord of the Iron Islands, they turned on me. Their own uncle. They stole my best ships and ran. Sailed the right across the world and gave them to the Dragon Queen so she could bring her armies here to attack you.

It's nothing compares to the treason you suffered at the hands of a family members, from what I hear. But still, it bothers me. Murdering them would make me feel a lot better. And since it appears that all our treasonous family members are fighting for the same side, I thought we rightful monarchs could murder them together.

I remember very well. I saw you. I heard so much talk. The best in the world. No one can stop him. I didn't believe it, to be honesty. But I must say, when you rushed through the breach and started cutting people down...it was glorious. Like a dance.
The place was getting crowded. I enjoyed watching it. I truly did.
A good thing for me. If you hadn't crushed us, I wouldn't have gone into exile. If I hadn't done that, I wouldn't be the greatest captain on the 14 seas.

You're not humble. You're the queen of a great nation. You don't care about the Iron Islands. They're nothing but rocks and bird shit and--and a lot of very unattractive people. The Iron Fleet, on the other hand, that's something else entirely. It's the greatest armada Westeros has ever seen. With the Iron Fleet, you own the seas. You can defeat the invaders of the east and the pretenders of the north and south.
Ever since I was a little boy, I wanted to grow up and mary the most beautiful woman in the world. So here I am, with a thousand ships and two good hands.
Why?
You should try it. Feels wonderful.

I don't expect you to trust me outright. You need proof of my honest intentions. In my experience, the surest way to a woman's heart is with a gift. A priceless gift. I won't return to King's Landing until I have that for you.
Give your uncle a kiss.
Theon!
Ah, come on your cockless hound. I have her. Come and get her.
This is the life. Look at them. Cheering for a Greyjoy.
I have to be honest, it's making me hard. Did you see little Theon's face right before he jumped overboard?
Oh no!
What a twat.
My queen. Please accept this gift on behalf of all of your loyal subjects in the Iron Islands.
I give you --
-- what no other man could give. Justice. Justice for your murdered daughter.
A bit more than a true friend.
There's only one reward I want.
There's nothing quite like it, is there? The love of the people. I suppose you wouldn't know.
Or yours. They just like severed heads really. Listen, if you have any advice at all I'd love to hear it when we have an hour or two to speak as brothers.
Does she like it gentle or rough? A finger in the bum?
Shhh, shhh, shhh, not now. We'll talk later.
Theon! I have your sister
Then why are you talking? You're the smallest concern here.
We don't even let your kind live in the Iron Islands, you know? We kill you at birth. An act of mercy for the parents.
Why?
Can they swim?
Good. I'm taking the Iron Fleet back to the Iron Islands.
I've been around the world. I've seen everything, things you couldn't imagine, and this this is the only thing I've ever seen that terrifies me.
I'm going back to my island. You should go back to yours. When winter's over, we'll be the only ones left alive.

8.text: But we're family. The last Greyjoys left in the world. The last ones with balls anyway.
If I kill you who can I talk to? Hmm?
I've got a crew full of mutes. It gets lonely at sea.
Mm.
Then I'll sail the Iron Fleet somewhere else.
But first I'm gonna fuck the queen.
They cheated at dice. Or maybe I cheated. Someone cheated. They weren't good fighters. You won't miss them.
Am I most welcome here?
Good. As a true friend and an honored guest
I was hoping we could talk in private.
Wars sometimes last years.
How?
I've given her justice, an army and the Iron Fleet, yet she gives me no sign of affection. My heart is nearly broken.
They were lesser men.
So, how do I compare to the fat king?
Are you offended?
And the Kingslayer?
Life is boring.
Do I please the queen?
I'm going to put a prince in your belly.
I saw it sink beneath the waves.
The glory is yours, my queen.
She's coming for you.

6.text: Lord, take your servant Balon back beneath the waves. Feed the creatures of your kingdom on his flesh. Pull his bones down to your depths to rest beside his ancestors and his children.
The Salt Throne is not yours to swear upon, not unless the kingsmoot chooses you.
Your father does not get to choose. The law is clear. Perhaps you'll win. Perhaps you’ll be the first woman in history to rule the Ironborn. And perhaps not.
We speak in the presence of the Drowned God. In his name we father today to choose a new king as our leader. Who makes a claim?
May Euron, your servant, be born again from the sea as you were. Bless him with salt. Bless him with stone. Bless him with steel.
Let the fish eat the scales off his eyes.
What is dead may never die, but rises again harder and stronger.
What is dead may never die.
They stole our best ships.

2.text: Nine years, is it? They took a frightened boy. What have they given back?
We shall see. Stark had you longer than I did.
And how do you feel about that?
Who gave you those clothes? (Stands up). Was it Ned Stark's pleasure to make you his daughter?

It will. (Begins walking forward). That bauble around your neck. Did you pay the iron price for it or the gold? (Theon looks down). I asked a question. Did you pull it from the neck of a corpse you made or did you buy it to match your fine clothes? Iron or gold?
I'll not have my son dressed as a whore. (Balon walks towards the fireplace and looks into it). My fears have come true. The Starks have made you theirs.
Yet, (Turns around), the Stark boy sends you to me like a trained raven, clutching his message.
He heeds your counsel?
No, not here, (Walks forward), not in my hearing, you will not name him brother. This son of the man who put your true brothers to the sword. Or have you forgotten your own blood?
I see. I destroy Robb Stark's enemies for him and he will make me King of the Iron Islands once again.
Oh, you will?
(Puts his arm around her). My dear.
And why not?
This isn't Winterfell, boy. Your sister took over command of your eldest brother's ship after your new father killed him.
(Watching the letter burn in his hand). No man gives me a crown. I pay the iron price. I will take my crown. (Throws the letter in the fire). That is who I am. That is who we have always been.
Who said anything about the Lannisters?
The plans are made. It's time you heard them.

The wolf pup has gone south with the entirety of the Northern army at his back. While he's tangling with the lion in the Westerlands, the North is ripe for the taking. The ironborn will reave and pillage, as it was in the old days, all along the northern coast. We'll spread our dominion across the green lands, securing the Neck and everything above. Every stronghold will yield to us, one by one. Winterfell may defy us for a year, but what of it? The rest shall be ours, forest, field, and hall. Yara, my daughter, you'll take 30 longships to attack Deepwood Motte.
You'll take a ship to raid the fishing villages on the Stoney Shore.
Your brothers were warriors, both of them dead at the hands of those you seem so eager to protect.
What are our words? Our words?
We do not sow. We are ironborn. We're not subjects. We're not slaves. We do not plow the fields or toil in the mine. We take what is ours. Your time with the wolves has made you weak.

3.text: 'Balon Greyjoy, Lord of the Iron Islands and invader of the North. I give you until the full moon to order all ironborn scum out of the North and back to those shit-stained rocks you call a home.

On the first night of the full moon, I will hunt down every islander still in our lands and flay them living the way I flayed the 20 ironborn scum I found at Winterfell. In the box you'll find a special gift-- Theon's favorite toy. He cried when I took it away from him.'
'Leave the North now or more boxes will follow with more Theon. Signed Ramsay Snow, natural-born son of Roose Bolton, Lord of the Dreadfort and Warden of the North.' Get that out of my sight.
Theon disobeyed my orders.
The boy is a fool. He cannot further the Greyjoy line. I will not give up the lands I have seized, the strongholds I have taken. Get this away from me.
Son? He's not a man anymore.
Watch yourself. I've made my decision.

What is dead may never die.

And when the storm passed, you cut out their tongues.
What kind of an Ironborn loses his senses during a storm?

Dagmer, your first mate.

(nods)

Come.
(laughs)
Halt!

Send the old man home.

His wife, too. You want to keep a man silent, you silence him.
Aye.
Thought he'd never shut up.
Where are we headed, Captain?
And who decides if we've done our jobs well?

I have been reaving and raping since before you left Balon's balls, Captain Don't reckon I've got much use for your ideas on how to do it. Don't reckon I've got much use for a captain at all. (laughs)
Greyjoy!
We caught this one on his way back from Torrhen's Square. Took out two of ours before I got his sword.

Gone, along with the wildling woman. The one you were fucking.

l'm told we still have his sisters.

Stark's son has called his banners.
At once, My Lord.
Our scouts tell us the Stark host has moved south from the Twins with Lord Frey's levies in tow. They're a day's march north.
The great hairy one insisted he must have two battleaxes. Heavy black steel, double-sided.
They do seem rather ferocious.

2.text: King's Landing will fall an hour after Stannis lands his force. It's not too late for King Joffrey and Cersei and the court to ride west to safety.

The scouts assure us Robb Stark remains north of Ashemark.
He sent a splinter force to recapture Winterfell. The Greyjoys have done us a great favor. Stark won't risk marching on Casterly Rock until he's at full force.

5.text: I apologize for my son’s appearance.
They call themselves sparrows. Bloody fanatics. Religion has its place, of course, but at a certain point… They never would have come to the capital when Tywin was alive.
Of course.
You're the Hand of the King?
That is kind of you to say. I would like to hear it from the king himself.
He should be here, learning what it means to rule.

I returned to the capital to pay my respects to my brother. And to you. And to serve the king. I did not return to the capital to serve as your puppet. To watch you stack the small council with sycophants. (looks to Qyburn) Sending your own brother away so he wouldn't be--
What mission?
I do not recognize your authority to dictate what is and is not my concern. You are the Queen Mother. Nothing more.
If he wants to send for me, I will be waiting for him. At Casterly Rock.

6.text: Can I help you?
No, we cannot make you leave. And you cannot make us stay. Not unless you're gonna have that thing murder us all.
The king has ordered me to take no action against the High Sparrow or the Faith Militant out of fear for the queen’s safety.
No, but if the king should call on me --
Of course I want him back.
If it doesn’t go as planned, the Sparrows have many friends in the city. We’ll have civil war. Many will die.
There is.
There is to be a royal announcement in the throne room at this very moment.
Where are you going?
Your place is in the gallery with the other ladies of the court.

1.text: l can't believe we're actually at war. Was it this exciting last time, when you were young? What does it say? Have we captured Robb Stark yet? What's our next move?

There's no more wine.

No, Your Grace.
More wine, your Grace?
More wine, your Grace?

2.text: Using some vile sorcery, your brother fell on Stafford Lannister with an army of wolves. Thousands of good men were butchered. After the slaughter, the Northmen feasted on the flesh of the slain.
Her Grace, the Queen Regent, commands you to release Grand Maester Pycelle. Here's your warrant.
I am here at Her Grace's behest, not to drink with you, Imp.
I don't care what you make of it, so long as you release your prisoner immediately.
As I said several times.
When the Queen Regent gives me a command, I carry it out without delay.
The Queen Regent has a great many responsibilities. She often works from dusk till dawn.
I am a knight!
You will withdraw these filthy accusations.
It's not my fault!
Your own father, Lord Tywin, when I was named the King's squire, he told me to obey her in everything.
I only meant I did as I was bid.
Mercy! Mercy, my lord! I beg you.
My lord, it was your sister's bidding, the Queen. I'll leave the city at once, I swear.
My lord?
Yes, my lord, I will. I swear it, as you command.
But her demands?
You will?
It's wildfire.
No.
It is not a lie. Why would I lie?
I'm telling you the truth.
She's making wildfire.
The Alchemists' Guild is being commissioned.
They have thousands of pots already stored in their vaults. They are planning to launch it from the city walls into Stannis' ships and armies. Please.
I heard her talking with the pyromancer And the other night, after I left her, she went to meet him. I swear to you.
On my life.
In the light of the Seven, by all that is holy and right, I, Lancel Lannister, do solemnly vow . . .
Please kill me if anything should happen to Lord Tyrion.
Where's our fleet?
Your Grace!
The Imp has set the river afire. Hundreds of ships are burning, maybe more. Stannis' fleet destroyed, but But But his troops have landed outside the city walls.
On the battlements with Lord Tyrion.
Your Grace
The king's presence is good for morale.
Not here?
No, but I
Your Grace, the queen has sent me to bring you back to the Red Keep.
She did not say, Your Grace.
The battle is lost, Your Grace. Stannis' troops are at the gates. When the gold cloaks saw the king leaving, they lost all heart.
I want to escort him back to the battle.
Now listen to me

5.text: Your grace.
My deepest sympathies.
It wasn’t my wounds that needed healing.
You can forgive me.
I led you into the darkness.
I tempted you into our unnatural relations. And, of course, there was the king. His boar hunt. His wine.

I’m a different person now. I found peace in the light of the Seven. You can too. They watch over all of us, ready to dole out mercy… or justice. Their world is at hand. I will pray for your father’s soul.
You have profaned our faith. The faith of our fathers and forefathers.
(Grabs his neck). You are a sinner. And you shall be punished.
Ser Loras of House Tyrell, you have broken the laws of Gods and men.
Justice. (Loras grunts and struggles).
Lord Baelish.
Brother Lancel. We abandoned our family names.
The city has changed since you were here last. We flooded the gutters with wine, smashed the false idols, and sent the godless on the run.
Step carefully, Lord Baelish. You’ll find that there’s little tolerance for flesh peddlers in the new King’s Landing.

6.text: Her litter never left the Red Keep.
Get the others.
The longer you wait, the worse it’ll be for you.
What are you doing?
Your Grace, His Holiness the High Septon wishes to speak with you at the Great Sept of Baelor.
Your Grace, this is not a request.
The High Septon commands you. Are you sure you want to refuse him?
He made no such promises. If you refuse to come of your own free will- -
Move aside, ser.
Order your man to step aside or there will be violence.

2.text: What do we have here?
That's a fine little blade. Maybe I'll pick my teeth with it.
You heard him. You're coming with us.
Something wrong with your leg, boy?
Can you walk?
All right.
"Carry him," he says.
This lot won't be here long. Don't need no permanent place. After we interrogate 'em, we usually just
What are you looking at? Kneel! Kneel or I'll carve your lungs out, boy.

4.text: Shut your mouth and pour us more ale and we may not take her with us when we're done with her.
I know you.
You're the Hound.
Pour our new friend some ale. What brings you so far north?
Just keeping the king's peace.
So I've heard. Stannis defeated at the Blackwater. Robb Stark killed at the Twins. And where am I for all of it? Stuck with your brother. Meaning no offense.

He's good, the Mountain is. Best at what he does. But torture, torture, torture, torture. You spend enough time putting the hammer to people, you start to feel like a carpenter making chairs. Drains the fun right out of it. And what's life without a little fun? (Chuckles)
But I don't need to tell you that, eh?

(Laughs) You know what? You should come with us. His kind, they've always got something hidden away somewhere. Gold, silver, more daughters. Always something if you know how to make them talk. And there's plenty of him between here and King's Landing. You could do well for yourself. We certainly have been.
Think about it. We could do whatever we like wherever we go. These are the king's colors. No one's standing in his way now. Which means no one's standing in ours.
When I heard that Joffrey's dog had tucked tail and run from the Battle of the Blackwater, I didn't believe it. But here you are.
You got money to pay for it?
(Laughs) No. But we're the king's men. So, you got money?
Tell you what. We'll trade you. One of our little chickens for one of yours. Give us a go at your friend. Lowell there likes them a bit broken in.
You don't seem to understand the situation.
You lived your life for the king. You're gonna die for some chickens?
What? What do you mean?
Carry me?

2.text: I am, Your Grace.
An honorable request, Your Grace.
These are... Your Grace, these are...
King Joffrey is a Baratheon, Your Grace.
I will, Your Grace.
I did. They have not broken his spirit, Your Grace.
I will, Your Grace.

She

Cinda Lannister.
Well, perhaps she's gotten a little larger than she
I squired for you once, you know.
The tournament, the day of Willem Frey's wedding.
You did. Your squire had gotten so drunk the night before that he threw up.
Bryan.
That's right. I ran up and volunteered. "Let me, my lord. Let me. " My father was furious. Afraid I'd embarrass our family in front of the Family.
You really remember?
When I think back to that day
I Never mind. It's embarrassing.

I remember everything about that day, your helmet, your horse, the rake lines in the dirt along the list, where the sun was in the sky when you knocked Balon from his horse, and the dent in your shield when you handed it back to me. I'll remember it all until I die. That was the best day of my life. And I remember being on the field after it was over. All the competitors were done. I was the last one out there. And I couldn't leave. I couldn't bring myself to go and sit with my family at a table so far on the edge of the feast you could barely even see the bride. And I couldn't bear to tell them what it had been like squiring for you, when I knew that they could never have the faintest idea what I was talking about.
How could you? Sorry, I I didn't mean to doubt you.
Which knight was it?
What was he like?
It's hard to put into words.
(nods) Leaving that battlefield was like being dragged off to prison.
Did you squire for him again?
(smiles)
And have you thought about
And?
(nods)
What is it?
Well, let me help you.
Tell me.
Where's the bastard, crow?
Ser Amory Lorch, sworn bannerman to Lord Tywin Lannister. These men from the capital requested our assistance. Drop your weapons in the name of the King.
This is your last chance. In the name of King Joffrey, drop your weapons.
So be it.
Our spies report growing discontent among the Northern lords. They want to return home and gather the harvest before the crops turn.
My lord?
My apologies, my lord. I must have

What might this be?

Move! Get out of the way!

The only antidote. Who’s the most beautiful woman in the world?

Father got careless. That's what Momma says.
Maybe I'll kill you both before we take King's Landing and then I won't have to share.
Momma!

Why do we play? I’m better than you, I’ll always be better than you. Have I ever missed once? I don’t think, I can’t recall. You must love humiliation or pain. Which do you love most? Humiliation or-- (slaps) -- pain? That one hurt didn’t it? You going to cry? Give up, little sister.
I never miss.

Slut.

A ship's captain, who found me in Planky Town, claiming he had information to sell. He told me he smuggled Jaime Lannister into Dorne.

Smart boy.

Obara.

5.text: My future queen.

He won’t. You’ve waited long enough. I want you to be my wife now. What is it?

I am Trystane Martell.
We weren’t expecting you, Ser Jaime.
A fleabite.
I have learned the value of mercy from my father. I will set your man free.
On one condition.

6.text: I told you I’m not hungry.
We are family. I don’t want to hurt you.

5.text: I wish you a safe journey home.
Captain. Let her pass.
Oberyn was slain during a trial by combat. By law, that is not murder.
You don't have to remind me. He was my brother long before he was anything to you.
I will bury him. I will mourn for him.
You would have me go to war?
Then we are lucky the whole country does not decide.
I loved my brother. And you made him very happy. For that you will always have a place in my heart. But we do not mutilate little girls for vengeance. Not here. Not while I rule.
They make a lovely couple. A Lannister and a Martell. They have no idea how dangerous that is. We must protect them.
You have not had to use that axe of yours in a very long time. I hope you remember how.
Forgive us, we started without you. Please, sit.
And rather than send a raven or speak to me directly you decided to enter my country in secret and abduct our guest by force.

We can’t behead you. Many in Dorne want war. But I’ve seen war. I’ve seen the bodies piled on the battlefields. I’ve seen the orphans starving in the cities. I don’t want to lead my people into that hell.
And that is precisely what we are doing. (raises glass) Let us drink to Tommen, the first of his name, the King of the Andals and the First Men, Lord of the Seven Kingdoms.
King Tommen insists on his sister’s return to the capital?

I cannot disobey my King’s command. (Ellaria glares at Doran) She will return with you to King’s Landing. And my son, Prince Trystane, will accompany you both. If the alliance between Dorne and the Iron Throne is to continue, their engagement must stand.

One more thing. My brother was named to the small council before his death. Your father understood the importance of keeping Dorne in the loop. With Oberyn gone, Trystane will take his place on the small council.
You are mother to four of my nieces, girls I love very much. For their sake, I hope you live a long life. Talk to me that way again and you won’t.
Tell me, Ser Jaime, in King’s Landing, how do they punish a commoner who strikes a prince?
Prince Trystane must learn judgement if he’s to rule one day. I’ll let him decide.
Perhaps some soup instead?
Your rebellion is over. You can swear your allegiance to me now, or you can die.
I believe in second chances. I don’t believe in third chances.

6.text: I always envied Oberyn. He lived. He truly lived. Sailed around the world. Fought men from every country. Lay with the most beautiful women alive.
And men. He experienced everything, while I sat here in Dorne trying my best to keep my people alive and well fed. But that is life. We each have our roles.
Oberyn was born to be an adventurer. And I was born to rule.
Your mother is a brilliant woman, you know that?
The Princess Myrcella…
My son Trystane…

5.text: The prince does not wish to be disturbed.
Yes, my prince.
I remember how.
Drop you weapons!
Drop your weapons!
When you were whole, it would have been a good fight.
Prince Doran hopes this satisfies your concerns about the princess’s wellbeing.
You’ll find out very soon.

4.text: Look at this one. How lovely is she?
They like them pale in the capital. Shows they don't work the fields.
You like?
You're a bit of mischief, aren't you?
I think she likes you. ELLARIA" She has good taste.
You're not timid, are you?
Do you like women?
The two girls can leave.
You stay.
Everyone who works for Littlefinger is an offer. Take off your clothes. We'll be here a while.
I am a prince, boy. Have you ever been with a prince?
Take off your clothes.
My way .
Forgive me for staring. I don't see many Lannisters where I'm from.
We don't like the smell. (Laughs)
Do you know why all the world hates a Lannister?
You think your gold and your lions and your gold lions make you better than everyone. May I tell you a secret? You're not a golden lion. You're just a pink little man who is far too slow on the draw.
Longsword is a bad option in close quarters. When I pull my blade, your friend starts bleeding. Quite a lot, I'm afraid. So many veins in the wrist.
He'll live if you get him help straightaway. So, decisions.
Apologies, my love.
Ellaria Sand, my paramour. The king's own Uncle Imp. Tyrion, son of Tywin Lannister.
What are you? His hired killer?
How did that come to pass?
We'll need a few more girls. Girls, yes?
Seems I visited the Lannister brothel by mistake.
Even Dornishmen.
Let us speak truth here. Joffrey is insulted. I am only the second son after all.
(Chuckles)
I was invited to the royal wedding.

The last time I was in the capital was many years ago. Another wedding. My sister Elia and Rhaegar Targaryen, the Last Dragon. My sister loved him. She bore his children. Swaddled them, rocked them, fed them at her own breast. Elia wouldn't let the wet nurse touch them. And beautiful, noble Rhaegar Targaryen left her for another woman. That started a war and the war ended right here when your father's army took the city...
And butchered those children. My nephew and niece. Carved them up and wrapped them in Lannister cloaks. And my sister, you know what they did to her?
I'm asking you a question.
(Chuckles) So have I. The one I keep hearing is that Gregor Clegane the Mountain raped Elia and split her in half with his great sword.
If the Mountain killed my sister, your father gave the order. Tell your father I'm here. And tell him the Lannisters aren't the only ones who pay their debts.
Hello.
Not you.
Your Grace. Lord Tywin.
I don't believe you have met Ellaria. This is the Lord Hand Tywin Lannister and Cersei Lannister the Queen Regent. I suppose it is former Queen Regent now. Lord Hand and Lady Cersei, Ellaria Sand.
Bastards are born of passion, aren't they? We don't despise them in Dorne.
I expect it is a relief, Lady Cersei, giving up your regal responsibilities. Wearing the crown for so many years must have left your neck a bit crooked.
They call it the rich man's disease. A wonder you don't have it.

People everywhere have their differences. In some places the highborn frown upon those of low birth. In other places the rape and murder of women and children is considered distasteful. What a fortunate thing for you, former Queen Regent, that your daughter Myrcella has been sent to live in the latter sort of place.
Greedy.
You're calling my beauty an acquired taste?
Your loss.
Does that surprise you?

Then everyone is missing half the world's pleasure. The gods made that and it delights me. The gods made this and it delights me. When it comes to war, I fight for Dorne. When it comes to love, I don't choose sides.
What are you, 25?

(CHUCKLES) Someday, if you're lucky, you will wake up and realize you are old. That pretty ass of yours will sag. Your belly will grow soft and your back will ache in the night and gray hairs will sprout from your ears. No one will want you anymore. Make sure you fucked your fill before that day.
They will all have to line up behind you.
Lord Tywin.
Would you like to sit?
Some wine?
I'm sorry about your grandson.
I don't believe that a child is responsible for the sins of his father. Or his grandfather. An awful way to die.
Are you interrogating me, Lord Tywin?
Some believe the sky is blue because we live inside the eye of a blue-eyed giant. The king was poisoned.
I did. This is why I know.
Rather suspicious. Why haven't you thrown me in a dungeon?
You think we conspired together?
The death of my sister.
She was raped and murdered by the Mountain. The Mountain follows your orders. Of course I blame you.
You are unarmed and unguarded because you know me better than that. I am a man of reason. If I cut your throat today, I will be drawn and quartered tomorrow.
So you deny involvement in Elia's murder?
I would like to speak with the Mountain.
He might not enjoy it as much as he thinks he would.
But you want something in return.
Why?
Well, you made the Tyrell girl a queen. Asking me to judge at your son's trial isn't quite as tempting.
I never realized you had such respect for Dorne, Lord Tywin.
You're saying you need us? That must be hard for you to admit.
Your Grace.
A poem, actually.
I couldn't very well refuse a royal escort.
Not a very good one.
For one of my daughters.
Eight.
The fifth is difficult. I named her after my sister Elia.
Yes. But I can't say it without turning sad. And after I turn sad, I grow angry.
Which joke is that?
We can avenge them.
You really believe Tyrion murdered your son?
We will have a trial and we will learn the truth.
The last time I saw her, she was swimming with two of my girls in the Water Gardens. Laughing in the sun.
You have my word. We don't hurt little girls in Dorne.
Anything at all.
I will have it sailed down to Sunspear for her.
These meetings aren't always going to be this early, are they? I was up late last night. So, does this mean I am a master of something now? Coins, ships?
Lord Varys is right. I have been to Essos and seen the Unsullied firsthand. They are very impressive on the battlefield. Less so in the bedroom.
Lord Varys...
And yet everyone does.
Five years.
'Tis a big and beautiful world. Most of us live and die in the same corner where we were born and never get to see any of it. I don't want to be most of us.
You are from Essos. Where? Lys?
I have an ear for that as well. How did you get here?
One you don't like telling people.

My paramour Ellaria, she would find you very interesting. You should come to the brothel and meet her. We brought our own wine, not the swill they serve here. We have some lovely boys on retainer, but...
You did like boys before?
Really? Girls? Hmm. I hope you won't be offended when I say I never would have guessed.
What then?
Everybody is interested in something.
Such as?
I think you have made your point, Grand Maester. You have a lot of poison in your store.
Tyrion said, "And you will know the debt is paid." What debt?
How could you possibly know all this? Why would he reveal such plans to his wife's maid?
And did you?
Fuck him like it was his last night in this world.
I did spend some time with an absolutely stunning blonde the other day.
Your sister.

Cersei approached me. We spoke a great deal about her daughter. How worried your sister is about her. She was trying very hard to pretend she had not come to sway me against you. I think she may have even believed it herself.
It was difficult for her to hide her true intentions. It is rare to meet a Lannister who shares my enthusiasm for dead Lannisters. She desperately wants to see you killed.
Yes, I know. We met, you and I. Many years ago.

Unlikely. You had just been born. Our father brought me and my sister Elia with him on a visit to Casterly Rock. My first time away from Dorne. I didn't like anything about the Rock. Not the food, not the weather, your accents. Nothing. But the biggest disappointment... you.

The whole way from Dorne all anyone talked about was the monster that had been born to Tywin Lannister. A head twice the size of his body, a tail between his legs, claws, one red eye, the privates of both a girl and a boy.

When we met your sister, she promised she would show you to us. Every day we would ask. Every day she would say, "Soon." Then she and your brother took us to your nursery and... she unveiled the freak. Your head was a bit large. Your arms and legs were a bit small, but no claw. No red eye. No tail between your legs. Just a tiny pink cock. We didn't try to hide our disappointment. "That's not a monster," I told Cersei. "That's just a baby." And she said, "He killed my mother." And she pinched your little cock so hard, I thought she might pull it off. Until your brother made her stop. "It doesn't matter," she told us. "Everyone says he will die soon. I hope they are right. He should not have lived this long."
And what about what I want? Justice for my sister and her children.
I disagree.

I've come to the perfect place. I want to bring those who have wronged me to justice. And all those who have wronged me are right here. I will begin with Ser Gregor Clegane, who killed my sister's children and then raped her with their blood still on his hands before killing her, too. I will be your champion.
I like to move around.
You learn this during your years in the fighting pits? I always drink before a fight.
Today is not the day I die.
I'm going to kill that.
Size does not matter when you are flat on your back.
Never.
Have they told you who I am?
I am the brother of Elia Martell. Do you know why I have come all the way to this stinking shit-pile of a city? For you.
I'm going to hear you confess before you die. You raped my sister. You murdered her. You killed her children. Say it now and we can make this quick.
Say it. You raped her. You murdered her. You killed her children.
You raped her! You murdered her! You killed her children!
You raped her! You murdered her!
You killed her children!

Wait. Are you dying? No, no, no. You can't die yet. You haven't confessed. Say it. Say her name. Elia Martell. You raped her. You killed her children. Elia Martell. Who gave you the order? Who gave you the order?! Say her name! You raped her! You murdered her! You killed her children. Say it. Say her name. Say it!

6.text: I did not fight beside you on the field and I will regret that until my dying day. A man can only admit when he was wrong and ask forgiveness.
There will be more fights to come. House Glover will stand behind House Stark as we have for a thousands years. And I will stand behind Jon Snow… the King in the North!
The King in the North!
The answer is no.
I’ve heard enough. We’ve only just taken back this castle from the Ironborn. The Boltons helped us do it. Now you want me to fight against them? I could be skinned for even talking to you.
Have other northern houses pledged to fight for you?
And?
I don’t care about ravens. You’re asking me to join your army. Who is fighting in this army?

Then the rumors are true. I didn’t dare believe them. I received you out of respect for your father. Now I would like you to leave. House Glover will not abandon its ancestral home to fight alongside wildlings.
There’s nothing else to say.
Yes, my family served House Stark for centuries. We wept when we heard of your father’s death. When my brother was lord of this castle, he answered Robb’s call and hailed him King in the North.

And where was King Robb when the Ironborn attacked this castle? When they threw my wife and children in prison and brutalized and killed our subjects? Taking up with a foreign whore. Getting himself and those who followed him killed.
I served House Stark once, but House Stark is dead.

7.text: It's about time we taught these boys of summer how to fight.
You expect me to put a spear in my granddaughter's hand?
Indeed you are, my lady. No one has questioned--
We called your brother king, and then he rode south and lost his kingdom.
The King in the North should stay in the north. We did not choose you to rule us, My Lady, but perhaps we should have.

3.text: It's empty.
You'd rather be out there?
No. Who's he?
If the gods turned every killer into a giant white rat--
Who are you?
Who are you?!
Does the well lead to an underground river? Is that how you came here?
How do you know that?
But no one's killed a white walker in thousands of years.
I'm better with them. Drop the spear.
Drop it.
Why don't you ask?
Where's the shame in that?
Some people will always need help. That doesn't mean they're not worth helping.
I know how to skin a rabbit.
I didn't see any game before I got here.
Well, I made this bow myself. Guess you don't learn how to do that north of the Wall.
Oh, you're gonna punch the rabbits to death?
Well, someone else is sitting right here.
Well, some of us would say thank you when someone else hunts down their breakfast for them. Or don't they teach you to say thank you north of the Wall?
Your way of skinning rabbits is quicker than mine.
Thank you. See? Not so hard, is it? Thank you.
Shh. I'm right here with you.
I'm right here with you.
The visions take their toll.
(nods)
Leave him alone.
It’s good land and there’s no war up here. Why leave?
It’s as good a place to shelter as any.
Well, we’ll have to open them up again.
There’s a rider out there.
There’s more.
[To BRAN] What did you do?
Is that safe?

4.text: We can stop, we can rest.
We're not going to make it.
JOJEN! Hold on!
Hold on to me!
My brother, he led us to you, and now he…
How do you know?
You've been gone for hours.
We're all hungry.
You'd forget us, Bran. You'd forget your mother and father. You'd forget your brothers and sisters. You'd forget Winterfell. You'd forget you. And if we lose you, we lose everything.
Is that a baby?
No, we need to stay together.
Bran, what happened?
Who?
If Jon was here, why would they put his wolf in a cage?
They might have been Night'sWatch once, not anymore. We're not safe here.We need to go.
Bran, we need to go now.
Can you remember where the cage was?
If I'm not backsoon, we'll meet...
(screams) No, please. Please.Please, let me help him.
Please.
It's Meera. It's Meera.I'm right here.
I'm right here.
You need water.
Of course it matters.
What does that mean?
How... will we know the end?
(gasps)
(whimpers)
(GASPS)

6.text: You’re not coming with us?
Where will you go?
Are you sure you’re ready for this?
It’s not safe anywhere.
And we’re going to fight it in there.
For what? I sit in there and I watch him have his visions and nothing ever happens.
Come on, Hodor. Help me with the sledge.
We can go home now, Hodor. Well, maybe not home home, but somewhere that isn’t a cave.
Eat something that isn’t moss. I want an egg. How do you like ‘em? Boiled? Fried up with some butter?
With a rasher of bacon and some blood sausage.
Bran. Bran, wake up. Bran.
Bran, wake up.
Hodor.
Help me!
Bran! Bran, wake up!
Bran! Bran! Bran, wake up.
You have to wake up. We need Hodor.
Bran, we’re all going to die!
Bran, wake up! We’re all going to die! Bran! Bran!
Bran, you have to wake up! We need Hodor!
Warg into Hodor now!
Bran, wake up. We need Hodor. We need Hodor. Warg into Hodor now! Now!
Summer!
What are you doing?
Hodor, hurry!
Hold the door!
Hold the door! Hold the door! Hold the door!
Hold the door!
Hold the door!
Hold the door!
I’m so sorry.
Why did you help us?
The Three-Eyed Raven’s dead.

7.text: I'm Meera Reed, daughter of Howland Reed. This is Brandon Stark, son of Ned Stark.
What's that?
It's a very good idea.
I don't want to leave you, but when they come I need to be with my family. And you're safe, safe as anyone can be now. You don't need me anymore.
That's all you've got to say?
Thank you?
My brother died for you. Hodor and Summer died for you. I almost died for you. Bran!
You died in that cave.

6.text: Ned?
Is that you? Is that really you?
You’re not a dream.
I’ve missed you, big brother.
I want to be brave.
I’m not.
I don’t want to die.
No, no water.
Please. Listen to me, Ned.
If Robert finds out, he’ll kill him, you know he will. You have to protect him. Promise me, Ned. Promise me.
Promise me, Ned. Promise me.

Your son was butchered at the Red Wedding, Lord Manderly. But you refused the call. You swore allegiance to House Stark, Lord Glover, but in their hour of greatest need, you refused the call. And you, Lord Cerwyn, your father was skinned alive by Ramsay Bolton. Still you refuse the call. But House Mormont remembers. The North remembers. We know no king but the King in the North whose name is Stark. I don’t care if he’s a bastard. Ned Stark’s blood runs through his veins. He’s my king from this day until his last day.
Welcome to Bear Island.
I doubt it. My mother wasn’t a great beauty or any other kind of beauty. She was a great warrior, though. She died fighting for your brother, Robb.
I think we’ve had enough small talk. What are you here?
I remember what it said. “Bear Island knows no king but the King in the North whose name is Stark.”
As far as I understand, you’re a Snow and Lady Sansa is a Bolton. Or is she a Lannister? I’ve heard conflicting reports.
If you say so. In any case, you don’t just want my allegiance. You want my fighting men.
I understand that I’m responsible for Bear Island and all who live here. So why should I sacrifice one more Mormont life for someone else’s war?
I don’t know you, Ser…?
All right, Ser Davos of House Seaworth. How is it you understand how I feel?
Go on, Ser Davos.
Is this true?
House Mormont has kept faith with House Stark for 1,000 years. We will not break faith today.
We are not a large house, but we’re a proud one. And every man from Bear Island fights with the strength of 10 mainlanders.

7.text: I don't plan on knitting by the fire while men fight for me. I might be small, Lord Glover, and I might be a girl, but I am every bit as much a Northerner as you.
And I don't need your permission to defend the North.
We'll begin training every man, woman, boy, and girl on Bear Island.
Winter is here, Your Grace. We need the King in the North in the north.
Father, Smith, Warrior, Mother, Maiden, Crone, Stranger. I am his and he is mine from this day until the end of my days.
His name is Aegon.

8.text: "Your Grace."
But youâ€™re not. Are you? You left Winterfell a king and came back a- Iâ€™m not sure what you are now.
A lord? Nothing at all?
Not important? We named you King in the North.
I have trained my men, women and children. I have fought before. I can fight again.
I don't need you to remind me of that.
I will not hide underground. I pledged to fight for the North, and I will fight.
I wish you good fortune, cousin.

6.text: Shall I have a grave dug for her, my lord? Or would you rather the men build a pyre?
My lords. Lady Walda has given birth. A boy. Red-cheeked and healthy.
Poisoned by his enemies.
Forgive me, my lord.
She’s resting, my lord.
At once, my lord.

7.text: A raven from King's Landing, Your Grace.
A raven, My King, from the Citadel.
4,000 bushels, My Lady.
I'm not entirely certain. I'll check Maester Llewyn's records. He kept a copy of every raven scroll.
No, My Lady, most likely not.
I found it, my Lord.
It took some searching. Maester Llewyn's archives are thorough.
Yes, my Lord.

8.text: At once, Your Grace.
Welcome back, my lady. If you'd follow me
Apologies, my lady. Your Grace.
We don't have a king or queen.
Well, we have to choose someone.
Aye.

1.text: Here, Shaggydog.
He doesn't like chains.
No, l came to see Father.
He was down here. l saw him.
Last night, when l was sleeping. Here, Shaggydog.
They've all gone away.
No, they won't.

2.text: We'll make you better. LUWIN I feel just fine.
(cries)
Do something!
I'm fine.
Jack and Billy. They'll give us some food.
Billy climbs a tree better than anyone.

3.text: What's happening?
What's wrong with him?
Old Nan said they turn your skull into a cup and make you drink your own blood from it.
That’s what Old Nan said.
What’s That?
Where?
[Surprised] Me? I’m coming with you.
I’m coming with you. I’m your brother. I have to protect you.
We’re not Southerners.
And I don’t want to leave you.
[Crying, looks at OSHA] I know how to swing a sword.

1.text: Hodor.

2.text: Hodor
Hodor.
Hodor.

3.text: Hodor. Hodor.
Hodor.
Hodor.
Hodor.
Hodor.
Hodor.
Hodor!
Hodor!
Hodor!
Hodor.
Hodor!
Hodor!
Hodor!

4.text: Hodor...
Hodor.
Hodor. Hodor. Hodor.
Hodor.
Hodor. Hodor. Hodor.
Hodor.
Hodor. Hodor. Hodor.
Hodor. Hodor.
Hodor.
Hodor. Hodor.
Hodor. Hodor.
Hodor. Hodor.
Hodor! Hodor! Hodor. Hodor.
Hodor. Hodor. Hodor. Hodor. Hodor.
Hodor.

6.text: Hodor.
Hodor.
Hodor.
Hodor.
Hodor.
Hodor.
Hodor.
Hodor.
Hodor. Hodor.
Hodor. Hodor.
Hodor. Hodor.
Hodor. Hodor.
Hodor.
Hodor. Hodor.
Hodor. Hodor. Hodor. Hodor.

1.text: Your father's not down there, little lord. Not for many years yet.
l'm not afraid of some hole in the ground.
You see? He's not here.
That beast is supposed to be chained in the kennels!
You both miss him. lt's only natural he should be in your thoughts and dreams, but that doesn't mean that –
All alone in the deep dark woods.
Oh, that’s a pretty pin. Silver.
the boy’s worth nothing dead. Benjen Stark’s own blood. Think what Mance would give us.
Give me my life, my lord, and I’m yours.
Where is it you come from?
They far away?
Trust me, you've never heard where I'm from neither.
And what's that?
Why?
What's that got to do with you? If your father's lord, how can you be lord too?
So you're not lord now?
I just don't understand how you Southerners do things.
You're from South of the wall. That makes you a Southerner to me.
Couldn't say, My Lord. Don't know what "impunent" means.
I'm used to worse than him.
I'm used to men who could chew that boy up and pick their teeth with his bones.
Didn't mean to come here. Meant to get much further South than this.
There's things that sleep in the day and hunt at night.
I'm not talking about Owls and Shadowcats.
They wasn't gone, old man. They was sleeping.
You hear them, boy? The Old Gods are answering you.
They're my Gods too.
You asked them, they're answering you.
Well, there's a big man.
Giants and worse than giants.

2.text: Boil this for an hour and drink the tea. Makes all your pain go away.
Lucky for you.
You've been having those dreams again.
Everyone dreams.

Did they? (Hodor is kneeling next to the pool in the godswood. Osha begins unstrapping Bran from Hodor’s back). I heard some other fools say it's Lannister Red. Means the Lannisters will rule all Seven Kingdoms before long. I heard a stable boy say it's the color of blood, to mark the death of your father.
The stars don't fall for men. The red comet means one thing, boy. Dragons.
North's the wrong way. And mother and brother are south. We don't know where.
I've got no great love for my own kind. I'll get you milk of the poppy. Tell me where to find it. LUWIN I don't want milk of the poppy.
Ask your Maester Luwin. He's the one studying books all the time.
Must not mean anything, then.
You might be a little lord, but don't you call me a liar.
I never said I didn't.
That's not the same as being a liar.
So, you've been dreaming of a three-eyed raven again? In the godswood, you told me you didn't dream. Now who's a liar? What did you see in your dream?
Something bad? Tell me, boy.
The sea is hundreds of miles away.
I've got to get these potatoes to the kitchen. Otherwise they'll put me in chains again.
They say all sorts of crazy things north of the Wall.
My Lord Greyjoy.
You were here the day I was taken.
Let me serve you.
It was Robb Stark who put me in the kitchens. Put a spear in my hand again.
Step aside.
It's your dream, little lord. The ocean has come to swallow this place. I ain't letting it drown me.
I'm no liar.
I done what I had to do to stay alive. I hate the Starks as well as you do. Let me serve you, my lord.
There are other ways to serve, my lord.
We know things, the free people.
Other things.
Savage things.
It comes at a price.
I already had that.
I have something for you from Prince Theon.
Me. He says I'm to make the rounds. And keep you warm.
We should have took more food.
Those people all love you. They would have given you whatever you needed.
The boy can't survive on walnuts.
We've been walking since before sunrise. Even Hodor will tire. Hodor
Even you, sweet giant.
You've never seen me climb a tree, little man.
We got a good start on them, but we can't outrun hounds forever.
Got as far as the farm and then doubled back. Walked through the stream to throw off the hounds. Hoped this would be the last place they'd think to look.
Who was that out there hung up at the gates?
He killed them and burned them and passed them off as the little lords?
They'll never hear it from me. The little lads have suffered enough.

3.text: Were you inside the wolf again, little lord?
He's back.
I don't want to hear about it.
We've got plenty of worries. We don't need to pour black magic on top of them.
I know you didn't, little lord.
We need to move.
And who told you that? The three-eyed raven tell you?
Some good he is, then.
I don't know what other people know and what they don't. I only know the Wall is a long way off.
Looking for food.
Not another step, boy. Unless you want to drown in your own blood.
That was poor planning.
If you kill me, that wolf will tear you to bits.
Rickon, stay with us.
What's he telling him?
Isn't he ashamed, your brother, needing you to protect him?
Any boy his age who needs his sister to protect him is gonna find himself needing lots of protecting.
That's not how you skin a rabbit.
Not by the looks of it.
You grow up north of the Wall, you learn the proper way to handle game.
If I had a bow, I could have shot a dozen rabbits.
You learn how to use your fists, though.
I had someone else in mind.
Some of us are just a little better.
